title: Security Supervisor (Mall)
description:
Vista Security is currently hiring a day time Supervisor. Are you looking to become a police officer, or paramedic and want to take the next step towards that, this position is the perfect one for you. The position will run from Monday to Friday, 7am - 3pm. We are looking for someone with experience in the security industry who is looking to take their skills to another level. Training for the position will start Monday, April 11th.

Use of Force, Police foundations, and report writing classes will all be considered an asset. If you do not have any of the above we will be providing classes.

Qualifications:

  • Valid Security Guard Licence
  • Current First Aid Certified
  • Minimum two years Security Guard experience
  • Superior communication/comprehension/writing skills
  • Outstanding customer service skills
  • Display exemplary deportment
  • Leadership skills
  • Computer Literacy
  • Police Foundations/Law Enforcement an asset

Responsibilities:

  • Exemplify our standards of conduct and appearance
  • Responsible for the overall operation, administration and supervision of their site
  • Oversee their Guards and ensure they perform their duties in compliance with the Site Post Orders
  • Maintain Access Control to protect the personal safety and security of personnel, company building and fixtures, equipment and inventory, company trade name and all proprietary information.
  • CCTV / Fire / Intrusion Alarm monitoring
  • Assist Client management team in a professional manner as requested
  • Other duties as outlined in Post Orders

    • This position pays $19 an hour.

    Job Type: Full-time

title: Superviseur d'intégration - Sécurité
description:
SUPERVISEUR D’INTÉGRATION – SÉCURITÉ


QUI SOMMES-NOUS ?

Entreprise d’économie sociale fondée en 1975, Axia est spécialisée en gestion immobilière avec ses divisions en entretien ménager commercial, Axia Entretien ménager, et son agence de sécurité, Axia Sécurité. Dans un autre domaine, Axia Emballage permet aux compagnies d’optimiser leur capacité de production et d'atteindre de nouveaux marchés, en leur offrant un service de sous-traitance alimentaire et industrielle tout en leur assurant un soutien logistique.

Dans un marché toujours plus compétitif, notre groupe est fier d’offrir à ses clients des services hautement professionnels. La qualité de notre travail est au cœur de notre engagement comme le démontre notre certification ISO 9001.

Fort de ses nombreux succès, Axia prouve que l’économie sociale rapporte, pour le plus grand bénéfice de ses employés et, bien entendu, au profit de ses clients.


SOMMAIRE DU POSTE

Sous la supervision de la direction adjointe de la division sécurité, le rôle de la superviseure ou du superviseur d’intégration inclut notamment :

  • Préparer et s’assurer du bon déroulement des programmes d'intégration des nouveaux employés ;
  • Assurer le suivi, le soutien et les interventions nécessaires sur les postes de travail tout au long de la période d’intégration, et apporter les rétroactions ou ajustements nécessaires ;
  • S'assurer que les nouveaux employés connaissent bien leurs rôles et responsabilités, et que leurs besoins soient pris en charge.


PRINCIPALES RESPONSABILITÉS

  • En collaboration avec la direction adjointe, le formateur et les superviseurs, développer et maintenir à jour un programme d’intégration des nouvelles recrues afin de leur assurer un parcours d’intégration et le soutien nécessaire durant les 12 premiers mois ;
  • Ajuster ou mettre à jour régulièrement le programme d’intégration ; personnaliser si nécessaire ;
  • Participer aux sessions de formation ;
  • Suivre chaque nouvel employé dans son intégration : accompagner l’employé sur les contrats, planifier des rencontres régulières sur les lieux de travail, revoir les rôles et responsabilités, l’exécution des tâches, ainsi que ses besoins éventuels ; personnaliser le suivi (fréquence et contenu) en tenant compte de chaque employé ;
  • Mettre en place des plans de formations personnalisés ;
  • Émettre des compte-rendu réguliers au superviseur, à la direction adjointe et au département des ressources humaines ;
  • Coordonner les visites ou interventions avec celles du superviseur ou des éducateurs spécialisés ;
  • Effectuer toute autre tâche pouvant être exigée par son supérieur immédiat.


PROFIL RECHERCHÉ

  • Détenir une formation universitaire et/ou une expérience pertinente à l’emploi
  • 2 à 5 années d’expérience dans un poste similaire (sécurité, formation, intégration, éducation spécialisée)


Connaissances :

  • Excellente connaissance du français, l’anglais un atout
  • Connaissances des techniques de formation et d’éducation aux adultes, et de coaching
  • Connaissance de la suite Office


Compétences requises :

  • Contrôle et suivi
  • Motivation et développement compétence
  • Planification et organisation
  • Travail d'équipe et relations interpersonnelles
  • Prise de décision, jugement et autonomie
  • Amélioration continue, innovation et adaptation


Salaire de base à partir de 53 040$ par an

title: Security Supervisor
description:
Job Description

Company description:

Glen Recruiters offers an extensive range of security services tailored to the need of our valued customers. Our highly trained team has a great record of delivering customized security services to our valued customers.

Job description:

Our highly trained team has a great record of delivering customized security services to our valued customers. Glen Team is highly trained and qualified for protecting business, people, and assets according to our client’s request. Our target is to deliver a secure and safe workspace that allows employees and leaders to focus on improving daily operations. Glen Group is the best choice when one is looking for a dedicated security partner that’s committed to exceeding your high level of expectations.

We are seeking to hire a Supervisor. This is a great opportunity for someone of this class who can exercise considerable independence of judgment and action within established guidelines, referring to unusual or complex matters in terms of services provided.

Join us today!!

Required Qualifications:

Mandatory:
  • A Valid Basic Security Training (BST) license
  • Valid Driving License
  • Flexible availability (Weekday/Weekends)
  • Minimum 5 years of experience in Security
  • 2 year of Security Supervisor Experience
  • Clean Driving Record

Asset:
  • Advanced Security Training (AST)
  • OFA1 & OFA2 is considered an asset
  • TCP Certification

Required skills:
  • Scheduling of the Sites to the Security guards based on its requirements
  • Taking Charge of the sites
  • Checking AV Reports daily and sending it over to the Clients
  • Patrolling all the shifts as required
  • Training Guards on their joining and ongoing checking of their works
  • Covering No Shows on sites as and when required
  • To be aware of all sites with real time information
  • Ensuring timely response to Client queries, providing final approval on candidates to be presented to the Client
  • Manage new hires, new assignments, assignment extensions, resignations/ terminations.
  • Act as a liaison between security guards, Client, and other agencies.
  • Monitor quality of service through various reporting methods.
  • Administer evaluations for Security Guards.
  • Maintain accurate records
  • Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
  • Ability to lead and make quick decision to de-escalate the difficult situations
  • Maintaining professionalism all the time at the job site with excellent customer service

Responsibilities:
  • The Supervisor plans, assigns, supervises, schedules, reviews and participates in the work of subordinates engaged in security work.
  • participates in the training and performance evaluation of subordinates.
  • Follows up on incident reports written by subordinates; performs risk assessments and inspections; reports findings on same and recommends corrective action.
  • Provides input in the management and implementation of security standards, guidelines, and procedures to ensure optimal security operations. Performs related work as required.
  • Maintain safe environment ensuring the safety of property, assets, and people
  • Any other duties as required by specific site needs

Benefits working at Glen:
  • We offer competitive compensation
  • All of our staff at any level of the hierarchy are treated with the same respect.
  • Full-time permanent employees are always considered first for new job postings of higher rank.
  • Karas Group believes in our team and helps to step up in ranks by helping to get certifications/licenses needed. We pay a proportion of your certification/license fee.

Documents required for application:
  • Resume
  • Driver License
  • Security License (BST/AST)
  • Availability in detail
  • OFA Certificates (If acquired already)

Make sure you have a reliable Phone with a reliable internet connection.

PLEASE INCLUDE ALL OF ABOVE DOCUMENTS WHILE APPLYING IF YOU WANT TO BE CONSIDERED.

Compensation will be discussed at the time of the interview.

Salary: $2,800.00-$4,000.00 per month

Powered by JazzHR

title: Security Site Supervisor
description:
Allied Universal is currently searching for a Security Site Supervisor. The Security Site Supervisor will embrace our company’s core values. The Security Site Supervisor will supervise and coordinate the delivery of quality services. The Site Supervisor will act as a liaison between customer, Operation Manager and security officers. Supervise site staff, providing coaching, recognition and discipline within approved empowerment range.


*Must possess a Valid Provincial Security Guard License*

G driver’s license and clean driver’s abstract


Supervisory Responsibilities

  • Enforce Contract Standards
  • Administers site safety programs outlining site-specific hazards for security officers including vehicle / driving safety as appropriate to corporate procedures
  • Prepared to participate in unemployment hearings
  • Capably utilizes scheduling and billing software, and to produce reports (such as Scheduling Activity, Training Detail reports, etc.) that require interpretation and action for effective business management
  • Enforces Allied Universal’s policies as outlined in the handbooks and executive memos



Qualifications/Requirements:


Qualified applicants for the Security Site Supervisor position will meet the minimum requirements, as described below:


  • At least 3 Years of experience in a Supervisory Role in the security industry or related field
  • Experience in Retail loss prevention program, high degree of customer focused experience
  • Good understanding of Criminal Code of Canada and Provincial legislation
  • Be at least 18 years of age with high school diploma or equivalent
  • Possess effective written and oral communication and interpersonal skills with ability to deal with all levels of personnel and the general public in a professional and effective manner
  • Licensing requirements are subject to province and/or local laws and regulations and will be required prior to employment.
  • Display exceptional customer service and communication skills
  • Have intermediate computer skills to operate innovative, wireless technology at client specific sites
  • Ability to handle crisis situations at the client site, calmly and efficiently


Able to:

  • Work in various environments such as cold weather, rain/snow or heat
  • Occasionally lift or carry up to 40 pounds
  • Climb stairs, ramps, or ladders occasionally during shift
  • Stand or walk on various surfaces for long periods of time

title: Mobile Security Supervisor - Position - Part Time (Weekends)
description:
Regal Security Inc. is currently seeking a Part Time Mobile Supervisor to supervise all our condominium sites in the after hours. This position will be based out of our Head Office located in the Dufferin and Lawrence area.

The Ideal Candidate must have:
  • Demonstrated past experience in either a senior security role, supervisor or mobile security role
  • Customer service driven individual
  • Clear English communication skills in all areas (verbal and written)
  • Detailed and thorough record keeping
  • Keen observation and attentiveness
  • Professional physical deportment and presentation
  • Decision Making, Reliable, Common Sense and exceptional judgement
  • Duties as otherwise assigned

Job Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Provide outstanding and personalized customer service as a front line representative of our client’s organizations
  • Act as Regal’s first point of contact for all after-hours client and field staff inquiries
  • Inspect contracted sites to ensure security staff are meeting company standards in terms of uniforming, training and site procedures
  • Respond to major incidents on properties and aid security staff with managing the situation (fire, flood, medical issue and criminal activity)
  • Safely operate and maintain company-issued vehicle
  • Enforce property rules in order to maintain the security and safety of our clients and their assets
  • Complete walking patrols and inspections of facilities and equipment as required
  • Perform parking tagging procedure where assigned
  • Duties as otherwise assigned

Qualifications:
  • Valid Ontario Security License
  • Valid First Aid/CPR Certification
  • Valid Ontario G Class Driver’s License with clean driver’s abstract
  • Valid WHMIS Certification
  • Ontario Secondary School education or higher (preference will be given to those with a Criminal Justice or Business post-secondary education)
  • Proficient in the use of various computer programs (ie. Microsoft Office, Gmail) and able to adapt and learn new programs
  • For insurance purposes, applicants must be over the age of 25.

Compensation:
  • Pay rate will be discussed with successful candidates
  • Health Benefits are available for full-time employees upon completion of 3 months probation

Why choose Regal Security?

Regal Security Inc. is an established and growing security company that offers a vast array of professional and dependable security guard services across the greater Toronto area and southwest Ontario.

Our Everyday Superhero™ guards are selected and trained to protect assets, property, employees, tenants, and residents using a custom-designed security solution for every client within the sectors we serve.

Every member of the Regal security team, and every service that is carried out is directed by the Regal guiding principle: Strength & Honor™. With this in mind, Regal’s security guards are known as Everyday Superheroes™ – they are friendly, well-trained and, most importantly, proud, as they go above and beyond the call of duty to uphold Regal’s high standards.

“THE REGAL SECURITY MISSION IS “YOUR PEACE OF MIND”™”

Thank you for your application, unfortunately due to the high volume of applicants, only those deemed eligible for an interview will be contacted. All candidates will be communicated to by phone or email for the purposes of the recruitment process.

Regal Security Inc. welcomes all candidates equally and encourages all qualified candidates, from women and men including persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and Aboriginal persons, to apply.

#INDREGAL

title: Security Supervisor
description:
Find Your Fit With Paladin!


Are you interested in advancing your security career in a leadership role at a fast-paced high end shopping centre in Toronto? We are searching for a high caliber Security Supervisor. As a provider of security services to clients with complex security needs, Paladin Security Group is offering an exciting career opportunity for you to give back to your community, while developing skills for future careers. Our training programs are also a leader in the security industry, and they will help prepare you for advancements, as well as build your resume for a potential career in law enforcement.


Why Choose Paladin:

  • $500 Signing Bonus
  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement


Site Description: High End Shopping Centre in Toronto, Ontario.


Job Description:

The Security Supervisor is responsible for supervising the activities and job performance of Security Officers assigned to all areas of the site. This position is a leadership role at a fast-paced, high end shopping centre in Toronto, ON. The Security Supervisor is expected to represent Paladin Security Group as well as the facility to which they are assigned. The compensation for this position is $27.03/hour.


Requirements:

  • Security industry experience of 4 or more years in a supervisory role preferably
  • Post-Secondary education in a related field would be an asset
  • Must have excellent communication and interpersonal skills/customer service skills
  • Must possess a valid Security License for the Province of Ontario
  • Must possess a current First Aid/CPR certification
  • Utilize two-way radio and computer applications
  • Excellent verbal and written English communications skills required; multilingual applicants preferred
  • Proven ability to build and maintain strong working relationships both internally and externally
  • Strong leadership, organization, and facilitation skills
  • Strong customer service and multi-tasking skills
  • Ability to meet strict deadlines and flexibility in time allocation


Your Impact:

Paladin Security: Making the World a Safer and Friendlier Place! Do you have superior customer service skills and a passion for helping people? Are you able to think quickly on your feet and defuse difficult situations? Your track record of handling a great deal of responsibility combined with your varied life experience and enthusiasm for a job well done make you an ideal candidate for our team! The Paladin Difference starts with our officers; we're the best because we hire the best. We believe in promoting from within, respecting people and their differences, providing high quality service and always having fun! If you think you have what it takes to join our team, we want to meet you!

title: High Profile Commercial Security Supervisor
description:
Find Your Fit With Paladin!


Are you interested in advancing your security career in a leadership role at a fast-paced high end shopping centre in Toronto? We are searching for a high caliber Security Supervisor. As a provider of security services to clients with complex security needs, Paladin Security Group is offering an exciting career opportunity for you to give back to your community, while developing skills for future careers. Our training programs are also a leader in the security industry, and they will help prepare you for advancements, as well as build your resume for a potential career in law enforcement.


Why Choose Paladin:

  • $500 Signing Bonus
  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement


Site Description: High End Shopping Centre in Toronto, Ontario.


Job Description:

The Security Supervisor is responsible for supervising the activities and job performance of Security Officers assigned to all areas of the site. This position is a leadership role at a fast-paced, high end shopping centre in Toronto, ON. The Security Supervisor is expected to represent Paladin Security Group as well as the facility to which they are assigned. The compensation for this position is $27.03/hour.


Requirements:

  • Security industry experience of 4 or more years in a supervisory role preferably
  • Post-Secondary education in a related field would be an asset
  • Must have excellent communication and interpersonal skills/customer service skills
  • Must possess a valid Security License for the Province of Ontario
  • Must possess a current First Aid/CPR certification
  • Utilize two-way radio and computer applications
  • Excellent verbal and written English communications skills required; multilingual applicants preferred
  • Proven ability to build and maintain strong working relationships both internally and externally
  • Strong leadership, organization, and facilitation skills
  • Strong customer service and multi-tasking skills
  • Ability to meet strict deadlines and flexibility in time allocation


Your Impact:

Paladin Security: Making the World a Safer and Friendlier Place! Do you have superior customer service skills and a passion for helping people? Are you able to think quickly on your feet and defuse difficult situations? Your track record of handling a great deal of responsibility combined with your varied life experience and enthusiasm for a job well done make you an ideal candidate for our team! The Paladin Difference starts with our officers; we're the best because we hire the best. We believe in promoting from within, respecting people and their differences, providing high quality service and always having fun! If you think you have what it takes to join our team, we want to meet you!

title: Officier de patrouille
description:
Chef de file en sécurité, Commissionnaires du Québec est une OBNL bientôt centenaire. Notre réputation d’excellence et notre engagement auprès de la communauté, entre autres par l'intégration de vétérans, reposent sur notre équipe ayant à cœur la sécurité des Canadiens et Canadiennes.


PATROUILLE VÉHICULE- BUREAU DES COMMISSIONNAIRES DU QUÉBEC- POSTE DE FIN DE SEMAINE


Commissionnaires du Québec t'offre :


  • Excellente conciliation vie personnelle/professionnelle
  • Tâches variées et stimulantes
  • Belle gamme d'avantages sociaux
  • Opportunités d'évolution
  • Formations continues
  • Équipe chaleureuse, qui ne te prendra jamais pour un numéro
  • Ambiance amicale et respectueuse
  • Employeur réputé : nommé 5 fois parmi les 300 meilleurs employeurs au Canada
  • Contribution à une mission noble: nous sommes un OBNL engagé auprès de la communauté
  • Entreprise croissante, qui te garantit une grande stabilité d'emploi


Pour faire partie de l'équipe, tu dois :


  • Être disponible la fin de semaine
  • Avoir un permis BSP régulier
  • Avoir un bon sens de la gestion des priorités
  • Avoir un bon sens de l'observation
  • Être particulièrement responsable
  • Détenir un permis de conduire valide
  • Être à l'aise avec les déplacements à pied et véhicule


Tes tâches comprennent :


  • Répondre aux alarmes provenant de nos clients
  • Effectuer des rondes de prévention dans différentes entreprises afin de s'assurer qu'il n'y a pas de risque d'incendie, de bris, de vandalisme, etc.
  • Assurer la sécurité de techniciens formés à maintenir les guichets automatiques en fonction
  • Faire des inspections des sites de gardiennage des Commissionnaires afin de s'assurer de la qualité du service offert par nos agents de sécurité
  • Offrir un soutien opérationnel en cas d'incident, mesures d'urgences ou autres sur les sites de l'entreprise et à la répartition en cas de besoin


Type d'emploi : Temps Plein, Temps Partiel, Permanent



Le processus est très simple et rapide: envoyez-nous votre CV dès maintenant!

title: Security Supervisor
description:
Job Type: Full-Time

The Gateway to Your Future

In this key role, you will be an integral part of the security team, ensuring Gateway’s staff, property, company assets and valued guests are secure and protected at all times. You will also deliver a high level of customer service, support to staff, and provide accurate reports. The Security Supervisor maintains a presence, patrols gaming and guest activity; conducts door duty and crowd control, and escorts guests and employees as required.

You will perform a number of varying duties throughout your shift, including controlling access to the facility and sensitive areas, escorting visitors, assisting departments, lost and found, monitoring alarm panels, controlling and issuing keys, writing reports, maintaining a daily log and conducting investigations. You may also be required to provide first aid and medical attention.

We Provide
  • Full benefits package for full-time employees
  • Retirement savings plan
  • Exciting, supportive and fun work environment
  • Family and friends discounts on travel, tech, food, beverage, and fitness
  • Development and training opportunities
Key Responsibilities
  • Supervises and manages team performance while participating in security activities
  • Oversees training, coaching, human resources, safety and recruitment needs of the team
  • Monitors floor traffic: watches for suspicious activity, communicates with management and surveillance
  • Provides excellent customer service by greeting customers, answering questions, and providing solutions
  • Escorts individuals within the facility and parking lot(s); may provide first aid; conducts interviews and investigations; writes reports
  • Comply with all applicable laws, policies and procedures
  • Keep work areas clean and free of safety hazards, debris and litter.
  • Perform all job duties in a safe and responsible manner.
  • Adhere to departmental quality standards.
  • Perform other related and compatible duties as assigned.
What You Bring
  • Previous Security experience and Security training is a strong asset.
  • Proven high level of Customer Service.
  • Organizational, interpersonal, analytical and communication skills.
  • The ability to obtain registration as a Category 1 Gaming Assistant with the Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario
  • Completion of Smart Serve to start date (in ON).
Why Work for Us?

Gateway celebrates and empowers our team members, who make it all possible. A career at Gateway means working with great people, being recognized for your unique contribution and career advancement opportunities across our 27 locations. Our employees thrive with ongoing training and leadership programs while working in a dynamic and fun environment. See for yourself what it’s like to be on a team that values your vision, skill and energy.

Get to Know Gateway

Gateway Casinos & Entertainment Limited (“Gateway”) is one of the largest and most diversified gaming and entertainment companies in Canada. Across its 27 gaming properties in British Columbia, Ontario and Edmonton, Alberta, Gateway currently employs approximately 8,648 people and boasts approximately 448 table games (including 49 poker tables), 13,887 slots, 85 restaurants and bars and 561 hotel rooms. Gateway is the service provider for the Central, Southwest and North gaming Bundles in Ontario, which includes 11 properties in their portfolio. A multi-pronged growth strategy has seen Gateway diversify and expand its product offering, including developing proprietary casino and restaurant brands, dramatically improving the gaming customer experience while attracting new customers. Some of Gateway's proprietary brands include Match Eatery & Public House, Atlas Steak + Fish and the new Halley's Club. In 2017, Gateway celebrated 25 years in the business of gaming and entertainment in Canada. Further information is available at www.gatewaycasinos.com.

Apply Now!

Not the right fit this time? Follow us on our careers social media pages!

Gateway is a proud equal opportunity employer and dedicates itself to Respect, Integrity, Team-Work and Exceptional Customer Service. We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier free candidate experience and work environment. If you require accommodation at any point during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know.

description:
Job Type: Full-Time

The Gateway to Your Future

In this key role, you will be an integral part of the security team, ensuring Gateway’s staff, property, company assets and valued guests are secure and protected at all times. You will also deliver a high level of customer service, support to staff, and provide accurate reports. The Security Supervisor maintains a presence, patrols gaming and guest activity; conducts door duty and crowd control, and escorts guests and employees as required.

You will perform a number of varying duties throughout your shift, including controlling access to the facility and sensitive areas, escorting visitors, assisting departments, lost and found, monitoring alarm panels, controlling and issuing keys, writing reports, maintaining a daily log and conducting investigations. You may also be required to provide first aid and medical attention.

We Provide
  • Full benefits package for full-time employees
  • Retirement savings plan
  • Exciting, supportive and fun work environment
  • Family and friends discounts on travel, tech, food, beverage, and fitness
  • Development and training opportunities
Key Responsibilities
  • Supervises and manages team performance while participating in security activities
  • Oversees training, coaching, human resources, safety and recruitment needs of the team
  • Monitors floor traffic: watches for suspicious activity, communicates with management and surveillance
  • Provides excellent customer service by greeting customers, answering questions, and providing solutions
  • Escorts individuals within the facility and parking lot(s); may provide first aid; conducts interviews and investigations; writes reports
  • Comply with all applicable laws, policies and procedures
  • Keep work areas clean and free of safety hazards, debris and litter.
  • Perform all job duties in a safe and responsible manner.
  • Adhere to departmental quality standards.
  • Perform other related and compatible duties as assigned.
What You Bring
  • Previous Security experience and Security training is a strong asset.
  • Proven high level of Customer Service.
  • Organizational, interpersonal, analytical and communication skills.
  • The ability to obtain registration as a Category 1 Gaming Assistant with the Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario
  • Completion of Smart Serve to start date (in ON).
Why Work for Us?

Gateway celebrates and empowers our team members, who make it all possible. A career at Gateway means working with great people, being recognized for your unique contribution and career advancement opportunities across our 27 locations. Our employees thrive with ongoing training and leadership programs while working in a dynamic and fun environment. See for yourself what it’s like to be on a team that values your vision, skill and energy.

Get to Know Gateway

Gateway Casinos & Entertainment Limited (“Gateway”) is one of the largest and most diversified gaming and entertainment companies in Canada. Across its 27 gaming properties in British Columbia, Ontario and Edmonton, Alberta, Gateway currently employs approximately 8,648 people and boasts approximately 448 table games (including 49 poker tables), 13,887 slots, 85 restaurants and bars and 561 hotel rooms. Gateway is the service provider for the Central, Southwest and North gaming Bundles in Ontario, which includes 11 properties in their portfolio. A multi-pronged growth strategy has seen Gateway diversify and expand its product offering, including developing proprietary casino and restaurant brands, dramatically improving the gaming customer experience while attracting new customers. Some of Gateway's proprietary brands include Match Eatery & Public House, Atlas Steak + Fish and the new Halley's Club. In 2017, Gateway celebrated 25 years in the business of gaming and entertainment in Canada. Further information is available at www.gatewaycasinos.com.

Apply Now!

Not the right fit this time? Follow us on our careers social media pages!

Gateway is a proud equal opportunity employer and dedicates itself to Respect, Integrity, Team-Work and Exceptional Customer Service. We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier free candidate experience and work environment. If you require accommodation at any point during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know.

A career at Gateway means working with great people, being recognized for your unique contribution and career advancement opportunities across our 27 locations. Our employees thrive with ongoing training and leadership programs while working in a dynamic and fun environment. See for yourself what it’s like to be on a team that values your vision, skill and energy.

Get to Know Gateway

Gateway Casinos & Entertainment Limited (“Gateway”) is one of the largest and most diversified gaming and entertainment companies in Canada. Across its 27 gaming properties in British Columbia, Ontario and Edmonton, Alberta, Gateway currently employs approximately 8,648 people and boasts approximately 448 table games (including 49 poker tables), 13,887 slots, 85 restaurants and bars and 561 hotel rooms. Gateway is the service provider for the Central, Southwest and North gaming Bundles in Ontario, which includes 11 properties in their portfolio. A multi-pronged growth strategy has seen Gateway diversify and expand its product offering, including developing proprietary casino and restaurant brands, dramatically improving the gaming customer experience while attracting new customers. Some of Gateway's proprietary brands include Match Eatery & Public House, Atlas Steak + Fish and the new Halley's Club. In 2017, Gateway celebrated 25 years in the business of gaming and entertainment in Canada. Further information is available at www.gatewaycasinos.com.

Apply Now!

Not the right fit this time? Follow us on our careers social media pages!

Gateway is a proud equal opportunity employer and dedicates itself to Respect, Integrity, Team-Work and Exceptional Customer Service. We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier free candidate experience and work environment. If you require accommodation at any point during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know.

title: Security Supervisor (Mall)
description:
Vista Security is currently hiring a day time Supervisor. Are you looking to become a police officer, or paramedic and want to take the next step towards that, this position is the perfect one for you. The position will run from Monday to Friday, 7am - 3pm. We are looking for someone with experience in the security industry who is looking to take their skills to another level. Training for the position will start Monday, April 11th.

Use of Force, Police foundations, and report writing classes will all be considered an asset. If you do not have any of the above we will be providing classes.

Qualifications:

  • Valid Security Guard Licence
  • Current First Aid Certified
  • Minimum two years Security Guard experience
  • Superior communication/comprehension/writing skills
  • Outstanding customer service skills
  • Display exemplary deportment
  • Leadership skills
  • Computer Literacy
  • Police Foundations/Law Enforcement an asset

Responsibilities:

  • Exemplify our standards of conduct and appearance
  • Responsible for the overall operation, administration and supervision of their site
  • Oversee their Guards and ensure they perform their duties in compliance with the Site Post Orders
  • Maintain Access Control to protect the personal safety and security of personnel, company building and fixtures, equipment and inventory, company trade name and all proprietary information.
  • CCTV / Fire / Intrusion Alarm monitoring
  • Assist Client management team in a professional manner as requested
  • Other duties as outlined in Post Orders

    • This position pays $19 an hour.

    Job Type: Full-time

title: Superviseur d'intégration - Sécurité
description:
SUPERVISEUR D’INTÉGRATION – SÉCURITÉ


QUI SOMMES-NOUS ?

Entreprise d’économie sociale fondée en 1975, Axia est spécialisée en gestion immobilière avec ses divisions en entretien ménager commercial, Axia Entretien ménager, et son agence de sécurité, Axia Sécurité. Dans un autre domaine, Axia Emballage permet aux compagnies d’optimiser leur capacité de production et d'atteindre de nouveaux marchés, en leur offrant un service de sous-traitance alimentaire et industrielle tout en leur assurant un soutien logistique.

Dans un marché toujours plus compétitif, notre groupe est fier d’offrir à ses clients des services hautement professionnels. La qualité de notre travail est au cœur de notre engagement comme le démontre notre certification ISO 9001.

Fort de ses nombreux succès, Axia prouve que l’économie sociale rapporte, pour le plus grand bénéfice de ses employés et, bien entendu, au profit de ses clients.


SOMMAIRE DU POSTE

Sous la supervision de la direction adjointe de la division sécurité, le rôle de la superviseure ou du superviseur d’intégration inclut notamment :

  • Préparer et s’assurer du bon déroulement des programmes d'intégration des nouveaux employés ;
  • Assurer le suivi, le soutien et les interventions nécessaires sur les postes de travail tout au long de la période d’intégration, et apporter les rétroactions ou ajustements nécessaires ;
  • S'assurer que les nouveaux employés connaissent bien leurs rôles et responsabilités, et que leurs besoins soient pris en charge.


PRINCIPALES RESPONSABILITÉS

  • En collaboration avec la direction adjointe, le formateur et les superviseurs, développer et maintenir à jour un programme d’intégration des nouvelles recrues afin de leur assurer un parcours d’intégration et le soutien nécessaire durant les 12 premiers mois ;
  • Ajuster ou mettre à jour régulièrement le programme d’intégration ; personnaliser si nécessaire ;
  • Participer aux sessions de formation ;
  • Suivre chaque nouvel employé dans son intégration : accompagner l’employé sur les contrats, planifier des rencontres régulières sur les lieux de travail, revoir les rôles et responsabilités, l’exécution des tâches, ainsi que ses besoins éventuels ; personnaliser le suivi (fréquence et contenu) en tenant compte de chaque employé ;
  • Mettre en place des plans de formations personnalisés ;
  • Émettre des compte-rendu réguliers au superviseur, à la direction adjointe et au département des ressources humaines ;
  • Coordonner les visites ou interventions avec celles du superviseur ou des éducateurs spécialisés ;
  • Effectuer toute autre tâche pouvant être exigée par son supérieur immédiat.


PROFIL RECHERCHÉ

  • Détenir une formation universitaire et/ou une expérience pertinente à l’emploi
  • 2 à 5 années d’expérience dans un poste similaire (sécurité, formation, intégration, éducation spécialisée)


Connaissances :

  • Excellente connaissance du français, l’anglais un atout
  • Connaissances des techniques de formation et d’éducation aux adultes, et de coaching
  • Connaissance de la suite Office


Compétences requises :

  • Contrôle et suivi
  • Motivation et développement compétence
  • Planification et organisation
  • Travail d'équipe et relations interpersonnelles
  • Prise de décision, jugement et autonomie
  • Amélioration continue, innovation et adaptation


Salaire de base à partir de 53 040$ par an
skills: ['Ajuster ou mettre à jour régulièrement le programme d’intégration ; personnaliser si nécessaire ;', 'Contrôle et suivi', 'Sous la supervision de la direction adjointe de la division sécurité, le rôle de la superviseure ou du superviseur d’intégration inclut notamment :']

QUI SOMMES-NOUS ?

Entreprise d’économie sociale fondée en 1975, Axia est spécialisée en gestion immobilière avec ses divisions en entretien ménager commercial, Axia Entretien ménager, et son agence de sécurité, Axia Sécurité. Dans un autre domaine, Axia Emballage permet aux compagnies d’optimiser leur capacité de production et d'atteindre de nouveaux marchés, en leur offrant un service de sous-traitance alimentaire et industrielle tout en leur assurant un soutien logistique.

Dans un marché toujours plus compétitif, notre groupe est fier d’offrir à ses clients des services hautement professionnels. La qualité de notre travail est au cœur de notre engagement comme le démontre notre certification ISO 9001.

Fort de ses nombreux succès, Axia prouve que l’économie sociale rapporte, pour le plus grand bénéfice de ses employés et, bien entendu, au profit de ses clients.


SOMMAIRE DU POSTE

Sous la supervision de la direction adjointe de la division sécurité, le rôle de la superviseure ou du superviseur d’intégration inclut notamment :

  • Préparer et s’assurer du bon déroulement des programmes d'intégration des nouveaux employés ;
  • Assurer le suivi, le soutien et les interventions nécessaires sur les postes de travail tout au long de la période d’intégration, et apporter les rétroactions ou ajustements nécessaires ;
  • S'assurer que les nouveaux employés connaissent bien leurs rôles et responsabilités, et que leurs besoins soient pris en charge.


PRINCIPALES RESPONSABILITÉS

  • En collaboration avec la direction adjointe, le formateur et les superviseurs, développer et maintenir à jour un programme d’intégration des nouvelles recrues afin de leur assurer un parcours d’intégration et le soutien nécessaire durant les 12 premiers mois ;
  • Ajuster ou mettre à jour régulièrement le programme d’intégration ; personnaliser si nécessaire ;
  • Participer aux sessions de formation ;
  • Suivre chaque nouvel employé dans son intégration : accompagner l’employé sur les contrats, planifier des rencontres régulières sur les lieux de travail, revoir les rôles et responsabilités, l’exécution des tâches, ainsi que ses besoins éventuels ; personnaliser le suivi (fréquence et contenu) en tenant compte de chaque employé ;
  • Mettre en place des plans de formations personnalisés ;
  • Émettre des compte-rendu réguliers au superviseur, à la direction adjointe et au département des ressources humaines ;
  • Coordonner les visites ou interventions avec celles du superviseur ou des éducateurs spécialisés ;
  • Effectuer toute autre tâche pouvant être exigée par son supérieur immédiat.


PROFIL RECHERCHÉ

  • Détenir une formation universitaire et/ou une expérience pertinente à l’emploi
  • 2 à 5 années d’expérience dans un poste similaire (sécurité, formation, intégration, éducation spécialisée)


Connaissances :

  • Excellente connaissance du français, l’anglais un atout
  • Connaissances des techniques de formation et d’éducation aux adultes, et de coaching
  • Connaissance de la suite Office


Compétences requises :

  • Contrôle et suivi
  • Motivation et développement compétence
  • Planification et organisation
  • Travail d'équipe et relations interpersonnelles
  • Prise de décision, jugement et autonomie
  • Amélioration continue, innovation et adaptation


Salaire de base à partir de 53 040$ par an
skills: ['Ajuster ou mettre à jour régulièrement le programme d’intégration ; personnaliser si nécessaire ;', 'Contrôle et suivi', 'Sous la supervision de la direction adjointe de la division sécurité, le rôle de la superviseure ou du superviseur d’intégration inclut notamment :']

SUPERVISEUR D’INTÉGRATION – SÉCURITÉ


QUI SOMMES-NOUS ?

Entreprise d’économie sociale fondée en 1975, Axia est spécialisée en gestion immobilière avec ses divisions en entretien ménager commercial, Axia Entretien ménager, et son agence de sécurité, Axia Sécurité. Dans un autre domaine, Axia Emballage permet aux compagnies d’optimiser leur capacité de production et d'atteindre de nouveaux marchés, en leur offrant un service de sous-traitance alimentaire et industrielle tout en leur assurant un soutien logistique.

Dans un marché toujours plus compétitif, notre groupe est fier d’offrir à ses clients des services hautement professionnels. La qualité de notre travail est au cœur de notre engagement comme le démontre notre certification ISO 9001.

Fort de ses nombreux succès, Axia prouve que l’économie sociale rapporte, pour le plus grand bénéfice de ses employés et, bien entendu, au profit de ses clients.


SOMMAIRE DU POSTE

Sous la supervision de la direction adjointe de la division sécurité, le rôle de la superviseure ou du superviseur d’intégration inclut notamment :

  • Préparer et s’assurer du bon déroulement des programmes d'intégration des nouveaux employés ;
  • Assurer le suivi, le soutien et les interventions nécessaires sur les postes de travail tout au long de la période d’intégration, et apporter les rétroactions ou ajustements nécessaires ;
  • S'assurer que les nouveaux employés connaissent bien leurs rôles et responsabilités, et que leurs besoins soient pris en charge.


PRINCIPALES RESPONSABILITÉS

  • En collaboration avec la direction adjointe, le formateur et les superviseurs, développer et maintenir à jour un programme d’intégration des nouvelles recrues afin de leur assurer un parcours d’intégration et le soutien nécessaire durant les 12 premiers mois ;
  • Ajuster ou mettre à jour régulièrement le programme d’intégration ; personnaliser si nécessaire ;
  • Participer aux sessions de formation ;
  • Suivre chaque nouvel employé dans son intégration : accompagner l’employé sur les contrats, planifier des rencontres régulières sur les lieux de travail, revoir les rôles et responsabilités, l’exécution des tâches, ainsi que ses besoins éventuels ; personnaliser le suivi (fréquence et contenu) en tenant compte de chaque employé ;
  • Mettre en place des plans de formations personnalisés ;
  • Émettre des compte-rendu réguliers au superviseur, à la direction adjointe et au département des ressources humaines ;
  • Coordonner les visites ou interventions avec celles du superviseur ou des éducateurs spécialisés ;
  • Effectuer toute autre tâche pouvant être exigée par son supérieur immédiat.


PROFIL RECHERCHÉ

  • Détenir une formation universitaire et/ou une expérience pertinente à l’emploi
  • 2 à 5 années d’expérience dans un poste similaire (sécurité, formation, intégration, éducation spécialisée)


Connaissances :

  • Excellente connaissance du français, l’anglais un atout
  • Connaissances des techniques de formation et d’éducation aux adultes, et de coaching
  • Connaissance de la suite Office


Compétences requises :

  • Contrôle et suivi
  • Motivation et développement compétence
  • Planification et organisation
  • Travail d'équipe et relations interpersonnelles
  • Prise de décision, jugement et autonomie
  • Amélioration continue, innovation et adaptation


Salaire de base à partir de 53 040$ par an
skills: ['Ajuster ou mettre à jour régulièrement le programme d’intégration ; personnaliser si nécessaire ;', 'Contrôle et suivi', 'Sous la supervision de la direction adjointe de la division sécurité, le rôle de la superviseure ou du superviseur d’intégration inclut notamment :']

SUPERVISEUR D’INTÉGRATION – SÉCURITÉ


QUI SOMMES-NOUS ?

Entreprise d’économie sociale fondée en 1975, Axia est spécialisée en gestion immobilière avec ses divisions en entretien ménager commercial, Axia Entretien ménager, et son agence de sécurité, Axia Sécurité. Dans un autre domaine, Axia Emballage permet aux compagnies d’optimiser leur capacité de production et d'atteindre de nouveaux marchés, en leur offrant un service de sous-traitance alimentaire et industrielle tout en leur assurant un soutien logistique.

Dans un marché toujours plus compétitif, notre groupe est fier d’offrir à ses clients des services hautement professionnels. La qualité de notre travail est au cœur de notre engagement comme le démontre notre certification ISO 9001.

Fort de ses nombreux succès, Axia prouve que l’économie sociale rapporte, pour le plus grand bénéfice de ses employés et, bien entendu, au profit de ses clients.


SOMMAIRE DU POSTE

Sous la supervision de la direction adjointe de la division sécurité, le rôle de la superviseure ou du superviseur d’intégration inclut notamment :

  • Préparer et s’assurer du bon déroulement des programmes d'intégration des nouveaux employés ;
  • Assurer le suivi, le soutien et les interventions nécessaires sur les postes de travail tout au long de la période d’intégration, et apporter les rétroactions ou ajustements nécessaires ;
  • S'assurer que les nouveaux employés connaissent bien leurs rôles et responsabilités, et que leurs besoins soient pris en charge.


PRINCIPALES RESPONSABILITÉS

  • En collaboration avec la direction adjointe, le formateur et les superviseurs, développer et maintenir à jour un programme d’intégration des nouvelles recrues afin de leur assurer un parcours d’intégration et le soutien nécessaire durant les 12 premiers mois ;
  • Ajuster ou mettre à jour régulièrement le programme d’intégration ; personnaliser si nécessaire ;
  • Participer aux sessions de formation ;
  • Suivre chaque nouvel employé dans son intégration : accompagner l’employé sur les contrats, planifier des rencontres régulières sur les lieux de travail, revoir les rôles et responsabilités, l’exécution des tâches, ainsi que ses besoins éventuels ; personnaliser le suivi (fréquence et contenu) en tenant compte de chaque employé ;
  • Mettre en place des plans de formations personnalisés ;
  • Émettre des compte-rendu réguliers au superviseur, à la direction adjointe et au département des ressources humaines ;
  • Coordonner les visites ou interventions avec celles du superviseur ou des éducateurs spécialisés ;
  • Effectuer toute autre tâche pouvant être exigée par son supérieur immédiat.


PROFIL RECHERCHÉ

  • Détenir une formation universitaire et/ou une expérience pertinente à l’emploi
  • 2 à 5 années d’expérience dans un poste similaire (sécurité, formation, intégration, éducation spécialisée)


Connaissances :

  • Excellente connaissance du français, l’anglais un atout
  • Connaissances des techniques de formation et d’éducation aux adultes, et de coaching
  • Connaissance de la suite Office


Compétences requises :

  • Contrôle et suivi
  • Motivation et développement compétence
  • Planification et organisation
  • Travail d'équipe et relations interpersonnelles
  • Prise de décision, jugement et autonomie
  • Amélioration continue, innovation et adaptation


Salaire de base à partir de 53 040$ par an
skills: ['Ajuster ou mettre à jour régulièrement le programme d’intégration ; personnaliser si nécessaire ;', 'Contrôle et suivi', 'Sous la supervision de la direction adjointe de la division sécurité, le rôle de la superviseure ou du superviseur d’intégration inclut notamment :']

title: Security Guard - Mobile Patrol - Full Time - St. Thomas
description:
To:                                      All Security Personnel

From:                                 People & Culture Coordinator

Date:                                  March 17, 2021

Closing Date:                    March 23, 2021

Re:                                     Job Posting

Position:                            Security Guard – Mobile Patrol

Site:                                    Various Sites

City:                                    St. Thomas, Ontario

Status:                                Full Time

Hours:                                 Fixed (Sat/Sun 2200-0730, Mon/Thrus/Fri 2330-0730)

Pay Rate:                            $17.00/hr. - $17.75/hr. Rates are based on levelling system

 

Position Overview:

Reporting to the Operations Manager, the Mobile Patrol Guard is accountable for maintaining the security of client sites and responding to alarms during patrols and on-call alarm response.

 

Essential Job Functions:

  • Ensure proper documentation is passed onto the Portfolio Resource Coordinator on daily basis.
  • Write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Good interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively at various social levels and across diverse cultures.
  • Patrol assigned area on foot, as assigned, to ensure personal, building, and equipment security.
  • On-Call Alarm response (30-minute response time). (weekends, holidays, as required by Management).
  • Communicate any concerns/issues with the Portfolio Resource Coordinator.

Requirements:

  • Valid Security guard license.
  • Valid G class driver’s license with a clean abstract.  
  • Must provide drivers abstract. No more than 2 minor convictions, no major convictions, and no more than 6 demerits in the last three years.
  • Standard First Aid, CPR Level C. 
  • Excellent communication skills with a focus on customer service along with good computer abilities are all core requirements.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills. Ability to write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy.
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.

 

Security Guards may be required to complete a Drug & Alcohol test for incidents.

Highlights:

  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

 

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  2. A Valid Ontario G Driver’s Licence
  3. Covid Vaccination Proof
  4. Proficient in English (both oral and written)

 

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. Immunization Record
  2. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  3. Report Writing
  4. Additional courses as assigned
  5. Paladin License LMS Course
  6. Security Clearance St Thomas Police
  7. Vulnerable Sector Check may be required

 

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

 

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding the OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned

We thank all applicant for your interest, however, only those applicants that are short listed will be contacted for an interview.

title: Mobile Security Guard
description:
Mobile Security Guard

Business Unit: Security Services
Career Area: Security Guard
Location: 

Saskatoon, SK, CA

If you are seeking a job where no two days are the same, this one is for you! As a Security Guard on Mobile Patrol, you will be working in a variety of settings including but not limited to condominiums, commercial properties, and malls.   

We provide people with growth opportunities. 26% of our frontline employees are promoted to become part of our operation teams.

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in Saskatoon now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, we have a position that will accommodate your needs and help you reach your goals.

 

What's in it for you?

  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits
  • We can guarantee 40 hours/week
  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld
  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus
  • Corporate Discounts

 

What does a Mobile Patrol Security Guard do in Saskatoon?

  • Patrolling in a variety of settings (mobile and foot)
  • Enforcing property rules, city by-laws, and other applicable laws
  • Deterring and responding to incidents on the property
  • Completing reports and memo book entries on a regular basis
  • Responding to various types of emergencies (fire alarms/elevator entrapment/intrusion

 

Qualifications to become a Mobile Patrol Security Guard in Saskatoon?

  • Saskatchewan Provincial Security Training Certificate 
  • High school diploma or equivalent
  • Previous security experience (asset)
  • Valid driver's license class 5 with a clean record
  • Able to work 12 hour night shifts
  • Above average communication skills (written/oral) 
  • Computer skills and ability to write report
  • Sense of observation and responsibility
  • Honesty, autonomy and very good judgment
  • Ability to intervene quickly and manage stress
  • Team spirit and excellent customer service
  • All GardaWorld Security Guard employees are required to be fully vaccinated with a COVID-19 vaccine series, approve by Health Canada, as a condition of hire. Should you be the successful candidate, you will be required to comply with GardaWorld’s mandatory Vaccination Policy that is in effect.

Start your career journey with GardaWorld today, apply online 

GardaWorld: Make the world a safer place

GardaWorld is a global leader in the security industry, offering a wealth of opportunity to individuals looking to gain experience and develop professionally in a growing industry. We offer flexible schedules, diverse work assignments spanning multiple industries, and training and career advancement opportunities. We embrace diversity and welcome newcomers, women, students, retirees, reservists, veterans, and more to join our team, as we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.


We thank all candidates for their interest; however, we will communicate only with the selected candidates.


Job Segment:Corporate Security, Security Guard, Security Officer, Security

title: K9 Security Hander- Vancouver/Vancouver Island Opportunities! OPEN TO RELOCATION
description:
Do you love Dogs? Do you enjoy a career making a difference? Securiguard K9 provide K9 protection and detection services for clients throughout Western Canada. With over 30 years of experience, we are the largest supplier of K9 services in Canada and have provided services to all levels of government, as well as corporations, industry, and other high-profile assignments. Our K9 teams are government certified and licensed in Patrol and Explosive or Narcotics Detection. Our advanced teams train with Canadian and U.S. Law Enforcement, the only private K9 Security teams to do so. Our highly skilled teams work in high profile sites including Ports, Airports, Arenas, Industrial Sites and Remote Locations.


We are currently recruiting for dedicated K9 Handlers to join our team of certified professionals!


Position Summary:

K9 Handlers to perform duties in various locations throughout the lower mainland, with some out of province travel. As a K9 Handler you will first start your career in Patrol. You and your K9 partner will work a variety of days/night shifts. As you progress in your career you may be selected for Detection School. Here you will become a highly skilled K9 operator with opportunities for further career advancement and travel.


Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Provide K9 Patrol/Protection support in accordance with established procedures.
  • Provide Explosive or Narcotic Detection Support as directed by the K9 Operations Manager which may include searching provisions, vehicles, equipment, general facilities etc. in accordance with established procedures.
  • Providing Excellent Customer Services
  • Ability to change schedule when needed and have an open availability.
  • Attend weekly K9 maintenance training.
  • Interior & Exterior Patrols as required, including but not restricted to parking lots, stairwells, hallways, common area facilities.
  • Prepares and maintain documentation to ensure thorough training of assigned canine.
  • Assist and respond to any calls by the K9 Operations Manager for additional service as required.
  • Coordinating & Liaising with Police and other Emergency Services Providers as Required.
  • Providing detailed reports, including occurrence reports, incident reports, and patrol reports as required.

Qualifications:

  • 2+ years of security experience
  • Must have a class 5 driver's license.
  • Must provide a clean driver's abstract and provide abstracts annually.
  • Must have a valid BC security license and maintain their BST security license throughout duration of employment.
  • Must have the ability to attain enhanced security clearance.
  • Must have an open availability.
  • Must be fit to stand/sit/patrol for up to 12 hours per day, carry 50lbs, and walk up and down stairs.
  • Must commit to a 3-month K9 training program.
  • Must have the ability to work outside during inclement weather.
  • Must ensure that deportment is impeccable (includes cleanliness, neatness, high level of personal hygiene)
  • Maintain care for assigned dog in the field or kennels.
  • The ability to take care of K9 after hours and provide a suitable home and friendly environment for a dog.
  • Must have a suitable vehicle to transport K9 to and from work in an approved crate.
  • Must be willing to accept requisite responsibilities for working with or around narcotics/ explosives in a training medium or in an operational environment.
  • Experience and skills to deal with difficult people.
  • Exceptional report writing skills.
  • Customer Service and solutions focused.
  • Ability to work independently or with little or no supervision.
  • Ability to accept direction and guidance (listening skills) follow instructions.

title: Security Officer - Hospital
description:
Description


PeaceHealth is seeking a Security Officer - Security Parking for a Per Diem/Relief FTE, Variable position. Hourly compensation starts at $19.37, more depending on experience.


Must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 including 2 doses of a 2-dose series or 1 dose of a 1-dose series plus 14 days beyond the final dose prior to start date.


JOB SUMMARY


The Security Officer is responsible for providing safety and security services which requires regular interactions with patients, visitors, caregivers and clinicians in highly diverse and complex situations. Interacts with local law enforcement to provide information, clarification of events and coordinate emergency protocols. Performs internal and external security patrol of assigned hospitals and/or clinics; dispatch; and access control as assigned.


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS


1. Provides safety and security services which includes; patrolling grounds, parking lots, buildings, securing entryways and exits, etc. to effectively address potential conduct issues, violations of policy, check for property damage, inspect safety issues, inspect certain safety features such as fire extinguishers or water valves, respond to all codes, address trespassing concerns, provide assistance with out of control patients, and utilizes electronic checkpoints.

2. Provides stand-by service or escort services for protection of caregivers or patients as needed.

3. Provides courtesy services such as providing directions, locksmith functions, jump-starts, changing flat tires, reporting vehicles with lights on, and assisting families in times of crisis.

4. Provides non-violent physical crisis intervention and de-escalation techniques to neutralize extreme situations and mitigate negative outcomes.

5. Provides crowd control during events resulting in an influx of patients and/or visitors.

6. Coordinates information, clarification of events and coordinating emergency protocols which may require collaboration with external safety and law enforcement agencies.

7. Responds to all emergency situations and applies appropriate protocols for the Code, Disaster (command center), ETO Exposure, Fire, Flood, Hazardous spills, and all code situations.

8. May assist flight crew and ground crew with Life Flight/Airlift NW transports and securing landing the pad.

9. Ensures adherence to protocols; completing, filing and maintaining correct documentation, filing reports, monitoring visitor permits, and assists with maintaining building access control by utilizing the computerized badge/door system.

10. Performs other duties as assigned.


QUALIFICATIONS


EDUCATION:


+ High School Diploma or equivalent is preferred.


EXPERIENCE/TRAINING:


+ Minimum of two (2) years , military or civilian security or law enforcement experience is required.

+ Healthcare facility security experience is preferred.


LICENSE/CERTIFICATION:


+ BLS Certification upon hire.

+ Valid state Driver’s License

+ IAHSS (International Assoc for Healthcare Security & Safety) Basic certification required within 45 days of employment.

+ If assigned location requires the use of tasers, successfully pass Taser Training Program. After successful completion of Taser Training Program officers will be required to carry the taser while on duty.


OTHER SKILLS:


+ Excellent verbal and written communication skills

+ Ability to formulate a plan of action, carry it out with control and apply crisis intervention and de-escalation skills

+ Ability to perform data entry as necessary

+ Good physical condition to walk, run and lift as needed

+ Working knowledge of Microsoft Windows, Outlook, Teams, Word, and Excel

+ Acceptable driving record in accordance with the PeaceHealth Motor Vehicle Safety Policy.


ST JOSEPH PHYSICAL/COGNITIVE REQUIREMENTS:


+ Work requires active physical exertion up to 33% of the time.

+ Ability to lift objects weighing 80 lbs. or less.

+ Work requires frequent exposure to conditions involving minor cold, heat, poor ventilation or sharp instruments such as syringes or lancets. Reasonably anticipated exposure to blood and body fluids once per month or more.

+ Job duties occasionally require the ability to concentrate and pay close attention to detail (less than 34% of work time).

+ Ability to assist in managing violent, uncontrollable persons.


See how PeaceHealth is committed to Inclusivity, Respect for Diversity and Cultural Humility (https://www.thecaregiver.org/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/PeaceHealth-Statement-of-Commitment-to-Diversity-and-Inclusion-vFINAL.pdf) .


For full consideration of your skills and abilities, please attach a current resume with your application. EEO Affirmative Action Employer/Vets/Disabled in accordance with applicable local, state or federal laws.

title: Part Time - Security Officer
description:
Overview:

Under the direction of security supervisors and managers, the incumbent provides basic security coverage ensuring that adequate protection is provided for the safety of patrons and team members. Safeguards the assets of the organization as well as those of its guests and team members. Promotes an outgoing, friendly guest oriented demeanor at all times.

Responsibilities:

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Exhibit conduct in accordance with all Alcohol Gaming Commission Ontario (AGCO) Regulations.
    ï‚· Ensures that proper security is provided for all transfers of monies within the casino.
    ï‚· Assist patrons with a wide variety of inquiries and situations including providing information about the property and events, giving directions and possibly escorting them if necessary.
    ï‚· Prepare detailed incident reports in a clear and precise manner.
    ï‚· Patrol the casino areas to establish a security presence and report all unusual situations and/or suspicious persons.
    ï‚· Assist in the coordination and resolution of emergency situations.
    ï‚· Assist in maintaining proper key control.
    ï‚· Demonstrate a commitment to ensuring responsible gaming and responsible alcohol service by discreetly notifying appropriate managers of concerns and observations.
    ï‚· Demonstrate actions and behaviors that reinforce the Companyâ€™s Mission and Values of Communication, Integrity, Fun, Respect, Accountability, Passion and Dedication.
    ï‚· Ensure prompt and discreet notification to managers of any observation of illegal acts or internal ethics violations.
    ï‚· Performs all other related and compatible duties as assigned.
    ï‚· Creates an atmosphere that induces guests to make Hard Rock their choice for gaming entertainment; responsible for actively building and retaining guest relations and acts as a mentor to team members in order to provide superior guest service.
    ï‚· Other duties as assigned.
    ï‚· Lives the Brand.

This job description reflects the positionâ€™s essential functions; it does not encompass all of the tasks that may be assigned.

Qualifications:

EXPERIENCE, EDUCATION, AND CERTIFICATIONS
ï‚· A minimum of a post-secondary diploma in Law and Security
ï‚· Working knowledge of computer application packages
ï‚· A current First Aid/CPR Certificate, along with Non Violent Intervention Technique Certificate
ï‚· The ability to obtain registration as a Category 1 Gaming Assistant with the Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario
SKILLS
ï‚· Strong analytical, verbal and written communication skills
ï‚· Working knowledge of computer software packages
ï‚· Previous gaming experience or knowledge of the gaming industry
PHYSICAL DEMANDS
ï‚· Ability to stand and sit for extended periods of time.
ï‚· Ability to walk distances.
ï‚· While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms, talk or hear; and taste or smell. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close, distance, color, and peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.
ï‚· The Casino environment is hectic, fast-paced and often crowded and noisy. May be exposed to casino related environmental factors including, but not limited to excessive noise and constant exposure to general public.

title: Security Guard
description:
Group Description

At Magna, we create technology that disrupts the industry and solves big problems for consumers, our customers, and the world around us. We’re the only mobility technology company and supplier with complete expertise across the entire vehicle.

We are committed to quality and continuous improvement because our products impact millions of people every day. But we’re more than what we make. We are a group of entrepreneurial-minded people whose collective expertise gives us a competitive advantage. World Class Manufacturing is a journey and it’s our talented people who lead us on this journey.

 

Role Summary

 

A Security Guard position with the Corporate Campus Security team, responsible for maintaining a safe and secure environment, while upholding the corporate standards and identity.

Key Responsibilities

 

  • Provide security protection at the Magna Headquarters (days, nights, and weekend shifts).
  • Access control management ensuring access to authorized persons.
  • Contact specific employees to verify authorization for visitor access.
  • Monitoring of video surveillance equipment, fire, and alarms panels.
  • Respond to any suspicious activity on or in relation to the Campus.
  • Regular foot patrol of interior and exterior / completing assigned Security duties.
  • Examine all doors, windows, and gates to ensure they are secure and make note of any areas that have been left insecure.
  • Notify 911 in case of fire, police and/or medical emergency.
  • Liaise with emergency services as appropriate.
  • Identify irregularities such as: fire hazards, leaking water pipes, inoperative lighting, equipment alarms, faulty security entrances and notify Facilities management.
  • Complete Incident/Occurrence reports as required.
  • Adhere to the policies and procedures of Magna International Inc.
  • Complete duties and special projects, as assigned by the Coordinator (Corporate Security), Director (Corporate Security – The Americas), Senior Manager (Corporate Security) and the Global Director (Corporate Security).
  • Performs related administrative duties as required.
  • 12 hour shifts - 4 on / 4 off

Key Qualifications/Requirements

 

SKILLS REQUIRED:

 

  • Ontario secondary school diploma or equivalent.
  • Valid Ontario Security Guard Licence.
  • Valid Emergency Level First Aid Certificate (as required with a Security Guard Licence).
  • Valid Driver’s Licence.
  • Ability to work independently and efficiently.
  • Must have good command of the English language both written and spoken.
  • Must possess good communication/interpersonal skills.
  • Our selection process requires candidates to provide a completed background check of criminal history.

 

DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

 

  • Minimum 1year work experience as a Security Guard.
  • College Diploma in Police Foundations is an asset.

Additional Information

 

Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.

 

Special Requirements

 

Candidates will be required to complete a Criminal Records Check and, if deemed necessary, a Credit Check as part of the candidate selection process.

title: Security Guard
description:
The Pathway Group, a leader in providing IT infrastructure and Help Desk solutions, is seeking security guards to join their growing team. Pathwayâ€™s Managed IT Services division handles clientsâ€™ internal IT systems, including infrastructure (servers, networks, security, desktops) and generic applications.

Reporting to the Facilities Coordinator, the security guards will provide exceptional, 24/7 security to the premises of Pathwayâ€™s corporate office at Markham.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Man the building and the premises to ensure only authorized persons are allowed entry
  • Greet visitors at the entrance & follow protocol for authorized entry
  • Patrol the premises to ensure there is no unauthorized activity in addition to video surveillance of premises (internal and external)
  • Escalate issues according to protocol - Monitor cooling systems, UPS and Generator systems
  • Monitor fire alarm/suppression systems; monthly inspection of Fire Systems and Extinguishers
  • Perform daily patrols & take readings of Data Center/Electrical Room temperature as well as load readings of electrical equipment according to checklist
  • Complete shipping & receiving requirements, maintain courier supplies, maintain & distribute incoming & outgoing mails as required
  • Ensure Janitorial Staff follow maintenance responsibilities

 

Requirements:

  • Minimum 1 year of relevant work experience
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Must be willing to work 12 hour shifts â€“ including overnight in addition to weekdays & weekends
  • Open to work on a part-time basis: 2 shifts per week 
  • Valid Security Guard License
  • Must have valid First Aid and CPR Certification
  • Must be legally authorized to work in Canada

 

Salary: $16 per hour

Schedule: Nightshift (8pm-8am), Tuesdays and Fridays

 

ABOUT THE PATHWAY GROUP

Pathway has been a pioneer in IT Managed Services. Starting out as one of the first ISPs in Canada in 1995, we are now a leading Canadian technology management firm with a global reach. Our clients rely on us as their sole source for high-quality IT solutions â€“ from hybrid cloud services to service desk, telephony and security. We were the first company in Canada to construct a Tier III certified data center and maintain a complete set of certifications including SOC 2 Type II, PCI, and ISO 27001. Pathway employs over 120 trained and qualified staff across four offices in Canada and overseas and continues to grow rapidly.

HOW TO APPLY

Apply with your resume, with details of relevant education, certifications, and work experience. Please email the documents with the subject line: Security Guard

The Pathway Group is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing equal treatment without discrimination on account of race, ancestry, place of origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, family status, disability, color, or ethnic origin.

We thank all applicants for their interest and will contact those selected for an interview. We are not accepting calls from Recruiters or Recruitment firms.
