title: Security Guard
description:
Location



Royal Bank Building - 335 - 8th Avenue SW



Business




Within our office business, this conviction guides every aspect of our work. Our signature structures not only define skylines but are also true destinations — bringing together office areas, retail spaces, and dining options all in one. And our high-end design capabilities and strong sustainability practices allow us to create properties that raise the bar for real estate everywhere. It’s why the world’s most respected businesses, non-profits, and start-ups choose us as their partner.




If you’re ready to be a part of our team, we encourage you to apply.




Job Description




This position is responsible for providing front-line security to maintain a safe and secure environment for the tenants, guests and employees at Brookfield’s high-rise office properties. Guards will work as a part of a team. Due to Brookfield’s high-profile guards can expect multiple training opportunities in various security & life safety related areas. There is opportunity for growth within Brookfield. There may also be opportunities available for overtime.




RESPONSIBILITIES:

+ Ensuring the security and life safety of all tenants, guests, contractors, and staff are a priority always.

+ Patrol building lobbies, exterior areas, parkades, tenant and retail areas.

+ Monitor and authorize entrance and departure of employees, visitors, contractors etc. ensure a high level of access control to the building.

+ Support the day to day operation of the Security Control Room, ensure response to calls are completed in a timely manner.

+ Deliver superior customer service to internal/external clients while ensuring strict adherence to Brookfield policies and processes.

+ Investigate and assist with response to all incidents that occur while on shift, ensure accurate documentation through incident management system.

+ Respond and provide support in relation to emergency response situations (fire alarms, medical emergencies, bomb threats etc.)

+ Audits and assisting in projects related to security & life safety equipment.

+ Embody and support Brookfield Properties’ Safety, Health and Environment Policy.

+ Proactively identify, manage, and mitigate hazards to reduce risk to the workplace.

+ Engage in training and continuing education to develop the knowledge, skills, and competencies required to work safely.

+ Take action to stop work if it cannot be executed safely or if conditions or behaviours are unsafe.

+ Immediately report SH&E incidents, near-misses, unsafe conditions, and/or at-risk behaviours to their supervisor; then diligently work to correct the problem.

+ Promote safe work practices and safe working conditions in accordance with all Brookfield Properties Safe Work Procedures.

+ Wear Personal Protective Equipment when required.

+ Completing other duties as assigned.

+ This position requires rotating shift work including weekends, evenings and holidays.






SERVICE & PERSONAL SKILLS:




This position requires a dedicated team player with a keen commitment to providing personalized customer service. Proven problem solving and decision-making skills are essential to perform in stressful situations. This position must deal with safety-related issues in a confidential, professional and mature manner.

+ Excellent English communication (written and verbal), organizational and time management skills are necessary.

+ Professional uniforms and shoes will be provided. Dry-cleaning of uniforms is included.






EXPERIENCE & TECHNICAL SKILLS:

+ Previous experience in the Security field as a Security Guard is preferred, but opportunity does exist to learn on the job.

+ Experience in commercial multi-tenant properties would be a definite asset but not required.

+ Strong customer service skills are required.

+ You will gain knowledge in the operation of fire alarm panels, security systems (including card access system), intercom system, two-way radio, telephones, CCTV system and basic computer skills

+ Candidates should be experienced with computers and MS Office.






EDUCATION / DESIGNATIONS / LICENSES:

+ Minimum Grade 12 Education or equivalent.

+ Must have or be able to obtain a valid Alberta Security License.









We are proud to create a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are grateful for your interest in this position, however, only candidates selected for pre-screening will be contacted.

title: Security Guard 2
company: Centre for Addiction and Mental Health
description:
EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY
Security Guard 2
Security Services,Legal Services

Position Description
The Centre for Addiction and Mental Health (CAMH) is seeking(2) two in-house casual Security Guards 2 to work in the Security Services department.This is an exciting and valuable opportunity for anyone embarking on a law enforcement career. CAMH Security Services offers above industry average salary and benefits as well as opportunities for full-time placements.

Reporting to the Supervisor of Security Services, the successful candidates will provide security services and assistance to CAMH patients, visitors, staff and volunteers to promote a safe and secure environment. The Security Guard will assist with safety matters; report and respond to emergencies, patrol hospital buildings and grounds; and complete various reports. Other duties include ensuring that all Security and Safety procedures are maintained; protection of life and property; incident investigations; liaising with Emergency responders and the removal of unauthorized persons. You will support a workplace that embraces diversity, encourages teamwork and effective communication as well as complies with all applicable regulatory and legislative requirements. This position involves shift rotation (day, evening, and night) and weekend work.Will adhere to minimum availability. This position is located at 1001 Queen Street West.

Qualifications

  • A valid PSIS’s Security Guard License is required.
  • The ideal candidate will possess 2 Years Community College education in law enforcement field or be in progress of completion.
  • You will have 6 months - 1 year of security experience and be First Aid/CPR Certified.
  • 1 year healthcare experience would be an asset.

You possess the ability to deal tactfully and effectively with the public, staff and patients. You will be a motivated team player with a positive service-oriented approach. You will have strong interpersonal and communication skills with a demonstrated sensitivity towards mental health and addictions clientele. The incumbent will be able to work with minimal supervision, problem-solve and exercise good judgment in varied situations. The successful candidate will possess basic computer skills such as Microsoft Office and Outlook. You will have the ability to cope with physical demands of work. Ability to work with diverse clients and staff is required. Bilingualism (French/English) and/or proficiency in a second language would be an asset.

All applicants offered and accepting employment must complete a Vulnerable Sector Police Records Check. The offer of employment will be conditional upon receipt of the satisfactory Vulnerable Sector Police Records Check.

Vaccines (COVID-19 and others) are a requirement of the jobunless you have an exemption on a medical ground pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code.

Please Note: These (2) casual position are part of the OPSEU bargaining unit.

Salary Range: $22.92 - $28.28 per hour

Please click the apply button below.

CAMH is a Tobacco-Free Organization.

CAMH is fully affiliated with the University of Toronto and is a teaching hospital and research institute. As a CAMH employee, you will be expected to actively support CAMH’s teaching and research activities, in addition to supporting the clinical work of the hospital.

At CAMH, we strive to be an equitable and inclusive employer. Our commitment to equity is grounded in an institution-wide commitment to achieving a working, teaching, and learning environment that is free of discrimination and harassment.

CAMH actively seeks candidates from First Nations, Métis and Inuit, racialized and LGBTQ2S+ communities, women, and people with disabilities (including people who have experienced mental health and substance use challenges).

We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply to our positions.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Please inform us if you require accommodations during the interview process.

title: Tactical Retail Security Guard
description:
If you are looking to work in a dynamic environment, learn new skills, and are interested in future law enforcement opportunities then, Apply Now!


Securiguard is currently seeking security professionals to join our Tactical Security Guards Team.


Who we are:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea their team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.


Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Free Uniforms
  • Paid Training
  • Health and Dental Benefits (subject to benefit waiting period)
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS Babylon. Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians (subject to waiting period)
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Recognition Programs & Events

What would you do:

As a Tactical Security Guard, you will be posted at the store entrance/exit or locations where high thefts have been previously identified, acting as a visual security deterrent.

Public presumes tactical security guard to be a trained security personnel. As you will be the first and last image a customer has of the retailer, we are seeking candidates that can demonstrate high-quality customer service and portray a professional image at all times regardless of the circumstances at hand.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Provide customer service
  • Act as a visual crime deterrent
  • Patrol designated areas
  • Protection of persons and property
  • Assist Loss Prevention Officers and liaise with police (when required)
  • Report significant 'criminal' events including attempted thefts, product recoveries, injuries, and other offences
  • Report risks, hazards, safety issues, and other 'non-criminal' events
  • Write reports using TrackTik software
  • Calmly and professionally handle difficult situations

What would you bring:

  • Valid BC Security License
  • Tactical security guard or related experience
  • Previous customer service experience
  • Ability to work alone and/or as a part of a team
  • Be able to stand and patrol for long periods of time
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Interpersonal skills

Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer, and we value the diversity of our staff. We are committed to building a facilitative environment of respect, inclusiveness, and career growth.

title: Retail Security Guard - Sherway Gardens Full Time
description:
To:                          All Security Personnel

 

From:                    Sharlin Alpin

 

Date:                     January 28, 2022

 

Closing Date:     February 4, 2022

 

Re:                         Job Posting

 

Position:              Security Guard

 

Site:                       CF Sherway Gardens

 

City:                       Etobicoke, ON                  

 

Status:                  Full-Time

 

Hours:               Rotating Continental Days (0700 – 1900/1900-0700hrs.)

 

Pay Rate:        $17.39/hr.

 

 

Site Description:  CF Sherway Gardens is located just west of downtown at the junction of Hwy. 427 & QEW. There is easy direct access to the shopping centre from both QEW and Hwy. 427 via Sherway Gardens Road. Anchored by The Bay, Saks Fifth Ave and Nordstrom, CF Sherway Gardens is an upscale fashion and lifestyle centre with over 200 shops and services. Known for its best in class retailers, lush gardens, and comfortable leather seating, CF Sherway is a shoppers' delight.   

 

Job Description:  To deliver a consistent and outstanding level of customer service to clients by actively seeking out opportunities to provide assistance and support. Working on assigned shifts, to act as a deterrent to crime and undesired activity and help to maintain a visibly safe and welcoming property environment.  You will be required to write reports and investigate routine incidents, as well as respond to emergencies in a quick and efficient manner.  Specific duties include but are not limited to:

  • Maintain compliance with and enforce property standards, rules, and regulations in a reasonable manner
  • Able to use tact and diplomacy in dealings across a range of settings and situations
  • Respond to medical emergencies and provide first aid, CPR or AED support until medical professionals arrive
  • Ability to maintain and enforce access control procedures
  • Solid understanding of emergency and standard operating procedures
  • Deal with trespassers and unauthorized persons found on the property, in a fair and safe manner, by enforcing the Trespass to Property Act
  • Assist with Fire & Life Safety inspections
  • Maintain a detailed memo book and prepare incident reports on all matters dealt with using CF's standard report-writing program

Prerequisites:  At the time of the interview, applicants must be able to produce proof of completion of the following:

 

  1. Must possess a valid G Class driver’s license
  2. Minimum driving experience of 3 to 5 years
  3. Must provide driver’s abstract
  4. No more than 2 minor convictions, no major convictions, and no more than 6 demerits in the last three years.
  1. First Aid & CRP Level C
  2. Use of Force
  3. Non-Violent Crisis Intervention
  4. Basic Security Officer Training
  5. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Introduction to Bike Patrol
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Custom Service
  8. COVID Double Vaccinated

 

Position Requirements:  Successful applicants will be required to complete the following courses:

 

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Sherway Gardens Orientation
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s LPO and Retail Security – Module 1
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s LPO and Retail Security – Module 2
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Can Bike Level 1
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online WHMIS
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Note Taking and Report Writing
  8. Additional courses as assigned

 

All interested personnel must apply through the Employee Portal by simply following these steps:

 

  1. Visit www.paladinsecurity.com
  2. Click on Employee Portal
  3. Enter username and password
  4. Click on career opportunities
  5. Click on Ontario, then Toronto
  6. Select the job posting
  7. Register and apply

 

Should you have any questions on this process, kindly contact the HR Department at

hrtoronto@paladinsecurity.com

.

title: Security Guard Supervisor-Residential Concierge
description:
Join our winning security team! Wincon is invested in our employees and our aim is to improve your skills set through professional development opportunities. Our Mission is to proactively protect the investments and assets of our commercial clients and residential communities as if they were our own. We fulfill this mission through our commitment to client satisfaction by continuous training and ongoing investment in advanced innovative technology.

Wincon Security is hiring for a Security Supervisor-Concierge, Markham, ON

These positions are for energetic, friendly, outgoing people, with excellent communication skills.

Why work with Wincon?

  • Competitive wages $18.00 and above per hour!
  • Health and benefits package option.
  • Extensive new hire training
  • Room for growth based on work performance.
  • Opportunities to continuous professional growth and development through training initiatives and employee recognition programs.
Job duties a Security Supervisor-Concierge:

  • Supervise and lead a team of 6 or more security guards
  • Ensuring security duties are carried out in compliance with all federal, provincial, and municipal laws including; The Criminal Code of Canada; Trespass to Property legislation
  • Maintain local site-specific post orders and directives by reviewing and notifying Client and Wincon of required revisions
  • Controlling all vehicles and pedestrian traffic entering the property
  • Greet direct, sign in guest(s) and answer pertinent questions
  • Monitor security cameras
  • Issue and receipt of keys to trades, building staff and contractors
  • Operate security equipment/systems, computers, radios and phones
  • Ensure that the Condominium Safety and Emergency Procedures are followed in response to Fire Alarms and other Site Emergencies
  • Training of new staff
  • Complete daily site inspections
  • Maintaining compliance and discipline of site staff
  • Performance of staff evaluations on a regular basis
  • Be the first and main point of contact in case of emergencies or any site related issues
Job Qualifications:

  • Eligibility to work full-time, legally in Canada without restrictions (Canadian Citizen, Permanent Resident, Work Permit only)
  • A Valid Ontario Security Guard License is required
  • First Aid CPR-C required
  • Two (2) years of security/concierge supervisory experience in residential properties
  • Past experience in managing a security team in a condominium setting
  • Excellent English verbal and written communication skills
  • Exceptional judgment, common sense and decision-making ability
  • Thorough record keeping, report writing and observation skills
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office programs
  • Must be comfortable walking, standing, patrolling
  • Excellent customer service skills: Friendly personality who enjoys interaction with people at a professional level
  • Must have open availability and willing to work overnights and weekends, if required.
About Us:

For almost 30 years, Wincon Security has delivered property monitoring and protective services to retail, commercial, residential, industrial, alarm response and condominium clients across the Greater Toronto Area. We are an integrated solutions provider committed to leveraging cutting-edge technology to provide the very best service our industry has to offer.

Wincon Security is committed to creating an accessible and inclusive workplace. We are committed to providing barrier-free and accessible employment practices in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Therefore, should you require Code-protected accommodation through any stage of the recruitment process, please make them known when contacted by the Recruitment Department and we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Night Security Attendant
description:
Job Description

We are seeking motivated individuals who can carry out all required duties with good deportment and professionalism while adhering to our company values and standards. The ideal candidate understands the effectiveness of operating as a team, whether leading or supporting and is keen to provide excellent customer service when working with the public. An interest in security solutions and a passion for public safety will make you a like-minded member of our workforce.

Whether you're just looking for casual security work or looking to make security a career, we can accommodate anyone who is the right fit for our company, while offering competitive wages. Apply today!

Job Responsibilities:

  • Maintain a safe and secure environment for clients and employees.
  • Staying alert and awake.
  • Documenting/reporting issues.
  • Provide excellent customer service.
  • Adhering to all company service and operating standards.
  • Be of good deportment.

Part-time position:

Overnight shifts.

Two days per week.

8 hours shift (10:00pm - 6:00am)

$18,00 per hour

Guidelines for submitting an Application ~ UNION staff, who choose to submit their application through hard-copy mail, fax or email will need to have their application (ONA & OPSEU: with accompanying skills profile) available to the Recruitment Staff before 4 p.m. on the day the posting closes (day-7). ALL JOB SEEKERS, including UNION staff, who use the Career's Website to apply for job postings will have until 11 p.m. on the day the posting closes (day-7). ***INTERNAL JOB SEEKERS - Please ensure that both your ID# and last name are entered exactly as you see it on your most recent pay stub, otherwise you will be treated as an external candidate.***

Hamilton Health Sciences fosters a culture of patient and staff safety, whereby all employees are guided by our Mission, Vision, Values, and Values Based Code of Conduct. Hamilton Health Sciences is a teaching hospital and all staff and physicians are expected to support students and other learners.

To be considered for this opportunity applicants must apply during the posting period. All internal and external applicants may ONLY apply via the Careers website.

Hamilton Health Sciences is an equal opportunity employer and we will accommodate any needs under the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedom, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. Hiring processes will be modified to remove barriers to accommodate those with disabilities, if requested. Should any applicant require accommodation through the application processes, please contact HR Services at 905-521-2100, Ext. 46947 for assistance. If the applicant requires a specific accommodation because of a disability during an interview, the applicant will need to advise the hiring manager when scheduling the interview and the appropriate accommodations can be made.

This competition is open to all qualified applicants, however, qualified internal applicants will be considered first. Past performance will be considered as part of the selection process. If you are a previous employee of Hamilton Health Sciences, please note: the circumstances around an employee's exit will be considered prior to an offer of employment

Proficiency in both Official Languages, French and English, is considered an asset

If this position is temporary, selection for this position will be as per the outlined CollectiveAgreements:

Article 30 (k), CUPE Collective Agreement

Article 10.7 (d), ONA Collective Agreement

Article 13.01 (b) (ii), OPSEU 273 Collective Agreement

Article 14.04, OPSEU 209 Collective Agreement

Article 2.07 and Article 13, PIPSC RT Collective Agreement
skills: ['The Security Officer is responsible for the delivery of quality protection programs and security services to patients, visitors and staff at Hamilton Health Sciences and Faculty of Health Sciences. The Officer will work with all areas of Hamilton Health Sciences, Faculty of Health Sciences, McMaster University, Juravinski Cancer Centre and Hamilton Police Services to continuously improve our service levels and meet the expectations of our community and staff.']

title: Event Security Guard
description:
Overview

XA Security is one of Alberta's most visible security and crowd management agencies, specializing in outstanding customer service and engagement. We have fun, we smile, and we're nice!

We are a Kind, People-Focused team that Never Stops Learning, and Always Stays Cool. 

Job Description - Empathetic Security Professionals Needed

We are looking for friendly people who are both safety conscious and people-focused to join our Event Security Team. This is a role for skilled customer service professionals who have an exceptional attitude, the desire to solve problems, and the ability to empathize with others.

Every day is different with XA Security! Your role as a Security Guard can vary greatly, but your overall duties relate back to one concept - we keep people safe! This could mean verifying vaccination status, conducting searches and bag checks, or just providing an overall security presence so that attendees know who to find if they need anything. At XA Security, we believe that our security guards are really Experience Ambassadors. 

Where do you think we get the name "XA" from?

You should apply for this role if you have:

  • A friendly, approachable attitude. You love interacting with all sorts of humans!
  • A real interest in safety and customer service
  • The desire to ensure things in your care are managed efficiently and safely
  • A high comfort level working in unique situations where your customer service skills will be constantly challenged
  • The desire to make $17.75 to start, and have a flexible schedule that works well with other commitments!
  • Received both doses of a Covid-19 vaccination, or have a valid medical / religious exemption

Position Requirements:

This Experience Ambassador role requires:

  • Valid Alberta Security Worker License (we'll walk you through the licensing process!)
  • Valid ProServe, ProTect, and SellSafe certifications (easily attainable online!)
  • Valid Standard First Aid & CPR C certification 
  • 2 years in a customer-facing role in challenging environments (preferred)

Let's be honest - that's a lot. We know. But we pride ourselves on having employees with extensive skill sets that, when paired with a great attitude, will make them successful in their role.

We will gladly conduct interviews with the right applicants, even if you don't meet the hiring requirements at the time you apply. We are looking for people with the right attitude, and are happy to guide you towards achieving the required licences and certificates.

Looking for something more?

We know that our Event Security Guards are often looking for other ways to get involved with XA! We also operate Static and Mobile security divisions, and are regularly drawing from our Event Security Roster to fill these positions.

Think you'd be a good fit?

Apply today and you'll receive an invitation to join one of our weekly Information Sessions! With both in-person and virtual options, we use these sessions as a chance to get to know you better, and a platform where you can ask any questions you may have. 

Learn more about us at www.xasecurity.ca

Job Description

EXCITING JOB OPPORTUNITY

SECURITY OFFICER – PART TIME

SHORELINESSLOTS AT KAWARTHA DOWNS

(KAW-SEC-011-2022)

Team up with the industry’s best and provide great guest experiences at Shorelines Slots at Kawartha Downs!

We are currently seeking a driven and energetic individual to join our team as a Part Time Security Officer.  Under the direct supervision of the Security Manager, this position is responsible for the safety and protection of employees, guests, the facility and company assets at the site level. 

Duties and Responsibilities Include: 

  • Monitoring, documenting and reporting internal and external violations, unsafe conditions, potential hazards, suspicious persons and activities; preparing written and electronic statements;
  • Enforcing restricted access by unauthorized persons;
  • Observing transactions, slot drops, chip fills and transferring items to Lost & Found;
  • Performing identification checks to any guest who appears under 30;
  • Referring disputes to the Supervisor, Security;
  • Conducting regular patrols of the interior and exterior of the property as assigned;
  • Escorting guests and team members;
  • Performing crowd control as directed
  • Attending to first aid incidents;
  • Ensuring compliance with licensing laws, health and safety, and other statutory regulations;
  • Assisting Supervisor, Security with enrolling guests in the Self-Exclusion program;
  • Performing other reasonable duties as assigned.

Successful candidates will demonstrate the following qualifications:

  • Two (2) years of experience working with the public in a service role or in the service industry
  • Smart Serve certification
  • Current First Aid/CPR certification
  • High school diploma or equivalent required, post-secondary education an asset
  • Previous experience or training in security an asset
  • The ability to obtain registration as a Category 2 Gaming Assistant with the Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario
  • A willingness to learn, develop and achieve new skills for personal and professional development
  • Computer literacy in MS Office
  • Inquisitive, investigative mind, able to identify suspicious behaviours /transactions and make sound judgments based on this
  • Able to organize data with great accuracy
  • Knowledge of privacy legislation an asset
  • Ability to exceed internal and external guest expectations through timely, effective and service-oriented communication
  • Excellent problem solving and conflict resolution capabilities

Since the fun never stops at Shorelines, candidates must be ready and willing to work a flexible schedule, including evenings, weekends, holidays and overnights, based on business needs.

 

 

ApplicationProcess: Qualified Internal candidates are welcome to apply by completing an internal application form and submitting application, cover letter & resume directly to Danielle Prior at HRKAW@shorelinescasinos.com by the deadline of 17:00 EST, May 12th, 2022 Thank you for your application and best of luck!

 

Great Canadian Gaming Corporation is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we welcome all qualified applicants to apply to join our team of unique contributors. We accommodate people with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process and applicants are encouraged to advise Human Resources in advance if an accommodation is required. We thank all applicants for their interest and will contact those qualified to continue in the recruitment process.

title: Agent de sécurité
description:
Description de l'entreprise

ES-TU FORGÉ POUR AIM GLOBAL ?

Inscris-toi dans l’histoire de AIM Global.

Nous n’avons cessé de prospérer au cours des huit dernières décennies grâce à la force de nos employés et à la confiance de nos clients, établissant ainsi notre présence au niveau mondial et diversifiant nos expertises. Prends part à AIM Global, une chaîne intégrée comprenant cinq divisions qui travaillent en collaboration pour revaloriser des ressources, dont les métaux, les déchets de construction, les véhicules hors d’usage et les espaces urbains. Nous investissons dans nos installations et nos employés pour garantir un meilleur avenir pour tous.

C’est simple ; nous le faisons bien. Nous visons l’excellence.

Description du poste

Sous la supervision du superviseur des agents de sécurité, le titulaire du poste sera responsable d’effectuer la sécurité sur les lieux de travail.

Responsabilités

  • Contrôle des entrées et sorties (visiteurs, employés, client);
  • Patrouiller, à pied ou en véhicule, les bâtiments ainsi que la cour (AIM Montréal ou Laval);
  • Service à la clientèle;
  • Assurer la protection de la preuve lors d’un délit;
  • Protéger les lieux d’un incident;
  • Intervenir en cas d’incendies, d’urgences médicales, d’alertes à la bombe, d’inondations, de fuites d’eau, de présence de matière dangereuses;
  • Rédiger les rapports et registres;
  • Prévention de la criminalité;
  • Procéder au verrouillage et déverrouillage des portes;
  • Faire les fouilles en cas de doutes;
  • Effectuer toutes autres tâches connexes.
Qualifications

  • Niveau d’étude : Diplôme d’études secondaires
  • Disponibilité : Doit être en mesure de travailler sur les quarts : jour/soir/nuit
  • Détenir un permis d’agent de sécurité valide, émis par le Bureau de la sécurité privée
  • Ne pas avoir de casier judiciaire
  • Maîtrise du français et anglais parlé
  • Maîtrise du français à l’écrit
  • Cours de secourisme
  • Bonne connaissance informatique (word, excel, outlook)
  • Permis de conduire de classe 5

Atout

  • Possède formation incendie;
  • A travaillé dans le domaine industriel;
  • A reçu la formation : attestation d’études professionnelles- sécurité privée-gardiennage.

Qualités / Aptitudes recherchés

  • Excellent jugement;
  • Calme et rationnel;
  • Leadership;
  • Travail d’équipe;
  • Faire preuve d’initiative et d’autonomie;
  • Bonne capacité à faire face à des situations stressantes;
  • Service à la clientèle;
  • Sens de l’observation;
  • Habileté à communiquer efficacement.


Informations complémentaires

  • Poste temporaire à temps partiel;
  • Deux horaires possible:
  • Laval - Lundi au vendredi 16h à 21h (25 heures)
  • Montréal - Samedi et dimanche 18h à 6h (24 heures)

La Compagnie Américaine de Fer & Métaux et ses filiales offrent des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous. Le masculin est uniquement utilisé afin d'alléger le texte. Seules les personnes retenues pour entrevue seront contactées.

Nous visons l’excellence.', 'Possède formation incendie;']

title: Airside Security Guard
description:
AIRPORT SECURITY GUARD (TORONTO PEARSON AIRPORT)

(Flexible Hours/Weekdays/Weekends/Casual hours)

Areyou passionate about Safety & Security and seeking opportunity to join a team of Security Professionals?

A.S.P. Incorporated has provided security and customer service solutions for over 20 years to Canadian clients. We employ in excess of 2000 employees and are a subsidiary of ICTS EUROPE, which is operating in 22 countries and employing more than 17000 professionals. A.S.P provide services to some of the largest airports in Canada and has a significant presence in the Commercial and Residential spaces in Ontario and Alberta.

A.S.P. is looking for Access Control Officer, who take pride in becoming ambassador of Airport and make every interaction professional and positive. Work with integrity, respect, and take responsibility of the security and safety at the Pearson Airport.

What you will do:

  • Monitor and controls ground-side to airside access and doors (restricted area access control);
  • Operate a variety of security and parking equipment including CCTV, Parking Pay & Display Units, Parking Cash Register & Pay on Foot Station, Recording systems, PA System, Portable Radios, etc.;
  • Respond to screening checkpoint and other airport restricted area alarms;
  • Perform security patrols and responses throughout the airport as well as tenant facilities;
  • Complete daily logs, deficiency reports and incident/occurrence reports;
  • Carry out customer service-related duties which includes hand shoveling of snow, greeting passengers & assisting with luggage when required, etc.;
  • Perform emergency response duties in accordance with the Airport Emergency Response Manual.

Who you are:

  • Minimum High School diploma or Grade 12 education;
  • Eligible to work in Canada;
  • Proficient computer skills such as Microsoft Office;
  • Self-motivated individual with a strong attention to detail.
  • Excellent written & verbal communication and active listening skills;
  • Must Possess a valid Security license, Ontario Drivers License (G or Higher) with a clear a driving abstract and Basic First Aid and CPR certification;
  • Must be willing to provide Criminal Record check upon request;
  • Possession of a valid Restricted Area Identity Card (RAIC) is an asset;
  • Possession of a valid Airside Vehicle Operator's Permit (AVOP D/DA) is an asset.

Why you should work with A.S.P:

  • We care about our team and their personal and professional success;
  • We offer competitive salaries;
  • You can have flexible hours/schedules; and
  • Free airport parking when on shift

A.S.P. Incorporated is committed to support a diverse workforce from various communities within which we operate. We encourage all qualified professionals, without regard to race, gender identity, colour, sex, marital / family status, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, aboriginal status, age, etc. to apply.

EMAIL YOUR RESUME TO BPaul@security-asp.com

We hire for PERSONALITY. We train for the job.

* Please note: If you are on a work/study permit - Obtaining a Restricted Access Identification Card (RAIC) through Transport Canada is taking approximately 18-24 months (2 years) for individuals.

title: Security Guard (Travel to Fort St. John area)
description:
WHY WORK AT BACKWOODS?

 

Backwoods Security Services Ltd. is an Alberta Based security and protective services provider owned by the Alexis Nakota Sioux Nation. We are part of the larger family of Backwoods Energy Services which prides itself in its ability to execute projects in a safe, cost effective and timely manner. With our access to highly experienced Indigenous security guards, Backwoods Security offers top-tier security execution while creating a positive socio-economic impact within Indigenous communities.

 

At Backwoods Security Services, our culture is what sets us apart from our competition. Our employees are dedicated members of our team who know they can connect with those they serve and secure, count on reliable work hours, and be part of a growing organization that has its sights set on becoming an industry standard.

 

OUR EMPLOYEES CAN COUNT ON US FOR:

 

  • Reliable Work hours
  • Competitive Wages
  • A competitive Health Benefit Package
  • Flexible Shifts to suit a work life balance
  • Uniforms and PPE
  • Training Opportunities
  • Career Growth Opportunities
  • Recognition Programs
  • Making impacts within Indigenous Communities and People

 

tHE rOLE:

Maintain safe and secure environments for customers and employees by patrolling and monitoring premises and personnel. As a security guard for Backwoods you would complete patrols and protect assigned property. You would promote and enforce safety, as our guards act as a visible deterrent against irregular activity.

 

 

What youâ€™ll be doing:

  • Maintain a safe and secure environment for our clients by patrolling and monitoring premises
  • Monitor surveillance equipment, inspect buildings, equipment, and access points
  • Access Control: Permit authorized persons entry to site when required
  • Prevent losses and damage by reporting irregularities, inform violators of policy and procedures; restrain if necessary
  • Control traffic by directing drivers
  • Complete daily Field Level Hazard Assessments (FLHAâ€™s) and Daily Occurrence Reports (DORâ€™s) and Incident Reports (IRâ€™s) when required
  • Inspect Backwoods vehicles, notify Security Coordinator when service is required
  • Maintain environment by monitoring and setting building and equipment controls
  • Arrive for your shift on time. If you know you will be unable to fulfill your duties, you must communicate with the Security Coordinator ahead of time or organize a replacement
  • Able to work efficiently and effectively both as part of a team or individually on site

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

where youâ€™ll be working:

  • Work outdoors in all weather conditions when required, work indoors or in camps
  • Driving Backwoods truck in all weather conditions; advise Security Coordinator when service is required
  • Adhere to all traffic laws and regulations, such as driving within speed limits.
  • This is a Full Time Position. Shifts are generally 12 hours per day; Hours of Work Averaging Agreement in place.  
  • 2 Weeks on 2 Weeks off rotational schedule
  • Overtime and weekend work may be required
  • Overtime is paid out per BC Employment regulations

 

 

 

WHAT WEâ€™RE LOOKING FOR:

  • 1-year experience in Security
  • BCST training/BC Security Guard License
  • Additional training: First Aid/CPR/AED, CSTS-09 or CSTS 2020, PCST & H2S Alive 
  • Safe Driving, Class 5 Driver's License, and a Clean 3 Year Personal Driver's Abstract 
  • Objectivity, emotional control, and dependability
  • Able to follow complex instructions, both written and verbal
  • Knowledgeable about security operations and procedures
  • May be required to be double vaccinated for certain sites 
  • Site orientations as needed and requested
  • Technology Skills

 

 

 

How To Apply

 

Please submit your cover letter and resume directly to our website: backwoodsenergy.ca/careers

 

We thank all applicants for their interest in this position, however only selected candidates will be contacted for an interview.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by the incumbent(s) of this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and activities required of the position.

Job Description

EXCITING JOB OPPORTUNITY

SECURITY OFFICER – PART TIME PERMANENT

SHORELINES CASINO PETERBOROUGH

(PET-SEC-002-2022)

 

Team up with the industry’s best and provide great guest experiences at Shorelines Casino Peterborough!

We are currently seeking a driven and energetic individual to join our growing business in eastern Ontario as a SECURITY OFFICER. This role will join our team at Shorelines Casino Peterborough. Under the direct supervision of the Regional Manager, Security or the Shift Supervisor, Security, this position is responsible for the safety and protection of employees, guests, the facility and company assets at the site level. Ensures adherence to all policies and procedures while contributing to a safe and welcoming work environment for all employees.

Duties and Responsibilities Include: 

  • Exceeds guest expectations by providing outstanding customer service
  • Helps create an engaged work environment by choosing positivity and fun, recognizing excellent peer performance, and by caring about and supporting our colleagues every day
  • Monitors, documents and reports internal and external violations, unsafe conditions, potential hazards, suspicious persons and activities; prepares electronic statements via a non-gaming record keeping system
  • Enforces restricted access by unauthorized persons
  • Observes cashier transactions and slot drops (if applicable); escorts cash and cash equivalent movements
  • Tags and reports found property; transfers to Lost & Found
  • Conducts regular patrols of the interior and exterior as directed
  • Performs electronic surveillance; maintains site surveillance equipment; reports issues
  • Escorts guests and employees as directed
  • Performs identification checks as required
  • Refers guest disputes to the Supervisor, Security
  • Performs crowd control as directed
  • May enroll guests in the Self-Exclusion Program at some locations
  • Communicates effectively with all appropriate operational departments
  • Builds strong working relationships with guests and employees
  • Complies with licensing laws, health and safety and other statutory regulations
  • Performs other duties as assigned or directed

Successful candidates will demonstrate the following qualifications:

  • People-focused and committed to service excellence
  • Proactive and solution-oriented with a drive to succeed
  • High School Diploma
  • Smart Serve certification
  • Must be willing to recertify for Use of Force every 3 years
  • Occupational First Aid Level 2 an asset
  • Can understand, speak and write English; fluency in other languages an asset
  • Previous security experience an asset

Since the fun never stops at Shorelines, candidates must be ready and willing to work a flexible schedule, including evenings, weekends, holidays and overnights, based on business needs.

 

 

Application Process: Internal candidates please apply by submitting your signed internal application, resume and cover letter to Human Resources via email to HRPET@shorelinescasinos.com by the deadline of April 26th 2022. Thank you for your application and best of luck!

Great Canadian Gaming Corporation is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we welcome all qualified applicants to apply to join our team of unique contributors. We accommodate people with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process and applicants are encouraged to advise Human Resources in advance if an accommodation is required. We thank all applicants for their interest, and will contact those qualified to continue in the recruitment process.

title: Event Security Officer
description:
Company Description

Maple Leaf Sports & Entertainment Ltd. (MLSE) is Canada’s preeminent leader in delivering top quality sport and entertainment experiences to our fans. MLSE is one of North America’s leading providers of exceptional experiences. It is the parent company of the National Hockey League’s Toronto Maple Leafs, the National Basketball Association’s Toronto Raptors Major League Soccer’s Toronto FC, the Canadian Football League’s Toronto Argonauts and development teams with the Toronto Marlies (American Hockey League), Raptors 905 (NBA G League) and Toronto FC II (MLS Next Pro). MLSE owns or operates all of the venues its teams play and train in, including Scotiabank Arena, BMO Field, Coca-Cola Coliseum, Ford Performance Centre, BMO Training Ground, and the OVO Athletic Centre. MLSE also provides fans in Toronto incredible live music and entertainment events. MLSE strives to deliver championships to our city and our fans and bring the world to its feet.

Job Description

As a valuable member of the Security Services team, you will be responsible for the delivery of championship fan service, while maintaining high security standards during events! Come be a part of the action and support Toronto's preeminent sports and entertainment events!

  • Provide professional, diplomatic and pro-active fan service.
  • Offer a friendly and informed response to any service related issue/inquiry.
  • Report, evaluate and follow up on all incidents.
  • Conducting bag and identification checks.
  • Assist in emergency situations including evacuation and injury.
  • Communicate positively and professionally with co-workers and fans.
  • Ensure adherence to MLSE house policies and procedures, including alcohol enforcement.
  • Follow all MLSE Health & Safety policies and procedures.
  • Work in compliance with the provisions of the Occupational Health & Safety Act.
  • Adhere to MLSE service standards and policies.
  • Perform other functions as the need arises.
Qualifications

  • Must be 18 years of age or older
  • Possession of valid Security License (Bill C-159) is required
  • Current First-Aid/CPR training is an asset
  • Smart Serve Certificate within the last 4 years is required
  • Friendly, diplomatic, and outgoing attitude
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Familiarity with the City of Toronto and tourist attractions is an asset
  • Must be flexible to work shifts including weekdays as early as 4:30 pm, weekends and occasional holidays
  • Ability to work in a variety of environments and temperatures
  • A winning attitude


Additional Information

Apply by May 15, 2022 to be considered for interviews the following week.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Maple Leaf Sports & Entertainment Partnership will provide reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities in the job application process. If you have difficulty using our online application system and you need an accommodation due to a disability, please email accommodations@mlse.com. Please note this email is only for accommodation requests. Resumes sent to this email address will not be considered.

#LI-DNP

title: Security Guard
description:
Security Guard

Skanna Security is looking for a Full-Time Security Guard. You will be responsible for ensuring the security of properties and answering alarms during patrols.

Job details:
  • Must drive (own vehicle). 
  • Full Time. 
  • Flexible to work in afternoon and nights.

What you’ll be doing:
  • Deterring and responding to incidents on the property.
  • Responding to various types of emergencies (fire alarms/elevator entrapment/intrusion alarms) Communicating regularly with patrons/clients.
  • Completing reports and memo book entries on a regular basis.

What we offer:
  • Competitive wages.
  • Diverse work assignments.
  • A positive and dynamic environment.
  • Opportunity for advancement in the security industry.
  • Ongoing training and development.
  • Full uniform.

Hourly pay rate: $15.00

What we’re looking for:
  • Valid Security Guard license and first aid card (CPR level C).
  • High school diploma or equivalent.
  • Previous security experience (asset).
  • Valid driver's license with a clean record.
  • Above-average communication skills (written/oral).
  • Computer skills and ability to write a report.
  • Sense of observation and responsibility.
  • Honesty, autonomy, and very good judgment.
  • Ability to intervene quickly and manage stress.
  • Team spirit and excellent customer service


About Skanna Systems & Investigations Inc.:

All Skanna Investigators and Security Guards are licensed by the Government of Ontario, bonded and insured. Their initial and on going training ensures that they have the skills to get the job done. Professional Conduct

title: Campus Security Guard
description:
At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize their dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment.
Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuel us, and moments define us.
As we grow our team, the well-being of our team members remains our top priority. To ensure the health and safety of our team members, including those in the recruitment process, our team members are working from home, and are equipped to do so safely and efficiently.
  We’re looking for engaging Campus Security Guards to provide outstanding service to customers, employees, and clients, while assisting with traditional security challenges. Your protective nature and attention to details will play an important role in our success. Here, your work is appreciated as much as your individuality and you will be supported in all of your efforts.    Responsibilities:Ensuring security and safety of all property, clients, and employeesWelcome and acknowledge patrons according to the company standardsProvide access control for the propertyProtect the property by performing patrols and report hazards and deficienciesAbility to complete detailed incident reportsEffectively use security equipment, i.e. radios, cameras, printers, computers, and electronic lock systemsOperate as a member of the Emergency Response TeamReporting occurrences of accidents, complaints, criminal activity, and crisis situationsInputting of all actions in an electronic Shift Activity LogExposure to Fire, and Life & Safety systemsAvailable to work all shifts including holidays, weekends, nights, and eveningsPerform other duties as assigned Requirements:Prior work experience in a high paced customer service-oriented environmentA history of thriving in stressful situationsValid provincial Security Guard LicenceValid First Aid, CPR level C, AED certificationsKnowledge and application of Municipal, Provincial, and Federal statutes with attention to the Trespass to Property ActWHMIS and other safety courses an assetCCure and IndigoVision experience preferredExperience with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis.
Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine. Schedule: Full time
Shift: Night
Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position)
Work Location: 1 Mount Pleasant (083), Toronto, ON
Travel Requirements: None
Posting Category/Function: Finance & Accounting & Corporate Security
Requisition ID: 257676
 
Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work:Our people are at the heart of our successOur customers come first. They inspire everything we doWe do what’s right, each and every dayWe believe in the power of new ideasWe work as one team, with one visionWe give back to our communities and protect our environment What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You matter to us! For any questions, please visit the Rogers FAQ.

title: Tactical Security Guard - Healthcare Facility - Full Time Position
description:
Regal Security Inc. is currently seeking Tactical Security Guards at one of our Healthcare Facilities located in the Toronto, ON area.

The Ideal Candidate must have: 

  • Full-time availability to work all days of the week and schedules that will consist of afternoons, overnight and weekend shifts â€“ including holidays and weekends.
  • Customer service-driven individual
  • Clear English communication skills in all areas (verbal and written)
  • Detailed and thorough record-keeping (Memo book, incident reports, etc)
  • Keen observation and attentiveness
  • Professional physical deportment and presentation
  • Decision Making, Reliable, Common Sense, and exceptional judgment
  • Able to work as a team
  • Use of Force is an asset

 

Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Provide outstanding and personalized customer service as a front line representative of Regal Security
  • Operate and maintain an organized environment
  • Enforce property rules and regulations in order to maintain the security and safety of our clients and their assets
  • Oversee the logging in and out of site equipment
  • Monitor CCTV and card access systems
  • Respond to all emergency situations (medical, etc)
  • Ensure that safety and emergency protocols are completed in response to Fire Alarms and other Site Emergencies
  • Complete walking patrols and inspections of facilities and equipment
  • Review, know and follow post orders as identified for site representing
  • Maintain a safe working environment and follow the facilities health and safety procedures
  • Duties as otherwise assigned

 

Qualifications:

  • Valid Ontario Security License
  • Valid First Aid/CPR Certification
  • Valid COVID-19 Vaccination Certificate
  • Secondary School Diploma or equivalent and higher (preference will be given to those with a Criminal Justice or Business post-secondary education)
  • Proficient in the use of various computer programs (ie. Microsoft Office, Gmail) and able to adapt and learn new programs

 

Compensation:

  • The pay rate will be $16.00 - $17.50 per hour.
  • Health Benefits are available for full-time employees upon completion of 3 months probation

 

Why choose Regal Security?

Regal Security Inc. is an established and growing security company that offers a vast array of professional and dependable security guard services across the Greater Toronto Area and Southwest Ontario.

Our Everyday Superheroâ„¢ guards are selected and trained to protect our clientâ€™s assets, property, employees, and tenants, using a custom-designed security solution for every client within the sectors we serve.

Every member of the Regal security team, and every service that is carried out, is directed by the Regal guiding principle: Strength & Honorâ„¢. With this in mind, Regalâ€™s security guards are known as Everyday Superheroesâ„¢ â€“ they are friendly, well-trained and, most importantly, proud, as they go above and beyond the call of duty to uphold Regalâ€™s high standards.

 

â€œTHE REGAL SECURITY MISSION IS â€œYOUR PEACE OF MINDâ€â„¢â€

Thank you for your application, unfortunately, due to the high volume of applicants, only those deemed eligible for an interview will be contacted. All candidates will be communicated to by phone or email for the purposes of the recruitment process.

Regal Security Inc. welcomes all candidates equally and encourages all qualified candidates, from women and men including persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and Aboriginal persons, to apply.

 

Regal provides accommodation for applicants with disabilities during the recruitment process in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Physical Security Lead
description:
Company Description

World's No.1 online casino is hiring talent! At Evolution, our talent is live, the players are virtual.

Evolution is a developer and supplier of virtual casino games, since 2006. We evolve the gaming industry by designing and hosting the most streamed, interactive casino tables and slots in the world. Every day, thousands play with real money, from their mobile devices, on one of our 50 games.

Celebrating 15 years of presenting games in 15 languages, Evolution is momentously thriving beyond our 10 studios, 11,000 employees, and 20 countries and cities. Our North American talent broadcasts 24/7 from our studios in Atlantic City, New Jersey, Southfield, Michigan, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, and Vancouver, Canada.

At Evolution, everyone is a winner! Embracing diversity by hiring personalities across any ethnicity, gender expression, and religion, Evolution is a global enterprise hiring individuals that will elevate our brand.

Job Description

Summary

The Physical Security Lead is responsible for the security of Evolution Gaming Group Studios and Offices in Canada 

Responsibilities

Security Systems

·       Responsible for the Evolution Gaming Group Security Systems in North America- CCTV and Access Control- and ensuring systems work as required;

·       Responsible for designing security systems installations in existing and to be built premises;

·       Responsible for working with stakeholders in Evolution Gaming Group (including IT Operations and Technical Operations) to ensure security systems coverage is sufficient;

·       Responsible for configuration, installation and trouble-shooting of security systems, including physical installation of wiring, mounting of devices and basic network management;

Investigations

·       Conducts investigations into breaches of Evolution Gaming Group policies and Federal and State regulation;

·       Maybe required to conduct interviews of employees following alleged breaches;

·       Uses evidence from multiple systems, including CCTV, Access Control and other systems as needed, depending on the case, to identify breaches;

·       Works with HR, Operations and other stakeholders to recommend consequences to alleged breaches;  

Security Governance

·       Provides input on the development of policies and procedures to improve the Security of Evolution Gaming Group premises, and leads on implementation in North America;

·       Conducts periodic appropriate security assessments of Evolution Gaming Group premises, equipment and advice on shortfalls in security preparedness with recommended improvements and solutions;

·       Responsible for maintaining the Physical Security Risk Register for Evolution Gaming Group premises in North America;

·       Provides input on the annual budgeting process identifying opportunities for efficiency and cost savings;

·       Responsible for monitoring and reporting of defined Security KPIs;

·       Provides input on the development of quarterly OKRs;

Security Management

·       Manages security guards and security suppliers to ensure performance meets Evolution Gaming Group requirements;

·       Coordinates security requirements with landlords and tenants in shared buildings housing Evolution Gaming Group premises;

·       Ensures that new Employees receive appropriate Security awareness training during their onboarding;

Other Requirements

·       Must be computer literate and able to use Office and other specialist software;

·       Must be able to climb a ladder, lift up to 30lbs and stand for extended periods;

Competencies

PROFESSIONALISM

·       Knowledge of security management combined with solid background in security operations.

·       Ability to make quick decisions in emergencies or when rapid response is required.

·       Ability to communicate complex concepts orally.

·       Ability to produce assessments, reports, and other papers on security issues;

·       Ability to produce reports and papers on technical issues and to review and edit the work of others.

·       Ability to apply Evolution Gaming Group rules, policies, and guidelines in work situations.

·       Shows pride in work and in achievements; demonstrates professional competence and mastery of subject matter; is conscientious and efficient in meeting commitments, observing deadlines and achieving results; is motivated by professional rather than personal concerns; shows persistence when faced with difficult problems or challenges; remains calm in stressful situations.

·       Takes responsibility for incorporating gender perspectives and ensuring the equal participation of women and men in all areas of work.

TEAMWORK

Works collaboratively with colleagues to achieve organizational goals; solicits input by genuinely valuing others’ ideas and expertise; is willing to learn from others; places team agenda before personal agenda; supports and acts in accordance with final group decision, even when such decisions may not entirely reflect own position; shares credit for team accomplishments and accepts joint responsibility for team shortcomings.

PLANNING & ORGANIZING

Develops clear goals that are consistent with agreed strategies; identifies priority activities and assignments; adjusts priorities as required; allocates appropriate amount of time and resources for completing work; foresees risks and allows for contingencies when planning; monitors and adjusts plans and actions as necessary; uses time efficiently.

Qualifications

Work Experience

A minimum of five (5) years of progressively responsible experience in security management in the public or private service areas, such as national security, military or police, or in a corporate environment is required.

Of these, at least 2 years of experience in security operations in a multi-cultural environment is an asset.

Physical security management and people security management experience in the public, private or corporate sector is required.



Additional Information

Benefits

This position is an excellent opportunity to join the fast-growing Evolution team. We also offer:

  • Competitive Salary
  • Paid Time Off
  • Paid Holidays
  • Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance Plans
  • Company Paid Life and AD&D Insurance
  • Full Training & Growth Opportunities
  • Professional and personal development – for the right person there is an opportunity for the role to grow in responsibility

 

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines

Job Type: Full-time

title: Corporate Data Security Officer
description:
Not just a job…a communitya partnershipa team

You’ll experience them all at London Drugs.  As one of Canada’s fastest-growing and most successful retail chains, we know what it takes to build a satisfying career. We are seeking innovative, customer focused people to join our team!  Our IT Department currently has opportunities for:

Corporate Data Security Officer

This position is an integral part of the London Drugs IT team and reports directly to the Operations Manager, Information Technology. The Corporate Data Security Officer is responsible for the deployment, maintenance and management of information security systems. As well they develop policy and procedures around London Drugs security practices. The successful applicant must be able to work independently and have strong skills, both procedural and technical.  

The responsibilities of this position are as follows: 
 
• Develops and recommends annual resource plan that supports the Corporate Security programs.
• Conducts security risk assessment investigations.
• Conducts security violations investigations.
• Coordinates corporate efforts to find solutions to specific data security problems across all lines of business.
• Provides functional guidance to primary users, secondary users, and custodians on data security, integrity, and privacy.
• Develops and maintains Security policies, procedures and standards with consideration for industry standards such as PCI and PIPEDA.
• Monitors and reports to management on the performance of the corporate data security program.
• Plans, organizes, and controls assigned projects to accomplish a successful and timely completion.
• Performs routine maintenance on software installed and coordinate any change which may be impacted by new maintenance.
• Supports “critical maintenance” activities as required to support the Security Program.
• Supports and carries out Security Awareness Training VIA Corporate and DP Training areas.
• Responsible for Data Classification process.
• Responsible for Data Security Program.

The successful candidate should have a minimum of five years Senior System Analyst experience in application development including data base environment, knowledge of designing application security controls, Data Management and Data Analysis.

In addition, general knowledge of the hardware and software configuration installed, various lines of business, imported applications and security controls are required, including; 

a) Comprehensive knowledge of management skills, business writings skills and system analysis skills, ability to evaluate and resolve all security problems and issues.
b) Thorough knowledge of the various Data Security access control software controls installed, of Corporate Policies and plans, DP Standards, DP Development Methodology, Library Change Control and Data Management.

If you are a well-organized, self-motivated individual possessing professional customer service skills, a positive and professional attitude plus an eye for detail then we have the opportunity for you to excel!  

We offer advancement opportunities through our promote-from-within policies, and competitive compensation packages. We also offer a comprehensive benefits program including:
  • Health & Wellness
  • Comprehensive medical, dental, prescription drug and vision coverage for you and your family
  • Helping you plan for your future with Company matched RRSPs
  • Employee Discount Program
  • Ongoing in-house Training & Education Courses
  • Postsecondary Entrance Scholarships for you or your children
  • Free confidential counselling through our Employee Family Assistance Program
  • Employee Recognition Program
If you possess the necessary skills and expertise and would like to join an exciting team of professionals,

Apply Now!

We are an equal opportunity employer. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work applicable to this position and are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. Be advised, London Drugs DOES NOT use third party recruitment services.

London Drugs may collect, use, and/or disclose your personal information (including the information in this application) where it is reasonable for establishing, managing or terminating an employment relationship. This includes the use or disclosure of your personal information to persons inside or external to our organization, for the purpose of checking references or gathering other information to support an assessment of your candidacy.

To protect yourself, do not respond to unsolicited job offers from individuals or e-mail addresses, and never disclose any sensitive details about your identity (including personal or financial) to anyone you do not know or trust or on any unverified website, or website you do not trust.

title: Security Guard, Retail 1
description:

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in {City} now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, we have a position that will accommodate your needs and help you reach your goals.

title: AGENT(E) DE SÉCURITÉ
description:
Description de l'entreprise

Chantier Davie Canada inc. est le plus important chantier de construction et réparation navale au Canada. Axé sur des valeurs tel que ; Le succès, le dynamisme, la responsabilité et les relations.

Vous avez le goût de l'aventure, vous désirez entreprendre une carrière exceptionnelle dans un environnement ou vous aurez l'occasion de grandir. 

Venez supporter la nation avec nous. Nous fabriquons et réparons les navires canadiens du ministère de la Défense nationale, de Transports Canada et de la Garde côtière canadienne.

Description du poste

À titre d'agent(e) de sécurité vous devrez répondre aux appels d’assistance et effectuer le contrôle d’accès à l’entrée et sortie du chantier pour les travailleurs, les visiteurs et les véhicules. Il agit conformément au cadre légal en vigueur et veille à la sécurité physique sur le territoire du chantier. Plus spécifiquement vous aurez à  :

  • Effectuer le contrôle des entrées et des sorties du chantier et maintenir les registres à jour;
  • Répondre aux appels d’urgence et aux demandes d’assistances de diverses natures lorsque requis ;
  • Appliquer les procédures de département, de vérifications et de fouilles en vigueur;
  • Effectuer des escortes lorsque requis;
  • Émettre les vignettes de stationnement et appliquer les règlements internes concernant le stationnement et la circulation sur le chantier;
  • Effectuer les patrouilles de sécurité et de prévention à pied ou avec un véhicule sur l’ensemble du site selon les directives de travail et en utilisant les équipements désignés mis à sa disposition.
  • Effectuer la surveillance du site en utilisant les systèmes de sécurité.
  • Vérifier le bon fonctionnement des systèmes de sécurité et des équipements nécessaires à l’exécution de son travail.
  • Signaler et prendre action lors de situations irrégulières.
  • Rédiger le journal des évènements quotidien et complète les formulaires et documents requis.
  • Assurer le suivi et distribue les clés sous la responsabilité de la Sûreté industrielle.
  • Recevoir les plaintes, documente les faits et avise les personnes ressources appropriés lorsque requis.
  • Effectuer toute autre tâche connexe à la demande de son supérieur.
Qualifications

  • Être disponible à travailler de jour, de soir et de fin de semaine
  • Détenir un permis permanent du BSP
  • Détenir le diplôme AEC Sûreté industrielle ou commerciale, ou toutes autres formations d’agents de sécurité reconnues par le BSP avec une expérience dans le milieu industriel
  • Cours de premier soin à jour (un atout)
  • Cours de santé, sécurité en milieu de construction (atout)
  • Faire preuve d’honnêteté, de courtoisie, de professionnalisme et de discrétion.
  • Quart de travail de 12 heures (5h30-17h30, 17h30- 5h30)


Informations complémentaires

Pour être retenu, vous devrez obligatoirement vous soumettre et réussir le processus d’enquête et d’obtention de l’attestation de sécurité exigée dans le cadre du Programme de sécurité des contrats du gouvernement fédéral.

title: Security Guard- 19 Wing Comox
company: Commissionaires Victoria, The Islands And Yukon
description:
BC Security License not required for this role

WHO WE ARE:

Commissionaires Victoria, the Islands and Yukon (CVIY) is Vancouver Islandâ€™s largest security services company, with over 800 employees. CVIY is a locally owned and operated Not-For-Profit employer with 90% of revenues being returned to staff in the form of benefits, wages, and training. Founded in 1937 to provide meaningful employment opportunities for Veterans, we now employ persons of all backgrounds to protect Canadaâ€™s critical infrastructures and contribute to the security and well-being of Canadians.

CVIY is proud to offer the best benefits in the industry along with opportunities for promotion within the company, as a community focused, equal opportunity employer.

 

Location: 19 Wing Comox- Royal Canadian Air Force

Shifts: Various days, evenings, and overnight shifts

Reports to: Site Supervisor

Starting Wage: $16.73/hr (includes 2.5% RRSP cash)

 

Rewards & Perks

  • Exclusive BMO mortgage rates, banking options, and more.
  • Opportunities for advancement.
  • Free and paid training programs.

  • Free uniform and dry-cleaning reimbursement.

Job Responsibilities

Required Education, Qualifications and Experience

  • Have a positive attitude with a professional demeanour.
  • Have excellent attention to complete incident report writing.
  • Have excellent problem-solving skills. 
  • Comfortable handling emergencies in a calm manner â€“ training & support will be provided.
  • Ability to work independently and make sound decisions in varying situations.

 

Commissionaires Victoria, the Islands, and Yukon proudly celebrate diversity through an inclusive work environment and welcome candidates from all backgrounds.

title: Security Operator
description:
Canada’s leading business law firm is looking for a Security Operator who will be responsible for administration and technical operations of IT security that include monitoring vulnerability remediation, service delivery of proactive/reactive support and auditing.

If this role sounds like it's for you, email your resume to keshmi.desai@randstad.ca

Advantages
Want to join a growing and challenging team with a hybrid structure in place? This may be the role for you!

Responsibilities
Assists in the development, implementation, and promotion of security procedures, guidelines, industry best practices. Monitors for compliance of Firm policy and consults/advises Senior Security Specialist
Administration of the firm’s physical security system (access control and CCTV), logical security systems including anti-virus, endpoint, authentication/credential systems, Key Management System
Support administration of the firm’s network and firewalls, VPN and remote access solutions to ensure compliance with security standards
Support administration of the firm’s web filter and DLP systems to ensure continued security protection and policy compliance with minimal impact to staff
Provide day-to-day technical security related support to staff, conduct IS security incident handling, and participate in the analysis of QA tickets
Administer SIEM, report anomalous security incidents; conduct targeted analysis of suspect areas



Qualifications
3+ years Security experience, including conducting electronic investigations
Must have related experience configuring and managing physical access and network security systems
Completed Security+ or equivalent certification
Working knowledge of information security systems including PaloAlto, CarbonBlack, Centralized Anti-Virus, AD, Digital Certificates.

Summary
Nice to have...
CCSA/PCNSA certification

If this sounds like the role for you, email your resume to keshmi.desai@randstad.ca



Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.
