title: STATIC SECURITY GUARD
description:
At Fusion Security, we believe in providing valued service, building strong relationships within communities, and safeguarding the interests of the public and our stakeholders.

Fusion Security continues to grow and provide professional security services throughout Greater Vancouver and the Lower Mainland, with clients in a wide variety of sectors, including government, retail, commercial sites, industrial sites and residential areas. Our mission is to deliver the highest quality service in each interaction that reflects a strong and respectful culture.

We are looking for security personnel who are professional, committed, and have experience in security. If this sounds like you, then we want to hear from YOU!

PERKS FUSION SECURITY OFFERS YOU:

  • Competitive, market-based pay rate
  • Extended health and dental benefits
  • Paid training and subsidies for industry accreditations
  • Reimbursement of Security License renewal fees (for full-time employees only)
  • Access to exclusive employee discounts on over 5000 products & services
  • Fitness Centre Membership
  • Referral Bonus Program

JOB DUTIES:

  • Customer service
  • Ensuring the security of all personnel, visitors, and the general public
  • Inspecting & patrolling premises
  • Observe & report site activities and incidents
  • Monitoring property access
  • Investigating and reporting suspicious behavior, incidents, and security breaches
  • Enforcing client informed policies
  • Communicating with law enforcement, emergency medical personnel, and fire departments
  • Responding to alarms
  • Other duties that may be assigned

We Schedule Shifts According to Following Availability Needs:

  • Full time: able to work 32 to 40 hours per week
  • Shifts: Day, Afternoon and Night
  • Flexible availability - 7 days a week including weekends.
  • No restrictions on commuting - the most suitable candidates are available to commute to Downtown, Vancouver, Richmond, Delta, Burnaby & the North Shore. Parking can be provided at some sites for successful candidates with a personal vehicle.

JOB REQUIREMENTS & RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • A Valid BC Security License
  • The ability to stand for long periods of time & complete routine patrols to protect against fire & theft
  • Relevant experience in the security or customer service industry
  • Excellent customer service & professional deportment
  • A high standard for safety & a passion for security
  • Excellent documentation and communication skills
  • Additional certifications are an asset: Occupational First Aid Level 1, 2, 3, AST, Etc.

Please note that security officers may be required to work extended hours and be part of an on-call team for urgent scheduling needs.

For further information on the job posting or if you have any questions, you can contact Ikjot Rai, Talent Acquisition Specialist, at 604-928-1325.

In order to be considered for this position, your application must clearly demonstrate how you meet the requirements as outlined above. Ensure your resume includes your employment history including start and end dates of your employment, and any relevant information that relates to the job to which you are applying.

Due to receiving a high volume of applications, only those applicants selected to move forward in the hiring process will be contacted.

(Part 1, Section 2) of the Security Services Act of British Columbia requires all Security Services Workers are required to hold a valid BC Security License to be employed or employable. Any applicant without a valid BC Security License will be automatically disqualified. For more information please visit: http://www.bclaws.ca/civix/document/id/consol20/consol20/00_07030_01#section2

title: Security Guard
description:
Who We Are:

As a Best Managed Company, we are honoured to be named one of Londonâ€™s Best Places to Work. Sifton Properties Limited is a family owned and operated organization that has been in business for over 95 years. We have a family-based culture where we trust, understand, support and care about each other. As team members, we grow through collaboration, innovation, and open communication. At Sifton, we build outstanding communities where people live, work and play, and we live our values to the fullest.

 

We would love for you to join our team!

About the Role:
  • Inspections of assigned company buildings and grounds
  • Reporting of unusual alarms and occurrences to building management or staff
  • Reporting to tenant representative or building management should any tenant premises be found unsecured
  • Provide direction to visitors requesting information
  • Inspection of corridors and passageways to ensure they are kept secure and clear of any obstructions
  • Parking facility inspection for unauthorized parking or solicitation, accidents, general illumination, safe walkways, entrances, etc.
  • Provide support and break coverage for parking lot attendants
  • Present a positive company image at all times to both tenants and public
Experience & Qualifications:
  • Valid driverâ€™s license, safe driving record, and ability to drive manual transmission
  • Minimum grade 12 education and successful completion of Police Foundations and Diploma Course or Law and Security Administration course.
  • Must possess a valid Ontario Private Security and Investigative Services License
  • Minimum 2-3 yearsâ€™ experience in security preferred
  • Current First Aid and CPR certificates
  • Working knowledge of security systems and building operations, fire safety, city bylaws and applicable legislation
  • Assessment and problem solving skills, knowledge and training in emergency response, with good judgement and decision making ability.
  • Excellent interpersonal, communication and customer relations skills
  • Basic computer and keyboarding skills including working knowledge of Microsoft Word and Outlook
What We Can Offer You:
  • Weâ€™ll set you up for success by providing in-depth training with your team and mentors, working in partnership with our leadership team.
  • Youâ€™ll enjoy special events, celebrations, and unique perks, specific to your role and work environment, that reinforce our commitment to creating a wonderful employee experience.
  • Our unique rewards and recognition programs are designed to celebrate you, your contributions and promote your success.
  • Our Employee Assistance Program is available for your everyday needs.
AODA Statement:

We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee  has the opportunity to  reach their potential.

 

Sifton Properties would like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted.

title: Security Attendant- (Full time)
description:
Mission Statement: Understand the aspirations of seniors and respond with innovative supports.

Vision Statement: Building inclusive communities where all seniors are connected to living their best possible life.


Position:           Security Attendant- (Full time)
Reports to:       Security Team Leader
Date Posted:     April 11, 2022
Deadline:          Ongoing till position filled

Position Summary:
The Security Attendant is responsible for managing all aspects of the Terrace front desk, the security system and responds to Emergency Response System alarms to ensure the safety and security of clients, staff, contractor and visitors of St Paul’s Centre, Terrace and surrounding property.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Performs the patrolling duties of the security attendant during the shift
  • Maintains the safety and security system of the entire complex and monitors security cameras and alarm systems
  • Conducts daily inspection rounds of buildings and premises according to procedure
  • Performs fire safety checks and immediately reports incidents to the Superintendent
  • Ensures the safety and security of clients and responds to emergency situations as    required
  • Responds to resident requests and concerns related to security of the building and individual units
  • Provides access to resident units during emergencies and in response to requests from approved individuals
  • Conducts security checks of residents when instructed by an authorized person

Education:
  • Security Guard license

 Experience:
  • Working experience in community or housing setting or similar security setting
  • Experience working with seniors an asset

 Skills & Abilities:
  • Knowledge of standard security procedures and de-escalation techniques
  • Ability to read and write reports and logs and basic Microsoft Office skills
  • Ability to work independently and with a team
  • Ability to work under pressure and in emergency situations to solve problems
  • Knowledge and sensitivity to work in a culturally diverse environment
  • Professional manner, communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Cantonese language is an asset

Hours of Work:
  • 32-40 hours per week for full time
  • Required to work a rotational 24-hour schedule, weekends and holidays
  • Additional hours required for emergency situations

Other:
  • Vulnerable Sector screening required
  • Valid First Aid and CPR Certificate
  • Proof of full COVID 19 vaccination required for this position

Senior Persons Living Connected is a diverse work environment.  We encourage applications from all persons, including persons with disabilities. Accommodation will be provided if needed in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and Accessibility for Ontarians Disability Act.

Please submit your application by visiting our website at www.splc.ca/careers
While we thank all applicants for their interest, only those applicants selected for interview will be contacted.

title: Security Officer
description:
Few hotels can rival the elegance, European charm, and hospitality of The Sutton Place Hotel Vancouver. Situated in the heart of downtown Vancouver, The Sutton Place Hotel Vancouver has over 560 guest rooms and suites, approximately 15,000 sq. ft. of meeting/event space, and its spectacular setting allows guests to experience exceptional service with first-class amenities, from a personal concierge to a signature restaurant Boulevard Kitchen & Oyster Bar, complete beauty center at Vida Spa and Wine Merchant. Set against a majestic backdrop of mountains and sea, and with the city's famous shopping, business, arts, and entertainment districts just steps away, guests will experience the perfect blend of luxury and cosmopolitan ambience. With its opulent surroundings, The Sutton Place Hotel Vancouver brings a taste of Europe to one of North America's most beautiful cities.

The Sutton Place Hotel Vancouver has been voted 'BC's Leading Hotel' at the World Travel Awards, has been listed as one of Travel + Leisure's Top 500 in the World's Best Hotels, and is a perennial Cond Nast Traveler Gold List favorite.

We are currently recruiting for the following position:

Security Officer (Full-Time 32+ hours per week)

Responsibilities include (but not limited to):

  • Report to the Director of Security and work closely with the Front Office team to ensure a smooth operation
  • Ensure the overall safety and security of hotel guests, colleagues and hotel premises
  • Act as a member of the Emergency Response Team, responding in cases of fire, accident, safety concerns and calls for medical assistance
  • Ensure that any violations to law or hotel policy is investigated and reported
  • Respond to all emergency situations and provide First Aid and C.P.R. as required
  • Correct and report any fire hazards or health and safety hazards
  • Report and investigate occurrences of accidents, complaints, criminal activity and crisis situations
  • Conduct regular floor patrols, cash counts and crowd control
  • Maintain key control records
  • Maintain computer records of all actions in a Daily Shift Report
  • Follow all safety policies
  • Write detailed investigative reports

Qualifications:

  • Previous experience in a Security role required
  • Basic Security Training (BST) certification required
  • Computer literate in Microsoft Window applications required
  • Certification in First Aid required, Level 2 Preferred
  • Strong report writing skills required
  • University/College degree in a related discipline an asset
  • Must possess a professional presentation
  • Strong interpersonal and problem-solving abilities
  • Highly responsible & reliable
  • Ability to work well under pressure in a fast paced environment
  • Ability to work cohesively with fellow colleagues as part of a team
  • Ability to focus attention on guest needs, remaining calm and courteous at all times
  • Supervisory experience in Security an asset

PERKS:

  • Team rates from $59 per night
  • 25% discount at our restaurants for up to 6 people
  • ½ price passes/lift tickets at Grouse Mountain and Revelstoke Mountain Resort
  • RRSP Matching for eligible employees
  • HumanaCare free mental health support & counselling
  • Employment milestone rewards
  • Ongoing employee events, incentives and recognition

SUMMATION:

Submission of resume does not guarantee an interview or an actual transfer. Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, provided they meet the minimal requirements of the applicable skills required.

You must be legally entitled to work in Canada to apply as the employer does not have a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) that would support a foreign worker.

**Applications will not be accepted via email or in person.

**We thank all applicants for their interest in Career opportunities with The Sutton Place Hotel, however, only those applicants we wish to interview will receive a reply to their application.**

**ABSOLUTELY NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE**

title: Security Guard - Prince Albert
description:
Weidner Investment Services Inc., is committed to teamwork, through a spirit of honesty, trust and mutual respect.  While this job description is complete, some responsibilities may not be specifically addressed.

 Performance – Setting New Standards

  • Patrolling common areas and exterior of the property
  • Removing unauthorized individuals from the property
  • Liaison with local police when needed
  • Responding to after-hour calls, including disturbances in a timely manner, initiate action to calm any disorderly conduct
  • Check interior/exterior lighting weekly, report broken windows or lights to Community Director
  • Secure any unlocked apartments or entrance doors.  Report malfunctioning doors/locks to the Community Director
  • Other duties assigned by your Community Director which may include but not limited to garbage pick-up, minor painting or cleaning

 What we value. . . OUR PEOPLE

  • Set the standard and participate in a positive team environment through teamwork, communication and excellence in service; communicate with Community Director

 Customer Service – Responsive management and maintenance…

  • Always courteous and helpful to residents, prospective residents, vendors and associates

 Attention to Details sets us apart….

  • Follow Weidner’s Mission, Vision and Values and comply with all Weidner policies and procedures as outlined in the Associate Handbook and Policy and Procedure Manual
  • Submit daily activity report to the office
  • Prompt with regular attendance; available for flexible hours as needed
  • Willing to be assigned to other Weidner properties; maintain a professional appearance at all times while on duty

 Qualifications

  • Must be available to be contacted at home and to respond in cases of emergency
  • Previous security experience or security training is preferred
  • Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Must agree to a criminal background check
  • Valid and current driver’s license with reliable transportation

title: Security Guard (Relief/On-call)
description:
Overview:

WW Vehicle Services Canada is a recognized leader in automotive warehousing and distribution located in Delta, BC.   We are currently seeking  active Relief/On Call Security Guard, who provides protection for the terminal (142 acres) and its customersâ€™ property. This is accomplished primarily by controlling access to the facility at the Security kiosk and by performing frequent patrols of the entire site.   We are looking for applicants who are highly motivated, active, friendly and team player. Start date: ASAP

Shift & Location:  on call, no guarantee of monthly hours, must be available for either location at Annacis Island or Richmond. Shifts range from: days, afternoons, evenings, and graveyards.

 

Job Description:

 

  • Control the entrance and exit of all vehicles into and out of the facility.
  • Make frequent and non-routine patrols of both the perimeter and interior of the facility.
  • Check all the gates to ensure they are either unlocked and opened or closed and locked in accordance with the Yard Access schedule.
  • Prepare yard for vessel offloading by coning sections of the lot.
  • Verify T-bills as car carriers, dealers and others pick up vehicles from the compound.
  • Vehicle damage verification.
  • Pass vessel discharge information along to Stevedoring superintendents.
  • Other duties as required.
Job Requirements:
  • Mature and bondable
  • Valid BC driverâ€™s license, minimum Class 5 (no L or N licenses)
  • Must hold a valid BST License / Certification.
  • Must have access to a reliable vehicle.
  • Able to drive pick-up trucks.
  • Physical capabilities: requires frequent walking and ability to lift up to 20 lbs.
  • Available for any shifts.
  • Able to listen, comprehend and take direction well.
  • Able to work both independently and as part of a team.
  • Dependable and punctual.

 

We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage all interested, qualified candidates with clean driving records to apply by submitting  a resume and most updated driving record (obtained from ICBC website) and  a copy of their BST License/certificate to the attention of Human Resources. Please ensure you specify Relief /On Call Security Guard in subject line of email. If you fail to include your Drivers Abstract you will not be considered for the position. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

 

Salary: $20.50 per hour

Licenses:

  • Drivers License (Class 5) (Required)
  • BST License / Certificate (Required)

title: PT Facility Security Coordinator
description:
Future You wants to know – what is life at UPS really like? You’ll see that it’s about opportunity, teamwork, a supportive culture and benefits that help you become everything you’re envisioning right now.  Explore the many ways UPS can enrich life for Future You. And if you’d like benefit information, find it with the specific job you’re looking for.

Job Description:

The Facility Security Coordinator ensures regulatory compliance is maintained with all applicable laws and regulations in accordance with the Aviation Security legislation and UPS Local Operating Plan (LOP) standards. This position is also responsible for ensuring the daily operational quality of the facility’s screening process, overseeing chain of custody controls, maintaining documentation to prove compliance, and conducting self-assessments at the site.

title: Security Guard
description:
We are St Barbara. A growing gold company with a global outlook. ​

We’re an Australian based, ASX 200 company with gold mining operations in Australia, Canada and Papua New Guinea. Our vision is to be a brilliant, global mining company that grows sustainably and creates enduring, positive impacts.

Our Atlantic Operations Touqouy mine site is located an hour outside of Halifax, Nova Scotia. Situated in Canada’s Ocean Playground, it’s no surprise that Nova Scotian’s quality of life is second to none. Whether you prefer sandy beaches and coastal cliffs, or the culture and energy of city life, you’re never far from either. Halifax is one of the fastest growing cities in Canada and has been rated by Maclean’s Magazine as Canada’s best place to live and work.

Now is an exciting time for our business and for our people. We’re going through a period of significant change and have gained real momentum in transforming our business so that, together, we can build a brilliant future. We’re looking for people who are ready to grow through opportunity and build brilliance with us.​

We are currently seeking a Security Guard to join our team. This is a full-time permanent position with our Atlantic Operations based at our Touquoy mine in Middle Musquodoboit. The Security Guard works a 4 day on, 4 day off 12 hour shift schedule - rotating between days and nights. Reporting to the Watch Commander, your role will enforce the security policies and procedures for the company to ensure the security of the employees, infrastructure, equipment and supplies.

The Opportunity

  • Enforcing company policies and procedures.
  • Signing in/out and screening of employees, visitors, suppliers and their belongings arriving and departing the mine site;
  • Conducting periodic indoor and outdoor foot and vehicle patrols as required.
  • Maintaining surveillance of surrounding area and reporting suspicious activity;
  • Observing and reporting daily activities and irregularities to appropriate personnel, such as equipment damage, theft, presence of unauthorized persons, or unusual occurrences;
  • Responding to first aid and security emergencies.
  • Liaising with site management as necessary.
  • Ensuring Contractor Health & Safety Compliance.
  • Completing Access Control procedures.
  • Liaising with police, medical and fire in the event of an emergency situation
  • Other duties as assigned.

Are you ready to come and build a brilliant future with us?

We need the very best people. People who genuinely care for the work they do and the positive impact they can make. People who see challenge as an opportunity for growth and value working with others towards a common goal.​

We would love to hear from you if you have​:

  • A personal commitment to behavior consistent with St Barbara's Values including honesty and integrity, respect, working together, delivering to promise and striving to do better.
  • Security License or Diploma preferred.
  • Previous experience in law enforcement, military or security roles is considered a definite asset.
  • Strong written, verbal and customer service skills.
  • Critical thinking and problem solving skills.
  • Strong work ethic.
  • Ability to respond and deal with urgent/critical issues.
  • Ability to work in both indoor and outdoor environments.
  • Ability to generate shift logs, incident reports and access control logs.
  • A valid Driver’s License.
  • Ability to pass a background check.

For further information on St Barbara and to apply for this role, please visit: https://stbarbara.com.au/working-with-us/current-opportunities/

At St Barbara, we’re committed to finding the best fit for every role. We are a diverse and inclusive workplace, welcoming diversity in all its forms. All qualified applicants will be given equal consideration, regardless of their race, national origin, gender, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation or gender identity. We are the only Australian mining company to be recognised as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA) for seven consecutive years. 

We encourage Members of the Mi’ kmaq community to self-identify in their cover letter.

title: Full Time Security Guards
description:
Whether you're looking to start a new career in security services or you're a seasoned security professional, we invite you to explore a future with us.

Our mission at Westguard is to make people feel safe. As a full-time security guard, you'll be responsible for the protection of people and assets by patrolling designated areas, identifying, and reporting safety hazards and reporting security breaches, as well as completing all reporting and radio check-ins. Other duties may include responding to alarms and emergencies and controlling access to the site. You will provide excellent customer service to our clients and guests, while providing a visual security presence to deter and detect unauthorized guests.

What Would You Bring:

  • Valid BC Security Licence
  • OFA 1 (suitable candidate may be sponsored)
  • Excellent Customer Service Skills
  • Confidence in handling and deescalating confrontation in an assertive, calm and respectful manner.
  • Comfort working independently and in varying weather conditions
  • Ability to lift, carry and push weights of up to 50 pounds
  • Ability to walk and stand for an entire eight-hour shift
  • Ability to be part of a two or three-person team

Availability:

  • Full Time
  • Days, Afternoons, Overnights
  • Weekdays and Weekends

Who we are:

Westguard Security Services believes that every person deserves a safe environment to live, visit and work. Founded in 1986 and with more than 200 employees, Westguard remains a leader in the security industry today, delivering creative and innovative security solutions.

Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Paid Training
  • Flexible Schedules & Work life balance
  • Extended Health and Dental Benefits
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS Babylon
  • Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians
  • Access to a robust corporate discount program, Perkopolis
  • Discounted cineplex movie tickets
  • Discounts for an Annual Grouse Mountain Gondola Pass

At Westguard, we believe you can make a difference - by making people feel safe, caring for the people around you and supporting your community.

Westguard is an equal opportunity employer, and we value the diversity of our staff. We are committed to building a facilitative environment of respect, inclusiveness, and career growth. Join our amazing team and help make people feel safe.

title: Jr. Security Officer-Administrative
description:
Who are we? We’re partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That’s the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.

Why Us

We believe in cultivating an environment that breeds opportunity and encourages people to be the best version of themselves. Our team members see work as more than just a job—it’s a career built on passion, grit and ambition. From achieving personal success to lifting others up to do the same, we all rise together. We help people achieve their goals—and then some. Our culture is centered around making an impact. We believe in doing what we love and encouraging others to do the same. Whatever direction you’re headed, you’ll find talented, driven and passionate members of the TEKsystems family creating meaningful work.

General Description:

TEKsystems is currently seeking an Alternate Company Security Officer (ACSO) to help support the current Company Security Officer (CSO) in Ottawa.


Responsibilities

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Verify, Initiate, Monitor and Record Initiations and Duplications of employees/contractors Personnel Security Clearances with The Canadian Industrial Security Directorate (CISD) including: identifying those employees/contractors who require access to Protected/Classified information, assets, or Protected/Classified work sites and ensuring that accurate and complete Personnel Security Screening documentation is submitted for such employees;
  • Assist in ensuring that employees/contractors receive a security briefing upon notification of having been granted a security clearance or reliability status by completing the Security Screening Certificate and Briefing Form;
  • Assist in maintaining a current list of security screened employees/contractors in accordance with the Industrial Security Manual; 
  • Assist ensuring that personnel security screening files are safeguarded properly;
  • Support employees/contractors through the security processes by phone and email;
  • Compile data and organize/track information
  • Provide ad-hoc support to the Company Security Officer including but not limited to:
  • Supporting Private Sector Organization Screening (PSOS);
  • Supporting Request for Visits (RFV);
  • Reviewing subcontracts security compliance; and
  • Filing and management of the Security repository

Qualifications

Required Education and/or Experience:

  • Excellent skills in MS Office (Word, Outlook, Excel), Adobe PDFs and web browsers
  • Excellent writing, reading, and comprehension skills
  • Must show initiative and eagerness to learn
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Must show initiative and eagerness to learn
  • Must have a Federal security clearance at the level of Secret or the ability to obtain one within 6 months

Extra point if you have:

  • College Diploma/Bachelor’s Degree in English, Technical Writing, Journalism or Communications, or equivalent professional experience
  • Experience responding to RFPs or working with job-seekers to polish their resumes
  • Experience writing or editing documents in a professional setting

Additional benefits include:

  • Remote work with the option to work in our downtown office
  • RRSP Matching Program
  • Annual bonus and profit sharing
  • Tuition reimbursement – up to $5,000 annually
  • Charitable and social responsibility opportunities

The Company is a equal opportunity employers and will consider all applications without regard to race, genetic information, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other characteristic protected by law.

As a Doorman, you will be the first person that people see when they walk through our doors, so you might as well call yourself the â€œfaceâ€ of the brand! In this role, you will be responsible for providing our guests and team members with a safe and friendly environment and making them feel welcome!

-Strong ability to communicate effectively

Get Real. Play Hard.

The Banquet is a brand new bar where being bored is virtually impossible. title: Infra Security Lead
description:
Infra Security Lead


IT professional with strong security and infrastructure background with the ability to function in both a Technical role and as a Team Leader. The candidate must be able is to review, assess, design, plan and implement solutions to mitigate threats and vulnerabilities identified in security reports and client.










Build your career with us.

It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this changesupporting our clients digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.

At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.

Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.

Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.

title: Security Officer
description:
Job Description:

Security Officer

Part-time, Event-based

Wage & Pay Grade: $19.19/hour plus 10% in lieu of benefits and vacation (PG41)

Date Posted: February 24, 2022

 

 

Who we areâ€¦

The Pacific National Exhibition is an iconic institution in BC, famous for bringing generations of people together to celebrate and build memories. This 111-year old, non-profit organization has an annual operating budget of approximately $58 million dollars and generates revenue through four activity streams:   the 15 day annual summer Fair which averages 800,000 guests each year, Playland amusement park which welcomes 375,000 guests annually including Fright Nights, year-round events including concerts, trade shows and film, cultural and community events. The fourth activity stream is park care and facility maintenance. The PNE is proud of the work it does at Hastings Park and has a vibrant team that is passionate about events, guest experience and being the best, we can be.

 

At the PNE, we strive to create an environment that reflects our organizationâ€™s core values: Enthusiasm, Excellence and Evolution. With a focus on these core values, we are committed to achieving our mission which is to â€œDeliver Memorable Experiencesâ€ for all who interact with the PNE whether it is our guests, our employees or the community.

 

We are looking for diligent and talented individuals to join our PNE Public Safety Team and help us maintain a safe environment for all guests and team members. Security Officers of the Public Safety team will work under the direction of the Manager, Public Safety & Guest Experience.

 

Why join our Team?

  • Exhilarating and fun-loving culture
  • Opportunity for free or discounted tickets to shows, events, sports games, and much more
  • Staff discounts for Playland, The Fair, and Fright Nights, as well as all PNE Food Stands
  • Opportunity to create lasting memories and friendships!

 

What will you do this year?

In your role as a Security Officer, your primary accountabilities will be to:

  • Ensure a safe environment for the enjoyment of guests and staff
  • Deal with loud and unruly guests in a calm and diplomatic manner
  • Mediate disputes on-site and remove unruly or dangerous guests from the premises
  • Provide exceptional and friendly guest service
  • Greet and assist guests and staff in a friendly and courteous manner
  • Search for lost guests and items as required
  • Ensure that PNE Uniform and Appearance policy is adhered to at all times
  • Perform other related duties as assigned

 

What else?

  • Must have successful completion of grade 12
  • Must have a valid Security License
  • Previous security experience is required; event security experience is preferred
  • Must have basic knowledge of applicable laws, legal rights, and responsibilities associated with security personnel
  • Must possess sufficient physical strength, stamina, and coordination to perform the assigned tasks
  • Must be highly motivated and able to work alone
  • Must be capable of reading, writing and speaking in English for the purposes of written or oral instructions
  • Must possess strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively deal with a variety of situations while maintaining a calm and flexible demeanour
  • Must be able to work a variety of shifts, primarily Thursday to Sunday
  • Ability to work evenings, late nights, and weekends is preferred
  • Advanced security training and supervisory experience considered an asset
  • Occupational First Aid Level I considered an asset

 

Who are you?

  • Skillful communicator
  • Proactive
  • Reliable

 

Where and when to APPLY?

Applications can be submitted via the PNE website at www.pne.ca/jobs and will be accepted until the role is filled.

 

We look forward to hearing from you!

 

 

The PNE is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, committed to creating an inclusive workforce that reflects the diverse community we proudly serve. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, national or ethnic origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or age. If you require any support or accommodations throughout any stage of the recruitment process, please contact the People & Culture Department at hr@pne.ca.

title: Security Officer
description:
JOB SPECIFICATIONS

  • Provide outstanding and personalized customer service as a front-line representative 
  • Security staff must meet company standards in terms of uniform, training and site procedures
  • Respond to major incidents on events properties and aid security staff with managing the situation
  • Safely operate and maintain company issued vehicle, require a Class G driver’s license
  • Enforce of property rules in order to maintain the security and safety of our clients and their assets
  • Complete walking patrols and inspections of facilities and equipment as required
  • Perform parking tagging procedure where assigned
  • Communicates and coordinates with management regarding scheduling, staffing, equipment, record keeping, and related matters, to ensure smooth delivery of services.
  • Operational functions can include but is not limited to answering phones, dispatching resources, responding to alarms, spot-checking properties, site inspections, and other quality assurance-based tasks.
  • Duties as otherwise assigned

KNOWLEDGE & ABILITIES

  • Ability to foster a Team atmosphere and work well as a member of a team.
  • Ability to organize work and multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
  • Strong leadership and coaching skills
  • Effective Organizational Skills and Attention to detail.
  • Strong time management experience required with the ability to perform multiple tasks simultaneously.
  • Outstanding interpersonal and communications skills required.
  • Extensive knowledge of MS Office applications and computerized scheduling software applications.
  • Ability to work in a team-oriented management environment with the ability to work independently.
  • Ability to manage multiple and simultaneous priorities, complex situations
  • Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing for the purpose of public interaction and report writing.
  • Ability to providing quality customer service.
  • Ability to handle typical and crisis situations efficiently and effectively at client site.

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

Wet’n’Wild Toronto is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing accommodations for applicants upon request at any stage of the recruitment process in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA) and the Ontario Human Rights Code.

 

At Wet’n’Wild Toronto we appreciate all responses, however, only those qualified will be selected for an interview at this time.

WET’N’WILD TORONTO IS A DRUG FREE WORKPLACE

title: Stationary Security Guard (FT)
description:
BPS Protective Services K-9 Inc. is the largest security K-9 company in Western Canada. We are looking for an energetic, reliable and self motivated Stationary Security Guard to become a member of our team.

Applicant Requirements:
  • Valid Security Guard License issued by the Alberta Solicitor General.
  • Must be 18 years of age or older.
  • Have a clean criminal record.
  • Must speak, read and write fluent English.
  • Must be willing and able to keep up to the physical demands of the job.
  • Security experience is an asset.
  • Able to work weekends and night shifts.
  • Must have your own vehicle.

Candidate must be skilled in the following:
  • React appropriately in stressful situations.
  • Ability to follow proper BPS protocol and procedures.
  • Skilled in proper report writing and note taking as this is a big part of Security.
  • Knowledge of the Criminal Code of Canada.
  • Able to work independently and in a team environment.

When applying please include your availability, security experience and any information that you believe would be important to note for your position with us.


About BPS Protective Services K-9:

Since 1999, BPS K-9 has been serving Alberta’s security needs. Over the last 15 plus years, we have grown to become Western Canada’s largest K-9 security provider. With offices located in Calgary and Edmonton, an extensive mobile fleet, state of the art security equipment, and our professionally trained handler and dog teams, we are able to ensure that our clients assets stay protected and that they feel safe

title: Security Guard - Nanaimo (Full time and Part time)
description:
Western K9 Security Services Inc. provides Vessel and Terminal Security Guards for BC Ferries. We have over 30 years of experience and have provided services to Canadian and American law enforcement, government agencies, and other high profile organizations.

Currently we are recruiting for Security Professionals to work at one of our high profile sites in the Nanaimo region. If you're looking to utilize your stellar customer service skills and gain experience in working at the terminals or onboard the vessels then this is the job for you!

With a dynamic working environment, the shifts are rewarding and go by quickly while you ensure the safety of the travelling public!

Job Qualification:

  • Excellent Communication Skills
  • Takes Pride in Delivering Outstanding Customer Service
  • Comfortable with Radio Communication
  • Able to Write Reports on Job-Related Activities
  • Keen Eye for Observing Exterior and Interior Premises
  • Access Control
  • Approaches a Situation with a Listening Mindset
  • Capable of Standing for a Duration of the shift

Certification Requirements

  • BC Security License
  • Class 5 Driver's License

Availability Requirements:

  • Must be available to work holiday's
  • Available to work Full Time during the summer
  • Mornings and afternoons
  • Weekdays and Weekends

Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Free Uniforms
  • Paid Training
  • Benefits after 9 months to P/T & F/T Employees (Conditions Apply)
  • Discount Cineplex Movie Tickets
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Recognition Programs & Events

title: Physical Security (Stream 2.2)
description:
Reference # :21-00240Title :Physical Security (Stream 2.2)
Location :Ottawa, ON
Position Type :Contract
Experience Level :Start Date :10/19/2021 
Description
LocationOttawa
LanguageEnglish 
Security ClearanceNone required

Our Federal Government client is seeking senior-level Physical Security Specialists for a contract engagement. 

Responsibilities will include:
  • Supporting the development of Threat and Risk Assessments for facilities using the RCMP/CSE Harmonized Threat and Risk Assessment Methodology (2007)
  • Developing security requirements and/or designs addressing multiple domains such as (but not limited to) the following: Blast Analyses, Vehicle Ramming Mitigations, Ballistic Doors/Frames/Walls and Glazing, Crime Prevention through Environment Design (CPTED), Security Lighting, CBRN systems, Security Operations
  • Supporting the development of Security Design Briefs for development and rehabilitation projects
  • Gathering, document and consolidate physical security business, technical and functional requirements for new projects
  • Supporting the development of Concepts of Operations for systems, technologies and applications related to projects and security program improvements
  • Providing advice and guidance on concept designs, preliminary designs, detailed designs, and cost estimates
  • Providing input on industry standards, best practices and accepted approaches for the development and implementation of security mitigations
  • Reviewing architectural, electrical and structural designs and construction documents for requirements compliance and provide feedback to project teams
  • Providing site inspection services
  • Providing support in the preparation of procurement documentation, procurement plans, researching available technologies, providing detailed option analysis and tracking procurement activities
  • Developing approaches for consultation with key stakeholders and facilitating these consultations.
If interested in the role described above, please send us a copy of your resume via the application button or directly to kbriscoe@trm.ca.

title: Security Shift Supervisor
description:
A Securiguard Security Professional is responsible for maintaining the efficiencies, professionalism and deportment of security officers at all sites not designated as "self contained and policed" and ensuring that personal site knowledge maintenance, officer evaluation, mentoring, training and communication is conducted efficiently and professionally in a 24/7 environment.

We are currently hiring a Security Shift Supervisor to join our team. 

The ideal candidate will possess the following characteristics:

  • Team Player
  • Solid understanding  of the Securiguard Culture
  • Strong communicator who is able to effectively engage with employees and visitors
  • Capable of working in both a team and independent environment
  • The Ability to prioritize multiple demands
  • Perform regularly scheduled site duties as required.
  • Establish a professional working relationship with the client in order to coordinate safety on site
  • Mentor officers on site/duty protocols and conduct, deportment, reporting procedures, company policy/procedures and corporate Mission Statement and Values.
  • Submit daily Shift Summaries in a concise, yet detailed, time specific format.
  • Supervisors are expected to present themselves as deportment role models to site personnel, clients and Securiguard management and staff.
  • Performs other duties and special projects assigned by the Operations Manager or client as required.
  • Monitor property line for any evidence of un-authorized access, weak points within the security line (I.e. damage to fence) and suspicious activity in or near to the property line
  • Verify all vehicles entering are authorized and hold a valid vehicle pass permit.
  • Coaches, mentors and disciplines guard staff
  • Liaise with client, meets and exceeds expectations, delivers exception customer service and security expertise for the client, his customers and his staff.
  • Ensures a safe & secure environment for the public, employees of the client and to vendors on the premises
  • Provides recommendations for crowd management and traffic control

Requirements:

  • Valid BC Security License
  • 6-12 months Supervisory Experience
  • Must have experience working outdoors for the entire shift in all weather conditions
  • Must have the ability to walk/patrol for entire 8 hour shift
  • Must have ability and training for dealing with difficult customers (non-violent crisis intervention)
  • Must have experience and training with de-escalation tactics and negotiation skills
  • Confident and articulate leader
  • Must  have experience with event crowd control
  • Must always be on the lookout for security threats and must sometimes intervene when problems arise
  • Traffic control training is an asset
  • Schedules and assigns daily duties and responsibilities
  • OFA 2 would be considered an asset. 

Employee Perks We Offer: 

  • Free Uniforms
  • Paid Training
  • Benefits after 9 months to P/T & F/T Employees (Conditions Apply)
  • Discount Cineplex Movie Tickets
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Recognition Programs & Events

description:

title: Loss Prevention Guard-Part Time
description:
Overview:

We are North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider with over 300,000 phenomenal employees. At Allied Universal ®, we pride ourselves on fostering a promote from within culture. There are countless examples of individuals who began their career as Security Professionals and today hold positions on our senior leadership team. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, and vision coverage, life insurance, employee assistance programs, and more! We also offer company paid uniforms and part-time and flexible schedules!

Job Description:

Allied Universal is seeking Professional Security Guards  in Canada.    

 

QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS:

  • 2 years security experience with 1 year high risk site experience in Canada
  • Be at least 18 years of age with high school diploma or equivalent
  • Legally entitled to work in Canada
  • Possess effective written and oral communication and interpersonal skills with ability to deal with all levels of personnel and the general public in a professional and effective manner

  • Licensing requirements are subject to province and/or local laws and regulations and will be required prior to employment.

  • As a condition of employment, employee must successfully complete a background check
  • Display exceptional customer service and communication skills
  • Have intermediate computer skills to operate innovative, wireless technology at client specific sites
  • Ability to handle crisis situations at the client site, calmly and efficiently
  • Able to:
    • Work in various environments such as cold weather, rain/snow or heat
    • Occasionally lift or carry up to 20 kilograms
    • Climb stairs, ramps, or ladders occasionally during shift
    • Stand or walk on various surfaces for long periods of time
Closing:

Allied Universal ®  provides unparalleled service, systems and solutions to the people and business of our communities, and is North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider. Allied Universal delivers high-quality, tailored solutions, which allows clients to focus on their core business. For more information:  www.AUSecurity.ca.

title: Security
description:
The Calgary Drop-In Centre (the DI) is more than emergency shelter. We provide emergency shelter, health services and housing programs to people who need â€‹support. Our programs and services connect people to permanent housing that meets their individual needs. Rooted in community and fueled by kindness, the DI proudly serves as part of the Homeless-Serving System of Care. 

The DI has implemented a COVID-19 Immunization Policy. You must be able to provide proof of full vaccination in order to be an employee of the DI. Full vaccination means you will need to have received two doses of Moderna, Pfizer, or AstraZeneca, or one dose of Janssen and have cleared the 14-day waiting period since your last vaccine. Some people have received two different vaccines, such as AstraZeneca and Moderna, and these people are also considered fully vaccinated. 

Position Summary

Reporting to the Coordinator, Security, we need a security professional with a different approach to maintaining the safe and secure environment we've grown to appreciate. This role accentuates the difference we make in our community by addressing all security concerns with a compassionate approach to resolving issues in a restraint-free approach.  We serve our clients with respect and dignity, and consciously choose not to exercise power or control against our valued clients.

The candidate we are seeking will have prior training and experience in a security setting, will understand methods of conflict resolution, will have a proven customer service approach, solid references to support their compassion toward people, and will display confidence, strength of character, and a willingness to learn and grow.

This is a different kind of job, supporting our facilities as well as clients, staff, volunteers and members of the community, in a very demanding environment.  At any one time, you will be protecting the safety and security of people in a hectic and busy atmosphere.  We recognize it takes a special kind of person - someone who is resilient, enjoys working in close contact with people, and who can maintain their composure when situations escalate. 

Time Commitment

48 hours per rotation; with 4 days on and 4 days off from 7 AM to 7 PM OR 7 PM to 7 AM (overnight). Some unusual hours may be required from time to time as the need arises. Schedule may be altered at the discretion of management.

Job Duties

  • Maintain a safe living and working environment through humility, respect and compassion
  • Security staff must show composure and humility when handling situations that may require them to remove person(s). They will use non-violent crisis intervention techniques
  • Must maintain a professional and positive working relationship with emergency services. (i.e. CPS, CTS, EMS, etc.)
  • Teams of security personnel provide a presence 24 hours a day, 365 days a year
  • Security work can be physically demanding and always requires an individual to be alert
  • The current high standard of customer service must be maintained and improved upon if possible; all members of the security team, as frontline staff, have a key role to play in this
  • To provide assistance to new clients, volunteers, donors and members of the community at the main office and direct them to the appropriate avenues
  • Monitoring premises, clients, community members, volunteers and staff via CCTV to ensure everyone has a safe and respectful living and working environment
  • Monitoring the outside of the building for any illegal activity and taking appropriate action.
  • Patrol of the building and floors while keeping in contact with the control room with the use of handheld radios
  • Preparing for shift change by relating any information to help assist the oncoming staff.
  • Review the DVR regarding criminal activity and taking proper course of action
  • Required to keep your work station clean and tidy
  • Dealing with inquiries from staff, clients, and public
  • Responding to any security issues within the facility and the surrounding outside grounds
  • Performs any related activity that has been asked of by the on-shift supervisor

Required Competencies

  • Alberta Security License is MANDATORY
  • Completion of a college or university program in any of the following; human services, police sciences, criminology or other related programs is a definite asset
  • Previous work experience or background in military or law enforcement may replace formal education requirements
  • Experience working in distress and/or high-stress situations, which may include emergency response
  • Experience in the human services field would be an asset
  • Experience working in a shift work environment preferred
  • Experience with CCTV, access control systems and fire response systems is a must
  • Energetic and self-directed, with effective time management and organizational skills including the ability to deal with several priorities at the same time
  • Resiliency and stress tolerance and the ability to maintain composure, remain calm and focused when dealing with a high volume of volatile and stressful situations
  • The ability to make sound rational decisions based on information provided and employ critical thinking where information may not be clear
  • Strong strategically-focused analytical skills, good common sense; and capacity to provide leadership
  • Well-developed interpersonal, conflict resolution and negotiating skills
  • Resourcefulness and knowledge of community resources and social support systems
  • High morals, ethics and integrity

Working Conditions

Front-line staff are exposed to emotionally disturbing events, such as: medical distress, threatened/actual serious injury, violence, abuse, and death; where clients may be experiencing fear, terror, hopelessness, rage, self-harm and conflict. It is understood and accepted that you will be working in distress and/or high-stress situations, which may include emergency response where resiliency and stress tolerance and the ability to maintain composure, remain calm and focused is imperative. Exposure to bodily fluids may also occur.

Why the DI?

The DI aims to be an â€œEmployer of Choiceâ€ and affords each employee an opportunity to help make a real difference in our community, and more importantly in the lives of less privileged people.  We take great care in hiring the right people who fit, and who share our outlook on the value of people. We believe in living our values in every word we speak and in every action we take, and we want people who understand this commitment.

Our Culture

Our values form the cornerstone of our culture:

RESPECT: Our actions honour the rights, differences, and dignity of others

COMMUNITY: Through collaborative partnerships, we work together as a team, building inclusive communities

KINDNESS: We accept each personâ€™s uniqueness with compassion and empathy

WELLNESS: We promote, provide and support holistic wellbeing

ACCOUNTABILITY: We operate with transparency and integrity in both our relationships and our commitments.

Our Compensation

Some of the great benefits the DI has are agency paid:

  • Vacation days
  • Sick days
  • Wellness days
  • Medical & Dental coverage
  • Homewood EFAP
  • Long-Term Disability*
  • Life Insurance and Accidental Death & Dismemberment (AD&D)*
  • Critical Illness Insurance*

*Employees will be enrolled in a Long-Term Disability, Life and AD&D and Critical Illness insurance program, paid for by the employee. This is mandatory and may not be opted out of.

Benefits are based on employment type and usually available the 1st of the month following your start date. If you are successful in obtaining employment with the DI, Human Resources will discuss your eligibility with you.

title: Loss Prevention Officer
description:
London Drugs is looking for highly capable security and investigations professionals for our Loss Prevention team. You will find state of the art technology, training and support, and a high integrity group of people committed to excellence on our team.

Not just a job…
a community
a partnership
a team

You’ll experience them all at London Drugs. As one of Canada’s fastest-growing and most successful retail chains, we know what it takes to build a satisfying career. We are seeking innovative, customer focused people to join our team!

Opportunity:
Loss Prevention Officer

Responsibilities:
The Loss Prevention Officer position is well-suited for a highly capable security and investigations professional that thrives on working within a team environment.

Duties include:
  • Shifts at store locations conducting surveillance, investigation, and maintenance of loss prevention systems
  • Identifying areas of loss and working on team shrink reduction plans
  • Detection and apprehension of persons committing criminal offences against the company
  • Securing evidence, report writing & document preparation for court testifying purposes
  • Special assignments including lock repair, key control, staff awareness and orientation
  • Maintaining the overall security of our locations
Qualifications:
  • We have an extensive in-house training program (in BC we are an accredited BST training provider). While we are eager to develop our people, candidates should possess the following skills and qualifications:
  • Demonstrated ability to stay calm and respond with good judgment in emergency situations
  • A commitment and history of protecting people and property in a safe and legal manner
  • Demonstrated ability to work under strict confidentiality
  • High ethical standards and a commitment to personal and professional integrity
  • Good command of the English language, both written and verbal, required for report writing and court testimony
  • A valid Class 5 driver’s license and own vehicle
  • Availability and willingness to work at all locations and surrounding areas
  • Previous Loss Prevention experience or other related experience within the Criminal Justice system would be an asset
  • Previous security related education, professional accreditation, first aid and first responder training is an asset
  • Use of force and restraining device training is an asset
  • Provincial security worker license, or the ability to obtain one before commencing work
Availability Requirement
Employees must be available to work a flexible schedule, Monday through Sunday, for day and evening shifts.

We are an equal opportunity employer. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work applicable to this position and are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. Be advised, London Drugs DOES NOT use third party recruitment services.

London Drugs may collect, use, and/or disclose your personal information (including the information in this application) where it is reasonable for establishing, managing or terminating an employment relationship. This includes the use or disclosure of your personal information to persons inside or external to our organization, for the purpose of checking references or gathering other information to support an assessment of your candidacy.

To protect yourself, do not respond to unsolicited job offers from individuals or e-mail addresses, and never disclose any sensitive details about your identity (including personal or financial) to anyone you do not know or trust or on any unverified website, or website you do not trust.

title: Security
description:
The Brew Crew is a team of devoted, compassionate, and ambitious individuals that are hungry for what the future holds. We believe it's our duty to provide all of our employees with a safe, fun-filled work environment with endless advancement opportunities.

 

Let's talk about the Security | Doorman position!

 

What will your responsibilities be as Security?:

  • Greet guests appropriately and check for legal identification
  • Protect companyâ€™s property and staff by maintaining a safe and secure environment
  • Observe for signs of crime or disorder and investigate disturbances
  • Act lawfully in direct defense of life or property
  • Take accurate notes of unusual occurrences
  • Report in detail any suspicious incidents
  • Patrol building and perimeter
  • Monitor and control access at building entrances

Requirements

  • Excellent knowledge of public safety and security procedures/protocols
  • Surveillance skills and detail orientation
  • Integrity and professionalism
  • Valid Ontario Security License

Welcome to The Canadian Brewhouse (https://youtu.be/fyKRJzJWiu4), Canada's fastest-growing independent restaurant group! We are proud of being the only Canadian-themed sports bar in town, and we know that without our incredible teams we wouldn't be a fraction of where we are today. Our teams live and breathe our Core Values; these are 6 key principles that influence all of our decisions as an organization.

  • Take Care of Each Other and Yourself
  • Think Like a Customer
  • Support Your Community
  • Hurry, Donâ€™t Rush
  • Embrace Innovation
  • Be Persistent

 

When not at work, you may catch us out in the community volunteering, raising funds for The Canadian Mental Health Association or the local Children's Hospital, or having a couple of drinks with friends. The Brew Crew is a team of devoted, compassionate, and ambitious individuals that are hungry for what the future holds. We believe it's our duty to provide all of our employees with a safe, fun-filled work environment with endless advancement opportunities. Let us tell you more about why you should join the best team in Canada, today!

Benefits of Joining Our Team:

  • Staff discount for you that may be extended to friends and family
  • Advancement opportunities are endless with the right attitude and passion - our CEO started out as a dishwasher!
  • The opportunity to Support Your Community - one of our core values, a great experience to volunteer with causes youâ€™re passionate about.
  • Working with a team of like-minded individuals who have your interests at heart. Our team is our family - We Are Brew Crew

title: Loss Control Specialist - Canada
description:
About Our Company:

Are you looking for a challenging career that rewards hard work and success?   AFIRM is committed to finding outstanding people who have the ambition and willingness to learn in order to succeed.   The most successful candidates will be detail-oriented, self-motivated and possess strong problem-solving and analytical skills.  

 

AFIRM is the national leader in risk control, consulting services as well as commercial and residential inspections.   We provide our exceptional services to insurers, brokers, risk managers and government agencies.

 

Equal Opportunity Employer

The H.W. Kaufman Group of companies is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other status or condition protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

 

 

Qualifications:

Our Inspectorsâ€™ education and training:

 

  • Inspectors come from all walks of life with their own experience and background
  • AFIRM provides its candidates and Inspectors with a valuable set of skills unlike any other
  • They have all successfully completed AFIRMâ€™s own self-directed, on-line training certification program
  • Continue to hone their skills with AFIRMâ€™s on-going distance learning opportunities

 

 

Our Inspectorsâ€™ work environment      

 

  • As independent contractors with AFIRM, our inspectors work from home
  • They travel to various locations from their home base to assigned locations
  • Work evenings and weekends whenever required to maintain customer satisfaction

 

 

What all our Inspectors must have:

 

  • A reliable vehicle
  • Mobile phone
  • Windows based computer
  • Internet connection (high speed preferably)
  • Digital camera or smart phone that takes high quality digital pictures
Responsibilities:

 

AFIRM is a global leader in Loss Prevention and Premium Audit with Canadian locations in Richmond Hill and Montreal.   We are currently seeking independent Loss Prevention service contractors.

 

Our Loss Control Representatives (Inspectors) visit various property locations on behalf of the ownerâ€™s insurance company with a goal to minimize potential losses.   There is no selling involved.   Requests for inspection are received directly from the insurance companies.

 

Our successful Inspectors are:

 

  • Outgoing and independent
  • Curious and inquisitive by nature
  • Self-motivated strivers
  • Well organized and manage their time efficiently
  • Focused on quality of service
  • Competent computer skills with good input speed & accuracy
  • Skilled at writing well

 

What our Inspectors do:

 

  • Take responsibility for; and organize their assignments
  • Schedule their own appointments with property owners
  • Travel to the location
  • Tour the property and collect information (Residential and Commercial)
  • Identify potential areas of loss such as fire, theft and liability
  • Take photographs and measure buildings
  • Prepare a pre-define Loss Control report of the property using AFIRMâ€™s own web-based platform

title: Damage Prevention Technician
description:
ABOUT THIS CAREER OPPORTUNITY

Black & McDonald’s Ottawa team is growing! If you are committed and collaborative professional looking to contribute to a hard-working, innovative team, this opportunity is for you. The Damage Prevention Technician is located in Ottawa, Ontario and reports directly to the Supervisor.

  • Managing work orders and documenting locates
  • Provide sketches with markings of the locates
  • Utilize equipment to communicate with excavators and company personnel regarding underground facilities
  • Locate buried utility lines
  • Operate various electronic devices including use of a receiver wand and transmitter to assist in the locating and verifying of underground utilities
  • Mark utility lines
  • Prepare various reports and documentation verifying marked utilities
  • Adhere to safety standards and schedules

COMPETENCY REQUIREMENTS

  • Communicates Effectively
  • Customer Focus
  • Holds Self and Others Accountable
  • Problem Solving and Innovation
  • Teamwork and Collaboration

WORK EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

  • 1-3 years’ experience in similar role

SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS

  • Holds a valid G licence and comfortable driving in all types of weather conditions
  • Must be able to navigate utilizing GPS, or maps
  • Must be able to utilize a laptop computer to interpret utility maps
  • Candidates must be able to squat, kneel, use hands and fingers to push buttons, hold receiver (piece of locate equipment) and use paint stick in the other hand for marking ground and roadways up to 9 hours a day
  • Candidates must be comfortable walking on all types of terrain (grass, gravel, dirt and roadways)
  • Candidates must be able to work days, afternoons, nights and on call coverage

Black & McDonald welcomes and encourages applications from persons with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.

title: Loss Prevention Specialist - Ontario
description:
About Us:

Talize is a proudly Canadian owned and operated national for-profit retailer offering quality resale apparel and housewares at unbeatable prices. As Canada’s newest and most unique shopping experience we offer new, like-new, and vintage items all under one roof. That means fantastic deals on brand names and designer fashions, and housewares!

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Implement or monitor processes to reduce property or financial losses.
  • Investigate known or suspected internal theft, external theft, or vendor fraud.
  • Data mining of Company reports i.e. daily cash reports, promotional sales/coupons, store occurrence reporting.
  • Collaborate with law enforcement agencies to report or investigate crimes.
  • Conduct store audits to identify problem areas or procedural deficiencies.
  • Direct work of contract security officers or other loss prevention agents.
  • Identify and report merchandise shortages.
  • Inspect buildings, equipment, or access points to determine security risks.
  • Maintain documentation or reports on security-related incidents or investigations.
  • Monitor compliance with standard operating procedures for loss prevention, physical security, or risk management.
  • Perform covert surveillance of areas susceptible to loss.
  • Prepare written reports on investigations.
  • Recommend new or improved processes or equipment to reduce risk exposure.
  • Train establishment personnel in loss prevention activities.
  • Verify proper functioning of physical security systems, such as closed-circuit televisions, alarms, sensor tag systems, or locks.
  • Testify in civil or criminal court proceedings.
  • Apprehend shoplifters in accordance with guidelines.
  • Conduct employee background investigations and review reports with operational or human resources managers.
  • Coordinate with risk management, human resources, or other departments to assist in company programs, investigations, or training.
  • Identify and report safety concerns to maintain a safe shopping and working environment.
  • Recommend methods to reduce potential financial fraud losses.
  • Respond to critical incidents, such as catastrophic events, violent weather, or civil disorders.

 

Experience:

  • High School Diploma, or Associates Degree.
  • 3+ years of retail Loss Prevention experience or investigative work.
  • Must have a valid Security License issued by the Ministry of Corrections Canada, specific to Ontario.
  • Strong computer system skills and proficiency in Microsoft Office.
  • Basic knowledge of CCTV systems and covert camera use and/or installation.
  • Possess a valid Driver’s License, and personal vehicle.
  • Ability to travel daily.
  • Successfully pass a Criminal Background, and Reference Check.

 

Core Competencies:

  • Business Acumen – Knowledgeable in current, and future policies, practices, trends, technology applicable to the business.
  • Process Management – Takes advantage of opportunities for synergy and efficiency.
  • Conflict Management – Comfortable handing diverse situations, and settles disputes equitably.
  • Ethics and Values – Adheres to appropriate and effective core values and beliefs.

 

Talize Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. If you require any type of accommodation, please let the hiring manager know, and we will work with you to meet your needs.
