title: Asset Protection Service Representative - Toronto Eaton Centre
description:
About Old Navy


Forget what you know about old-school industry rules. When you work at Old Navy, you’re choosing a different path. From day one, we’ve been on a mission to democratize fashion and make shopping fun again. Our teams make style accessible to everyone, creating high-quality, must-have fashion essentials for the whole family, with love, season after season.


We opened our first store in 1994 in San Francisco and have been on a roll ever since. We cultivate a community of playful personalities that thrive in a fast-paced environment where our employees can be their most authentic selves. Here, we’re family.


About the Role


In this role, you will embody our value of Doing The Right Thing by protecting People, Assets, and Brands. You will work in a energized, fast paced environment focused on creating a safe environment for our employees, teams, and customers; this is critical to driving our Brand power, enduring customer relationships, and exuding our commitment to team and values. You’ll need to understand the big picture strategy and work with cross-functional teams and external partners.


What You'll Do


+ Support strategies, standards, and processes to implement an Asset Protection strategy to mitigate risk and loss within our Gap Inc stores

+ Assist with the implementation and continued execution of the shortage reduction program

+ Work with store personnel to identify inventory shortage opportunities and recommend solutions

+ Determine the assignment of appropriate Asset Protection resources (i.e.: agents, technology, etc.) to address shortage reduction opportunities

+ Courteous and responsive to internal/external requests

+ Exchange and verifies job related information to provide support


Who You Are


+ Experience in customer service and/or a high-pressure, multitask environment to drive results, coach, and collaborate

+ Strong communication and interpersonal skills, including the ability to negotiate and build consensus across multiple stakeholders and functions

+ Ability to actively learn and immediately apply learnings into decisions and behaviors

+ Ability to manage and prioritize their time; able to multi task

+ Use basic information-gathering skills to solve problems


Benefits at Old Navy


+ Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Gap, Banana Republic, Old Navy and Athleta, 30% off at Outlet, and 10% off markdowns at Gap, Banana Republic and Outlet.

+ Competitive Paid Time Off plans.*

+ Company match for donations and volunteer time*

+ Registered Retirement Savings Plan

+ Employee stock purchase plan.*

+ Medical, dental, vision and life insurance.*

+ Virtual health care 24/7*

+ Maternity/Parental Top Up.*

+ See more of the benefits we offer.


*For eligible employees


Gap Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status. We have received numerous awards for our long-held commitment to equality and will continue to foster a diverse and inclusive environment of belonging. This year, we’ve been named as one of the Best Places to Work by the Human Rights Campaign (https://www.hrc.org/resources/best-places-to-work-for-lgbtq-equality-2022) for the seventeenth consecutive year and have been included in the 2021 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index for the fourth year in a row.

title: Security Supervisor - St. Clair College - South Campus - Parking - Windsor, ON
description:
To:                                     All Security Personnel

From:                                 People & Culture Department

Date:                                 April 4, 2022

Closing Date:                   April 8, 2022

Re:                                     Job Posting

Position:                           Security Supervisor – South Campus – Parking

Site:                                   St. Clair College – South Campus

City:                                   Windsor  

Status:                              Full-Time  

Hours:                               Monday- Friday 0700-1530 hours

Pay Rate:                          $20.71/hour

 

Position Overview:

In this role you will be responsible for patrolling the South Campus both on foot and with a security vehicle during all types of weather. Working on assigned shifts, you will provide proactive and reactive security patrols and response to incidents. You will be required to write reports and investigate routine incidents, as well as respond to emergencies in a quick and efficient manner. You should display excellent customer service skills and be able to work with people who are under stress or in need of assistance. The successful candidate must possess superior computer skills and the ability to diffuse difficult or emotional situations.

Essential Job Functions:

  • Implement security measures to protect property, control access to sites, patrol assigned areas to monitor activities and ensure client rules and regulations are followed.
  • Maintain written reports.
  • Perform security checks and liaise with students, customers, and the public.
  • Ensure site safety and emergency procedures are followed and maintain written reports.
  • Enforce compliance to company policies and procedures.
  • First aid – be prepared to administer when required.
  • Maintaining a positive, productive work environment through collaboration.
  • Perform miscellaneous job – related duties as assigned.

Please note, students currently enrolled with St. Clair College are not eligible to apply to this position.

 

Job Requirements:

  • Must possess Ontario Security Guard License.
  • First Aid & CPR – Level C
  • Valid G Class Ontario Drivers Licence & Drivers Abstract
  • Post-Secondary education in law enforcement from a recognized institution or equivalent experience.
  • Physical Demands include excessive walking and standing.
  • Patrol area on foot and vehicle as assigned, to ensure personal, building, and equipment security.
  • Utilize radio and computer applications for communicating site activities.
  • Watch for and report irregularities by completing incident reports, such as security breaches, facility and safety hazards, and emergency situations; contact emergency responders, such as police, fire, and/or ambulance personnel, as required.
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills.
  • Must possess excellent computer skills.
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy.
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.

Highlights:

  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement
  • Extensive Paid Industry Training

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. Immunization Record
  2. Covid Vaccine’s Record 
  3. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  4. Proficient in English (both oral and written)

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  3. Use of Force
  4. Report Writing
  5. Additional courses as assigned

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

 

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned.

Should you have any questions on this process, please contact LeeAnne Feddes, People and Culture Coordinator at

lfeddes@paladinsecurity.com

.

title: Loss Prevention (Waterloo, ON, CA, N2L 5W6)
description:
Job ID: 208220
Location: ON-Conestoga (0872)
Address: 550 King Street North Unit C13A, Waterloo, ON N2L 5W6, Canada (CA)
Full Time/Part Time: Full Time
Position Type: Regular

The Loss Prevention Agent protects the assets of a store against theft, and works with the Leadership team to maintain operational controls to reduce shortage.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Loss Prevention
  • Provide friendly, professional and knowledgeable service to clients as needed.
  • Conduct surveillance on the sales floor, as well as utilizing the CCTV system, to identify, observe, and apprehend or deter individuals from committing external theft(s).
  • Adhere to all laws and SEPHORA policies concerning apprehensions, search and seizure and the preservation of evidence.
  • Prepare reports relative to any theft incidents, merchandise recoveries, accident investigations and audits.
  • Develop and maintain a professional relationship with all internal partners, local law enforcement agencies, mall security and other retailers.
  • Testify in court on behalf of the company, in any case, criminal or civil, to which the Agent is summoned.
  • Provide new hire and continuous employee trainings to maintain store loss prevention awareness.
Operations
  • Conduct store self-audits, checklists and safety inspections. Communicate findings to store Leadership team and District Loss Prevention Manager.
  • Assist store Leadership team with inventory preparation and process.
  • Partner with stores and DLPM in the development and execution of shrinkage prevention plans.

EXPECTED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS
  • 1 year of asset protection/loss prevention experience in a retail environment.
  • Satisfy and maintain all licensing requirements (as required by province or local jurisdiction).
  • Possess strong written, verbal, interviewing, listening and interpersonal communication skills.
  • Ability to maintain composure and provide effective coaching in the moment on loss prevention techniques.
  • Proficiency in Windows, Word and Excel is desirable.
  • A High School graduate or equivalent.
  • Availability to work flexible hours and days, including evenings, weekends, and holidays is essential.
  • Availability to work at multiples locations within a market.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
Physical Requirements:
  • Work in a fragrance filled environment.
  • Lift and carry up to 50 pounds.
  • Bend and stretch to stock shelves.

COMPANY OVERVIEW
Owned by LVMH Moet Hennessy Louis Vuitton, the world's leading luxury goods group, Sephora is highly regarded as a beauty trailblazer, thanks to its unparalleled assortment of prestige products, unbiased service from experts, interactive shopping environment, and innovation.

Sephora stores - Sephora operates approximately 1,900 stores in 29 countries worldwide, with an expanding base of over 360 stores across North America. Sephora opened its first U.S. store in New York in 1998, its first Canadian store in Toronto in 2004. Sephora's North American headquarters is located in San Francisco, with corporate offices in New York, Montreal and Toronto.
Sephora.com - Launched in the U.S. in 1999 and Canada in 2003, the foremost beauty site on the Internet is also Sephora's largest North American store in terms of sales and selection of products and brands.

title: Full Time Security Supervisor in Toronto
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

If you are looking for your next professional challenge, we have an opportunity for you! As a Supervisor, you will play a key role in the day-to-day operations and processes in place!  

We provide people with growth opportunities. 30% of our frontline employees are promoted to become part of our operation teams. 

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in {City} now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, we have a position that will accommodate your needs and help you reach your goals. 

What's in it for you?

  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits  

  • We can guarantee 40 hours/week 

  • Uniform provided free of charge 

  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld 

  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus like Use of Force training 

What does a Security Guard in Toronto do?

  • Plan, direct and ensure the smooth running of operations at the client's site 

  • Develop and implement procedures and policies for security operations 

  • Maintain protection systems for fire, theft and other disasters 

  • Ensure the availability of emergency equipment 

  • Make suggestions to improve and optimize the security service 

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in Toronto

  • 1 to 3 years experience in personnel management in a unionized environment 

  • Excellent oral and written communication skills (English an asset) 

  • Good knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook 

  • Valid security guard license and first aid card 

  • Available to work flexible hours  

  • Have a clean criminal record  

  • Be eligible to work in Canada

Job Description

We are searching for a full-time Security Supervisor to join our team at Great Blue Heron Casino & Hotel!

 

Reporting to the Security Manager, the Security Supervisor will be supervising the Security Officers and assisting the Security Manager in the daily organization and running of the security shift, adhering to GBH policies and procedures. The Security Supervisor will address any concerns arising during the shift, which will be brought to the attention of the Security Manager.

 

The Security Supervisor promotes the values of the Great Blue Heron Casino & Hotel’s Cultural Compass by example at all times. The key accountabilities for this position include:

  • Excellent internal and external customer service skills are required to be displayed at all times
  • Responsible for the direct supervision of Security Officers and provide support to the Security Manager in the overall operation and administration duties
  • Address any concerns during the shift and reporting it to Management
  • Ensure any violations or suspected violations of the Gaming Code, the Criminal Code of Canada, the Gaming Control Act 1992, the Terms and Conditions of Registration, Ontario Casino Corporation Act and regulations are logged and reported to the Security Manager accordingly
  • Ensure all irregular, unusual, suspicious or illegal activities are logged and reported immediately
  • Maintain effective rapport with the Ontario Provincial Police and any other local Law Enforcement Agencies
  • Ensure Security Personnel are fully briefed prior to each shift as required
  • Safeguard confidential information and exercise due care to prevent its improper disclosure or use
  • Respond to and ensure all alarms, duress situations and incidents are addressed promptly and according to established procedures
  • Investigate and oversee all activities or occurrences that could impact the Casino in a negative manner
  • Ensure all security equipment are operational and report any malfunctions immediately
  • Provide training, coaching and development opportunities to Security Officers as necessary
  • Answer emergency calls and provide immediate care to ill and/or injured patrons and employees
  • Ensure compliance with all company rules, regulations, policies and procedures at all times
  • Provide emergency medical care and manage medical complaints, altered mental status, seizures, environmental emergencies, behavioural emergencies and psychological crisis as required
  • Manage all aspect of employee issues including attendance, performance concerns, conflict resolutions, corrective actions and coaching as required
  • Work closely with EMS unit and provide emergency medical report of patient at the emergency scene as required
  • Perform all other duties as required by the Security Manager

Successful applicants will demonstrate the following qualifications:

  • Completion of Post-Secondary Diploma is Police Foundations/LASA preferred or equivalent education/experience
  • Minimum two years of experience as a Security Officer at GBH or equivalent
  • Previous supervisory experience would be an asset
  • Must be able to successfully complete a Provincially Regulated Emergency Response Training administered through St. John’s Ambulance or Red Cross
  • Extensive experience with all facets of a physical security program
  • Previous experience and/or certification in Health and Safety
  • Must have a basic understanding of Human Resources/Labour Management practices and applicable legislation
  • Must have a valid G Class Ontario Driver’s license
  • Knowledge of the Criminal Code of Canada (sections pertaining to the use of force an the powers of arrest)
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and tact in dealing with personnel and with the public
  • Must possess basic computer skills; including Microsoft Word, Outlook, Access and Excel
  • Ability to be fair, consistent and impartial in their approach to supervising the security staff
  • Ability to coach and obtain co-operations from others to achieve common goals, with well-developed leadership skills
  • Strong communication skills, both oral and written
  • Ability to operate effectively under stress during emergency situations
  • Ability to respect and maintain confidentiality of information
  • Ability to maintain discretion and diplomacy while performing job functions.
  • Ability to direct performance of departmental staff and follow-up with corrections where needed
  • Ability to prioritize, organize and follow through
  • Ability to exercise sound judgment
  • Must be able to exhibit professional business behavior at all times, have a high degree of initiative, proven dependability and accountability

Application Process:

Submit your resume to hdavies@gbhcasino.com. We will only be accepting applications electronically – hardcopy applications will not be accepted. Please indicate the position title and job posting number on the subject line. Please advise HR if you require assistance/accommodation during the interview process.

Ontario Gaming GTA L.P is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If you require accommodation to apply or if selected to participate in an assessment process, please advise Human Resources.

title: Security Supervisor
description:
Major Responsibilities & Duties:

  • Are confident and noble, and have a professional and welcoming smile for everyone you meet
  • Are dedicated to cultivate a strong team to achieve exceptional customer service
  • Can assess situations carefully, are sensitive in dealing with people and proactive in providing solutions
  • Are objective, have good judgment, and can express and support your findings in writing
  • Understand casino operations related to the law; work well with computers and surveillance equipment
  • Benefit from working flexible hours, evenings, and weekends
  • Supervises and manages team performance while participating in security activities
  • Oversees training, coaching, corrective feedback, human resources, safety and recruitment needs of the team
  • Monitors floor traffic: watches for suspicious activity, communicates with management and surveillance
  • Provides excellent customer service by greeting customers, answering questions, and providing solutions
  • Escorts individuals within the facility and parking lot (s); may provide first aid; conducts interviews and investigations; writes reports
  • Maintain floor cleanliness
  • Perform hourly guest counts
  • Complete month end reports/audits
  • Complete weekly schedules
  • Reviews and completes iTrak reports
  • Completes Voluntary Self Exclusions
  • Reviews Voluntary Self Exclusions daily
  • Completes daily shift reports
  • Completes key inventory
  • Liaise with Game-Sense Advisors as required, and promoting Game-Sense to our guests.
  • Ensures that all aspects of the Security department meet and or exceed the casino and regulators standards, policies and procedures. Manages, contributes and applies strategies to improve processes, standards, customer service and team morale.
  • Supervises and participates in the security team activities and shifts by leading, training, mentoring, evaluating, and providing feedback as appropriate. Develops and supervises staff to achieve high levels of performance and customer service.
  • Oversees the human resources issues, performance, safety and recruitment needs of the department
  • Conducts investigations, determines findings and informs to casino management, regulatory and police. Maintains building access and egress controls and ensures that department initiatives such as building evacuation, are coordinated with department and casino staff.
  • Retains a thorough and updated knowledge of company policies and procedures, provincial and local regulations for casino operations.
  • Liaises with the management team and participates in casino initiatives.
  • Contributes to the service standards and department budget. Ensures scheduling and expenditures are controlled.
  • Holds meetings with staff and their representatives
  • Secures the cage operations
  • Monitors floor traffic: watches for suspicious activity, communicates with management and surveillance

Skills, Knowledge, & Abilities Required:

  • Minimum 6 month security officer experience
  • Must be 19+
  • A commitment to continually increase your knowledge of our products and services in order to offer exceptional experiences to our guests
  • Understanding of yourself and others when communicating with team members and Guests
  • Ability to handle multiple tasks at one time
  • Previous security experience an asset but not required
  • Previous surveillance and security experience/training preferred
  • Experience using surveillance equipment and software such as audio and video equipment is a strong asset
  • 1-2 years demonstrated security/surveillance experience. (Preference will be given to experience in a casino environment)
  • Education in related field of study including law enforcement would be a definite asset.
  • Trained in self-defence and diffusing difficult situations without the use of force would be a definite asset.
  • Ability to maintain calm and perform duties under stressful conditions.
  • Exceptional interpersonal and communications skills (verbal and written).
  • Demonstrated report writing and incident investigation skills.

Experience, Training, Certification, & Education:

  • Completion of Gaming Security Officer (GSO) training/exam will be required within 90 days of start
  • High school diploma or equivalent required, post-secondary education an asset
  • The ability to successfully obtain a Criminal Record Check through the Gaming Policy and Enforcement Branch (GPEB)
  • First Aid Level 1 mandatory. First Aid Level 2 an asset but not required
  • WHMIS an asset
  • Appropriate Response Training to be completed prior to working
  • Anti-Money Laundering to be completed prior to working
  • Counterfeit Training
  • Must have Serving It Right certification prior to working
  • Strong communication and public relations skills
  • Previous experience or training in security an asset
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize
  • Ability to be adaptable and flexible with work schedule
  • Exceptional organizational, problem solving and conflict resolution capabilities
  • Good knowledge of MS Office and Outlook
  • Can understand, speak and write English; fluency in other languages an asset
  • English only on the gaming floor.
  • A commitment to continually increase your knowledge of our products and A willingness to learn, develop and achieve new skills for personal and professional development services in order to offer exceptional experiences to our guests
  • Responsible for providing professional and exceptional customer service in accordance with established company standards
    • Be an advocate for Superior Customer Service: Lead-By-Example and demonstrate the “Eye, Hi, See you soon”, and 5 core value model during every interaction (Family, Winning, Industry, Quality, and Honesty).
  • Identify opportunities to improve Operational Standards and efficiencies.
  • Maintain strict confidentiality
  • A passion for providing Great Experiences and Memories to our internal and external guests in the continual quest of achieving service excellence

Working Conditions:

  • Busy casino environment with constant loud noise constant wear of ear piece, and radio
  • Security officers work with many people but should have the physical ability to protect themselves if attacked by an aggressive person.
  • Ability to stand and/or walk for long periods of time, kneel, run, bend and jump
  • Security officers often have to handle and transport materials that are over 25lbs.
  • Ability to work outside completing different tasks for each season.

title: District Loss Prevention Manager (14 Month Contract for Canada East district)
description:
Thank you for your interest in advance. (No Agency Calls Please)


Are you looking for an opportunity to build a strong career with one of the coolest brands in the world?


We at NIKE Canada are currently looking for an exceptionally talented District Loss Prevention Manager for Eastern Canada (Nike Outlet Stores in Ontario and Quebec) and will be based out of Nike Vaughan Mills Store, ON.


PLEASE NOTE: This is a 14 month Contract position.


About Us:


Nike, Inc is one of the most recognized and leading brands in the world. We are the world’s leading innovator in athletic footwear, apparel, equipment, and accessories.


Along the way, Nike has established a strong Brand Portfolio with several wholly-owned subsidiaries including CONVERSE, JORDAN BRAND and NIKE GOLF. Nike’s world headquarters is located in the United States near Beaverton, Oregon, a suburb of Portland. Nike operates all around the globe employing more than 73,000+ people across six continents.


Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team


NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world's best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At Nike, it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.


WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR


As our District Loss Prevention Manager, you will act as the Loss Prevention (LP) subject matter expert at the District level for Nike buildings. We’re looking for a leader who will be a strategic and operational partner that will assist with reducing overall inventory shortage and minimizing business risks to the brand.


This candidate needs to have:


· Leadership skills and the ability to influence others


· Ability to learn and apply new information or skills


· Outstanding bias for action - willing to move quickly and conclusively to resolve an incident


· Demonstrated problem solving and decision-making skills


· Track record of dealing with sensitive loss prevention issues in an ethical manner


· Understanding of criminal and civil law as it applies to the retail environment


· Multi-unit store management experience preferred


WHAT WILL YOU WORK ON


This role will be responsible to:


· Identify, lead, and resolve time sensitive critical issues


· Responsiveness for off-hour, on-call incident management support for the North America Direct business


· Conduct loss prevention store audits


· Ensure that all store loss prevention systems and programs are fully operational, being regularly maintained, and properly used, including CCTV, alarms, locks, etc


WHO WILL YOU WORK WITH:


You will be a part of the Loss Prevention Field team within North America Nike Direct, while working collaboratively with the Retail Operations (NARO), Retail Store Teams, Employee Relations, Human Resources, Brand, District Operations Captain and Legal.


WHAT YOU BRING

* A Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience

* Minimum 5 years retail loss prevention experience, including 3 years management experience within a retail environment

* Wicklander-Zulawski or Reid certification preferred

* CFI (Certified Forensic Interviewer) preferred

* Proficient computer skills in MS Office (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint)

* Strong written, verbal, electronic communication and presentation skills


NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.


NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, or disability.


Nike believes smart, passionate, curious people will rise to the occasion, therefore they set the bar high and then raise it higher. At Nike, you will grow because you will be challenged.


You will be challenged because you will work with the best talent, the best athletes, and the best business partners in the industry.


Nike believes smart, passionate, curious people will rise to the occasion, therefore they set the bar high and then raise it higher. At Nike, you will grow because you will be challenged. You will be challenged because you will work with the best talent, the best athletes, and the best business partners in the industry.


If this is you, then please apply online with your most recent resume at your earliest opportunity. Selected candidates will be contacted for interviews.


In accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005, and the City of Toronto’s Accommodation Policy, accommodation will be provided in all parts of the hiring process. Applicants need to make their needs known in advance.
NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, protected veteran status, or disability. NIKE is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please call +1 503-671-4156 and let us know the nature of your request, your location and your contact information.

title: Loss Prevention Consultant
description:
Overview :

Join a Dynamic, Global Company Committed to Serving Its Clients. There's a wide range of career opportunities at FM Global for talented, driven professionals who value the opportunity to make a difference. We're seeking resourceful problem solvers with strong communications, technology and business skills to support our clients' property insurance, risk management and loss prevention needs. We offer a work environment that's dynamic, rewarding, and encourages professional development. We invite you to explore our worldwide career opportunities.

 

Responsibilities:

The person in this position will assist FM Global clients in physically protecting their large industrial and commercial properties against fire, explosion, earthquake, collapse, windstorm, mechanical and electrical breakdown and many other hazards!

 

He or she will work with clients to develop sound loss prevention recommendations in order to manage any exposures, and, once the solution is agreed, will help manage the project through to completion. In order to stay abreast of new developments in the field, this person will receive frequent technical training that involves independent and classroom study.

 

The individual will be expected to work independently and should be willing to operate from a home office. An average of 35% overnight travel is expected.

Qualifications:
  • Minimum of a bachelor's degree in engineering (civil, chemical, electrical, mechanical, materials and mining)
  • 0-2 years of general industry experience.
  • Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must.
  • Good analytical, organizational, problem solving, and interpersonal skills.
  • Efficient time management ability with minimal supervision.
  • Solid technical aptitude.
  • Valid driverâ€™s license
  • Proficient in MS Office products.

We offer our employees a wide range of benefits including career long learning opportunities, tuition reimbursement, pension, flexible schedules, rich health and well-being programs, generous time off allowances, volunteer days and so much more!

 

FM Global is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to attracting, developing, and retaining a diverse workforce.

 

Please note that all FM Global visitors, including external candidates interviewing for open positions will be required to be vaccinated and should be prepared to provide proof of vaccination.

title: Security
description: Come play a key role in building the future of Sports & Media! Everyone wants to be part of a transformational team – and that’s exactly what we’re building at Rogers Sports & Media. A team that innovates and a team that wins. At Rogers Sports & Media we are committed to creating and growing teams that are digital-first, fast-moving and bold-thinking and are focused on delivering impact with everything they do. Our impressive collection of assets includes media properties, sports teams, sports events & production, venues, e-commerce platforms and a close connection with our Connected Home and Wireless team. Collectively, we touch the lives of 30 million of Canadians every month! Not only is our business strong, but so is our culture. We genuinely care about each other and working in an environment that allows each of us to bring our best authentic selves to work. That starts with our firm commitment to a diverse, inclusive and safe workplace. We’re also dedicated to giving back by using our media megaphone to help Canadians who need it most. Our team is All IN on diversity and inclusion – find out more at www.allinforequity.ca. Are you up for the challenge and the fun?  If so, consider the following opportunity!  As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19 or undergo regular testing. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Toronto Blue Jays on a case by case basis.

title: Manager, Loss Prevention
description:
The Role

We are currently searching for a Manager, Loss Prevention leading the loss prevention team, reporting to the Vice President, Legal. This is a Full-Time Permanent opportunitysupporting both The Beer Store and Brewers Distributor Ltd.

 

Location: This is a hybrid/remote flex work position. The Manager, Loss Prevention will coordinate on-site loss prevention and security support at the corporate office in Bolton, ON. This role will require some occasional travel across Canada to sites depending on the loss prevention issue that arises. For this role you are required to have a valid drivers license and access to a vehicle and must comply with all company health and safety policies and vaccination policies when visiting company sites.

 

Who We Are

The Beer Store

Becoming experts on beer doesn't happen overnight - we've been in business since 1927 and we’ve established ourselves as the leading retailer and distribution channel for beer in Ontario and a trusted warehouse and distribution service provider for brewers in Western Canada. Our state-of-the-art recycling system has made us one of the most environmentally responsible retailers in the world; nothing sold or returned to our stores ends up in landfill. We are proud to be a part of communities across the province and believe that if you’re going to be part of the community, you should also give back to it. We’ve partnered with many non-profit organizations over the years to raise awareness and much needed funds!  The Beer Store offers ownership to all Ontario-based brewers which means there's no other team of Beer Champions who live and love all things beer as much as we do. What is a "Beer Champion?" you ask...a Beer Champion isn’t just a customer favourite or a great teammate. We’re health and safety advocates, environmental stewards, and your local community’s beerenthusiasts. Join us to continue to create a fun and genuine work culture that really feels like your second family!

 

Brewers Distributor Ltd.

Officially established in 1995, but with historical roots dating back to 1971, we know a thing or two about how to deliver beer. BDL is a private joint venture company owned by Labatt Breweries of Canada and Molson Coors Breweries that provides wholesale distribution of beer and the collection of returnable, refillable and recyclable beer containers within the four Western Canadian Provinces, Northwest Territories and the Yukon. Our mission is to serve our customers and communities responsibly and with integrity, striving to deliver superior distribution that is efficient and cost-effective. We’re leaders in providing a healthy and safe working environment, and a role model in environmental leadership with the goal to continuously preserve our planet! Apply now and find out more about our team.

 

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Reviews and evaluates TBS/BDL risk management systems and controls and provides findings and recommendations to Senior Management
  • Develops, implements and maintains programs, policies and procedures that relate to all aspects of loss prevention, including security and insurance, to protect the employees, customers, assets and reputation of the company.
  • This role encompasses internal control, forensic accounting, financial interpretation, risk evaluation, security equipment expertise and expertise, management of guard services, as well as 24-hour, 7 day per week management of all loss prevention matters at all locations of TBS/BDL, including timely support on urgent / emergency risk management / mitigation matters.
  • Responsible for managing the insurance portfolio for TBS/BDL; includes dispatching emergency response vendors, monitoring of third-party insurance adjusters performance, claims management by fulfilling the role of Claims Examiner, managing and being accountable for the Insurance Trust Account
  • Insurance premium management via risk assessment and risk reduction strategies. Responsible for overseeing the insurance renewal process, and periodic RFPs
  • Fulfill the role of “Coordinator” for the Crisis Management Team
  • Manage all aspects of internal investigations and direct the investigative team to ensure that appropriate action is taken whenever a breach of trust or breach of security occurs
  • Manage the relationship between TBS/BDL and our insurance Broker, our third party adjusting firm,and our insurance companies.
  • Manage and approve actions of third-party insurance administrators acting as liaison between the field and third party insurance adjusters, monitoring costs and results
  • Manage and approve deployment and maintenance of security equipment, guard service providers, monitoring costs and results
  • Manage the security equipment layout, specifications and quotations for new buildings, and their subsequent deployment
  • Manage the development and administration of the TBS / BDL Capital and AOP Security Budget
  • Reporting and analysis on insurance incident history and trends
  • Provide advice and recommendations for process improvements to improve efficiencies, risk assessment, management and mitigation, cash handling, asset protection, including goodwill and reputation, shrink management, integrity issues
  • Contingency planning, field training and risk communication, updating and maintaining field security manuals
  • Participation on the TBS “Shrink Committee”, which meets monthly to monitor and manage total company shrink and share best practices re loss prevention.
  • Acting as Chief Privacy Officer for TBS / BDL, management of privacy legislation requirements, investigating and management of human rights complaints.
  • Perform other related duties and projects as assigned

 

Who You Are - Your Knowledge, Skills & Experience

  • Private Investigator certification and valid PI license
  • 10 years Loss Prevention management experience
  • University degree or College Diploma
  • Ability to define a process, break it down into its parts, identify key control points and improve the process to increase efficiency and reduce costs
  • Ability to manage, direct and counsel people during crisis situations
  • Working knowledge of legislation pertaining to criminal law and civil law
  • Excellent analytical, organizational, verbal and written communication skills
  • In depth knowledge of Company Policies, Guidelines, and Procedures for Corporate, Retail and Logistics Operations in a unionized work environment
  • Working knowledge of computer concepts, specifically word processing, spreadsheets and data base programs (i.e. Excel /Word / PowerPoint)
  • Expert knowledge of various security equipment used to secure BDL / TBS employees and assets
  • Working knowledge of the insurance industry and experience with insurance claims management
  • Prior experience (internal or external) in business management, including supervision of a team
  • Ability to provide support to TBS/BDL on a 24/7 basis

 

 

Application Deadline: ASAP

Apply today with your resume so we can get to know you better!

 

 

 

 

Equal Opportunity Employer

We are committed to providing a respectful and empowering workplace that values our greatest resource, our people. Diversity, equity and inclusion are essential components of our culture that empower us to meet the needs of our employees, customers and communities. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds including racialized persons / persons of colour, women, Indigenous / Aboriginal People of North America, persons with disabilities, LGBTQ2S+ persons, and any other characteristic. We’re an equal opportunity employer and provide employment accommodation in accordance with provincial legislation. If contacted for an employment opportunity or testing, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation at any stage of the recruitment process. We genuinely thank you for your interest in this opportunity with us. Due to the high volume of applications we receive, only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Security Guard - Part Time - RBC Place London - London, ON
description:
Site:                                   RBC Place London(300 York St.)                            

City:                                   London, Ontario

Status:                             Part Time

Hours:                               Saturday & Sunday (+Holidays) Day Shift 0800hrs to 2000hrs

Pay Rate:                          $15.99/hr.

Position Overview:

During your shifts you will conduct extensive foot patrols inside, outside and in parking garage areas to detect unauthorized persons trespassing and deter theft and vandalism. During your patrol rounds you will also be required to take various readings from equipment and make accurate handwritten reports of your findings.

During your shift you will interact in a professional manner with site employees, vendors and clients/visitors. You will work close with the Facilities Management team to report and manage the functionality of the buildings systems.

In addition to patrols you will utilize the CCTV system in both a monitor room and with a handheld device to view all areas of the property to detect unauthorized activity and respond accordingly.

Preferred skills/qualifications:

  • Valid Ontario Security Guard licence (required)
  • Valid First Aid & CPR certificate
  • Covid-19 Vaccination Record (2 doses)
  • Microsoft Office experience

 

Essential Job Functions:

  • Be courteous and cooperative with a high quality of customer service.
  • Good interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively at various social levels and across diverse cultures.
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Communicates any concerns/issues with Operations Manager.
  • Extensive patrolling, such as walking up to 10km in a shift.
  • Patrol assigned area on foot, as assigned, to ensure personal, building, and equipment security.

Requirements:

  • Physical demands include excessive walking and climbing stairs, including walking up to 10km in a shift and standing.
  • Working knowledge of the Trespass to Property Act.
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Excellent communication skills with a focus on customer service along with good computer abilities are all core requirements.
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills. Ability to write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy.
  • Patrol assigned area on foot, as assigned, to ensure personal, building, and equipment security.
  • Watch for and report irregularities by completing investigations and incident reports, such as security breaches, facility and safety hazards, and emergency situations; contact emergency responders, such as police, fire, and/or ambulance personnel, as required.
  • Sustain effective relationships with key stakeholders and provide specialized security services by enforcing rules and regulations when required.
  • Offer support to any person in need such as providing good customer service when providing a security presence, such as providing direction, responding to emergency situation involving violent individuals and injuries.
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned. 

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

title: Mobile Security Guard
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

If you are seeking a job where no two days are the same, this one is for you! As a Security Guard on Mobile Patrol, you will be working in a designated area to monitor, patrol and assist as necessary in a GardaWorld marked vehicle.

Pay Rate: $15.50/Hour

Monday to Thursday: 8:00pm to 6:00am

Friday to Sunday: 8:00pm to 6:00am

We provide people with growth opportunities. 30% of our frontline employees are promoted to become part of our operation teams. 

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in Barrie now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, we have a position that will accommodate your needs and help you reach your goals.  

What's in it for you?

  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits  

  • We can guarantee 40 hours/week 

  • Uniform provided free of charge 

  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld 

  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus like Use of Force training 

What does a Security Guard in Barrie do?

  • Patrolling in a variety of settings (mobile and foot) 

  • Enforcing property rules, city by-laws, and other applicable laws 

  • Deterring and responding to incidents on the property 

  • Responding to various types of emergencies 

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in Barrie

  • A valid security guard license and first aid card 

  • A valid G driver's license 

  • Available to work flexible hours 

  • Have a clear criminal background and driving record 

  • Be eligible to work in Canada

title: Security Guard, Industrial Setting
description:
Security Guard, Industrial Setting

Business Unit: Security Services
Career Area: Security Guard
Location: 

Portage la Prairie, MB, CA

Are you ready to suit up?

We are looking for Full- Time and  Part-Time Security guard to work in the Industrial sector in Portage La Prairie area. As a member of the GardaWorld team, your primary role is to ensure the safety and security of client assets, tenants and visitors to the assignment area in a professional and courteous manner. 

During the current crisis, every day, thousands of Canadians are working to get us through the COVID-19 pandemic, and GardaWorld is at the forefront of this effort. Join us and help us keep our hospitals and essential services open and safe.

 

What you’ll be doing?

  • Maintain a safe and Secure environment
  • Access control of entry ways and exit points using equipment at your disposal.
  • Performing Mobile Patrol and Foot Patrol at the Premises regularly to maintain order and establish presence.
  • Enforce Property regulations and city Bi- Laws on the client's site.
  • Protect the client's assets relative to theft, assault, fire, and other safety issues.
  • Complete Daily reports and Incident Reports.
  • Provide Excellent customer service.

 

What we’re looking for?

  • Good verbal and written communication skills
  • Previous experience in the security industry (asset)
  • Valid Provincial Security Guard license
  •  Customer service oriented
  •  Must be able to work  days and evenings
  •  Leadership and problem-solving skills
  •  Ability to work in a stressful environment

 

What we offer?

  • Competitive wages
  • Diverse benefits plan
  • Positive and dynamic environment
  • On-the-job paid training
  • Opportunity for advancement in the security industry
  • Complete uniform

 

SSWINN

GardaWorld: Make the world a safer place

GardaWorld is a global leader in the security industry, offering a wealth of opportunity to individuals looking to gain experience and develop professionally in a growing industry. We offer flexible schedules, diverse work assignments spanning multiple industries, and training and career advancement opportunities. We embrace diversity and welcome newcomers, women, students, retirees, reservists, veterans, and more to join our team, as we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.


We thank all candidates for their interest; however, we will communicate only with the selected candidates.

title: Security Officer - Hospital
description:
Description

PeaceHealth is seeking a Security Officer - Security Parking for a Per Diem/Relief FTE, Variable position. Hourly compensation starts at $19.37, more depending on experience.

Must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 including 2 doses of a 2-dose series or 1 dose of a 1-dose series plus 14 days beyond the final dose prior to start date.

JOB SUMMARY

The Security Officer is responsible for providing safety and security services which requires regular interactions with patients, visitors, caregivers and clinicians in highly diverse and complex situations. Interacts with local law enforcement to provide information, clarification of events and coordinate emergency protocols. Performs internal and external security patrol of assigned hospitals and/or clinics; dispatch; and access control as assigned.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

1. Provides safety and security services which includes; patrolling grounds, parking lots, buildings, securing entryways and exits, etc. to effectively address potential conduct issues, violations of policy, check for property damage, inspect safety issues, inspect certain safety features such as fire extinguishers or water valves, respond to all codes, address trespassing concerns, provide assistance with out of control patients, and utilizes electronic checkpoints.

2. Provides stand-by service or escort services for protection of caregivers or patients as needed.

3. Provides courtesy services such as providing directions, locksmith functions, jump-starts, changing flat tires, reporting vehicles with lights on, and assisting families in times of crisis.

4. Provides non-violent physical crisis intervention and de-escalation techniques to neutralize extreme situations and mitigate negative outcomes.

5. Provides crowd control during events resulting in an influx of patients and/or visitors.

6. Coordinates information, clarification of events and coordinating emergency protocols which may require collaboration with external safety and law enforcement agencies.

7. Responds to all emergency situations and applies appropriate protocols for the Code, Disaster (command center), ETO Exposure, Fire, Flood, Hazardous spills, and all code situations.

8. May assist flight crew and ground crew with Life Flight/Airlift NW transports and securing landing the pad.

9. Ensures adherence to protocols; completing, filing and maintaining correct documentation, filing reports, monitoring visitor permits, and assists with maintaining building access control by utilizing the computerized badge/door system.

10. Performs other duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS

EDUCATION:

+ High School Diploma or equivalent is preferred.

EXPERIENCE/TRAINING:

+ Minimum of two (2) years , military or civilian security or law enforcement experience is required.

+ Healthcare facility security experience is preferred.

LICENSE/CERTIFICATION:

+ BLS Certification upon hire.

+ Valid state Driver’s License

+ IAHSS (International Assoc for Healthcare Security & Safety) Basic certification required within 45 days of employment.

+ If assigned location requires the use of tasers, successfully pass Taser Training Program. After successful completion of Taser Training Program officers will be required to carry the taser while on duty.

OTHER SKILLS:

+ Excellent verbal and written communication skills

+ Ability to formulate a plan of action, carry it out with control and apply crisis intervention and de-escalation skills

+ Ability to perform data entry as necessary

+ Good physical condition to walk, run and lift as needed

+ Working knowledge of Microsoft Windows, Outlook, Teams, Word, and Excel

+ Acceptable driving record in accordance with the PeaceHealth Motor Vehicle Safety Policy.

ST JOSEPH PHYSICAL/COGNITIVE REQUIREMENTS:

+ Work requires active physical exertion up to 33% of the time.

+ Ability to lift objects weighing 80 lbs. or less.

+ Work requires frequent exposure to conditions involving minor cold, heat, poor ventilation or sharp instruments such as syringes or lancets. Reasonably anticipated exposure to blood and body fluids once per month or more.

+ Job duties occasionally require the ability to concentrate and pay close attention to detail (less than 34% of work time).

+ Ability to assist in managing violent, uncontrollable persons.

See how PeaceHealth is committed to Inclusivity, Respect for Diversity and Cultural Humility (https://www.thecaregiver.org/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/PeaceHealth-Statement-of-Commitment-to-Diversity-and-Inclusion-vFINAL.pdf) .

For full consideration of your skills and abilities, please attach a current resume with your application. EEO Affirmative Action Employer/Vets/Disabled in accordance with applicable local, state or federal laws.

REQNUMBER: 23750

title: Security Guard Timmins
description:
CSM is looking for a Security Guard to join our team. The Security Guard is responsible for protecting the client and assigned property from any criminal activity or trespassing.  

 

The ideal candidate will have strong written and verbal communication, excellent observational skills and previous surveillance experience, preferably in a law enforcement environment.  This person should have the ability to remain calm in high-pressure situations while exhibiting patience and a superb attention to detail.

 

Responsibilities: 

 

  • Surveillance â€“  Mobile Patrol as assigned, regularly. If suspicious activity is detected, refer to the local authorities. Follow all site and company Policies and Procedures.
  • Investigation â€“ Respond to any alerts of suspicious activity. If a person is under suspicion of criminal activity, secure the environment and person, and report to the local authorities. Perform other related duties as assigned.

 

Requirements:

  • High school diploma or equivalent is required
  • Valid Class G Driver's License
  • Clean Driver's Abstract
  • Valid First Aid/CPR
  • Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  • 6 months to 1 year working security experience preferred
  • 18 years of age or older
  • Must be able to speak and write English, Bilingual French/English is an asset
  • Must have CSA approved work boots

 

Canadian Security Management is the leading provider of specialized security and investigation solutions in Canada. Our management team and valued staff are the industry leaders in these specialized fields.

Our Mission: Canadian Security Management has and will continue to attract the best security staff in the field to provide premium services tailored to individual client needs while actively working with Indigenous Business and hiring and training local indigenous people to build pathways for success.

14 days on/ 14 days off, 12 hour shifts, Day and night

Starting wage $17.00 - 22.50

Uniform, off site and onsite training provided.

title: Security Guard 2
company: Centre for Addiction and Mental Health
description:
EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY
Security Guard 2 (x2)
Security Services,Legal Services

Position Description
The Centre for Addiction and Mental Health (CAMH) is seeking (2) in-house casual Security Guard 2 to work in the Security Services department.This is an exciting and valuable opportunity for anyone embarking on a law enforcement career. CAMH Security Services offers above industry average salary and benefits as well as opportunities for full-time placements.

Reporting to the Supervisor of Security Services, the successful candidate will provide security services and assistance to CAMH patients, visitors, staff and volunteers to promote a safe and secure environment. The Security Guard will assist with safety matters; report and respond to emergencies, patrol hospital buildings and grounds; and complete various reports. Other duties include ensuring that all Security and Safety procedures are maintained; protection of life and property; incident investigations; liaising with Emergency responders and the removal of unauthorized persons. You will support a workplace that embraces diversity, encourages teamwork and effective communication as well as complies with all applicable regulatory and legislative requirements. This position involves shift rotation (day, evening, and night) and weekend work. Must adhere to minimum availability. This position is located at 1001 Queen Street West.

Qualifications

  • A valid PSIS’s Security Guard License is required.
  • The ideal candidate will possess 2 Years Community College education in law enforcement field or be in progress of completion.
  • You must have 6 months - 1 year of security experience and be First Aid/CPR Certified.
  • 1 year healthcare experience would be an asset.

You possess the ability to deal tactfully and effectively with the public, staff and patients. You will be a motivated team player with a positive service-oriented approach. You will have strong interpersonal and communication skills with a demonstrated sensitivity towards mental health and addictions clientele. The incumbent must be able to work with minimal supervision, problem-solve and exercise good judgment in varied situations. The successful candidate will possess basic computer skills such as Microsoft Office and Outlook. You will have the ability to cope with physical demands of work. Ability to work with diverse clients and staff is required. Bilingualism (French/English) and/or proficiency in a second language would be an asset.

Vaccines (COVID-19 and others) are a requirement of the jobunless you have an exemption on a medical ground pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code.

All applicants offered and accepting employment must complete a Vulnerable Sector Police Records Check. The offer of employment will be conditional upon receipt of the satisfactory Vulnerable Sector Police Records Check.

Please Note: These (2) casual position is part of the OPSEU bargaining unit.

Salary Range: $22.92 - $28.28per hour

CAMH is a Tobacco-Free Organization.

CAMH is fully affiliated with the University of Toronto and is a teaching hospital and research institute. As a CAMH employee, you will be expected to actively support CAMH’s teaching and research activities, in addition to supporting the clinical work of the hospital.

At CAMH, we strive to be an equitable and inclusive employer. Our commitment to equity is grounded in an institution-wide commitment to achieving a working, teaching, and learning environment that is free of discrimination and harassment.

CAMH actively seeks candidates from First Nations, Métis and Inuit, racialized and LGBTQ2S+ communities, women, and people with disabilities (including people who have experienced mental health and substance use challenges).

We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply to our positions.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Please inform us if you require accommodations during the interview process.

title: Security Guards (In-house)
description:
Brookfield Properties, Office

At Brookfield Properties, our success starts with our people. People like you.

We develop, operate, and manage more than 650 properties and 325 million square feet of real estate across the globe. Itâ€™s a feat that wouldnâ€™t be possible without our team, a diverse group of creative visionaries and innovative experts who are relentless in pursuit of one goal: to ensure our buildings donâ€™t simply meet the needs of our tenants, residents, and communities â€” but exceed them, every day.

Within our office business, this conviction guides every aspect of our work. Our signature structures not only define skylines but are also true destinations â€” bringing together office areas, retail spaces, and dining options all in one. And our high-end design capabilities and strong sustainability practices allow us to create properties that raise the bar for real estate everywhere. Itâ€™s why the worldâ€™s most respected businesses, non-profits, and start-ups choose us as their partner.

If youâ€™re ready to be a part of our team, we encourage you to apply.

Prior to the first day of employment with Brookfield Properties, successful candidates must be fully vaccinated and are required to provide proof in the form of a government issued record.

DESCRIPTION: 

This position is responsible for providing front-line security to maintain a safe and secure environment for the tenants, guests and employees at Brookfieldâ€™s high-rise office properties. Guards will work as a part of a team. Due to Brookfieldâ€™s high-profile guards can expect multiple training opportunities in various security & life safety related areas.  There is opportunity for growth within Brookfield.  There may also be opportunities available for overtime.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Ensuring the security and life safety of all tenants, guests, contractors, and staff are a priority always.
  • Patrol building lobbies, exterior areas, parkades, tenant and retail areas.
  • Monitor and authorize entrance and departure of employees, visitors, contractors etc. ensure a high level of access control to the building.
  • Support the day to day operation of the Security Control Room, ensure response to calls are completed in a timely manner.
  • Deliver superior customer service to internal/external clients while ensuring strict adherence to Brookfield policies and processes.
  • Investigate and assist with response to all incidents that occur while on shift, ensure accurate documentation through incident management system.
  • Respond and provide support in relation to emergency response situations (fire alarms, medical emergencies, bomb threats etc.)
  • Audits and assisting in projects related to security & life safety equipment.
  • Embody and support Brookfield Propertiesâ€™ Safety, Health and Environment Policy.
    • Proactively identify, manage, and mitigate hazards to reduce risk to the workplace.
    • Engage in training and continuing education to develop the knowledge, skills, and competencies required to work safely.
    • Take action to stop work if it cannot be executed safely or if conditions or behaviours are unsafe.
    • Immediately report SH&E incidents, near-misses, unsafe conditions, and/or at-risk behaviours to their supervisor; then diligently work to correct the problem.
    • Promote safe work practices and safe working conditions in accordance with all Brookfield Properties Safe Work Procedures.
    • Wear Personal Protective Equipment when required.
  • Completing other duties as assigned.
  • This position requires rotating shift work including weekends, evenings and holidays.

SERVICE & PERSONAL SKILLS: 

  • This position requires a dedicated team player with a keen commitment to providing personalized customer service. Proven problem solving and decision-making skills are essential to perform in stressful situations.   This position must deal with safety-related issues in a confidential, professional and mature manner.
  • Excellent English communication (written and verbal), organizational and time management skills are necessary.
  • Professional uniforms and shoes will be provided.  Dry-cleaning of uniforms is included.

EXPERIENCE & TECHNICAL SKILLS:

  • Previous experience in the Security field as a Security Guard is preferred, but opportunity does exist to learn on the job.
  • Experience in commercial multi-tenant properties would be a definite asset but not required.
  • Strong customer service skills are required.
  • You will gain knowledge in the operation of fire alarm panels, security systems (including card access system), intercom system, two-way radio, telephones, CCTV system and basic computer skills
  • Candidates should be experienced with computers and MS Office.

EDUCATION / DESIGNATIONS / LICENSES:

  • Minimum Grade 12 Education or equivalent.
  • Must have or be able to obtain a valid Alberta Security License.

 

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for pre-screening will be contacted.

Brookfield Properties is an equal opportunity employer committed to the inclusion and accommodation of all individuals.

description:
Description:

The Department of Protection Services is responsible for the overall co-ordination of security services including investigation of issues, technical advise to optimize personal security of visitors and staff and liaison with external authorities as appropriate.



Qualifications:

The Department of Protection Services is responsible for the overall co-ordination of security services including investigation of issues, technical advise to optimize personal security of visitors and staff and liaison with external authorities as appropriate.


The Security Officer is responsible for the delivery of quality protection programs and security services to patients, visitors and staff at Hamilton Health Sciences and Faculty of Health Sciences. The Officer will work with all areas of Hamilton Health Sciences, Faculty of Health Sciences, McMaster University, Juravinski Cancer Centre and Hamilton Police Services to continuously improve our service levels and meet the expectations of our community and staff.

The Officer will work with all areas of Hamilton Health Sciences, Faculty of Health Sciences, McMaster University, Juravinski Cancer Centre and Hamilton Police Services to continuously improve our service levels and meet the expectations of our community and staff.

Guidelines for submitting an Application ~ UNION staff, who choose to submit their application through hard-copy mail, fax or email will need to have their application (ONA & OPSEU: with accompanying skills profile) available to the Recruitment Staff before 4 p.m. on the day the posting closes (day-7). ALL JOB SEEKERS, including UNION staff, who use the Career's Website to apply for job postings will have until 11 p.m. on the day the posting closes (day-7). ***INTERNAL JOB SEEKERS - Please ensure that both your ID# and last name are entered exactly as you see it on your most recent pay stub, otherwise you will be treated as an external candidate.***

Hamilton Health Sciences fosters a culture of patient and staff safety, whereby all employees are guided by our Mission, Vision, Values, and Values Based Code of Conduct. Hamilton Health Sciences is a teaching hospital and all staff and physicians are expected to support students and other learners.

To be considered for this opportunity applicants must apply during the posting period. All internal and external applicants may ONLY apply via the Careers website.

Hamilton Health Sciences is an equal opportunity employer and we will accommodate any needs under the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedom, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. Hiring processes will be modified to remove barriers to accommodate those with disabilities, if requested. Should any applicant require accommodation through the application processes, please contact HR Operations at 905-521-2100, Ext. 46947 for assistance. If the applicant requires a specific accommodation because of a disability during an interview, the applicant will need to advise the hiring manager when scheduling the interview and the appropriate accommodations can be made.

This competition is open to all qualified applicants, however, qualified internal applicants will be considered first. Past performance will be considered as part of the selection process. If you are a previous employee of Hamilton Health Sciences, please note: the circumstances around an employee's exit will be considered prior to an offer of employment

Proficiency in both Official Languages, French and English, is considered an asset

If this position is temporary, selection for this position will be as per the outlined Collective Agreements:

Article 30 (k), CUPE Collective Agreement

Article 10.7 (d), ONA Collective Agreement

Article 13.01 (b) (ii), OPSEU 273 Collective Agreement

Article 14.04, OPSEU 209 Collective Agreement

Article 2.07 and Article 13, PIPSC RT Collective Agreement

title: Event Security Guard
description:
Overview

XA Security is one of Alberta's most visible security and crowd management agencies, specializing in outstanding customer service and engagement. We have fun, we smile, and we're nice!

We are a Kind, People-Focused team that Never Stops Learning, and Always Stays Cool. 

Job Description - Empathetic Security Professionals Needed

We are looking for friendly people who are both safety conscious and people-focused to join our Event Security Team. This is a role for skilled customer service professionals who have an exceptional attitude, the desire to solve problems, and the ability to empathize with others.

Every day is different with XA Security! Your role as a Security Guard can vary greatly, but your overall duties relate back to one concept - we keep people safe! This could mean verifying vaccination status, conducting searches and bag checks, or just providing an overall security presence so that attendees know who to find if they need anything. At XA Security, we believe that our security guards are really Experience Ambassadors. 

Where do you think we get the name "XA" from?

You should apply for this role if you have:

  • A friendly, approachable attitude. You love interacting with all sorts of humans!
  • A real interest in safety and customer service
  • The desire to ensure things in your care are managed efficiently and safely
  • A high comfort level working in unique situations where your customer service skills will be constantly challenged
  • The desire to make $17.75 to start, and have a flexible schedule that works well with other commitments!
  • Received both doses of a Covid-19 vaccination, or have a valid medical / religious exemption

Position Requirements:

This Experience Ambassador role requires:

  • Valid Alberta Security Worker License (we'll walk you through the licensing process!)
  • Valid ProServe, ProTect, and SellSafe certifications (easily attainable online!)
  • Valid Standard First Aid & CPR C certification 
  • 2 years in a customer-facing role in challenging environments (preferred)

Let's be honest - that's a lot. We know. But we pride ourselves on having employees with extensive skill sets that, when paired with a great attitude, will make them successful in their role.

We will gladly conduct interviews with the right applicants, even if you don't meet the hiring requirements at the time you apply. We are looking for people with the right attitude, and are happy to guide you towards achieving the required licences and certificates.

Looking for something more?

We know that our Event Security Guards are often looking for other ways to get involved with XA! We also operate Static and Mobile security divisions, and are regularly drawing from our Event Security Roster to fill these positions.

Think you'd be a good fit?

Apply today and you'll receive an invitation to join one of our weekly Information Sessions! With both in-person and virtual options, we use these sessions as a chance to get to know you better, and a platform where you can ask any questions you may have. 

Learn more about us at www.xasecurity.ca

title: Floor Security (Full Time)
description:
Requisition #2377391
Job LocationCanada-British Columbia-Richmond
Job StreamSecurity and Surveillance
Site LocationRiver Rock Casino Resort
Job TypePermanent, Full-Time
Number of Positions1
Posting Date02-May-2022
Expiry Date01-Jun-2022
Travel RequiredNot Required
Educational RequirementsN/A
Languages RequiredEnglish
Requisition #2377391
Job LocationCanada-British Columbia-Richmond
Job StreamSecurity and Surveillance
Site LocationRiver Rock Casino Resort
Job TypePermanent, Full-Time
Number of Positions1
Posting Date02-May-2022
Expiry Date01-Jun-2022
Travel RequiredNot Required
Educational RequirementsN/A
Languages RequiredEnglish
Job Description

River Rock Casino Resort is recruiting for Full Time Floor Security. In this role you will be responsible for protecting patrons, staff, and assets to ensure the integrity of the gaming floor and company property by patrolling and monitoring the entire casino site, interior and exterior, as well as controlling access to keys and restricted areas; and other duties as assigned.

 Duties and responsibilities for our Floor Security will include:

  • Monitoring, documenting and reporting internal and external violations, unsafe conditions, potential hazards, suspicious persons and activities; prepares electronic statements via a non-gaming record keeping system
  • Enforcing restricted access by unauthorized persons
  • Observing cashier transactions, slot drops, chip/hopper fills and transfers; escorts cash and cash equivalent movements
  • Tagging and reporting found property; transferring items to Lost and Found
  • Conducting regular patrols of the facility interior and exterior as directed
  • Escorting guests and employees as directed
  • Performing identification checks as required
  • Referring disputes to the Supervisor, Security
  • Performing crowd control as directed
  • May perform electronic surveillance of non-gaming facilities, including exterior and adjacent properties at some locations
  • May enroll guests in the Self-Exclusion Program at some locations
  • Liaising and communicating effectively with all appropriate operational departments
  • Developing and cultivating strong working relationships with all stakeholders (guests, ownership and employees)
  • Ensuring compliance with licensing laws, health and safety and other statutory regulations
  • Performing other duties as assigned or directed

Successful candidates will demonstrate the following qualifications:

  • You must be able to work on an as needed or when needed basis (hours may vary depending on operational needs) in a variety of shifts including early mornings, afternoons, evening, nights, graveyards, weekends and holidays as we operate 24 hours a day, seven days a week.
  • High School Diploma or equivalent
  • Previous security experience an asset but not required
  • Must be willing to recertify for Use of Force every 3 years
  • Occupational First Aid Level 2 asset
  • Serving It Right Certification
  • Can understand, speak and write English; fluency in other languages an asset
  • Exceptional interpersonal and communications skills and the ability to handle multiple tasks at one time
  • Ability to exceed internal and external customer expectations through timely, effective and service oriented communication
  • The ability to successfully obtain a Criminal Record Check through the Gaming Policy and Enforcement Branch (GPEB)
  • A commitment to continually increase your knowledge of our products and services in order to offer exceptional experiences to our guests
