title: Airside Security Guard
description:
AIRPORT SECURITY GUARD (TORONTO PEARSON AIRPORT)

(Flexible Hours/Weekdays/Weekends/Casual hours)

Areyou passionate about Safety & Security and seeking opportunity to join a team of Security Professionals?

A.S.P. Incorporated has provided security and customer service solutions for over 20 years to Canadian clients. We employ in excess of 2000 employees and are a subsidiary of ICTS EUROPE, which is operating in 22 countries and employing more than 17000 professionals. A.S.P provide services to some of the largest airports in Canada and has a significant presence in the Commercial and Residential spaces in Ontario and Alberta.

A.S.P. is looking for Access Control Officer, who take pride in becoming ambassador of Airport and make every interaction professional and positive. Work with integrity, respect, and take responsibility of the security and safety at the Pearson Airport.

What you will do:

  • Monitor and controls ground-side to airside access and doors (restricted area access control);
  • Operate a variety of security and parking equipment including CCTV, Parking Pay & Display Units, Parking Cash Register & Pay on Foot Station, Recording systems, PA System, Portable Radios, etc.;
  • Respond to screening checkpoint and other airport restricted area alarms;
  • Perform security patrols and responses throughout the airport as well as tenant facilities;
  • Complete daily logs, deficiency reports and incident/occurrence reports;
  • Carry out customer service-related duties which includes hand shoveling of snow, greeting passengers & assisting with luggage when required, etc.;
  • Perform emergency response duties in accordance with the Airport Emergency Response Manual.

Who you are:

  • Minimum High School diploma or Grade 12 education;
  • Eligible to work in Canada;
  • Proficient computer skills such as Microsoft Office;
  • Self-motivated individual with a strong attention to detail.
  • Excellent written & verbal communication and active listening skills;
  • Must Possess a valid Security license, Ontario Drivers License (G or Higher) with a clear a driving abstract and Basic First Aid and CPR certification;
  • Must be willing to provide Criminal Record check upon request;
  • Possession of a valid Restricted Area Identity Card (RAIC) is an asset;
  • Possession of a valid Airside Vehicle Operator's Permit (AVOP D/DA) is an asset.

Why you should work with A.S.P:

  • We care about our team and their personal and professional success;
  • We offer competitive salaries;
  • You can have flexible hours/schedules; and
  • Free airport parking when on shift

A.S.P. Incorporated is committed to support a diverse workforce from various communities within which we operate. We encourage all qualified professionals, without regard to race, gender identity, colour, sex, marital / family status, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, aboriginal status, age, etc. to apply.

EMAIL YOUR RESUME TO BPaul@security-asp.com

We hire for PERSONALITY. We train for the job.

* Please note: If you are on a work/study permit - Obtaining a Restricted Access Identification Card (RAIC) through Transport Canada is taking approximately 18-24 months (2 years) for individuals.

title: Security Guard - Downtown Kelowna (FT and Weekends)
description:
Commissionaires BC is currently hiring for a Security Guards to work various shifts at a site in Downtown Kelowna.

Shifts available:

  • Monday to Friday mornings, afternoon and overnights
  • Weekends mornings, afternoon and overnights

Your Must-Haves:

  • You hold a valid BC security license
  • Class 5 Drivers License
  • You have 1-2 years of Security experience
  • You have excellent verbal and written English communication skills
  • You have proven time-management and organizational skills

Your nice to haves:

  • Non Violent Crisis Intervention training

Some of your responsibilities will include:

  • Foot patrols of residential building, interior and exterior
  • Maintaining a safe environment for all, handling any crisis situations in a calm and controlled manner
  • Offering first class customer service to the client and members of the public
  • Work with and respect the diverse community of Kelowna, supporting and guiding where needed
  • Access Control
  • Proactively responding to and resolving emergency situations and conflicts
  • Maintaining detailed and accurate daily logs and incident reports
  • Effectively communicating problems or concerns to the Site Supervisor

Whatâ€™s in it for you?

  • Above industry wages for the area
  • Opportunity for growth within Commissionaires
  • Work for a reputable and nationally known company
  • A challenging yet rewarding work environment
  • Gain valuable experience to put towards a future career in law enforcement

Youâ€™re a good fit ifâ€¦

  • You pride yourself on your superior customer service skills and have outstanding communication skills
  • You have experience in de-escalation and working under pressure
  • You thrive in a fast-paced environment
  • You can think on your feet and problem solve
  • You can work alone or as part of a team

Our Story

Commissionaires BC is a Canadian, not-for-profit security/enforcement organization that has been in business since 1927. Our mandate is to give back to those who served and continue to serve in our communities and country.

title: Security Guard
description:
Skanna Systems & Investigations Inc. is currently looking for a Full-time, Flexible-Shift Security Guard in Halton Hills, Ontario.

 Job details: 
  • Reception and gatehouse security guard.
  • Must drive (own vehicle). 
  • Full-time.

Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Use telecommunications (i.e. two-way radio, cell phone, telephone paging systems). Enforce regulations of establishments.
  • Respond to alarms, bomb threats, and other emergencies.
  • Visitor Access Control.
  • Maintain order and follow and adhere to post orders.
  • Follow radio and emergency telephone procedures.
  • Monitor security cameras.
  • Operate security control room equipment.
  • Patrolling.
  • Ensure safety and emergency procedures are followed.
  • Detect or prevent thefts and vandalism.
  • Report writing.

Qualifications, Required License, or Certification:
  • Must possess a valid Ontario Security Guard License.
  • CPR Level C Certified.
  • Must have a valid Ontario Driver’s license and a reliable vehicle.
  • Must be available to do rotational shift work: afternoon, nights & weekends.

The Ideal Candidate will possess:
  • Excellent English verbal and written communication skills.
  • Professional work ethics.
  • Must be able to stand for long periods of time.
  • Excellent computer skills and the ability to learn new computer programs site-specific.
  • Excellent Customer Service.
  • Willing to travel 40-50 kilometers to work if needed.

What we offer:
  • Full-time.
  • Employee Incentive Programs.
  • Corporate and Distribution Center environments.


About Skanna Systems & Investigations Inc.:

All Skanna Investigators and Security Guards are licensed by the Government of Ontario, bonded and insured. Their initial and on going training ensures that they have the skills to get the job done. Professional Conduct

title: Tactical Security Guard - Healthcare Facility - Full Time Position
description:
Regal Security Inc. is currently seeking Tactical Security Guards at one of our Healthcare Facilities located in the Toronto, ON area.

The Ideal Candidate must have: 

  • Full-time availability to work all days of the week and schedules that will consist of afternoons, overnight and weekend shifts â€“ including holidays and weekends.
  • Customer service-driven individual
  • Clear English communication skills in all areas (verbal and written)
  • Detailed and thorough record-keeping (Memo book, incident reports, etc)
  • Keen observation and attentiveness
  • Professional physical deportment and presentation
  • Decision Making, Reliable, Common Sense, and exceptional judgment
  • Able to work as a team
  • Use of Force is an asset

 

Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Provide outstanding and personalized customer service as a front line representative of Regal Security
  • Operate and maintain an organized environment
  • Enforce property rules and regulations in order to maintain the security and safety of our clients and their assets
  • Oversee the logging in and out of site equipment
  • Monitor CCTV and card access systems
  • Respond to all emergency situations (medical, etc)
  • Ensure that safety and emergency protocols are completed in response to Fire Alarms and other Site Emergencies
  • Complete walking patrols and inspections of facilities and equipment
  • Review, know and follow post orders as identified for site representing
  • Maintain a safe working environment and follow the facilities health and safety procedures
  • Duties as otherwise assigned

 

Qualifications:

  • Valid Ontario Security License
  • Valid First Aid/CPR Certification
  • Valid COVID-19 Vaccination Certificate
  • Secondary School Diploma or equivalent and higher (preference will be given to those with a Criminal Justice or Business post-secondary education)
  • Proficient in the use of various computer programs (ie. Microsoft Office, Gmail) and able to adapt and learn new programs

 

Compensation:

  • The pay rate will be $16.00 - $17.50 per hour.
  • Health Benefits are available for full-time employees upon completion of 3 months probation

 

Why choose Regal Security?

Regal Security Inc. is an established and growing security company that offers a vast array of professional and dependable security guard services across the Greater Toronto Area and Southwest Ontario.

Our Everyday Superheroâ„¢ guards are selected and trained to protect our clientâ€™s assets, property, employees, and tenants, using a custom-designed security solution for every client within the sectors we serve.

Every member of the Regal security team, and every service that is carried out, is directed by the Regal guiding principle: Strength & Honorâ„¢. With this in mind, Regalâ€™s security guards are known as Everyday Superheroesâ„¢ â€“ they are friendly, well-trained and, most importantly, proud, as they go above and beyond the call of duty to uphold Regalâ€™s high standards.

 

â€œTHE REGAL SECURITY MISSION IS â€œYOUR PEACE OF MINDâ€â„¢â€

Thank you for your application, unfortunately, due to the high volume of applicants, only those deemed eligible for an interview will be contacted. All candidates will be communicated to by phone or email for the purposes of the recruitment process.

Regal Security Inc. welcomes all candidates equally and encourages all qualified candidates, from women and men including persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and Aboriginal persons, to apply.

 

Regal provides accommodation for applicants with disabilities during the recruitment process in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Security Operator
description:
Canada’s leading business law firm is looking for a Security Operator who will be responsible for administration and technical operations of IT security that include monitoring vulnerability remediation, service delivery of proactive/reactive support and auditing.

If this role sounds like it's for you, email your resume to keshmi.desai@randstad.ca

Advantages
Want to join a growing and challenging team with a hybrid structure in place? This may be the role for you!

Responsibilities
Assists in the development, implementation, and promotion of security procedures, guidelines, industry best practices. Monitors for compliance of Firm policy and consults/advises Senior Security Specialist
Administration of the firm’s physical security system (access control and CCTV), logical security systems including anti-virus, endpoint, authentication/credential systems, Key Management System
Support administration of the firm’s network and firewalls, VPN and remote access solutions to ensure compliance with security standards
Support administration of the firm’s web filter and DLP systems to ensure continued security protection and policy compliance with minimal impact to staff
Provide day-to-day technical security related support to staff, conduct IS security incident handling, and participate in the analysis of QA tickets
Administer SIEM, report anomalous security incidents; conduct targeted analysis of suspect areas



Qualifications
3+ years Security experience, including conducting electronic investigations
Must have related experience configuring and managing physical access and network security systems
Completed Security+ or equivalent certification
Working knowledge of information security systems including PaloAlto, CarbonBlack, Centralized Anti-Virus, AD, Digital Certificates.

Summary
Nice to have...
CCSA/PCNSA certification

If this sounds like the role for you, email your resume to keshmi.desai@randstad.ca



Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: STATIC SECURITY GUARD
description:
At Fusion Security, we believe in providing valued service, building strong relationships within communities, and safeguarding the interests of the public and our stakeholders.

Fusion Security continues to grow and provide professional security services throughout Greater Vancouver and the Lower Mainland, with clients in a wide variety of sectors, including government, retail, commercial sites, industrial sites and residential areas. Our mission is to deliver the highest quality service in each interaction that reflects a strong and respectful culture.

We are looking for security personnel who are professional, committed, and have experience in security. If this sounds like you, then we want to hear from YOU!

PERKS FUSION SECURITY OFFERS YOU:

  • Competitive, market-based pay rate
  • Extended health and dental benefits
  • Paid training and subsidies for industry accreditations
  • Reimbursement of Security License renewal fees (for full-time employees only)
  • Access to exclusive employee discounts on over 5000 products & services
  • Fitness Centre Membership
  • Referral Bonus Program

JOB DUTIES:

  • Customer service
  • Ensuring the security of all personnel, visitors, and the general public
  • Inspecting & patrolling premises
  • Observe & report site activities and incidents
  • Monitoring property access
  • Investigating and reporting suspicious behavior, incidents, and security breaches
  • Enforcing client informed policies
  • Communicating with law enforcement, emergency medical personnel, and fire departments
  • Responding to alarms
  • Other duties that may be assigned

We Schedule Shifts According to Following Availability Needs:

  • Full time: able to work 32 to 40 hours per week
  • Shifts: Day, Afternoon and Night
  • Flexible availability - 7 days a week including weekends.
  • No restrictions on commuting - the most suitable candidates are available to commute to Downtown, Vancouver, Richmond, Delta, Burnaby & the North Shore. Parking can be provided at some sites for successful candidates with a personal vehicle.

JOB REQUIREMENTS & RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • A Valid BC Security License
  • The ability to stand for long periods of time & complete routine patrols to protect against fire & theft
  • Relevant experience in the security or customer service industry
  • Excellent customer service & professional deportment
  • A high standard for safety & a passion for security
  • Excellent documentation and communication skills
  • Additional certifications are an asset: Occupational First Aid Level 1, 2, 3, AST, Etc.

Please note that security officers may be required to work extended hours and be part of an on-call team for urgent scheduling needs.

For further information on the job posting or if you have any questions, you can contact Ikjot Rai, Talent Acquisition Specialist, at 604-928-1325.

In order to be considered for this position, your application must clearly demonstrate how you meet the requirements as outlined above. Ensure your resume includes your employment history including start and end dates of your employment, and any relevant information that relates to the job to which you are applying.

Due to receiving a high volume of applications, only those applicants selected to move forward in the hiring process will be contacted.

(Part 1, Section 2) of the Security Services Act of British Columbia requires all Security Services Workers are required to hold a valid BC Security License to be employed or employable. Any applicant without a valid BC Security License will be automatically disqualified. For more information please visit: http://www.bclaws.ca/civix/document/id/consol20/consol20/00_07030_01#section2

Job Description
Job Description

Are you passionate about safety and guest experience? Looking for a place to put your skills to play making guests safe and special? Elements Casino Surrey is looking for personable, energetic and passionate individuals for the position of full-time Security Officer. Under the supervision of the Security Manager, you will be responsible for protecting patrons, team members, and assets to ensure the integrity of the gaming floor and company property by patrolling and monitoring the entire casino site, interior and exterior, controlling access to keys and restricted areas; and other duties as assigned. This position requires shift schedule flexibility.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Greet guests and control access to the Casino
  • Monitor, document and report internal and external violations, unsafe conditions, potential hazards, suspicious persons or activities; prepares electronic statements via a non-gaming record keeping system
  • Observe various transactions, slot drops, chip/hopper fills and transfers; escorts cash and cash equivalent movements; may assist in fills, credits, drops and key control
  • Tag and report found property, transfers items to Lost and Found
  • Conduct regular patrols of the facility interior and exterior as directed
  • Perform identification checks and escort guests or employees as required
  • Respond to emergency situations as requested; while minimizing casino liabilities
  • May perform electronic surveillance of non-gaming facilities, including exterior and adjacent properties at some locations
  • Refer disputes to the Security Supervisor
  • Enroll guests in the Self-Exclusion program
  • Ensure compliance with licensing laws, and other statutory regulations
  • Perform other duties as assigned or directed

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Strong communication and public relations skills
  • Second language an asset
  • Previous experience or training in security an asset
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize
  • Exceptional organizational, problem solving and conflict resolution capabilities
  • Good knowledge of MS Office and Outlook
  • Certification in Occupational First Aid Level 2 and WHMIS an asset
  • Completion of Gaming Security Officer training an asset
  • High school diploma required, post secondary edu-cation an asset
  • Provides a Great Experience and Memory to all guests, both external and internal
  • Live GCC’s Values on the job: Integrity, Team Engagement, Drive to Succeed, Service Excellence, Citizenship

If this sounds like a GREAT opportunity for you, we invite you to submit an application today.

Great Canadian Gaming Corporation is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we welcome all qualified applicants to apply to join our team of unique contributors. We accommodate people with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process and applicants are encouraged to advise Human Resources in advance if an accommodation is required. We thank all applicants for their interest, and will contact those qualified to continue in the recruitment process.

title: Security Guard, Retail
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

If you are looking for a job where you will be working with the public, this is the job for you! As a Mall Security Officer, you will play a key role in ensuring the safety of workers, businesses and the public!  

We provide people with growth opportunities. 30% of our frontline employees are promoted to become part of our operation teams. 

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in {City} now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, we have a position that will accommodate your needs and help you reach your goals. 

What's in it for you?

  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits  

  • We can guarantee 40 hours/week 

  • Uniform provided free of charge 

  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld 

  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus like Use of Force training 

What does a Security Guard in {City} do?

  • Facilitate access to restricted areas for authorized persons 

  • Patrol the site on foot and by car 

  • Monitor closed circuit cameras

  • Respond to telephone calls received by the security department

  • Be eligible to work in Canada

title: Mobile Industrial Security Guard
description:
WHY WORK AT BACKWOODS?

 

Backwoods Security Services Ltd. is an Alberta Based security and protective services provider owned by the Alexis Nakota Sioux Nation. We are part of the larger family of Backwoods Energy Services which prides itself in its ability to execute projects in a safe, cost effective and timely manner. With our access to highly experienced Indigenous security guards, Backwoods Security offers top-tier security execution while creating a positive socio-economic impact within Indigenous communities.

 

At Backwoods Security Services, our culture is what sets us apart from our competition. Our employees are dedicated members of our team who know they can connect with those they serve and secure, count on reliable work hours, and be part of a growing organization that has its sights set on becoming an industry standard.

 

OUR EMPLOYEES CAN COUNT ON US FOR:

 

  • Reliable Work hours
  • Competitive Wages
  • A competitive Health Benefit Package
  • Flexible Shifts to suit a work life balance
  • Uniforms and PPE
  • Training Opportunities
  • Career Growth Opportunities
  • Recognition Programs
  • Making impacts within Indigenous Communities and People

 

tHE rOLE:

Maintain safe and secure environments for customers and employees by patrolling and monitoring premises and personnel. As a security guard for Backwoods you would complete patrols and protect assigned property. You would promote and enforce safety, as our guards act as a visible deterrent against irregular activity.

 

 

What youâ€™ll be doing:

  • Maintain a safe and secure environment for our clients by patrolling and monitoring premises
  • Monitor surveillance equipment, inspect buildings, equipment, and access points
  • Access control: Permit authorized persons entry to site when required, administrative and technology responsibilities when applicable
  • Working on an industrial site for a industrial site shutdown
  • Prevent losses and damage by reporting irregularities, inform violators of policy and procedures; restrain if necessary
  • Control traffic by directing drivers
  • Complete daily Field Level Hazard Assessments (FLHAâ€™s) and Daily Occurrence Reports (DORâ€™s) and Incident Reports (IRâ€™s) when required
  • Inspect Backwoods vehicles, notify Field Manager when service is required
  • Maintain environment by monitoring and setting building and equipment controls
  • Arrive for your shift on time. If you know you will be unable to fulfill your duties, you must communicate with the On-Call Supervisor ahead of time
  • Able to work efficiently and effectively as part of a team  

 

where youâ€™ll be working:

  • Work for this position will be indoors or outdoors depending on the posting
  • Adhere to all company office policies and safety procedures
  • Adhere to all site policies and safety procedures
  • Shifts are generally 12 hours per day; 14 on 14 off rotation; Hours of Work Averaging Agreement in place.  
  • Overtime and weekend work may be required
  • Accommodation and meals provided
  • Travel pay included with each successful rotation
  • Overtime pay per Alberta Employment Standards is available for this position

 

WHAT WEâ€™RE LOOKING FOR:

 

  • 1-2 Years of Industrial Security Experience
  • Alberta Security Guard License
  • Following certifications required: First Aid Level C; CSTS 2020, WHMIS 2015
  • Site orientations completed prior to going to site
  • Valid Class 5 Driverâ€™s License and clean 3-Year Personal Driverâ€™s Abstract
  • Objectivity, emotional control and dependability
  • Able to follow complex instructions, both written and verbal
  • Knowledgeable about security operations and procedures
  • Knowledgeable about technology, can use different software and multi-task
  • Successful applicants for this position will be fully vaccinated per site requirement
  • Drug and Alcohol pre-access test required by site for this position

 

 

 

How To Apply

 

Please submit your cover letter and resume directly to our website: backwoodsenergy.ca/careers

title: Full-Time Security Guard
company: Commissionaires Victoria, The Islands And Yukon
description:
$500 signing bonus for applicants with an existing security license! *

WORK WITH US, NOT FOR US

 

Join the Commissionaires!

As the only not-for-profit security company, our focus is on our employees. Over 90% of our revenues go directly back to our staff in profit share bonuses, health & dental benefits, RRSP contributions, employee recognition programs, and more.

Our recent partnership with BMO Financial Group offers our staff prime mortgage and loan rates, discounted banking options, exclusive investment options and more. Life is unpredictable, but the Commissionaires and BMO can help you to secure your future.

Frequently promoting from within, we are always looking for responsible, top performers who want to advance their careers. Our reputation is built on 80 years and our 20,000 security professionals with varied backgrounds of all ages. We are a dedicated equal opportunity employer with flexible shifts across Vancouver Island to suit every lifestyle â€“ student, parent, night owl, you name it!

As one of Canada's oldest security organizations, our security professionals keep airports, schools, government facilities, and other commercial enterprises safe. We also work with police departments and municipalities to help in keeping Canadians safe.

Reach your full potential today!

 

Location: Various sites in Duncan

Position Status: Full-Time & Part-Time Available

Wage Range: $16.73/hr - $22.55/hr

Shifts: Various days, evenings, and overnight shifts

Reports to: Site Supervisor

 

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Provide superior customer service to clients and general public.
  • Provide access control and security foot patrols as needed.
  • Proactively respond to and resolve emergency situations and conflicts.
  • Complete evacuation and emergency response procedures.
  • Communicate problems or concerns to the site supervisor.
  • Possess excellent multi-tasking, problem solving, prioritizing and organizational abilities.
  • Have knowledge of occupational health and safety regulations.
  • Perform all duties with high safety standards.

REQUIRED EDUCATION, QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE

  • Must possess a valid BC Security Workers License or be willing to complete training.
  • Must be legally entitled to work in Canada.
  • Must be able to obtain a Reliability Clearance and be minimum 19 years of age.
  • Must be physically fit and able to stand for long periods at a time.
  • Must be able to work in a range of weather conditions throughout shift.
  • Must be willing to complete the online Commissionaire Qualifying Course (CQC)
  • Must be fluent in the English language - written, verbal and reading skills.
  • Must have a positive attitude with a professional demeanour, and strong interpersonal skills.
  • Have excellent attention to detail to fulfill duties and responsibilities and incident report writing.
  • Have excellent problem solving skills with an ability to handle emergency situations in a calm manner.
  • Have the ability to work independently and make sound decisions in varying situations.
  • Have a demonstrated interest and experience in serving the public.

REWARDS

  • Exclusive BMO mortgage rates, banking options, and more.
  • Opportunities for advancement.
  • Free and paid training programs. 
  • Flexible work schedule â€“ maximize work-life balance!
  • Recognition programs.  
  • Paid sick, vacation and personal needs time-off.
  • Group-life, medical & dental coverage.
  • Mental health supports and dedicated HR team. 
  • Free uniform and dry-cleaning reimbursement.
  • BC Transit Pro Pass.
  • Safety boot reimbursement.
  • Personal protective equipment provided. 
  • RRSP contributions.
  • Referral bonuses.
  • And more!

 

Commissionaires Victoria, the Islands, and Yukon proudly celebrates diversity through an inclusive work environment, and welcomes applications from candidates of all backgrounds.

* Candidates who serve for six months working a minimum of 30hrs a week will be eligible for the signing bonus.

description:
Company Overview

Synterra Security Solutions is a First Nation owned Company which was formed in September 2011, dedicated to Premium Security Services. title: Security Guards with MTSC
description:
Westguard is currently hiring for qualified security professionals with Marine Transport Security Clearances (MTSC) - $19.50 an hour!

Our mission at Westguard is to make people feel safe. As a security professional with MTSC you'll be responsible for the protection of people and assets by patrolling designated areas, identifying, and reporting safety hazards and reporting security breaches, as well as completing all reporting and radio check-ins. Other duties may include responding to alarms and emergencies and controlling access to the site. You will provide excellent customer service to our clients and guests, while providing a visual security presence to deter and detect unauthorized guests.

What Would You Bring:

  • BC Security Licence
  • Marine Transportation Security Clearance (MTSC) (suitable candidate may be sponsored)
  • Class 5 Drivers License
  • Excellent Customer Service Skills
  • Ability to walk and stand for an entire eight-hour shift
  • Confidence in handling and deescalating confrontation in an assertive, calm and respectful manner.
  • Comfort working independently and in varying weather conditions
  • Ability to lift, carry and push weights of up to 50 pounds

Availability:

  • Full Time
  • Days, Afternoons, Overnights
  • Weekdays and Weekends

Who we are:

Westguard Security Services believes that every person deserves a safe environment to live, visit and work. Founded in 1986 and with more than 200 employees, Westguard remains a leader in the security industry today, delivering creative and innovative security solutions.

Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Paid Training
  • Flexible Schedules & Work life balance
  • Extended Health and Dental Benefits
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS Babylon
  • Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians
  • Access to a robust corporate discount program, Perkopolis
  • Discounted cineplex movie tickets
  • Discounts for an Annual Grouse Mountain Gondola Pass

At Westguard, we believe you can make a difference - by making people feel safe, caring for the people around you and supporting your community.

Westguard is an equal opportunity employer, and we value the diversity of our staff. We are committed to building a facilitative environment of respect, inclusiveness, and career growth. Join our amazing team and help make people feel safe.

title: Mobile Security Guard (Overnights)
description:
BPS K9 is looking for security professionals to join our reliable, confident, and self-motivated team of Mobile Security Agents in a Part Time position

Shifts: 12-hour overnights.

Successful candidates will:
  • Have a valid Alberta Security Guard License.
  • Have a valid Class 5 Driver License (or Equivalent).
  • Provide full 3-year Driver Abstract history. (less than 4 demerits)** ( February 2019 to Present)
  • Provide full 3-year Insurance Claim Report. (February 2019 to Present )
  • Have their own vehicle to get to the office.
  • Be available to start immediately or soon.
  • Have previous Security experience. (an asset)
  • Be able to work independently and in a team environment.
  • Meet the physical demands of the job. (extensive walking, standing, stairs, and driving)***
  • Fluency/proficiency in English language, both written and spoken.
  • Working in all types of weather. (sun, rain, snow, etc.)***
Duties of a Mobile Security Agent include:
  • Driving a company vehicle safely and obey all traffic laws.
  • Conducting foot patrols, securing access points, and removing trespassers.
  • Reacting appropriately in stressful situations by remaining calm and non-violent.
  • Being professional while representing the company and clients at all times.
  • Completing detailed and accurate shift reports daily.
Candidates will be skilled in the following:
  • MS Office Word and Excel. (Basic to Intermediate)**
  • Critical thinking and problem solving.
  • Safe and defensive driving at night and during snow/rain/fog etc.
  • Interpersonal and communication skills.

Wage: Guaranteed minimum $18/hour after probation (3 months)

BPS Protective Services K-9 Inc. provides competitive compensation, comprehensive training, reliable equipment, and supervision, and is a firm believer in equal opportunities.

COVID-19 considerations:
All visitors and employees must wear a mask when in the office - no mask no access
All employees must wear a mask when on shift and working indoors or when unable to maintain social distancing - no exceptions.

title: Security Guard (FT)
description:
** PLEASE ONLY APPLY IF YOU ARE SEEKING FULL-TIME OPPORTUNITES**

We are actively recruiting FULL-TIME Security Guards to work in a variety of exciting sites all across Ontario.

*********

For almost 30 years, Wincon Security has delivered property monitoring and protective services to retail, commercial, residential, industrial, alarm response and condominium clients across the Greater Toronto Area. We are an integrated solutions provider committed to leveraging cutting-edge technology to provide the very best service our industry has to offer.

What makes Wincon unique?

A passion for service excellence across our team, and the pride we take in proactively identifying and mitigating key security vulnerabilities. Along the way, we’ve stayed true to one of our founding principles; attracting, engaging and retaining top talent is a recipe for success. So, too, is building an employee-friendly culture where staff are treated with respect and given opportunities to advance in their careers.

Apply today to see be placed at a site that best suits your experience and skills!

Required skills & Qualifications:
  • Must hold a valid Security Guard license issued by the Private Securities & Investigative Services Act
  • Valid First Aid and CPR certificate
  • Must be able to stand and walk for long periods of time, including up and down stairs
  • Excellent verbal & written communication skills
  • Comprehensive knowledge of common security policies and various related Acts, Codes, WHMIS
  • Highly developed interpersonal and customer service skills; including conflict resolution, problem solving, decision making, situational assessment and communication skills
  • Parking enforcement, if required
  • Previous security/concierge experience preferred
  • Must be willing to travel to Markham; additional fare required to travel to York Region
  • Available to work overnights
  • Vehicle is considered an asset
  • Able to work in all weather conditions
  • Ability to work independently and unsupervised

Responsibilities include:
  • Be visible to public as they enter the premises
  • Acknowledge customers as they enter and exit the store
  • Strong interpersonal communication; good command of English language
  • Provide exceptional customer service to clients, customers, contractors and visitors of client's property
  • Perform routine property patrols and respond to Fire alarms
  • Detect, challenge and displace unwanted people
  • Promote safety and adhere to client site emergency procedures
  • On-site First Aid responder until expert Medical help arrives
  • Recording and maintaining log books of daily activities
  • Follow up with daily documentation in your memo book; inputting notes and incident reports as required

While we appreciate the interest of all applicants, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Wincon is committed to providing support and accommodation for persons with disabilities. If you require accommodation during our selection process, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs

title: CC_Gatehouse Security (Weekends)
description:
Condo Concierge is a security specialty firm that serves the ever-growing condominium and rental market in the GTA. We are hiring a part-time (Saturdays & Sundays 3:00pm -11:00pm) Gatehouse Security Guard in the Brampton area.

Job Duties:

  • Access control for the facility/area
  • Act as a front-line ambassador to residents, tenants & clients
  • Maintain a strong optical and tangible image of security & safety
  • Ensure the facility's safety and emergency response protocols are in place and followed i.e. fire alarms, site emergencies, theft, etc.
  • Complete daily (site specific) reports ensuring seamless communication between your staff
  • Address and report incidents in a timely manner according to the protocol
  • Report, evaluate and follow up on all incidents
  • Performing other duties as assigned

Job Requirements:

  • Must possess a valid security license issued by the Ontario Ministry of Community and Correctional Services
  • Valid CPR/First Aid Certificate
  • Competent computer literacy
  • Strong written and verbal skills to communicate
  • Superior telephone etiquette, strong interpersonal and customer service skills
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Must have completed high school, or GED, or an acceptable combination of education and experience
  • Must be able to work independently with minimal supervision and ability to handle multiple tasks

title: Security Shift Supervisor
description:
A Securiguard Security Professional is responsible for maintaining the efficiencies, professionalism and deportment of security officers at all sites not designated as "self contained and policed" and ensuring that personal site knowledge maintenance, officer evaluation, mentoring, training and communication is conducted efficiently and professionally in a 24/7 environment.

We are currently hiring a Security Shift Supervisor to join our team. 

The ideal candidate will possess the following characteristics:

  • Team Player
  • Solid understanding  of the Securiguard Culture
  • Strong communicator who is able to effectively engage with employees and visitors
  • Capable of working in both a team and independent environment
  • The Ability to prioritize multiple demands
  • Perform regularly scheduled site duties as required.
  • Establish a professional working relationship with the client in order to coordinate safety on site
  • Mentor officers on site/duty protocols and conduct, deportment, reporting procedures, company policy/procedures and corporate Mission Statement and Values.
  • Submit daily Shift Summaries in a concise, yet detailed, time specific format.
  • Supervisors are expected to present themselves as deportment role models to site personnel, clients and Securiguard management and staff.
  • Performs other duties and special projects assigned by the Operations Manager or client as required.
  • Monitor property line for any evidence of un-authorized access, weak points within the security line (I.e. damage to fence) and suspicious activity in or near to the property line
  • Verify all vehicles entering are authorized and hold a valid vehicle pass permit.
  • Coaches, mentors and disciplines guard staff
  • Liaise with client, meets and exceeds expectations, delivers exception customer service and security expertise for the client, his customers and his staff.
  • Ensures a safe & secure environment for the public, employees of the client and to vendors on the premises
  • Provides recommendations for crowd management and traffic control

Requirements:

  • Valid BC Security License
  • 6-12 months Supervisory Experience
  • Must have experience working outdoors for the entire shift in all weather conditions
  • Must have the ability to walk/patrol for entire 8 hour shift
  • Must have ability and training for dealing with difficult customers (non-violent crisis intervention)
  • Must have experience and training with de-escalation tactics and negotiation skills
  • Confident and articulate leader
  • Must  have experience with event crowd control
  • Must always be on the lookout for security threats and must sometimes intervene when problems arise
  • Traffic control training is an asset
  • Schedules and assigns daily duties and responsibilities
  • OFA 2 would be considered an asset. 

Employee Perks We Offer: 

  • Free Uniforms
  • Paid Training
  • Benefits after 9 months to P/T & F/T Employees (Conditions Apply)
  • Discount Cineplex Movie Tickets
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Recognition Programs & Events

title: Loss Prevention Officer
description:
London Drugs is looking for highly capable security and investigations professionals for our Loss Prevention team. You will find state of the art technology, training and support, and a high integrity group of people committed to excellence on our team.

Not just a job…a communitya partnershipa team

You’ll experience them all at London Drugs. As one of Canada’s fastest-growing and most successful retail chains, we know what it takes to build a satisfying career. We are seeking innovative, customer focused people to join our team!

Opportunity:Loss Prevention Officer 

Responsibilities:The Loss Prevention Officer position is well-suited for a highly capable security and investigations professional that thrives on working within a team environment.

Duties include:
  • Shifts at store locations conducting surveillance, investigation, and maintenance of loss prevention systems
  • Identifying areas of loss and working on team shrink reduction plans
  • Detection and apprehension of persons committing criminal offences against the company
  • Securing evidence, report writing & document preparation for court testifying purposes
  • Special assignments including lock repair, key control, staff awareness and orientation
  • Maintaining the overall security of our locations
QualificationsWe have an extensive in-house training program (in BC we are an accredited BST training provider). While we are eager to develop our people, candidates should possess the following skills and qualifications:
  • Demonstrated ability to stay calm and respond with good judgment in emergency situations
  • A commitment and history of protecting people and property in a safe and legal manner
  • Demonstrated ability to work under strict confidentiality
  • High ethical standards and a commitment to personal and professional integrity
  • Good command of the English language, both written and verbal, required for report writing and court testimony
  • A valid Class 5 driver’s license and own vehicle
  • Availability and willingness to work at all locations and surrounding areas
  • Previous Loss Prevention experience or other related experience within the Criminal Justice system would be an asset
  • Previous security related education, professional accreditation, first aid and first responder training is an asset
  • Use of force and restraining device training is an asset
  • Provincial security worker license, or the ability to obtain one before commencing work
Availability RequirementThis is a Full Time position.  Employees must be available to work a flexible schedule, Monday through Sunday, 40 hours per week for day and evening shifts.

We are an equal opportunity employer. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work applicable to this position and are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. Be advised, London Drugs DOES NOT use third party recruitment services.

London Drugs may collect, use, and/or disclose your personal information (including the information in this application) where it is reasonable for establishing, managing or terminating an employment relationship. This includes the use or disclosure of your personal information to persons inside or external to our organization, for the purpose of checking references or gathering other information to support an assessment of your candidacy.

To protect yourself, do not respond to unsolicited job offers from individuals or e-mail addresses, and never disclose any sensitive details about your identity (including personal or financial) to anyone you do not know or trust or on any unverified website, or website you do not trust.

title: Loss Control Specialist - Canada
description:
About Our Company:

Are you looking for a challenging career that rewards hard work and success?   AFIRM is committed to finding outstanding people who have the ambition and willingness to learn in order to succeed.   The most successful candidates will be detail-oriented, self-motivated and possess strong problem-solving and analytical skills.  

 

AFIRM is the national leader in risk control, consulting services as well as commercial and residential inspections.   We provide our exceptional services to insurers, brokers, risk managers and government agencies.

 

Equal Opportunity Employer

The H.W. Kaufman Group of companies is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other status or condition protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

 

 

Qualifications:

Our Inspectorsâ€™ education and training:

 

  • Inspectors come from all walks of life with their own experience and background
  • AFIRM provides its candidates and Inspectors with a valuable set of skills unlike any other
  • They have all successfully completed AFIRMâ€™s own self-directed, on-line training certification program
  • Continue to hone their skills with AFIRMâ€™s on-going distance learning opportunities

 

 

Our Inspectorsâ€™ work environment      

 

  • As independent contractors with AFIRM, our inspectors work from home
  • They travel to various locations from their home base to assigned locations
  • Work evenings and weekends whenever required to maintain customer satisfaction

 

 

What all our Inspectors must have:

 

  • A reliable vehicle
  • Mobile phone
  • Windows based computer
  • Internet connection (high speed preferably)
  • Digital camera or smart phone that takes high quality digital pictures
Responsibilities:

 

AFIRM is a global leader in Loss Prevention and Premium Audit with Canadian locations in Richmond Hill and Montreal.   We are currently seeking independent Loss Prevention service contractors.

 

Our Loss Control Representatives (Inspectors) visit various property locations on behalf of the ownerâ€™s insurance company with a goal to minimize potential losses.   There is no selling involved.   Requests for inspection are received directly from the insurance companies.

 

Our successful Inspectors are:

 

  • Outgoing and independent
  • Curious and inquisitive by nature
  • Self-motivated strivers
  • Well organized and manage their time efficiently
  • Focused on quality of service
  • Competent computer skills with good input speed & accuracy
  • Skilled at writing well

 

What our Inspectors do:

 

  • Take responsibility for; and organize their assignments
  • Schedule their own appointments with property owners
  • Travel to the location
  • Tour the property and collect information (Residential and Commercial)
  • Identify potential areas of loss such as fire, theft and liability
  • Take photographs and measure buildings
  • Prepare a pre-define Loss Control report of the property using AFIRMâ€™s own web-based platform

title: Loss Prevention Officers
description:
If you are looking to work in a dynamic environment, learn new skills and are interested in future law enforcement opportunities, Apply Now!

Securiguard is looking for highly capable security and investigations professionals for our Loss Prevention Team.


Who we are:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea their team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.


Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Free Uniforms
  • Paid Training
  • Extended Health Benefits for P/T & F/T Employees (subject to benefit waiting periods)
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS Babylon. Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians (subject to waiting period)
  • Recognition Programs & Events

What would you do:

As a member of our Undercover Retail Crime Team, you will be working in teams of 2-4, patrolling select retail stores. As part of your role, you will be apprehending shoplifters, following prolific offenders, and gathering related intelligence on current crime activity.


What would you bring:

  • Valid BC Security Worker License
  • Valid Advanced Security Training (Asset)
  • Loss Prevention Experience- 1 year (Asset)
  • Must be flexible to work in multiple stores/locations
  • Must be able to stand for an 8-hour period
  • Ability to complete incident reports on a daily basis
  • Must be comfortable apprehending and detaining shoplifters when required
  • Ability to handle difficult situations with a calm demeanor
  • Excellent judgment and decision-making ability
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to arrest, recover and conduct mobile and static surveillance of persons, groups, vehicles, and addresses
  • Ability to work alone and as part of a team as operational needs dictate

Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer, and we value the diversity of our staff. We are committed to building a facilitative environment of respect, inclusiveness, and career growth.

title: Damage Prevention Technician
description:
ABOUT THIS CAREER OPPORTUNITY

Black & McDonald's Ottawa team is growing! If you are committed and collaborative professional looking to contribute to a hard-working, innovative team, this opportunity is for you. The Damage Prevention Technician is located in Ottawa, Ontario and reports directly to the Supervisor.

  • Managing work orders and documenting locates
  • Provide sketches with markings of the locates
  • Utilize equipment to communicate with excavators and company personnel regarding underground facilities
  • Locate buried utility lines
  • Operate various electronic devices including use of a receiver wand and transmitter to assist in the locating and verifying of underground utilities
  • Mark utility lines
  • Prepare various reports and documentation verifying marked utilities
  • Adhere to safety standards and schedules

COMPETENCY REQUIREMENTS

  • Communicates Effectively
  • Customer Focus
  • Holds Self and Others Accountable
  • Problem Solving and Innovation
  • Teamwork and Collaboration

WORK EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

  • 1-3 years' experience in similar role

SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS

  • Holds a valid G licence and comfortable driving in all types of weather conditions
  • Must be able to navigate utilizing GPS, or maps
  • Must be able to utilize a laptop computer to interpret utility maps
  • Candidates must be able to squat, kneel, use hands and fingers to push buttons, hold receiver (piece of locate equipment) and use paint stick in the other hand for marking ground and roadways up to 9 hours a day
  • Candidates must be comfortable walking on all types of terrain (grass, gravel, dirt and roadways)
  • Candidates must be able to work days, afternoons, nights and on call coverage

Black & McDonald welcomes and encourages applications from persons with disabilities.  Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.

title: Asset Protection Service Representative - Robson St -Granville
description:
About Old Navy


Forget what you know about old-school industry rules. When you work at Old Navy, you’re choosing a different path. From day one, we’ve been on a mission to democratize fashion and make shopping fun again. Our teams make style accessible to everyone, creating high-quality, must-have fashion essentials for the whole family, with love, season after season.


We opened our first store in 1994 in San Francisco and have been on a roll ever since. We cultivate a community of playful personalities that thrive in a fast-paced environment where our employees can be their most authentic selves. Here, we’re family.


About the Role


In this role, you will embody our value of Doing The Right Thing by protecting People, Assets, and Brands. You will work in a energized, fast paced environment focused on creating a safe environment for our employees, teams, and customers; this is critical to driving our Brand power, enduring customer relationships, and exuding our commitment to team and values. You’ll need to understand the big picture strategy and work with cross-functional teams and external partners.


What You'll Do


+ Support strategies, standards, and processes to implement an Asset Protection strategy to mitigate risk and loss within our Gap Inc stores

+ Assist with the implementation and continued execution of the shortage reduction program

+ Work with store personnel to identify inventory shortage opportunities and recommend solutions

+ Determine the assignment of appropriate Asset Protection resources (i.e.: agents, technology, etc.) to address shortage reduction opportunities

+ Courteous and responsive to internal/external requests

+ Exchange and verifies job related information to provide support


Who You Are


+ Experience in customer service and/or a high-pressure, multitask environment to drive results, coach, and collaborate

+ Strong communication and interpersonal skills, including the ability to negotiate and build consensus across multiple stakeholders and functions

+ Ability to actively learn and immediately apply learnings into decisions and behaviors

+ Ability to manage and prioritize their time; able to multi task

+ Use basic information-gathering skills to solve problems


Benefits at Old Navy


+ Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Gap, Banana Republic, Old Navy and Athleta, 30% off at Outlet, and 10% off markdowns at Gap, Banana Republic and Outlet.

+ Competitive Paid Time Off plans.*

+ Company match for donations and volunteer time*

+ Registered Retirement Savings Plan

+ Employee stock purchase plan.*

+ Medical, dental, vision and life insurance.*

+ Virtual health care 24/7*

+ Maternity/Parental Top Up.*

+ See more of the benefits we offer.


*For eligible employees


Gap Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status. We have received numerous awards for our long-held commitment to equality and will continue to foster a diverse and inclusive environment of belonging. This year, we’ve been named as one of the Best Places to Work by the Human Rights Campaign (https://www.hrc.org/resources/best-places-to-work-for-lgbtq-equality-2022) for the seventeenth consecutive year and have been included in the 2021 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index for the fourth year in a row.

title: Loss Prevention (Ottawa, ON, CA, K1N 9J7)
description:
Job ID: 208277
Location: ON-Rideau Centre (0518)
Address: 50 Rideau St, Ottawa, ON K1N 9J7, Canada (CA)
Full Time/Part Time: Full Time
Position Type: Regular

The Loss Prevention Agent protects the assets of a store against theft, and works with the Leadership team to maintain operational controls to reduce shortage.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Loss Prevention
  • Provide friendly, professional and knowledgeable service to clients as needed.
  • Conduct surveillance on the sales floor, as well as utilizing the CCTV system, to identify, observe, and apprehend or deter individuals from committing external theft(s).
  • Adhere to all laws and SEPHORA policies concerning apprehensions, search and seizure and the preservation of evidence.
  • Prepare reports relative to any theft incidents, merchandise recoveries, accident investigations and audits.
  • Develop and maintain a professional relationship with all internal partners, local law enforcement agencies, mall security and other retailers.
  • Testify in court on behalf of the company, in any case, criminal or civil, to which the Agent is summoned.
  • Provide new hire and continuous employee trainings to maintain store loss prevention awareness.
Operations
  • Conduct store self-audits, checklists and safety inspections. Communicate findings to store Leadership team and District Loss Prevention Manager.
  • Assist store Leadership team with inventory preparation and process.
  • Partner with stores and DLPM in the development and execution of shrinkage prevention plans.

EXPECTED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS
  • 1 year of asset protection/loss prevention experience in a retail environment.
  • Satisfy and maintain all licensing requirements (as required by province or local jurisdiction).
  • Possess strong written, verbal, interviewing, listening and interpersonal communication skills.
  • Ability to maintain composure and provide effective coaching in the moment on loss prevention techniques.
  • Proficiency in Windows, Word and Excel is desirable.
  • A High School graduate or equivalent.
  • Availability to work flexible hours and days, including evenings, weekends, and holidays is essential.
  • Availability to work at multiples locations within a market.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
Physical Requirements:
  • Work in a fragrance filled environment.
  • Lift and carry up to 50 pounds.
  • Bend and stretch to stock shelves.

COMPANY OVERVIEW
Owned by LVMH Moet Hennessy Louis Vuitton, the world's leading luxury goods group, Sephora is highly regarded as a beauty trailblazer, thanks to its unparalleled assortment of prestige products, unbiased service from experts, interactive shopping environment, and innovation.

Sephora stores - Sephora operates approximately 1,900 stores in 29 countries worldwide, with an expanding base of over 360 stores across North America. Sephora opened its first U.S. store in New York in 1998, its first Canadian store in Toronto in 2004. Sephora's North American headquarters is located in San Francisco, with corporate offices in New York, Montreal and Toronto.
Sephora.com - Launched in the U.S. in 1999 and Canada in 2003, the foremost beauty site on the Internet is also Sephora's largest North American store in terms of sales and selection of products and brands.

title: Security Supervisor
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

If you are looking for your next professional challenge, we have an opportunity for you! As a regional security supervisor, you will play a key role in the day-to-day operations and processes in place!  

 

What's in it for you?

  • We offer comprehensive health benefits  

  • Rate of pay $20.00

  • We can guarantee 40 hours/week 

  • Uniform provided free of charge 

  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld 

  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus like Use of Force training 

Task Related objectives:

Assigned duties will include, but are not limited to:
• Drive corrective action and organizational engagement on any site specific operational or disservice issue, per
requirements under our Professional Standards
• Assisting client with complete Standing Orders
• Complete Site Hazard Assessments,
• Ensure site operations are conducted with prescribed GardaWorld Professional Standards guidelines and Business
Management manual
• Coordinate with union representatives on personnel related matters as required
• Complete annual performance evaluations for staff within portfolio
• Provide backfill support within the portfolio as required, such as covering shifts to reduce open shifts and
overtime.
• Develop intimate familiarity with customer culture, requirements and day to day operations

Required Skils:

• Must be able to demonstrate professional conduct at all times in a customer service environment.
• The site supervisor must intervene and effectively provide conflict resolution techniques in a professional manner.
• The Site Supervisor will be required to be proficient in GardaWorld operating procedures including Office 365,
Scheduling Software (GSKED,Gtrack, Kiosk) and be able to produce detailed reports as associated with various
platforms.
• Have a good understanding of LMS for online training courses in order to assist employees having difficulty.
• Understand WorkSafe NB protocols and procedures, Health and Safety, and various provincial regulations;
excellent deportment and communication skills; be flexible in working off hours as required; must be an organized
self-starter, able to work unsupervised in a fast-paced and stressful environment.
• All supervisors are required to be bilingual in both English and French, with proficiency in reading, writing and
verbal communications. In the event of discrepancy, the supervisor must be able to successfully provide, upon
request a copy of a language proficiency evaluation by service New Brunswick and obtain an Intermediate (2) in
order to maintain employment.
• Complete required training by the client and by Gardaworld in order to be eligible for work and is responsible for
maintaining and tracking his or her skills. Note additional training may be added at the discretion of the operations
or account manager at anytime.

Must have drivers license with clean driving record and reliable insured vehicle.

title: Security Guard, Industrial Setting
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

We are looking for Full- Time and  Part-Time Security guard to work in the Industrial sector in Portage La Prairie area. As a member of the GardaWorld team, your primary role is to ensure the safety and security of client assets, tenants and visitors to the assignment area in a professional and courteous manner. 

During the current crisis, every day, thousands of Canadians are working to get us through the COVID-19 pandemic, and GardaWorld is at the forefront of this effort. Join us and help us keep our hospitals and essential services open and safe.

 

What you’ll be doing?

  • Maintain a safe and Secure environment
  • Access control of entry ways and exit points using equipment at your disposal.
  • Performing Mobile Patrol and Foot Patrol at the Premises regularly to maintain order and establish presence.
  • Enforce Property regulations and city Bi- Laws on the client's site.
  • Protect the client's assets relative to theft, assault, fire, and other safety issues.
  • Complete Daily reports and Incident Reports.
  • Provide Excellent customer service.

 

What we’re looking for?

  • Good verbal and written communication skills
  • Previous experience in the security industry (asset)
  • Valid Provincial Security Guard license
  •  Customer service oriented
  •  Must be able to work  days and evenings
  •  Leadership and problem-solving skills
  •  Ability to work in a stressful environment

 

What we offer?

  • Competitive wages
  • Diverse benefits plan
  • Positive and dynamic environment
  • On-the-job paid training
  • Opportunity for advancement in the security industry
  • Complete uniform

title: Security Officer - Hospital
description:
Description

PeaceHealth is seeking a Security Officer - Security Parking for a Per Diem/Relief FTE, Variable position. Hourly compensation starts at $19.37, more depending on experience.

Must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 including 2 doses of a 2-dose series or 1 dose of a 1-dose series plus 14 days beyond the final dose prior to start date.

JOB SUMMARY

The Security Officer is responsible for providing safety and security services which requires regular interactions with patients, visitors, caregivers and clinicians in highly diverse and complex situations. Interacts with local law enforcement to provide information, clarification of events and coordinate emergency protocols. Performs internal and external security patrol of assigned hospitals and/or clinics; dispatch; and access control as assigned.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

1. Provides safety and security services which includes; patrolling grounds, parking lots, buildings, securing entryways and exits, etc. to effectively address potential conduct issues, violations of policy, check for property damage, inspect safety issues, inspect certain safety features such as fire extinguishers or water valves, respond to all codes, address trespassing concerns, provide assistance with out of control patients, and utilizes electronic checkpoints.

2. Provides stand-by service or escort services for protection of caregivers or patients as needed.

3. Provides courtesy services such as providing directions, locksmith functions, jump-starts, changing flat tires, reporting vehicles with lights on, and assisting families in times of crisis.

4. Provides non-violent physical crisis intervention and de-escalation techniques to neutralize extreme situations and mitigate negative outcomes.

5. Provides crowd control during events resulting in an influx of patients and/or visitors.

6. Coordinates information, clarification of events and coordinating emergency protocols which may require collaboration with external safety and law enforcement agencies.

7. Responds to all emergency situations and applies appropriate protocols for the Code, Disaster (command center), ETO Exposure, Fire, Flood, Hazardous spills, and all code situations.

8. May assist flight crew and ground crew with Life Flight/Airlift NW transports and securing landing the pad.

9. Ensures adherence to protocols; completing, filing and maintaining correct documentation, filing reports, monitoring visitor permits, and assists with maintaining building access control by utilizing the computerized badge/door system.

10. Performs other duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS

EDUCATION:

+ High School Diploma or equivalent is preferred.

EXPERIENCE/TRAINING:

+ Minimum of two (2) years , military or civilian security or law enforcement experience is required.

+ Healthcare facility security experience is preferred.

LICENSE/CERTIFICATION:

+ BLS Certification upon hire.

+ Valid state Driver’s License

+ IAHSS (International Assoc for Healthcare Security & Safety) Basic certification required within 45 days of employment.

+ If assigned location requires the use of tasers, successfully pass Taser Training Program. After successful completion of Taser Training Program officers will be required to carry the taser while on duty.

OTHER SKILLS:

+ Excellent verbal and written communication skills

+ Ability to formulate a plan of action, carry it out with control and apply crisis intervention and de-escalation skills

+ Ability to perform data entry as necessary

+ Good physical condition to walk, run and lift as needed

+ Working knowledge of Microsoft Windows, Outlook, Teams, Word, and Excel

+ Acceptable driving record in accordance with the PeaceHealth Motor Vehicle Safety Policy.

ST JOSEPH PHYSICAL/COGNITIVE REQUIREMENTS:

+ Work requires active physical exertion up to 33% of the time.

+ Ability to lift objects weighing 80 lbs. or less.

+ Work requires frequent exposure to conditions involving minor cold, heat, poor ventilation or sharp instruments such as syringes or lancets. Reasonably anticipated exposure to blood and body fluids once per month or more.

+ Job duties occasionally require the ability to concentrate and pay close attention to detail (less than 34% of work time).

+ Ability to assist in managing violent, uncontrollable persons.

See how PeaceHealth is committed to Inclusivity, Respect for Diversity and Cultural Humility (https://www.thecaregiver.org/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/PeaceHealth-Statement-of-Commitment-to-Diversity-and-Inclusion-vFINAL.pdf) .

For full consideration of your skills and abilities, please attach a current resume with your application. EEO Affirmative Action Employer/Vets/Disabled in accordance with applicable local, state or federal laws.

title: Security Guard, Casual
description:
Security Guard, Casual

Business Unit: Security Services
Career Area: Security Guard
Location: 

Winnipeg, MB, CA

Description

Every day, thousands of Canadians are working to get us through the COVID-19 pandemic, and GardaWorld is at the forefront of this effort. Join us and help us keep our hospitals and essential services open and safe.

 

We are looking for Floater Security Guards to fill assignments for various client sites. The security guard (floater) will be playing a crucial role in maintaining the public security in these times of crisis.

What is a Floater Security Guard? A Floater Security Guard provides support to mulitple sites and can adapt to different work environments easily. For Floater Guards, variety is the spice of life. You may be working at an office tower one week, and the next week you may work at  a community college, then assigned to a condominium or retail mall. Your site is never the same - you will jump from one site to another while gaining knowledge about each one. Hours are flexible, and you can work up to 40 hours/week.

What you’ll be doing

  • Maintain a safe and secure environment
  • Access control of entryways and exit points using equipment at your disposal
  • Enforce property regulations and city bi-laws on the client's site
  • Patrol and monitor premises regularly to maintain order and establish presence
  • Protect the client's assets relative to theft, assault, fire, and other safety issues
  • Complete daily reports and incident reports
  • Provide excellent customer service

What we’re looking for

  • Valid security guard licence
  • High school diploma or equivalent
  • 1 year or more security-related experience
  • First aid and CPR certification preferred
  • Good communication skills (written/oral)
  • Driver’s licence and car (asset)
  • Excellent customer service and resourcefulness 
  • Good adaptability

What we offer

  • Flexible schedules 
  • Career advancement opportunities 
  • Excellent benefits 
  • Diverse work assignments 
  • Complete security uniform 
  • Free training

 

SSWINN

GardaWorld: Make the world a safer place

GardaWorld is a global leader in the security industry, offering a wealth of opportunity to individuals looking to gain experience and develop professionally in a growing industry. We offer flexible schedules, diverse work assignments spanning multiple industries, and training and career advancement opportunities. We embrace diversity and welcome newcomers, women, students, retirees, reservists, veterans, and more to join our team, as we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.


We thank all candidates for their interest; however, we will communicate only with the selected candidates.

title: Security Guard 2
company: Centre for Addiction and Mental Health
description:
EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY
Security Guard 2
Security Services,Legal Services

Position Description
The Centre for Addiction and Mental Health (CAMH) is seeking an in-house full time permanent Security Guard 2 to work in the Security Services department.This is an exciting and valuable opportunity for anyone embarking on a law enforcement career. CAMH Security Services offers above industry average salary and benefits as well as opportunities for full-time placements.

Reporting to the Supervisor of Security Services, the successful candidate will provide security services and assistance to CAMH patients, visitors, staff and volunteers to promote a safe and secure environment. The Security Guard will assist with safety matters; report and respond to emergencies, patrol hospital buildings and grounds; and complete various reports. Other duties include ensuring that all Security and Safety procedures are maintained; protection of life and property; incident investigations; liaising with Emergency responders and the removal of unauthorized persons. You will support a workplace that embraces diversity, encourages teamwork and effective communication as well as complies with all applicable regulatory and legislative requirements. This position involves shift rotation (day, evening, and night) and weekend work. Must adhere to minimum availability. This position is located at 1001 Queen Street West.

Qualifications

  • A valid PSIS’s Security Guard License is required.
  • The ideal candidate will possess 2 Years Community College education in law enforcement field or be in progress of completion.
  • You must have 6 months - 1 year of security experience and be First Aid/CPR Certified.
  • 1 year healthcare experience would be an asset.

You possess the ability to deal tactfully and effectively with the public, staff and patients. You will be a motivated team player with a positive service-oriented approach. You will have strong interpersonal and communication skills with a demonstrated sensitivity towards mental health and addictions clientele. The incumbent must be able to work with minimal supervision, problem-solve and exercise good judgment in varied situations. The successful candidate will possess basic computer skills such as Microsoft Office and Outlook. You will have the ability to cope with physical demands of work. Ability to work with diverse clients and staff is required. Bilingualism (French/English) and/or proficiency in a second language would be an asset.

All applicants offered and accepting employment must complete a Vulnerable Sector Police Records Check. The offer of employment will be conditional upon receipt of the satisfactory Vulnerable Sector Police Records Check.

Vaccines (COVID-19 and others) are a requirement of the jobunless you have an exemption on a medical ground pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code.

Please Note: This full time permanent position is part of the OPSEU bargaining unit.

Salary Range:$22.92 - $28.28 per hour

Please click the apply button below.

CAMH is a Tobacco-Free Organization.

CAMH is fully affiliated with the University of Toronto and is a teaching hospital and research institute. As a CAMH employee, you will be expected to actively support CAMH’s teaching and research activities, in addition to supporting the clinical work of the hospital.

At CAMH, we strive to be an equitable and inclusive employer. Our commitment to equity is grounded in an institution-wide commitment to achieving a working, teaching, and learning environment that is free of discrimination and harassment.

CAMH actively seeks candidates from First Nations, Métis and Inuit, racialized and LGBTQ2S+ communities, women, and people with disabilities (including people who have experienced mental health and substance use challenges).

We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply to our positions.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Please inform us if you require accommodations during the interview process.
