ALL JOB SEEKERS, including UNION staff, who use the Career's Website to apply for job postings will have until 11 p.m. on the day the posting closes (day-7). ***INTERNAL JOB SEEKERS - Please ensure that both your ID# and last name are entered exactly as you see it on your most recent pay stub, otherwise you will be treated as an external candidate.***

Hamilton Health Sciences fosters a culture of patient and staff safety, whereby all employees are guided by our Mission, Vision, Values, and Values Based Code of Conduct. Hamilton Health Sciences is a teaching hospital and all staff and physicians are expected to support students and other learners.

To be considered for this opportunity applicants must apply during the posting period. All internal and external applicants may ONLY apply via the Careers website.

Hamilton Health Sciences is an equal opportunity employer and we will accommodate any needs under the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedom, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. Hiring processes will be modified to remove barriers to accommodate those with disabilities, if requested. Should any applicant require accommodation through the application processes, please contact HR Services at 905-521-2100, Ext. 46947 for assistance. If the applicant requires a specific accommodation because of a disability during an interview, the applicant will need to advise the hiring manager when scheduling the interview and the appropriate accommodations can be made.

This competition is open to all qualified applicants, however, qualified internal applicants will be considered first. Past performance will be considered as part of the selection process. Job Description

EXCITING JOB OPPORTUNITY

SECURITY OFFICER – PART TIME PERMANENT

SHORELINES CASINO BELLEVILLE

Team up with the industry’s best and provide great guest experiences at Shorelines Casino Belleville!

We are currently seeking a driven and energetic individual to join our growing business in eastern Ontario as a SECURITY OFFICER.  This role will join our team at Shorelines Casino Belleville.  Under the direct supervision of the Regional Manager, Security or the Shift Supervisor, Security, this position is responsible for the safety and protection of employees, guests, the facility and company assets at the site level. Ensures adherence to all policies and procedures while contributing to a safe and welcoming work environment for all employees.

Duties and Responsibilities Include: 

  • Exceeds guest expectations by providing outstanding customer service
  • Helps create an engaged work environment by choosing positivity and fun, recognizing excellent peer performance, and by caring about and supporting our colleagues every day
  • Monitors, documents and reports internal and external violations, unsafe conditions, potential hazards, suspicious persons and activities; prepares electronic statements via a non-gaming record keeping system
  • Enforces restricted access by unauthorized persons
  • Observes cashier transactions and slot drops (if applicable); escorts cash and cash equivalent movements
  • Tags and reports found property; transfers to Lost & Found
  • Conducts regular patrols of the interior and exterior as directed
  • Performs electronic surveillance; maintains site surveillance equipment; reports issues
  • Escorts guests and employees as directed
  • Performs identification checks as required
  • Refers guest disputes to the Supervisor, Security
  • Performs crowd control as directed
  • May enroll guests in the Self-Exclusion Program at some locations
  • Communicates effectively with all appropriate operational departments
  • Builds strong working relationships with guests and employees
  • Complies with licensing laws, health and safety and other statutory regulations
  • Performs other duties as assigned or directed

Successful candidates will demonstrate the following qualifications:

  • People-focused and committed to service excellence
  • Proactive and solution-oriented with a drive to succeed
  • High School Diploma
  • Smart Serve certification
  • Must be willing to recertify for Use of Force every 3 years
  • Occupational First Aid Level 2 an asset
  • Can understand, speak and write English; fluency in other languages an asset
  • Previous security experience an asset

Since the fun never stops at Shorelines, candidates must be ready and willing to work a flexible schedule, including evenings, weekends, holidays and overnights, based on business needs.

Great Canadian Gaming Corporation is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we welcome all qualified applicants to apply to join our team of unique contributors. We accommodate people with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process and applicants are encouraged to advise Human Resources in advance if an accommodation is required. We thank all applicants for their interest, and will contact those qualified to continue in the recruitment process.

title: Security Officer -Chilliwack Casual On Call RCMP Guards
description:
Looking to start your career in security services? We have a great opportunity for you! 

Our Story 

Commissionaires BC is a Canadian, not-for-profit security/enforcement organization that has been in business since 1927. Our mandate is to give back to those who served and continue to serve in our communities and country.

Commissionaires provides security services for over 200 sites and are located in over 110 communities across the province. Our client base runs from the Federal Government to local municipalities, airports, industrial sectors, and commercial/residential buildings.  

Our guards are not only behind the scenes providing security and access control, but front and centre providing valued customer service to the public.

We are looking for security guards who are available to work in the Vancouver area. 

Whatâ€™s in it for you 

  • Opportunity for growth
  • Work for a reputable and nationally known company 
  • A challenging yet rewarding work environment 
  • Flexibility of rotations and sites to suit your requirements 
  • Free uniforms 
  • Paid on-site training  
  • Gain valuable experience as a stepping stone into a law enforcement career 

Youâ€™re a good fit ifâ€¦  

  • You hold a positive and can do attitude 
  • You are reliable and committed  
  • You can think on your feet and problem solve 
  • You can work alone or as part of a team 

Some of your responsibilities include: 

  • Patrolling the RCMP sites/locations 
  • Offering first class customer service to both clients and general public 
  • Mobile patrolling/ticketing  
  • Access Control 
  • CCTV Monitoring 
  • Proactively responding to and resolving emergency situations and conflicts  
  • Provide first aid in a prompt,accessible,and appropriate manner
  • Maintaining detailed and accurate daily logs and incident reports 
  • Effectively communicating problems or concerns to the Site Supervisor 
  • Maintaining up-to-date knowledge of site duties and safety standards

Your Must-Haves:

  • BC Security License  
  • You have excellent problem solving skills  
  • Own a Vehicle
  • You have a valid Driverâ€™s Licence with a clean driverâ€™s abstract 
  • You can work under pressure 
  • Able to stand for long periods and work both indoors and outdoors in a range of weather conditions; 
  • You have resided in Canada for the last five years 

Your Nice-To-Haves:

  • Hold OFA 1 or OFA 2

title: Security Guard- Sudbury Airport (CASUAL)
description:
SECURITY GUARD- SUDBURY AIRPORT


Are you passionate about Safety & Security and seeking opportunity to join a team of Security Professionals?


A.S.P. Incorporated has provided security and customer service solutions for over 20 years to Canadian clients. We employ in excess of 2000 employees and are a subsidiary of ICTS EUROPE, which is operating in 22 countries and employing more than 17000 professionals. A.S.P provide services to some of the largest airports in Canada and has a significant presence in the Commercial and Residential spaces in Ontario and Alberta.

A.S.P. in looking for Access Control Officer, who take pride in becoming ambassador of Airport and make every interaction professional and positive. Work with integrity, respect, and take responsibility of the security and safety at the Sudbury Airport.


What you will do:

  • Monitor and controls ground-side to airside access and doors (restricted area access control);
  • Enforce parking by-law at the Sudbury Airport (YSB) & collects all YSB vehicle parking lot fees;
  • Operate a variety of security and parking equipment including CCTV, Parking Pay & Display Units, Parking Cash Register & Pay on Foot Station, Recording systems, PA System, Portable Radios, etc.;
  • Respond to screening checkpoint and other airport restricted area alarms;
  • Perform security patrols and responses throughout the airport as well as tenant facilities;
  • Complete daily logs, deficiency reports and incident/occurrence reports;
  • Carry out customer service-related duties which includes hand shoveling of snow, greeting passengers & assisting with luggage when required, etc.;
  • Perform emergency response duties in accordance with the Airport Emergency Response Manual.

Who you are:

  • Minimum High School diploma or Grade 12 education;
  • Proficient computer skills such as Microsoft Office;
  • Self-motivated individual with a strong attention to detail.
  • Excellent written & verbal communication and active listening skills;
  • Must Possess a valid Security licence, Ontario Drivers Licence (G or Higher) with a clear a driving abstract and Basic First Aid and CPR certification;
  • Must be willing to provide Criminal Record check upon request;
  • Possession of a valid Restricted Area Identity Card (RAIC) is an asset;
  • Possession of a valid Airside Vehicle Operator's Permit (AVOP D/DA) is an asset.

Why you should work with A.S.P:

  • We offer competitive salaries;

  • Free airport parking when on shift

A.S.P. Incorporated is committed to support a diverse workforce from various communities within which we operate. We encourage all qualified professionals, without regard to race, gender identity, colour, sex, marital / family status, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, aboriginal status, age, etc. to apply.

To apply please send your cover letter and resume toNadia Onorato @ nonorato

sgallagher@security-asp.com

About Skanna Systems & Investigations Inc.:

All Skanna Investigators and Security Guards are licensed by the Government of Ontario, bonded and insured. Their initial and on going training ensures that they have the skills to get the job done. Professional Conduct

title: Concierge Security Guard - Full Time
description:
Regal Security Inc. is currently seeking a Full-Time Concierge Security Guardat one of our sites located in the Downtown TorontoArea, ON area.

 

The Ideal Candidate must have: 

 

  • Full-time availability to work all days of the week and schedules that will consist of afternoons, overnight and weekend shifts â€“ including holidays.
  • Demonstrated experience in either a senior security role or supervisor
  • Customer service-driven individual
  • Clear English communication skills in all areas (verbal and written)
  • Detailed and thorough record-keeping (Memo book, incident reports, etc.)
  • Keen observation and attentiveness
  • Professional physical deportment and presentation
  • Decision Making, Reliable, Common Sense and exceptional judgment

 

Job Duties and Responsibilities:

 

  • Provide outstanding and personalized customer service as a front line representative of Regal Security
  • Act as Regalâ€™s day to day point of contact for our individual client and field staff inquiries
  • Supervise contracted site to ensure security staff are meeting company standards in terms of uniforming, training and site procedures
  • Operate and maintain an organized environment
  • Enforce property rules and regulations to maintain the security and safety of our clients and their assets
  • Ensure enforcement of Trespass to Property Act
  • Safely operate and maintain company and client-issued equipment and supplies.
  • Respond to major incidents on property and aid security staff with managing the situation (fire, flood, medical issue and criminal activity)
  • Ensure that safety and emergency protocols are completed in response to Fire Alarms and other Site Emergencies
  • Complete walking patrols and inspections of facilities and equipment as required
  • Review, know and follow post orders as identified for site representing
  • Maintain a safe working environment and follow the facilities health and safety procedures
  • Duties as otherwise assigned

 

Qualifications:

  • Valid Ontario Security License
  • Valid First Aid/CPR Certification
  • Valid WHMIS Certification
  • Secondary School Diploma or equivalent and higher (preference will be given to those with a Criminal Justice or Business post-secondary education)
  • Proficient in the use of various computer programs (i.e. Microsoft Office, Gmail) and able to adapt and learn a new program.

 

Compensation:

  • The pay rate will be up to $17.09 per hour.
  • Health Benefits are available for full-time employees upon completion of 3 months probation.
     

Why choose Regal Security?

 

Regal Security Inc. is an established and growing security company that offers a vast array of professional and dependable security guard services across the Greater Toronto Area and Southwest Ontario.

Our Everyday Superheroâ„¢ guards are selected and trained to protect the clientâ€™s assets, property, employees, and tenants, using a custom-designed security solution for every client within the sectors we serve.

Every member of the Regal security team and every service carried out is directed by the Regal guiding principle: Strength & Honorâ„¢. With this in mind, Regalâ€™s security guards are known as Everyday Superheroesâ„¢ â€“ they are friendly, well-trained and, most importantly, proud, as they go above and beyond the call of duty to uphold Regalâ€™s high standards.

 

â€œTHE REGAL SECURITY MISSION IS â€œYOUR PEACE OF MINDâ€â„¢.â€

 

Thank you for your application. Unfortunately, due to the high volume of applicants, only those deemed eligible for an interview will be contacted. All candidates will be communicated to by phone or email for the recruitment process.

Regal Security Inc. welcomes all candidates equally and encourages all qualified candidates, from women and men, including persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and Aboriginal persons, to apply.

Regal provides accommodation for applicants with disabilities during the recruitment process in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Security Guard- Canadian Coast Guard
company: Commissionaires Victoria, The Islands And Yukon
description:
$500 signing bonus for applicants with an existing security license! *

WORK WITH US, NOT FOR US

Join the Commissionaires!

As the only not-for-profit security company, our focus is on our employees. Over 90% of our revenues go directly back to our staff in health & dental benefits, RRSP contributions, employee recognition programs, and more.

Our recent partnership with BMO Financial Group offers our staff prime mortgage and loan rates, discounted banking options, exclusive investment options and more. Life is unpredictable, but the Commissionaires and BMO can help you to secure your future.

Frequently promoting from within, we are always looking for responsible, top performers who want to advance their careers. Our reputation is built on 80 years and our 20,000 security professionals with varied backgrounds of all ages. We are a dedicated equal opportunity employer with flexible shifts across Vancouver Island to suit every lifestyle â€“ student, parent, night owl, you name it!

As one of Canada's oldest security organizations, our security professionals keep airports, schools, government facilities, and other commercial enterprises safe. We also work with police departments and municipalities to help in keeping Canadians safe.

Reach your full potential today!

 

Location: Federal site - Coast Guard

Reports to: Site Manager

Shifts: 15:00-23:00 and 23:00-0700 (Rotating- 5 on/3 off, 5 on/2 off)

Wage: $17.69/hr (includes 2.%% RRSP cash)

Position Status: Union - Public Service Alliance of Canada

 

Job Responsibilities

  • Provide access control, ID checks and regular security foot patrols.
  • Proactively respond to and resolve emergency situations and conflicts.
  • Complete evacuation and emergency response procedures.
  • Communicate problems or concerns to the site supervisor.
  • Possess excellent multi-tasking, problem solving, prioritizing and organizational abilities.
  • Have knowledge of occupational health and safety regulations.
  • Use a cell phone and write incident reports as needed.
  • Perform all duties with high safety standards.

 

Required Education, Qualifications and Experience

  • Must be have or be able to obtain a Government of Canada level II (Secret) security clearance
  • No security license? No problem! We will help you through the simple process and will pay for your Basic Security Training. Already have one? We will pay you a hiring bonus!
  • Must be physically fit and able to walk patrols.
  • Must be able to work in a range of weather conditions throughout shift.
  • Must be fluent in the English language - written, verbal and reading skills.
  • Must have a positive attitude with a professional demeanour, and strong interpersonal skills.
  • Have excellent attention to detail and incident report writing skills.
  • Have excellent problem solving skills with an ability to handle emergency situations in a calm manner.
  • Have the ability to work independently and make sound decisions in varying situations.
  • Have a demonstrated interest and experience in serving the public.

 

Rewards & Perks

  • Exclusive BMO mortgage rates, banking options, and more.
  • Opportunities for advancement.
  • Free and paid training programs. 
  • Flexible work schedule â€“ maximize work-life balance!
  • Recognition programs.  
  • Paid sick, vacation and personal needs time-off.
  • Group-life, medical & dental coverage.
  • Mental health supports and dedicated HR team. 
  • Free uniform and dry-cleaning reimbursement.
  • BC Transit Pro Pass.
  • Safety boot reimbursement.
  • Personal protective equipment provided. 
  • RRSP contributions.
  • Referral bonuses.
  • And more!

 

*$500 signing bonus paid out after 6 months of full-time employment

Commissionaires Victoria, the Islands, and Yukon proudly celebrates diversity through an inclusive work environment, and welcomes applications from candidates of all backgrounds.

title: Security Guards with MTSC
description:
Westguard is currently hiring for qualified security professionals with Marine Transport Security Clearances (MTSC) - $19.50 an hour!

Our mission at Westguard is to make people feel safe. As a security professional with MTSC you'll be responsible for the protection of people and assets by patrolling designated areas, identifying, and reporting safety hazards and reporting security breaches, as well as completing all reporting and radio check-ins. Other duties may include responding to alarms and emergencies and controlling access to the site. You will provide excellent customer service to our clients and guests, while providing a visual security presence to deter and detect unauthorized guests.

What Would You Bring:

  • BC Security Licence
  • Marine Transportation Security Clearance (MTSC) (suitable candidate may be sponsored)
  • Class 5 Drivers License
  • Excellent Customer Service Skills
  • Ability to walk and stand for an entire eight-hour shift
  • Confidence in handling and deescalating confrontation in an assertive, calm and respectful manner.
  • Comfort working independently and in varying weather conditions
  • Ability to lift, carry and push weights of up to 50 pounds

Availability:

  • Full Time
  • Days, Afternoons, Overnights
  • Weekdays and Weekends

Who we are:

Westguard Security Services believes that every person deserves a safe environment to live, visit and work. Founded in 1986 and with more than 200 employees, Westguard remains a leader in the security industry today, delivering creative and innovative security solutions.

Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Paid Training
  • Flexible Schedules & Work life balance
  • Extended Health and Dental Benefits
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS Babylon
  • Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians
  • Access to a robust corporate discount program, Perkopolis
  • Discounted cineplex movie tickets
  • Discounts for an Annual Grouse Mountain Gondola Pass

At Westguard, we believe you can make a difference - by making people feel safe, caring for the people around you and supporting your community.

Westguard is an equal opportunity employer, and we value the diversity of our staff. We are committed to building a facilitative environment of respect, inclusiveness, and career growth. Join our amazing team and help make people feel safe.

title: Security Officer
description:
Requisition #010-2022-2373371
Job LocationCanada-Ontario-Milton
Job StreamSecurity and Surveillance
Job TypePermanent, Part-Time
Expiry Date
Travel RequiredNot Required
Educational RequirementsHigh School

Requisition #010-2022-2373371
Job LocationCanada-Ontario-Milton
Job StreamSecurity and Surveillance
Job TypePermanent, Part-Time
Expiry Date
Travel RequiredNot Required
Educational RequirementsHigh School
Languages RequiredEnglish
On-Going Opportunities Description

The Security Officer’s role is to protect the company’s assets while being a welcoming ambassador to the Casino. Security
Officers will protect all guests and team members against theft, fraud, vandalism and abuse while delivering the highest
level of service and respect to patrons and colleagues. You will perform a number of varying duties throughout your shift,
including controlling access to the facility and sensitive areas, escorting visitors, assisting departments, lost and found,
and monitoring and recording within a daily log and assigned notebook. You may also be required to provide first aid and
medical attention. At all times, you must be aware of the gaming operations, and you will work under the Alcohol and
Gaming Commission of Ontario (AGCO) regulations and comply with all applicable laws, policies and procedures.
The successful candidate will possess:
• Ability to exceed internal and external guest expectations through timely, effective and service-oriented
communication;
• Two (2) years of experience working with the public in a service role or in the service industry;
• Excellent problem solving and conflict resolution capabilities;
• High school diploma or equivalent required, post-secondary education an asset;
• Previous experience or training in security an asset;
• A willingness to learn, develop and achieve new skills for personal and professional development;
• Computer literacy in MS Office;
• Ability to successfully obtain Smart Serve certification;
• Inquisitive, investigative mind, able to identify suspicious behaviours /transactions and make sound judgments
based on this;
• Able to organize data with great accuracy;
• Knowledge of privacy legislation an asset;
• A current First Aid/CPR certification;
• The ability to obtain registration as a Category 2 Gaming Assistant with the Alcohol and Gaming Commission of
Ontario.
INTERESTED APPLICANTS MUST FORWARD AN INTERNAL APPLICATION FORM TO
onmohrecruitment@elementsmohawk.com BY 5:00 P.M. ON THE DEADLINE.
Great Canadian Gaming Corporation is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we welcome all qualified
applicants to apply to join our team of unique contributors. We accommodate people with disabilities throughout the
recruitment and selection process and applicants are encouraged to advise Human Resources in advance if an
accommodation is required. We thank all applicants for their interest and will contact those qualified to continue in the
recruitment process.

title: Experienced Security Officers - Downtown Vancouver High Profile Location - FULL TIME
description:
British Columbia's Leading Security Solutions Provider


Experienced Security Officers - Downtown Vancouver High Profile Location - FULL TIME Employment Opportunity

Fusion Security, a fast-growing and respected security company, is searching for experienced, professional security officers with excellent customer service skills for a high-profile building in Downtown Vancouver.

What you will be doing:

  • Responding to client requests and on-site emergencies
  • High-visibility patrolling to guard against theft, trespassing, vandalism and fire
  • Providing face-to-face customer service to tenants and patrons
  • Recording and tracking all security-related activity on the premises
  • Responding to alarms and conducting investigations

Who you are:

  • A positive and proactive individual who is also a strong team player
  • An experienced security officer with minimum two years' experience
  • A good communicator (written, verbal, and listening)
  • Possess a valid BC Security License
  • Have 24/7 availability
  • Capable of standing/walking for long periods of time
  • Have excellent customer service & professional deportment
  • Certified in OFA (Occupational First Aid) Level 1
  • Certified in AST (Advanced Security Training)

Also, you should know:

  • Starting minimum wage for this position is for professional, experienced candidates with higher wage considered based on applicable qualifications including years of experience, demonstrated customer service skills, and OFA and AST certifications.
  • We offer an awesome health benefits package (we pay 100% of your medical premiums)
  • We pay for your continuous training and development
  • You get a free gym membership

We want to speak with you. Please apply through our website by clicking on the following: Job Listings - Fusion Security Jobs (prevueaps.com). We thank all applicants for their interest, but we will only be contacting those who are qualified for this position.

Fusion Security is an Equal Opportunity Employer and welcomes applications from candidates, regardless of race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, sex, age or mental or physical disability. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all stages of the recruitment process.

Suite 160 - 4321 Still Creek Drive, Burnaby, BC

title: Loss Prevention Specialist: Full Time
description:
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • This is a plain clothed/undercover positon in multiple locations
  • Detain and interview persons apprehended for shoplifting in accordance with local laws and company procedures. Complete investigative case packages and statements regarding all internal/external theft and fraud for local police agencies

  • Check physical security of The Home Depot facilities to prevent and deter theft/fraudulent activity
  • Represent the Home Depot in a professional manner throughout all court-related procedures
  • Maintain an open channel of communication with store management and all associates
  • Partner with store management to drive LP issues

  • Valid Security and Drivers Licenses as required by the Province

title: Security Guard - Retail - Part-time
description:
Overview:

We are North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider with over 300,000 phenomenal employees. At Allied Universal ®, we pride ourselves on fostering a promote from within culture. There are countless examples of individuals who began their career as Security Professionals and today hold positions on our senior leadership team. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, and vision coverage, life insurance, employee assistance programs, and more! We also offer company paid uniforms and part-time and flexible schedules!

Job Description:

Allied Universal is seeking Professional Security Guards  in Canada.    

 

Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • React to Public or Employee safety issues by informing Management of incidents.
  • Be visible to Customers as they enter the Retail premises.
  • Perform access control duties  
  • Acknowledge customers as they enter and exit the Store.
  • Direct all customers that have items for return to the Customer Service location.
  • Verifying customer receipts.
  • Must follow Covid 19 procedures and guidelines  

Weekend Shifts: Saturday/Sunday - 1400-2200

 

Essential Employment Requirements:

  • Full availability to work all days of the week and schedules that consist of days, afternoons and evenings is an asset.
  • Must have valid First Aid and CPR
  • Must have valid Provincial Security Guard licence
  • Minimum High school education/equivalence
  • Excellent Customer Service skills.
  • Must demonstrate excellence communication skills  
  • Be able to stand/walk for extended periods of time.                
Closing:

Allied Universal ®  provides unparalleled service, systems and solutions to the people and business of our communities, and is North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider. Allied Universal delivers high-quality, tailored solutions, which allows clients to focus on their core business. For more information:  www.AUSecurity.ca.

title: Loss Prevention Officer
description:
London Drugs is looking for highly capable security and investigations professionals for our Loss Prevention team. You will find state of the art technology, training and support, and a high integrity group of people committed to excellence on our team.

Not just a job…a communitya partnershipa team

You’ll experience them all at London Drugs. As one of Canada’s fastest-growing and most successful retail chains, we know what it takes to build a satisfying career. We are seeking innovative, customer focused people to join our team!

Opportunity:Loss Prevention Officer 

Responsibilities:The Loss Prevention Officer position is well-suited for a highly capable security and investigations professional that thrives on working within a team environment.

Duties include:
  • Shifts at store locations conducting surveillance, investigation, and maintenance of loss prevention systems
  • Identifying areas of loss and working on team shrink reduction plans
  • Detection and apprehension of persons committing criminal offences against the company
  • Securing evidence, report writing & document preparation for court testifying purposes
  • Special assignments including lock repair, key control, staff awareness and orientation
  • Maintaining the overall security of our locations
QualificationsWe have an extensive in-house training program (in BC we are an accredited BST training provider). While we are eager to develop our people, candidates should possess the following skills and qualifications:
  • Demonstrated ability to stay calm and respond with good judgment in emergency situations
  • A commitment and history of protecting people and property in a safe and legal manner
  • Demonstrated ability to work under strict confidentiality
  • High ethical standards and a commitment to personal and professional integrity
  • Good command of the English language, both written and verbal, required for report writing and court testimony
  • A valid Class 5 driver’s license and own vehicle
  • Availability and willingness to work at all locations and surrounding areas
  • Previous Loss Prevention experience or other related experience within the Criminal Justice system would be an asset
  • Previous security related education, professional accreditation, first aid and first responder training is an asset
  • Use of force and restraining device training is an asset
  • Provincial security worker license, or the ability to obtain one before commencing work
Availability RequirementThis is a Full Time position.  Employees must be available to work a flexible schedule, Monday through Sunday, for day and evening shifts.
We are an equal opportunity employer. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work applicable to this position and are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. Be advised, London Drugs DOES NOT use third party recruitment services.

London Drugs may collect, use, and/or disclose your personal information (including the information in this application) where it is reasonable for establishing, managing or terminating an employment relationship. This includes the use or disclosure of your personal information to persons inside or external to our organization, for the purpose of checking references or gathering other information to support an assessment of your candidacy.

To protect yourself, do not respond to unsolicited job offers from individuals or e-mail addresses, and never disclose any sensitive details about your identity (including personal or financial) to anyone you do not know or trust or on any unverified website, or website you do not trust.

title: Loss Control Specialist - Canada
description:
About Our Company:

Are you looking for a challenging career that rewards hard work and success?   AFIRM is committed to finding outstanding people who have the ambition and willingness to learn in order to succeed.   The most successful candidates will be detail-oriented, self-motivated and possess strong problem-solving and analytical skills.  

 

AFIRM is the national leader in risk control, consulting services as well as commercial and residential inspections.   We provide our exceptional services to insurers, brokers, risk managers and government agencies.

 

Equal Opportunity Employer

The H.W. Kaufman Group of companies is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other status or condition protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

 

 

Qualifications:

Our Inspectorsâ€™ education and training:

 

  • Inspectors come from all walks of life with their own experience and background
  • AFIRM provides its candidates and Inspectors with a valuable set of skills unlike any other
  • They have all successfully completed AFIRMâ€™s own self-directed, on-line training certification program
  • Continue to hone their skills with AFIRMâ€™s on-going distance learning opportunities

 

 

Our Inspectorsâ€™ work environment      

 

  • As independent contractors with AFIRM, our inspectors work from home
  • They travel to various locations from their home base to assigned locations
  • Work evenings and weekends whenever required to maintain customer satisfaction

 

 

What all our Inspectors must have:

 

  • A reliable vehicle
  • Mobile phone
  • Windows based computer
  • Internet connection (high speed preferably)
  • Digital camera or smart phone that takes high quality digital pictures
Responsibilities:

 

AFIRM is a global leader in Loss Prevention and Premium Audit with Canadian locations in Richmond Hill and Montreal.   We are currently seeking independent Loss Prevention service contractors.

 

Our Loss Control Representatives (Inspectors) visit various property locations on behalf of the ownerâ€™s insurance company with a goal to minimize potential losses.   There is no selling involved.   Requests for inspection are received directly from the insurance companies.

 

Our successful Inspectors are:

 

  • Outgoing and independent
  • Curious and inquisitive by nature
  • Self-motivated strivers
  • Well organized and manage their time efficiently
  • Focused on quality of service
  • Competent computer skills with good input speed & accuracy
  • Skilled at writing well

 

What our Inspectors do:

 

  • Take responsibility for; and organize their assignments
  • Schedule their own appointments with property owners
  • Travel to the location
  • Tour the property and collect information (Residential and Commercial)
  • Identify potential areas of loss such as fire, theft and liability
  • Take photographs and measure buildings
  • Prepare a pre-define Loss Control report of the property using AFIRMâ€™s own web-based platform

title: Asset Protection Agent
description:
About Gap


Gap has always been about optimistic American style. Starting with our very first store on Ocean Avenue in San Francisco, opened almost 50 years ago by Doris and Don Fisher. The thread that’s run through those five decades is the phenomenal people that make up our brand – our employees and our customers. People who are rooted in the legacy that makes Gap what it is, but who are also focused on the future. People who want to leave the world better than they found it.


We’ve built our brand on staying true to our roots while always being out in front of what’s next. If you want to be part of an iconic American brand, and help lead the way for where we’re headed, we’d love to have you join us.


About the Role


In this role, you will embody our value of Doing The Right Thing by protecting People, Assets, and Brands. You will work in a energized, fast paced environment focused on creating a safe environment for our employees, teams, and customers; this is critical to driving our Brand power, enduring customer relationships, and exuding our commitment to team and values. You’ll need to understand the big picture strategy and work with cross-functional teams and external partners.


What You'll Do


+ Partner with store leadership to develop and implement an Asset Protection strategy to mitigate risk and loss within our Gap Inc stores

+ Assist with investigations and utilize all available resources to identify and resolve crime activity in assigned locations

+ Assist with the implementation and continued execution of the shortage reduction program

+ Work with store personnel to identify inventory shortage opportunities and recommend solutions

+ Determine the assignment of appropriate Asset Protection resources (i.e.: agents, technology, etc.) to address shortage reduction opportunities

+ Courteous and responsive to internal/external request

+ Exchange and verifies job related information to provide support


Who You Are


+ Ability to provide Asset Protection leadership to drive results, coach and develop direct reports, collaborate and lead execution through others

+ Strong communication and interpersonal skills, including the ability to negotiate and build consensus across multiple stakeholders and functions

+ Ability to actively learn and immediately apply learnings into decisions and behaviors

+ Ability to manage and prioritize their time; able to multi task

+ Ability to learn procedural knowledge acquired through on-the-job training


Benefits at Gap


+ Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Gap, Banana Republic, Old Navy and Athleta, 30% off at Outlet, and 10% off markdowns at Gap, Banana Republic and Outlet.

+ Competitive Paid Time Off plans.*

+ Company match for donations and volunteer time*

+ Registered Retirement Savings Plan

+ Employee stock purchase plan.*

+ Medical, dental, vision and life insurance.*

+ Virtual health care 24/7*

+ Maternity/Parental Top Up.*

+ See more of the benefits we offer.


*For eligible employees


Gap Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status. We have received numerous awards for our long-held commitment to equality and will continue to foster a diverse and inclusive environment of belonging. This year, we’ve been named as one of the Best Places to Work by the Human Rights Campaign (https://www.hrc.org/resources/best-places-to-work-for-lgbtq-equality-2022) for the seventeenth consecutive year and have been included in the 2021 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index for the fourth year in a row.

title: Security Supervisor – Remote Camp
description:
Securiguard, Canada's provider of corporate security, is seeking Security Supervisors for sites in the BC Interior.

Start Date: April 25, 2022

Deadline for Resumes: April 11, 2022

Hours of work: 12-hour shifts, 14 days on 14 days off

Job overview:

Our mission at Securiguard is to make people feel safe. As a Security Supervisor, you'll be responsible for leading and motivating a team of security officers and ensuring site coverage and the integrity of emergency response.

Leading my example, you will also ensure the professionalism and deportment of security officers on site, including coaching, mentoring, and training, and performance management.

In this role, you will be working in an industrial environment, supporting a large and exciting critical infrastructure project in a remote area. You'll be dedicated to safety and maintaining a safe work environment for all by following and enforcing all safety protocols, ensuring all team members have valid and up-to-date safety orientations, and identifying and reporting any hazards. As part of your role as Supervisor, you will also be responsible for ensuring team compliance with all COVID-19 protocols, ensuring adherence to full PPE in the field, temperature checks and declarations are submitted.

Candidate requirements:

  • Valid BC Security License
  • Class 5 Driver's License with a clean driving abstract and claims history
  • At least 1 year of experience in the private security sector
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills, with demonstrated experience in preparing security reports.
  • Ability to lead the team in emergency situations in a firm, confident manner
  • Strong communicator with assertive interpersonal skills, sensitivity and the ability to motivate a team
  • Positive and professional attitude, with the ability to de-escalate situations and maintain a customer service demeaner
  • Must be able to pass a pre-employment drug screening test
  • Must be comfortable working in a wilderness setting for extended periods of time
  • Must be able to work a 12-hour shift (day or night), with full time availability.
  • Proficient with MS Office and comfortable with using computers.

A bonus if you have:

  • Previous experience supervising a team
  • Supervising for Safety Ticket
  • Occupational First Aid Level 1
  • Pipeline Construction Safety Training
  • Experience working in an Industrial security environment, with knowledge of relevant Health & Safety Protocols and WorkSafe BC Regulations

Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Daily & weekly overtime
  • Work Life balance
  • Extended health and dental benefits
  • Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians through TELUS Health
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS health
  • Discounts on Cineplex movie tickets and more

More about Securiguard:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

We make people feel safe and inspire our staff to believe they can make a difference in everything they do. We believe that diversity enables the company to grow towards a better future. Our mission, vision, and values enabled us to be a finalist of the 2021 Canadian HR Awards' Excellence in Diversity & Inclusion category and one of the winners of the 2021 Most Admired Corporate Culture Award!

Securiguard is committed to maximizing employment and training opportunities for Indigenous, local and regional residents. If you identify as a member of an Indigenous community, we encourage you to self-identify in our optional screening question.

title: Security Supervisor - New Brunswick
description:
POSITION TITLE: Security Supervisor

DEPARTMENT: Operations

DATE: ASAP

Position Overview: The Security Supervisor is responsible for supervising the activities and job performance of Security Officers assigned to all areas belonging to their facility. The Security Supervisor is expected to represent Paladin Security Group as well as the facility to which they are assigned.

Why Choose Paladin 

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training 
  • Co-pay Benefits 
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement 

Essential Job Functions:

  • Provide leadership, direction, and ongoing coaching, and training
  • Ensures all standing orders and scheduled daily activities are carried out as required for each shift
  • Ensures site staff adhere to all Paladin Security and college campus security policies and procedures
  • Plans and implements shift work schedule
  • Ensures all Security Officers have received the mandatory training
  • Motivates staff and issues commendations
  • Disciplines staff when necessary and ensures proper documentation is passed onto head office
  • Attendance management
  • Performs security audits
  • Documents and investigates security incidents and complaints
  • Provide proactive and reactive security patrols.
  • Communicates any concerns/issues with Client Service Manager
  • Develop and maintain effective relationships with the frontline staff
  • Assist in development and implementation of department specific policies & procedures
  • Review incident reports and provide feedback to frontline staff
  • Respond to high-level incidents and support as needed
  • Work as a liaison between leadership and frontline staff
  • Assist in developing security plans for high-risk patients
  • Participate in hiring and onboarding processes for new staff

Position Requirements:

  • At least two years’ security experience in a leadership role
  • Post-Secondary education in a law enforcement/security program is an asset
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact, and diplomacy
  • Immunization Record
  • First Aid & CRP Level C (asset if current, if not will train if successful)
  • Valid New Brunswick Security License

Your Impact 

Paladin Security: Making the World a Safer and Friendlier Place! Do you have superior customer service skills and a passion for helping people? Are you able to think quickly on your feet and defuse difficult situations? Your track record of handling a great deal of responsibility combined with your varied life experience and enthusiasm for a job well done make you an ideal candidate for our team! The Paladin Difference starts with our officers; we're the best because we hire the best. We believe in promoting from within, respecting people and their differences, providing high quality service and always having fun! If you think you have what it takes to join our team, we want to meet you!

title: Security Guard - St. Clair Centre for Arts - Part Time (Saturdays and Sundays) - Windsor, ON
description:
Site:                                    St. Clair College Centre for the Arts

City:                                    Windsor, Ontario

Status:                               Part Time 

Hours:                                Saturdays and Sundays (0730-1930)

Pay Rate:                           $17.28/hour

 

Position Overview:

Working assigned shifts, you will be responsible for patrolling the campus and monitoring surveillance cameras and completing written reports.

You will be expected to perform regular patrols and interact with students, staff and members of the public to provide direction and promote good customer service while providing a security presence.

 

Essential Job Functions:

  • Implement security measures to protect property, control access to sites, patrol assigned areas to monitor activities and ensure client rules and regulations are followed.
  • Maintain written reports.
  • Perform security checks and liaise with students, customers, and the public.
  • Ensure site safety and emergency procedures are followed and maintain written reports.
  • Enforce compliance to company policies and procedures.
  • First aid – be prepared to administer when required.
  • Maintaining a positive, productive work environment through collaboration.
  • Perform miscellaneous job – related duties as assigned.

 

Please note, students currently enrolled with St. Clair College are not eligible to apply to this position.

 

Job Requirements:

  • Must possess Ontario Security Guard License.
  • First Aid & CPR – Level C
  • Valid G Class Ontario Drivers Licence & Drivers Abstract
  • Post-Secondary education in law enforcement from a recognized institution or equivalent experience.
  • Physical Demands include excessive walking and standing.
  • Patrol area on foot and vehicle as assigned, to ensure personal, building, and equipment security.
  • Utilize radio and computer applications for communicating site activities.
  • Watch for and report irregularities by completing incident reports, such as security breaches, facility and safety hazards, and emergency situations; contact emergency responders, such as police, fire, and/or ambulance personnel, as required.
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills.
  • Must possess excellent computer skills.
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy.
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.

 

Highlights:

  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement
  • Extensive Paid Industry Training

title: Mobile Security Guard in Vaughan
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

If you are seeking a job where no two days are the same, this one is for you! As a Security Guard on Mobile Patrol, you will be working in a variety of settings including but not limited to condominiums, commercial properties, and malls.     

We provide people with growth opportunities. 30% of our frontline employees are promoted to become part of our operation teams. 

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in {City} now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, we have a position that will accommodate your needs and help you reach your goals.  

What's in it for you?

  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits  

  • We can guarantee 40 hours/week 

  • Uniform provided free of charge 

  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld 

  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus like Use of Force training 

What does a Security Guard in Vaughan do?

  • Patrolling in a variety of settings (mobile and foot) 

  • Enforcing property rules, city by-laws, and other applicable laws 

  • Deterring and responding to incidents on the property 

  • Responding to various types of emergencies 

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in Vaughan

  • A valid security guard license and first aid card 

  • A valid driver's license 

  • Available to work flexible hours 

  • Have a clear criminal background and driving record 

  • Be eligible to work in Canada

title: Event Security Guards Required
description:
Securiguard is committed to building a facilitative environment of respect and personal growth for all of our staff. We support this commitment with highly competitive compensation and benefits, comprehensive training, reliable equipment and supportive supervision as well as great opportunities for advancement, community involvement and work/life balance practices.

Currently we are accepting Security applicants to join for work in Kelowna, Kamloops, Vernon, Penticton and other surrounding areas with ongoing events expected year round.

Responsibilities:

  • Greeting and welcoming all guests in the area
  • Conducting access control and traffic control
  • Providing excellent customer service
  • Coordinating & liaising with Police and other Emergency Service Providers as required
  • Providing detailed reports including: occurrence reports, incident reports, and patrol reports as required.
  • Reporting and documenting any safety hazards to the Operations Manager
  • Crowd control and surveillance
  • Managing any incidents that occur onsite

Requirements:

  • Valid BC Security Worker's license (or ability to attain - temporary is okay!)
  • Must be able to stand/walk for an 8+ hr. period.
  • Customer service experience and ability to provide excellent customer service
  • Great communication skills, verbally and written
  • Must be comfortable with radio communication
  • Ability to handle a situation with a listening mindset
  • Must be available evenings and weekends (and some holidays)
  • Class 5 driver's license is required

DO NOT HAVE SECURITY WORKERS LICENSE?

  • 90-day license program- Can work as a Security Guard at an event with a temporary 90-day license with simple procedure of criminal background checks. Having a 90 days license can help you kick start towards acquiring permanent security license.
  • BST (Basic Security training) leading towards acquiring permanent valid security license.

About us:

Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects, Events and has the largest and highest accredited K-9 detection and screening division in Canada.

With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea, our team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals provide people with a feeling of safety by offering a comprehensive selection of security services and solutions.

We make people feel safe and inspire our staff to believe they can make a difference in everything they do. We believe that diversity enables the company to grow towards a better future. By creating an environment which is inclusive and provides equal opportunity for all, ideas are generated which help to solve the problems of a changing and increasingly complex world. Our mission, vision, and values enabled us to be the 2021 winners of Canada's Most Admired Corporate Culture and a finalist of the 2021 Canadian HR Awards' Excellence in Diversity & Inclusion category. Join our amazing team and help make people feel safe.


Apply online today!

title: Security Officer - Hospital
description:
Description

PeaceHealth is seeking a Security Officer - Security Parking for a Per Diem/Relief FTE, Variable position. Hourly compensation starts at $19.37, more depending on experience.

Must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 including 2 doses of a 2-dose series or 1 dose of a 1-dose series plus 14 days beyond the final dose prior to start date.

JOB SUMMARY

The Security Officer is responsible for providing safety and security services which requires regular interactions with patients, visitors, caregivers and clinicians in highly diverse and complex situations. Interacts with local law enforcement to provide information, clarification of events and coordinate emergency protocols. Performs internal and external security patrol of assigned hospitals and/or clinics; dispatch; and access control as assigned.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

1. Provides safety and security services which includes; patrolling grounds, parking lots, buildings, securing entryways and exits, etc. to effectively address potential conduct issues, violations of policy, check for property damage, inspect safety issues, inspect certain safety features such as fire extinguishers or water valves, respond to all codes, address trespassing concerns, provide assistance with out of control patients, and utilizes electronic checkpoints.

2. Provides stand-by service or escort services for protection of caregivers or patients as needed.

3. Provides courtesy services such as providing directions, locksmith functions, jump-starts, changing flat tires, reporting vehicles with lights on, and assisting families in times of crisis.

4. Provides non-violent physical crisis intervention and de-escalation techniques to neutralize extreme situations and mitigate negative outcomes.

5. Provides crowd control during events resulting in an influx of patients and/or visitors.

6. Coordinates information, clarification of events and coordinating emergency protocols which may require collaboration with external safety and law enforcement agencies.

7. Responds to all emergency situations and applies appropriate protocols for the Code, Disaster (command center), ETO Exposure, Fire, Flood, Hazardous spills, and all code situations.

8. May assist flight crew and ground crew with Life Flight/Airlift NW transports and securing landing the pad.

9. Ensures adherence to protocols; completing, filing and maintaining correct documentation, filing reports, monitoring visitor permits, and assists with maintaining building access control by utilizing the computerized badge/door system.

10. Performs other duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS

EDUCATION:

+ High School Diploma or equivalent is preferred.

EXPERIENCE/TRAINING:

+ Minimum of two (2) years , military or civilian security or law enforcement experience is required.

+ Healthcare facility security experience is preferred.

LICENSE/CERTIFICATION:

+ BLS Certification upon hire.

+ Valid state Driver’s License

+ IAHSS (International Assoc for Healthcare Security & Safety) Basic certification required within 45 days of employment.

+ If assigned location requires the use of tasers, successfully pass Taser Training Program. After successful completion of Taser Training Program officers will be required to carry the taser while on duty.

OTHER SKILLS:

+ Excellent verbal and written communication skills

+ Ability to formulate a plan of action, carry it out with control and apply crisis intervention and de-escalation skills

+ Ability to perform data entry as necessary

+ Good physical condition to walk, run and lift as needed

+ Working knowledge of Microsoft Windows, Outlook, Teams, Word, and Excel

+ Acceptable driving record in accordance with the PeaceHealth Motor Vehicle Safety Policy.

ST JOSEPH PHYSICAL/COGNITIVE REQUIREMENTS:

+ Work requires active physical exertion up to 33% of the time.

+ Ability to lift objects weighing 80 lbs. or less.

+ Work requires frequent exposure to conditions involving minor cold, heat, poor ventilation or sharp instruments such as syringes or lancets. Reasonably anticipated exposure to blood and body fluids once per month or more.

+ Job duties occasionally require the ability to concentrate and pay close attention to detail (less than 34% of work time).

+ Ability to assist in managing violent, uncontrollable persons.

See how PeaceHealth is committed to Inclusivity, Respect for Diversity and Cultural Humility (https://www.thecaregiver.org/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/PeaceHealth-Statement-of-Commitment-to-Diversity-and-Inclusion-vFINAL.pdf) .

For full consideration of your skills and abilities, please attach a current resume with your application. EEO Affirmative Action Employer/Vets/Disabled in accordance with applicable local, state or federal laws.

title: Security Guard 2
company: Centre for Addiction and Mental Health
description:
EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY
Security Guard 2
Security Services,Legal Services

Position Description
The Centre for Addiction and Mental Health (CAMH) is seeking (5) in-house casual Security Guard 2 to work in the Security Services department.This is an exciting and valuable opportunity for anyone embarking on a law enforcement career. CAMH Security Services offers above industry average salary and benefits as well as opportunities for full-time placements.

Reporting to the Supervisor of Security Services, the successful candidate will provide security services and assistance to CAMH patients, visitors, staff and volunteers to promote a safe and secure environment. The Security Guard will assist with safety matters; report and respond to emergencies, patrol hospital buildings and grounds; and complete various reports. Other duties include ensuring that all Security and Safety procedures are maintained; protection of life and property; incident investigations; liaising with Emergency responders and the removal of unauthorized persons. You will support a workplace that embraces diversity, encourages teamwork and effective communication as well as complies with all applicable regulatory and legislative requirements. This position involves shift rotation (day, evening, and night) and weekend work. Must adhere to minimum availability. This position is located at 1001 Queen Street West.

Qualifications

  • A valid PSIS’s Security Guard License is required.
  • The ideal candidate will possess 2 Years Community College education in law enforcement field or be in progress of completion.
  • You must have 6 months - 1 year of security experience and be First Aid/CPR Certified.
  • 1 year healthcare experience would be an asset.

You possess the ability to deal tactfully and effectively with the public, staff and patients. You will be a motivated team player with a positive service-oriented approach. You will have strong interpersonal and communication skills with a demonstrated sensitivity towards mental health and addictions clientele. The incumbent must be able to work with minimal supervision, problem-solve and exercise good judgment in varied situations. The successful candidate will possess basic computer skills such as Microsoft Office and Outlook. You will have the ability to cope with physical demands of work. Ability to work with diverse clients and staff is required. Bilingualism (French/English) and/or proficiency in a second language would be an asset.

Vaccines (COVID-19 and others) are a requirement of the job unless you have an exemption on a medical ground pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code.

Please Note: These (5) casual position is part of the OPSEU bargaining unit.

Salary Range: $22.92 - $28.28 per hour

Please click the apply button below.

Posting Date: April 25, 2022
Closing Date: May 4 , 2022 by 5pm
Job Number:897471

CAMH is a Tobacco-Free Organization.

CAMH is fully affiliated with the University of Toronto and is a teaching hospital and research institute. As a CAMH employee, you will be expected to actively support CAMH’s teaching and research activities, in addition to supporting the clinical work of the hospital.

At CAMH, we strive to be an equitable and inclusive employer. Our commitment to equity is grounded in an institution-wide commitment to achieving a working, teaching, and learning environment that is free of discrimination and harassment.

CAMH actively seeks candidates from First Nations, Métis and Inuit, racialized and LGBTQ2S+ communities, women, and people with disabilities (including people who have experienced mental health and substance use challenges).

We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply to our positions.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Please inform us if you require accommodations during the interview process.

Job Description

EXCITING JOB OPPORTUNITY

SECURITY OFFICER – PART TIME PERMANENT

SHORELINES CASINO PETERBOROUGH

(PET-SEC-002-2022)

 

Team up with the industry’s best and provide great guest experiences at Shorelines Casino Peterborough!

We are currently seeking a driven and energetic individual to join our growing business in eastern Ontario as a SECURITY OFFICER. This role will join our team at Shorelines Casino Peterborough. Under the direct supervision of the Regional Manager, Security or the Shift Supervisor, Security, this position is responsible for the safety and protection of employees, guests, the facility and company assets at the site level. Ensures adherence to all policies and procedures while contributing to a safe and welcoming work environment for all employees.

Duties and Responsibilities Include: 

  • Exceeds guest expectations by providing outstanding customer service
  • Helps create an engaged work environment by choosing positivity and fun, recognizing excellent peer performance, and by caring about and supporting our colleagues every day
  • Monitors, documents and reports internal and external violations, unsafe conditions, potential hazards, suspicious persons and activities; prepares electronic statements via a non-gaming record keeping system
  • Enforces restricted access by unauthorized persons
  • Observes cashier transactions and slot drops (if applicable); escorts cash and cash equivalent movements
  • Tags and reports found property; transfers to Lost & Found
  • Conducts regular patrols of the interior and exterior as directed
  • Performs electronic surveillance; maintains site surveillance equipment; reports issues
  • Escorts guests and employees as directed
  • Performs identification checks as required
  • Refers guest disputes to the Supervisor, Security
  • Performs crowd control as directed
  • May enroll guests in the Self-Exclusion Program at some locations
  • Communicates effectively with all appropriate operational departments
  • Builds strong working relationships with guests and employees
  • Complies with licensing laws, health and safety and other statutory regulations
  • Performs other duties as assigned or directed

Successful candidates will demonstrate the following qualifications:

  • People-focused and committed to service excellence
  • Proactive and solution-oriented with a drive to succeed
  • High School Diploma
  • Smart Serve certification
  • Must be willing to recertify for Use of Force every 3 years
  • Occupational First Aid Level 2 an asset
  • Can understand, speak and write English; fluency in other languages an asset
  • Previous security experience an asset

Since the fun never stops at Shorelines, candidates must be ready and willing to work a flexible schedule, including evenings, weekends, holidays and overnights, based on business needs.

 

 

Application Process: Internal candidates please apply by submitting your signed internal application, resume and cover letter to Human Resources via email to HRPET@shorelinescasinos.com by the deadline of April 26th 2022. Thank you for your application and best of luck!

Great Canadian Gaming Corporation is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we welcome all qualified applicants to apply to join our team of unique contributors. We accommodate people with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process and applicants are encouraged to advise Human Resources in advance if an accommodation is required. We thank all applicants for their interest, and will contact those qualified to continue in the recruitment process.

title: Security Officer -Surrey Casual On Call RCMP Guards
description:
Looking to start your career in security services? We have a great opportunity for you! 

Our Story 

Commissionaires BC is a Canadian, not-for-profit security/enforcement organization that has been in business since 1927. Our mandate is to give back to those who served and continue to serve in our communities and country.

Commissionaires provides security services for over 200 sites and are located in over 110 communities across the province. Our client base runs from the Federal Government to local municipalities, airports, industrial sectors, and commercial/residential buildings.  

Our guards are not only behind the scenes providing security and access control, but front and centre providing valued customer service to the public.

We are looking for security guards who are available to work in the Vancouver area. 

Whatâ€™s in it for you 

  • Opportunity for growth
  • Work for a reputable and nationally known company 
  • A challenging yet rewarding work environment 
  • Flexibility of rotations and sites to suit your requirements 
  • Free uniforms 
  • Paid on-site training  
  • Gain valuable experience as a stepping stone into a law enforcement career 

Youâ€™re a good fit ifâ€¦  

  • You hold a positive and can do attitude 
  • You are reliable and committed  
  • You can think on your feet and problem solve 
  • You can work alone or as part of a team 

Some of your responsibilities include: 

  • Patrolling the RCMP sites/locations 
  • Offering first class customer service to both clients and general public 
  • Mobile patrolling/ticketing  
  • Access Control 
  • CCTV Monitoring 
  • Proactively responding to and resolving emergency situations and conflicts  
  • Provide first aid in a prompt,accessible,and appropriate manner
  • Maintaining detailed and accurate daily logs and incident reports 
  • Effectively communicating problems or concerns to the Site Supervisor 
  • Maintaining up-to-date knowledge of site duties and safety standards

Your Must-Haves:

  • BC Security License  
  • You have excellent problem solving skills  
  • Own a Vehicle
  • You have a valid Driverâ€™s Licence with a clean driverâ€™s abstract 
  • You can work under pressure 
  • Able to stand for long periods and work both indoors and outdoors in a range of weather conditions; 
  • You have resided in Canada for the last five years 

Your Nice-To-Haves:

  • Hold OFA 1 or OFA 2

title: Security Guard- Sudbury Airport (CASUAL)
description:
SECURITY GUARD- SUDBURY AIRPORT


Are you passionate about Safety & Security and seeking opportunity to join a team of Security Professionals?


A.S.P. Incorporated has provided security and customer service solutions for over 20 years to Canadian clients. We employ in excess of 2000 employees and are a subsidiary of ICTS EUROPE, which is operating in 22 countries and employing more than 17000 professionals. A.S.P provide services to some of the largest airports in Canada and has a significant presence in the Commercial and Residential spaces in Ontario and Alberta.

A.S.P. in looking for Access Control Officer, who take pride in becoming ambassador of Airport and make every interaction professional and positive. Work with integrity, respect, and take responsibility of the security and safety at the Sudbury Airport.


What you will do:

  • Monitor and controls ground-side to airside access and doors (restricted area access control);
  • Enforce parking by-law at the Sudbury Airport (YSB) & collects all YSB vehicle parking lot fees;
  • Operate a variety of security and parking equipment including CCTV, Parking Pay & Display Units, Parking Cash Register & Pay on Foot Station, Recording systems, PA System, Portable Radios, etc.;
  • Respond to screening checkpoint and other airport restricted area alarms;
  • Perform security patrols and responses throughout the airport as well as tenant facilities;
  • Complete daily logs, deficiency reports and incident/occurrence reports;
  • Carry out customer service-related duties which includes hand shoveling of snow, greeting passengers & assisting with luggage when required, etc.;
  • Perform emergency response duties in accordance with the Airport Emergency Response Manual.

Who you are:

  • Minimum High School diploma or Grade 12 education;
  • Proficient computer skills such as Microsoft Office;
  • Self-motivated individual with a strong attention to detail.
  • Excellent written & verbal communication and active listening skills;
  • Must Possess a valid Security licence, Ontario Drivers Licence (G or Higher) with a clear a driving abstract and Basic First Aid and CPR certification;
  • Must be willing to provide Criminal Record check upon request;
  • Possession of a valid Restricted Area Identity Card (RAIC) is an asset;
  • Possession of a valid Airside Vehicle Operator's Permit (AVOP D/DA) is an asset.

Why you should work with A.S.P:

  • We care about our team and their personal and professional success;
  • We offer competitive salaries;
  • You can have flexible schedules; and
  • Free airport parking when on shift

A.S.P. Incorporated is committed to support a diverse workforce from various communities within which we operate. We encourage all qualified professionals, without regard to race, gender identity, colour, sex, marital / family status, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, aboriginal status, age, etc. to apply.

To apply please send your cover letter and resume toNadia Onorato @ nonorato

sgallagher@security-asp.com

.


We hire for PERSONALITY. We train for the job.

title: Security Guard
description:
Skanna Systems & Investigations Inc. is currently looking for a Full-Time Flexible Security Guard in Bolton, Ontario.

Job Details:
  • Must Drive (Own Vehicle)
  • Full-time
  • Rotational Shifts: afternoon, overnight and weekends

Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Enforce regulations of establishments.
  • Visitor Access Control.
  • Maintain order and follow and adhere to post orders.
  • Use telecommunications (i.e. two-way radio, cell phone, telephone paging systems).
  • Follow radio and emergency telephone procedures.
  • Monitor security cameras.
  • Operate security control room equipment.
  • Patrolling.
  • Ensure safety and emergency procedures are followed.
  • Respond to alarms, bomb threats, and other emergencies.
  • Detect or prevent thefts and vandalism.
  • Report writing.

Qualifications, Required License, or Certification:
  • Must possess a valid Ontario Security Guard License.
  • CPR Level C Certified.
  • Must have a valid Ontario Driver’s license and a reliable vehicle.
  • Must be available to do shift work: afternoon, nights, and weekends.

The Ideal Candidate will possess:
  • Excellent English verbal and written communication skills.
  • Professional work ethics.
  • Must be able to stand for long periods of time.
  • Excellent computer skills and the ability to learn new computer programs site-specific.
  • Excellent Customer Service.
  • Willing to travel 40-50 kilometers to work if needed.

What we offer:
  • Full-time.
  • Employee Incentive Programs.
  • Corporate and Distribution Center environments.


About Skanna Systems & Investigations Inc.:

All Skanna Investigators and Security Guards are licensed by the Government of Ontario, bonded and insured. Their initial and on going training ensures that they have the skills to get the job done. Professional Conduct

title: Overnight Concierge Security Guard - Full Time
description:
Regal Security Inc. is currently seeking a Full-Time Concierge Security Guardat one of our sites located in the Whitchurch-Stouffville, ON area.

 

The Ideal Candidate must have: 

 

  • Full-time availability to work all days of the week and schedules that will consist of afternoons, overnight and weekend shifts â€“ including holidays.
  • Demonstrated experience in either a senior security role or supervisor
  • Customer service-driven individual
  • Clear English communication skills in all areas (verbal and written)
  • Detailed and thorough record-keeping (Memo book, incident reports, etc.)
  • Keen observation and attentiveness
  • Professional physical deportment and presentation
  • Decision Making, Reliable, Common Sense and exceptional judgment
  • Access to a personal vehicle due to limited available of transit in the area.

 

Job Duties and Responsibilities:

 

  • Provide outstanding and personalized customer service as a front line representative of Regal Security
  • Act as Regalâ€™s day to day point of contact for our individual client and field staff inquiries
  • Supervise contracted site to ensure security staff are meeting company standards in terms of uniforming, training and site procedures
  • Operate and maintain an organized environment
  • Enforce property rules and regulations to maintain the security and safety of our clients and their assets
  • Ensure enforcement of Trespass to Property Act
  • Safely operate and maintain company and client-issued equipment and supplies.
  • Respond to major incidents on property and aid security staff with managing the situation (fire, flood, medical issue and criminal activity)
  • Ensure that safety and emergency protocols are completed in response to Fire Alarms and other Site Emergencies
  • Complete walking patrols and inspections of facilities and equipment as required
  • Review, know and follow post orders as identified for site representing
  • Maintain a safe working environment and follow the facilities health and safety procedures
  • Duties as otherwise assigned

 

Qualifications:

  • Valid Ontario Security License
  • Valid First Aid/CPR Certification
  • Valid WHMIS Certification
  • Secondary School Diploma or equivalent and higher (preference will be given to those with a Criminal Justice or Business post-secondary education)
  • Proficient in the use of various computer programs (i.e. Microsoft Office, Gmail) and able to adapt and learn a new program.

 

Compensation:

  • The pay rate will be up to $17 an hour
  • Health Benefits are available for full-time employees upon completion of 3 months probation.
     

Why choose Regal Security?

 

Regal Security Inc. is an established and growing security company that offers a vast array of professional and dependable security guard services across the Greater Toronto Area and Southwest Ontario.

Our Everyday Superheroâ„¢ guards are selected and trained to protect the clientâ€™s assets, property, employees, and tenants, using a custom-designed security solution for every client within the sectors we serve.

Every member of the Regal security team and every service carried out is directed by the Regal guiding principle: Strength & Honorâ„¢. With this in mind, Regalâ€™s security guards are known as Everyday Superheroesâ„¢ â€“ they are friendly, well-trained and, most importantly, proud, as they go above and beyond the call of duty to uphold Regalâ€™s high standards.

 

â€œTHE REGAL SECURITY MISSION IS â€œYOUR PEACE OF MINDâ€â„¢.â€

 

Thank you for your application. Unfortunately, due to the high volume of applicants, only those deemed eligible for an interview will be contacted. All candidates will be communicated to by phone or email for the recruitment process.

Regal Security Inc. welcomes all candidates equally and encourages all qualified candidates, from women and men, including persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and Aboriginal persons, to apply.

Regal provides accommodation for applicants with disabilities during the recruitment process in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Please contact us to request accommodation.
