title: Cruise Ship Terminal Security Guard
description:
Cruise Ship Terminal Security Guard

Location: Vancouver

Hours of work: 12-hour shifts, 8-hour shifts

Shift Hours: 06:00-18:00, 08:00-16:00

Wages:

OFA2 Officer: $23.00

Dock Supervisor: $20.50

Regular Officer: $19.50


What you'll do

Our mission at Westguard to make people feel safe. As a security professional working at the Cruise Ship Terminal at Canada Place you'll be responsible for the protection of people and assets by patrolling designated areas, identifying, and reporting safety hazards, and security concerns.

You will provide excellent customer service to our clients, guests, and cruise passengers while providing a visual security presence.

In this role, you will be working in a passenger terminal environment, supporting a large volume of cruise passengers embarking and disembarking cruise ships while supporting dock operations loading stores and provisions onto the ship. You'll be dedicated to safety and maintaining a safe work environment for all by following all protocols, processes and procedures and taking steps to eliminate and minimize hazards.


Why you'll love working with us:

  • Work life balance
  • Health and Dental Benefits
  • Paid training (including Occupational First Aid 1)
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS Health MyCare
  • Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians through TELUS Health MyCare
  • Corporate Discount Programs which include savings on CINEPLEX tickets, Grouse Mountain gondola passes, travel, clothing and more!
  • Exciting growth opportunities in security and valuable experience for a career in law enforcement, corrections, or civil service

Your skills:

  • Previous work experience in customer service
  • Able to handle himself/herself in high pressure environment
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Ability to read and write descriptive reports in English
  • Share our REACH values (Respect, Empathy, Accountability, Courtesy & Honesty).

Your qualifications:

  • Valid BC Security License
  • Ability to obtain Marine Transportation Security Clearance (MTSC) or Restricted Area Identity Card (RAIC) clearance. Westguard will sponsor and submit clearances for those who do not have them.
  • OFA 1 (Paid training will be provided for those needing to obtain certification)
  • OFA 2 (Paid training will be provided for those needing to obtain certification)

Who we are:

Westguard Security Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how we have become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Westguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

At Westguard we believe in living and acting by our values: R.E.A.C.H. · Respect · Empathy · Accountability · Courtesy & · Honesty. Our mission, vision, and values enabled us to be a finalist of the 2021 Canadian HR Awards' Excellence in Diversity & Inclusion category. We celebrate people of diverse backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives, and we believe that diversity enables the company to grow towards a better future.Join us if you believe you can make a difference.


Westguard is committed to maximizing employment and training opportunities for Indigenous, local, and regional residents. If you identify as a member of an Indigenous community, we encourage you to self-identify in our optional screening question.

title: Security Guard- Part Time and Casual Opportunities
company: Commissionaires Victoria, The Islands And Yukon
description:
$500 signing bonus for applicants with an existing security license! *

WORK WITH US, NOT FOR US

 

Join the Commissionaires!

As the only not-for-profit security company, our focus is on our employees. Over 90% of our revenues go directly back to our staff in profit share bonuses, health & dental benefits, RRSP contributions, employee recognition programs, and more.

Our recent partnership with BMO Financial Group offers our staff prime mortgage and loan rates, discounted banking options, exclusive investment options and more. Life is unpredictable, but the Commissionaires and BMO can help you to secure your future.

Frequently promoting from within, we are always looking for responsible, top performers who want to advance their careers. Our reputation is built on 80 years and our 20,000 security professionals with varied backgrounds of all ages. We are a dedicated equal opportunity employer with flexible shifts across Vancouver Island to suit every lifestyle â€“ student, parent, night owl, you name it!

As one of Canada's oldest security organizations, our security professionals keep airports, schools, government facilities, and other commercial enterprises safe. We also work with police departments and municipalities to help in keeping Canadians safe.

Reach your full potential today!

 

Location: Comox Valley- various sites

Position Status: Part Time/Casual

Shifts: Various days, evenings, and overnight shifts

Wage: $18.45/hr

Reports to: Site Supervisor

 

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Provide superior customer service to clients and general public.
  • Provide access control and security foot patrols as needed.
  • Proactively respond to and resolve emergency situations and conflicts.
  • Complete evacuation and emergency response procedures.
  • Communicate problems or concerns to the site supervisor.
  • Possess excellent multi-tasking, problem solving, prioritizing and organizational abilities.
  • Have knowledge of occupational health and safety regulations.
  • Perform all duties with high safety standards.

REQUIRED EDUCATION, QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE

  • Must possess a valid BC Security Workers License or be willing to complete training.
  • Must be legally entitled to work in Canada.
  • Must be able to obtain a Reliability Clearance and be minimum 19 years of age.
  • Must be physically fit and able to stand for long periods at a time.
  • Must be able to work in a range of weather conditions throughout shift.
  • Must be willing to complete the online Commissionaire Qualifying Course (CQC)
  • Must be fluent in the English language - written, verbal and reading skills.
  • Must have a positive attitude with a professional demeanour, and strong interpersonal skills.
  • Have excellent attention to detail to fulfill duties and responsibilities and incident report writing.
  • Have excellent problem solving skills with an ability to handle emergency situations in a calm manner.
  • Have the ability to work independently and make sound decisions in varying situations.
  • Have a demonstrated interest and experience in serving the public.

REWARDS

  • Exclusive BMO mortgage rates, banking options, and more.
  • Opportunities for advancement.
  • Free and paid training programs. 
  • Flexible work schedule â€“ maximize work-life balance!
  • Recognition programs.  
  • Paid sick, vacation and personal needs time-off.
  • Group-life, medical & dental coverage.
  • Mental health supports and dedicated HR team. 
  • Free uniform and dry-cleaning reimbursement.
  • BC Transit Pro Pass.
  • Safety boot reimbursement.
  • Personal protective equipment provided. 
  • RRSP contributions.
  • Referral bonuses.
  • And more!

 

Commissionaires Victoria, the Islands, and Yukon proudly celebrates diversity through an inclusive work environment, and welcomes applications from candidates of all backgrounds.

* Candidates who serve for six months working a minimum of 30hrs a week will be eligible for the signing bonus.

title: Mobile Security Guard (PT)
description:
BPS K9 is looking for security professionals to join our reliable, confident, and self-motivated team of Mobile Security Agents in a Part Time position

Shifts: 12-hour overnights

Successful candidates will:
  • Have a valid Alberta Security Guard License.
  • Have a valid Class 5 Driver License. (or Equivalent)
  • Provide full 3-year Driver Abstract history. (less than 4 demerits)** ( February 2019 to Present)
  • Provide full 3-year Insurance Claim Report. (February 2019 to Present )
  • Have their own vehicle to get to the office.
  • Be available to start immediately or soon.
  • Have previous Security experience. (an asset)
  • Be able to work independently and in a team environment.
  • Meet the physical demands of the job. (extensive walking, standing, stairs, and driving)***
  • Fluency/proficiency in English language, both written and spoken.
  • Working in all types of weather. (sun, rain, snow, etc.)***
Duties of a Mobile Security Agent include:
  • Driving a company vehicle safely and obey all traffic laws.
  • Conducting foot patrols, securing access points, and removing trespassers.
  • Reacting appropriately in stressful situations by remaining calm and non-violent.
  • Being professional while representing the company and clients at all times.
  • Completing detailed and accurate shift reports daily.
Candidates will be skilled in the following:
  • MS Office Word and Excel. (Basic to Intermediate)**
  • Critical thinking and problem solving.
  • Safe and defensive driving at night and during snow/rain/fog etc.
  • Interpersonal and communication skills.

Wage: Guaranteed minimum $18/hour after probation (3 months)

BPS Protective Services K-9 Inc. provides competitive compensation, comprehensive training, reliable equipment, and supervision, and is a firm believer in equal opportunities.

Salary: $17.00-$18.00 per hour.

COVID-19 considerations:
All visitors and employees must wear a mask when in the office - no mask no access
All employees must wear a mask when on shift and working indoors or when unable to maintain social distancing - no exceptions

title: STATIC SECURITY GUARD - On-Call/Graveyard
description:
At Fusion Security, we believe in providing valued service, building strong relationships within communities, and safeguarding the interests of the public and our stakeholders.

Fusion Security continues to grow and provide professional security services throughout Greater Vancouver and the Lower Mainland, with clients in a wide variety of sectors, including government, retail, commercial sites, industrial sites and residential areas. Our mission is to deliver the highest quality service in each interaction that reflects a strong and respectful culture.

We are looking for security personnel who are professional, committed, and have experience in security. If this sounds like you, then we want to hear from YOU!

PERKS FUSION SECURITY OFFERS YOU:

  • Competitive, market-based pay rate
  • Extended health and dental benefits
  • Paid training and subsidies for industry accreditations
  • Fitness Centre Membership
  • Referral Bonus Program

WHAT YOU WILL DO:

  • Customer service
  • Ensuring the security of all personnel, visitors, and the general public
  • Inspecting & patrolling premises
  • Observe & report site activities and incidents
  • Monitoring property access
  • Investigating and reporting suspicious behavior, incidents, and security breaches
  • Enforcing client informed policies
  • Communicating with law enforcement, emergency medical personnel, and fire departments
  • Responding to alarms
  • Other duties that may be assigned

We Schedule Shifts According to Following Availability Needs:

  • Full time: able to work 32 to 40 hours per week
  • Shift available: Graveyard only
  • Flexible availability - 7 days a week including weekends.
  • No restrictions on commuting - the most suitable candidates are available to commute to Downtown, Vancouver, Richmond, Delta, Burnaby & the North Shore. Parking can be provided at some sites for successful candidates with a personal vehicle.

YOU ARE A GREAT FIT IF YOU HAVE:

  • A Valid BC Security License
  • The ability to stand for long periods of time & complete routine patrols to protect against fire & theft
  • Relevant experience in the security or customer service industry
  • Excellent customer service & professional deportment
  • A high standard for safety & a passion for security
  • Excellent documentation and communication skills
  • Additional certifications are an asset: Occupational First Aid Level 1, 2, 3, AST, Etc.

Please note that security officers may be required to work extended hours and be part of an on-call team for urgent scheduling needs.

For further information on the job posting or if you have any questions, you can contact Ikjot Rai, Talent Acquisition Specialist, at 604-928-1325.

In order to be considered for this position, your application must clearly demonstrate how you meet the requirements as outlined above. Ensure your resume includes your employment history including start and end dates of your employment, and any relevant information that relates to the job to which you are applying.

Due to receiving a high volume of applications, only those applicants selected to move forward in the hiring process will be contacted.

(Part 1, Section 2) of the Security Services Act of British Columbia requires all Security Services Workers are required to hold a valid BC Security License to be employed or employable. Any applicant without BST or a valid BC Security License will be automatically disqualified. For more information please visit: http://www.bclaws.ca/civix/document/id/consol20/consol20/00_07030_01#section2

title: Security Officer ( Part-time)
description:
Requisition #2366998
Job LocationCanada-Ontario-Ajax
Job StreamSecurity and Surveillance
Job TypePermanent, Part-Time
Expiry Date
Travel RequiredNot Required
Educational RequirementsN/A
Languages RequiredEnglish
Requisition #2366998
Job LocationCanada-Ontario-Ajax
Job StreamSecurity and Surveillance
Job TypePermanent, Part-Time
Expiry Date
Travel RequiredNot Required
Educational RequirementsN/A
Languages RequiredEnglish
On-Going Opportunities Description

Don’t miss the opportunity to join One Toronto Gaming’s at Casino Ajax Security Team. This exciting career opportunity at Casino Ajax is seeking dynamic individuals with a drive to succeed.

Under the direct supervision of the Security Manager, or the Supervisor, Security, this position is responsible for the safety and protection of employees, guests, the facility and company assets at the site level. Ensures adherence to all policies and procedures while contributing to a safe and welcoming work environment for all employees.

The Security Officer’s role is to protect the company’s assets, patrons and employees against theft, fraud, vandalism and abuse, while delivering the highest level of customer service and respect to all customers and employees. You will perform a variety of duties throughout your shift, including controlling access to the facility and sensitive areas, escorting visitors, assisting departments, lost and found, monitoring alarm panels, controlling and issuing keys, writing reports, maintaining a daily log and conducting investigations. You may also be required to provide first aid and medical attention. At all times, you must be aware of the gaming operations, and you will work under Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario (AGCO) regulations and comply with all applicable laws, policies and procedures.

The ideal candidate is an energetic professional with proven knowledge, skills and abilities, executing the following in support of the company’s vision, mission and values:

  • Self-motivator and ability to inspire other team members in enhancing the guest experience within the entertainment business;
  • Monitoring, documenting and reporting internal and external violations, unsafe conditions, potential hazards, suspicious persons and activities; preparing written and electronic statements;
  • Escorting guests and team members;
  • Enforcing restricted access by unauthorized persons;
  • Observing transactions, slot drops, chip fills and transferring items to Lost & Found;
  • Performing identification checks to any guest who appears under 30; * Referring disputes to the Supervisor, Security;
  • Conducting regular patrols of the interior and exterior of the property as assigned;
  • Performing crowd control as directed;
  • Attend to first aid incidents;
  • Ensuring compliance with licensing laws, health and safety, and other statutory regulations;
  • Assisting Supervisor, Security with enrolling guests in the Self-Exclusion program;
  • Performing other reasonable duties as assigned.

Skills/ Qualification Requirements

  • Ability to exceed internal and external guest expectations through timely, effective and service-oriented communication;
  • 2 years of experience working with customer service/ public service role or in the service industry;
  • High school diploma or equivalent required, post-secondary education in a related field an asset
  • Previous experience or training in security an asset
  • Computer literacy in MS Office
  • Able to organize data with great accuracy
  • Knowledge of privacy legislation an asset
  • Inquisitive, investigative mind, able to identify suspicious behaviors /transactions and make sound judgments based on this;
  • A willingness to learn, develop and achieve new skills for personal and professional development
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize;
  • Ability to follow rules, regulations, policies and procedures at all times;
  • The ability to maintain tact and composure during high-stress situations
  • Must be able to work independently, without close direct supervision, and apply good judgment and discretion under pressure;
  • Excellent problem solving and conflict resolution capabilities;
  • Candidates must be ready and willing to work a flexible schedule, including overnight, weekends and holidays. The hours of work will be based on customers and business needs

Training/ Licenses/ Certification Requirements

  • A valid class “G” driver’s license with a clear driving record is also required
  • A current First Aid/CPR certification
  • Ability to successfully obtain Smart Serve certification
  • The ability to obtain registration as a Category 2 Gaming Assistant with the Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario

Casino Ajax candidates must be ready and willing to work a flexible schedule, including evenings, weekends, holidays and overnights. 12 hour shifts. The hours of work will be based on operational needs.

One Toronto Gaming accommodates people with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process. Applicants are encouraged to advise Human Resources of requirements in advance.

title: Loss Prevention Specialist: Full Time
description:
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • This is a plain clothed/undercover positon in multiple locations
  • Detain and interview persons apprehended for shoplifting in accordance with local laws and company procedures. Complete investigative case packages and statements regarding all internal/external theft and fraud for local police agencies
  • Conduct floor walks and support the stores by conducting tests and providing feedback regarding all aspects of home depot’s safety, security and shrink standards
  • Check physical security of The Home Depot facilities to prevent and deter theft/fraudulent activity
  • Represent the Home Depot in a professional manner throughout all court-related procedures
  • Maintain an open channel of communication with store management and all associates
  • Partner with store management to drive LP issues
  • Effectively utilize CCTV and Electronic Article Surveillance (EAS) systems
  • Conduct surveillance when required

CANDIDATE QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Must fulfil minimum time-in-position and performance management code requirements of M
  • Excellent analytical skills as well as strong verbal
  • Valid Security and Drivers Licenses as required by the Province
  • Must have access to reliable transportation

COMPENSATION:

  • Competitive pay
  • Travel time and mileage expensed
  • Profit Sharing and Stock Purchase Plan
  • Paid training and Career Development
  • Health and Dental Benefits
  • RRSP Contributions
  • Certain travel requirements will be reimbursed through submitted expenses

title: Loss Control Specialist - Canada
description:
About Our Company:

Are you looking for a challenging career that rewards hard work and success?   AFIRM is committed to finding outstanding people who have the ambition and willingness to learn in order to succeed.   The most successful candidates will be detail-oriented, self-motivated and possess strong problem-solving and analytical skills.  

 

AFIRM is the national leader in risk control, consulting services as well as commercial and residential inspections.   We provide our exceptional services to insurers, brokers, risk managers and government agencies.

 

Equal Opportunity Employer

The H.W. Kaufman Group of companies is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other status or condition protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

 

 

Qualifications:

Our Inspectorsâ€™ education and training:

 

  • Inspectors come from all walks of life with their own experience and background
  • AFIRM provides its candidates and Inspectors with a valuable set of skills unlike any other
  • They have all successfully completed AFIRMâ€™s own self-directed, on-line training certification program
  • Continue to hone their skills with AFIRMâ€™s on-going distance learning opportunities

 

 

Our Inspectorsâ€™ work environment      

 

  • As independent contractors with AFIRM, our inspectors work from home
  • They travel to various locations from their home base to assigned locations
  • Work evenings and weekends whenever required to maintain customer satisfaction

 

 

What all our Inspectors must have:

 

  • A reliable vehicle
  • Mobile phone
  • Windows based computer
  • Internet connection (high speed preferably)
  • Digital camera or smart phone that takes high quality digital pictures
Responsibilities:

 

AFIRM is a global leader in Loss Prevention and Premium Audit with Canadian locations in Richmond Hill and Montreal.   We are currently seeking independent Loss Prevention service contractors.

 

Our Loss Control Representatives (Inspectors) visit various property locations on behalf of the ownerâ€™s insurance company with a goal to minimize potential losses.   There is no selling involved.   Requests for inspection are received directly from the insurance companies.

 

Our successful Inspectors are:

 

  • Outgoing and independent
  • Curious and inquisitive by nature
  • Self-motivated strivers
  • Well organized and manage their time efficiently
  • Focused on quality of service
  • Competent computer skills with good input speed & accuracy
  • Skilled at writing well

 

What our Inspectors do:

 

  • Take responsibility for; and organize their assignments
  • Schedule their own appointments with property owners
  • Travel to the location
  • Tour the property and collect information (Residential and Commercial)
  • Identify potential areas of loss such as fire, theft and liability
  • Take photographs and measure buildings
  • Prepare a pre-define Loss Control report of the property using AFIRMâ€™s own web-based platform

title: Loss Prevention Officer
description:
London Drugs is looking for highly capable security and investigations professionals for our Loss Prevention team. You will find state of the art technology, training and support, and a high integrity group of people committed to excellence on our team.

Not just a job…a communitya partnershipa team

You’ll experience them all at London Drugs. As one of Canada’s fastest-growing and most successful retail chains, we know what it takes to build a satisfying career. We are seeking innovative, customer focused people to join our team!

Opportunity:Loss Prevention Officer 

Responsibilities:The Loss Prevention Officer position is well-suited for a highly capable security and investigations professional that thrives on working within a team environment.

Duties include:
  • Shifts at store locations conducting surveillance, investigation, and maintenance of loss prevention systems
  • Identifying areas of loss and working on team shrink reduction plans
  • Detection and apprehension of persons committing criminal offences against the company
  • Securing evidence, report writing & document preparation for court testifying purposes
  • Special assignments including lock repair, key control, staff awareness and orientation
  • Maintaining the overall security of our locations
QualificationsWe have an extensive in-house training program (in BC we are an accredited BST training provider). While we are eager to develop our people, candidates should possess the following skills and qualifications:
  • Demonstrated ability to stay calm and respond with good judgment in emergency situations
  • A commitment and history of protecting people and property in a safe and legal manner
  • Demonstrated ability to work under strict confidentiality
  • High ethical standards and a commitment to personal and professional integrity
  • Good command of the English language, both written and verbal, required for report writing and court testimony
  • A valid Class 5 driver’s license and own vehicle
  • Availability and willingness to work at all locations and surrounding areas
  • Previous Loss Prevention experience or other related experience within the Criminal Justice system would be an asset
  • Previous security related education, professional accreditation, first aid and first responder training is an asset
  • Use of force and restraining device training is an asset
  • Provincial security worker license, or the ability to obtain one before commencing work
Availability RequirementThis is a Full Time position, 40 hours per week. Employees must be available to work a flexible schedule, Monday through Sunday, for day and evening shifts.

We are an equal opportunity employer. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work applicable to this position and are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. Be advised, London Drugs DOES NOT use third party recruitment services.

London Drugs may collect, use, and/or disclose your personal information (including the information in this application) where it is reasonable for establishing, managing or terminating an employment relationship. This includes the use or disclosure of your personal information to persons inside or external to our organization, for the purpose of checking references or gathering other information to support an assessment of your candidacy.

To protect yourself, do not respond to unsolicited job offers from individuals or e-mail addresses, and never disclose any sensitive details about your identity (including personal or financial) to anyone you do not know or trust or on any unverified website, or website you do not trust.

title: Asset Protection Service Representative
description:
About Gap Inc.


Our past is full of iconic moments — but our future is going to spark many more. We're looking for the people who'll help make our next decade just as revolutionary as our first five. If you're one of the super-talented who thrive on change, aren't afraid to take risks and love to make a difference, you're the right fit. Come grow with us.


About the Role


In this role, you will embody our value of Doing The Right Thing by protecting People, Assets, and Brands. You will work in a energized, fast paced environment focused on creating a safe environment for our employees, teams, and customers; this is critical to driving our Brand power, enduring customer relationships, and exuding our commitment to team and values. You’ll need to understand the big picture strategy and work with cross-functional teams and external partners.


What You'll Do


+ Support strategies, standards, and processes to implement an Asset Protection strategy to mitigate risk and loss within our Gap Inc stores

+ Assist with the implementation and continued execution of the shortage reduction program

+ Work with store personnel to identify inventory shortage opportunities and recommend solutions

+ Determine the assignment of appropriate Asset Protection resources (i.e.: agents, technology, etc.) to address shortage reduction opportunities

+ Courteous and responsive to internal/external requests

+ Exchange and verifies job related information to provide support


Who You Are


+ Experience in customer service and/or a high-pressure, multitask environment to drive results, coach, and collaborate

+ Strong communication and interpersonal skills, including the ability to negotiate and build consensus across multiple stakeholders and functions

+ Ability to actively learn and immediately apply learnings into decisions and behaviors

+ Ability to manage and prioritize their time; able to multi task

+ Use basic information-gathering skills to solve problems


Benefits at Gap Inc.


+ Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Gap, Banana Republic, Old Navy and Athleta, 30% off at Outlet, and 10% off markdowns at Gap, Banana Republic and Outlet.

+ Competitive Paid Time Off plans.*

+ Company match for donations and volunteer time*

+ Registered Retirement Savings Plan

+ Employee stock purchase plan.*

+ Medical, dental, vision and life insurance.*

+ Virtual health care 24/7*

+ Maternity/Parental Top Up.*

+ See more of the benefits we offer.


*For eligible employees


Gap Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status. We have received numerous awards for our long-held commitment to equality and will continue to foster a diverse and inclusive environment of belonging. This year, we’ve been named as one of the Best Places to Work by the Human Rights Campaign (https://www.hrc.org/resources/best-places-to-work-for-lgbtq-equality-2022) for the seventeenth consecutive year and have been included in the 2021 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index for the fourth year in a row.

title: Security Supervisor
description:
Securiguard is a 'different kind of employer'. We focus on the individual security professional and believe that if we treat you right, you will treat our customer right. We want to be your 'Employer of Choice'

Due to expansion, Securiguard is accepting resumes for the position of Security Supervisor, for a High Profile Corporate site in Pickering/Ajax.

Pay rate: $20/hour

Required Skills & Qualifications

  • Minimum of 1 year Security Supervisory experience in a fast-paced professional environment
  • Minimum of 1 year Security Guard Experience
  • Must have strong English communication skills both written and verbal
  • Must be reliable, available, of sound character and be able to work in a team environment or independently
  • Must be physically fit and able to stand, sit or walk for extended periods
  • Must be able to work overnight shifts
  • Ability to handle multiple situations and use sound judgment to handle emergency situations
  • Must be knowledgeable on various systems including but not limited to CCTV various types, elevators, mechanical alarms, intercom systems, fire and life safety systems, control room systems
  • Must be able to provide coaching, training, and update site Manager on new trainees progress
  • Act as a Liaison between our client and Securiguard
  • Will be required to keep track of staff training records, expiry dates and book for training when required
  • Ensure the facility's Safety and Emergency procedures are followed in response to fire alarms and other site emergencies
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle stressful situations
  • Ability to write and compile reports on computer software in a timely manner
  • Available to work overtime hours as required
  • Knowledge and Application of Section 494(c) of the Canadian Criminal Code: Trespass to Property Act, and other related legislation

We thank all applicants for their interest in working with Securiguard however; only qualified candidates will be contacted. We encourage you to apply again at any time in the future.

title: Security Guard - Full Time - Canada Life - London, ON
description:
Site:                                   Canada Life                                   

City:                                   London, Ontario

Status:                               Full Time

Hours:                                Afternoons & Midnights – Rotating (see below for details)

Pay Rate:                           $16.38 - 17.05/hr. Based on a levelling system

Position Overview:

Assignments include:

  • Implement security measures to protect property, control access to sites, patrol assigned areas to monitor activities and ensure client rules and regulations are followed.
  • Ensure safety and emergency procedures are followed and maintain written reports.
  • Direct visitors to appropriate areas, perform security checks, and liaise with visitors, customers and the public.
  • Maintaining a positive, productive work environment through collaboration.

 

Preferred skills/qualifications:

  • Valid Ontario Security Guard licence.
  • Valid First Aid & CPR certificate.
  • Education or experience in security or a related field is required.
  • In this role, it is essential that you maintain integrity, clear written and oral communication skills, basic computer knowledge and maintain a high standard of customer service.

 

Hours of work will be Afternoon & Night shift rotation including weekends and holidays as follows:

Week 1

Sunday – 1200-2359

Monday – 1600-2359

Tuesday – 1600-2359

Wednesday – 1600-2359

Thursday – 1600-2359

Friday - OFF

Saturday OFF

 

Week 2

Sunday - OFF

Monday - OFF

Tuesday – 0000-0800

Wednesday – 0000-0800

Thursday – 0000-0800

Friday – 0000-0800

Saturday 0000-1200

 

Week 3

Sunday – 0000-1200

Monday – 0000-0800 (ends Monday AM)

Tuesday - OFF

Wednesday - OFF

Thursday - OFF

Friday – 1600-2359

Saturday 1200-2359 - return to Week 1 rotation

 

Preferred skills/qualifications:

  • Valid Ontario Security Guard licence (required)
  • Valid First Aid & CPR certificate
  • Microsoft Office experience

 

Essential Job Functions:

  • Be courteous and cooperative with a high quality of customer service.
  • Good interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively at various social levels and across diverse cultures.
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Communicates any concerns/issues with Operations Manager.

Requirements:

  • Working knowledge of the Trespass to Property Act.
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Excellent communication skills with a focus on customer service along with good computer abilities are all core requirements.
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills. Ability to write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy.
  • Patrol assigned area on foot, as assigned, to ensure personal, building, and equipment security.
  • Watch for and report irregularities by completing investigations and incident reports, such as security breaches, facility and safety hazards, and emergency situations; contact emergency responders, such as police, fire, and/or ambulance personnel, as required.
  • Sustain effective relationships with key stakeholders and provide specialized security services by enforcing rules and regulations when required.
  • Offer support to any person in need such as providing good customer service when providing a security presence, such as providing direction, responding to emergency situation involving violent individuals and injuries.
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

title: Health Care Security Guard - Red Deer & Ponoka
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

If you are seeking a job where you can help people and make an impact, this one is for you!  As a security guard in the hospital sector, you will ensure the safety of patients, staff, and visitors. A great way to contribute to making your community safer!

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in Red Deer and Ponoka now more than ever!  We provide people with growth opportunities as 30% of our frontline employees are promoted to become part of our operation teams.

With our wide variety of contracts, we have a position that will accommodate your needs and help you reach your goals. Great step into any law enforcement career!

What's in it for you?

  • Pay Rate: $18-$19/hr 
  • Guaranteed 40 hours per week
  • Must be able to work 12 hr rotational shifts days and nights
  • Uniform provided
  • Training programs for development in the hospital sector and the security industry
  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus courses (such as managing aggressive behavior, dealing with people with mental health issues, and conflict resolution)

What does a Security Guard do?

  • Assist clinical staff members with checking ID's and vaccine passports
  • Enforce safety procedures and standards
  • Helping visitors find their way around the hospital
  • Completing daily reports
  • Monitoring CCTV systems.
  • Responding as necessary to assist and support Community Peace officers
  • Preventative patrols, including foot and/or mobile patrol of exterior and interior perimeters

Qualifications:

  • Valid Alberta Security License 
  • Excellent customer service and communication skills
  • Some Health Care sites require a N95 mask to be fit tested, which will require no facial hair for those working on site. Please note, if you are unable to remove your facial hair, you will not be selected for this site
  • Strong de-escalation abilities and problem-solving mindset
  • Emergency or Standard first aid is an asset

 

 

SSRED

GardaWorld: Make the world a safer place

GardaWorld is a global leader in the security industry, offering a wealth of opportunity to individuals looking to gain experience and develop professionally in a growing industry. We offer flexible schedules, diverse work assignments spanning multiple industries, and training and career advancement opportunities. We embrace diversity and welcome newcomers, women, students, retirees, reservists, veterans, and more to join our team, as we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.


We thank all candidates for their interest; however, we will communicate only with the selected candidates.

title: Security Guard - Full Time - Schomberg
description:
**IMMEDIATE OPENINGS**

Full-Time Security Guard required for Commercial location in Schomberg, Ontario

Experience and Qualifications:

  • Valid Security Guard License
  • Valid First Aid / CPR certificate
  • Must be able to stand, sit and walk for extended periods of time
  • Strong Communication skills, written and verbal
  • Ability to complete daily logs and write detailed reports
  • Must have strong customer service skills
  • Previous security experience would be an asset
  • Basic Computer Skills
  • Must have your own transportation to and from work location

What's in it for you:

  • Salary - $16.50 per hour
  • Benefits package for full-time employees
  • Paid Training
  • Safety Footwear Allowance

"A Different Kind of Employer"

Securiguard secured its first contract in 1974 in the mining town of Cassiar, acting as an extension of management focusing on customer service. Our original trade name was World Investigation, Security Division, which was re-branded to Securiguard in 1977.

We are an innovative security company known to make strides ahead of others in the field. We introduced the first high visibility yellow jacket, the first bicycle patrol and being the first private security company to become ISO certified. Securiguard was selected to replace the RCMP at a Class 1 Airport, at the time, the only one in Canada. Partly due to the success of our implementation, many airport authorities have now adopted this model. Securiguard was also selected to replace the Ports Canada Police patrolling functions, which is where we introduced our trademark high visibility vehicles.

We do things differently than other companies - an unprecedented level of respect for security personnel, with progressive supervisors and management. You will not be hired and forgotten

We thank all applicants for applying however only qualified candidates will be contacted.

THIS POSTING WILL REMAIN VISIBLE UNTIL ALL POSITIONS ARE FILLED.

title: Security Guard, Part Time, Cornwall
description:
Overview:

We are North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider with over 300,000 phenomenal employees. At Allied Universal ®, we pride ourselves on fostering a promote from within culture. There are countless examples of individuals who began their career as Security Professionals and today hold positions on our senior leadership team. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, and vision coverage, life insurance, employee assistance programs, and more! We also offer company paid uniforms and part-time and flexible schedules!

Job Description:

Allied Universal is seeking Professional Security Guards  in Canada.    

  • Good pay rate & comprehensive health benefits

  • Uniform provided free of charge

  • Opportunities to grow  

  • Opportunity to work in one of the best security company in the world

  • Access to over 3600 trainings to enhance your skills

  • Career Advancement  
  • Start work immediately

  • Able to drive a patrol vehicle  
  • Have 5 year history in Canada for clearance
  • Be at least 18 years of age with high school diploma or equivalent

description:
Skanna Security is looking for Static/Mobile Security Guards. You will be responsible for ensuring the security of properties and answering alarms during patrols. Driver must have a full G with a clean driving abstract.

title: Security Guard - CCTV Operations Weekends
description:
Commissionaires BC is currently looking for an experienced security officer to join our onsite operations team at one of our high profile locations!

Shifts: Saturday and Sunday 11pm till 7am

Some of your responsibilities will include:

  • Monitor CCTV cameras and fire/alarm systems and reporting any suspicious activity
  • Take incoming calls from the public, police and/or employees in a timely manner 
  • Maintaining a detailed log after the end of each shift
  • Producing ad hoc reports as required by various departments
  • Conducting follow-up reviews with clients to ensure client satisfaction  
  • Any other ad-hoc duties may be assigned to you in your role

Your Must-Haves:  

  • A valid BC Security License
  • A Class 5 BC Drivers License and clean drivers abstract
  • You have a minimum of 2 yearsâ€™ experience in a customer service environment
  • Previous experience monitoring multiple CCTV cameras simultaneously
  • You have excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • You have proven time-management and organizational skills

Your Nice to Haves:

  • Occupational first aid level 1
  • Advanced security training

Whatâ€™s in it for you?   

  • Opportunity for growth
  • Work for a reputable and nationally known company 
  • A challenging yet rewarding work environment
  • Free uniforms
  • Competitive salary  

Youâ€™re a good fit ifâ€¦  

  • You pride yourself on your superior customer service skills
  • You thrive in a fast-paced environment
  • You can think on your feet and problem solve
  • You can work alone or as part of a team

Our Story 

Commissionaires BC is a Canadian, not-for-profit security/enforcement organization that has been in business since 1927. Our mandate is to give back to those who served and continue to serve in our communities and country. 

Commissionaires provides security services for over 200 sites and are located in over 110 communities across the province. Our client base runs from the Federal Government to local municipalities, airports, industrial sectors, and commercial/residential buildings.  

Our guards are not only behind the scenes providing security and access control, but front and centre providing valued customer service to the public.

title: Security Guard- Sudbury Airport (CASUAL)
description:
SECURITY GUARD- SUDBURY AIRPORT


Are you passionate about Safety & Security and seeking opportunity to join a team of Security Professionals?


A.S.P. Incorporated has provided security and customer service solutions for over 20 years to Canadian clients. We employ in excess of 2000 employees and are a subsidiary of ICTS EUROPE, which is operating in 22 countries and employing more than 17000 professionals. A.S.P provide services to some of the largest airports in Canada and has a significant presence in the Commercial and Residential spaces in Ontario and Alberta.

A.S.P. in looking for Access Control Officer, who take pride in becoming ambassador of Airport and make every interaction professional and positive. Work with integrity, respect, and take responsibility of the security and safety at the Sudbury Airport.


What you will do:

  • Monitor and controls ground-side to airside access and doors (restricted area access control);
  • Enforce parking by-law at the Sudbury Airport (YSB) & collects all YSB vehicle parking lot fees;
  • Operate a variety of security and parking equipment including CCTV, Parking Pay & Display Units, Parking Cash Register & Pay on Foot Station, Recording systems, PA System, Portable Radios, etc.;
  • Respond to screening checkpoint and other airport restricted area alarms;
  • Perform security patrols and responses throughout the airport as well as tenant facilities;
  • Complete daily logs, deficiency reports and incident/occurrence reports;
  • Carry out customer service-related duties which includes hand shoveling of snow, greeting passengers & assisting with luggage when required, etc.;
  • Perform emergency response duties in accordance with the Airport Emergency Response Manual.

Who you are:

  • Minimum High School diploma or Grade 12 education;
  • Proficient computer skills such as Microsoft Office;
  • Self-motivated individual with a strong attention to detail.
  • Excellent written & verbal communication and active listening skills;
  • Must Possess a valid Security licence, Ontario Drivers Licence (G or Higher) with a clear a driving abstract and Basic First Aid and CPR certification;
  • Must be willing to provide Criminal Record check upon request;
  • Possession of a valid Restricted Area Identity Card (RAIC) is an asset;
  • Possession of a valid Airside Vehicle Operator's Permit (AVOP D/DA) is an asset.

Why you should work with A.S.P:

  • We care about our team and their personal and professional success;
  • We offer competitive salaries;
  • You can have flexible schedules; and
  • Free airport parking when on shift

A.S.P. Incorporated is committed to support a diverse workforce from various communities within which we operate. We encourage all qualified professionals, without regard to race, gender identity, colour, sex, marital / family status, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, aboriginal status, age, etc. to apply.

To apply please send your cover letter and resume toNadia Onorato @ nonorato@security-asp.com.


We hire for PERSONALITY. We train for the job.

title: Overnight Concierge Security Guard - Full Time
description:
Regal Security Inc. is currently seeking a Full-Time Concierge Security Guard at one of our sites located in the Richmond Hill, ON area.

 

The Ideal Candidate must have: 

 

  • Full-time availability to work all days of the week and schedules that will consist of afternoons, overnight and weekend shifts â€“ including holidays.

 

  • Demonstrated past experience in either a senior security role or supervisor
     
  • Customer service-driven individual
     
  • Clear English communication skills in all areas (verbal and written)
     
  • Detailed and thorough record-keeping (Memo book, incident reports, etc)
     
  • Keen observation and attentiveness
     
  • Professional physical deportment and presentation
     
  • Decision Making, Reliable, Common Sense and exceptional judgment
  • A personal vehicle is an asset as the position is not easily accessible for transit.

 

Job Duties and Responsibilities:

 

  • Provide outstanding and personalized customer service as a front line representative of Regal Security
     
  • Act as Regalâ€™s day to day point of contact for our individual client and field staff inquiries
     
  • Supervise contracted site to ensure security staff are meeting company standards in terms of uniforming, training and site procedures
     
  • Operate and maintain an organized environment
     
  • Enforce property rules and regulations in order to maintain the security and safety of our clients and their assets
     
  • Ensure enforcement of Trespass to Property Act
     
  • Safely operate and maintain company and client issued equipment and supplies
     
  • Respond to major incidents on property and aid security staff with managing the situation (fire, flood, medical issue and criminal activity)
     
  • Ensure that safety and emergency protocols are completed in response to Fire Alarms and other Site Emergencies
     
  • Complete walking patrols and inspections of facilities and equipment as required
     
  • Review, know and follow post orders as identified for site representing
     
  • Maintain a safe working environment and follow the facilities health and safety procedures
     
  • Duties as otherwise assigned

 

Qualifications:

 

  • Valid Ontario Security License
     
  • Valid First Aid/CPR Certification

 

  • Valid WHMIS Certification
     
  • Secondary School Diploma or equivalent and higher (preference will be given to those with a Criminal Justice or Business post-secondary education)
     
  • Proficient in the use of various computer programs (ie. Microsoft Office, Gmail) and able to adapt and learn new program.

 

Compensation:

 

  • Pay Rate will be $17 per hour.

 

  • Health Benefits are available for full-time employees upon completion of 3 months probation
     

Why choose Regal Security?

 

Regal Security Inc. is an established and growing security company that offers a vast array of professional and dependable security guard services across the Greater Toronto Area and Southwest Ontario.

 

Our Everyday Superheroâ„¢ guards are selected and trained to protect the clientâ€™s assets, property, employees, and tenants, using a custom-designed security solution for every client within the sectors we serve.

 

Every member of the Regal security team, and every service that is carried out, is directed by the Regal guiding principle: Strength & Honorâ„¢. With this in mind, Regalâ€™s security guards are known as Everyday Superheroesâ„¢ â€“ they are friendly, well-trained and, most importantly, proud, as they go above and beyond the call of duty to uphold Regalâ€™s high standards.

 

â€œTHE REGAL SECURITY MISSION IS â€œYOUR PEACE OF MINDâ€â„¢â€

 

Thank you for your application, unfortunately, due to the high volume of applicants, only those deemed eligible for an interview will be contacted. All candidates will be communicated to by phone or email for the purposes of the recruitment process.

 

Regal Security Inc. welcomes all candidates equally and encourages all qualified candidates, from women and men including persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and Aboriginal persons, to apply.


 

#INDREGAL

Job Description
Job Description

Are you passionate about safety and guest experience? Looking for a place to put your interpersonal skills into play ensuring our guests feel safe and special? Chances Maple Ridge is currently on the lookout for a vibrant and service-oriented Surveillance/Security Officer. Under the direct supervision of the Security and Surveillance Manager and Supervisors, our Surveillance/Security Officer will be responsible for the safety and protection of team members, guests, and company assets. If you have the drive to become a part of a leading gaming and entertainment destination in Maple Ridge, come join our team!

Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Greeting guests and controlling access to the Casino
  • Enforcing restricted access by unauthorized persons
  • Monitoring, documenting and reporting internal and external violations, unsafe conditions, potential hazards, suspicious persons and activities
  • Preparing electronic statements via a non-gaming record keeping system
  • Observing cashier transactions, slot drops, and escorts cash and cash equivalent movements
  • Tagging and reporting found property and transferring items to Lost and Found
  • Conducting regular patrols of the facility, interior and exterior as directed
  • Performing identification checks and escorting guests and employees as directed
  • Referring disputes to the Security Supervisor
  • Designated Security Officers may be required to attend to First Aid incidents after completion of an Occupational First Aid course
  • Liaising and communicating effectively with all appropriate operational departments
  • Complying with licensing laws, health and safety and other statutory regulations
  • Performing other duties as assigned or directed

Qualifications:

  • High School Diploma or equivalent
  • Previous security experience an asset but not required
  • Gaming Security Officer (GSO) training and other training as required
  • Serving It Right certification
  • The ability to successfully obtain a Criminal Record Check through the Gaming Policy and Enforcement Branch (GPEB)
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office
  • Exceptional interpersonal and communications skills and the ability to handle multiple tasks at one time
  • Ability to exceed internal and external customer expectations through timely, effective and service oriented communication
  • Must be available to work all shifts including days, nights, weekends and statutory holidays

Great Canadian Gaming Corporation is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we welcome all qualified applicants to apply to join our team of unique contributors. We accommodate people with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process and applicants are encouraged to advise Human Resources in advance if an accommodation is required. We thank all applicants for their interest and will contact those qualified to continue in the recruitment process.

Great Canadian Gaming Corporation is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we welcome all qualified applicants to apply to join our team of unique contributors. We accommodate people with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process and applicants are encouraged to advise Human Resources in advance if an accommodation is required. We thank all applicants for their interest and will contact those qualified to continue in the recruitment process.

title: CBSA Security Guard
description:
CBSA Security Guard

Business Unit: Security Services
Career Area: Security Guard
Location: 

Calgary, AB, CAOkotoks, CA, T1S2E9Airdrie, AB, CACochrane, CA, T4C2X8

More than a job – 26% of our corporate employees at GardaWorld Canada started as frontline employees. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset and you’re ambitious, this could be just the beginning of your career journey with GardaWorld!

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in Calgary now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, you can be sure that we have a position that can fill your needs and goals. Join our team of dedicated and highly qualified professionals! If you are interested in a fulfilling career in a one-of-a-kind premium high profile position, you have picked the right position!

 

What you’ll be doing:

 

  • The safe and secure control and custody of individuals in all the work sites and at other locations (e.g., hospitals, hearings, etc.) as required by the CBSA
  • Complying with and applying all CBSA policies and POSOPS, and ensuring all individuals follow site specific rules
  • Monitoring and controlling designates areas inside and outside the resources assigned work location
  • Following CBSA building emergency procedures
  • Admitting individuals to the IHC or other CBSA facilities
  • Conducting intake (logging and itemization of personal effects) and decontamination of individuals belongings
  • Using CBSA-approved search methods
  • Communication using radios that comply with all provincial and federal regulations
  • Completing report and forms as required
  • Applying use of force principles and methods for intervention when handling individuals
  • Using metal detectors and x-ray technology
  • Monitoring individual’s behavior through active engagement and using verbal de-escalation techniques, as required
  • Entire outer perimeter is safe and secure. Reporting verbally and in writing.
  • Ensuring all illegal items or substance are removed from an individual’s personal belongings upon admission at Admission & Discharge
  • Admitting visitors to the IHC and advising specific rules and policies
  • Keeping up-to-date records, inventories and handing all incoming and outgoing mail
  • Meeting detained and non-detained individuals at in-bound domestic flights and
  • escort them to their outbound flight
  • Escorting individuals who have voluntarily withdrawn their application to enter Canada to their outbound flight and confirm departure.
  • Transporting individuals between terminals, airline counters for check-in, baggage examination when required.
  • Retrieving incoming calls on the video reception phone and properly advise the CBSA on-duty Superintendent
  • Completing the COD package for non-detained individuals, including making a copy of the individual’s boarding pass and having them sign their COD;
  • Booking flights and checking in individuals who have been deemed inadmissible to Canada

 

What we offer:

 

    • We offer competitive wages starting at $22.20/hr
    • Comprehensive health benefits
    • We can guarantee 40 hours/week
    • Uniform provided free of charge
    • Career advancement opportunities in the security field or within the head office
    • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld
    • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus- Use of Force Training
    • Corporate discounts
    • Paid onsite training

 

 Skill Requirements:

    • Fluency in English, spoken and written. Fluency in French is an asset
    • Excellent communication, customer service and people skills
    • Previous experience in the security industry
    • Strong computer skills
    • Available to work and commute any scheduled shifts in a 24/7 operation including weekends and public holidays
    • Leadership and problem-solving skills
    • Ability to work in a stressful environment
    • Ability to stand on foot and walk for long periods of time

 

 

Career Requirements:

 

    • CBSA Enhanced Reliability
    • Contract Security Program (CSP) Reliability Status
    • Vulnerable Sector Check
    • Valid Alberta Security Guard licence
    • Full Class 5 Drivers license with clean drivers abstract
    • First Aid and PR Training with Automated External Defibrillator (AED)
    • Must be able to obtain a Transportation Canada Security Clearance (RAIC)
    • Over 18 years of age with a high school diploma or equivalent (GED)
    • Must be a Canadian Citizen or Permanent Residence
    • All GardaWorld employees are required to be fully vaccinated with a COVID-19 vaccine series, approved by Health Canada, as a condition of hire. Should you be a successful candidate, you will be required to comply with GardaWorld’s mandatory Vaccination Policy that is in effect.

 

We thank all applicants for applying. Those who are selected will be contacted for further procedure

 

GardaWorld: Make the world a safer place

GardaWorld is a global leader in the security industry, offering a wealth of opportunity to individuals looking to gain experience and develop professionally in a growing industry. We offer flexible schedules, diverse work assignments spanning multiple industries, and training and career advancement opportunities. We embrace diversity and welcome newcomers, women, students, retirees, reservists, veterans, and more to join our team, as we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.


We thank all candidates for their interest; however, we will communicate only with the selected candidates.


Job Segment:Corporate Security, Security Guard, Security Officer, Security

title: Security Guard- Full Time, Part Time and Casual Opportunities
company: Commissionaires Victoria, The Islands And Yukon
description:
$500 signing bonus for applicants with an existing security license! *

WORK WITH US, NOT FOR US

 

Join the Commissionaires!

As the only not-for-profit security company, our focus is on our employees. Over 90% of our revenues go directly back to our staff in profit share bonuses, health & dental benefits, RRSP contributions, employee recognition programs, and more.

Our recent partnership with BMO Financial Group offers our staff prime mortgage and loan rates, discounted banking options, exclusive investment options and more. Life is unpredictable, but the Commissionaires and BMO can help you to secure your future.

Frequently promoting from within, we are always looking for responsible, top performers who want to advance their careers. Our reputation is built on 80 years and our 20,000 security professionals with varied backgrounds of all ages. We are a dedicated equal opportunity employer with flexible shifts across Vancouver Island to suit every lifestyle â€“ student, parent, night owl, you name it!

As one of Canada's oldest security organizations, our security professionals keep airports, schools, government facilities, and other commercial enterprises safe. We also work with police departments and municipalities to help in keeping Canadians safe.

Reach your full potential today!

 

Location: Various sites in Nanaimo

Position Status: Full-Time, Part-Time and Casual Opportunities Available

Wage Range: $16.73/hr - $22.55/hr

Shifts: Various days, evenings, and overnight shifts

Reports to: Site Supervisor

 

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Provide superior customer service to clients and general public.
  • Provide access control and security foot patrols as needed.
  • Proactively respond to and resolve emergency situations and conflicts.
  • Complete evacuation and emergency response procedures.
  • Communicate problems or concerns to the site supervisor.
  • Possess excellent multi-tasking, problem solving, prioritizing and organizational abilities.
  • Have knowledge of occupational health and safety regulations.
  • Perform all duties with high safety standards.

REQUIRED EDUCATION, QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE

  • Must possess a valid BC Security Workers License or be willing to complete training.
  • Must be legally entitled to work in Canada.
  • Must be able to obtain a Reliability Clearance and be minimum 19 years of age.
  • Must be physically fit and able to stand for long periods at a time.
  • Must be able to work in a range of weather conditions throughout shift.
  • Must be willing to complete the online Commissionaire Qualifying Course (CQC)
  • Must be fluent in the English language - written, verbal and reading skills.
  • Must have a positive attitude with a professional demeanour, and strong interpersonal skills.
  • Have excellent attention to detail to fulfill duties and responsibilities and incident report writing.
  • Have excellent problem solving skills with an ability to handle emergency situations in a calm manner.
  • Have the ability to work independently and make sound decisions in varying situations.
  • Have a demonstrated interest and experience in serving the public.

REWARDS

  • Exclusive BMO mortgage rates, banking options, and more.
  • Opportunities for advancement.
  • Free and paid training programs. 
  • Flexible work schedule â€“ maximize work-life balance!
  • Recognition programs.  
  • Paid sick, vacation and personal needs time-off.
  • Group-life, medical & dental coverage.
  • Mental health supports and dedicated HR team. 
  • Free uniform and dry-cleaning reimbursement.
  • BC Transit Pro Pass.
  • Safety boot reimbursement.
  • Personal protective equipment provided. 
  • RRSP contributions.
  • Referral bonuses.
  • And more!

 

Commissionaires Victoria, the Islands, and Yukon proudly celebrates diversity through an inclusive work environment, and welcomes applications from candidates of all backgrounds.

* Candidates who serve for six months working a minimum of 30hrs a week will be eligible for the signing bonus.

title: Mobile Security Guard (Days/Evenings)
description:
BPS K9- is currently looking to add a Full-Time Day shift Mobile Security Agent to our professional, reliable, confident, and self-motivated team.

Shift: 9 to 12 hours.

Hours: 6am to 6pm | 12pm to 9pm.

Rotation: 4 on - 4 off.

Successful candidates will:
  • Possess a valid Alberta Security Guard License.
  • Possess a valid Class 5 Driver License. (or Equivalent)
  • Provide full 3-year Driver Abstract history. (less than 4 demerits) ** (February 2019 to Present)
  • Provide full 3-years of Insurance Claim History. (no at-fault claims) ** (February 2019 to Present)
  • Be available 7 days a week including weekends and holidays**
  • Have their own vehicle to get to the office.**
  • Be available to start immediately or soon.
  • Have previous Security experience.**
  • Fluency / proficiency in English, both written and spoken.
  • Working in all types of weather (sun, rain, snow, etc.) whether indoors or outdoors. **
  • Meeting the physical demands of the job. (extensive periods of walking, standing, stairs, etc.) **
Duties of a Mobile Security Agent include:
  • Driving a company vehicle safely and obey all traffic laws.
  • Conducting patrols, securing access points, and removing trespassers from client properties.
  • Learning and following all BPS K9 policies and procedures.
  • Reacting appropriately in stressful situations by remaining calm and non-violent.
  • Being professional while representing the company and our clients.
  • Completing detailed and accurate shift reports daily.
Candidates will be skilled in the following:
  • MS Office Word and Excel. (Basic to Intermediate) **
  • Critical thinking and problem solving for appropriately resolving issues and concerns.
  • Interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Knowledge of the Criminal Code of Canada.

Wage: Guaranteed minimum $18/hour after probation (3 months)

BPS Protective Services K-9 Inc. provides competitive compensation, benefits after 3 months, comprehensive training, reliable equipment, and supervision, and is a firm believer in equal opportunities.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent.

Salary: $17.00-$18.00 per hour.

COVID-19 considerations:
All visitors and employees must wear a mask when in the office - no mask no access
All employees must wear a mask when on shift and working indoors or when unable to maintain social distancing - no exceptions

title: Experienced Security Officers - Downtown Vancouver High Profile Location - FULL TIME
description:
British Columbia's Leading Security Solutions Provider


Experienced Security Officers - Downtown Vancouver High Profile Location - FULL TIME Employment Opportunity

Fusion Security, a fast-growing and respected security company, is searching for experienced, professional security officers with excellent customer service skills for a high-profile building in Downtown Vancouver.

What you will be doing:

  • Responding to client requests and on-site emergencies
  • High-visibility patrolling to guard against theft, trespassing, vandalism and fire
  • Providing face-to-face customer service to tenants and patrons
  • Recording and tracking all security-related activity on the premises
  • Responding to alarms and conducting investigations

Who you are:

  • A positive and proactive individual who is also a strong team player
  • An experienced security officer with minimum two years' experience
  • A good communicator (written, verbal, and listening)
  • Possess a valid BC Security License
  • Have 24/7 availability
  • Capable of standing/walking for long periods of time
  • Have excellent customer service & professional deportment
  • Certified in OFA (Occupational First Aid) Level 1
  • Certified in AST (Advanced Security Training)

Also, you should know:

  • Starting minimum wage for this position is for professional, experienced candidates with higher wage considered based on applicable qualifications including years of experience, demonstrated customer service skills, and OFA and AST certifications.
  • We offer an awesome health benefits package (we pay 100% of your medical premiums)
  • We pay for your continuous training and development
  • You get a free gym membership

We want to speak with you. Please apply through our website by clicking on the following: Job Listings - Fusion Security Jobs (prevueaps.com). We thank all applicants for their interest, but we will only be contacting those who are qualified for this position.

Fusion Security is an Equal Opportunity Employer and welcomes applications from candidates, regardless of race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, sex, age or mental or physical disability. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all stages of the recruitment process.

Suite 160 - 4321 Still Creek Drive, Burnaby, BC

description:

title: Loss Control Specialist - Canada
description:
About Our Company:

Are you looking for a challenging career that rewards hard work and success?   AFIRM is committed to finding outstanding people who have the ambition and willingness to learn in order to succeed.   The most successful candidates will be detail-oriented, self-motivated and possess strong problem-solving and analytical skills.  

 

AFIRM is the national leader in risk control, consulting services as well as commercial and residential inspections.   We provide our exceptional services to insurers, brokers, risk managers and government agencies.

 

Equal Opportunity Employer

The H.W. Kaufman Group of companies is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other status or condition protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

 

 

Qualifications:

Our Inspectorsâ€™ education and training:

 

  • Inspectors come from all walks of life with their own experience and background
  • AFIRM provides its candidates and Inspectors with a valuable set of skills unlike any other
  • They have all successfully completed AFIRMâ€™s own self-directed, on-line training certification program
  • Continue to hone their skills with AFIRMâ€™s on-going distance learning opportunities

 

 

Our Inspectorsâ€™ work environment      

 

  • As independent contractors with AFIRM, our inspectors work from home
  • They travel to various locations from their home base to assigned locations
  • Work evenings and weekends whenever required to maintain customer satisfaction

 

 

What all our Inspectors must have:

 

  • A reliable vehicle
  • Mobile phone
  • Windows based computer
  • Internet connection (high speed preferably)
  • Digital camera or smart phone that takes high quality digital pictures
Responsibilities:

 

AFIRM is a global leader in Loss Prevention and Premium Audit with Canadian locations in Richmond Hill and Montreal.   We are currently seeking independent Loss Prevention service contractors.

 

Our Loss Control Representatives (Inspectors) visit various property locations on behalf of the ownerâ€™s insurance company with a goal to minimize potential losses.   There is no selling involved.   Requests for inspection are received directly from the insurance companies.

 

Our successful Inspectors are:

 

  • Outgoing and independent
  • Curious and inquisitive by nature
  • Self-motivated strivers
  • Well organized and manage their time efficiently
  • Focused on quality of service
  • Competent computer skills with good input speed & accuracy
  • Skilled at writing well

 

What our Inspectors do:

 

  • Take responsibility for; and organize their assignments
  • Schedule their own appointments with property owners
  • Travel to the location
  • Tour the property and collect information (Residential and Commercial)
  • Identify potential areas of loss such as fire, theft and liability
  • Take photographs and measure buildings
  • Prepare a pre-define Loss Control report of the property using AFIRMâ€™s own web-based platform

title: Loss Prevention Officer
description:
London Drugs is looking for highly capable security and investigations professionals for our Loss Prevention team. You will find state of the art technology, training and support, and a high integrity group of people committed to excellence on our team.

Not just a job…a communitya partnershipa team

You’ll experience them all at London Drugs. As one of Canada’s fastest-growing and most successful retail chains, we know what it takes to build a satisfying career. We are seeking innovative, customer focused people to join our team!

Opportunity:Loss Prevention Officer
 Responsibilities:The Loss Prevention Officer position is well-suited for a highly capable security and investigations professional that thrives on working within a team environment.

Duties include:
  • Shifts at store locations conducting surveillance, investigation, and maintenance of loss prevention systems
  • Identifying areas of loss and working on team shrink reduction plans
  • Detection and apprehension of persons committing criminal offences against the company
  • Securing evidence, report writing & document preparation for court testifying purposes
  • Special assignments including lock repair, key control, staff awareness and orientation
  • Maintaining the overall security of our locations
QualificationsWe have an extensive in-house training program (in BC we are an accredited BST training provider). While we are eager to develop our people, candidates should possess the following skills and qualifications:
  • Demonstrated ability to stay calm and respond with good judgment in emergency situations
  • A commitment and history of protecting people and property in a safe and legal manner
  • Demonstrated ability to work under strict confidentiality
  • High ethical standards and a commitment to personal and professional integrity
  • Good command of the English language, both written and verbal, required for report writing and court testimony
  • A valid Class 5 driver’s license and own vehicle
  • Availability and willingness to work at all locations and surrounding areas
  • Previous Loss Prevention experience or other related experience within the Criminal Justice system would be an asset
  • Previous security related education, professional accreditation, first aid and first responder training is an asset
  • Use of force and restraining device training is an asset
  • Provincial security worker license, or the ability to obtain one before commencing work
Availability RequirementThis is a Full Time position, 40 hours per week.  Employees must be available to work a flexible schedule, Monday through Sunday, for day and evening shifts.

We are an equal opportunity employer. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work applicable to this position and are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. Be advised, London Drugs DOES NOT use third party recruitment services.

London Drugs may collect, use, and/or disclose your personal information (including the information in this application) where it is reasonable for establishing, managing or terminating an employment relationship. This includes the use or disclosure of your personal information to persons inside or external to our organization, for the purpose of checking references or gathering other information to support an assessment of your candidacy.

To protect yourself, do not respond to unsolicited job offers from individuals or e-mail addresses, and never disclose any sensitive details about your identity (including personal or financial) to anyone you do not know or trust or on any unverified website, or website you do not trust.
