title: Security Supervisor
description:
Securiguard is a 'different kind of employer'. We focus on the individual security professional and believe that if we treat you right, you will treat our customer right. We want to be your 'Employer of Choice'

Due to expansion, Securiguard is accepting resumes for the position of Security Supervisor, for a High Profile Corporate site in Pickering.

Pay rate: $20/hour

Required Skills & Qualifications

  • Minimum of 1 year Security Supervisory experience in a fast-paced professional environment
  • Minimum of 1 year Security Guard Experience
  • Must have strong English communication skills both written and verbal
  • Must be reliable, available, of sound character and be able to work in a team environment or independently
  • Must be physically fit and able to stand, sit or walk for extended periods
  • Must be able to work overnight shifts
  • Ability to handle multiple situations and use sound judgment to handle emergency situations
  • Must be knowledgeable on various systems including but not limited to CCTV various types, elevators, mechanical alarms, intercom systems, fire and life safety systems, control room systems
  • Must be able to provide coaching, training, and update site Manager on new trainees progress
  • Act as a Liaison between our client and Securiguard
  • Will be required to keep track of staff training records, expiry dates and book for training when required
  • Ensure the facility's Safety and Emergency procedures are followed in response to fire alarms and other site emergencies
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle stressful situations
  • Ability to write and compile reports on computer software in a timely manner
  • Available to work overtime hours as required
  • Knowledge and Application of Section 494(c) of the Canadian Criminal Code: Trespass to Property Act, and other related legislation

We thank all applicants for their interest in working with Securiguard however; only qualified candidates will be contacted. We encourage you to apply again at any time in the future.

title: Security Guard - London Public Library - Temporary Full Time - London, ON
description:
Position:                           Security Guard

Site:                                   London Public Library – East London Branch - 2016 Dundas St. East               

City:                                   London, Ontario

Status:                             Temporary Full Time

Hours:                               Tues-Thurs 1300-2100hrs, Fri. 1000-1800hrs, Sat. 0900-1700hrs   

Pay Rate:                          $16.00/hr.

 

Are you interested in starting a career in a fast paced and growing industry? As a provider of security services to clients with complex security needs, Paladin Security Group is offering an exciting career opportunity for you to give back to your community, while developing skills for future careers. Our training programs are also a leader in the security industry, and they will help prepare you for advancements, as well as build your resume for a potential career in law enforcement.

Position Overview:

Assignments include:

  • Opening and closing the facility, patrolling interior and exterior spaces and controlling access/egress, providing security escorts, as required
  • Operating, accessing, and occasionally monitoring the video surveillance equipment
  • Monitoring and responding to alarm systems
  • Guards shall at all times maintain a high standard of civility, deportment and appearance, and, guards shall proactive a philosophy of compassion and de-escalation
  • Supporting staff, volunteers, tenants and Library patrons by knowing and understanding the Library’s Rules of Conduct and being able to apply these rules in a fair, dignified and positive manner.
  • Reporting Incidents using the Library’s Incident Reporting Tool
  • Resolving incidents according to the Library’s guidelines, instructions, procedures, and reporting on incidents according to established procedures
  • Protecting all persons (including public, staff, volunteers, on-site contractors, tenants) and property in the event of medical, fire, disaster, severe weather, bomb threat, evacuation and other emergencies
  • Functioning as the Primary First Aid service provider at the Central Library. This might include the ability to administer a blocking medication such as Naloxone, and use of devices such as automated external defibrillators (AED), and
  • All Emergency occurs are to be reported to the Library as soon as possible.  A written incident report, using the Library’s Incident Reporting Tool, shall be provided to the Library on any or all minor/major incidents

 

Preferred skills/qualifications:

  • Valid Ontario Security Guard licence (required)
  • Valid First Aid & CPR certificate
  • Exceptional Customer Service Skills
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office

 

Essential Job Functions:

  • Be courteous and cooperative with a high quality of customer service.
  • Good interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively at various social levels and across diverse cultures.
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Patrol assigned area on foot, as assigned, to ensure personal, building, and equipment security.
  • Communicates any concerns/issues with Site Supervisor.

Requirements:

  • Physical demands include excessive walking such as walking up to 5km in a shift and standing.
  • Working knowledge of the Trespass to Property Act.
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Excellent communication skills with a focus on customer service along with good computer abilities are all core requirements.
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills. Ability to write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy.
  • Patrol assigned area on foot, as assigned, to ensure personal, building, and equipment security.
  • Watch for and report irregularities by completing investigations and incident reports, such as security breaches, facility and safety hazards, and emergency situations; contact emergency responders, such as police, fire, and/or ambulance personnel, as required.
  • Sustain effective relationships with key stakeholders and provide specialized security services by enforcing rules and regulations when required.
  • Offer support to any person in need such as providing good customer service when providing a security presence, such as providing direction, responding to emergency situation involving violent individuals and injuries.
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned. 

Why Choose Paladin:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

title: Full-Time Security Guard Position
description:
Securiguard is currently looking for a Full-Time Security Professional, that is experienced and motivated, to join our team in Cambridge, Ontario.

Requirements:

  • Ontario Security License
  • First Aid/CPR
  • WHIMS
  • Previous experience in Security and customer service
  • Ability to work days, nights, and weekends

Duties for this Key Role include:

  • Access control at gate house
  • Recording and reporting accurate details of events
  • Greet and record entry and exit of drivers and deliveries
  • Be capable of professionally representing Securiguard and our clients
  • Superior communication skills both verbally and written
  • Keen Customer Service and interpersonal skills

We offer:

  • Extensive Training
  • Extended Health Benefits for (subject to benefit waiting periods)
  • Recognition Programs & Events

We are committed to building an environment of respect and personal growth for all our staff. We support this commitment with highly competitive compensation and benefits, comprehensive training, reliable equipment, and supportive supervision as well as great opportunities for advancement, community involvement and work/life balance practices.

About Us:

Securiguard is Western Canada's leading provider of corporate security through a focus on customer service, creating value for our clients and caring for our people, community, and the environment. With offices in Vancouver, the Fraser Valley, Victoria, Nanaimo, Kelowna, Terrace, Edmonton and Ontario, we employ over 2000 security officers and offer a comprehensive selection of services. Security solutions provided include uniformed security guards, concierge officers, bike patrollers, vehicle patrols, K9 patrol and detection units and loss prevention specialists.

Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer, and we value the diversity of our staff. We are committed to building a facilitative environment of respect, inclusiveness, and career growth.

title: Education Security Guard, North York
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

If you are seeking a job where no two days are the same, this one is for you! As a Education Security Guard on Mobile Patrol and Desk duties, you will be working in a variety of Education Institutions in Toronto.     

We provide people with growth opportunities. 30% of our frontline employees are promoted to become part of our operation teams. 

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in Toronto now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, we have a position that will accommodate your needs and help you reach your goals.  

What's in it for you?

  • We offer a pay rate of $18.00/hour & comprehensive health benefits  

  • Uniform provided free of charge 

  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld 

  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus like Use of Force training 

What does a Mobile/Desk Security Guard in Toronto do?

  • Patrolling in a variety of settings (mobile and foot) 

  • Enforcing property rules, city by-laws, and other applicable laws 

  • Deterring and responding to incidents on the property 

  • Responding to various types of emergencies 

  • Desk duties and Access Control

Qualifications to become a Mobile/Desk Security Guard in Toronto

  • A valid Ontario security license and CPR-C/first aid card 

  • A valid G or G2 driver's license and a clean driving abstract

  • Previous Mobile Security experience (required)

  • Comfortable using computers

  • Available to work flexible hours, specifically 3 positions available for the following shifts: 2 positions for Full-time Overnights 8PM-8AM on various days including weekends, and 1 position for Part-time Days Saturday-Sunday 8AM-8PM

  • Have a clear criminal background and driving record 

  • Be eligible to work in Canada

title: Senior Security Guard - Part-Time on Sunshine Coast
description:
At Fusion Security, we believe in providing valued service, building strong relationships within communities, and safeguarding the interests of the public and our stakeholders.

Fusion Security is currently seeking a talented professional for a Senior Security Guard role on the beautiful Sunshine Coast for Full-time and Part-time positions. The successful candidate will be responsible for protecting and securing the property, personnel, and information against theft and vandalism, controlling access to facilities, maintaining order and safety under the designate authority of the owner of the property.

CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS

  • A valid BC Security Guard license
  • Minimum of 2 years commitment to the position
  • Minimum of 2+ years of relevant experience in the security and customer service industry
  • Excellence in customer service and professional deportment
  • Excellent documentation and communication skills
  • A high standard for safety and a passion for security
  • Additional certifications are an asset: Occupational First Aid level 1, 2, 3, AST, etc.

JOB DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

The successful candidate must perform some or all of the following duties:

  • Patrol assigned areas to guard against theft, shoplifting, vandalism and fire
  • Provide assistances to tenants, visitors and contractors
  • Operate security control-room equipment to monitor establishment activities
  • Ensure the establishment safety and emergency procedures are followed, responding to fire alarms, bomb threats and other on-site emergencies
  • Observe and keep records of security related activities in written or electronic form
  • Respond to and investigates alarms from businesses as required
  • Enforce regulations of an establishment to maintain order in accordance with site manuals and client instructions
  • Look for and act on opportunities to provide added value and exceptional customer service in all interactions and/or duties
  • Analyzing information and evaluations results to choose the best solution and solve problems

BENEFITS AND COMPENSATION

  • Full time starting pay rate, $20.00 to $21.00 per hour
  • Bi-weekly pay
  • Vacation and paid time off
  • Uniform issued by the company
  • Security License renewal reimbursement
  • Additional training opportunities
  • Relocation assistance
  • Housing assistance

If you feel this opportunity matches with your qualifications, please submit your current and updated resume complete with a cover letter detailing reasons for your interest as well as why you think you would be the best candidate for the position.

(Part 1, Section 2) of the Security Services Act of British Columbia requires all Security Services Workers are required to hold a valid BC Security License to be employed or employable. Any applicant without a valid BC Security License will be automatically disqualified. For more information please visit: http://www.bclaws.ca/civix/document/id/consol20/consol20/00_07030_01#section2

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in Fusion Security, however only formal applications will be considered and only selected candidates will be contacted for an interview. Any applicant that does not meet availability requirements will not be considered suitable for the role.

description:

  • Detain and interview persons apprehended for shoplifting in accordance with local laws and company procedures. Complete investigative case packages and statements regarding all internal/external theft and fraud for local police agencies

title: Loss Control Specialist - Canada
description:
About Our Company:

Are you looking for a challenging career that rewards hard work and success?   AFIRM is committed to finding outstanding people who have the ambition and willingness to learn in order to succeed.   The most successful candidates will be detail-oriented, self-motivated and possess strong problem-solving and analytical skills.  

 

AFIRM is the national leader in risk control, consulting services as well as commercial and residential inspections.   We provide our exceptional services to insurers, brokers, risk managers and government agencies.

 

Equal Opportunity Employer

The H.W. Kaufman Group of companies is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other status or condition protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

 

 

Qualifications:

Our Inspectorsâ€™ education and training:

 

  • Inspectors come from all walks of life with their own experience and background
  • AFIRM provides its candidates and Inspectors with a valuable set of skills unlike any other
  • They have all successfully completed AFIRMâ€™s own self-directed, on-line training certification program
  • Continue to hone their skills with AFIRMâ€™s on-going distance learning opportunities

 

 

Our Inspectorsâ€™ work environment      

 

  • As independent contractors with AFIRM, our inspectors work from home
  • They travel to various locations from their home base to assigned locations
  • Work evenings and weekends whenever required to maintain customer satisfaction

 

 

What all our Inspectors must have:

 

  • A reliable vehicle
  • Mobile phone
  • Windows based computer
  • Internet connection (high speed preferably)
  • Digital camera or smart phone that takes high quality digital pictures
Responsibilities:

 

AFIRM is a global leader in Loss Prevention and Premium Audit with Canadian locations in Richmond Hill and Montreal.   We are currently seeking independent Loss Prevention service contractors.

 

Our Loss Control Representatives (Inspectors) visit various property locations on behalf of the ownerâ€™s insurance company with a goal to minimize potential losses.   There is no selling involved.   Requests for inspection are received directly from the insurance companies.

 

Our successful Inspectors are:

 

  • Outgoing and independent
  • Curious and inquisitive by nature
  • Self-motivated strivers
  • Well organized and manage their time efficiently
  • Focused on quality of service
  • Competent computer skills with good input speed & accuracy
  • Skilled at writing well

 

What our Inspectors do:

 

  • Take responsibility for; and organize their assignments
  • Schedule their own appointments with property owners
  • Travel to the location
  • Tour the property and collect information (Residential and Commercial)
  • Identify potential areas of loss such as fire, theft and liability
  • Take photographs and measure buildings
  • Prepare a pre-define Loss Control report of the property using AFIRMâ€™s own web-based platform

title: Loss Prevention Officer
description:
Do you like working in a stimulating environment where you can make the most of your experience and make a positive difference? Join a team of dedicated and highly skilled professionals who work together to detect and intercept suspects who may commit theft and fraud in retail businesses. We are looking for Full Time and Part Time Loss Prevention Officers to work at a retail store with hourly pay rate being $19.50. 

What's in it for you?

  • Career advancement opportunities
  • Excellent benefits
  • Diverse work assignments
  • Free training and professional development courses

What does a Loss Prevention Officer in Sarnia do?

  • This is a plain clothed/undercover Loss prevention role
  • Detain and interview persons apprehended for shoplifting in accordance with local laws and company procedures. Complete investigative case packages and statements regarding all internal/external theft and fraud for local police agencies
  • Conduct floor walks and support the store by conducting tests and providing feedback regarding all aspects of safety, security and shrink standards
  • Complete & compile necessary evidence and paperwork in a timely and professional manner
  • Document all violations and communicate with Store Manager
  • Report all incidents of unsafe store conditions and associate conduct 
  • Take immediate action to remedy any imminent safety hazard
  • Represent the store in a positive manner
  • Record daily activities and complete incident reports
  • Maintaining safe and secure environment for customers and employees by patrolling and monitoring premises and personnel

Qualifications to become a Loss Prevention Officer in Sarnia

  • Valid Security License is required
  • Prior security experience as a Loss Prevention Officer is required
  • Must be proficient in the English language, spoken, written, and via electronics
  • Superior observational skills
  • Knowledge of all steps to an arrest/detainment of a shoplifter
  • Some knowledge of applicable laws & laws enforcement
  • Excellent communication and customer service skills
  • Meticulous record keeping, report writing and observation skills
  • Use of Force certification is an asset

title: Loss Prevention Officer
description:
London Drugs is looking for highly capable security and investigations professionals for our Loss Prevention team. You will find state of the art technology, training and support, and a high integrity group of people committed to excellence on our team.

Not just a job…a communitya partnershipa team

You’ll experience them all at London Drugs. As one of Canada’s fastest-growing and most successful retail chains, we know what it takes to build a satisfying career. We are seeking innovative, customer focused people to join our team!

Opportunity:Loss Prevention Officer 

Responsibilities:The Loss Prevention Officer position is well-suited for a highly capable security and investigations professional that thrives on working within a team environment.

Duties include:
  • Shifts at store locations conducting surveillance, investigation, and maintenance of loss prevention systems
  • Identifying areas of loss and working on team shrink reduction plans
  • Detection and apprehension of persons committing criminal offences against the company
  • Securing evidence, report writing & document preparation for court testifying purposes
  • Special assignments including lock repair, key control, staff awareness and orientation
  • Maintaining the overall security of our locations
QualificationsWe have an extensive in-house training program (in BC we are an accredited BST training provider). While we are eager to develop our people, candidates should possess the following skills and qualifications:
  • Demonstrated ability to stay calm and respond with good judgment in emergency situations
  • A commitment and history of protecting people and property in a safe and legal manner
  • Demonstrated ability to work under strict confidentiality
  • High ethical standards and a commitment to personal and professional integrity
  • Good command of the English language, both written and verbal, required for report writing and court testimony
  • A valid Class 5 driver’s license and own vehicle
  • Availability and willingness to work at all locations and surrounding areas
  • Previous Loss Prevention experience or other related experience within the Criminal Justice system would be an asset
  • Previous security related education, professional accreditation, first aid and first responder training is an asset
  • Use of force and restraining device training is an asset
  • Provincial security worker license, or the ability to obtain one before commencing work
Availability RequirementThis is a Full Time position, 40 hours per week.  Employees must be available to work a flexible schedule, Monday through Sunday, for day and evening shifts.

We are an equal opportunity employer. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work applicable to this position and are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. Be advised, London Drugs DOES NOT use third party recruitment services.

London Drugs may collect, use, and/or disclose your personal information (including the information in this application) where it is reasonable for establishing, managing or terminating an employment relationship. This includes the use or disclosure of your personal information to persons inside or external to our organization, for the purpose of checking references or gathering other information to support an assessment of your candidacy.

To protect yourself, do not respond to unsolicited job offers from individuals or e-mail addresses, and never disclose any sensitive details about your identity (including personal or financial) to anyone you do not know or trust or on any unverified website, or website you do not trust.

title: London Public Library - Security Guard - London, ON
description:
Position Overview:

Assignments include:

  • Opening and closing the facility, patrolling interior and exterior spaces and controlling access/egress, providing security escorts, as required
  • Operating, accessing, and occasionally monitoring the video surveillance equipment
  • Monitoring and responding to alarm systems
  • Guards shall at all times maintain a high standard of civility, deportment and appearance, and, guards shall proactive a philosophy of compassion and de-escalation
  • Supporting staff, volunteers, tenants and Library patrons by knowing and understanding the Library’s Rules of Conduct and being able to apply these rules in a fair, dignified and positive manner.
  • Reporting Incidents using the Library’s Incident Reporting Tool
  • Resolving incidents according to the Library’s guidelines, instructions, procedures, and reporting on incidents according to established procedures
  • Protecting all persons (including public, staff, volunteers, on-site contractors, tenants) and property in the event of medical, fire, disaster, severe weather, bomb threat, evacuation and other emergencies
  • Functioning as the Primary First Aid service provider at the Central Library. This might include the ability to administer a blocking medication such as Naloxone, and use of devices such as automated external defibrillators (AED), and
  • All Emergency occurs are to be reported to the Library as soon as possible.  A written incident report, using the Library’s Incident Reporting Tool, shall be provided to the Library on any or all minor/major incidents

 

Why Choose Paladin:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

Preferred skills/qualifications:

  • Valid Ontario Security Guard licence (required)
  • Valid First Aid & CPR certificate
  • Exceptional Customer Service Skills
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office

 

Essential Job Functions:

  • Be courteous and cooperative with a high quality of customer service.
  • Good interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively at various social levels and across diverse cultures.
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Patrol assigned area on foot, as assigned, to ensure personal, building, and equipment security.
  • Communicates any concerns/issues with Site Supervisor.

Requirements:

  • Physical demands include excessive walking such as walking up to 5km in a shift and standing.
  • Working knowledge of the Trespass to Property Act.
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Excellent communication skills with a focus on customer service along with good computer abilities are all core requirements.
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills. Ability to write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy.
  • Patrol assigned area on foot, as assigned, to ensure personal, building, and equipment security.
  • Watch for and report irregularities by completing investigations and incident reports, such as security breaches, facility and safety hazards, and emergency situations; contact emergency responders, such as police, fire, and/or ambulance personnel, as required.
  • Sustain effective relationships with key stakeholders and provide specialized security services by enforcing rules and regulations when required.
  • Offer support to any person in need such as providing good customer service when providing a security presence, such as providing direction, responding to emergency situation involving violent individuals and injuries.
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.

title: Industrial Security - North Coast
description:
Canada's Leading Provider of Corporate Security is seeking full-time security professionals for positions in the Oil and Gas sector on the North Coast of BC.


At Securiguard, we believe that every person deserves a safe environment to live, visit and work. Our vision is to be the best at making people feel safe by inspiring our staff to "believe they can make a difference" in everything they do.


If you are looking for a stimulating and rewarding entry level position with great potential for career advancement in corporate security and asset protection, this role is for you.


Hours of work: 12-hour shifts, 2 weeks in/out schedule

Locations: Lejac, Houston, Burns Lake, Kitimat, Terrace, Prince George, Fraser Lake, Fort Fraser, New Hazelton, Hazelton, Smithers, and Over Arching North Coast

In this position you will:

  • Provide excellent customer service to both the client and site visitors
  • Provide emergency response:
    • Respond to incident/emergency situations and follow required protocols
    • Coordinate with the police or emergency personnel when required
  • Provide visual security presence:
    • Detect and deter unauthorized persons
  • Access control at terminals and project sites
  • Patrol designated areas
  • Conduct radio check ins
  • Identify and report safety hazards
  • Report security breaches
  • Submit a daily written report
  • Maintain consistent records using company issued notebook
  • Adhere to Securiguard's core Values, Vision, Mission statement
  • Perform regularly scheduled site duties as required by client's Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs)
  • Report Frequent shift activities

The Ideal Candidate will have:

  • A valid BC Security License
  • A Class 5 BC Driver's License with a clean driving abstract
  • A personal vehicle to travel to and from the job site
  • Will be able to pass the drug and alcohol test
  • Excellent English communication skills to write descriptive and factual daily reports

Additional Considerations:

Completion of any of the following certifications:

  • OFA 1 (Occupational First Aid)
  • WHMIS (Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System)
  • CSTS (Construction Safety Training System
  • PCST (Pipeline Construction Training)

Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Extended health and dental benefits - conditions apply
  • Discounted Cineplex movie tickets
  • Recognition programs & events
  • Flexible schedules
  • Additional training & Uniforms

We're only accepting applications from individuals seeking full-time employment with the ability to get yourself to and from site.

To learn more about Securiguard, our values, and career paths available, please visit our website:

https://www.securiguard.com/careers-and-training/

More about Securiguard:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea their team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.

At Securiguard, we believe you can make a difference - by making people feel safe, caring for the people around you, supporting your community, and by making a positive impact on the environment.

title: High Profile Tactical Mall Security Guard
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

If you are looking for a job where you will be working with the public, this is the job for you! As a Mall Security Guard, you will play a key role in ensuring the safety of workers, businesses and the public!  

We provide people with growth opportunities. 30% of our frontline employees are promoted to become part of our operation teams. 

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in Calgary now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, we have a position that will accommodate your needs and help you reach your goals. This is the first step into that stepping stone into your law enforcement career!

What's in it for you?

  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits  

  • We can guarantee 40 hours/week 

  • Uniform provided free of charge 

  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld 

  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus and in-class Defensive Tactical training 

  •  Corporate Discounts 

What does a Security Guard in Calgary do?

  • Facilitate access to restricted areas for authorized persons 

  • Patrol the site on foot and by car 

  • Monitor closed circuit cameras  

  • Coordinate response to incidents  

  • Respond to telephone calls received by the security department

  • High level customer service to all customers and tenants 

  • Removal of unauthorized individuals 

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in Calgary

  • Valid Alberta security guard license and first aid card 

  • Available to work flexible hours days, evenings and nights   

  • Have a clear criminal background 

  • Be eligible to work in Canada 

  • Criminal justice or police foundations diploma is an asset 

  • Team player

  • Excellent verbal and written communication

  • SSCAL

title: Security/Doorman
description:
The Brew Crew is a team of devoted, compassionate, and ambitious individuals that are hungry for what the future holds. We believe it's our duty to provide all of our employees with a safe, fun-filled work environment with endless advancement opportunities.

 

Let's talk about the Security | Doorman position!

 

What will your responsibilities be as Security?:

  • Greet guests appropriately and check for legal identification
  • Protect companyâ€™s property and staff by maintaining a safe and secure environment
  • Observe for signs of crime or disorder and investigate disturbances
  • Act lawfully in direct defense of life or property
  • Take accurate notes of unusual occurrences
  • Report in detail any suspicious incidents
  • Patrol building and perimeter
  • Monitor and control access at building entrances

Requirements

  • Excellent knowledge of public safety and security procedures/protocols
  • Surveillance skills and detail orientation
  • Integrity and professionalism

Welcome to The Canadian Brewhouse (https://youtu.be/fyKRJzJWiu4), Canada's fastest-growing independent restaurant group! We are proud of being the only Canadian-themed sports bar in town, and we know that without our incredible teams we wouldn't be a fraction of where we are today. Our teams live and breathe our Core Values; these are 6 key principles that influence all of our decisions as an organization.

  • Take Care of Each Other and Yourself
  • Think Like a Customer
  • Support Your Community

The Brew Crew is a team of devoted, compassionate, and ambitious individuals that are hungry for what the future holds. Let us tell you more about why you should join the best team in Canada, today!

title: Security Guard in Kingston
description:
Overview:

We are North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider with over 300,000 phenomenal employees. At Allied Universal ®, we pride ourselves on fostering a promote from within culture. There are countless examples of individuals who began their career as Security Professionals and today hold positions on our senior leadership team. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, and vision coverage, life insurance, employee assistance programs, and more! We also offer company paid uniforms and part-time and flexible schedules!

Job Description:

Allied Universal is seeking Professional Security Guards  in Canada.    

 

QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS:

  • Be at least 18 years of age with high school diploma or equivalent
  • Legally entitled to work in Canada

title: Concierge Security Guard - Part Time Position
description:
Regal Security Inc. is currently seeking a Part-Time Concierge Security Guard at one of our sites located in the Toronto, ON area.

 

The Ideal Candidate must have: 

 

  • Full-time availability to work all days of the week and schedules that will consist of afternoons, overnight and weekend shifts â€“ including holidays.

 

  • Demonstrated past experience in either a senior security role or supervisor
     
  • Customer service-driven individual
     
  • Clear English communication skills in all areas (verbal and written)
     
  • Detailed and thorough record-keeping (Memo book, incident reports, etc)
     
  • Keen observation and attentiveness
     
  • Professional physical deportment and presentation
     
  • Decision Making, Reliable, Common Sense and exceptional judgment

 

Job Duties and Responsibilities:

 

  • Provide outstanding and personalized customer service as a front line representative of Regal Security
     
  • Act as Regalâ€™s day to day point of contact for our individual client and field staff inquiries
     
  • Supervise contracted site to ensure security staff are meeting company standards in terms of uniforming, training and site procedures
     
  • Operate and maintain an organized environment
     
  • Enforce property rules and regulations in order to maintain the security and safety of our clients and their assets
     
  • Ensure enforcement of Trespass to Property Act
     
  • Safely operate and maintain company and client issued equipment and supplies
     
  • Respond to major incidents on property and aid security staff with managing the situation (fire, flood, medical issue and criminal activity)
     
  • Ensure that safety and emergency protocols are completed in response to Fire Alarms and other Site Emergencies
     
  • Complete walking patrols and inspections of facilities and equipment as required
     
  • Review, know and follow post orders as identified for site representing
     
  • Maintain a safe working environment and follow the facilities health and safety procedures
     
  • Duties as otherwise assigned

 

Qualifications:

 

  • Valid Ontario Security License
     
  • Valid First Aid/CPR Certification

 

  • Valid WHMIS Certification
     
  • Secondary School Diploma or equivalent and higher (preference will be given to those with a Criminal Justice or Business post-secondary education)
     
  • Proficient in the use of various computer programs (ie. Microsoft Office, Gmail) and able to adapt and learn new program.

 

Compensation:

 

  • Pay Rate will depend upon candidates' s previous work experience and expertise.

 

  • Health Benefits are available for full-time employees upon completion of 3 months probation
     

Why choose Regal Security?

 

Regal Security Inc. is an established and growing security company that offers a vast array of professional and dependable security guard services across the Greater Toronto Area and Southwest Ontario.

 

Our Everyday Superheroâ„¢ guards are selected and trained to protect the clientâ€™s assets, property, employees, and tenants, using a custom-designed security solution for every client within the sectors we serve.

 

Every member of the Regal security team, and every service that is carried out, is directed by the Regal guiding principle: Strength & Honorâ„¢. With this in mind, Regalâ€™s security guards are known as Everyday Superheroesâ„¢ â€“ they are friendly, well-trained and, most importantly, proud, as they go above and beyond the call of duty to uphold Regalâ€™s high standards.

 

â€œTHE REGAL SECURITY MISSION IS â€œYOUR PEACE OF MINDâ€â„¢â€

 

Thank you for your application, unfortunately, due to the high volume of applicants, only those deemed eligible for an interview will be contacted. All candidates will be communicated to by phone or email for the purposes of the recruitment process.

 

Regal Security Inc. welcomes all candidates equally and encourages all qualified candidates, from women and men including persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and Aboriginal persons, to apply.

title: CBSA Security Guard
description:
CBSA Security Guard

Business Unit: Security Services
Career Area: Security Guard
Location: 

Edmonton, AB, CALeduc, AB, CAFort Saskatchewan, AB, CA

More than a job – 26% of our corporate employees at GardaWorld Canada started as frontline employees. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset and you’re ambitious, this could be just the beginning of your career journey with GardaWorld!

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in Edmonton now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, you can be sure that we have a position that can fill your needs and goals. Join our team of dedicated and highly qualified professionals! If you are interested in a fulfilling career in a one-of-a-kind premium high profile position, you have picked the right position!

 

What you’ll be doing:

 

  • The safe and secure control and custody of individuals in all the work sites and at other locations (e.g., hospitals, hearings, etc.) as required by the CBSA
  • Complying with and applying all CBSA policies and POSOPS, and ensuring all individuals follow site specific rules
  • Monitoring and controlling designates areas inside and outside the resources assigned work location
  • Following CBSA building emergency procedures
  • Admitting individuals to the IHC or other CBSA facilities
  • Conducting intake (logging and itemization of personal effects) and decontamination of individuals belongings
  • Using CBSA-approved search methods
  • Communication using radios that comply with all provincial and federal regulations
  • Completing report and forms as required
  • Applying use of force principles and methods for intervention when handling individuals
  • Using metal detectors and x-ray technology
  • Monitoring individual’s behavior through active engagement and using verbal de-escalation techniques, as required
  • Entire outer perimeter is safe and secure. Reporting verbally and in writing.
  • Ensuring all illegal items or substance are removed from an individual’s personal belongings upon admission at Admission & Discharge
  • Admitting visitors to the IHC and advising specific rules and policies
  • Keeping up-to-date records, inventories and handing all incoming and outgoing mail
  • Meeting detained and non-detained individuals at in-bound domestic flights and
  • escort them to their outbound flight
  • Escorting individuals who have voluntarily withdrawn their application to enter Canada to their outbound flight and confirm departure.
  • Transporting individuals between terminals, airline counters for check-in, baggage examination when required.
  • Retrieving incoming calls on the video reception phone and properly advise the CBSA on-duty Superintendent
  • Completing the COD package for non-detained individuals, including making a copy of the individual’s boarding pass and having them sign their COD;
  • Booking flights and checking in individuals who have been deemed inadmissible to Canada

 

What we offer:

 

    • We offer competitive wages starting at $22.20/hr
    • Comprehensive health benefits
    • We can guarantee 40 hours/week
    • Uniform provided free of charge
    • Career advancement opportunities in the security field or within the head office
    • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld
    • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus- Use of Force Training
    • Corporate discounts
    • Paid onsite training

 

 Skill Requirements:

    • Fluency in English, spoken and written. Fluency in French is an asset
    • Excellent communication, customer service and people skills
    • Previous experience in the security industry
    • Strong computer skills
    • Available to work and commute any scheduled shifts in a 24/7 operation including weekends and public holidays
    • Leadership and problem-solving skills
    • Ability to work in a stressful environment
    • Ability to stand on foot and walk for long periods of time

 

 

Career Requirements:

 

    • CBSA Enhanced Reliability
    • Contract Security Program (CSP) Reliability Status
    • Vulnerable Sector Check
    • Valid Alberta Security Guard licence
    • Full Class 5 Drivers license with clean drivers abstract
    • First Aid and PR Training with Automated External Defibrillator (AED)
    • Must be able to obtain a Transportation Canada Security Clearance (RAIC)
    • Over 18 years of age with a high school diploma or equivalent (GED)
    • Must be a Canadian Citizen or Permanent Residence
    • All GardaWorld employees are required to be fully vaccinated with a COVID-19 vaccine series, approved by Health Canada, as a condition of hire. Should you be a successful candidate, you will be required to comply with GardaWorld’s mandatory Vaccination Policy that is in effect.

 

We thank all applicants for applying. Those who are selected will be contacted for further procedure

 

GardaWorld: Make the world a safer place

GardaWorld is a global leader in the security industry, offering a wealth of opportunity to individuals looking to gain experience and develop professionally in a growing industry. We offer flexible schedules, diverse work assignments spanning multiple industries, and training and career advancement opportunities. We embrace diversity and welcome newcomers, women, students, retirees, reservists, veterans, and more to join our team, as we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.


We thank all candidates for their interest; however, we will communicate only with the selected candidates.


Job Segment:Corporate Security, Security Guard, Security Officer, Security

title: Security Officer - Hard Rock Casino
description:
Requisition #HRCV-SEC-011-2375909
Job LocationCanada-British Columbia-Coquitlam
Job StreamSecurity and Surveillance
Site LocationHard Rock Casino Vancouver
Job TypePermanent, Part-Time
Number of Positions1

Expiry Date09-Jun-2022
Travel RequiredNot Required
Educational RequirementsN/A
Languages RequiredEnglish
Requisition #HRCV-SEC-011-2375909
Job LocationCanada-British Columbia-Coquitlam
Job StreamSecurity and Surveillance
Site LocationHard Rock Casino Vancouver
Job TypePermanent, Part-Time
Number of Positions1
Posting Date07-Apr-2022
Expiry Date09-Jun-2022
Travel RequiredNot Required
Educational RequirementsN/A
Languages RequiredEnglish
Job Description

Are you passionate about safety and guest experience? Looking for a place to put your skills to play making guests safe and special? Hard Rock Casino Vancouver is looking for personable, energetic and passionate individuals for the position of full-time Security Officer. Under the supervision of the Security Manager, you will be responsible for protecting patrons, team members, and assets to ensure the integrity of the gaming floor and company property by patrolling and monitoring the entire casino site, interior and exterior, controlling access to keys and restricted areas; and other duties as assigned. This position requires shift schedule flexibility.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Greet guests and control access to the Casino
  • Monitor, document and report internal and external violations, unsafe conditions, potential hazards, suspicious persons or activities; prepares electronic statements via a non-gaming record keeping system
  • Observe various transactions, slot drops, chip/hopper fills and transfers; escorts cash and cash equivalent movements; may assist in fills, credits, drops and key control
  • Tag and report found property, transfers items to Lost and Found
  • Conduct regular patrols of the facility interior and exterior as directed
  • Perform identification checks and escort guests or employees as required
  • Respond to emergency situations as requested; while minimizing casino liabilities
  • May perform electronic surveillance of non-gaming facilities, including exterior and adjacent properties at some locations
  • Refer disputes to the Security Supervisor
  • Enroll guests in the Self-Exclusion program
  • Ensure compliance with licensing laws, and other statutory regulations
  • Perform other duties as assigned or directed

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Strong communication and public relations skills
  • Second language an asset
  • Previous experience or training in security an asset
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize
  • Exceptional organizational, problem solving and conflict resolution capabilities
  • Good knowledge of MS Office and Outlook
  • Certification in Occupational First Aid Level 2 and WHMIS an asset
  • Completion of Gaming Security Officer training an asset
  • High school diploma required, post secondary education an asset
  • Provides a Great Experience and Memory to all guests, both external and internal
  • Live GCC’s Values on the job: Integrity, Team Engagement, Drive to Succeed, Service Excellence, Citizenship
  • The ability to successfully obtain a criminal record and credit check through the Gaming Policy and Enforcement Branch (GPEB)

If this sounds like a GREAT opportunity for you, we invite you to submit an application today.

Great Canadian Gaming Corporation is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we welcome all qualified applicants to apply to join our team of unique contributors. We accommodate people with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process and applicants are encouraged to advise Human Resources in advance if an accommodation is required. We thank all applicants for their interest, and will contact those qualified to continue in the recruitment process.

title: Security Officer - Bilingual (French)
description:
Our Story

Commissionaires BC is a Canadian, not-for-profit security/enforcement organization that has been in business since 1927. Our mandate is to give back to those who served and continue to serve in our communities and country.

Commissionaires is the leading supplier of security services for the federal government. From access control and front desk security, to 24/7 control room operations, we provide high-level security services to our federal clients.

We are looking for bilingual (French) guards to work Monday to Friday 0830-1630 at a Government site in Abbotsford.

Whatâ€™s in it for you?

-Gain valuable experience as a stepping stone into a law enforcement career

-Competitive hourly wages

-Chance to work at high profile site

-Free uniforms

-Training and support to succeed in your role

Youâ€™re a good fit if you haveâ€¦

-Demonstrated interest and experience in serving the public

-Positive and professional attitude, with strong customer service skills

-Proficient with Microsoft Office, and equipment such as faxes and photocopiers

-Excellent attention to detail and problem-solving skills

-Ability to handle emergency situations in a calm and professional manner

-Excellent multi-tasking, prioritizing, and organizational abilities

-Ability to work independently and make sound decisions under pressure

-Physically fit, and able to conduct extensive foot patrols both indoors and outdoors in a range of weather conditions

Some of your responsibilities include:

-Interior and exterior patrols

-Access Control and visitor verification

-Crowd control and management

-Responding to potential protesters or media

-Directing incoming mail to relevant staff

-First responder in building emergencies such as evacuations and medical emergencies

-Following specific emergency and alarm response protocols. 

Your Must Haves â€¦

- Valid BC Security License

-Have lived in Canada for a minimum of 5 years due to clearance requirements

-OFA 1 or willing to obtain one

-Excellent English oral and written skills

title: Security Guard- Esquimalt Graving Dock
company: Commissionaires Victoria, The Islands And Yukon
description:
$500 signing bonus for applicants with an existing security license! *

WORK WITH US, NOT FOR US

 

Join the Commissionaires!

As the only not-for-profit security company, our focus is on our employees. Over 90% of our revenues go directly back to our staff in profit share bonuses, health & dental benefits, RRSP contributions, employee recognition programs, and more.

Our recent partnership with BMO Financial Group offers our staff prime mortgage and loan rates, discounted banking options, exclusive investment options and more. Life is unpredictable, but the Commissionaires and BMO can help you to secure your future.

Frequently promoting from within, we are always looking for responsible, top performers who want to advance their careers. Our reputation is built on 80 years and our 20,000 security professionals with varied backgrounds of all ages. We are a dedicated equal opportunity employer with flexible shifts across Vancouver Island to suit every lifestyle â€“ student, parent, night owl, you name it!

As one of Canada's oldest security organizations, our security professionals keep airports, schools, government facilities, and other commercial enterprises safe. We also work with police departments and municipalities to help in keeping Canadians safe.

Reach your full potential today!

 

Location: Esquimalt Graving Dock

Hours of Work: Various Days, Afternoons, and Overnight Shifts Available

Starting Wage: $17.72/hr (includes 2.5% RRSP cash)

Reports to: Site Supervisor and Client Services Manager

 

Job Responsibilities

  •    Provide superior customer service to clients and general public.
  •    Provide access control at points of entry.
  •    Proactively respond to and resolve emergency situations and conflicts.
  •    Complete evacuation and emergency response procedures.
  •    Communicate problems or concerns to the site supervisor.
  •    Possess excellent multi-tasking, problem solving, prioritizing and organizational abilities.
  •    Have knowledge of occupational health and safety regulations.
  •    Perform all duties with high safety standards.

Required Education, Qualifications and Experience

  •    Must be a Canadian citizen or landed immigrant and have lived in Canada for at least 5 years.
  •    Must be able to obtain a Reliability Clearance.
  •    Must possess a valid B.C. security workers licence.
  •    Must be physically fit and able to stand for long periods at a time.
  •    Must be able to work in a range of weather conditions throughout shift.
  •    Must be fluent in the English language - written, verbal and reading skills.
  •    Must have a positive attitude with a professional demeanour, and strong interpersonal and customer service skills.
  •    Have excellent attention to detail to fulfill duties and responsibilities and incident report writing.
  •    Have excellent problem solving skills with an ability to handle emergency situations in a calm and professional manner.
  •    Have the ability to work independently and make sound decisions in varying situations.
  •    Have a demonstrated interest and experience in serving the public.

Rewards & Perks

  • Exclusive BMO mortgage rates, banking options, and more.
  • Opportunities for advancement.
  • Free and paid training programs. 
  • Flexible work schedule â€“ maximize work-life balance!
  • Recognition programs.  
  • Paid sick, vacation and personal needs time-off.
  • Group-life, medical & dental coverage.
  • Mental health supports and dedicated HR team. 
  • Free uniform and dry-cleaning reimbursement.
  • BC Transit Pro Pass.
  • Safety boot reimbursement.
  • Personal protective equipment provided. 
  • RRSP contributions.
  • Referral bonuses.
  • And more!

 

Commissionaires Victoria, the Islands, and Yukon proudly celebrate diversity through an inclusive work environment and welcome candidates from all backgrounds.

* Candidates who serve for six months working a minimum of 30hrs a week will be eligible for the signing bonus.

title: Mobile Security Guard (Overnights)
description:
BPS K9 is looking for security professionals to join our reliable, confident, and self-motivated team of Mobile Security Agents in a Part Time position

Shifts: 12-hour overnights.

Successful candidates will:
  • Have a valid Alberta Security Guard License.
  • Have a valid Class 5 Driver License (or Equivalent).
  • Provide full 3-year Driver Abstract history. (less than 4 demerits)** ( February 2019 to Present)
  • Provide full 3-year Insurance Claim Report. (February 2019 to Present )
  • Have their own vehicle to get to the office.
  • Be available to start immediately or soon.
  • Have previous Security experience. (an asset)
  • Be able to work independently and in a team environment.
  • Meet the physical demands of the job. (extensive walking, standing, stairs, and driving)***
  • Fluency/proficiency in English language, both written and spoken.
  • Working in all types of weather. (sun, rain, snow, etc.)***
Duties of a Mobile Security Agent include:
  • Driving a company vehicle safely and obey all traffic laws.
  • Conducting foot patrols, securing access points, and removing trespassers.
  • Reacting appropriately in stressful situations by remaining calm and non-violent.
  • Being professional while representing the company and clients at all times.
  • Completing detailed and accurate shift reports daily.
Candidates will be skilled in the following:
  • MS Office Word and Excel. (Basic to Intermediate)**
  • Critical thinking and problem solving.
  • Safe and defensive driving at night and during snow/rain/fog etc.
  • Interpersonal and communication skills.

Wage: Guaranteed minimum $18/hour after probation (3 months)

BPS Protective Services K-9 Inc. provides competitive compensation, comprehensive training, reliable equipment, and supervision, and is a firm believer in equal opportunities.

COVID-19 considerations:
All visitors and employees must wear a mask when in the office - no mask no access
All employees must wear a mask when on shift and working indoors or when unable to maintain social distancing - no exceptions.




    About BPS Protective Services K-9:

    Since 1999, BPS K-9 has been serving Alberta’s security needs. Over the last 15 plus years, we have grown to become Western Canada’s largest K-9 security provider. With offices located in Calgary and Edmonton, an extensive mobile fleet, state of the art security equipment, and our professionally trained handler and dog teams, we are able to ensure that our clients assets stay protected and that they feel safe

title: Senior Security Guard - Full-time at Sunshine Coast
description:
At Fusion Security, we believe in providing valued service, building strong relationships within communities, and safeguarding the interests of the public and our stakeholders.

Fusion Security is currently seeking a talented professional for a Senior Security Guard role on the beautiful Sunshine Coast for Full-time and Part-time positions. The successful candidate will be responsible for protecting and securing the property, personnel, and information against theft and vandalism, controlling access to facilities, maintaining order and safety under the designate authority of the owner of the property.

CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS

  • A valid BC Security Guard license
  • Minimum of 2 years commitment to the position
  • Minimum of 2+ years of relevant experience in the security and customer service industry
  • Excellence in customer service and professional deportment
  • Excellent documentation and communication skills
  • A high standard for safety and a passion for security
  • Additional certifications are an asset: Occupational First Aid level 1, 2, 3, AST, etc.

JOB DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

The successful candidate must perform some or all of the following duties:

  • Patrol assigned areas to guard against theft, shoplifting, vandalism and fire
  • Provide assistances to tenants, visitors and contractors
  • Operate security control-room equipment to monitor establishment activities
  • Ensure the establishment safety and emergency procedures are followed, responding to fire alarms, bomb threats and other on-site emergencies
  • Observe and keep records of security related activities in written or electronic form
  • Respond to and investigates alarms from businesses as required
  • Enforce regulations of an establishment to maintain order in accordance with site manuals and client instructions
  • Look for and act on opportunities to provide added value and exceptional customer service in all interactions and/or duties
  • Analyzing information and evaluations results to choose the best solution and solve problems

BENEFITS AND COMPENSATION

  • Full time starting pay rate, $20.00 to $21.00 per hour
  • Bi-weekly pay
  • Vacation and paid time off
  • Uniform issued by the company
  • Security License renewal reimbursement
  • Additional training opportunities
  • Relocation assistance
  • Housing assistance

If you feel this opportunity matches with your qualifications, please submit your current and updated resume complete with a cover letter detailing reasons for your interest as well as why you think you would be the best candidate for the position.

(Part 1, Section 2) of the Security Services Act of British Columbia requires all Security Services Workers are required to hold a valid BC Security License to be employed or employable. Any applicant without a valid BC Security License will be automatically disqualified. For more information please visit: http://www.bclaws.ca/civix/document/id/consol20/consol20/00_07030_01#section2

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in Fusion Security, however only formal applications will be considered and only selected candidates will be contacted for an interview. Any applicant that does not meet availability requirements will not be considered suitable for the role.

title: Loss Prevention Specialist: Full Time (6 Month Contract)
description:
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • This is a plain clothed/undercover positon in multiple locations
  • Detain and interview persons apprehended for shoplifting in accordance with local laws and company procedures. Complete investigative case packages and statements regarding all internal/external theft and fraud for local police agencies
  • Conduct floor walks and support the stores by conducting tests and providing feedback regarding all aspects of home depot’s safety, security and shrink standards
  • Check physical security of The Home Depot facilities to prevent and deter theft/fraudulent activity
  • Represent the Home Depot in a professional manner throughout all court-related procedures
  • Maintain an open channel of communication with store management and all associates
  • Partner with store management to drive LP issues
  • Effectively utilize CCTV and Electronic Article Surveillance (EAS) systems
  • Conduct surveillance when required

CANDIDATE QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Must fulfil minimum time-in-position and performance management code requirements of M
  • Excellent analytical skills as well as strong verbal
  • Valid Security and Drivers Licenses as required by the Province
  • Must have access to reliable transportation

COMPENSATION:

  • Competitive pay
  • Travel time and mileage expensed
  • Profit Sharing and Stock Purchase Plan
  • Paid training and Career Development
  • Health and Dental Benefits
  • RRSP Contributions
  • Certain travel requirements will be reimbursed through submitted expenses

title: Loss Control Specialist - Canada
description:
About Our Company:

Are you looking for a challenging career that rewards hard work and success?   AFIRM is committed to finding outstanding people who have the ambition and willingness to learn in order to succeed.   The most successful candidates will be detail-oriented, self-motivated and possess strong problem-solving and analytical skills.  

 

AFIRM is the national leader in risk control, consulting services as well as commercial and residential inspections.   We provide our exceptional services to insurers, brokers, risk managers and government agencies.

 

Equal Opportunity Employer

The H.W. Kaufman Group of companies is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other status or condition protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

 

 

Qualifications:

Our Inspectorsâ€™ education and training:

 

  • Inspectors come from all walks of life with their own experience and background
  • AFIRM provides its candidates and Inspectors with a valuable set of skills unlike any other
  • They have all successfully completed AFIRMâ€™s own self-directed, on-line training certification program
  • Continue to hone their skills with AFIRMâ€™s on-going distance learning opportunities

 

 

Our Inspectorsâ€™ work environment      

 

  • As independent contractors with AFIRM, our inspectors work from home
  • They travel to various locations from their home base to assigned locations
  • Work evenings and weekends whenever required to maintain customer satisfaction

 

 

What all our Inspectors must have:

 

  • A reliable vehicle
  • Mobile phone
  • Windows based computer
  • Internet connection (high speed preferably)
  • Digital camera or smart phone that takes high quality digital pictures
Responsibilities:

 

AFIRM is a global leader in Loss Prevention and Premium Audit with Canadian locations in Richmond Hill and Montreal.   We are currently seeking independent Loss Prevention service contractors.

 

Our Loss Control Representatives (Inspectors) visit various property locations on behalf of the ownerâ€™s insurance company with a goal to minimize potential losses.   There is no selling involved.   Requests for inspection are received directly from the insurance companies.

 

Our successful Inspectors are:

 

  • Outgoing and independent
  • Curious and inquisitive by nature
  • Self-motivated strivers
  • Well organized and manage their time efficiently
  • Focused on quality of service
  • Competent computer skills with good input speed & accuracy
  • Skilled at writing well

 

What our Inspectors do:

 

  • Take responsibility for; and organize their assignments
  • Schedule their own appointments with property owners
  • Travel to the location
  • Tour the property and collect information (Residential and Commercial)
  • Identify potential areas of loss such as fire, theft and liability
  • Take photographs and measure buildings
  • Prepare a pre-define Loss Control report of the property using AFIRMâ€™s own web-based platform

title: Loss Prevention Worker
description:
Your mission at GardaWorld:  

As a Loss Prevention Worker, you are responsible to ensure the security of various Retail companies.  We work in partnership with our clients to ensure the safety and security of their employees and the public.

What are the job benefits we offer you?

  • Regular wages ranging from $16to $17/hour
  • Medical benefits after 90 days
  • Career path planning and advancement opportunities
  • Paid on-the-job training
  • Ongoing training available

On a typical day, you will be responsible of:

  • Deter and apprehend shoplifters at various retail locations
  • Enforce property rules, city bi-laws, and other applicable laws
  • Deter and respond to incidents on property
  • Complete reports and memo book entries on a regular basis
  • Compile the necessary reports for court dates
  • Make arrests as required-training provided

You are the ideal candidate for this position because you possess:

  • Grade 12 diploma or equivalent
  • Valid Alberta Security License
  • Minimum 1-year experience in retail prevention/security environment
  • Excellent English communication skills both written and verbal (candidates will be tested)
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • Knowledge of the Criminal Code Powers of Arrest section
  • Knowledge of Provincial Trespass to Property Act
  • Ability to stand and walk the floor for a 6 – 8 hour period
  • Ability to be flexible to work various store locations
  • Valid First Aid/CPR, or willingness to obtain
  • Highly organized with the ability to work unsupervised

Interested? Join our workforce!  Please email your resume to

sasha.vilich@garda.com

 

CAL20

title: Loss Prevention Officer
description:
London Drugs is looking for highly capable security and investigations professionals for our Loss Prevention team. You will find state of the art technology, training and support, and a high integrity group of people committed to excellence on our team.

Not just a job…a communitya partnershipa team

You’ll experience them all at London Drugs. As one of Canada’s fastest-growing and most successful retail chains, we know what it takes to build a satisfying career. We are seeking innovative, customer focused people to join our team!

Opportunity:Loss Prevention Officer 

Responsibilities:The Loss Prevention Officer position is well-suited for a highly capable security and investigations professional that thrives on working within a team environment.

Duties include:
  • Shifts at store locations conducting surveillance, investigation, and maintenance of loss prevention systems
  • Identifying areas of loss and working on team shrink reduction plans
  • Detection and apprehension of persons committing criminal offences against the company
  • Securing evidence, report writing & document preparation for court testifying purposes
  • Special assignments including lock repair, key control, staff awareness and orientation
  • Maintaining the overall security of our locations
QualificationsWe have an extensive in-house training program (in BC we are an accredited BST training provider). While we are eager to develop our people, candidates should possess the following skills and qualifications:
  • Demonstrated ability to stay calm and respond with good judgment in emergency situations
  • A commitment and history of protecting people and property in a safe and legal manner
  • Demonstrated ability to work under strict confidentiality
  • High ethical standards and a commitment to personal and professional integrity
  • Good command of the English language, both written and verbal, required for report writing and court testimony
  • A valid Class 5 driver’s license and own vehicle
  • Availability and willingness to work at all locations and surrounding areas
  • Previous Loss Prevention experience or other related experience within the Criminal Justice system would be an asset
  • Previous security related education, professional accreditation, first aid and first responder training is an asset
  • Use of force and restraining device training is an asset
  • Provincial security worker license, or the ability to obtain one before commencing work
Availability RequirementThis is a Full Time position, 40 hours per week.  Employees must be available to work a flexible schedule, Monday through Sunday, for day and evening shifts.

We are an equal opportunity employer. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work applicable to this position and are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. Be advised, London Drugs DOES NOT use third party recruitment services.

London Drugs may collect, use, and/or disclose your personal information (including the information in this application) where it is reasonable for establishing, managing or terminating an employment relationship. This includes the use or disclosure of your personal information to persons inside or external to our organization, for the purpose of checking references or gathering other information to support an assessment of your candidacy.

To protect yourself, do not respond to unsolicited job offers from individuals or e-mail addresses, and never disclose any sensitive details about your identity (including personal or financial) to anyone you do not know or trust or on any unverified website, or website you do not trust.
