title: CF Industries - Spare - Front Counter Guard - Courtright
description:
To:                                     All Security Personnel

From:                                 People & Culture Coordinator

Date:                                 March 1, 2022

Closing Date:                   Mar. 7, 2022

Re:                                     Job Posting

Position:                           Front Counter - Main Gate Security Guard

Site:                                   CF Industries

City:                                   Courtright, ON

Status:                               Spare / Back-Up

Hours:                               (0700- 1630/0630-1630/ 0500 -1700 / 1700 -0500 hours)

Pay Rate:                          $15.73/hr. – 17.91/hr. wages based on levelling system

Position Overview:

Supervision of security incumbents and the security and safety of the Courtright Location. They must ensure all personnel entering the Courtright location has a valid site specific safety orientation and/ or is registered appropriately upon arrival.

Essential Job Functions:

  • Maintain professionalism, confidence and confidentiality.
  • Provide security services at the Courtright CF Nitrogen Complex, maintaining order and the protection of assets, information and employees onsite.
  • Maintain a professional relationship with all personnel entering the site.
  • Administrative and reception duties; forward incoming calls to the appropriate department or personnel. Greet all visitors and communicate with the appropriate location personnel upon their arrival.
  • Responsible for site access control; issues site access cards and photo IDs as per the site Access Management Program. Ensure profiles are current and up to date information is complete.  Complete proper documentation as required.  Report any security breaches involving the program.
  • Responsible to conduct site Safety Orientation video for approved individuals prior to entry to site or annual renewals. Assist EH&S with Contractor Management Program.
  • Responsible to consult with ISNetworld Application program/ Short List to ensure contractor companies onsite are in compliance with insurance and WSIB prior to access on site. Report infractions to Procurement and/or EHS department.
  • Responsible for the signing out and issuance of keys onsite i.e. office keys, vehicle keys as per the site Access Management Program.   Complete proper documentation as required. Report any security breaches involving the program.
  • Responsible for the signing out and issuance of vehicle passes onsite as per the site Access Program.  Complete proper documentation as required.Report any security breaches involving the program.
  • Responsible for Material Gate / Personal passes onsite. Must review the pass for appropriate signatures, inspect the item(s) and sign the pass to allow item(s) to leave the Courtright location.
  • Assist in all shipping procedures. Must be fluent in the operation of the CF Direct shipping program.
  • Conduct Vehicle/ Seal inspections as required or requested.
  • Report all observed hazardous or unsafe conditions to the Security Supervisor/ Security Manager or appropriate shift supervisor including communicating this information to the oncoming security shift.
  • Log and report all unusual activities to the other security guards, Security Supervisor/ Security Manager.
  • Conduct interior and exterior patrols of the site; day shift only.Patrol grounds to protect against possible hazards through exercising sound judgment and problem-solving skills. Conduct random site security checks foot patrols.
  • Assist in any site investigation.
  • Write informative and detailed reports (Daily, Incident, and Accident) on all security matters.
  • Conduct Bag checks as required or requested.
  • Responsible to deliver outgoing mail and pickup incoming mail.
  • Responsible for miscellaneous deliveries or pickups as requested by the Security Supervisor/ Security Manager.
  • In the event of an emergency, follow emergency response procedures and directives from Security Supervisor/ Security Manager, Incident Commander, or ER Coordinator.
  • Review and continue to educate oneself on site emergency procedures and first aid/ CPR and all site medical equipment.
  • Responsible to administer first-aid/ CPR when required.
  • Continuously stay up to date on all Everbridge, CAER and Site Watch notification systems. Responsible to initiate notifications when directed to do so. 
  • Continuously stay up to date US/ Canadian Border Agency, Canadian Government Agencies, Canadian Coast Guard regulations and laws.
  • Send out via fax overtime meals and call and confirm the orders. Report any security breaches involving the program.
  • Accept after hours deliveries as per directives. Log and communicate arrival.
  • Responsible for monitoring and reporting any noncompliance with any EH&S/ HR policies and procedures
  • Unlock offices and gates as requested by the Security Supervisor/ Security Manager.
  • Assist/ conduct in any monthly Security inspections as required by the site Security Management Program.
  • Assist in the management of the Security Management Program.
  • Designated the back up to the Maingate Guard position; hours will be flexible up scheduling needs. Will cover Maingate Guard vacations, and time off.
  • Complete all assigned training or reviews as required.
  • Attend mandatory security training meetings.
  • Any other duties assigned by the Security Supervisor or Security Manager and/or site FSO

 

Security Guards are required to complete a Drug & Alcohol test for incidents that occur on client property.

 

Requirements:

  • Must possess a valid Ontario Driver’s License.
  • Must possess a valid First Aid training certificate.
  • Must possess a valid Transportation of Dangerous Goods training certificate.
  • Completion of Law and Security or equivalent considered an asset.
  • Must possess a minimum of 1 year’s directly related experience in the security and safety field; preferably in the fertilizer or petrochemical processing industry.
  • Demonstrate knowledge of safety and environmental regulations and issues.
  • Strong attention to detail with high focus on accuracy.
  • Strong communication skills both written and verbal.
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills.
  • Demonstrate the ability to work safely and in compliance with site safety, health and environmental standards and practices.
  • Demonstrate leadership capabilities.
  • Strong analytical and decision-making abilities.
  • Ability to deal effectively and diplomatically with employees, contractors, visitors etc.
  • Ability to work flexible hours

Working Conditions:

  • This position is mostly stationed out of the main gate security office
  • Indoor/ Outdoor tasks and duties
  • Moderate physical activities related to tasks and duties
  • Standing for extended periods of time is required
  • Computer work throughout the day.
  • Primarily day shift also shift work as back up main gate position

Physical Conditions:

  • This position is mostly stationed out of an office; the incumbent must be able to be mobile, with physical demands pertaining to standing for extended periods of time, climbing stairs, building tours, emergency response and computer work throughout the day.

Highlights:

  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement.

 

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. Immunization Record
  2. Double Vaccinated
  3. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  4. Proficient in English (both oral and written)
  5. Vulnerable Sector Check may be required

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  3. Use of Force
  4. Report Writing
  5. Additional courses as assigned

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

 

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Mental Illness Awareness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned

 

 

 

Should you have any questions on this process, kindly contact LeeAnne Feddes, People and Culture Coordinator at

lfeddes@paladinsecurity.com

title: Home Improvement Store Security Guards
description:
Are you passionate about making people feel safe and providing excellent customer service? Are you a skilled deterrent and want to master your security skills? If so, this is the perfect opportunity for you.


Securiguard is currently seeking security professionals to join our Retail Security Guard Team.


Who we are:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea their team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.


Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Free Uniforms
  • Paid Training
  • Health and Dental Benefits (subject to benefit waiting period)
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS Babylon. Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians (subject to waiting period)
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Recognition Programs & Events

What would you do:

  • Deliver exceptional customer service
  • Patrol interior and exterior of the store
  • Write reports on job-related activities
  • Provide access control as required
  • Approach and mitigate difficult situations
  • Provide protection to customers and premises
  • Coordinate and liaise with police and other emergency service providers during an emergency
  • Report and document safety hazards to operation managers

What would you bring:

  • Valid BC Security License
  • Previous customer service experience is required
  • Previous security experience is preferred
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Capable of standing and patrolling throughout the shift
  • Comfortable communicating through a two-way radio

Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer, and we value the diversity of our staff. We are committed to building a facilitative environment of respect, inclusiveness, and career growth.

title: Health Care Security Guard
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

If you are seeking a job where you can help people and make an impact, this one is for you!  As a security guard in the hospital sector, you will ensure the safety of patients, staff, and visitors. A great way to contribute to making your community safer!

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in Calgary, Okotoks and Cochrane now more than ever!  We provide people with growth opportunities as 30% of our frontline employees are promoted to become part of our operation teams.

With our wide variety of contracts, we have a position that will accommodate your needs and help you reach your goals. Great step into any law enforcement career!

What's in it for you?

  • Pay Rate: $18-$19/hr 
  • Guaranteed 40 hours per week
  • Must be able to work 12 hr rotational shifts days and nights
  • Uniform provided
  • Training programs for development in the hospital sector and the security industry
  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus courses (such as managing aggressive behavior, dealing with people with mental health issues, and conflict resolution)

What does a Security Guard do?

  • Assist clinical staff members with checking ID's and vaccine passports
  • Enforce safety procedures and standards
  • Helping visitors find their way around the hospital
  • Completing daily reports
  • Monitoring CCTV systems.
  • Responding as necessary to assist and support Community Peace officers
  • Preventative patrols, including foot and/or mobile patrol of exterior and interior perimeters

Qualifications:

  • Valid Alberta Security License 
  • Excellent customer service and communication skills
  • Some Health Care sites require a N95 mask to be fit tested, which will require no facial hair for those working on site. Please note, if you are unable to remove your facial hair, you will not be selected for this site
  • Strong de-escalation abilities and problem-solving mindset
  • Emergency or Standard first aid is an asset

 

 

SSCAL

GardaWorld: Make the world a safer place

GardaWorld is a global leader in the security industry, offering a wealth of opportunity to individuals looking to gain experience and develop professionally in a growing industry. We offer flexible schedules, diverse work assignments spanning multiple industries, and training and career advancement opportunities. We embrace diversity and welcome newcomers, women, students, retirees, reservists, veterans, and more to join our team, as we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.


We thank all candidates for their interest; however, we will communicate only with the selected candidates.

We also offer company paid uniforms and part-time and flexible schedules!

title: Security Guard with Reliability Clearance - Casual
description:
** RELIABILITY STATUS SECURITY CLEARANCE ( or must be willing to obtain) ** 


Regal Security Inc. is currently seeking a Casual Security Guard at one of our sites located in Toronto, ON.
 

The Ideal Candidate must have: 
 

  • RELIABILITY STATUS SECURITY CLEARANCE ( or must be willing to obtain) 
  • Customer service driven individual
  • Clear English communication skills in all areas (verbal and written)
  • Detailed and thorough record-keeping
  • Keen observation and attentiveness
  • Professional physical deportment and presentation
  • Decision Making, Reliable, Common Sense, and exceptional judgment
     

Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Provide outstanding and personalized customer service as a front line representative of Regal Security
  • Operate and maintain an organized front desk environment
  • Enforce property rules and regulations to maintain the security and safety of our clients and their assets
  • Oversee the logging in and out of crucial site equipment (Radios, Keys)
  • Monitor CCTV and card access systems
  • Ensure that safety and emergency protocols are completed in response to Fire Alarms and other Site Emergencies
  • Complete walking patrols and inspections of facilities and equipment
  • Review, know and follow post orders as identified for site representing
  • Maintain a safe working environment and follow the facilities health and safety procedures


Qualifications

  • Valid Ontario Security License
  • Valid First Aid/CPR Certification
  • Valid WHMIS Certification
  • Secondary School Diploma or equivalent and higher (preference will be given to those with a Criminal Justice or Business post-secondary education)
  • Proficient in the use of various computer programs (i.e. Microsoft Office, Gmail) and able to adapt and learn new programs
     

Compensation:

  • Starting pay rate of $17.00 an hour
  • Health Benefits are available for full-time employees upon completion of 3 months probation.
     

Why choose Regal Security?
 

Regal Security Inc. is an established and growing security company that offers a vast array of professional and dependable security guard services across the greater Toronto area and southwest Ontario.


Our Everyday Superheroâ„¢ guards are selected and trained to protect assets, property, employees, tenants, and residents using a custom-designed security solution for every client within the sectors we serve.
 

Every member of the Regal security team, and every service that is carried out, is directed by the Regal guiding principle: Strength & Honorâ„¢. With this in mind, Regalâ€™s security guards are known as Everyday Superheroesâ„¢ â€“ they are friendly, well-trained and, most importantly, proud, as they go above and beyond the call of duty to uphold Regalâ€™s high standards.
 

â€œTHE REGAL SECURITY MISSION IS â€œYOUR PEACE OF MINDâ€â„¢.â€
 

Thank you for your application. Unfortunately, only those deemed eligible for an interview will be contacted due to the high volume of applicants. However, all candidates will be communicated to by phone or email for the recruitment process.
 

Regal Security Inc. welcomes all candidates equally and encourages all qualified candidates, from women and men, including persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and Aboriginal persons, to apply.

title: High Profile Security Guard
description:
High Profile Security Guard

Business Unit: Security Services
Career Area: Security Guard
Location: 

Saskatoon, SK, CA

Are you interested in a fulfilling career in a One Of A Kind Property? Working with a multi faced team, delivering the best of Customer Service and Security in Saskatoon? 

We are hiring HIGH PROFILE SECURITY GUARDS to ensure the positive customer service atmosphere of a TRIPLE A PROPERTY.

What we offer:

  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits
  • Career advancement opportunities in the security field or within the head office
  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld
  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus 
  • Corporate discounts

On a typical day, you will be responsible of:

  • Interior and exterior patrols
  • Enforce property rules, city bi-laws, and other applicable laws
  • Deter and respond to incidents on property
  • Maintain a presence to ensure the safety and security of all persons on site
  • Communicate regularly with patrons/clients
  • Complete reports and memo book entries on a regular basis

Career Requirements:

  • Saskatchewan provincial security guard training certificate
  • Minimum of 1-year security experience is an asset
  • Able to handle excessive amounts of patrolling
  • Excellent English communication skills both written and verbal

  • Valid First Aid/CPR, or willingness to obtain
  • Professional deportment
  • All GardaWorld Security Guard employees are required to be fully vaccinated with a COVID-19 vaccine series, approve by Health Canada, as a condition of hire. Should you be the successful candidate, you will be required to comply with GardaWorld’s mandatory Vaccination Policy that is in effect

title: Security Guard- Department of National Defence
company: Commissionaires Victoria, The Islands And Yukon
description:
WORK WITH US, NOT FOR US

 

Join the Commissionaires!

As the only not-for-profit security company, our focus is on our employees. Over 90% of our revenues go directly back to our staff in profit share bonuses, health & dental benefits, RRSP contributions, employee recognition programs, and more.

Our recent partnership with BMO Financial Group offers our staff prime mortgage and loan rates, discounted banking options, exclusive investment options and more. Life is unpredictable, but the Commissionaires and BMO can help you to secure your future.

Frequently promoting from within, we are always looking for responsible, top performers who want to advance their careers. Our reputation is built on 80 years and our 20,000 security professionals with varied backgrounds of all ages. We are a dedicated equal opportunity employer with flexible shifts across Vancouver Island to suit every lifestyle â€“ student, parent, night owl, you name it!

As one of Canada's oldest security organizations, our security professionals keep airports, schools, government facilities, and other commercial enterprises safe. We also work with police departments and municipalities to help in keeping Canadians safe.

Reach your full potential today!

 

Location: Department of National Defense (Esquimalt Dockyard)

Shifts: Various days, evenings, and overnight shifts

Reports to: Site Supervisor

Starting Wage: $16.73/hr (includes 2.5% RRSP cash)

 

Job Responsibilities

  • Provide superior customer service to clients and the general public.
  • Provide access control and security foot/mobile patrols as needed.
  • Proactively respond to and resolve emergency situations and conflicts.
  • Complete evacuation and emergency response procedures when necessary.
  • Using mobile phones and basic computer programs.
  • Communicate problems or concerns to the site supervisor.
  • Possess excellent multi-tasking, problem-solving, prioritizing and organizational abilities.
  • Know occupational health and safety regulations â€“ training provided.
  • Perform all duties with high safety standards.

Required Education, Qualifications and Experience

  • Must be legally entitled to work in Canada.
  • Ability to remain alert while on duty. 
  • Ability to work in a range of weather conditions throughout shift.
  • Possess or be willing to attain a valid BC security worker's license.
  • Be comfortable using computers.
  • Fluent in the English language - written, verbal and reading skills.
  • Have a positive attitude with a professional demeanour.
  • Have excellent attention to complete incident report writing.
  • Have excellent problem-solving skills. 
  • Comfortable handling emergencies in a calm manner â€“ training & support will be provided.
  • Ability to work independently and make sound decisions in varying situations.

Rewards & Perks

  • Exclusive BMO mortgage rates, banking options, and more.
  • Opportunities for advancement.
  • Free and paid training programs. 
  • Flexible work schedule â€“ maximize work-life balance!
  • Recognition programs.  
  • Paid sick, vacation and personal needs time-off.
  • Group-life, medical & dental coverage.
  • Mental health supports and dedicated HR team. 
  • Free uniform and dry-cleaning reimbursement.
  • BC Transit Pro Pass.
  • Safety boot reimbursement.
  • Personal protective equipment provided. 
  • RRSP contributions.
  • Referral bonuses.
  • And more!

title: Security Officer
description:
Requisition #010-2022-2373371
Job LocationCanada-Ontario-Milton
Job StreamSecurity and Surveillance
Site LocationElements Casino Mohawk
Job TypePermanent, Part-Time
Expiry Date
Travel RequiredNot Required
Educational RequirementsHigh School
Languages RequiredEnglish
Requisition #010-2022-2373371
Job LocationCanada-Ontario-Milton
Job StreamSecurity and Surveillance
Site LocationElements Casino Mohawk
Job TypePermanent, Part-Time
Expiry Date
Travel RequiredNot Required
Educational RequirementsHigh School
Languages RequiredEnglish
On-Going Opportunities Description

The Security Officer’s role is to protect the company’s assets while being a welcoming ambassador to the Casino. Security
Officers will protect all guests and team members against theft, fraud, vandalism and abuse while delivering the highest
level of service and respect to patrons and colleagues. You will perform a number of varying duties throughout your shift,
including controlling access to the facility and sensitive areas, escorting visitors, assisting departments, lost and found,
and monitoring and recording within a daily log and assigned notebook. You may also be required to provide first aid and
medical attention. At all times, you must be aware of the gaming operations, and you will work under the Alcohol and
Gaming Commission of Ontario (AGCO) regulations and comply with all applicable laws, policies and procedures.
The successful candidate will possess:
• Ability to exceed internal and external guest expectations through timely, effective and service-oriented
communication;
• Two (2) years of experience working with the public in a service role or in the service industry;
• Excellent problem solving and conflict resolution capabilities;
• High school diploma or equivalent required, post-secondary education an asset;
• Previous experience or training in security an asset;
• A willingness to learn, develop and achieve new skills for personal and professional development;
• Computer literacy in MS Office;
• Ability to successfully obtain Smart Serve certification;
• Inquisitive, investigative mind, able to identify suspicious behaviours /transactions and make sound judgments
based on this;
• Able to organize data with great accuracy;
• Knowledge of privacy legislation an asset;
• A current First Aid/CPR certification;
• The ability to obtain registration as a Category 2 Gaming Assistant with the Alcohol and Gaming Commission of
Ontario.
INTERESTED APPLICANTS MUST FORWARD AN INTERNAL APPLICATION FORM TO
onmohrecruitment@elementsmohawk.com BY 5:00 P.M. ON THE DEADLINE.
Great Canadian Gaming Corporation is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we welcome all qualified
applicants to apply to join our team of unique contributors. We accommodate people with disabilities throughout the
recruitment and selection process and applicants are encouraged to advise Human Resources in advance if an
accommodation is required. We thank all applicants for their interest and will contact those qualified to continue in the
recruitment process.

title: Senior Security Guard - Part-Time at Sunshine Coast
description:
At Fusion Security, we believe in providing valued service, building strong relationships within communities, and safeguarding the interests of the public and our stakeholders.

Fusion Security is currently seeking a talented professional for a Senior Security Guard role on the beautiful Sunshine Coast for Full-time and Part-time positions. The successful candidate will be responsible for protecting and securing the property, personnel, and information against theft and vandalism, controlling access to facilities, maintaining order and safety under the designate authority of the owner of the property.

CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS

  • A valid BC Security Guard license
  • Minimum of 2 years commitment to the position
  • Minimum of 2+ years of relevant experience in the security and customer service industry
  • Excellence in customer service and professional deportment
  • Excellent documentation and communication skills
  • A high standard for safety and a passion for security
  • Additional certifications are an asset: Occupational First Aid level 1, 2, 3, AST, etc.

JOB DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

The successful candidate must perform some or all of the following duties:

  • Patrol assigned areas to guard against theft, shoplifting, vandalism and fire
  • Provide assistances to tenants, visitors and contractors
  • Operate security control-room equipment to monitor establishment activities
  • Ensure the establishment safety and emergency procedures are followed, responding to fire alarms, bomb threats and other on-site emergencies
  • Observe and keep records of security related activities in written or electronic form
  • Respond to and investigates alarms from businesses as required
  • Enforce regulations of an establishment to maintain order in accordance with site manuals and client instructions
  • Look for and act on opportunities to provide added value and exceptional customer service in all interactions and/or duties
  • Analyzing information and evaluations results to choose the best solution and solve problems

BENEFITS AND COMPENSATION

  • Full time starting pay rate, $20.00 to $21.00 per hour
  • Bi-weekly pay
  • Vacation and paid time off
  • Uniform issued by the company
  • Security License renewal reimbursement
  • Additional training opportunities
  • Relocation assistance
  • Housing assistance

If you feel this opportunity matches with your qualifications, please submit your current and updated resume complete with a cover letter detailing reasons for your interest as well as why you think you would be the best candidate for the position.

(Part 1, Section 2) of the Security Services Act of British Columbia requires all Security Services Workers are required to hold a valid BC Security License to be employed or employable. Any applicant without a valid BC Security License will be automatically disqualified. For more information please visit: http://www.bclaws.ca/civix/document/id/consol20/consol20/00_07030_01#section2

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in Fusion Security, however only formal applications will be considered and only selected candidates will be contacted for an interview. Any applicant that does not meet availability requirements will not be considered suitable for the role.

title: Static Security Guard (FT)
description:
BPS -K9 is currently looking to add to their team of reliable and self-motivated team of Static/Stationary Security Agents in Full-Time and Part-Time and Casual positions

Candidates must:
  • Have a valid Alberta Security Guard License.
  • Have own vehicle to get to sites.*** (if you do not have a vehicle please apply once you do)
  • Be available for days, afternoons, evenings, overnights, weekends, and holiday shifts
  • Be available to start immediately or soon.
  • Fluency / proficiency in English, both written and spoken.
  • Meet the physical demands of the job. (extensive periods of walking, standing, and stairs)**
  • Work in all types of weather (sun, rain, snow,) both indoors or outdoors **
Duties of a Static Security Guard include:
  • Conducting foot patrols, access control, traffic control, and CCTV monitoring.
  • Responding to alarms / emergencies.
  • Completing detailed shift reports and incident reports.
  • Following company and client polices.
  • Reacting appropriately in stressful situations. (calm and non-violent)
  • Being professional while representing the company and clients at all times.
Candidates will be skilled in the following:
  • Basic to Intermediate MS Office Skills. (Word, Excel, Email)
  • Critical thinking and problem solving.
  • Interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Be able to work independently.

BPS Protective Services K-9 Inc. provides competitive compensation, benefits to full time employees, comprehensive training, reliable equipment and supervision, and is a firm believer in equal opportunities.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Casual, Permanent.

Salary: $15.00-$16.00 per hour.

COVID-19 considerations:
All visitors and employees must wear a mask when in the office - no mask no access
All employees must wear a mask when on shift and working indoors or when unable to maintain social distancing - no exceptions




    About BPS Protective Services K-9:

    Since 1999, BPS K-9 has been serving Alberta’s security needs. Over the last 15 plus years, we have grown to become Western Canada’s largest K-9 security provider. With offices located in Calgary and Edmonton, an extensive mobile fleet, state of the art security equipment, and our professionally trained handler and dog teams, we are able to ensure that our clients assets stay protected and that they feel safe

title: Loss Prevention Specialist: Full Time (1 Year Contract)
description:
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • This is a plain clothed/undercover positon in multiple locations
  • Detain and interview persons apprehended for shoplifting in accordance with local laws and company procedures. Complete investigative case packages and statements regarding all internal/external theft and fraud for local police agencies
  • Conduct floor walks and support the stores by conducting tests and providing feedback regarding all aspects of home depot’s safety, security and shrink standards
  • Check physical security of The Home Depot facilities to prevent and deter theft/fraudulent activity
  • Represent the Home Depot in a professional manner throughout all court-related procedures
  • Maintain an open channel of communication with store management and all associates
  • Partner with store management to drive LP issues
  • Effectively utilize CCTV and Electronic Article Surveillance (EAS) systems
  • Conduct surveillance when required

CANDIDATE QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Must fulfil minimum time-in-position and performance management code requirements of M
  • Excellent analytical skills as well as strong verbal
  • Valid Security and Drivers Licenses as required by the Province
  • Must have access to reliable transportation

COMPENSATION:

  • Competitive pay
  • Travel time and mileage expensed
  • Profit Sharing and Stock Purchase Plan
  • Paid training and Career Development
  • Health and Dental Benefits
  • RRSP Contributions
  • Certain travel requirements will be reimbursed through submitted expenses

title: Loss Control Specialist - Canada
description:
About Our Company:

Are you looking for a challenging career that rewards hard work and success?   AFIRM is committed to finding outstanding people who have the ambition and willingness to learn in order to succeed.   The most successful candidates will be detail-oriented, self-motivated and possess strong problem-solving and analytical skills.  

 

AFIRM is the national leader in risk control, consulting services as well as commercial and residential inspections.   We provide our exceptional services to insurers, brokers, risk managers and government agencies.

 

Equal Opportunity Employer

The H.W. Kaufman Group of companies is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other status or condition protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

 

 

Qualifications:

Our Inspectorsâ€™ education and training:

 

  • Inspectors come from all walks of life with their own experience and background
  • AFIRM provides its candidates and Inspectors with a valuable set of skills unlike any other
  • They have all successfully completed AFIRMâ€™s own self-directed, on-line training certification program
  • Continue to hone their skills with AFIRMâ€™s on-going distance learning opportunities

 

 

Our Inspectorsâ€™ work environment      

 

  • As independent contractors with AFIRM, our inspectors work from home
  • They travel to various locations from their home base to assigned locations
  • Work evenings and weekends whenever required to maintain customer satisfaction

 

 

What all our Inspectors must have:

 

  • A reliable vehicle
  • Mobile phone
  • Windows based computer
  • Internet connection (high speed preferably)
  • Digital camera or smart phone that takes high quality digital pictures
Responsibilities:

 

AFIRM is a global leader in Loss Prevention and Premium Audit with Canadian locations in Richmond Hill and Montreal.   We are currently seeking independent Loss Prevention service contractors.

 

Our Loss Control Representatives (Inspectors) visit various property locations on behalf of the ownerâ€™s insurance company with a goal to minimize potential losses.   There is no selling involved.   Requests for inspection are received directly from the insurance companies.

 

Our successful Inspectors are:

 

  • Outgoing and independent
  • Curious and inquisitive by nature
  • Self-motivated strivers
  • Well organized and manage their time efficiently
  • Focused on quality of service
  • Competent computer skills with good input speed & accuracy
  • Skilled at writing well

 

What our Inspectors do:

 

  • Take responsibility for; and organize their assignments
  • Schedule their own appointments with property owners
  • Travel to the location
  • Tour the property and collect information (Residential and Commercial)
  • Identify potential areas of loss such as fire, theft and liability
  • Take photographs and measure buildings
  • Prepare a pre-define Loss Control report of the property using AFIRMâ€™s own web-based platform

title: Loss Prevention Officer
description:
London Drugs is looking for highly capable security and investigations professionals for our Loss Prevention team. You will find state of the art technology, training and support, and a high integrity group of people committed to excellence on our team.

Not just a job…a communitya partnershipa team

You’ll experience them all at London Drugs. As one of Canada’s fastest-growing and most successful retail chains, we know what it takes to build a satisfying career. We are seeking innovative, customer focused people to join our team!

Opportunity:Loss Prevention Officer 

Responsibilities:The Loss Prevention Officer position is well-suited for a highly capable security and investigations professional that thrives on working within a team environment.

Duties include:
  • Shifts at store locations conducting surveillance, investigation, and maintenance of loss prevention systems
  • Identifying areas of loss and working on team shrink reduction plans
  • Detection and apprehension of persons committing criminal offences against the company
  • Securing evidence, report writing & document preparation for court testifying purposes
  • Special assignments including lock repair, key control, staff awareness and orientation
  • Maintaining the overall security of our locations
QualificationsWe have an extensive in-house training program (in BC we are an accredited BST training provider). While we are eager to develop our people, candidates should possess the following skills and qualifications:
  • Demonstrated ability to stay calm and respond with good judgment in emergency situations
  • A commitment and history of protecting people and property in a safe and legal manner
  • Demonstrated ability to work under strict confidentiality
  • High ethical standards and a commitment to personal and professional integrity
  • Good command of the English language, both written and verbal, required for report writing and court testimony
  • A valid Class 5 driver’s license and own vehicle
  • Availability and willingness to work at all locations and surrounding areas
  • Previous Loss Prevention experience or other related experience within the Criminal Justice system would be an asset
  • Previous security related education, professional accreditation, first aid and first responder training is an asset
  • Use of force and restraining device training is an asset
  • Provincial security worker license, or the ability to obtain one before commencing work
Availability RequirementEmployees must be available to work a flexible schedule, Monday through Sunday, for day and evening shifts.We are an equal opportunity employer. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work applicable to this position and are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. Be advised, London Drugs DOES NOT use third party recruitment services.

London Drugs may collect, use, and/or disclose your personal information (including the information in this application) where it is reasonable for establishing, managing or terminating an employment relationship. This includes the use or disclosure of your personal information to persons inside or external to our organization, for the purpose of checking references or gathering other information to support an assessment of your candidacy.

To protect yourself, do not respond to unsolicited job offers from individuals or e-mail addresses, and never disclose any sensitive details about your identity (including personal or financial) to anyone you do not know or trust or on any unverified website, or website you do not trust.

title: Security Guard - CF Industries - Main Gate - Full Time - Courtright ($ 250 Retention Bonus)
description:
$250 Retention Bonus for candidates hired who successfully complete three months onsite at CF Industries.

To:                                      All Security Personnel

From:                                 People & Culture Coordinator

Date:                                   Feb. 25, 2022

Closing Date:                     March 3, 2022

Re:                                      Job Posting

Position:                             Security Guard – Main Gate

Site:                                    CF Industries

City:                                    Courtright, ON

Status:                                Full Time

Hours:                                 Shift Rotation – 0500 -1700/ 1700-0500 hours

Pay Rate:                            $17.91-$21.67/hr.

 

Position Overview:

Reporting to the Security Manager and Security Supervisor, the Main Gate Security Guard is accountable for the security and safety of the Courtright Location. They must ensure all personnel entering the Courtright location has a valid site-specific safety orientation and/ or is registered appropriately upon arrival.

Essential Job Functions:

  • Maintain a professional relationship with all personnel and visitors entering the site.
  • Maintain confidence.
  • Provide security services at the Courtright CF location, maintaining order and the protection of property and employees onsite.
  • Responsible for product inbound and outbound truck scaling and shipping; Scaling transport trucks and other various trucks. Providing bills of lading and custom documents when required.
  • Responsible for communicating with the loading areas prior to scaling in a truck.
  • Scale and record all waste management shipments i.e. garbage, recycling trucks.
  • Responsible for Alarms, Fire Alarms and Access System Alarms i.e. data room alarm, lab alarms, heat sensor alarms etc.
  • Responsible for the daily testing of the Alarm System and site PA system; conducted at 12:30 hours and 19:00 hours. (Site Alarm System tested each Monday at 12:30 hours).
  • Responsible for the daily test of the CVECO radio; 07:00 hours.
  • Responsible to monitor and communicate severe weather following provided weather applications.
  • Administrative and reception duties; forward incoming calls to the appropriate department or personnel, forward hand delivered resumes to Human Resources, send out overtime meals via fax and call and confirm the order(s).
  • Greet all visitors and communicate with the appropriate location personnel upon their arrival.
  • Report all observed hazardous or unsafe conditions to the appropriate shift supervisor including communicating this information to the oncoming shift.
  • Log and report all unusual activities to the other security guards, Security Supervisor and EH&S Manager.
  • Track hourly headcount of all personnel onsite following report form.
  • Track and record all CF vehicles entering and exiting the site.
  • Responsible for tracking location upsets and start-ups following report form.
  • Conduct random site security checks i.e. vehicle inspections.
  • Conduct random security seal inspections – document.
  • In the event of an emergency situation, follow emergency response procedures and directives from Security Supervisor, Emergency Operating Center and/ or Location Field Incident Commander.
  • Act as the EOC for emergency response situations on off-hours.
  • Review and continue to educate oneself on site emergency procedures and first-aid/ CPR.
  • Responsible to administer first-aid/ CPR when required.
  • Continuously stay up to date on all CAER, US Border Agency, Canadian Government, Canadian Coast Guard regulations and law.
  • Continuously review and monitor location access and surveillance camera system. Report any unusual activity or occurrences.
  • Responsible for the activation of CAER codes
  • Responsible for activation of Everbridge notifications as directed.
  • Write informative and detailed reports (Daily, Incident, and Accident) on all security matters.
  • Responsible for access control; assists with issuing site access cards and photo IDs.
  • Assist with and the signing out and issuance of keys onsite i.e. office keys, vehicle keys.
  • Responsible for the issuance of vehicle passes onsite.
  • Responsible for Material Gate/ Personal passes onsite. Must review the pass for appropriate signatures, inspect the item(s) and sign the pass to allow item(s) to leave the Courtright location.
  • Responsible to consult with ISNetworld Application program to ensure contractor companies onsite are in compliance with insurance and WSIB requirements.
  • Any other duties assigned by the Security Supervisor, Security Manager or EH&S Manager.

 

Security Guards are required to complete a Drug & Alcohol test for incidents that occur on client property.

 

 

 

Requirements:

  • Must possess a valid Ontario Security Guard Licence.
  • Must possess a valid G Class Ontario Driver’s Licence.
  • Must possess a valid First Aid training certificate.
  • Transportation of Dangerous Goods training certificate will be an asset .
  • Law and Security/ Police Foundations or equivalent diploma or CPO certificate will be an asset.
  • Demonstrate knowledge of safety and environmental regulations and issues.
  • Strong attention to detail with high focus on accuracy.
  • Strong communication skills both written and verbal.
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills.
  • Demonstrate the ability to work safely and in compliance with site safety, health and environmental standards and practices.
  • Demonstrate leadership capabilities.
  • Strong analytical and decision-making abilities.
  • Ability to deal effectively and diplomatically with employees, contractors, visitors etc.
  • Working knowledge of the Trespass to Property Act and Mental Health Act.
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy.
  • Patrol assigned area on foot, as assigned, to ensure personal, building, and equipment security.
  • Watch for and report irregularities by completing investigations and incident reports, such as security breaches, facility and safety hazards, and emergency situations; contact emergency responders, such as police, fire, and/or ambulance personnel, as required.
  • Utilize two-way radio and computer applications for communicating site activities.
  • Sustain effective relationships with key stakeholders and provide specialized security services by enforcing rules and regulations when required.
  • Offer support to any person in need such as providing good customer service when providing a security presence, such as providing direction, responding to emergency situation involving violent individuals and injuries.
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.

 

Working Conditions:

  • This position is stationed in the main gate security office.
  • Indoor duties.
  • Moderate physical activities related to tasks and duties.
  • Sitting for extended periods of time is required.
  • Computer work throughout the day.
  • Day and Night 12-hour shift schedule.

 

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  2. Proficient in English (both oral and written)

 

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Double Vaccinated
  3. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  4. Use of Force
  5. Report Writing
  6. Introduction to Industrial Security
  7. Additional courses as assigned

 

 

 

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned.

Should you have any questions on this process, please contact LeeAnne Feddes, People and Culture Coordinator at

lfeddes@paladinsecurity.com

.

title: Security Guard, Commercial
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

If you are seeking a job where you have important responsibilities, this one is for you! We are looking for a Full-Time Security Guard to work at one of our Commercial sites in Flin Flon, MB. As a security guard in the Commercial sector, you will play a key role in ensuring the safety of workers for some of the biggest brands out there! 

We provide people with growth opportunities. 30% of our frontline employees are promoted to become part of our operation teams. 

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in Winnipeg now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, we have a position that will accommodate your needs and help you reach your goals. 

What does a Security Guard in Flin Flon do ?

  • Maintain a safe and Secure environment
  • Access control of entry ways and exit points using equipment at your disposal.
  • Performing  Patrol at the Premises regularly to maintain order and establish presence.
  • Enforce Property regulations and city Bi- Laws on the client's site.
  • Protect the client's assets relative to theft, assault, fire, and other safety issues.
  • Complete Daily reports and Incident Reports.
  • Provide Excellent customer service.

Qualification to become a Security guard in Flin Flon ?

  • Good verbal and written communication skills
  • Previous experience in the security industry (asset)
  • Valid Provincial Security Guard license
  •  Customer service oriented
  •  Must be able to work days
  •  Leadership and problem-solving skills
  •  Ability to work in a stressful environment

What we Offer ?

  • Shifts: Monday - Friday 10.30 – 1830 hrs
  • Wage rate of $ 20.00 per hour
  • Career advancement opportunities

title: Industrial Security - North Coast
description:
Canada's Leading Provider of Corporate Security is seeking full-time security professionals for positions in the Oil and Gas sector on the North Coast of BC.


At Securiguard, we believe that every person deserves a safe environment to live, visit and work. Our vision is to be the best at making people feel safe by inspiring our staff to "believe they can make a difference" in everything they do.


If you are looking for a stimulating and rewarding entry level position with great potential for career advancement in corporate security and asset protection, this role is for you.


Hours of work: 12-hour shifts, 2 weeks in/out schedule

Locations: Lejac, Houston, Burns Lake, Kitimat, Terrace, Prince George, Fraser Lake, Fort Fraser, New Hazelton, Hazelton, Smithers, and Over Arching North Coast

In this position you will:

  • Provide excellent customer service to both the client and site visitors
  • Provide emergency response:
    • Respond to incident/emergency situations and follow required protocols
    • Coordinate with the police or emergency personnel when required
  • Provide visual security presence:
    • Detect and deter unauthorized persons
  • Access control at terminals and project sites
  • Patrol designated areas
  • Conduct radio check ins
  • Identify and report safety hazards
  • Report security breaches
  • Submit a daily written report
  • Maintain consistent records using company issued notebook
  • Adhere to Securiguard's core Values, Vision, Mission statement
  • Perform regularly scheduled site duties as required by client's Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs)
  • Report Frequent shift activities

The Ideal Candidate will have:

  • A valid BC Security License
  • A Class 5 BC Driver's License with a clean driving abstract
  • A personal vehicle to travel to and from the job site
  • Will be able to pass the drug and alcohol test
  • Excellent English communication skills to write descriptive and factual daily reports

Additional Considerations:

Completion of any of the following certifications:

  • OFA 1 (Occupational First Aid)
  • WHMIS (Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System)
  • CSTS (Construction Safety Training System
  • PCST (Pipeline Construction Training)

Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Extended health and dental benefits - conditions apply
  • Discounted Cineplex movie tickets
  • Recognition programs & events
  • Flexible schedules
  • Additional training & Uniforms

We're only accepting applications from individuals seeking full-time employment with the ability to get yourself to and from site.

To learn more about Securiguard, our values, and career paths available, please visit our website:

https://www.securiguard.com/careers-and-training/

More about Securiguard:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea their team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.

At Securiguard, we believe you can make a difference - by making people feel safe, caring for the people around you, supporting your community, and by making a positive impact on the environment.

title: Security Guard - Manufacturing - Part time
description:

Job Description:

title: High Profile Tactical Mall Security Guard
description:
High Profile Tactical Mall Security Guard

Business Unit: Security Services
Career Area: Security Guard
Location: 

Saskatoon, SK, CA

More than a job – 26% of our corporate employees at GardaWorld Canada started as frontline employees. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset and you’re ambitious, this could be just the beginning of your career journey with GardaWorld!

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in Saskatoon now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, you can be sure that we have a position that can fill your needs and goals. Join our team of dedicated and highly qualified professionals! This is the next step towards your law enforcement career!

 

On a typical day, you will be responsible of:

  • Deter and apprehend shoplifters at various retail locations
  • Enforce property rules, city bi-laws, and other applicable laws
  • Deter and respond to incidents on property
  • Complete reports and memo book entries on a regular basis
  • Compile the necessary reports for court dates
  • Make arrests as required-training provided
  • Ensure the protection of people, assets, and property
  • Monitor access of entryways and exit points
  • Conduct preventive surveillance rounds
  • Point of contact with authorities and emergency services
  • Provide keys and temporary pass to visitors/employees
  • Maintaining a positive, productive work environment through positive teamwork
  • Removal of unauthorized individuals.

What we offer:

  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits
  • Career advancement opportunities in the security field or within the head office
  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld
  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus 
  • Corporate discounts

Career Requirements:

  • Maintaining a positive, productive work environment through positive teamwork
  • Good verbal and written communication skills – English is required; French is an asset
  • Previous experience in the security industry (asset)
  • Saskatchewan Provincial Security Training Certificate
  •  Strong computer skills
  •  Customer service oriented
  •  Security clearance reliability
  •  Must be able to work days, evening and nights any day.
  •  Leadership and problem-solving skills
  •  Ability to work in a stressful environment
  • Criminal Justice Diploma considered an asset
  • Be eligible to work in Canada
  • All GardaWorld Security Guard employees are required to be fully vaccinated with a COVID-19 vaccine series, approve by Health Canada, as a condition of hire. Should you be the successful candidate, you will be required to comply with GardaWorld’s mandatory Vaccination Policy that is in effect.

 

We thank all applicants for applying. Those who are selected will be contacted for further procedure.

GardaWorld: Make the world a safer place

GardaWorld is a global leader in the security industry, offering a wealth of opportunity to individuals looking to gain experience and develop professionally in a growing industry. We offer flexible schedules, diverse work assignments spanning multiple industries, and training and career advancement opportunities. We embrace diversity and welcome newcomers, women, students, retirees, reservists, veterans, and more to join our team, as we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.


We thank all candidates for their interest; however, we will communicate only with the selected candidates.


Job Segment:Loss Prevention, Corporate Security, Temporary, Security Officer, Security, Contract

title: Overnight Concierge Security Guard - Full Time
description:
Regal Security Inc. is currently seeking a Full-Time Concierge Security Guard at one of our sites located in the Richmond Hill, ON area.

 

The Ideal Candidate must have: 

 

  • Full-time availability to work all days of the week and schedules that will consist of afternoons, overnight and weekend shifts â€“ including holidays.

 

  • Demonstrated past experience in either a senior security role or supervisor
     
  • Customer service-driven individual
     
  • Clear English communication skills in all areas (verbal and written)
     
  • Detailed and thorough record-keeping (Memo book, incident reports, etc)
     
  • Keen observation and attentiveness
     
  • Professional physical deportment and presentation
     
  • Decision Making, Reliable, Common Sense and exceptional judgment
  • A personal vehicle is an asset as the position is not easily accessible for transit.

 

Job Duties and Responsibilities:

 

  • Provide outstanding and personalized customer service as a front line representative of Regal Security
     
  • Act as Regalâ€™s day to day point of contact for our individual client and field staff inquiries
     
  • Supervise contracted site to ensure security staff are meeting company standards in terms of uniforming, training and site procedures
     
  • Operate and maintain an organized environment
     
  • Enforce property rules and regulations in order to maintain the security and safety of our clients and their assets
     
  • Ensure enforcement of Trespass to Property Act
     
  • Safely operate and maintain company and client issued equipment and supplies
     
  • Respond to major incidents on property and aid security staff with managing the situation (fire, flood, medical issue and criminal activity)
     
  • Ensure that safety and emergency protocols are completed in response to Fire Alarms and other Site Emergencies
     
  • Complete walking patrols and inspections of facilities and equipment as required
     
  • Review, know and follow post orders as identified for site representing
     
  • Maintain a safe working environment and follow the facilities health and safety procedures
     
  • Duties as otherwise assigned

 

Qualifications:

 

  • Valid Ontario Security License
     
  • Valid First Aid/CPR Certification

 

  • Valid WHMIS Certification
     
  • Secondary School Diploma or equivalent and higher (preference will be given to those with a Criminal Justice or Business post-secondary education)
     
  • Proficient in the use of various computer programs (ie. Microsoft Office, Gmail) and able to adapt and learn new program.

 

Compensation:

 

  • Pay Rate will be between $15 - $17 per hour.

 

  • Health Benefits are available for full-time employees upon completion of 3 months probation
     

Why choose Regal Security?

 

Regal Security Inc. is an established and growing security company that offers a vast array of professional and dependable security guard services across the Greater Toronto Area and Southwest Ontario.

 

Our Everyday Superheroâ„¢ guards are selected and trained to protect the clientâ€™s assets, property, employees, and tenants, using a custom-designed security solution for every client within the sectors we serve.

 

Every member of the Regal security team, and every service that is carried out, is directed by the Regal guiding principle: Strength & Honorâ„¢. With this in mind, Regalâ€™s security guards are known as Everyday Superheroesâ„¢ â€“ they are friendly, well-trained and, most importantly, proud, as they go above and beyond the call of duty to uphold Regalâ€™s high standards.

 

â€œTHE REGAL SECURITY MISSION IS â€œYOUR PEACE OF MINDâ€â„¢â€

 

Thank you for your application, unfortunately, due to the high volume of applicants, only those deemed eligible for an interview will be contacted. All candidates will be communicated to by phone or email for the purposes of the recruitment process.

 

Regal Security Inc. welcomes all candidates equally and encourages all qualified candidates, from women and men including persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and Aboriginal persons, to apply.


 

#INDREGAL

title: Security Guard - Pr. Rupert
description:
Commissionaires BC is currently looking for Security Officers in Pr. Rupert!

Regular positions available:

  • Saturday and Sunday 4pm till midnight
  • Saturday and Sunday midnight to 8am

Your Must Haves:

-Valid BC Security License

-Have lived in Canada for a minimum of 5 years due to clearance requirements

-OFA 1 or willing to obtain one

-Excellent English oral and written skills

Youâ€™re a good fit if you haveâ€¦

-Demonstrated interest and experience in serving the public

-Positive and professional attitude, with strong customer service skills

-Proficient using computers

-Excellent attention to detail and problem-solving skills

-Excellent multi-tasking, prioritizing, and organizational abilities

-Ability to work independently and make sound decisions under pressure

Some of your responsibilities include:

-Interior and exterior patrols

-Access Control and visitor verification

-Directing incoming mail to relevant staff

-First responder in building emergencies such as evacuations and medical emergencies

What's in it for you?

ARE YOU:

  • A person who loves to go “above and beyond” and takes pride in providing superior personal service?

  • A person who enjoys and is available to work a flexible work schedule?   

We would love to hear from you!

 

We are looking for a personable, energetic, and passionate individual for the position of a Security Officer. Under the supervision of the Security Manager, you will be responsible for protecting patrons, staff and assets to ensure the integrity of the gaming floor and company property!

 

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:  

  • Preparing statements/reports on internal and external violations, unsafe conditions, potential hazards, suspicious persons and activities
  • Enrolling guests into the Self-Exclusion Program
  • Conducting regular patrols of the entire property as directed; identifies risks and conditions that present safety issues

  • Strong communication and public relations skills

  • Ability to be adaptable and flexible with work schedule

title: Senior Security Guard - Sunshine Coast
description:
At Fusion Security, we believe in providing valued service, building strong relationships within communities, and safeguarding the interests of the public and our stakeholders.

Fusion Security is currently seeking a talented professional for a Senior Security Guard role on the beautiful Sunshine Coast for Full-time and Part-time positions. The successful candidate will be responsible for protecting and securing the property, personnel, and information against theft and vandalism, controlling access to facilities, maintaining order and safety under the designate authority of the owner of the property.

CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS

  • A valid BC Security Guard license
  • Minimum of 2 years commitment to the position
  • Minimum of 2+ years of relevant experience in the security and customer service industry
  • Excellence in customer service and professional deportment
  • Excellent documentation and communication skills
  • A high standard for safety and a passion for security
  • Additional certifications are an asset: Occupational First Aid level 1, 2, 3, AST, etc.

JOB DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

The successful candidate must perform some or all of the following duties:

  • Patrol assigned areas to guard against theft, shoplifting, vandalism and fire
  • Provide assistances to tenants, visitors and contractors
  • Operate security control-room equipment to monitor establishment activities
  • Ensure the establishment safety and emergency procedures are followed, responding to fire alarms, bomb threats and other on-site emergencies
  • Observe and keep records of security related activities in written or electronic form
  • Respond to and investigates alarms from businesses as required
  • Enforce regulations of an establishment to maintain order in accordance with site manuals and client instructions
  • Look for and act on opportunities to provide added value and exceptional customer service in all interactions and/or duties
  • Analyzing information and evaluations results to choose the best solution and solve problems

BENEFITS AND COMPENSATION

  • Full time starting pay rate, $20.00 to $21.00 per hour
  • Bi-weekly pay
  • Vacation and paid time off
  • Uniform issued by the company
  • Security License renewal reimbursement
  • Additional training opportunities
  • Relocation assistance
  • Housing assistance

If you feel this opportunity matches with your qualifications, please submit your current and updated resume complete with a cover letter detailing reasons for your interest as well as why you think you would be the best candidate for the position.

(Part 1, Section 2) of the Security Services Act of British Columbia requires all Security Services Workers are required to hold a valid BC Security License to be employed or employable. Any applicant without a valid BC Security License will be automatically disqualified. For more information please visit: http://www.bclaws.ca/civix/document/id/consol20/consol20/00_07030_01#section2

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in Fusion Security, however only formal applications will be considered and only selected candidates will be contacted for an interview. Any applicant that does not meet availability requirements will not be considered suitable for the role.

title: Mobile Security Guard (Days/Evenings)
description:
BPS K9- is currently looking to add a Full-Time Day shift Mobile Security Agent to our professional, reliable, confident, and self-motivated team.

Shift: 9 to 12 hours.

Hours: 6am to 6pm | 12pm to 9pm.

Rotation: 4 on - 4 off.

Successful candidates will:
  • Possess a valid Alberta Security Guard License.
  • Possess a valid Class 5 Driver License. (or Equivalent)
  • Provide full 3-year Driver Abstract history. (less than 4 demerits) ** (February 2019 to Present)
  • Provide full 3-years of Insurance Claim History. (no at-fault claims) ** (February 2019 to Present)
  • Be available 7 days a week including weekends and holidays**
  • Have their own vehicle to get to the office.**
  • Be available to start immediately or soon.
  • Have previous Security experience.**
  • Fluency / proficiency in English, both written and spoken.
  • Working in all types of weather (sun, rain, snow, etc.) whether indoors or outdoors. **
  • Meeting the physical demands of the job. (extensive periods of walking, standing, stairs, etc.) **
Duties of a Mobile Security Agent include:
  • Driving a company vehicle safely and obey all traffic laws.
  • Conducting patrols, securing access points, and removing trespassers from client properties.
  • Learning and following all BPS K9 policies and procedures.
  • Reacting appropriately in stressful situations by remaining calm and non-violent.
  • Being professional while representing the company and our clients.
  • Completing detailed and accurate shift reports daily.
Candidates will be skilled in the following:
  • MS Office Word and Excel. (Basic to Intermediate) **
  • Critical thinking and problem solving for appropriately resolving issues and concerns.
  • Interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Knowledge of the Criminal Code of Canada.

Wage: Guaranteed minimum $18/hour after probation (3 months)

BPS Protective Services K-9 Inc. provides competitive compensation, benefits after 3 months, comprehensive training, reliable equipment, and supervision, and is a firm believer in equal opportunities.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent.

Salary: $17.00-$18.00 per hour.

COVID-19 considerations:
All visitors and employees must wear a mask when in the office - no mask no access
All employees must wear a mask when on shift and working indoors or when unable to maintain social distancing - no exceptions





    About BPS Protective Services K-9:

    Since 1999, BPS K-9 has been serving Alberta’s security needs. Over the last 15 plus years, we have grown to become Western Canada’s largest K-9 security provider. With offices located in Calgary and Edmonton, an extensive mobile fleet, state of the art security equipment, and our professionally trained handler and dog teams, we are able to ensure that our clients assets stay protected and that they feel safe

title: Loss Prevention Specialist: Full Time
description:
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • This is a plain clothed/undercover positon in multiple locations
  • Detain and interview persons apprehended for shoplifting in accordance with local laws and company procedures. Complete investigative case packages and statements regarding all internal/external theft and fraud for local police agencies

  • Valid Security and Drivers Licenses as required by the Province

title: Loss Control Specialist - Canada
description:
About Our Company:

Are you looking for a challenging career that rewards hard work and success?   AFIRM is committed to finding outstanding people who have the ambition and willingness to learn in order to succeed.   The most successful candidates will be detail-oriented, self-motivated and possess strong problem-solving and analytical skills.  

 

AFIRM is the national leader in risk control, consulting services as well as commercial and residential inspections.   We provide our exceptional services to insurers, brokers, risk managers and government agencies.

 

Equal Opportunity Employer

The H.W. Kaufman Group of companies is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other status or condition protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

 

 

Qualifications:

Our Inspectorsâ€™ education and training:

 

  • Inspectors come from all walks of life with their own experience and background
  • AFIRM provides its candidates and Inspectors with a valuable set of skills unlike any other
  • They have all successfully completed AFIRMâ€™s own self-directed, on-line training certification program
  • Continue to hone their skills with AFIRMâ€™s on-going distance learning opportunities

 

 

Our Inspectorsâ€™ work environment      

 

  • As independent contractors with AFIRM, our inspectors work from home
  • They travel to various locations from their home base to assigned locations
  • Work evenings and weekends whenever required to maintain customer satisfaction

 

 

What all our Inspectors must have:

 

  • A reliable vehicle
  • Mobile phone
  • Windows based computer
  • Internet connection (high speed preferably)
  • Digital camera or smart phone that takes high quality digital pictures
Responsibilities:

 

AFIRM is a global leader in Loss Prevention and Premium Audit with Canadian locations in Richmond Hill and Montreal.   We are currently seeking independent Loss Prevention service contractors.

 

Our Loss Control Representatives (Inspectors) visit various property locations on behalf of the ownerâ€™s insurance company with a goal to minimize potential losses.   There is no selling involved.   Requests for inspection are received directly from the insurance companies.

 

Our successful Inspectors are:

 

  • Outgoing and independent
  • Curious and inquisitive by nature
  • Self-motivated strivers
  • Well organized and manage their time efficiently
  • Focused on quality of service
  • Competent computer skills with good input speed & accuracy
  • Skilled at writing well

 

What our Inspectors do:

 

  • Take responsibility for; and organize their assignments
  • Schedule their own appointments with property owners
  • Travel to the location
  • Tour the property and collect information (Residential and Commercial)
  • Identify potential areas of loss such as fire, theft and liability
  • Take photographs and measure buildings
  • Prepare a pre-define Loss Control report of the property using AFIRMâ€™s own web-based platform

title: Loss Prevention Officer
description:
London Drugs is looking for highly capable security and investigations professionals for our Loss Prevention team. You will find state of the art technology, training and support, and a high integrity group of people committed to excellence on our team.

Not just a job…a communitya partnershipa team

You’ll experience them all at London Drugs. As one of Canada’s fastest-growing and most successful retail chains, we know what it takes to build a satisfying career. We are seeking innovative, customer focused people to join our team!

Opportunity:Loss Prevention Officer 

Responsibilities:The Loss Prevention Officer position is well-suited for a highly capable security and investigations professional that thrives on working within a team environment.

Duties include:
  • Shifts at store locations conducting surveillance, investigation, and maintenance of loss prevention systems
  • Identifying areas of loss and working on team shrink reduction plans
  • Detection and apprehension of persons committing criminal offences against the company
  • Securing evidence, report writing & document preparation for court testifying purposes
  • Special assignments including lock repair, key control, staff awareness and orientation
  • Maintaining the overall security of our locations
QualificationsWe have an extensive in-house training program (in BC we are an accredited BST training provider). While we are eager to develop our people, candidates should possess the following skills and qualifications:
  • Demonstrated ability to stay calm and respond with good judgment in emergency situations
  • A commitment and history of protecting people and property in a safe and legal manner
  • Demonstrated ability to work under strict confidentiality
  • High ethical standards and a commitment to personal and professional integrity
  • Good command of the English language, both written and verbal, required for report writing and court testimony
  • A valid Class 5 driver’s license and own vehicle
  • Availability and willingness to work at all locations and surrounding areas
  • Previous Loss Prevention experience or other related experience within the Criminal Justice system would be an asset
  • Previous security related education, professional accreditation, first aid and first responder training is an asset
  • Use of force and restraining device training is an asset
  • Provincial security worker license, or the ability to obtain one before commencing work
Availability RequirementThis is a Full time role, 40 hours per week.  Employees must be available to work a flexible schedule, Monday through Sunday, for day and evening shifts.

We are an equal opportunity employer. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work applicable to this position and are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. Be advised, London Drugs DOES NOT use third party recruitment services.

London Drugs may collect, use, and/or disclose your personal information (including the information in this application) where it is reasonable for establishing, managing or terminating an employment relationship. This includes the use or disclosure of your personal information to persons inside or external to our organization, for the purpose of checking references or gathering other information to support an assessment of your candidacy.

To protect yourself, do not respond to unsolicited job offers from individuals or e-mail addresses, and never disclose any sensitive details about your identity (including personal or financial) to anyone you do not know or trust or on any unverified website, or website you do not trust.
