title: Security Guard - Hospitals
description:
YOUR NEXT OPPORTUNITY 

Are you an aspiring Health Care or Emergency Management professional? Be a part of a rewarding team that ensures the safety of our healthcare workers and visitors. As a Healthcare Security Officer, you respond to alarms, emergency requests, and use your excellent verbal de-escalation skills to resolve incidents. You always maintain confidentiality and discretion when handling private information, and you never forget to smile while providing your incredible customer service. 

WHAT YOU WILL DO 

You promptly fill out detailed incident reports whenever an issue arises. This helps you discover solutions on how to keep staff, patients, and guests feeling comfortable in the secure environment you provide. Along with your dedication to utilizing PPE, you regularly patrol the facility so that no potential conflict leaves your sight. 

YOU’RE A GREAT FIT IF YOU: 

  • Provide exceptional customer service, with a winning smile.
  • Are comfortable standing for long periods of time
  • Hold a valid First Aid/CPR certification or are willing to obtain one. We take safety seriously, and we know you do too.
  • Are eligible to work in Canada
  • Have prior experience and a valid security license, which are considered an asset. If not, you’re in luck! We’ll help you acquire your security license and even pay for it.  

All our Officers are required to carry a valid Security License. We also provide the Basic Security Training to those who have not been through the course previously. 

PALADIN OFFERS YOU: 

  • Competitive wages 
  • Promotion from within
  • Company-paid training & uniforms
  • Benefits & recognition programs 
  • This position pays $22/hour

Paladin Security is one of Canada’s Best Employers. We have been awarded for our outstanding corporate culture, approach to management and our customer service. Join our winning team today! 

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those applicants that are short listed will be contacted for an interview.

Please note that all interviews are being conducted via phone and/or video chat at this time.

title: High Profile Commercial Security Guard
description:
What's in it for you?

  • Free Security Guard Training!
  • Competitive wages 
  • Complete uniform provided
  • Diverse work assignements
  • Career development and advancement, and training opportunities

Are you ready to suit up?

GardaWorld is the world’s largest privately owned security services company, offering cash services, physical and specialized security solutions. We protect our clients’ staff and assets, wherever they are in the world.

We are looking for security guards to fulfill different assignments for our clients.

What does a Security Guard in Regina do?

  • Ensure the protection of people, assets and property
  • Monitor access of entryways and exit points using equipment at your disposal
  • Conduct preventive surveillance rounds according to established procedures
  • Provide impeccable customer service
  • Prevent fire, theft and vandalism
  • Verify and inspect safety equipment
  • Enforce the regulations in effect at your client's premises
  • Write daily reports and incident reports
  • Conduct Access Control
  • Desk Duties 
  • Process Visitors
  • Issue Access Card(s)
  • Operate Electric Gates Arm to Allow Entry to the Site and Exit from.
  • Conduct Vehicle Patrol(s)
  • Enter Data into Various Programs
  • Monitor Live Events Via CCTV Camera System and Report Issues to the Appropriate Group(s)
  • Complete Incident Reports: on alarm(s) Break and Enter, Health and Safety Concerns(others)
  • Contact the Authority (RCMP) and report Incident(s) as per need.
  • Communicate with different Reporting Software and MS Office Apps(Microsoft Excell or Word)

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in Regina

  • Professional deportment
  • Proactive, attention-to-detail, self-motivated, team player 
  • Above average written and oral communication skills
  • High school diploma or equivalent (asset)
  • Driver’s licence and access to a vehicle (asset)
  • Previous experience in security (asset)
  • Drug and Alcohol Testing on pre-access and Standard First Aid CPR Level C+AED

title: Security Guard - Part Time
description:
Securiguard will be hiring for part-time guards in the Prince Rupert area! This is a chance to be a part of a unique and exciting project!

Hours of work: Pay Rate is: $17-19/hr; 4-12 hour shifts

Job Requirements:

  • Providing excellent customer service to both the client and its guests
  • Emergency response: Ability to respond to incident/emergency situations and follow required protocol
  • Access control at terminals and project sites
  • Patrolling of designated areas
  • Radio check ins
  • Report writing
  • Identify and reporting safety hazards
  • Visual security presence - detect and deter unauthorized persons
  • Coordinating and liaising with the police or emergency personnel when required
  • Reporting security breaches
  • Adhere to Securiguard's core Values, Vision, Mission statement
  • Perform regularly scheduled site duties as required by client standard operating procedures
  • Keep consistent notes using company issued note book
  • Frequent shift activity reporting

Candidate Requirements:

  • Valid BC Security License
  • Must be able to get yourself to and from worksite
  • Ability to read and write descriptive and factual reports in the English language

We're only accepting applications from individuals seeking part-time employment with the ability to get yourself to and from site.


Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer and we value the diversity of our staff. We are committed to building a facilitative environment of respect, inclusiveness and career growth.

About us:

Securiguard is Western Canada's leading provider of corporate security through a focus on customer service, creating value for our clients and caring for our people, community and the environment. With offices in Vancouver, the Fraser Valley, Victoria, Nanaimo, Kelowna, Terrace and Edmonton, we employ over 2000 security officers and offer a comprehensive selection of services. Security solutions provided include uniformed security guards, concierge officers, bike patrollers, vehicle patrols, K9 patrol and detection units and loss prevention specialists.

Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer and we value the diversity of our staff. We are committed to building a facilitative environment of respect, inclusiveness and career growth.

title: Security Guard (MLEO license needed)
description:
Regal Security Inc. is currently seeking a Full-Time Concierge Security Guard at one of our sites located in the Scarborough, ON area.

 

The Ideal Candidate must have: 

 

  • Full-time availability to work all days of the week and schedules that will consist of afternoons, overnight and weekend shifts â€“ including holidays.

 

  • Demonstrated past experience in either a senior security role or supervisor
     
  • Customer service-driven individual
     
  • Clear English communication skills in all areas (verbal and written)
     
  • Detailed and thorough record-keeping (Memo book, incident reports, etc.)
     
  • Keen observation and attentiveness
     
  • Professional physical deportment and presentation
     
  • Decision Making, Reliable, Common Sense and exceptional judgment

 

Job Duties and Responsibilities:

 

  • Provide outstanding and personalized customer service as a front line representative of Regal Security
     
  • Act as Regalâ€™s day to day point of contact for our individual client and field staff inquiries
     
  • Supervise contracted site to ensure security staff are meeting company standards in terms of uniforming, training and site procedures
     
  • Operate and maintain an organized environment
     
  • Enforce property rules and regulations to maintain the security and safety of our clients and their assets
     
  • Ensure enforcement of Trespass to Property Act
     
  • Safely operate and maintain company and client-issued equipment and supplies.
     
  • Respond to major incidents on property and aid security staff with managing the situation (fire, flood, medical issue and criminal activity)
     
  • Ensure that safety and emergency protocols are completed in response to Fire Alarms and other Site Emergencies
     
  • Complete walking patrols and inspections of facilities and equipment as required
     
  • Review, know and follow post orders as identified for site representing.
     
  • Maintain a safe working environment and follow the facilities health and safety procedures
     
  • Duties as otherwise assigned

 

Qualifications:

 

  • Valid Ontario Security License
  • Valid First Aid/CPR Certification
  • Have MLEO license
  • Valid WHMIS Certification
  • Secondary School Diploma or equivalent and higher (preference will be given to those with a Criminal Justice or Business post-secondary education)
  • Proficient in the use of various computer programs (i.e. Microsoft Office, Gmail) and able to adapt and learn new programs.

 

Compensation:

 

  • Health Benefits are available for full-time employees upon completion of 3 months probation.
  • Pay rate will be discussed upon hiring.
     

Why choose Regal Security?

Regal Security Inc. is an established and growing security company that offers a vast array of professional and dependable security guard services across the Greater Toronto Area and Southwest Ontario.

 

Our Everyday Superheroâ„¢ guards are selected and trained to protect the clientâ€™s assets, property, employees, and tenants, using a custom-designed security solution for every client within the sectors we serve.

 

Every member of the Regal security team and every service carried out, is directed by the Regal guiding principle: Strength & Honorâ„¢. With this in mind, Regalâ€™s security guards are known as Everyday Superheroesâ„¢ â€“ they are friendly, well-trained and, most importantly, proud, as they go above and beyond the call of duty to uphold Regalâ€™s high standards.

 

â€œTHE REGAL SECURITY MISSION IS â€œYOUR PEACE OF MINDâ€â„¢.â€

 

Thank you for your application. Unfortunately, due to the high volume of applicants, only those deemed eligible for an interview will be contacted. All candidates will be communicated to by phone or email for the recruitment process.

 

Regal Security Inc. welcomes all candidates equally and encourages all qualified candidates, from women and men, including persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and Aboriginal persons, to apply.

title: Security Officer - Public Safety
description:
Commissionaires BC is proud to provide security services a Canadian Public Safety site located in Burnaby.

We are currently looking for security professionals who would be interested in working at a high profile public safety site, and are comfortable and able to go through a Top Secret Clearance process.

Successful candidates will need to have an open availability, including weekends and overnight shifts. 

Ideal candidates would be:

  • Able to provide superior customer service to both customers and clients
  • Experienced in following strict protocols and dealing with emergency situations
  • Be of good character and sound mind,
  • Honest and trustworthy
  • Reliable
  • Capable of obtaining a Top Secret Clearance. 
  • In possession of valid BC Security Licence and OFA 1 certificate or willing to obtain
  • Able to work shift rotations including mornings, afternoons and graveyards

Top secret clearance requirements:

  • Minimum of 10 years living Canada
  • Do not hold citizenship in any other country
  • Have no criminal record or association with criminal activities (including family, friends and acquaintances)
  • The test itself comprises of:
    • Completion of comprehensive paperwork
    • Thorough and intense investigation on past activities, associations and your character
    • Examination of vices, dishonesty, and financial status
    • Polygraph Test â€“ Must complete and pass testing

**Please note â€“ due to the nature of the clearance, processing times can take 10-12 months to complete. Commissionaires would be able to offer temporary employment in the meantime**

Whatâ€™s in it for you:

  • Opportunity to work for high profile government site
  • Competitive wages
  • Potential future career opportunities within CSIS
  • Bonus Program ($500 Bonus)
    • $250 â€“ Once Top Secret Clearance has been obtained
    • $250 â€“ after 1040 hours reached (approximately 6 months of full-time work)

Site role and responsibilities:

  • Liaise with all security personnel regarding specific activities or concerns, maintaining open communication
  • Monitoring of CCTV cameras, reviewing situations and reporting/advising on-site personnel of appropriate response
  • Greet visitors and staff members
  • Ensure confidentiality for staff members and the site
  • Enforce building security, and maintain a safe environment for all personnel and the public
  • Manage incoming calls, inquiries, and pass along vital information
  • Respond to inquiries according to site access protocols
  • Respond to emergency situations

title: Security Officer ( Part-time)
description:
Requisition #2366998
Job LocationCanada-Ontario-Ajax
Job StreamSecurity and Surveillance
Site LocationCasino Ajax
Job TypePermanent, Part-Time
Expiry Date
Travel RequiredNot Required
Educational RequirementsN/A
Languages RequiredEnglish
Requisition #2366998
Job LocationCanada-Ontario-Ajax
Job StreamSecurity and Surveillance
Site LocationCasino Ajax
Job TypePermanent, Part-Time
Expiry Date
Travel RequiredNot Required
Educational RequirementsN/A
Languages RequiredEnglish
On-Going Opportunities Description

Don’t miss the opportunity to join One Toronto Gaming’s at Casino Ajax Security Team. This exciting career opportunity at Casino Ajax is seeking dynamic individuals with a drive to succeed.

Under the direct supervision of the Security Manager, or the Supervisor, Security, this position is responsible for the safety and protection of employees, guests, the facility and company assets at the site level. Ensures adherence to all policies and procedures while contributing to a safe and welcoming work environment for all employees.

The Security Officer’s role is to protect the company’s assets, patrons and employees against theft, fraud, vandalism and abuse, while delivering the highest level of customer service and respect to all customers and employees. You will perform a variety of duties throughout your shift, including controlling access to the facility and sensitive areas, escorting visitors, assisting departments, lost and found, monitoring alarm panels, controlling and issuing keys, writing reports, maintaining a daily log and conducting investigations. You may also be required to provide first aid and medical attention. At all times, you must be aware of the gaming operations, and you will work under Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario (AGCO) regulations and comply with all applicable laws, policies and procedures.

The ideal candidate is an energetic professional with proven knowledge, skills and abilities, executing the following in support of the company’s vision, mission and values:

  • Self-motivator and ability to inspire other team members in enhancing the guest experience within the entertainment business;
  • Monitoring, documenting and reporting internal and external violations, unsafe conditions, potential hazards, suspicious persons and activities; preparing written and electronic statements;
  • Escorting guests and team members;
  • Enforcing restricted access by unauthorized persons;
  • Observing transactions, slot drops, chip fills and transferring items to Lost & Found;
  • Performing identification checks to any guest who appears under 30; * Referring disputes to the Supervisor, Security;
  • Conducting regular patrols of the interior and exterior of the property as assigned;
  • Performing crowd control as directed;
  • Attend to first aid incidents;
  • Ensuring compliance with licensing laws, health and safety, and other statutory regulations;
  • Assisting Supervisor, Security with enrolling guests in the Self-Exclusion program;
  • Performing other reasonable duties as assigned.

Skills/ Qualification Requirements

  • Ability to exceed internal and external guest expectations through timely, effective and service-oriented communication;
  • 2 years of experience working with customer service/ public service role or in the service industry;
  • High school diploma or equivalent required, post-secondary education in a related field an asset
  • Previous experience or training in security an asset
  • Computer literacy in MS Office
  • Able to organize data with great accuracy
  • Knowledge of privacy legislation an asset
  • Inquisitive, investigative mind, able to identify suspicious behaviors /transactions and make sound judgments based on this;
  • A willingness to learn, develop and achieve new skills for personal and professional development
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize;
  • Ability to follow rules, regulations, policies and procedures at all times;
  • The ability to maintain tact and composure during high-stress situations
  • Must be able to work independently, without close direct supervision, and apply good judgment and discretion under pressure;
  • Excellent problem solving and conflict resolution capabilities;
  • Candidates must be ready and willing to work a flexible schedule, including overnight, weekends and holidays. The hours of work will be based on customers and business needs

Training/ Licenses/ Certification Requirements

  • A valid class “G” driver’s license with a clear driving record is also required
  • A current First Aid/CPR certification
  • Ability to successfully obtain Smart Serve certification
  • The ability to obtain registration as a Category 2 Gaming Assistant with the Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario

Casino Ajax candidates must be ready and willing to work a flexible schedule, including evenings, weekends, holidays and overnights. 12 hour shifts. The hours of work will be based on operational needs.

One Toronto Gaming accommodates people with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process. Applicants are encouraged to advise Human Resources of requirements in advance.

title: Security Guard, Invista Maitland
description:
Security Guard, Invista Maitland

Business Unit: Security Services
Career Area: Security Guard
Location: 

Brockville, ON, CAKingston, ON, CA

Are you ready to suit up?

If you are seeking a job where you have important responsibilities, this one is for you! As a security guard in the industrial sector, you will play a key role in ensuring the safety of workers for some of the biggest brands out there! 

 

We provide people with growth opportunities. 30% of our frontline employees are promoted to become part of our operation teams. 

 

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks now more than ever! 

What's in it for you?

  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits  

  • Uniform provided free of charge 

  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld 

  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus like Use of Force training 

What does a Security Guard in Maitland do?

  • Manage access as well as access cards through the computer system 

  • Camera surveillance of access gates and parking barriers 

  • Greet customers and register visitors as needed 

  • Act as a first responder in the event of a crisis or emergency  

  • Interior and exterior patrols

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in Maitland?

  • A valid security guard license and first aid card 

  • Available to work 5 days in first and second week of every month

  • Be double vaccinated against COVID-19 (a site requirement)

  • Have a clear criminal background 

  • Be eligible to work in Canada 

 

GardaWorld: Make the world a safer place

GardaWorld is a global leader in the security industry, offering a wealth of opportunity to individuals looking to gain experience and develop professionally in a growing industry. We offer flexible schedules, diverse work assignments spanning multiple industries, and training and career advancement opportunities. We embrace diversity and welcome newcomers, women, students, retirees, reservists, veterans, and more to join our team, as we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.


We thank all candidates for their interest; however, we will communicate only with the selected candidates.


Job Segment:Security Guard, Security Officer, Security

title: STATIC SECURITY GUARD - On-Call/Graveyard
description:
At Fusion Security, we believe in providing valued service, building strong relationships within communities, and safeguarding the interests of the public and our stakeholders.

Fusion Security continues to grow and provide professional security services throughout Greater Vancouver and the Lower Mainland, with clients in a wide variety of sectors, including government, retail, commercial sites, industrial sites and residential areas. Our mission is to deliver the highest quality service in each interaction that reflects a strong and respectful culture.

We are looking for security personnel who are professional, committed, and have experience in security. If this sounds like you, then we want to hear from YOU!

PERKS FUSION SECURITY OFFERS YOU:

  • Competitive, market-based pay rate
  • Extended health and dental benefits
  • Paid training and subsidies for industry accreditations
  • Fitness Centre Membership
  • Referral Bonus Program

WHAT YOU WILL DO:

  • Customer service
  • Ensuring the security of all personnel, visitors, and the general public
  • Inspecting & patrolling premises
  • Observe & report site activities and incidents
  • Monitoring property access
  • Investigating and reporting suspicious behavior, incidents, and security breaches
  • Enforcing client informed policies
  • Communicating with law enforcement, emergency medical personnel, and fire departments
  • Responding to alarms
  • Other duties that may be assigned

We Schedule Shifts According to Following Availability Needs:

  • Full time: able to work 32 to 40 hours per week
  • Shift available: Graveyard only
  • Flexible availability - 7 days a week including weekends.
  • No restrictions on commuting - the most suitable candidates are available to commute to Downtown, Vancouver, Richmond, Delta, Burnaby & the North Shore. Parking can be provided at some sites for successful candidates with a personal vehicle.

YOU ARE A GREAT FIT IF YOU HAVE:

  • A Valid BC Security License
  • The ability to stand for long periods of time & complete routine patrols to protect against fire & theft
  • Relevant experience in the security or customer service industry
  • Excellent customer service & professional deportment
  • A high standard for safety & a passion for security
  • Excellent documentation and communication skills
  • Additional certifications are an asset: Occupational First Aid Level 1, 2, 3, AST, Etc.

Please note that security officers may be required to work extended hours and be part of an on-call team for urgent scheduling needs.

For further information on the job posting or if you have any questions, you can contact Ikjot Rai, Talent Acquisition Specialist, at 604-928-1325.

In order to be considered for this position, your application must clearly demonstrate how you meet the requirements as outlined above. Ensure your resume includes your employment history including start and end dates of your employment, and any relevant information that relates to the job to which you are applying.

Due to receiving a high volume of applications, only those applicants selected to move forward in the hiring process will be contacted.

(Part 1, Section 2) of the Security Services Act of British Columbia requires all Security Services Workers are required to hold a valid BC Security License to be employed or employable. Any applicant without BST or a valid BC Security License will be automatically disqualified. For more information please visit: http://www.bclaws.ca/civix/document/id/consol20/consol20/00_07030_01#section2

title: Mobile Security Guard (PT)
description:
BPS K9 is looking for security professionals to join our reliable, confident, and self-motivated team of Mobile Security Agents in a Part Time position

Shifts: 12-hour overnights

Successful candidates will:
  • Have a valid Alberta Security Guard License.
  • Have a valid Class 5 Driver License. (or Equivalent)
  • Provide full 3-year Driver Abstract history. (less than 4 demerits)** ( February 2019 to Present)
  • Provide full 3-year Insurance Claim Report. (February 2019 to Present )
  • Have their own vehicle to get to the office.
  • Be available to start immediately or soon.
  • Have previous Security experience. (an asset)
  • Be able to work independently and in a team environment.
  • Meet the physical demands of the job. (extensive walking, standing, stairs, and driving)***
  • Fluency/proficiency in English language, both written and spoken.
  • Working in all types of weather. (sun, rain, snow, etc.)***
Duties of a Mobile Security Agent include:
  • Driving a company vehicle safely and obey all traffic laws.
  • Conducting foot patrols, securing access points, and removing trespassers.
  • Reacting appropriately in stressful situations by remaining calm and non-violent.
  • Being professional while representing the company and clients at all times.
  • Completing detailed and accurate shift reports daily.
Candidates will be skilled in the following:
  • MS Office Word and Excel. (Basic to Intermediate)**
  • Critical thinking and problem solving.
  • Safe and defensive driving at night and during snow/rain/fog etc.
  • Interpersonal and communication skills.

Wage: Guaranteed minimum $18/hour after probation (3 months)

BPS Protective Services K-9 Inc. provides competitive compensation, comprehensive training, reliable equipment, and supervision, and is a firm believer in equal opportunities.

Salary: $17.00-$18.00 per hour.

COVID-19 considerations:
All visitors and employees must wear a mask when in the office - no mask no access
All employees must wear a mask when on shift and working indoors or when unable to maintain social distancing - no exceptions




    About BPS Protective Services K-9:

    Since 1999, BPS K-9 has been serving Alberta’s security needs. Over the last 15 plus years, we have grown to become Western Canada’s largest K-9 security provider. With offices located in Calgary and Edmonton, an extensive mobile fleet, state of the art security equipment, and our professionally trained handler and dog teams, we are able to ensure that our clients assets stay protected and that they feel safe

title: Loss Prevention Specialist: Full Time
description:
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • This is a plain clothed/undercover positon in multiple locations
  • Detain and interview persons apprehended for shoplifting in accordance with local laws and company procedures. Complete investigative case packages and statements regarding all internal/external theft and fraud for local police agencies
  • Conduct floor walks and support the stores by conducting tests and providing feedback regarding all aspects of home depot’s safety, security and shrink standards
  • Check physical security of The Home Depot facilities to prevent and deter theft/fraudulent activity
  • Represent the Home Depot in a professional manner throughout all court-related procedures
  • Maintain an open channel of communication with store management and all associates
  • Partner with store management to drive LP issues
  • Effectively utilize CCTV and Electronic Article Surveillance (EAS) systems
  • Conduct surveillance when required

CANDIDATE QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Must fulfil minimum time-in-position and performance management code requirements of M
  • Excellent analytical skills as well as strong verbal
  • Valid Security and Drivers Licenses as required by the Province
  • Must have access to reliable transportation

COMPENSATION:

  • Competitive pay
  • Travel time and mileage expensed
  • Profit Sharing and Stock Purchase Plan
  • Paid training and Career Development
  • Health and Dental Benefits
  • RRSP Contributions
  • Certain travel requirements will be reimbursed through submitted expenses

title: Loss Control Specialist - Canada
description:
About Our Company:

Are you looking for a challenging career that rewards hard work and success?   AFIRM is committed to finding outstanding people who have the ambition and willingness to learn in order to succeed.   The most successful candidates will be detail-oriented, self-motivated and possess strong problem-solving and analytical skills.  

 

AFIRM is the national leader in risk control, consulting services as well as commercial and residential inspections.   We provide our exceptional services to insurers, brokers, risk managers and government agencies.

 

Equal Opportunity Employer

The H.W. Kaufman Group of companies is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other status or condition protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

 

 

Qualifications:

Our Inspectorsâ€™ education and training:

 

  • Inspectors come from all walks of life with their own experience and background
  • AFIRM provides its candidates and Inspectors with a valuable set of skills unlike any other
  • They have all successfully completed AFIRMâ€™s own self-directed, on-line training certification program
  • Continue to hone their skills with AFIRMâ€™s on-going distance learning opportunities

 

 

Our Inspectorsâ€™ work environment      

 

  • As independent contractors with AFIRM, our inspectors work from home
  • They travel to various locations from their home base to assigned locations
  • Work evenings and weekends whenever required to maintain customer satisfaction

 

 

What all our Inspectors must have:

 

  • A reliable vehicle
  • Mobile phone
  • Windows based computer
  • Internet connection (high speed preferably)
  • Digital camera or smart phone that takes high quality digital pictures
Responsibilities:

 

AFIRM is a global leader in Loss Prevention and Premium Audit with Canadian locations in Richmond Hill and Montreal.   We are currently seeking independent Loss Prevention service contractors.

 

Our Loss Control Representatives (Inspectors) visit various property locations on behalf of the ownerâ€™s insurance company with a goal to minimize potential losses.   There is no selling involved.   Requests for inspection are received directly from the insurance companies.

 

Our successful Inspectors are:

 

  • Outgoing and independent
  • Curious and inquisitive by nature
  • Self-motivated strivers
  • Well organized and manage their time efficiently
  • Focused on quality of service
  • Competent computer skills with good input speed & accuracy
  • Skilled at writing well

 

What our Inspectors do:

 

  • Take responsibility for; and organize their assignments
  • Schedule their own appointments with property owners
  • Travel to the location
  • Tour the property and collect information (Residential and Commercial)
  • Identify potential areas of loss such as fire, theft and liability
  • Take photographs and measure buildings
  • Prepare a pre-define Loss Control report of the property using AFIRMâ€™s own web-based platform

title: Security Guard - Front Counter & Main Gate back-up - Part Time - Courtright, ON
description:
To:                                         All Security Personnel

From:                                    LeeAnne Feddes, People & Culture Coordinator

Date:                                     Open 

Closing Date:                       Open 

Re:                                         Job Posting

Position:                                Front Counter - Main Gate Security Guard

Site:                                       CF Industries

City:                                       Courtright, ON

Status:                                   Part-Time / Spare 

Hours:                                   (0700- 1630/0630-1630/ 0500 -1700 / 1700 -0500 hours)

Pay Rate:                               $15.73/hr. – 17.91/hr. wages based on levelling system.

 

Are you interested in starting a career in a fast paced and growing industry? As a provider of security services to clients with complex security needs, Paladin Security Group is offering an exciting career opportunity for you to give back to your community, while developing skills for future careers. Our training programs are also a leader in the security industry, and they will help prepare you for advancements, as well as build your resume for a potential career in law enforcement. 

Position Overview:

Supervision of security incumbents and the security and safety of the Courtright Location. They must ensure all personnel entering the Courtright location has a valid site specific safety orientation and/ or is registered appropriately upon arrival.

Essential Job Functions:

  • Maintain professionalism, confidence and confidentiality.
  • Provide security services at the Courtright CF Nitrogen Complex, maintaining order and the protection of assets, information and employees onsite.
  • Maintain a professional relationship with all personnel entering the site.
  • Administrative and reception duties; forward incoming calls to the appropriate department or personnel. Greet all visitors and communicate with the appropriate location personnel upon their arrival.
  • Responsible to conduct site Safety Orientation video for approved individuals prior to entry to site or annual renewals. Assist EH&S with Contractor Management Program.
  • Responsible to consult with ISNetworld Application program/ Short List to ensure contractor companies onsite are in compliance with insurance and WSIB prior to access on site. Report infractions to Procurement and/or EHS department.
  • Responsible for the signing out and issuance of keys onsite i.e. office keys, vehicle keys as per the site Access Management Program.   Complete proper documentation as required. Report any security breaches involving the program.
  • Responsible for the signing out and issuance of vehicle passes onsite as per the site Access Program.  Complete proper documentation as required.Report any security breaches involving the program.
  • Responsible for Material Gate / Personal passes onsite. Must review the pass for appropriate signatures, inspect the item(s) and sign the pass to allow item(s) to leave the Courtright location.
  • Assist in all shipping procedures. Must be fluent in the operation of the CF Direct shipping program.
  • Conduct Vehicle/ Seal inspections as required or requested.
  • Report all observed hazardous or unsafe conditions to the Security Supervisor/ Security Manager or appropriate shift supervisor including communicating this information to the oncoming security shift.
  • Log and report all unusual activities to the other security guards, Security Supervisor/ Security Manager.
  • Conduct interior and exterior patrols of the site; day shift only.Patrol grounds to protect against possible hazards through exercising sound judgment and problem-solving skills. Conduct random site security checks foot patrols.
  • Assist in any site investigation.
  • Write informative and detailed reports (Daily, Incident, and Accident) on all security matters.
  • Conduct Bag checks as required or requested.
  • Responsible to deliver outgoing mail and pickup incoming mail.
  • Responsible for miscellaneous deliveries or pickups as requested by the Security Supervisor/ Security Manager.
  • In the event of an emergency, follow emergency response procedures and directives from Security Supervisor/ Security Manager, Incident Commander, or ER Coordinator.
  • Review and continue to educate oneself on site emergency procedures and first aid/ CPR and all site medical equipment.
  • Responsible to administer first-aid/ CPR when required.
  • Continuously stay up to date on all Everbridge, CAER and Site Watch notification systems. Responsible to initiate notifications when directed to do so. 
  • Continuously stay up to date US/ Canadian Border Agency, Canadian Government Agencies, Canadian Coast Guard regulations and laws.
  • Accept after hours deliveries as per directives. Log and communicate arrival.
  • Responsible for monitoring and reporting any noncompliance with any EH&S/ HR policies and procedures
  • Unlock offices and gates as requested by the Security Supervisor/ Security Manager.
  • Assist/ conduct in any monthly Security inspections as required by the site Security Management Program.
  • Assist in the management of the Security Management Program
  • Designated the back up to the Maingate Guard position; hours will be flexible up scheduling needs. Will cover Maingate Guard vacations, and time off.
  • Complete all assigned training or reviews as required.
  • Attend mandatory security training meetings.
  • Any other duties assigned by the Security Supervisor or Security Manager .Security Guards are required to complete a Drug & Alcohol test for incidents that occur on client property.

Requirements:

  • Must possess a valid Ontario Driver’s License.
  • Must possess a valid First Aid training certificate.
  • Must possess a valid Transportation of Dangerous Goods training certificate.
  • Completion of Law and Security or equivalent considered an asset.
  • Must possess a minimum of 1 year’s directly related experience in the security and safety field; preferably in the fertilizer or petrochemical processing industry.
  • Demonstrate knowledge of safety and environmental regulations and issues.
  • Strong attention to detail with high focus on accuracy.
  • Strong communication skills both written and verbal.
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills.
  • Demonstrate the ability to work safely and in compliance with site safety, health and environmental standards and practices.
  • Demonstrate leadership capabilities.
  • Strong analytical and decision-making abilities.
  • Ability to deal effectively and diplomatically with employees, contractors, visitors etc.
  • Ability to work flexible hours

Working Conditions:

  • This position is mostly stationed out of the main gate security office
  • Indoor/ Outdoor tasks and duties
  • Moderate physical activities related to tasks and duties
  • Standing for extended periods of time is required
  • Computer work throughout the day.
  • Primarily day shift also shift work as back up main gate position

Physical Conditions:

  • This position is mostly stationed out of an office; the incumbent must be able to be mobile, with physical demands pertaining to standing for extended periods of time, climbing stairs, building tours, emergency response and computer work throughout the day.

Highlights:

  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement.

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. Immunization Record.
  2. Full Covid Vaccine.
  3. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License.
  4. Proficient in English (both oral and written).
  5. Vulnerable Sector Check may be required.

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  3. Use of Force
  4. Report Writing
  5. Additional courses as assigned

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Mental Illness Awareness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned

Should you have any questions on this process, kindly contact LeeAnne Feddes, People and Culture Coordinator at

lfeddes@paladinsecurity.com

title: Security Guard, Casual
description:
Description

Every day, thousands of Canadians are working to get us through the COVID-19 pandemic, and GardaWorld is at the forefront of this effort. Join us and help us keep our hospitals and essential services open and safe.

 

We are looking for Floater Security Guards to fill assignments for various client sites. The security guard (floater) will be playing a crucial role in maintaining the public security in these times of crisis.

What is a Floater Security Guard? A Floater Security Guard provides support to mulitple sites and can adapt to different work environments easily. For Floater Guards, variety is the spice of life. You may be working at an office tower one week, and the next week you may work at  a community college, then assigned to a condominium or retail mall. Your site is never the same - you will jump from one site to another while gaining knowledge about each one. Hours are flexible, and you can work up to 40 hours/week.

What you’ll be doing

  • Maintain a safe and secure environment
  • Access control of entryways and exit points using equipment at your disposal
  • Enforce property regulations and city bi-laws on the client's site
  • Patrol and monitor premises regularly to maintain order and establish presence
  • Protect the client's assets relative to theft, assault, fire, and other safety issues
  • Complete daily reports and incident reports
  • Provide excellent customer service

What we’re looking for

  • Valid security guard licence
  • High school diploma or equivalent
  • 1 year or more security-related experience
  • First aid and CPR certification preferred
  • Good communication skills (written/oral)
  • Driver’s licence and car (asset)
  • Excellent customer service and resourcefulness 
  • Good adaptability

What we offer

  • Flexible schedules 
  • Career advancement opportunities 
  • Excellent benefits 
  • Diverse work assignments 
  • Complete security uniform 
  • Free training

 

SSWINN

title: Oil and Gas Security Professional - North Coast
description:
Canada's Leading Provider of Corporate Security is seeking full-time security professionals for positions in the Oil and Gas sector on the North Coast of BC.

At Securiguard, we believe that every person deserves a safe environment to live, visit and work. Our vision is to be the best at making people feel safe by inspiring our staff to "believe they can make a difference" in everything they do. Currently, we employ over 4,000 security professionals worldwide, and we are committed to helping our employees reach their full potential through training, mentorship, and an internal mobility structure.

If you are looking for a stimulating and rewarding entry level position with great potential for career advancement in corporate security and asset protection, this role is for you.

Hours of work: 12-hour shifts, 2 weeks in/out schedule

Locations: Lejac, Houston, Burns Lake, Kitimat, Terrace, Prince George, Fraser Lake, Fort Fraser, New Hazelton, Hazelton, Smithers, and Over Arching North Coast

In this position you will:

  • Provide excellent customer service to both the client and site visitors
  • Provide emergency response:
    • Respond to incident/emergency situations and follow required protocols
    • Coordinate with the police or emergency personnel when required
  • Provide visual security presence:
    • Detect and deter unauthorized persons
  • Access control at terminals and project sites
  • Patrol designated areas
  • Conduct radio check ins
  • Identify and report safety hazards
  • Report security breaches
  • Submit a daily written report
  • Maintain consistent records using company issued notebook
  • Adhere to Securiguard's core Values, Vision, Mission statement
  • Perform regularly scheduled site duties as required by client's Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs)
  • Report Frequent shift activities

The Ideal Candidate will have:

  • A valid BC Security License
  • A Class 5 BC Driver's License with a clean driving abstract
  • A personal vehicle to travel to and from the job site
  • Will be able to pass the drug and alcohol test
  • Excellent English communication skills to write descriptive and factual daily reports

Additional Considerations:

Completion of any of the following certifications:

  • OFA 1 (Occupational First Aid)
  • WHMIS (Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System)
  • CSTS (Construction Safety Training System
  • PCST (Pipeline Construction Training)

Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Extended health and dental benefits - conditions apply
  • Discounted Cineplex movie tickets
  • Recognition programs & events
  • Flexible schedules
  • Additional training & Uniforms

We're only accepting applications from individuals seeking full-time employment with the ability to get yourself to and from site.

To learn more about Securiguard, our values, and career paths available, please visit our website:

https://www.securiguard.com/careers-and-training/

More about Securiguard:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea their team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.

At Securiguard, we believe you can make a difference – by making people feel safe, caring for the people around you, supporting your community, and by making a positive impact on the environment.

title: Security Guard - Financial
description:
Overview:

We are North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider with over 300,000 phenomenal employees. At Allied Universal ®, we pride ourselves on fostering a promote from within culture. There are countless examples of individuals who began their career as Security Professionals and today hold positions on our senior leadership team. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, and vision coverage, life insurance, employee assistance programs, and more! We also offer company paid uniforms and part-time and flexible schedules!

Job Description:

Allied Universal is seeking Professional Security Guards  in Canada.    

 

  • Part time
  • Financial services environment
  • Friday, Saturday & Sunday - Overnight
  • Eglinton and Eastgate, Mississauga
  • Valid Security Guard Licence
  • Valid First Aid/CPR Certificate
  • Must have a 5 year residency in Canada (min. PR held since April 2017) due to Reliability clearance (includes a Credit, Sanctions and Educational verification)
  • Some previous Security experience preferred
  • Excellent Communication & Computer skills
  • Pay rate: $16.00 per hour

 

QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS:

  • Be at least 18 years of age with high school diploma or equivalent
  • Legally entitled to work in Canada
  • Possess effective written and oral communication and interpersonal skills with ability to deal with all levels of personnel and the general public in a professional and effective manner

  • Licensing requirements are subject to province and/or local laws and regulations and will be required prior to employment.

  • As a condition of employment, employee must successfully complete a background check
  • Display exceptional customer service and communication skills
  • Have intermediate computer skills to operate innovative, wireless technology at client specific sites
  • Ability to handle crisis situations at the client site, calmly and efficiently
  • Able to:
    • Work in various environments such as cold weather, rain/snow or heat
    • Occasionally lift or carry up to 20 kilograms
    • Climb stairs, ramps, or ladders occasionally during shift
    • Stand or walk on various surfaces for long periods of time
Closing:

Allied Universal ®  provides unparalleled service, systems and solutions to the people and business of our communities, and is North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider. Allied Universal delivers high-quality, tailored solutions, which allows clients to focus on their core business. For more information:  www.AUSecurity.ca.

title: Tactical Security Gaurd - Full Time Position
description:
Regal Security Inc. is currently seeking Tactical Security Guards at one of its locations in the Welland, ON area.


The Ideal Candidate must have:

  • Full-time availability to work all days of the week and schedules that will consist of afternoons, overnight, and weekend shifts â€“ including holidays and weekends.
  • Customer service-driven individual
  • Clear English communication skills in all areas (verbal and written)
  • Detailed and thorough record-keeping (Memo book, incident reports, etc)
  • Keen observation and attentiveness
  • Professional physical deportment and presentation
  • Decision Making, Reliable, Common Sense, and exceptional judgment
  • Able to work as a team
  • Working knowledge of Trespass to Property Act and Criminal Code of Canada


Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Provide outstanding and personalized customer service as a front line representative of Regal Security
  • Operate and maintain an organized environment
  • Enforce property rules and regulations and Trespass to Property Act in order to maintain the security and safety of our clients and their assets
  • Oversee the logging in and out of site equipment
  • Actively Monitor CCTV, fire systems, and access systems
  • Respond to all emergency situations (medical, building, etc)
  • Ensure that safety and emergency protocols are completed in response to Fire Alarms and other Site Emergencies
  • Complete walking patrols, vehicle patrols, and inspections of facilities and equipment and report any hazards, deficiencies, etc. to ensure safety and security
  • Review, know and follow post orders as identified for site representing
  • Maintain a safe working environment and follow the facilities health and safety procedures
  • Duties as otherwise assigned


Qualifications:

  • Valid Ontario Security License
  • Valid First Aid/CPR Certification
  • Valid WHMIS Certification
  • Valid Ontario Drivers Licence with a clean driving record
  • The use of Force is an asset
  • Secondary School Diploma or equivalent and higher (preference will be given to those with a Criminal Justice, Law, and Security, Police Foundations or similar post-secondary education)
  • Proficient in the use of various computer programs (ie. Microsoft Office, Gmail) and able to adapt and learn new programs
 

Compensation:

  • Pay rate will be $17.00 per hour.
  • Health Benefits are available for full-time employees upon completion of 3 months probation

 

Why choose Regal Security?

Regal Security Inc. is an established and growing security company that offers a vast array of professional and dependable security guard services across the Greater Toronto Area and Southwest Ontario.

Our Everyday Superheroâ„¢ guards are selected and trained to protect our clientâ€™s assets, property, employees, and tenants, using a custom-designed security solution for every client within the sectors we serve.

Every member of the Regal security team, and every service that is carried out, is directed by the Regal guiding principle: Strength & Honorâ„¢. With this in mind, Regalâ€™s security guards are known as Everyday Superheroesâ„¢ â€“ they are friendly, well-trained and, most importantly, proud, as they go above and beyond the call of duty to uphold Regalâ€™s high standards.

 

â€œTHE REGAL SECURITY MISSION IS â€œYOUR PEACE OF MINDâ€â„¢â€

Thank you for your application, unfortunately, due to the high volume of applicants, only those deemed eligible for an interview will be contacted. All candidates will be communicated to by phone or email for the purposes of the recruitment process.

Regal Security Inc. welcomes all candidates equally and encourages all qualified candidates, from women and men including persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and Aboriginal persons, to apply.

 

Regal provides accommodation for applicants with disabilities during the recruitment process in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Security Guard
description:
Company Overview

Synterra Security Solutions is a First Nation owned Company which was formed in September 2011, dedicated to Premium Security Services. We are a very diverse company and we pride ourselves on being an equal opportunity employer. We are all about inclusion, diversity, professionalism and success. When you choose to join our team, youâ€™ll have the security in knowing you will be joining a company that provides you with not just a job but a rewarding career. Visit us: www.synterra.ca

Work Location: Northern Ontario, outside of Geraldton, ON

Full time positions are available 

Shifts: 7 days on 7 days off rotation, 12-hour shifts

Work Setting: Private security agency, mine/energy site

title: Security Guard: Vernon/Lavington
description:
Saturday & Sunday 07:00AM to 3:00PM 

Saturday & Sunday 11:00PM - 07:00AM

$19.00 per hour

Commissionaires BC is recruiting for a local security professional in the Lavington area to perform security services at the local mill. This is no desk job! This role will keep you active with foot patrols throughout the site during your shifts. This site pays competitively within the security field at $19/hr.

Opportunity to pick up additional shifts within Commissionaires BC is also available. 

Your Must-Haves: 

  • BC Security Worker's License
  • Excellent problem solving skills  
  • Can work under pressure
  • Physically fit, able to stand for long periods and work both indoors and outdoors in a range of weather conditions
  • Valid Driverâ€™s License with a clean driverâ€™s abstract 

Your Nice-To-Haves: 

  • Occupational First Aid Level 1 or 2 
  • Resident of Canada for 5 years (required for some government clearances)

About Us

Commissionaires BC is a Canadian, not-for-profit security/enforcement organization that has been in business since 1927. Our mandate is to give back to those who served and continue to serve in our communities and country.

Commissionaires is the leading supplier of security services for the federal government. From access control and front desk security, to 24/7 control room operations, we provide high-level security services to our federal clients.
 

Whatâ€™s in it for you? 

  • Opportunity for growth advancement within the organization
  • Work for a reputable and nationally known company 
  • A challenging yet rewarding work environment
  • Free uniforms
  • Paid on-site training
  • Gain valuable experience that can be applied as a stepping stone into a career in law enforcement, border services, corrections, etc.

Youâ€™re a good fit ifâ€¦

  • You are reliable and committed
  • You are familiar with shift work and can work days/afternoons/graveyards
  • You are comfortable working indoors and outdoors
  • You are comfortable working alone or as part of a team
  • You have a positive attitude and enjoy working with the public
  • You can think on your feet and problem solve
  • You can work alone or as part of a team

Some of your responsibilities include: 

  • Completing extensive interior and exterior patrols at Tolko - Lavington including up and down stairs
  • Offering first class customer service to the client and public
  • Access Control
  • Proactively responding to and resolving emergency situations and conflicts
  • Maintaining detailed and accurate daily logs and incident reports
  • Effectively communicating problems or concerns to the Site Supervisor

title: Loss Prevention Specialist: Full Time (9 Month Contract)
description:
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • This is a plain clothed/undercover positon in multiple locations
  • Detain and interview persons apprehended for shoplifting in accordance with local laws and company procedures. Complete investigative case packages and statements regarding all internal/external theft and fraud for local police agencies
  • Conduct floor walks and support the stores by conducting tests and providing feedback regarding all aspects of home depot’s safety, security and shrink standards
  • Check physical security of The Home Depot facilities to prevent and deter theft/fraudulent activity
  • Represent the Home Depot in a professional manner throughout all court-related procedures
  • Maintain an open channel of communication with store management and all associates
  • Partner with store management to drive LP issues
  • Effectively utilize CCTV and Electronic Article Surveillance (EAS) systems
  • Conduct surveillance when required

CANDIDATE QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Must fulfil minimum time-in-position and performance management code requirements of M
  • Excellent analytical skills as well as strong verbal
  • Valid Security and Drivers Licenses as required by the Province
  • Must have access to reliable transportation

COMPENSATION:

  • Competitive pay
  • Travel time and mileage expensed
  • Profit Sharing and Stock Purchase Plan
  • Paid training and Career Development
  • Health and Dental Benefits
  • RRSP Contributions
  • Certain travel requirements will be reimbursed through submitted expenses

title: Loss Control Specialist - Canada
description:
About Our Company:

Are you looking for a challenging career that rewards hard work and success?   AFIRM is committed to finding outstanding people who have the ambition and willingness to learn in order to succeed.   The most successful candidates will be detail-oriented, self-motivated and possess strong problem-solving and analytical skills.  

 

AFIRM is the national leader in risk control, consulting services as well as commercial and residential inspections.   We provide our exceptional services to insurers, brokers, risk managers and government agencies.

 

Equal Opportunity Employer

The H.W. Kaufman Group of companies is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other status or condition protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

 

 

Qualifications:

Our Inspectorsâ€™ education and training:

 

  • Inspectors come from all walks of life with their own experience and background
  • AFIRM provides its candidates and Inspectors with a valuable set of skills unlike any other
  • They have all successfully completed AFIRMâ€™s own self-directed, on-line training certification program
  • Continue to hone their skills with AFIRMâ€™s on-going distance learning opportunities

 

 

Our Inspectorsâ€™ work environment      

 

  • As independent contractors with AFIRM, our inspectors work from home
  • They travel to various locations from their home base to assigned locations
  • Work evenings and weekends whenever required to maintain customer satisfaction

 

 

What all our Inspectors must have:

 

  • A reliable vehicle
  • Mobile phone
  • Windows based computer
  • Internet connection (high speed preferably)
  • Digital camera or smart phone that takes high quality digital pictures
Responsibilities:

 

AFIRM is a global leader in Loss Prevention and Premium Audit with Canadian locations in Richmond Hill and Montreal.   We are currently seeking independent Loss Prevention service contractors.

 

Our Loss Control Representatives (Inspectors) visit various property locations on behalf of the ownerâ€™s insurance company with a goal to minimize potential losses.   There is no selling involved.   Requests for inspection are received directly from the insurance companies.

 

Our successful Inspectors are:

 

  • Outgoing and independent
  • Curious and inquisitive by nature
  • Self-motivated strivers
  • Well organized and manage their time efficiently
  • Focused on quality of service
  • Competent computer skills with good input speed & accuracy
  • Skilled at writing well

 

What our Inspectors do:

 

  • Take responsibility for; and organize their assignments
  • Schedule their own appointments with property owners
  • Travel to the location
  • Tour the property and collect information (Residential and Commercial)
  • Identify potential areas of loss such as fire, theft and liability
  • Take photographs and measure buildings
  • Prepare a pre-define Loss Control report of the property using AFIRMâ€™s own web-based platform

title: Security Guard/Officer
description:
Are you an experienced customer service or hospitality professional that has recently had your employment negatively impacted by Covid-19? Do you have strong skills in customer service delivery, teamwork, and problem-solving? We want to hear from you!

Paladin offers job stable positions and lots of career advancement opportunities, including free training, security licensing, and promotion from within.

Your track record of handling a great deal of responsibility combined with your varied life experience and enthusiasm for a job well done make you an ideal candidate for our team! The Paladin Difference starts with our officers; we're the best because we hire the best.  If you think you have what it takes to join our team, we want to meet you!

Pay range: $17-22 per hour (dependent on site/location).

Positions are available now in Kamloops, Ashcroft, Williams Lake and other parts of BC!

Overview

We offer top industry wages, free training in the fundamentals of security and First Aid / CPR, a rewards and recognition program, excellent promotional opportunities, free uniforms, flexible hours, and a comprehensive benefits package.

Job Skills / Requirements

Our current opportunities include full-time and part-time positions with a focus on having a 24/7 availability in hospitals and healthcare facilities, government buildings, post-secondary campuses, shopping centers, office towers, mobile alarm response drivers, warehouses, and more!

Minimum Requirements

  • Excellent customer service, problem solving, and willingness to help.
  • Strong English communication skills (written and verbal).
  • Comfortable interacting verbally with team members, client personnel, members of the general public, and emergency services.
  • Able to write detailed incident reports which may be utilized in court if subpoenaed.
  • A passion for being active, your patrols may be indoors or outdoors, in all weather conditions, and can include stairwells, uneven surfaces, and parkades.
  • You must be physically able to stand and/or patrol for the majority of a shift (8-hours average).
  • Comfortable approaching and leading in emergency situations, including trauma, aggression, intoxication, bodily fluids, etc.
  • Basic skills in utilizing technology, including writing reports on a computer, tracking patrols in a smart phone, and communicating via two-way radio.

Additional Information / Benefits

  • An active lifestyle: If sitting behind a desk doesn’t appeal to you, you’ll love the dynamic work environment that security can bring.
  • Leading Corporate Culture: Paladin is a Canadian employee or choice because of the amazing people that work here!
  • Career advancement: Whether you are gaining experience for law enforcement, looking for meaningful work as a student, or simply exploring a field you are passionate about, Paladin gives you the opportunity to advance your skills!
  • Health Benefits & Perks: Full-time employees are eligible for great benefits, and all staff can enjoy exclusive Paladin discounts at your favourite retailers and service providers across Canada!
  • And more…

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those applicants that are short listed will be contacted for an interview.

title: Security Guard, Industrial
description:
If you are seeking a job where you have important responsibilities, this one is for you! As a security guard in the industrial sector, you will play a key role in ensuring the safety of workers for some of the biggest brands out there!  We provide people with growth opportunities. 30% of our frontline employees are promoted to become part of our operation teams. 

 

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in Sarnia now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, we have a position that will accommodate your needs and help you reach your goals. 

What's in it for you?

  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits  

  • Uniform provided free of charge 

  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld 

  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus like Use of Force training 

What does a Security Guard in Sarnia do?

  • Logging commercial vehicles and visitors on site,

  • Providing access control

  • Interior and Exterior patrols 

  • Alarm response patrols on foot and in mobile patrol vehicle 

  • Enforce property rules,

  • Deter and respond to incidents on property

  • Maintain a presence to ensure the safety and security of all persons on site

  • Communicate regularly with patrons/clients

  • Complete reports and memo book entries on a regular basis

  • Respond to various types of emergencies (fire alarms/ medical emergencies)

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in Sarnia

  • A valid security guard license and first aid card 

  • Available to work flexible hours 

  • Have a clear criminal background 

  • Be eligible to work in Canada 

 

Start your journey with GardaWorld today! Apply online or get in touch with Dean at dean.mougenot@garda.com

title: Security Guard - Full Time - Shelburne Ontario
description:
Full Time Security Guard required for Industrial location in Shelburne, Ontario

Close to Alliston and Orangeville

Salary is $15.50 per hour

Experience and Qualifications:

  • Valid Security Guard License
  • Valid First Aid / CPR certificate
  • Must be able to stand, sit and walk for extended periods of time
  • Strong Communication skills, written and verbal
  • Ability to complete daily logs and write detailed reports
  • Must have strong customer service skills
  • Previous security experience would be an asset
  • Basic Computer Skills

"A Different Kind of Employer"

Securiguard secured its first contract in 1974 in the mining town of Cassiar, acting as an extension of management focusing on customer service. Our original trade name was World Investigation, Security Division, which was re-branded to Securiguard in 1977.

We are an innovative security company known to make strides ahead of others in the field. We introduced the first high visibility yellow jacket, the first bicycle patrol and being the first private security company to become ISO certified. Securiguard was selected to replace the RCMP at a Class 1 Airport, at the time, the only one in Canada. Partly due to the success of our implementation, many airport authorities have now adopted this model. Securiguard was also selected to replace the Ports Canada Police patrolling functions, which is where we introduced our trademark high visibility vehicles.

We do things differently than other companies - an unprecedented level of respect for security personnel, with progressive supervisors and management. You will not be hired and forgotten

We thank all applicants for applying however only qualified candidates will be contacted.

THIS POSTING WILL REMAIN VISIBLE UNTIL ALL POSITIONS ARE FILLED.

title: Experienced Security Guard - Brampton
description:
Overview:

We are North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider with over 300,000 phenomenal employees. At Allied Universal ®, we pride ourselves on fostering a promote from within culture. There are countless examples of individuals who began their career as Security Professionals and today hold positions on our senior leadership team. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, and vision coverage, life insurance, employee assistance programs, and more! We also offer company paid uniforms and part-time and flexible schedules!

Job Description:

Allied Universal is seeking Professional Security Guards  in Canada.    

 

 

  • Part time
  • Saturday - Sunday  
  • Vodden Street. East, Brampton, L6V 1N2
  • Valid Security Guard Licence
  • Valid First Aid/CPR Certificate
  • Some previous Security experience preferred
  • Excellent Communication
  • Saturday 11:30 to 18:30 hours and Sunday 11:30 to 17:30 hours.

 

QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS:

  • Be at least 18 years of age with high school diploma or equivalent
  • Legally entitled to work in Canada
  • Possess effective written and oral communication and interpersonal skills with ability to deal with all levels of personnel and the general public in a professional and effective manner

  • Licensing requirements are subject to province and/or local laws and regulations and will be required prior to employment.

  • As a condition of employment, employee must successfully complete a background check
  • Display exceptional customer service and communication skills
  • Have intermediate computer skills to operate innovative, wireless technology at client specific sites
  • Ability to handle crisis situations at the client site, calmly and efficiently
  • Able to:
    • Work in various environments such as cold weather, rain/snow or heat
    • Occasionally lift or carry up to 20 kilograms
    • Climb stairs, ramps, or ladders occasionally during shift
    • Stand or walk on various surfaces for long periods of time
Closing:

Allied Universal ®  provides unparalleled service, systems and solutions to the people and business of our communities, and is North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider. Allied Universal delivers high-quality, tailored solutions, which allows clients to focus on their core business. For more information:  www.AUSecurity.ca.

title: Tactical Security Gaurd - Full Time Position
description:
Regal Security Inc. is currently seeking Tactical Security Guards at one of its locations in the Welland, ON area.


The Ideal Candidate must have:

  • Full-time availability to work all days of the week and schedules that will consist of afternoons, overnight, and weekend shifts â€“ including holidays and weekends.
  • Customer service-driven individual
  • Clear English communication skills in all areas (verbal and written)
  • Detailed and thorough record-keeping (Memo book, incident reports, etc)
  • Keen observation and attentiveness
  • Professional physical deportment and presentation
  • Decision Making, Reliable, Common Sense, and exceptional judgment
  • Able to work as a team
  • Working knowledge of Trespass to Property Act and Criminal Code of Canada


Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Provide outstanding and personalized customer service as a front line representative of Regal Security
  • Operate and maintain an organized environment
  • Enforce property rules and regulations and Trespass to Property Act in order to maintain the security and safety of our clients and their assets
  • Oversee the logging in and out of site equipment
  • Actively Monitor CCTV, fire systems, and access systems
  • Respond to all emergency situations (medical, building, etc)
  • Ensure that safety and emergency protocols are completed in response to Fire Alarms and other Site Emergencies
  • Complete walking patrols, vehicle patrols, and inspections of facilities and equipment and report any hazards, deficiencies, etc. to ensure safety and security
  • Review, know and follow post orders as identified for site representing
  • Maintain a safe working environment and follow the facilities health and safety procedures
  • Duties as otherwise assigned


Qualifications:

  • Valid Ontario Security License
  • Valid First Aid/CPR Certification
  • Valid WHMIS Certification
  • Valid Ontario Drivers Licence with a clean driving record
  • The use of Force is an asset
  • Secondary School Diploma or equivalent and higher (preference will be given to those with a Criminal Justice, Law, and Security, Police Foundations or similar post-secondary education)
  • Proficient in the use of various computer programs (ie. Microsoft Office, Gmail) and able to adapt and learn new programs
 

Compensation:

  • Pay rate will be $17.00 per hour.
  • Health Benefits are available for full-time employees upon completion of 3 months probation

 

Why choose Regal Security?

Regal Security Inc. is an established and growing security company that offers a vast array of professional and dependable security guard services across the Greater Toronto Area and Southwest Ontario.

Our Everyday Superheroâ„¢ guards are selected and trained to protect our clientâ€™s assets, property, employees, and tenants, using a custom-designed security solution for every client within the sectors we serve.

Every member of the Regal security team, and every service that is carried out, is directed by the Regal guiding principle: Strength & Honorâ„¢. With this in mind, Regalâ€™s security guards are known as Everyday Superheroesâ„¢ â€“ they are friendly, well-trained and, most importantly, proud, as they go above and beyond the call of duty to uphold Regalâ€™s high standards.

 

â€œTHE REGAL SECURITY MISSION IS â€œYOUR PEACE OF MINDâ€â„¢â€

Thank you for your application, unfortunately, due to the high volume of applicants, only those deemed eligible for an interview will be contacted. All candidates will be communicated to by phone or email for the purposes of the recruitment process.

Regal Security Inc. welcomes all candidates equally and encourages all qualified candidates, from women and men including persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and Aboriginal persons, to apply.

 

Regal provides accommodation for applicants with disabilities during the recruitment process in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Please contact us to request accommodation.

 

#INDREGAL

title: Security Officer - Casual Vancouver Area
description:
Looking to start your career in security services? We have a great opportunity for you! 

Our Story 

Commissionaires BC is a Canadian, not-for-profit security/enforcement organization that has been in business since 1927. Our mandate is to give back to those who served and continue to serve in our communities and country.

Commissionaires provides security services for over 200 sites and are located in over 110 communities across the province. Our client base runs from the Federal Government to local municipalities, airports, industrial sectors, and commercial/residential buildings.  

Our guards are not only behind the scenes providing security and access control, but front and centre providing valued customer service to the public.

We are looking for security guards who are available to work in the Vancouver area. 

Whatâ€™s in it for you 

  • Opportunity for growth
  • Work for a reputable and nationally known company 
  • A challenging yet rewarding work environment 
  • Flexibility of rotations and sites to suit your requirements 
  • Free uniforms 
  • Paid on-site training  
  • Gain valuable experience as a stepping stone into a law enforcement career 

Youâ€™re a good fit ifâ€¦  

  • You hold a positive and can do attitude 
  • You are reliable and committed  
  • You can think on your feet and problem solve 
  • You can work alone or as part of a team 

Some of your responsibilities include: 

  • Patrolling various sites/locations 
  • Offering first class customer service to both clients and general public 
  • Mobile patrolling/ticketing  
  • Access Control 
  • CCTV Monitoring 
  • Proactively responding to and resolving emergency situations and conflicts  
  • Maintaining detailed and accurate daily logs and incident reports 
  • Effectively communicating problems or concerns to the Site Supervisor 

Your Must-Haves:

  • BC Security License  
  • You have excellent problem solving skills  
  • You can work under pressure 
  • Physically fit, able to stand for long periods and work both indoors and outdoors in a range of weather conditions; 

Your Nice-To-Haves:

  • You have a valid Driverâ€™s Licence with a clean driverâ€™s abstract 
  • You have resided in Canada for the last five years 
  • Hold OFA 1 or OFA 2

title: Loss Prevention Specialist: Full Time (6 Month Contract)
description:
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • This is a plain clothed/undercover positon in multiple locations
  • Detain and interview persons apprehended for shoplifting in accordance with local laws and company procedures. Complete investigative case packages and statements regarding all internal/external theft and fraud for local police agencies
  • Conduct floor walks and support the stores by conducting tests and providing feedback regarding all aspects of home depot’s safety, security and shrink standards
  • Check physical security of The Home Depot facilities to prevent and deter theft/fraudulent activity
  • Represent the Home Depot in a professional manner throughout all court-related procedures
  • Maintain an open channel of communication with store management and all associates
  • Partner with store management to drive LP issues
  • Effectively utilize CCTV and Electronic Article Surveillance (EAS) systems
  • Conduct surveillance when required

CANDIDATE QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Must fulfil minimum time-in-position and performance management code requirements of M
  • Excellent analytical skills as well as strong verbal
  • Valid Security and Drivers Licenses as required by the Province
  • Must have access to reliable transportation

COMPENSATION:

  • Competitive pay
  • Travel time and mileage expensed
  • Profit Sharing and Stock Purchase Plan
  • Paid training and Career Development
  • Health and Dental Benefits
  • RRSP Contributions
  • Certain travel requirements will be reimbursed through submitted expenses
