title: Security Guard - Screener - St. Thomas Elgin General Hospital - Full Time - St. Thomas, ON
description:
Position Overview:

In this role you will work alongside hospital staff to ensure compliance of Covid Entry Protocols. Must hold a valid Ontario Security Guard License. All required PPE is provided, and you will be required to always wear a medical face mask.

  • Support security measures relative to hospital access policies in accordance with COVID19 protocols
  • Ensure safety and emergency procedures are followed
  • Direct visitors to appropriate areas, perform security checks, and liaise with visitors, customers, and the public.
  • Maintaining a positive, productive work environment through collaboration.

Why Choose Paladin:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement
 

Preferred skills/qualifications:

  • Valid Ontario Security Guard licence (required)
  • Valid First Aid & CPR certificate
  • In this role, it is essential that you maintain integrity, clear written and oral communication skills, and maintain a high standard of customer service.

 

Essential Job Functions:

  • Be courteous and cooperative with a high quality of customer service.
  • Good interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively at various social levels and across diverse cultures.
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Communicates any concerns/issues with Operations Manager.

Requirements:

  • Working knowledge of the Trespass to Property Act.
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Excellent communication skills with a focus on customer service along with good computer abilities are all core requirements.
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills. Ability to write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy.
  • Patrol assigned area on foot, as assigned, to ensure personal, building, and equipment security.
  • Watch for and report irregularities by completing investigations and incident reports, such as security breaches, facility and safety hazards, and emergency situations; contact emergency responders, such as police, fire, and/or ambulance personnel, as required.
  • Sustain effective relationships with key stakeholders and provide specialized security services by enforcing rules and regulations when required.
  • Offer support to any person in need such as providing good customer service when providing a security presence, such as providing direction, responding to emergency situation involving violent individuals and injuries.
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.

title: Security Guard, Shopping Center
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

If you are looking for a job where you will be working with the public, this is the job for you! As a Mall Security Officer, you will play a key role in ensuring the safety of workers, businesses and the public!  

We provide people with growth opportunities. 30% of our frontline employees are promoted to become part of our operation teams. 

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in Ottawa now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, we have a position that will accommodate your needs and help you reach your goals. 

 

What's in it for you?

  • $300 signing bonus!

  • 15,80$ - 16,28$ & comprehensive health benefits  

  • We can guarantee 40 hours/week 

  • Uniform provided free of charge 

  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld 

  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus like Use of Force training 

What does a Security Guard in Ottawa do ?

  • Facilitate access to restricted areas for authorized persons 

  • Patrol the site on foot and by car 

  • Monitor closed circuit cameras  

  • Coordinate response to incidents  

  • Respond to telephone calls received by the security department

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in Ottawa

  • A valid security guard license and first aid card 

  • Available to work flexible hours 

  • Have a clear criminal background 

  • Be eligible to work in Canada

title: Pipeline Remote Camp Security Guard
description:
Securiguard is looking for Security Guards for an gas pipeline extending from Chetwynd, BC to Houston BC, BC. This is a great opportunity for those looking for well paid work to those who are open to travel and staying with us in comfort.


Wages: starting at $283 per day (based on a 12 hour shift) plus travel expenses.


Who we are:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost 50 years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solutions provider. That is how we have become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea, our team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.


Securiguard is looking for Security Guards for a pipeline project in the following cities in BC : Chetwynd, Burns Lake, Fraser Lake and Houston, and Kitimat BC. This is a rewarding position, accommodations, travel, and meals are provided. For those looking for well-paid work to those who are open to travel to remote work and stay in comfort, we want to hear from you!

Securiguard is committed to maximizing employment and training opportunities for Indigenous, local, and regional residents. If you identify as a member of an Indigenous community, we encourage you to self-identify in our optional screening question


What's in it for YOU!

  • Accommodation for 2 weeks in your rotation
  • Clean private room, which includes, Bed, A/C, 32" TV ( Netflix, Crave, Prime are included), desk, small closet, personal shower, and toilet.
  • Housekeeping - towels, sheet changing and room cleaning
  • Meals are provided - 24/7 meals, includes a daily breakfast, lunch and dinner, and after-hours snack/food available, support any dietary restrictions. Meal to GO app available
  • Health and Wellness - workout gym, running and bike machines, lounge, playroom, media room
  • Free Wi-Fi in each room
  • Travel allowance per rotation, including hotel stay if needed.

Stay and work in comfort with Securiguard


What would you do:

  • Observe and report suspicious activity, and report security breaches
  • Respond to incident/emergency situations and follow protocol
  • Provide perimeter security coverage
  • Provide access control and ensure there is no unauthorized access to the site
  • Patrolling of designated areas in an outdoor environment
  • Radio check ins and security report writing duties
  • Provide a visual security presence - detecting and deterring unauthorized persons
  • Coordinating and liaising with the police or emergency personnel when required
  • Adhere to Securiguard's core Values, Vision, Mission statement

What would you bring:

  • Valid BC Security License
  • Previous security experience is an asset
  • Class 5 Driver's License with a clean driving abstract and claims history
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Comfort working in a wilderness setting
  • Must be able to pass drug and alcohol test

Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer, and we value the diversity of our staff. We are committed to building a facilitative environment of respect, inclusiveness, and career growth.

Securiguard is committed to maximizing employment and training opportunities for Indigenous, local, and regional residents. If you identify as a member of an Indigenous community, we encourage you to self-identify in our optional screening question.

title: Security Guard - Data Centre
description:
Overview:

We are North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider with over 300,000 phenomenal employees. At Allied Universal ®, we pride ourselves on fostering a promote from within culture. There are countless examples of individuals who began their career as Security Professionals and today hold positions on our senior leadership team. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, and vision coverage, life insurance, employee assistance programs, and more! We also offer company paid uniforms and part-time and flexible schedules!

Job Description:

Allied Universal is seeking Professional Security Guards  in Canada.    

 

  • Part time
  • Data Centre
  • Saturday - Sunday Overnight
  • Valid Security Guard Licence
  • Valid First Aid/CPR Certificate
  • Argentia Road, Mississauga
  • Some previous Security experience preferred
  • Pay rate: $16.50 per hour

 

QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS:

  • Be at least 18 years of age with high school diploma or equivalent
  • Legally entitled to work in Canada
  • Possess effective written and oral communication and interpersonal skills with ability to deal with all levels of personnel and the general public in a professional and effective manner

  • Licensing requirements are subject to province and/or local laws and regulations and will be required prior to employment.

  • As a condition of employment, employee must successfully complete a background check
  • Display exceptional customer service and communication skills
  • Have intermediate computer skills to operate innovative, wireless technology at client specific sites
  • Ability to handle crisis situations at the client site, calmly and efficiently
  • Able to:
    • Work in various environments such as cold weather, rain/snow or heat
    • Occasionally lift or carry up to 20 kilograms
    • Climb stairs, ramps, or ladders occasionally during shift
    • Stand or walk on various surfaces for long periods of time
Closing:

Allied Universal ®  provides unparalleled service, systems and solutions to the people and business of our communities, and is North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider. Allied Universal delivers high-quality, tailored solutions, which allows clients to focus on their core business. For more information:  www.AUSecurity.ca.

title: Security Guard - Healthcare Screener (Full Time)
description:
Regal Security Inc. is currently seeking a Security Guard - Healthcare Screener at a prominent healthcare facility located in theMississauga, ON area.

Job Summary: Security Guard - Healthcare Screener will be posted at various access and egress points of the facility and will be responsible for the proper verbal assessment of a visitor to grant or deny them entry past the access control points.  Healthcare Screener Security Guards will be responsible to strictly enforce that all persons entering the facility comply with the Health Care Facilityâ€™s visitor access policy.

 

Applicants must be able to demonstrate the following prior to an interview: 

Â· Valid Security Licence

Â· Valid CPR Certificate

 

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Assess and screen all persons wishing to enter the access control point of the healthcare facility as per the visitor policy 
  • Maintain flow at the entrance ensuring everyone entering the location is verbally screened
  • Adhere to necessary policy and procedures related to wearing Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) and sanitization
  • Ensure all persons entering the facility follow proper precautionary measures and wear the correct protective apparel as required
  • Exercise diplomacy and empathy if there is an issue with the visitorâ€™s request for access to the site
  • Conducting access control at various control points
  • Conducting patrols across various locations on hospital grounds

 

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Demonstrated strong communication, customer service and interpersonal skills
  • Ability and willingness to work in a Healthcare environment
  • Successful completion of a high school diploma or equivalent
  • Availability to work a variety of shifts (days, evenings, overnights), 7 days per week
  • Willingness to work shifts that require extended periods of standing;
  • Willingness to wear protective apparel for duration of shift times (face mask, face shields, gloves and gowns)
  • Thoroughness and attention to detail
  • Flexibility and adaptability
  • Problem solving and decision-making skills
  • Sound judgment and conflict management skills
  • Reliability and punctuality
  • Demonstrated ability to work co-operative with a variety of people in a team environment
  • Due to the hours of the job and limitations of transit, a personal vehicle is preferred.

 

COMPENSATION:

  • Pay Rate will be $18.00 per hour.
  • Health Benefits are available for full-time employees upon completion of 3 months probation
     

Why choose Regal Security?

Regal Security Inc. is an established and growing security company that offers a vast array of professional and dependable security guard services across the Greater Toronto Area and Southwest Ontario.

Our Everyday Superheroâ„¢ guards are selected and trained to protect the clientâ€™s assets, property, employees, and tenants, using a custom-designed security solution for every client within the sectors we serve.

 

Every member of the Regal security team, and every service that is carried out, is directed by the Regal guiding principle: Strength & Honorâ„¢. With this in mind, Regalâ€™s security guards are known as Everyday Superheroesâ„¢ â€“ they are friendly, well-trained and, most importantly, proud, as they go above and beyond the call of duty to uphold Regalâ€™s high standards.

 

â€œTHE REGAL SECURITY MISSION IS â€œYOUR PEACE OF MINDâ€â„¢â€

 

Thank you for your application, unfortunately, due to the high volume of applicants, only those deemed eligible for an interview will be contacted. All candidates will be communicated to by phone or email for the purposes of the recruitment process.

 

Regal Security Inc. welcomes all candidates equally and encourages all qualified candidates, from women and men including persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and Aboriginal persons, to apply.

 

#INDREGAL

title: Security Guard - Casual on call Kelowna
description:
We are growing! Join Commissionaires BC's Reserve Division in Kelowna BC and experience a variety of security sites, competitive pay, flexible schedules, and lots of opportunity for advancement. We have plenty of work on our Reserve Division within the city of Kelowna. 

If you have a passion for security, take pride in your work, have excellent communication and customer service skills, and are looking for your next step in your security career, we'd love to have you join our team!

Our Story 

Commissionaires BC is a Canadian, not-for-profit security/enforcement organization that has been in business since 1927. Our mandate is to give back to those who served and continue to serve in our communities and country. 

Commissionaires provides security services for over 200 sites and are located in over 110 communities across the province. Our client base runs from the Federal Government to local municipalities, airports, industrial sectors, and commercial/residential buildings.  

Our guards are not only behind the scenes providing security and access control, but front and centre providing valued customer service to the public. 

Whatâ€™s in it for you? 

  • Opportunity for growth advancement within the organization
  • Extended health & dental benefits
  • Work for a reputable and nationally known company 
  • A challenging yet rewarding work environment
  • Flexibility of rotations and sites to suit your requirements
  • Free uniforms
  • Paid on-site training
  • Gain valuable experience as a stepping stone into a law enforcement career

Youâ€™re a good fit ifâ€¦

  • You hold a positive and can do attitude 
  • You are reliable and committed
  • You can think on your feet and problem solve
  • You can work alone or as part of a team

Some of your responsibilities include: 

  • Extensive interior and/or exterior patrols 
  • Offering first class customer service to both clients and general public
  • Access Control
  • CCTV Monitoring
  • Proactively responding to and resolving emergency situations and conflicts
  • Maintaining detailed and accurate daily logs and incident reports
  • Effectively communicating problems or concerns to the Field Supervisor

Your Must-Haves: 

  • BC Security License
  • Valid Driverâ€™s License with a clean driverâ€™s abstract 
  • Clear criminal record with ability
  • Excellent problem solving skills  
  • Basic computer skills
  • Able to work under pressure
  • Able to stand for long periods and work both indoors and outdoors in a range of weather conditions

Your Nice-To-Haves: 

  • You have resided in Canada for the last five years 
  • Hold OFA 1 or OFA 2

title: Loss Control Specialist - Canada
description:
About Our Company:

Are you looking for a challenging career that rewards hard work and success?   AFIRM is committed to finding outstanding people who have the ambition and willingness to learn in order to succeed.   The most successful candidates will be detail-oriented, self-motivated and possess strong problem-solving and analytical skills.  

 

AFIRM is the national leader in risk control, consulting services as well as commercial and residential inspections.   We provide our exceptional services to insurers, brokers, risk managers and government agencies.

 

Equal Opportunity Employer

The H.W. Kaufman Group of companies is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other status or condition protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

 

 

Qualifications:

Our Inspectorsâ€™ education and training:

 

  • Inspectors come from all walks of life with their own experience and background
  • AFIRM provides its candidates and Inspectors with a valuable set of skills unlike any other
  • They have all successfully completed AFIRMâ€™s own self-directed, on-line training certification program
  • Continue to hone their skills with AFIRMâ€™s on-going distance learning opportunities

 

 

Our Inspectorsâ€™ work environment      

 

  • As independent contractors with AFIRM, our inspectors work from home
  • They travel to various locations from their home base to assigned locations
  • Work evenings and weekends whenever required to maintain customer satisfaction

 

 

What all our Inspectors must have:

 

  • A reliable vehicle
  • Mobile phone
  • Windows based computer
  • Internet connection (high speed preferably)
  • Digital camera or smart phone that takes high quality digital pictures
Responsibilities:

 

AFIRM is a global leader in Loss Prevention and Premium Audit with Canadian locations in Richmond Hill and Montreal.   We are currently seeking independent Loss Prevention service contractors.

 

Our Loss Control Representatives (Inspectors) visit various property locations on behalf of the ownerâ€™s insurance company with a goal to minimize potential losses.   There is no selling involved.   Requests for inspection are received directly from the insurance companies.

 

Our successful Inspectors are:

 

  • Outgoing and independent
  • Curious and inquisitive by nature
  • Self-motivated strivers
  • Well organized and manage their time efficiently
  • Focused on quality of service
  • Competent computer skills with good input speed & accuracy
  • Skilled at writing well

 

What our Inspectors do:

 

  • Take responsibility for; and organize their assignments
  • Schedule their own appointments with property owners
  • Travel to the location
  • Tour the property and collect information (Residential and Commercial)
  • Identify potential areas of loss such as fire, theft and liability
  • Take photographs and measure buildings
  • Prepare a pre-define Loss Control report of the property using AFIRMâ€™s own web-based platform

title: Security Guard - Imperial Oil - Portal Gate back up & Utility Gate - Sarnia, ON
description:
To:                                     All Security Personnel

From:                                 People & Culture Coordinator

Date:                                 March 10, 2022

Closing Date:                   March 16, 2022  

Re:                                     Job Posting

Position:                           Portal Gate back - up & Utility Gate Security Guard

Site:                                   Imperial Oil

City:                                   Sarnia, ON

Status:                              Part Time

Hours:                               Shift Rotation(12 hours) days, nights, and weekends

Pay Rate:                          $15.89 - $20.06/hr. Rates based on a levelling system.

Position Overview:

Reporting to the Security Front Line Supervisor serving IOL this position has the primary responsibility to perform all duties related to the Site Access Control System to control access to the Imperial Oil Sarnia Site for the purpose of security

This position involves familiarity of the Imperial Oil Sarnia site and its practices, as well as an extensive general computer knowledge to perform all required tasks.

 

Portal Gate Essential Job Functions:

Duties and Responsibilities:

Site Access Control System management includes administration and operation to ensure that:

 

  • All system devices (doors, readers, gates, cameras etc.) are working and maintained to operate as required.
  • All cardholders have necessary accesses.
  • Access is provided in accordance with site policies (authorized custodians, card holders possess the necessary prerequisites).
  • Access provided is in accordance with requirements.
  • Photo ID are produced.
  • Participate in updating or creating new procedures pertaining to system.
  • Activate the site Send Word Now and Everbridge call out systems for the Site Fire Marshall.
  • Monitor site CCTV throughout the shift and perform CCTV tours regularly.
  • Accessing the IEC database to check expiry dates for workers coming on site.
  • Clip videos and save them for IOL/Paladin management to access when requested.

Details of the job are as follows:

 

  • Operate Site Access Control System to control access to the Imperial Oil Sarnia Site for the purpose of security.
  • Operate Photo ID System in cooperation with the Site Access Control System for the purpose of security.
  • Ensure/Request supplies for Site Access Control System when needed.
  • Issue, activate, reactivate, and deactivate Site Access Control System cards on authorized request.
  • Ensure photos of all Site Access Control System applicants are in the Site Access Control System
  • Monitor User Operations and assist with trouble areas.
  • Review Operator Logs daily for temporary modifications on cardholders.
  • Perform traffic duties at 2 Gate Mon-Fri including vehicle inspections.
  • Perform rover duties as requested by the Security Shift Supervisor as well as vehicle inspections at remote gates and contraband (bag) searches at various location.

Network Demands

 

  • Liaise with SMC Portal staff and Genetec Admin (pass daily information and changes to procedures).
  • Liaise with other security staff on site.
  • Liaise with Site Security Leader (SSL) to physically inspect issues with doors, gates, readers etc. and request further maintenance if necessary; provide information on any negative impacts to SMC Portal activities; follow-up on any alarms requiring SSL attention.
  • Provide assistance to all IOL contacts and contractors when requested.
  • Liaise with the Security Management Team.

Utility Gate Essential Job Functions:

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Conduct random vehicle checks and inspections as required by the client. 
  • Maintain accurate gate logs, and to retain them as required by the client.
  • Perform access control at assigned location checking badges/proper swipes.
  • Ensure vehicles have proper pass and signage before entering site.
  • Ensure material is not being removed from sight unauthorized.
  • Secure all gates/fence line at the conclusion of each shift.
  • Observe all perimeters and report all suspicious activity to supervisor.
  • Perform temperature checks screening locations.
  • Operate vehicles to and from work location and to perform patrols.
  • Liaise with other security staff on site.
  • Provide assistance to all IOL contacts and contractors when requested.
  • Liaise with site Security Front Line Supervisor.
  • Watch for and report irregularities by completing investigations and incident reports, such as security breaches, facility and safety hazards, and emergency situations; contact emergency responders, such as police, fire, and/or ambulance personnel, as required.
  • Fast paced work environment that may require you to be on your feet for extended periods of time.

 

Requirements:

  • At least two years of security experience in an industrial setting would be an asset.
  • Post-Secondary education in a law enforcement/security program from a recognized college an asset.
  • A Valid Drivers class G license with clean abstract.
  • System Administrators need to have extensive general computer knowledge to perform all required tasks. Must possess a detailed knowledge of the MS Office, with the ability to extract and manipulate data using MS Access/Excel. A working knowledge of relational database composition, operation and query functions an asset.
  • Experience working at the IOL site or Portal Gate would be considered an asset.
  • Possess good general office and organizational skills.
  • This position requires excellent communication skills written and verbal with the emphasis on practical industrial knowledge. The job requires tact, and excellent interpersonal skills.
  • This position is stationed out of an office, but physical demands are required for traffic duties.
  • Working knowledge of the Trespass to Property Act and Mental Health Act.
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy.
  • Utilize two-way radio and computer applications for communicating site activities.
  • Sustain effective relationships with key stakeholders and provide specialized security services by enforcing rules and regulations when required.
  • Offer support to any person in need such as providing good customer service when providing a security presence, such as providing direction, responding to emergency situation involving violent individuals and injuries.
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.

 

Security Guards at Imperial Oil may be required to complete a Drug & Alcohol test for incidents that occur on Imperial Oil property.

 

Highlights:

  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

 

 

 

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. Immunization Record
  2. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  3. Proficient in English (both oral and written)

 

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  3. Use of Force
  4. Report Writing
  5. Additional courses as assigned

 

 

 

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

 

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned

title: Security Guard Professional
description:
Overview:

We are North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider with over 300,000 phenomenal employees. At Allied Universal ®, we pride ourselves on fostering a promote from within culture. There are countless examples of individuals who began their career as Security Professionals and today hold positions on our senior leadership team. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, and vision coverage, life insurance, employee assistance programs, and more! We also offer company paid uniforms and part-time and flexible schedules!

Job Description:

Allied Universal is seeking Professional Security Guards  in Canada.    

 

Opportunity for growth.

 

 

Site Location: 310 Brunel, Mississauga, ON L4Z 2C2
Schedule: Mon to Friday 0815-1345

 

QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS:

  • Be at least 18 years of age with high school diploma or equivalent
  • Legally entitled to work in Canada
  • Possess effective written and oral communication and interpersonal skills with ability to deal with all levels of personnel and the general public in a professional and effective manner

  • Licensing requirements are subject to province and/or local laws and regulations and will be required prior to employment.

  • As a condition of employment, employee must successfully complete a background check
  • Display exceptional customer service and communication skills
  • Have intermediate computer skills to operate innovative, wireless technology at client specific sites
  • Ability to handle crisis situations at the client site, calmly and efficiently
  • Able to:
    • Work in various environments such as cold weather, rain/snow or heat
    • Occasionally lift or carry up to 20 kilograms
    • Climb stairs, ramps, or ladders occasionally during shift
    • Stand or walk on various surfaces for long periods of time
Closing:

Allied Universal ®  provides unparalleled service, systems and solutions to the people and business of our communities, and is North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider. Allied Universal delivers high-quality, tailored solutions, which allows clients to focus on their core business. For more information:  www.AUSecurity.ca.

title: Security Guard - Healthcare Screener
description:
Regal Security Inc. is currently seeking a Security Guard - Healthcare Screener at a prominent healthcare facility located in the North York, ON area. 

Job Summary: Security Guard - Healthcare Screener will be posted at various access and egress points of the facility and will be responsible for the proper verbal assessment of a visitor to grant or deny them entry past the access control points.  Healthcare Screener Security Guards will be responsible to strictly enforce that all persons entering the facility comply with the Health Care Facilityâ€™s visitor access policy.

 

Applicants must be able to demonstrate the following prior to an interview: 

Â· Valid Security Licence

Â· Valid CPR Certificate

 

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Assess and screen all persons wishing to enter the access control point of the healthcare facility as per the visitor policy 
  • Maintain flow at the entrance ensuring everyone entering the location is verbally screened
  • Adhere to necessary policy and procedures related to wearing Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) and sanitization
  • Ensure all persons entering the facility follow proper precautionary measures and wear the correct protective apparel as required;
  • Exercise diplomacy and empathy if there is an issue with the visitorâ€™s request for access to the site;

 

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Demonstrated strong communication, customer service and interpersonal skills
  • Ability and willingness to work in a Healthcare environment
  • Successful completion of a high school diploma or equivalent
  • Availability to work a variety of shifts (days, evenings, overnights), 7 days per week
  • Willingness to work shifts that require extended periods of standing;
  • Willingness to wear protective apparel for duration of shift times (face mask, face shields, gloves and gowns)
  • Thoroughness and attention to detail
  • Flexibility and adaptability
  • Problem solving and decision-making skills
  • Sound judgment and conflict management skills
  • Reliability and punctuality
  • Demonstrated ability to work co-operative with a variety of people in a team environment

 

COMPENSATION:

  • Pay Rate will be $18.00 per hour.
  • Health Benefits are available for full-time employees upon completion of 3 months probation
     

Why choose Regal Security?

Regal Security Inc. is an established and growing security company that offers a vast array of professional and dependable security guard services across the Greater Toronto Area and Southwest Ontario.

Our Everyday Superheroâ„¢ guards are selected and trained to protect the clientâ€™s assets, property, employees, and tenants, using a custom-designed security solution for every client within the sectors we serve.

 

Every member of the Regal security team, and every service that is carried out, is directed by the Regal guiding principle: Strength & Honorâ„¢. With this in mind, Regalâ€™s security guards are known as Everyday Superheroesâ„¢ â€“ they are friendly, well-trained and, most importantly, proud, as they go above and beyond the call of duty to uphold Regalâ€™s high standards.

 

â€œTHE REGAL SECURITY MISSION IS â€œYOUR PEACE OF MINDâ€â„¢â€

 

Thank you for your application, unfortunately, due to the high volume of applicants, only those deemed eligible for an interview will be contacted. All candidates will be communicated to by phone or email for the purposes of the recruitment process.

 

Regal Security Inc. welcomes all candidates equally and encourages all qualified candidates, from women and men including persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and Aboriginal persons, to apply.

 

#INDREGAL

title: Security Officer - High Profile Government Site
description:
Our Story

Commissionaires BC is a Canadian, not-for-profit security/enforcement organization that has been in business since 1927. Our mandate is to give back to those who served and continue to serve in our communities and country.

Commissionaires is the leading supplier of security services for the federal government. From access control and front desk security, to 24/7 control room operations, we provide high-level security services to our federal clients.

We are looking for a guard to work Monday to Friday 0830-1630 at a Government site in Squamish

Whatâ€™s in it for you?

-Gain valuable experience as a stepping stone into a law enforcement career

-Competitive hourly wages

-Chance to work at high profile site

-Free uniforms

-Training and support to succeed in your role

Youâ€™re a good fit if you haveâ€¦

-Demonstrated interest and experience in serving the public

-Positive and professional attitude, with strong customer service skills

-Proficient with Microsoft Office, and equipment such as faxes and photocopiers

-Excellent attention to detail and problem-solving skills

-Ability to handle emergency situations in a calm and professional manner

-Excellent multi-tasking, prioritizing, and organizational abilities

-Ability to work independently and make sound decisions under pressure

-Physically fit, and able to conduct extensive foot patrols both indoors and outdoors in a range of weather conditions

Some of your responsibilities include:

-Interior and exterior patrols

-Access Control and visitor verification

-Crowd control and management

-Responding to potential protesters or media

-Directing incoming mail to relevant staff

-First responder in building emergencies such as evacuations and medical emergencies

-Following specific emergency and alarm response protocols. 

Your Must Haves â€¦

- Valid BC Security License

-Have lived in Canada for a minimum of 5 years due to clearance requirements

-OFA 1 

-Excellent English oral and written skills

title: Loss Control Specialist - Canada
description:
About Our Company:

Are you looking for a challenging career that rewards hard work and success?   AFIRM is committed to finding outstanding people who have the ambition and willingness to learn in order to succeed.   The most successful candidates will be detail-oriented, self-motivated and possess strong problem-solving and analytical skills.  

 

AFIRM is the national leader in risk control, consulting services as well as commercial and residential inspections.   We provide our exceptional services to insurers, brokers, risk managers and government agencies.

 

Equal Opportunity Employer

The H.W. Kaufman Group of companies is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other status or condition protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

 

 

Qualifications:

Our Inspectorsâ€™ education and training:

 

  • Inspectors come from all walks of life with their own experience and background
  • AFIRM provides its candidates and Inspectors with a valuable set of skills unlike any other
  • They have all successfully completed AFIRMâ€™s own self-directed, on-line training certification program
  • Continue to hone their skills with AFIRMâ€™s on-going distance learning opportunities

 

 

Our Inspectorsâ€™ work environment      

 

  • As independent contractors with AFIRM, our inspectors work from home
  • They travel to various locations from their home base to assigned locations
  • Work evenings and weekends whenever required to maintain customer satisfaction

 

 

What all our Inspectors must have:

 

  • A reliable vehicle
  • Mobile phone
  • Windows based computer
  • Internet connection (high speed preferably)
  • Digital camera or smart phone that takes high quality digital pictures
Responsibilities:

 

AFIRM is a global leader in Loss Prevention and Premium Audit with Canadian locations in Richmond Hill and Montreal.   We are currently seeking independent Loss Prevention service contractors.

 

Our Loss Control Representatives (Inspectors) visit various property locations on behalf of the ownerâ€™s insurance company with a goal to minimize potential losses.   There is no selling involved.   Requests for inspection are received directly from the insurance companies.

 

Our successful Inspectors are:

 

  • Outgoing and independent
  • Curious and inquisitive by nature
  • Self-motivated strivers
  • Well organized and manage their time efficiently
  • Focused on quality of service
  • Competent computer skills with good input speed & accuracy
  • Skilled at writing well

 

What our Inspectors do:

 

  • Take responsibility for; and organize their assignments
  • Schedule their own appointments with property owners
  • Travel to the location
  • Tour the property and collect information (Residential and Commercial)
  • Identify potential areas of loss such as fire, theft and liability
  • Take photographs and measure buildings
  • Prepare a pre-define Loss Control report of the property using AFIRMâ€™s own web-based platform

title: Security Guard / Officer
description:
Do you have strong skills in customer service delivery, teamwork, and problem-solving? We want to hear from you! The Paladin Difference starts with our officers; we're the best because we hire the best.  If you think you have what it takes to join our team, we want to meet you! We offer job stable positions and lots of career advancement opportunities, including free training, security licensing, and promotion from within.

Pay range: $17-22 per hour (dependent on site/location).

Apply now to join our Team of elite security officers at our various locations in government buildings, post-secondary campuses, shopping centers, office towers, warehouses, and more!

  • Bentall Centre, Vancouver
  • Critical Infrastructure, Vancouver
  • Granville Island, Vancouver
  • International Village, Vancouver
  • Langara College, Vancouver
  • Pacific Centre, Vancouver 
  • Robson Square Courthouse, Vancouver
  • Royal Centre, Vancouver
  • ICBC Corporate Office, North Vancouver
  • Central at Garden City, Richmond
  • Lansdowne Centre, Richmond
  • WorkSafeBC, Richmond
  • Tsawwassen Mills, Tsawwassen
  • Shops at New West, New Westminster
  • Coquitlam Centre, Coquitlam
  • BC Rapid Transit, Burnaby and Coquitlam
  • BCIT Campuses, Lower Mainland
  • Douglas College, New Westminster and Coquitlam

Minimum Requirements

  • Excellent customer service, problem solving, and willingness to help.
  • Strong English communication skills (written and verbal).
  • Comfortable interacting verbally with team members, client personnel, members of the general public, and emergency services.
  • Able to write detailed incident reports which may be utilized in court if subpoenaed.
  • A passion for being active, your patrols may be indoors or outdoors, in all weather conditions, and can include stairwells, uneven surfaces, and parkades. You must be physically able to stand and/or patrol for the majority of a shift (8-hours average).
  • Comfortable approaching and leading in emergency situations, including trauma, aggression, intoxication, bodily fluids, etc.
  • Able to watch for and report irregularities, such as security breaches, facility and safety hazards, and emergency situations and contact emergency responders as required
  • Basic skills in utilizing technology, including writing reports on a computer, tracking patrols in a smart phone, and communicating via two-way radio.

Benefits

  • An active lifestyle: If sitting behind a desk doesn’t appeal to you, you’ll love the dynamic work environment that security can bring.
  • Leading Corporate Culture: Paladin is a Canadian employee or choice because of the amazing people that work here!
  • Career advancement: Whether you are gaining experience for law enforcement, looking for meaningful work as a student, or simply exploring a field you are passionate about, Paladin gives you the opportunity to advance your skills!
  • Health Benefits & Perks: Full-time employees are eligible for great benefits, and all staff can enjoy exclusive Paladin discounts at your favourite retailers and service providers across Canada!
  • And more…

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those applicants that are short listed will be contacted for an interview.

title: Security Guard, Mall
description:
If you are looking for a job where you will be working with the public, this is the job for you! As a Mall Security Officer, you will play a key role in ensuring the safety of workers, businesses and the public!  We provide people with growth opportunities. 30% of our frontline employees are promoted to become part of our operation teams. 

 

Please find details for the position available below : 

Location: 435 Stone Rd W, Guelph

The hourly pay rate for this site is $16.58

 

What's in it for you?

  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits  

  • Uniform provided free of charge 

  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld 

  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus like Use of Force training 

What does a Security Guard in Guelph do?

  • Facilitate access to restricted areas for authorized persons 

  • Patrol the site on foot 

  • Monitor closed circuit cameras  

  • Coordinate response to incidents  

  • Respond to telephone calls received by the security department

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in Guelph

  • A valid security guard license and first aid card 

  • Have a clear criminal background 

  • Be eligible to work in Canada 

 

Please apply online or send in your resume to palak.soni@garda.com

title: Full Time Security Guard - London
description:
Securiguard is currently looking for full-time Security Guards to join our team in London.

Whether you're looking to start a new career in security services or you're a seasoned security professional, we invite you to explore a future with us. Our men and women in the field are the true ambassadors of our company and we are fully committed to providing an environment of respect and personal growth for our staff.

Our ideal candidate will possess

  • Ontario Security Guard License
  • Excellent Communication Skills
  • Takes Pride in Delivering Outstanding Customer Service
  • Comfortable with Radio Communication
  • Able to Write Reports on Job-Related Activities
  • Keen Eye for Observing Exterior and Interior Premises
  • Access Control Experience
  • Approaches a Situation with a Listening Mindset
  • Mature Attitude Towards Executive Protection
  • Capable of Standing/walking for a Duration of 8 / 12 Hours

We offer:

  • Extensive Training
  • Extended Health Benefits (subject to benefit waiting periods)
  • Recognition Programs & Events

We are committed to building an environment of respect and personal growth for all of our staff. We support this commitment with highly competitive compensation and benefits, comprehensive training, reliable equipment and supportive supervision as well as great opportunities for advancement, community involvement and work/life balance practices.

Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer and we value the cultural diversity of our staff. We offer flexibility in scheduling to accommodate students, family, caregivers and part-time personnel.

title: Tactical Commercial Security Guard - Full Time Position
description:
Regal Security Inc. currently seeks Tactical Security Guards at one of its locations in the Toronto, ON area.


The Ideal Candidate must have:

  • Full-time availability to work all days of the week and schedules will consist of afternoons, overnight, and weekend shifts â€“ including holidays and weekends.
  • Customer service-driven individual
  • Clear English communication skills in all areas (verbal and written)
  • Detailed and thorough record-keeping (Memo book, incident reports, etc.)
  • Keen observation and attentiveness
  • Professional physical deportment and presentation
  • Decision Making, Reliable, Common Sense, and exceptional judgment
  • Able to work as a team
  • Working knowledge of Trespass to Property Act and Criminal Code of Canada


Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Provide outstanding and personalized customer service as a front line representative of Regal Security
  • Operate and maintain an organized environment
  • Enforce property rules and regulations and the Trespass to Property Act to maintain the security and safety of our clients and their assets
  • Oversee the logging in and out of site equipment
  • Actively Monitor CCTV, fire systems, and access systems
  • Respond to all emergencies (medical, building, etc.)
  • Ensure that safety and emergency protocols are completed in response to Fire Alarms and other Site Emergencies
  • Complete walking patrols, vehicle patrols, and inspections of facilities and equipment and report any hazards, deficiencies, etc. to ensure safety and security
  • Review, know and follow post orders as identified for site representing
  • Maintain a safe working environment and follow the facilities health and safety procedures
  • Duties as otherwise assigned


Qualifications:

  • Valid Ontario Security License
  • Valid First Aid/CPR Certification
  • Valid WHMIS Certification
  • Valid Ontario Drivers Licence with a clean driving record
  • The use of Force is an asset
  • Secondary School Diploma or equivalent and higher (preference will be given to those with a Criminal Justice, Law, and Security, Police Foundations or similar post-secondary education)
  • Proficient in the use of various computer programs (i.e. Microsoft Office, Gmail) and able to adapt and learn new programs
 

Compensation:

  • The pay rate will be $19.14 per hour.
  • Health Benefits are available for full-time employees upon completion of 3 months probation.

 

Why choose Regal Security?

Regal Security Inc. is an established and growing security company that offers a vast array of professional and dependable security guard services across the Greater Toronto Area and Southwest Ontario.

Our Everyday Superheroâ„¢ guards are selected and trained to protect our clientâ€™s assets, property, employees, and tenants, using a custom-designed security solution for every client within the sectors we serve.

Every member of the Regal security team and every service carried out is directed by the Regal guiding principle: Strength & Honorâ„¢. With this in mind, Regalâ€™s security guards are known as Everyday Superheroesâ„¢ â€“ they are friendly, well-trained and, most importantly, proud, as they go above and beyond the call of duty to uphold Regalâ€™s high standards.

 

â€œTHE REGAL SECURITY MISSION IS â€œYOUR PEACE OF MINDâ€â„¢.â€

Thank you for your application. Unfortunately, only those deemed eligible for an interview will be contacted due to the high volume of applicants. However, all candidates will be communicated to by phone or email for the recruitment process.

Regal Security Inc. welcomes all candidates equally and encourages all qualified candidates, from women and men, including persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and Aboriginal persons, to apply.

 

Regal provides accommodation for applicants with disabilities during the recruitment process in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Please get in touch with us to request an accommodation.

title: Security Officer - Casual Abbotsford Area
description:
Looking to start your career in security services? We have a great opportunity for you! 

Our Story 

Commissionaires BC is a Canadian, not-for-profit security/enforcement organization that has been in business since 1927. Our mandate is to give back to those who served and continue to serve in our communities and country.

Commissionaires provides security services for over 200 sites and are located in over 110 communities across the province. Our client base runs from the Federal Government to local municipalities, airports, industrial sectors, and commercial/residential buildings.  

Our guards are not only behind the scenes providing security and access control, but front and centre providing valued customer service to the public.

We are looking for security guards who are available to work in the Abbotsford area. 

Whatâ€™s in it for you 

  • Opportunity for growth
  • Work for a reputable and nationally known company 
  • A challenging yet rewarding work environment 
  • Flexibility of rotations and sites to suit your requirements 
  • Free uniforms 
  • Paid on-site training  
  • Gain valuable experience as a stepping stone into a law enforcement career 

Youâ€™re a good fit ifâ€¦  

  • You hold a positive and can do attitude 
  • You are reliable and committed  
  • You can think on your feet and problem solve 
  • You can work alone or as part of a team 

Some of your responsibilities include: 

  • Patrolling various sites/locations 
  • Offering first class customer service to both clients and general public 
  • Mobile patrolling/ticketing  
  • Access Control 
  • CCTV Monitoring 
  • Proactively responding to and resolving emergency situations and conflicts  
  • Maintaining detailed and accurate daily logs and incident reports 
  • Effectively communicating problems or concerns to the Site Supervisor 

Your Must-Haves:

  • BC Security License  
  • You have excellent problem solving skills  
  • You can work under pressure 
  • Physically fit, able to stand for long periods and work both indoors and outdoors in a range of weather conditions; 

Your Nice-To-Haves:

  • You have a valid Driverâ€™s Licence with a clean driverâ€™s abstract 
  • You have resided in Canada for the last five years 
  • Hold OFA 1 or OFA 2

title: Loss Control Specialist - Canada
description:
About Our Company:

Are you looking for a challenging career that rewards hard work and success?   AFIRM is committed to finding outstanding people who have the ambition and willingness to learn in order to succeed.   The most successful candidates will be detail-oriented, self-motivated and possess strong problem-solving and analytical skills.  

 

AFIRM is the national leader in risk control, consulting services as well as commercial and residential inspections.   We provide our exceptional services to insurers, brokers, risk managers and government agencies.

 

Equal Opportunity Employer

The H.W. Kaufman Group of companies is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other status or condition protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

 

 

Qualifications:

Our Inspectorsâ€™ education and training:

 

  • Inspectors come from all walks of life with their own experience and background
  • AFIRM provides its candidates and Inspectors with a valuable set of skills unlike any other
  • They have all successfully completed AFIRMâ€™s own self-directed, on-line training certification program
  • Continue to hone their skills with AFIRMâ€™s on-going distance learning opportunities

 

 

Our Inspectorsâ€™ work environment      

 

  • As independent contractors with AFIRM, our inspectors work from home
  • They travel to various locations from their home base to assigned locations
  • Work evenings and weekends whenever required to maintain customer satisfaction

 

 

What all our Inspectors must have:

 

  • A reliable vehicle
  • Mobile phone
  • Windows based computer
  • Internet connection (high speed preferably)
  • Digital camera or smart phone that takes high quality digital pictures
Responsibilities:

 

AFIRM is a global leader in Loss Prevention and Premium Audit with Canadian locations in Richmond Hill and Montreal.   We are currently seeking independent Loss Prevention service contractors.

 

Our Loss Control Representatives (Inspectors) visit various property locations on behalf of the ownerâ€™s insurance company with a goal to minimize potential losses.   There is no selling involved.   Requests for inspection are received directly from the insurance companies.

 

Our successful Inspectors are:

 

  • Outgoing and independent
  • Curious and inquisitive by nature
  • Self-motivated strivers
  • Well organized and manage their time efficiently
  • Focused on quality of service
  • Competent computer skills with good input speed & accuracy
  • Skilled at writing well

 

What our Inspectors do:

 

  • Take responsibility for; and organize their assignments
  • Schedule their own appointments with property owners
  • Travel to the location
  • Tour the property and collect information (Residential and Commercial)
  • Identify potential areas of loss such as fire, theft and liability
  • Take photographs and measure buildings
  • Prepare a pre-define Loss Control report of the property using AFIRMâ€™s own web-based platform

title: Security Guard – Hospitals
description:
YOUR NEXT OPPORTUNITY 

Are you an aspiring Health Care or Emergency Management professional? Be a part of a rewarding team that ensures the safety of our healthcare workers and visitors. As a Healthcare Security Officer, you respond to alarms, emergency requests, and use your excellent verbal de-escalation skills to resolve incidents. You always maintain confidentiality and discretion when handling private information, and you never forget to smile while providing your incredible customer service. 

WHAT YOU WILL DO 

You promptly fill out detailed incident reports whenever an issue arises. This helps you discover solutions on how to keep staff, patients, and guests feeling comfortable in the secure environment you provide. Along with your dedication to utilizing PPE, you regularly patrol the facility so that no potential conflict leaves your sight. 

YOU’RE A GREAT FIT IF YOU: 

  • Provide exceptional customer service, with a winning smile.
  • Are comfortable standing for long periods of time
  • Hold a valid First Aid/CPR certification or are willing to obtain one. We take safety seriously, and we know you do too.
  • Are eligible to work in Canada
  • Have prior experience and a valid security license, which are considered an asset. If not, you’re in luck! We’ll help you acquire your security license and even pay for it.  

All our Officers are required to carry a valid Security License. We also provide the Basic Security Training to those who have not been through the course previously. 

PALADIN OFFERS YOU: 

  • Competitive wages 
  • Promotion from within
  • Company-paid training & uniforms
  • Benefits & recognition programs 

Paladin Security is one of Canada’s Best Employers. We have been awarded for our outstanding corporate culture, approach to management and our customer service. Join our winning team today! 

Please note that all interviews are being conducted via phone and/or video chat at this time.

LET’S GET STARTED!

title: Security / Loss Prevention officers needed
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

If you are looking for a job where you will be working with the public, this is the job for you! As a retail Security Officer, you will play a key role in ensuring the safety of workers, businesses and the public, This role will be a License loss prevention officer role in the future.

. 

What's in it for you?

  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits  

  • Flexible schedule (Must be available to work durning prime hours) 

  • Uniform provided free of charge 

  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld 

  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus like Use of Force training 

What does a Retail Security Guard do?

  • Facilitate access to restricted areas for authorized persons 

  • Patrol premisis on foot 

  • Monitor closed circuit cameras  

  • Coordinate response to incidents  

  • Respond to telephone calls received by the security department

Qualifications to become a Security Guard

  • Willing to obtain secuirty guard license through garda

  • Available to work flexible hours 

  • Have a clear criminal background 

  • Be eligible to work in Canada 

  • Loss prevention officer experience an asset!

title: Pipeline Remote Camp Security Guard - $283 per day
description:
Securiguard is looking for Security Guards for an gas pipeline extending from Chetwynd, BC to Houston BC, BC. This is a great opportunity for those looking for well paid work to those who are open to travel and staying with us in comfort.


Wages: starting at $283 per day (based on a 12 hour shift) plus travel expenses.


Who we are:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost 50 years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solutions provider. That is how we have become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea, our team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.


Securiguard is looking for Security Guards for a pipeline project in the following cities in BC : Chetwynd, Burns Lake, Fraser Lake and Houston, and Kitimat BC. This is a rewarding position, accommodations, travel, and meals are provided. For those looking for well-paid work to those who are open to travel to remote work and stay in comfort, we want to hear from you!

Securiguard is committed to maximizing employment and training opportunities for Indigenous, local, and regional residents. If you identify as a member of an Indigenous community, we encourage you to self-identify in our optional screening question


What's in it for YOU!

  • Accommodation for 2 weeks in your rotation
  • Clean private room, which includes, Bed, A/C, 32" TV ( Netflix, Crave, Prime are included), desk, small closet, personal shower, and toilet.
  • Housekeeping - towels, sheet changing and room cleaning
  • Meals are provided - 24/7 meals, includes a daily breakfast, lunch and dinner, and after-hours snack/food available, support any dietary restrictions. Meal to GO app available
  • Health and Wellness - workout gym, running and bike machines, lounge, playroom, media room
  • Free Wi-Fi in each room
  • Travel allowance per rotation, including hotel stay if needed.

Stay and work in comfort with Securiguard


What would you do:

  • Observe and report suspicious activity, and report security breaches
  • Respond to incident/emergency situations and follow protocol
  • Provide perimeter security coverage
  • Provide access control and ensure there is no unauthorized access to the site
  • Patrolling of designated areas in an outdoor environment
  • Radio check ins and security report writing duties
  • Provide a visual security presence - detecting and deterring unauthorized persons
  • Coordinating and liaising with the police or emergency personnel when required
  • Adhere to Securiguard's core Values, Vision, Mission statement

What would you bring:

  • Valid BC Security License
  • Previous security experience is an asset
  • Class 5 Driver's License with a clean driving abstract and claims history
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Comfort working in a wilderness setting
  • Must be able to pass drug and alcohol test

Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer, and we value the diversity of our staff. We are committed to building a facilitative environment of respect, inclusiveness, and career growth.

Securiguard is committed to maximizing employment and training opportunities for Indigenous, local, and regional residents. If you identify as a member of an Indigenous community, we encourage you to self-identify in our optional screening question.

title: Security Guard - Experienced
description:
Overview:

We are North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider with over 300,000 phenomenal employees. At Allied Universal ®, we pride ourselves on fostering a promote from within culture. There are countless examples of individuals who began their career as Security Professionals and today hold positions on our senior leadership team. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, and vision coverage, life insurance, employee assistance programs, and more! We also offer company paid uniforms and part-time and flexible schedules!

Job Description:

Allied Universal is seeking Professional Security Guards  in Canada.    

 

  • Full time
  • Fima Cres, Etobicoke (Near Kipling & Horner Ave)
  • Valid Security Guard Licence
  • Valid First Aid/CPR certificate
  • Must have 5 years residency in Canada (min. PR held since April 2017) due to Reliability clearances
  • Must be fully vaccinated  
  • Excellent Communication and computer skills
  • Safety Shoes required
  • Pay rate: $21.00 per hour

 

QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS:

  • Be at least 18 years of age with high school diploma or equivalent
  • Legally entitled to work in Canada
  • Possess effective written and oral communication and interpersonal skills with ability to deal with all levels of personnel and the general public in a professional and effective manner

  • Licensing requirements are subject to province and/or local laws and regulations and will be required prior to employment.

  • As a condition of employment, employee must successfully complete a background check
  • Display exceptional customer service and communication skills
  • Have intermediate computer skills to operate innovative, wireless technology at client specific sites
  • Ability to handle crisis situations at the client site, calmly and efficiently
  • Able to:
    • Work in various environments such as cold weather, rain/snow or heat
    • Occasionally lift or carry up to 20 kilograms
    • Climb stairs, ramps, or ladders occasionally during shift
    • Stand or walk on various surfaces for long periods of time
Closing:

Allied Universal ®  provides unparalleled service, systems and solutions to the people and business of our communities, and is North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider. Allied Universal delivers high-quality, tailored solutions, which allows clients to focus on their core business. For more information:  www.AUSecurity.ca.

 

Requisition ID:2022-756819

title: Security Officer - RCMP
description:
Our Story

Commissionaires BC is a Canadian, not-for-profit security/enforcement organization that has been in business since 1927. Our mandate is to give back to those who served and continue to serve in our communities and country.

Commissionaires is the leading supplier of security services for the federal government. From access control and front desk security, to 24/7 control room operations, we provide high-level security services to our federal clients.

We are currently recruiting for professional security officers who want to work at a high profile RCMP site in Chilliwack. Fulltime staff are required to work 4 on 4 off, both afternoon and graveyard shifts.

 Whatâ€™s in it for you?

-Gain valuable experience as a stepping stone into a law enforcement career

-Health & dental benefits  

-Free uniforms  

-Training to succeed in your role  

Youâ€™re a good fit ifâ€¦

 -Demonstrated interest and experience in serving the public/working with law enforcement

-Positive and professional attitude, with strong customer service skills

-Proficient with Microsoft Office, and equipment such as faxes and photocopiers

-Excellent attention to detail and problem-solving skills

-Ability to handle emergency situations in a calm and professional manner

-Strong multi-tasking, prioritizing, and organizational skills

-Physically fit and assertive, including the ability to conduct extensive foot patrols

-Fluent English written, verbal and reading skills

Some of your responsibilities include:

-Performing exterior patrols

-Maintaining official visitor logs, count sheets, sign-in/out sheets

-Writing clear and concise daily logs and reports of all incidents

-Proactively responding to and resolving emergency situations

-Provide first aid in a prompt, accessible, and appropriate manner

-Effectively communicating problems or concerns to the Site Supervisor

- Maintaining up-to-date knowledge of site duties and safety standards

Your Must â€“ Haves â€¦

- Valid BC Security Licence

- Lived in Canada for minimum 5 years for clearance purposes

- OFA 1 or willing to obtain

-Class 5 Drivers Licence

Powered by JazzHR

title: Loss Control Specialist - Canada
description:
About Our Company:

Are you looking for a challenging career that rewards hard work and success?   AFIRM is committed to finding outstanding people who have the ambition and willingness to learn in order to succeed.   The most successful candidates will be detail-oriented, self-motivated and possess strong problem-solving and analytical skills.  

 

AFIRM is the national leader in risk control, consulting services as well as commercial and residential inspections.   We provide our exceptional services to insurers, brokers, risk managers and government agencies.

 

Equal Opportunity Employer

The H.W. Kaufman Group of companies is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other status or condition protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

 

 

Qualifications:

Our Inspectorsâ€™ education and training:

 

  • Inspectors come from all walks of life with their own experience and background
  • AFIRM provides its candidates and Inspectors with a valuable set of skills unlike any other
  • They have all successfully completed AFIRMâ€™s own self-directed, on-line training certification program
  • Continue to hone their skills with AFIRMâ€™s on-going distance learning opportunities

 

 

Our Inspectorsâ€™ work environment      

 

  • As independent contractors with AFIRM, our inspectors work from home
  • They travel to various locations from their home base to assigned locations
  • Work evenings and weekends whenever required to maintain customer satisfaction

 

 

What all our Inspectors must have:

 

  • A reliable vehicle
  • Mobile phone
  • Windows based computer
  • Internet connection (high speed preferably)
  • Digital camera or smart phone that takes high quality digital pictures
Responsibilities:

 

AFIRM is a global leader in Loss Prevention and Premium Audit with Canadian locations in Richmond Hill and Montreal.   We are currently seeking independent Loss Prevention service contractors.

 

Our Loss Control Representatives (Inspectors) visit various property locations on behalf of the ownerâ€™s insurance company with a goal to minimize potential losses.   There is no selling involved.   Requests for inspection are received directly from the insurance companies.

 

Our successful Inspectors are:

 

  • Outgoing and independent
  • Curious and inquisitive by nature
  • Self-motivated strivers
  • Well organized and manage their time efficiently
  • Focused on quality of service
  • Competent computer skills with good input speed & accuracy
  • Skilled at writing well

 

What our Inspectors do:

 

  • Take responsibility for; and organize their assignments
  • Schedule their own appointments with property owners
  • Travel to the location
  • Tour the property and collect information (Residential and Commercial)
  • Identify potential areas of loss such as fire, theft and liability
  • Take photographs and measure buildings
  • Prepare a pre-define Loss Control report of the property using AFIRMâ€™s own web-based platform

title: Security Guard - High Profile Site
description:
Job Description

Paladin Security offers top industry wages, free training in the fundamentals of security, First Aid/CPR and Non-Violent Crisis Intervention, a recognition and rewards program, excellent promotional opportunities, supplied uniforms, flexible hours and a comprehensive benefit package.

Duties Include:

  • Foot patrol of buildings both interior and exterior
  • Monitoring access control
  • Monitoring situations, property and events
  • Sustain effective relationships with key stakeholders

Skills/Qualifications Required:

  • Skills to deal with challenges and communicate with, clients and visitors to the site.
  • Flexibility to work a variety of shifts
  • Ability to write comprehensive reports and maintain proper records
  • Carry out written and verbal instructions
  • Provide excellent customer service
  • Good computer skills
  • Must be able to provide work or study and residential history for the last 5 years.
  • Vehicle is an asset  
  • Must be bondable
  • High School Diploma
  • Must be 18 years of age

 

Required Certifications

  • Valid Manitoba Security Guard License

 Required Education

  • Grade 12 or GED equivalent

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those applicants that are short listed will be contacted for an interview. 
Applicants are required to complete an online application at www.paladinsecurity.com/careers to be considered for this position.

title: Security Guard, Tactical
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

If you are looking for a job where you will be working with the public, this is the job for you! As a Tactical Security Officer, you will play a key role in ensuring the safety of workers, businesses and the public!  

We provide people with growth opportunities. 30% of our frontline employees are promoted to become part of our operation teams. 

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in Winnipeg now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, we have a position that will accommodate your needs and help you reach your goals. 

What does a Security Guard in Winnipeg do?

  • Facilitate access to restricted areas for authorized persons 

  • Patrol the site on foot and by car 

  • Monitor closed circuit cameras  

  • Coordinate response to incidents  

  • Respond to telephone calls received by the security department

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in Winnipeg

  • A valid Manitoba security guard license

  • Have a clear criminal background 

  • Be eligible to work in Canada 

What's in it for you?

  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits  

  • Shifts: Various hours

  • Pay Rate: $15.00/hr

  • Uniform provided free of charge 

  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld 

  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus

title: Security Guard - Penticton
description:
Whether you're looking to start a new career in security services or you're a seasoned security professional, we invite you to explore a future with us.

Our mission at Securiguard is to make people feel safe. As a security guard, you'll be responsible for the protection of people and assets by patrolling designated areas, identifying, and reporting safety hazards and reporting security breaches, as well as completing all reporting and radio check-ins. Other duties may include responding to alarms and emergencies and controlling access to the site. You will provide excellent customer service to our clients and guests, while providing a visual security presence to deter and detect unauthorized guests.

What you bring:

  • Valid BC Security License
  • Pride in delivering outstanding customer service
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Comfort with radio communication
  • Ability to write reports on job-related activities
  • Keen eye for observing exterior and interior premises
  • A listening mindset
  • Capable of standing for a duration of 8 hours

Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Paid Training
  • Flexible Schedules & Work life balance
  • Extended Health and Dental Benefits
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS Babylon
  • Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians
  • Access to a robust corporate discount program, Perkopolis
  • Discounted cineplex movie tickets
  • Discounts for an Annual Grouse Mountain Gondola Pass

Who we are:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

At Securiguard, we believe you can make a difference - by making people feel safe, caring for the people around you and supporting your community.

Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer and we are proud of inclusive workplace culture. In 2021, Securiguard was a winner of Canada's Most Admired Culture Culture and listed as a finalist in Canada's HR Awards for excellence in diversity and inclusion. Join our amazing team and help make people feel safe.
