title: Security Guard - St. Clair Centre for the Arts - Part Time(Saturdays) - Windsor, ON
description:
Site:                                    St. Clair College Centre for the Arts

City:                                    Windsor, Ontario

Status:                                Part Time   

Hours:                                 Saturdays (1600-0200)

Pay Rate:                            $17.28/hour

Position Overview:

Working assigned shifts, you will be responsible for patrolling the campus and monitoring surveillance cameras and completing written reports.

You will be expected to perform regular patrols and interact with students, staff and members of the public to provide direction and promote good customer service while providing a security presence.

 

Essential Job Functions:

  • Implement security measures to protect property, control access to sites, patrol assigned areas to monitor activities and ensure client rules and regulations are followed.
  • Maintain written reports.
  • Perform security checks and liaise with students, customers, and the public.
  • Ensure site safety and emergency procedures are followed and maintain written reports.
  • Enforce compliance to company policies and procedures.
  • First aid – be prepared to administer when required.
  • Maintaining a positive, productive work environment through collaboration.
  • Perform miscellaneous job – related duties as assigned.

Please note, students currently enrolled with St. Clair College are not eligible to apply to this position.

 

Job Requirements:

  • Must possess Ontario Security Guard License.
  • First Aid & CPR – Level C
  • Valid G Class Ontario Drivers Licence & Drivers Abstract
  • Post-Secondary education in law enforcement from a recognized institution or equivalent experience.
  • Physical Demands include excessive walking and standing.
  • Patrol area on foot and vehicle as assigned, to ensure personal, building, and equipment security.
  • Utilize radio and computer applications for communicating site activities.
  • Watch for and report irregularities by completing incident reports, such as security breaches, facility and safety hazards, and emergency situations; contact emergency responders, such as police, fire, and/or ambulance personnel, as required.
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills.
  • Must possess excellent computer skills.
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy.
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.

 

Highlights:

  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement
  • Extensive Paid Industry Training

 

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. Immunization Record
  2. Covid Vaccine’s Record 
  3. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  4. Proficient in English (both oral and written)

 

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  3. Use of Force
  4. Report Writing
  5. Additional courses as assigned

 

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

 

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned.

title: Security Guard, Special Operations
description:
We are currently looking for Full Time Security Guard, Special Operations in the Hamilton area. We are looking for a self-motivated individual who is committed to security and safety; who is passionate about working and gaining experience in different environment/sites. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset and you’re ambitious, this could be just the beginning of your career journey with GardaWorld! Join our team of dedicated and highly qualified professionals!

 

Garda Hamilton Branch is open for Walk in interviews every Thursdayfrom 10 am to 3 pm at 54 Centennial Pkwy N, Hamilton. Please ensure you have the following documents and dress business casual: 

  • Updated Resume 
  • Valid Security License 
  • Valid First Aid CPR 

 

In the event you are hired on the spot, please be prepared to spend 15 minutes to an hour for documentations and uniforming. 

 

What does a Security Guard in Hamilton do?

  • Access control
  • Crowd management and customer service
  • Protection of property and people
  • Support to police forces and risk prevention
  • Ensure the application of the regulations in force on the contract
  • Write daily reports and incident reports
  • Perform intervention in case of emergency
  • Provide first aid when necessary according to procedures
  • Assist with Mobile patrol

What’s in it for you?

  • Complete uniform
  • Diverse work assignments
  • Opportunity for advancement in the security industry

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in Guelph ?

  • Valid security guard license
  • Available on call for day, night and weekend shifts
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • First aid and CPR licence required
  • Must have G or G2 license and access to a personal vehicle

 

Interested? Apply online or send in your resume to palak.soni@garda.com

title: Remote Security Guard - starting at $252/ day
description:
Securiguard is looking for Security Guards for an industrial project in a remote location. This is a great opportunity for those looking for well-paid and who are open to travel to the beautiful North Coast.

Wages: starting at $252 per day (based on a 12-hour shift) plus travel expenses.

Who we are:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea their team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.

What would you do:

  • Observe and report suspicious activity, and report security breaches
  • Respond to incident/emergency situations and follow protocol
  • Provide perimeter security coverage
  • Provide access control and ensure there is no unauthorized access to the site
  • Patrolling of designated areas in an outdoor environment
  • Radio check-ins and security report writing duties
  • Provide a visual security presence - detecting and deterring unauthorized persons
  • Coordinating and liaising with the police or emergency personnel when required
  • Adhere to Securiguard's Core Values, Vision, Mission statement

What would you bring:

  • Valid BC Security License
  • Previous security experience is an asset
  • Class 5 Driver's License with a clean driving abstract and claims history
  • Must be able to pass drug and alcohol test
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Comfort working in a wilderness setting

Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer, and we value the diversity of our staff. We are committed to building a facilitative environment of respect, inclusiveness, and career growth.

Securiguard is committed to maximizing employment and training opportunities for Indigenous, local, and regional residents. If you identify as a member of an Indigenous community, we encourage you to self-identify in our optional screening question.

title: Loss Control Specialist - Canada
description:
About Our Company:

Are you looking for a challenging career that rewards hard work and success?   AFIRM is committed to finding outstanding people who have the ambition and willingness to learn in order to succeed.   The most successful candidates will be detail-oriented, self-motivated and possess strong problem-solving and analytical skills.  

 

AFIRM is the national leader in risk control, consulting services as well as commercial and residential inspections.   We provide our exceptional services to insurers, brokers, risk managers and government agencies.

 

Equal Opportunity Employer

The H.W. Kaufman Group of companies is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other status or condition protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

 

 

Qualifications:

Our Inspectorsâ€™ education and training:

 

  • Inspectors come from all walks of life with their own experience and background
  • AFIRM provides its candidates and Inspectors with a valuable set of skills unlike any other
  • They have all successfully completed AFIRMâ€™s own self-directed, on-line training certification program
  • Continue to hone their skills with AFIRMâ€™s on-going distance learning opportunities

 

 

Our Inspectorsâ€™ work environment      

 

  • As independent contractors with AFIRM, our inspectors work from home
  • They travel to various locations from their home base to assigned locations
  • Work evenings and weekends whenever required to maintain customer satisfaction

 

 

What all our Inspectors must have:

 

  • A reliable vehicle
  • Mobile phone
  • Windows based computer
  • Internet connection (high speed preferably)
  • Digital camera or smart phone that takes high quality digital pictures
Responsibilities:

 

AFIRM is a global leader in Loss Prevention and Premium Audit with Canadian locations in Richmond Hill and Montreal.   We are currently seeking independent Loss Prevention service contractors.

 

Our Loss Control Representatives (Inspectors) visit various property locations on behalf of the ownerâ€™s insurance company with a goal to minimize potential losses.   There is no selling involved.   Requests for inspection are received directly from the insurance companies.

 

Our successful Inspectors are:

 

  • Outgoing and independent
  • Curious and inquisitive by nature
  • Self-motivated strivers
  • Well organized and manage their time efficiently
  • Focused on quality of service
  • Competent computer skills with good input speed & accuracy
  • Skilled at writing well

 

What our Inspectors do:

 

  • Take responsibility for; and organize their assignments
  • Schedule their own appointments with property owners
  • Travel to the location
  • Tour the property and collect information (Residential and Commercial)
  • Identify potential areas of loss such as fire, theft and liability
  • Take photographs and measure buildings
  • Prepare a pre-define Loss Control report of the property using AFIRMâ€™s own web-based platform

title: Security Guard - Full Time - St. Thomas Elgin General Hospital - St. Thomas, ON
description:
To:                                     All Security Personnel

From:                                 People & Culture

Date:                                 April 19, 2022

Closing Date:                   April 25, 2022

Re:                                     Job Posting

Position:                           Security Guard

Site:                                   St. Thomas Elgin General Hospital

City:                                   St. Thomas, Ontario

Status:                              Full Time

Hours:                               Shift Rotation – 12 hours Days & Nights

Pay Rate:                          $17.00 – $18.00/hour – Rates based on Levelling System

 

Are you interested in starting a career in a fast paced and growing industry? As a provider of security services to clients with complex security needs, Paladin Security Group is offering an exciting career opportunity for you to give back to your community, while developing skills for future careers. Our training programs are also a leader in the security industry, and they will help prepare you for advancements, as well as build your resume for a potential career in law enforcement.

Job Description:

  • Working on assigned shifts, you will provide proactive and reactive security patrols and response to incidents.
  • You should display excellent customer service skills and be able to work with people you are under stress or in need of medical assistance.
  • In this role, it is essential that you are physically fit and able to stand and walk for long periods of time.
  • You will be required to operate the Switchboard duties including call handling, dispatching, monitoring of building alarm systems and CCTV.
  • Perform a variety of preventative and reactive duties to include, but not limited to interior and exterior patrols within the hospital as well as exterior of all buildings and areas of the organization.
  • Provide Use of Force/Restraint as required and directed under the Mental Health Act
  • Provide security escort service to staff and visitors as requested.
  • Daily lock and unlock of facilities
  • Provide motor vehicle assistance to staff and or visitors as required.
  • Responsible for the collection of all lost and found items and produce the proper documentation and location of owner of property when possible.
  • Accountable for keeping accurate logs and notebook entries of all shift activity and calls for service.
  • Accountable to write accurate reports upon investigations or reportable occurrences in timely manner upon completion of occurrence.
  • Investigate and follow-up of incidents, report writing, door opening requests, CCTV camera reviews.
  • Security Guards shall warn persons of rule infractions or violations, and apprehend or evict violators from premises, using force when necessary.
  • Responsible for all office duties (i.e. ID badges, key distribution, lost and found etc)

 

Essential Job Functions:

  • Be courteous and cooperative with a high quality of customer service.
  • Good interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively at various social levels and across diverse cultures.
  • Must be able to communicate clearly with clinical staff, and the general public while conveying professionalism and authority at all times.
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Communicates any concerns/issues with Site Coordinator.

Requirements:

  • Diploma in Police Foundations/Protection, Security & Investigations or equivalent from a recognized College, University or equivalent ie: military, police college or hospital security guard experience
  • CPR and First Aid certificates -Standard First Aid & CPR Level A/AED 
  • Valid Ontario Security Guard License 

 

General Duties

  • Provides excellent customer service at all times 

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement
     

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. Immunization Record
  2. Covid Vaccine
  3. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  4. Proficient in English (both oral and written)

 

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  3. Use of Force
  4. Report Writing
  5. Additional courses as assigned

 

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned

title: Part-time, weekend, Brampton Gatehouse Security
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

More than a job – 26% of our corporate employees at GardaWorld started as frontline employees. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset and you're ambitious, this could be just the beginning of your career journey with GardaWorld! 

 

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in Brampton now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, you can be sure that we have a position that can fill your needs and goals. Join our team of dedicated and highly qualified professionals! 

What's in it for you?

  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits  

  • We can guarantee 40 hours/week 

  • Uniform provided free of charge 

  • Career advancement opportunities in the security field or within the head office 

  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld 

What does a Security Guard in Brampton do?

  • Ensure the protection of people, assets, and property 

  • Monitor access of entryways and exit points 

  • Conduct preventive surveillance rounds  

  • Point of contact with authorities and emergency services 

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in Brampton

  • A valid security guard license and first aid card 

  • Available to work flexible hours 

  • Have a clear criminal background 

  • Be eligible to work in Canada

title: Security Guard - Full Time - St. Thomas
description:
Overview:

We are North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider with over 300,000 phenomenal employees. At Allied Universal ®, we pride ourselves on fostering a promote from within culture. There are countless examples of individuals who began their career as Security Professionals and today hold positions on our senior leadership team. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, and vision coverage, life insurance, employee assistance programs, and more! We also offer company paid uniforms and part-time and flexible schedules!

Job Description:

Allied Universal is seeking Professional Security Guards  in Canada.    

 

Join our team today! Currently, we are seeking Full Time & Part-time Security Guard in St.Thomas .

 

Specific Duties Performed and Essential Functions

  • Access control for the facility/area
  • Present a polished, professional, customer friendly image at all times
  • Ability to manage conflicts and incidents and to deescalate
  • Patrolling and following protocols as per  the post orders, which may include indoor or outdoor patrols,  manage the movement of guests at various points throughout the property etc.
  • Ensure that the facilityâ€™s safety and emergency procedures are followed in response to fire alarms and other site Emergencies
  • Undertake site specific training, follow direction and guidance from Site Supervisor or Manager
  • Demonstrate good  judgment, common sense and decision-making ability, particularly when required to take charge and direct others in emergencies or other incidents
  • Meticulous record keeping, report writing, observation skills excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Operate/monitor security room equipment, Completion of site required training
  • Perform Access control and Covid Screening duties  
  • Additional OTJ training is included and paid

Noted: Site location is in St.Thomas; this is not on a bus route and vehicle is required

 

Qualifications:

      • Valid Provincial Security Guard License
      • Valid  First Aid & CPR and AED
      • Must have a minimum high school diploma or GED
      • Flexible availability is required - Shifts may vary from Days/Evenings/Overnights  
      • Exceptional interpersonal and organizational skills
      • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
      • Positions may require the use  of a computer for report writing and communications
      • Applicants with security experience may be considered for more advanced positions
      • Valid Driver's License and reliable transport is an asset
Closing:

Allied Universal ®  provides unparalleled service, systems and solutions to the people and business of our communities, and is North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider. Allied Universal delivers high-quality, tailored solutions, which allows clients to focus on their core business. For more information:  www.AUSecurity.ca.

title: Full Time Security Guards
description:
Whether you're looking to start a new career in security services or you're a seasoned security professional, we invite you to explore a future with us! Securiguard is currently hiring for full-time Security Guards for work in Kelowna, Kamloops, Vernon, Penticton and other surrounding areas!

Key Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for the protection of people and assets by patrolling designated areas.
  • Identifying, and reporting safety hazards and reporting security breaches.
  • Completing all reporting and radio check-ins.
  • Other duties may include responding to alarms, emergencies, controlling access to the site.
  • You will provide excellent customer service to our clients and guests, while providing a visual security presence to deter and detect unauthorized guests.

Requirements:

  • A valid BC Security License or ability to attain
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Pride in delivering outstanding customer service.
  • Comfortable with radio communication.
  • Able to write reports on job-related activities.
  • Keen eye for observing exterior and interior premises.
  • Ability to provide access control.
  • Ability to handle a situation with a listening mindset

Employee Benefits/perks:

  • Free uniforms.
  • Paid trainings.
  • Flexible Schedules & Work life balance.
  • Extended Health and Dental Benefits (Conditions apply).
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS Babylon.
  • Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians.
  • Access to a robust corporate discount program, Perkopolis.

Do not have a security workers license?

BST (Basic Security training)-In order to work as a security Guard in BC, you are required to have a valid BC security License. This involves completion of a 40-hour Basic Security Training (BST) course. Upon completion of BST, a certificate of completion will be issued by the Justice Institute of British Columbia (JIBC). For top quality and passionate candidates, we would be willing to cover the cost of the Basic Security Training course. We are only looking to sponsor the best and most eager candidate!

Please contact us for more details.

About Us:

Securiguard Services Ltd. has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects, Events and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea their team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.

We make people feel safe and inspire our staff to believe they can make a difference in everything they do. We believe that diversity enables the company to grow towards a better future. By creating an environment which is inclusive and provides equal opportunity for all, ideas are generated which help to solve the problems of a changing and increasingly complex world. Our mission, vision, and values enabled us to be the 2021 winners of Canada's Most Admired Corporate Culture and a finalist of the 2021 Canadian HR Awards' Excellence in Diversity & Inclusion category. Join our amazing team and help make people feel safe.


INDSGS

title: Erie Shores Healthcare - Security Guard - Full Time - Leamington, ON
description:
o:                                      All Security Personnel

From:                                 People & Culture

Date:                                  April 14, 2022  

Closing Date:                    April 21, 2022

Re:                                     Job Posting

Position:                           Security Guard 

Site:                                   Erie Shores Healthcare

City:                                   Leamington, Ontario

Status:                               Full - Time 

Hours:                                Rotation: Week 1 & 3: Sundays, Wednesdays, Thursdays

                                            Week 2 & 4: Mondays, Tuesdays, Fridays, Saturdays (1000-2200)

Pay Rate:                           $ 17.24

 

Job Description:

  • Working on assigned shifts, you will provide proactive and reactive security patrols and response to incidents.
  • Display excellent customer service skills and be able to work with people who are under stress or in need of medical assistance.
  • In this role, it is essential that you are physically fit and able to stand and walk for long periods of time.
  • You will be required to operate the Switchboard duties including call handling, dispatching, monitoring of building alarm systems and CCTV.
  • Perform a variety of preventative and reactive duties to include, but not limited to interior and exterior patrols within the hospital as well as exterior of all buildings and areas of the organization.
  • Provide Use of Force/Restraint as required and directed under the Mental Health Act
  • Provide security escort service to staff and visitors as requested.
  • Daily lock and unlock of facilities.
  • Provide motor vehicle assistance to staff and or visitors as required.
  • Accountable for keeping accurate logs and notebook entries of all shift activity and calls for service.
  • Accountable to write accurate reports upon investigations or reportable occurrences in timely manner upon completion of occurrence.
  • Investigate and follow-up of incidents, report writing, door opening requests, CCTV camera reviews.
  • Security Guards shall warn persons of rule infractions or violations, and apprehend or evict violators from premises, using force when necessary.
  • Responsible for all office duties (i.e. ID badges, key distribution, lost and found etc.)

Essential Job Functions:

  • Be courteous and cooperative with a high quality of customer service.
  • Good interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively at various social levels and across diverse cultures.
  • Must be able to communicate clearly with clinical staff, and the general public while conveying professionalism and authority at all times.
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Communicates any concerns/issues with Site Coordinator.

Requirements:

  • Diploma in Police Foundations/Protection, Security & Investigations or equivalent from a recognized College, University is preferred or equivalent ie: military, police college or hospital security guard experience and asset.
  • CPR and First Aid certificates -Standard First Aid & CPR Level A/AED 
  • Valid Ontario Security Guard License 

 

General Duties

  • Provides excellent customer service at all times. 

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

     

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. Immunization Record
  2. Double Vaccine
  3. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  4. Proficient in English (both oral and written)

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  3. Use of Force
  4. Report Writing
  5. Additional courses as assigned

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

 

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned

title: Experienced Hospital Security Guard
description:
We are looking for an experienced Hospital Security Guard to work a leadership role in an important Emergency Room environment. 

Successful applicants will have at least 1 year of security experience, preferably within a health care environment. 

Hourly Pay Rate: $20.09/Hour

If you are seeking a job where you can make an impact, this one is for you! As a security guard in the health care sector, you will ensure the safety of kids, families, and staff. A great way to contribute to making your community safer! 

We provide people with growth opportunities. 30% of our frontline employees are promoted to become part of our operation teams. Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in Thunder Bay now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, we have a position that will accommodate your needs and help you reach your goals. 

 

What's in it for you?

  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits  

  • Uniform provided free of charge 

  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld 

  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus like Use of Force training 

  • Flexible schedule and potential for full time hours

What does a Security Guard in Thunder Bay do?

  • Respond promptly to all incidents of aggression (including patients, visitors, staff, physicians, child apprehensions etc.)
  • Maintain high visibility primarily in the Emergency Department. Duties permitting, patrols throughout facility and grounds at sporadic intervals.
  • Provide regular support to other guards in the form of regular breaks for meals and washroom visits.
  • Maintain a high level of compliance with respect to confidentiality and privacy act matters 
  • Maintain certification for NVCI, Mechanical Restraint and FA/CPR training annually or as legislate
  • Issue parking tickets once training is completed
  • Possess good Customer Service Skills – ability to deal with visitors, patients, staff, and others in a respectful, courteous and professional manner
  • Conduct sporadic and routine patrols to high risk areas such as Forensics, Adult Mental Health and Child & Adolescent Mental Health.
  • Be considered the lead during serious incidents off hours and will be responsible for notifying appropriate manager and/or Admin Co-coordinator in addition to the Site Supervisor or Employers Senior management team and email Manager of Security Services.
  • Remain current with hospital policies and security directives/memos as they relate to the security function
  • Other duties as required

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in Thunder Bay

  • Must be licenced by the Province of Ontario as a registered Security Guard and must maintain the licence for the duration of employment
  • Must have security experience
  • Valid First Aid/CPR, or willingness to obtain
  • Strong customer skills with the ability to act under pressure and provide creative solutions
  • Ability to work effectively with fellow employees and Management
  • Acquired knowledge and ability to use PC based incident reporting and scheduling systems
  • Acquired knowledge and ability to use CCTV equipment, access systems and PC controlled security systems
  • Ability to operate standard firefighting equipment such as pull stations and fire extinguishers
  • Willingness to work irregular hours/shift work
  • Very high level of integrity

title: Security Guard - Long Term Care - Full Time
description:
Overview:

We are North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider with over 300,000 phenomenal employees. At Allied Universal ®, we pride ourselves on fostering a promote from within culture. There are countless examples of individuals who began their career as Security Professionals and today hold positions on our senior leadership team. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, and vision coverage, life insurance, employee assistance programs, and more! We also offer company paid uniforms and part-time and flexible schedules!

Job Description:

Join our team today! Currently, we are seeking Full  Time Security Guards.

 

Specific Duties Performed and Essential Functions

 

  • Access control for the facility/area
  • Present a polished, professional, customer friendly image at all times
  • Ability to manage conflicts and incidents and to deescalate
  • Patrolling and following protocols as per the post orders, which may include indoor or outdoor patrols, manage the movement of guests at various points throughout the property etc.
  • Ensure that the facilityâ€™s safety and emergency procedures are followed in response to fire alarms and other site Emergencies
  • Undertake site specific training, follow direction and guidance from Site Supervisor or Manager
  • Demonstrate good judgment, common sense and decision-making ability, particularly when required to take charge and direct others in emergencies or other incidents
  • Meticulous record keeping, report writing, observation skills excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Operate/monitor security room equipment, Completion of site required training
  • Perform 1:1 resident watch  

 

The Ideal Candidate

 

  • Valid Provincial Security Guard Licence
  • Valid First Aid & CPR and AED
  • Must have a minimum high school diploma or GED
  • Must be have or be willing to get a vulnerable sector check  
  • Shifts may vary from Days/Evenings/Overnights - flexible availability is an asset
  • Exceptional interpersonal and organizational skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Positions may require the use of a computer for report writing and communications
  • Applicants with security experience may be considered for more advanced positions
Closing:

Allied Universal ®  provides unparalleled service, systems and solutions to the people and business of our communities, and is North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider. Allied Universal delivers high-quality, tailored solutions, which allows clients to focus on their core business. For more information:  www.AUSecurity.ca.

title: Security Guard - Kamloops
description:
Whether you're looking to start a new career in security services or you're a seasoned security professional, we invite you to explore a future with us.

Our mission at Securiguard is to make people feel safe. As a security guard, you'll be responsible for the protection of people and assets by patrolling designated areas, identifying, and reporting safety hazards and reporting security breaches, as well as completing all reporting and radio check-ins. Other duties may include responding to alarms and emergencies and controlling access to the site. You will provide excellent customer service to our clients and guests, while providing a visual security presence to deter and detect unauthorized guests.

What you bring:

  • Valid BC Security License
  • Pride in delivering outstanding customer service
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Comfort with radio communication
  • Ability to write reports on job-related activities
  • Keen eye for observing exterior and interior premises
  • A listening mindset
  • Capable of standing for a duration of 8 hours

Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Paid Training
  • Flexible Schedules & Work life balance
  • Extended Health and Dental Benefits
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS Babylon
  • Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians
  • Access to a robust corporate discount program, Perkopolis
  • Discounted cineplex movie tickets
  • Discounts for an Annual Grouse Mountain Gondola Pass

Who we are:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

At Securiguard, we believe you can make a difference - by making people feel safe, caring for the people around you and supporting your community.

Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer and we are proud of inclusive workplace culture. In 2021, Securiguard was a winner of Canada's Most Admired Culture Culture and listed as a finalist in Canada's HR Awards for excellence in diversity and inclusion. Join our amazing team and help make people feel safe.

title: Loss Control Specialist - Canada
description:
About Our Company:

Are you looking for a challenging career that rewards hard work and success?   AFIRM is committed to finding outstanding people who have the ambition and willingness to learn in order to succeed.   The most successful candidates will be detail-oriented, self-motivated and possess strong problem-solving and analytical skills.  

 

AFIRM is the national leader in risk control, consulting services as well as commercial and residential inspections.   We provide our exceptional services to insurers, brokers, risk managers and government agencies.

 

Equal Opportunity Employer

The H.W. Kaufman Group of companies is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other status or condition protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

 

 

Qualifications:

Our Inspectorsâ€™ education and training:

 

  • Inspectors come from all walks of life with their own experience and background
  • AFIRM provides its candidates and Inspectors with a valuable set of skills unlike any other
  • They have all successfully completed AFIRMâ€™s own self-directed, on-line training certification program
  • Continue to hone their skills with AFIRMâ€™s on-going distance learning opportunities

 

 

Our Inspectorsâ€™ work environment      

 

  • As independent contractors with AFIRM, our inspectors work from home
  • They travel to various locations from their home base to assigned locations
  • Work evenings and weekends whenever required to maintain customer satisfaction

 

 

What all our Inspectors must have:

 

  • A reliable vehicle
  • Mobile phone
  • Windows based computer
  • Internet connection (high speed preferably)
  • Digital camera or smart phone that takes high quality digital pictures
Responsibilities:

 

AFIRM is a global leader in Loss Prevention and Premium Audit with Canadian locations in Richmond Hill and Montreal.   We are currently seeking independent Loss Prevention service contractors.

 

Our Loss Control Representatives (Inspectors) visit various property locations on behalf of the ownerâ€™s insurance company with a goal to minimize potential losses.   There is no selling involved.   Requests for inspection are received directly from the insurance companies.

 

Our successful Inspectors are:

 

  • Outgoing and independent
  • Curious and inquisitive by nature
  • Self-motivated strivers
  • Well organized and manage their time efficiently
  • Focused on quality of service
  • Competent computer skills with good input speed & accuracy
  • Skilled at writing well

 

What our Inspectors do:

 

  • Take responsibility for; and organize their assignments
  • Schedule their own appointments with property owners
  • Travel to the location
  • Tour the property and collect information (Residential and Commercial)
  • Identify potential areas of loss such as fire, theft and liability
  • Take photographs and measure buildings
  • Prepare a pre-define Loss Control report of the property using AFIRMâ€™s own web-based platform

title: Security Guard - Full Time - ILSCi - London, ON
description:
To:                                     All Security Personnel

From:                                 John Cox

Date:                                 April 14, 2022

Closing Date:                   April 21, 2022

Re:                                     Job Posting

Position:                           Security Guard

Site:                                   ILSCi

City:                                   London, Ontario

Status:                             Full Time

Hours:                               Monday to Friday, Days 0600-1430hrs

Pay Rate:                          $17.90/hr.

 

Position Overview:

The facility adheres to US Homeland Security CTPAT (Customs Trade Partnership Against Terrorism) program access control including inbound and outbound shipments, visitors and contractors. The guard will be required to work outdoors in all weather conditions inspecting and logging truck traffic and completing patrols. Experience with CTPAT would be an asset. Excellent communication skills with a focus on customer service along with good computer abilities are all core requirements.

Duties include but are not limited to: CTPAT Procedures, , Covid Screening, Access Control, Monitor Security Systems, Conduct Security Patrols, Respond to Emergency Situations.

NOTE: No bus service available for 0600hrs start time

The applicant must possess the following:

  • 1 Year Security Guard Experience preferably in warehousing & logistics environment
  • College Diploma in police/security related discipline considered an asset
  • Be courteous and cooperative with a high quality of customer service
  • Good interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively at various social levels and across diverse cultures
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Write clear, concise and legible reports

 

Preferred skills/qualifications:

  • Valid Ontario Security Guard licence (required)
  • Valid First Aid & CPR certificate
  • Microsoft Office experience

 

Essential Job Functions:

  • Work outdoors in all weather conditions
  • Be courteous and cooperative with a high quality of customer service.
  • Good interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively at various social levels and across diverse cultures.
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Communicates any concerns/issues with Operations Manager.

Requirements:

  • Working knowledge of the Trespass to Property Act.
  • Excellent communication skills with a focus on customer service along with good computer abilities are all core requirements.
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills. Ability to write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy.
  • Patrol assigned area on foot, as assigned, to ensure personal, building, and equipment security.
  • Watch for and report irregularities by completing investigations and incident reports, such as security breaches, facility and safety hazards, and emergency situations; contact emergency responders, such as police, fire, and/or ambulance personnel, as required.
  • Sustain effective relationships with key stakeholders and provide specialized security services by enforcing rules and regulations when required.
  • Offer support to any person in need such as providing good customer service when providing a security presence, such as providing direction, responding to emergency situation involving violent individuals and injuries.
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned. 

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  2. Proficient in English (both oral and written)

 

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  3. Use of Force
  4. Report Writing
  5. Additional courses as assigned

 

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

 

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned

 

Should you have any questions on this process, kindly contact People & Culture Department at  

aaradana@paladinsecurity.com

title: Full Time Condo Security Guard
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

If you are looking for a job where you will impact people's daily lives, this is the one for you! As a Condo Security Officer, you will keep children, families, and individuals safe. A great way to help make your community safer!  

This position is right on Barrie's beautiful waterfront and within walking distance of the Barrie Transit Terminal. 

We are looking for someone able to work Monday to Friday from 7:00pm to 4:00am.  Pay Rate: $16.00/hour

What's in it for you?

  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits  

  • Uniform provided free of charge 

  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld 

  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus like Use of Force training 

What does a Security Guard in Barrie do?

  • Access control, security escorts, response to calls for service  

  • Emergency assistance, first aid or any other intervention                   

  • Detect, challenge and relocate unwanted persons     

  • Evacuating the building in case of emergency 

  • Property inspections and enforcement of property regulations

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in Barrie

  • A valid security guard license and first aid card 

  • Available to work flexible hours 

  • Have a clear criminal background 

  • Be eligible to work in Canada

There are countless examples of individuals who began their career as Security Professionals and today hold positions on our senior leadership team. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, and vision coverage, life insurance, employee assistance programs, and more! We also offer company paid uniforms and part-time and flexible schedules!

Allied Universal is seeking Professional Security Guards  in Canada.

  • Display exceptional customer service and communication skills

title: On-Call Security Guards
description:
Securiguard is currently hiring for licensed on-call Security Guards for a number of our sites across Vancouver. We have a range of site options and offer flexibility in scheduling.


Who we are:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost 50 years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solutions provider. That is how we have become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.


With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea, our team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.


Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Free Uniforms
  • Paid Training
  • Health and Dental Benefits (subject to benefit waiting period)
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS Babylon. Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians (subject to waiting period)
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Recognition Programs & Events

What would you bring:

  • Valid BC Security License
  • Pride in delivering outstanding customer service
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Comfortable with radio communication
  • Ability to write reports on job-related activities
  • Keen eye for observing exterior and interior premises
  • Ability to provide building access control
  • Approaches a situation with a listening mindset
  • Capable of standing for a duration of 8 hours

Availability:

  • On-Call- we are able to accommodate a flexible schedule
  • Days, Afternoons, Overnights
  • Weekdays and Weekends

Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer, and we value the diversity of our staff. We are committed to building a facilitative environment of respect, inclusiveness, and career growth.

title: Loss Control Specialist - Canada
description:
About Our Company:

Are you looking for a challenging career that rewards hard work and success?   AFIRM is committed to finding outstanding people who have the ambition and willingness to learn in order to succeed.   The most successful candidates will be detail-oriented, self-motivated and possess strong problem-solving and analytical skills.  

 

AFIRM is the national leader in risk control, consulting services as well as commercial and residential inspections.   We provide our exceptional services to insurers, brokers, risk managers and government agencies.

 

Equal Opportunity Employer

The H.W. Kaufman Group of companies is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other status or condition protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

 

 

Qualifications:

Our Inspectorsâ€™ education and training:

 

  • Inspectors come from all walks of life with their own experience and background
  • AFIRM provides its candidates and Inspectors with a valuable set of skills unlike any other
  • They have all successfully completed AFIRMâ€™s own self-directed, on-line training certification program
  • Continue to hone their skills with AFIRMâ€™s on-going distance learning opportunities

 

 

Our Inspectorsâ€™ work environment      

 

  • As independent contractors with AFIRM, our inspectors work from home
  • They travel to various locations from their home base to assigned locations
  • Work evenings and weekends whenever required to maintain customer satisfaction

 

 

What all our Inspectors must have:

 

  • A reliable vehicle
  • Mobile phone
  • Windows based computer
  • Internet connection (high speed preferably)
  • Digital camera or smart phone that takes high quality digital pictures
Responsibilities:

 

AFIRM is a global leader in Loss Prevention and Premium Audit with Canadian locations in Richmond Hill and Montreal.   We are currently seeking independent Loss Prevention service contractors.

 

Our Loss Control Representatives (Inspectors) visit various property locations on behalf of the ownerâ€™s insurance company with a goal to minimize potential losses.   There is no selling involved.   Requests for inspection are received directly from the insurance companies.

 

Our successful Inspectors are:

 

  • Outgoing and independent
  • Curious and inquisitive by nature
  • Self-motivated strivers
  • Well organized and manage their time efficiently
  • Focused on quality of service
  • Competent computer skills with good input speed & accuracy
  • Skilled at writing well

 

What our Inspectors do:

 

  • Take responsibility for; and organize their assignments
  • Schedule their own appointments with property owners
  • Travel to the location
  • Tour the property and collect information (Residential and Commercial)
  • Identify potential areas of loss such as fire, theft and liability
  • Take photographs and measure buildings
  • Prepare a pre-define Loss Control report of the property using AFIRMâ€™s own web-based platform

title: Security Guard - Full Time - Cargill - Sarnia
description:
To:                                     All Security Personnel

From:                                People & Culture Coordinator

Date:                                 April 11, 2022

Closing Date:                   April 18, 2022

Re:                                     Job Posting

Position:                           Security Guard

City:                                   Sarnia

Status:                              Full-Time (1 position)

Hours:                               Various Shifts (8 to 12 hours)

Pay Rate:                          $15.15 / hour  

Job Description:

Working on assigned shifts, you will provide proactive and reactive security patrols and response to incidents.  You will be required to write reports and investigate routine incidents, as well as respond to emergencies in a quick and efficient manner. 

Job Requirements:

  • Valid Ontario Security Guard license
  • First Aid & CPR – Level C
  • Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent
  • Valid G Class Ontario Drivers License & Drivers Abstract
  • Minimum 1 year security related experience preferred
  • Excellent verbal/written communication skills in English
  • Superior customer service skills
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy
  • Reliable transportation to the job site
  • Position requires the ability to walk/stand/climb stairs for extended periods of time in all weather conditions    

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

 

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. Immunization Record
  2. Double Vaccinated
  3. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  4. Proficient in English (both oral and written)
  5. Vulnerable Sector Check

 

 

 

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

  1. Customer Service
  2. Patrol Procedures
  3. Diversity Awareness  
  4. Finding the OHS Manual
  5. Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Workplace Respect
  8. Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned

Should you have any questions on this process, kindly contact the People and Culture Department at

aaradana@paladinsecurity.com

.

title: Full-time, Overnight, Brampton, Gatehouse Security Guard
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

More than a job – 26% of our corporate employees at GardaWorld started as frontline employees. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset and you're ambitious, this could be just the beginning of your career journey with GardaWorld! 

 

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in Brampton now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, you can be sure that we have a position that can fill your needs and goals. Join our team of dedicated and highly qualified professionals! 

What's in it for you?

  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits  

  • We can guarantee 40 hours/week 

  • Uniform provided free of charge 

  • Career advancement opportunities in the security field or within the head office 

  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld 

What does a Security Guard in Brampton do?

  • Ensure the protection of people, assets, and property 

  • Monitor access of entryways and exit points 

  • Conduct preventive surveillance rounds  

  • Point of contact with authorities and emergency services 

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in Brampton

  • A valid security guard license and first aid card 

  • Available to work flexible hours 

  • Have a clear criminal background 

  • Be eligible to work in Canada

  • Obtain a valid G/G2 driver's license

title: Security Guard - Full time - Putnam
description:
Overview:

We are North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider with over 300,000 phenomenal employees. At Allied Universal ®, we pride ourselves on fostering a promote from within culture. There are countless examples of individuals who began their career as Security Professionals and today hold positions on our senior leadership team. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, and vision coverage, life insurance, employee assistance programs, and more! We also offer company paid uniforms and part-time and flexible schedules!

Job Description:

Join our team today! Currently, we are seeking Full Time Security Guard   for our Putnam Location.

 

Specific Duties Performed and Essential Functions

  • Access control for the facility/area
  • Present a polished, professional, customer friendly image at all times
  • Ability to manage conflicts and incidents and to deescalate
  • Patrolling and following protocols as per  the post orders, which may include indoor or outdoor patrols,  manage the movement of guests at various points throughout the property etc.
  • Ensure that the facilityâ€™s safety and emergency procedures are followed in response to fire alarms and other site Emergencies
  • Undertake site specific training, follow direction and guidance from Site Supervisor or Manager
  • Demonstrate good  judgment, common sense and decision-making ability, particularly when required to take charge and direct others in emergencies or other incidents
  • Meticulous record keeping, report writing, observation skills excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Operate/monitor security room equipment, Completion of site required training
  • Perform Access control and Covid Screening duties  

The Ideal Candidate

  • Valid Provincial Security Guard Licence
  • Valid  First Aid & CPR and AED
  • Must have a minimum high school diploma or GED
  • Shifts may vary from Days/Evenings/Overnights - flexible availability is an asset
  • Exceptional interpersonal and organizational skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Positions may require the use  of a computer for report writing and communications
  • Applicants with security experience may be considered for more advanced positions
  • Ontario Driver's Licence and own vehicle is required
Closing:

Allied Universal ®  provides unparalleled service, systems and solutions to the people and business of our communities, and is North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider. Allied Universal delivers high-quality, tailored solutions, which allows clients to focus on their core business. For more information:  www.AUSecurity.ca.

title: OFA1 Security Guards – Sponsoring OFA2
description:
Securiguard is currently looking for highly motivated and hard-working individuals to work at a high-profile retail site in Downtown Vancouver. If you have an OFA1/OFA2 certification security experience in a similar role, and open availability, we'd love to hear from you. We are offering limited OFA2 sponsorship opportunities for exceptional candidates - this is a great opportunity to gain new skills and certifications within the security industry!

What you would do:

As a Retail Security Officer (RSO) you will be posted at the store entrance/exit or locations that have been identified as high loss to act as a visual security deterrence. RSOs are not expected nor permitted to apprehend shoplifters. As RSOs are often the first and last image a customer has of the retailer, we are seeking candidates that can demonstrate high-quality customer service and always portray a professional image.

Securiguard is currently looking to hire F/T and P/T Retail Security Officers for Vancouver, North Shore, Burnaby, and Surrey locations of the BC Liquor Retail Stores.

What would you bring:

  • Valid BC security license
  • OFA1/OFA2 certificate (sponsoring for OFA2 - Conditions Apply!)
  • More than 1 year of security experience
  • Excellent customer service and communication skills
  • Professional deportment and accountability

Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Paid Training
  • Flexible Schedules & Work life balance
  • Extended Health and Dental Benefits
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS Babylon
  • Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians
  • Access to a robust corporate discount program, Perkopolis
  • Discounted cineplex movie tickets
  • Discounts for an Annual Grouse Mountain Gondola Pass

Who we are:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

At Securiguard, we believe you can make a difference - by making people feel safe, caring for the people around you and supporting your community.

Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer and we are proud of inclusive workplace culture. In 2021, Securiguard was a winner of Canada's Most Admired Culture Culture and listed as a finalist in Canada's HR Awards for excellence in diversity and inclusion. Join our amazing team

title: Rideau Shopping Centre Security Guard (Full Time and Part Time Needed)
description:
Site: Rideau Center Shopping Mall

Status: (Temporary) Full Time 

Hours: Monday to Saturday 10:00-20:00; Sunday 10:00-18:00; Various

Pay Rate: $18.50 hourly during probation, $19.00 afterward

 

Job Description:

  • Greeting employees and customers at designated entrances and keeping the entrances clear from loitering.
  • Watching for and reporting irregularities by completing investigations and incident reports, such as security breaches, facility and safety hazards, and emergency situations; contact emergency responders, such as police, fire, and/or ambulance personnel, as required.
  • Sustaining effective relationships with key stakeholders and providing specialized security services by enforcing the mall’s rules and regulations when required. 
  • Offering support to any person in need such as providing good customer service when providing a security presence, such as providing direction in the mall, responding to emergencies involving violent individuals and injuries.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required:

  • Remain calm and effectively perform during emergencies.
  • Write comprehensive reports and maintain proper written records
  • Effective verbal communication skills.
  • Able to detect problems and report information to appropriate personnel.
  • Basic knowledge of security procedures, handling violent behaviors, and non-defensive communication.
  • Able to follow, and enforce safety codes, mall regulations, and procedures.
  • Strong interpersonal skills, flexibility, and customer service orientation.
  • Able to handle private and confidential information with a high amount of discretion.
  • Present a professional image to the public.
  • Adhere to our Code of Ethics in performing job requirements.
  • Able to understand and follow specific instructions and procedures.
  • Adapt to a variety of environmental factors while performing exterior patrols.
  • Moderate physical activity including standing and/or walking for extended periods of time.

Minimum Job Requirements:

  • Excellent verbal and written English communication skills.
  • Demonstrates superior customer service skills and able to work independently
  • Flexibility to work a variety of shifts (days/nights/overnights/weekends/holidays).
  • Police Foundations Diploma or equivalent post-secondary education/training
  • Must have a valid Ontario Security License
  • Must have a valid First Aid/CPR Level C with AED Certificate
  • Use of Force and MOAB training would be considered a definite asset
  • Previous customer service-related experience would be an asset
  • Previous related security experience would be considered a definite asset

 Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  • Immunization Record
  • Proof of COVID-19 Vaccination Status (Site Requirement)
  • A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  • First Aid & CPR – Level C
  • Proficient in English (both oral and written)

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  • Use of Force and MOAB training
  • Report Writing
  • Additional courses as assigned
  • Able to obtain clearance of a Vulnerable Sector Check

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

  • Customer Service
  • Patrol Procedures
  • Diversity Awareness  
  • The OHS Manual
  • Paladin OHS Orientation
  • Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  • Workplace Respect
  • Slips, Trips and Falls
  • Additional courses as assigned

Should you have any questions on this process, kindly contact the People and Culture Department at 

chuang@paladinsecurity.com

Schedule 1: Monday to Friday 3pm to 8pm 

Schedule 2: Saturday and Sunday 8am to 8pm 

 

Please note the hours could possibly change at client request. 

 

 

Garda London Branch is open for Walk in interviews ALTERNATE Tuesdays from 10 am to 3 pm at 120 Wellington St #200, London starting May 17th, 2022. Please ensure you have the following documents and dress business casual: 

  • Updated Resume 
  • Valid Security License

In the event you are hired on the spot, please be prepared to spend 15 minutes to an hour for documentations and uniforming.

  • Career advancement opportunities in the security field or within the head office

description:
Overview:

We are North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider with over 300,000 phenomenal employees. At Allied Universal ®, we pride ourselves on fostering a promote from within culture. There are countless examples of individuals who began their career as Security Professionals and today hold positions on our senior leadership team. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, and vision coverage, life insurance, employee assistance programs, and more! We also offer company paid uniforms and part-time and flexible schedules!

Job Description:

Join our team today! Currently, we are seeking Part Time Security Guards in our Putnam location.

 

Specific Duties Performed and Essential Functions

  • Access control for the facility/area
  • Present a polished, professional, customer friendly image at all times
  • Ability to manage conflicts and incidents and to deescalate
  • Patrolling and following protocols as per  the post orders, which may include indoor or outdoor patrols,  manage the movement of guests at various points throughout the property etc.
  • Ensure that the facilityâ€™s safety and emergency procedures are followed in response to fire alarms and other site Emergencies
  • Undertake site specific training, follow direction and guidance from Site Supervisor or Manager
  • Demonstrate good  judgment, common sense and decision-making ability, particularly when required to take charge and direct others in emergencies or other incidents
  • Meticulous record keeping, report writing, observation skills excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Operate/monitor security room equipment, Completion of site required training
  • Perform Access control and Covid Screening duties  

This site is not located on a bus route

The Ideal Candidate

  • Valid Provincial Security Guard Licence
  • Valid  First Aid & CPR and AED
  • Must have a minimum high school diploma or GED
  • Shifts may vary from Days/Evenings/Overnights - flexible availability is an asset
  • Exceptional interpersonal and organizational skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Positions may require the use  of a computer for report writing and communications
  • Applicants with security experience may be considered for more advanced positions
  • Ontario Driver's Licence and own vehicle is required
Closing:

Allied Universal ®  provides unparalleled service, systems and solutions to the people and business of our communities, and is North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider. Allied Universal delivers high-quality, tailored solutions, which allows clients to focus on their core business. For more information:  www.AUSecurity.ca.

title: Security Guard- North Vancouver Industrial Site
description:
Securiguard is currently hiring for full-time Overnight/evening Security Guards for immediate work in North Vancouver! The ideal candidate must have 24/7 availability and an active security license. Starting wage is $18/hour with a potential increase after 3 months.


Who we are:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost 50 years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solutions provider. That is how we have become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.


With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea, our team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.


Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Free Uniforms
  • Paid Training
  • Health and Dental Benefits (subject to benefit waiting period)
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS Babylon. Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians (subject to waiting period)
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Recognition Programs & Events

What would you do:

  • Access Control
  • Carry out patrols using the site vehicle

What would you bring:

  • Valid BC Security License
  • Class 5 Driver's License with clean driver's abstract
  • Personal vehicle to get to the site - not transit friendly
  • OFA-1
  • High School Diploma/GED
  • Excellent Verbal and Written Communication Skills
  • Takes Pride in Delivering Outstanding Customer Service
  • Comfortable with Radio Communication
  • Able to Write Reports on Job-Related Activities
  • Keen Eye for Observing Exterior and Interior Premises
  • Approaches a Situation with a Listening Mindset
  • Mature Attitude Towards Executive Protection
  • Capable of Standing for a Duration of 8 Hours
  • Requires quick thinking, great communication skills, and the ability to use technology

Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer, and we value the diversity of our staff. We are committed to building a facilitative environment of respect, inclusiveness, and career growth.

title: Loss Control Specialist - Canada
description:
About Our Company:

Are you looking for a challenging career that rewards hard work and success?   AFIRM is committed to finding outstanding people who have the ambition and willingness to learn in order to succeed.   The most successful candidates will be detail-oriented, self-motivated and possess strong problem-solving and analytical skills.  

 

AFIRM is the national leader in risk control, consulting services as well as commercial and residential inspections.   We provide our exceptional services to insurers, brokers, risk managers and government agencies.

 

Equal Opportunity Employer

The H.W. Kaufman Group of companies is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other status or condition protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

 

 

Qualifications:

Our Inspectorsâ€™ education and training:

 

  • Inspectors come from all walks of life with their own experience and background
  • AFIRM provides its candidates and Inspectors with a valuable set of skills unlike any other
  • They have all successfully completed AFIRMâ€™s own self-directed, on-line training certification program
  • Continue to hone their skills with AFIRMâ€™s on-going distance learning opportunities

 

 

Our Inspectorsâ€™ work environment      

 

  • As independent contractors with AFIRM, our inspectors work from home
  • They travel to various locations from their home base to assigned locations
  • Work evenings and weekends whenever required to maintain customer satisfaction

 

 

What all our Inspectors must have:

 

  • A reliable vehicle
  • Mobile phone
  • Windows based computer
  • Internet connection (high speed preferably)
  • Digital camera or smart phone that takes high quality digital pictures
Responsibilities:

 

AFIRM is a global leader in Loss Prevention and Premium Audit with Canadian locations in Richmond Hill and Montreal.   We are currently seeking independent Loss Prevention service contractors.

 

Our Loss Control Representatives (Inspectors) visit various property locations on behalf of the ownerâ€™s insurance company with a goal to minimize potential losses.   There is no selling involved.   Requests for inspection are received directly from the insurance companies.

 

Our successful Inspectors are:

 

  • Outgoing and independent
  • Curious and inquisitive by nature
  • Self-motivated strivers
  • Well organized and manage their time efficiently
  • Focused on quality of service
  • Competent computer skills with good input speed & accuracy
  • Skilled at writing well

 

What our Inspectors do:

 

  • Take responsibility for; and organize their assignments
  • Schedule their own appointments with property owners
  • Travel to the location
  • Tour the property and collect information (Residential and Commercial)
  • Identify potential areas of loss such as fire, theft and liability
  • Take photographs and measure buildings
  • Prepare a pre-define Loss Control report of the property using AFIRMâ€™s own web-based platform
