title: Full Time Brockville General Hospital Security Guard - $500 Hiring Bonus!
description:
Position:                           Floor Security Guard

Site:                                   Brockville General Hospital 

City:                                   Brockville, Ontario

Status:                               (3) Full Time

Hours:                               Continental Rotation 

Pay Rate:                          $17.89/ hourly

 

YOUR NEXT OPPORTUNITY

Be a part of a rewarding career that ensures a safe and friendly environment in the Ontario region! We are currently offering a hiring bonus for new employees (conditions apply).

  • Full-Time Positions (minimum 36 hours a week)
    • $200 after 3 months
    • $300 after 6 months

Conditions: 

This offer is valid only for new employees hired for the position of Full-Time Security Guard, Brockville General Hospital between April 04, 2022 and May 04, 2022. 

Job Description:

  • Proactive & reactive security patrols
  • Response to incidents
  • Report writing
  • Investigate routine incidents

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. Immunization Record
  2. Proof of valid COVID-19 Vaccine
  3. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  4. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  5. Proficient in English (both oral and written)

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  2. Use of Force
  3. Weapons Defense Tactic Training
  4. Baton Training
  5. Report Writing
  6. Additional courses as assigned
  7. Able to obtain clearance of a Vulnerable Sector Check

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

  1. Customer Service
  2. Patrol Procedures
  3. Diversity Awareness  
  4. Finding the OHS Manual
  5. Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. with People with Mental Illness
  7. Workplace Respect
  8. Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned

Should you have any questions on this process, kindly contact the People and Culture Department at

creilly@paladinsecurity.com

title: Security Guard, Banking
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

If you are looking for a job in a stable environment, this is the one for you! As a Security Officer in the banking industry, you will play a key role in ensuring the safety of workers for high profile clients!  

We provide people with growth opportunities. 30% of our frontline employees are promoted to become part of our operation teams. 

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in Toronto now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, we have a position that will accommodate your needs and help you reach your goals. 

What's in it for you?

  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits  

    • Starting at $16

  • Full-Time and Part-Time opportunities available

  • Uniform provided free of charge 

  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld 

What does a Security Guard in Toronto do?

  • Receive calls and direct visitors and/or employees 

  • Ensure the protection of people, property and premises 

  • Act as a deterrent to any misconduct or suspicious behaviour

  • Control the entrances and exits with the equipment at your disposal 

  • Perform various administrative tasks

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in Toronto

  • A valid security guard license and first aid certificate

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

  • Available to work flexible hours

  • Comfortable to STAND for your entire shift

  • Previous experience guarding at a bank site is a strong asset

  • Have a clear criminal background

title: Security Guard Dispatch, Industrial
description:
We’re growing our ranks in Fort McMurray, now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, we have a position that will accommodate your needs and help you reach your goals. We are currently looking to fill the role of Security Guard Dispatch.

The successful candidate for this position must reside in Fort McMurray and possess excellent oral and written communication and technology skills.

 

 

What does a Security Guard Dispatch in Fort McMurray do?

 

  • Ability to use computers and complete timely spoken and written correspondence
  • Willingness to complete multiple online site-specific trainings as well as in person training
  • Ability to progress in a standardized dispatch training plan and meet certifications within three months
  • Responsible for the collecting information and dispatching emergency services for various emergency situations such as medical emergencies, fire alarms, fires, etc.
  • Knowledgeable of all the policies and procedures related to emergency dispatching ability to conduct duties under pressure
  • As the dispatcher, you must assist the Security Shift Supervisor and ensure all instructions are given to the appropriate team members.
  • Help oversee all daily security operations.

 

 

What’s in it for you?

  • Complete uniform
  • Guarantee of full-time hours
  • Benefits
  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus like Use of Force training

 

 

Qualifications to become a Security Guard with Garda Fort McMurray Branch.

  • Valid Alberta Security Guard Licence
  • Class 5 Driver's License Advanced (non GDL)
  • Willing to complete a class 4 drivers license within 3 months
  • CSO (common safety orientation)
  • Standard First Aid Level-C (2-day course)
  • High School Diploma
  • Pass drug and alcohol testing
  • WHMIS
  • Security experience
  • At ease working as a team and offering excellent customer service

 

Start your career journey with GardaWorld today, apply online or email your resume to marsha.hutchings-campbell@garda.com

title: Loss Control Specialist - Canada
description:
About Our Company:

Are you looking for a challenging career that rewards hard work and success?   AFIRM is committed to finding outstanding people who have the ambition and willingness to learn in order to succeed.   The most successful candidates will be detail-oriented, self-motivated and possess strong problem-solving and analytical skills.  

 

AFIRM is the national leader in risk control, consulting services as well as commercial and residential inspections.   We provide our exceptional services to insurers, brokers, risk managers and government agencies.

 

Equal Opportunity Employer

The H.W. Kaufman Group of companies is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other status or condition protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

 

 

Qualifications:

Our Inspectorsâ€™ education and training:

 

  • Inspectors come from all walks of life with their own experience and background
  • AFIRM provides its candidates and Inspectors with a valuable set of skills unlike any other
  • They have all successfully completed AFIRMâ€™s own self-directed, on-line training certification program
  • Continue to hone their skills with AFIRMâ€™s on-going distance learning opportunities

 

 

Our Inspectorsâ€™ work environment      

 

  • As independent contractors with AFIRM, our inspectors work from home
  • They travel to various locations from their home base to assigned locations
  • Work evenings and weekends whenever required to maintain customer satisfaction

 

 

What all our Inspectors must have:

 

  • A reliable vehicle
  • Mobile phone
  • Windows based computer
  • Internet connection (high speed preferably)
  • Digital camera or smart phone that takes high quality digital pictures
Responsibilities:

 

AFIRM is a global leader in Loss Prevention and Premium Audit with Canadian locations in Richmond Hill and Montreal.   We are currently seeking independent Loss Prevention service contractors.

 

Our Loss Control Representatives (Inspectors) visit various property locations on behalf of the ownerâ€™s insurance company with a goal to minimize potential losses.   There is no selling involved.   Requests for inspection are received directly from the insurance companies.

 

Our successful Inspectors are:

 

  • Outgoing and independent
  • Curious and inquisitive by nature
  • Self-motivated strivers
  • Well organized and manage their time efficiently
  • Focused on quality of service
  • Competent computer skills with good input speed & accuracy
  • Skilled at writing well

 

What our Inspectors do:

 

  • Take responsibility for; and organize their assignments
  • Schedule their own appointments with property owners
  • Travel to the location
  • Tour the property and collect information (Residential and Commercial)
  • Identify potential areas of loss such as fire, theft and liability
  • Take photographs and measure buildings
  • Prepare a pre-define Loss Control report of the property using AFIRMâ€™s own web-based platform

title: Security Guard - Imperial Oil - Gate 2 - Full Time - Sarnia, ON
description:
To:                                     All Security Personnel

From:                                 People & Culture Recruiter  

Re:                                     Job Posting

Position:                           Security Guard

Site:                                   Imperial Oil

City:                                   Sarnia, ON

Status:                              Full-Time (1 position)

Hours:                               Continental rotation

Pay Rate:                          $15.89 – 20.06/hr.

Position Overview:

Reporting to the Paladin Operations Manager serving IOL, this position has the primary responsibility to perform all duties related to the Site Access Control System to control access to the Imperial Oil Sarnia Site for the purpose of security as well as emergency duties.

 

Essential Job Functions:

  • Security personnel at this location will act as backup to #318 Gate for in plant emergencies.
  • Security personnel are to be conversant with emergency duties and procedures of Gate 318.
  • Monitor Genetec access at Gate 2.
  • Custodian of key and sign out for IOL gas pump during off-hours.
  • Custodian of keys, key press and key log for #2 Gate.
  • Report MOB Generator alarms to RSS via Site Emergency Channel immediately.
  • Hold keys to IOL vehicles to be picked up for repair.
  • Inform S.E.R.L./RSS/SSL of the arrival of police, fire department, MOE, MOL, US Coast Guard, Transport Canada and media.
  • Every other Monday – EWS test at 12:30 – fire or toxic (count tones, call assigned units for L/C, log in book).
  • Conduct Overtime callout for IOL mechanical trades.
  • Conduct snow removal callout at the request of the S.E.R.L.
  • Operate Weigh Scale during off-hours according to #2 Weigh Scale procedures.
  • Monitor CB channel and for product truck communication.
  • Initiate report for record of public complaints regarding odor, noise or any other complaint and notify proper IOL contact.
  • Conduct gate specific duties during emergencies and follow direction from site leadership.
  • Liaise with other security staff on site.
  • Provide assistance to all IOL contacts and contractors when requested

 

Requirements:

  • Must possess Ontario Security Guard License.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy.
  • Sustain effective relationships with key stakeholders and provide specialized security services by enforcing rules and regulations when required.
  • Moderate physical demands related to tasks and duties. This position calls for vehicle inspections to be conducted on access and egress and vehicle checks.
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.
  • Experience as a security guard on an industrial site.
  • Site interview.

 

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

 

 

 

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. Immunization Record
  2. Full Covid Vaccine
  3. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  4. Proficient in English (both oral and written)

 

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Additional courses as assigned

 

 

 

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned.

 

Should you have any questions on this process, please contact People and Culture Recruiter, Aradana, at

aaradana@paladinsecurity.com

.

title: Agent de sécurité, Granby-Bromont
description:
Prêt à revêtir l’uniforme?

Plus qu'un emploi - 26% de nos employés corporatifs chez GardaWorld ont commencé comme employés de première ligne. Si vous avez l'esprit d'entreprise et que vous êtes ambitieux, ce pourrait être le début de votre carrière chez GardaWorld !  

 

Malgré les défis de la dernière année, nous élargissons nos rangs à Granby et Bromont maintenant plus que jamais ! Grâce à notre grande variété de contrats, vous pouvez être sûr que nous avons un poste qui répondra à vos besoins et à vos objectifs. Rejoignez notre équipe de professionnels dévoués et hautement qualifiés !  

Qu'est-ce que vous y gagnez ?

  • Nous offrons des salaires compétitifs et des prestations de santé complètes  

  • Nous pouvons garantir 40 heures par semaine  

  • Uniforme fourni gratuitement  

  • Possibilités d'avancement dans le domaine de la sécurité ou au siège social.  

  • Opportunités de croissance au sein de GardaWorld  

  • Formation continue avec notre Campus GardaWorld, comme emploi de la force 

Que fait un agent de sécurité à Bromont ?

  • Assurer la protection des personnes, des biens et des propriétés.  

  • Surveiller l'accès aux entrées et aux sorties  

  • Effectuer des rondes de surveillance préventive   

  • Assurer le contact avec les autorités et les services d'urgence  

Qualifications pour devenir un agent de sécurité?

  • Une licence d'agent de sécurité et une carte de premiers secours valide 

  • Être disponible pour travailler selon des horaires flexibles  

  • Avoir un casier judiciaire vierge  

  • Être admissible à travailler au Canada  

 

Intéressé par ce défi ? Envoyer votre CV dès maintenant à felicia.pupo@garda.com

 

SSEST

title: Experienced Security Guard - Full Time
description:
Overview:

We are North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider with over 300,000 phenomenal employees. At Allied Universal ®, we pride ourselves on fostering a promote from within culture. There are countless examples of individuals who began their career as Security Professionals and today hold positions on our senior leadership team. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, and vision coverage, life insurance, employee assistance programs, and more! We also offer company paid uniforms and part-time and flexible schedules!

Job Description:

Allied Universal is seeking Professional Security Guards in Toronto downtown.    

 

-Over night shift, continental rotation, full time

-Great opportunity  to get experience with the Government site

-Competitive pay

-Paid Training

-Start work immediately

 

Specific Duties Performed and Essential Functions

  • Access control for the facility/area
  • Present a polished, professional, customer friendly image at all times
  • Ability to manage conflicts and incidents and to deescalate
  • Patrolling and following protocols as per the post orders, which may include indoor or outdoor patrols, manage the movement of guests at various points throughout the property etc.
  • Ensure that the facilityâ€™s safety and emergency procedures are followed in response to fire alarms and other site Emergencies
  • Undertake site specific training, follow direction and guidance from Site Supervisor or Manager
  • Demonstrate good judgment, common sense and decision-making ability, particularly when required to take charge and direct others in emergencies or other incidents
  • Meticulous record keeping, report writing, observation skills excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Operate/monitor security room equipment, Completion of site required training

Formal Education, Licenses and Certifications Required:

  • 1 year of Security Experience is mandatory
  • Own transportation is an asset to some positions: G Drivers License and Clean Drivers Abstract
  • Valid Ontario Security Guard License with Valid First Aid / CPR
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Education in Police Foundations and/or Law and Security/ Criminology degree/ or equivalent
  • Advanced knowledge of computers and computer programs
  • Advanced report writing and note taking abilities
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • Minimum two years experience in a high security high confidentiality, complex environment.
  • Must be physically fit, and able to work long hours standing and walking.
Closing:

Allied Universal ®  provides unparalleled service, systems and solutions to the people and business of our communities, and is North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider. Allied Universal delivers high-quality, tailored solutions, which allows clients to focus on their core business. For more information:  www.AUSecurity.ca.

title: Part-Time Security Guards - Kelowna
description:
Securiguard is currently hiring for part-time Security Guards for work in Kelowna!

Job Requirements:

  • A valid BC Security License
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Pride in delivering outstanding customer service
  • Comfortable with radio communication
  • Able to write reports on job-related activities
  • Keen eye for observing exterior and interior premises
  • Ability to provide access control
  • Ability to handle a situation with a listening mindset

Availability:

  • Thursday - Saturday 12:00PM - 7:00PM

About Us:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea their team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.

title: Paladin Security: Security Guard - St. Lawrence College (Brockville)
description:
Date:                                 March 10, 2022

Re:                                     Job Posting (External)

Position:                           Security Guard

Site:                                   St. Lawrence College (Brockville Campus)

City:                                   Brockville, Ontario

Status: Full-Time Position

Hours:                               Thursday – Friday 0300-083, Saturday 0030-1230, Sunday-Monday 0030-0830

Pay Rate:                          $17.00/hour ($15.00 base rate + $2 premium for the site) 

 

JOB DUTIES

  • Ensure students, staff and visitors adhere to St. Lawrence College policy, directives and regulations
  • Monitor activities and respond to incidents and such as criminal activity, security breaches, assaults, sexual assaults, harassments, thefts, mischief, public order, noise complaints, safety hazards, etc.
  • Maintain surveillance of facility and persons
  • Watch for and report irregularities by completing incident reports, such as security breaches, facility and safety hazards, and emergency situations; contact emergency responders, such as police, fire, and/or ambulance personnel, as required
  • Utilize site radios and computer applications for communicating / reporting site activities and incidents
  • Sustain effective relationships with key stakeholders and provide specialized security services by enforcing rules and regulations when required
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:

  • Remain calm and effectively perform in emergency situations
  • Successfully conduct security patrols without direct supervision.
  • Write comprehensive reports and maintain proper records using effective communication skills
  • Able to detect problems and report information to appropriate personnel
  • Basic knowledge of security procedures, handling possible violent behaviours, and non-  defensive communication.
  • Able to follow, and enforce safety codes, campus regulations, and procedures.
  • Strong interpersonal skills, flexibility, and customer service orientation
  • Able to handle private and confidential information with a high amount of discretion
  • Present a professional image to the public
  • Adhere to our Code of Ethics in performing job requirements
  • Able to understand and follow specific instructions and procedures
  • Moderate physical activity including standing and/or walking for extended periods of  time

MINIMUM JOB REQUIREMENTS:

  • Excellent verbal and written English communication skills.    
  • Demonstrates superior customer service skills and able to work independently
  • Flexibility to work a variety of shifts (afternoons/nights/weekends).
  • Minimum of a High School Diploma.
  • Must be 18 years old and meet all other minimum requirements and MUST possess a Security Guard Licence in Ontario.
  • Management of Aggressive Behaviour, Use of Force and First Aid/CPR Level C would be considered a definite asset
  • Previous customer service related experience would be an asset
  • Previous security experience would be considered a definite asset
  • Experience in Microsoft Word, Excel and Reporting programs like Tracktix, would be an asset
  • Experience in Customer Service

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. Immunization Record
  2. Proof of valid COVID-19 Vaccine
  3. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  4. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  5. Proficient in English (both oral and written)

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  2. Use of Force
  3. Weapons Defense Tactic Training
  4. Baton Training
  5. Report Writing
  6. Additional courses as assigned
  7. Able to obtain clearance of a Vulnerable Sector Check

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

  1. Customer Service
  2. Patrol Procedures
  3. Diversity Awareness  
  4. Finding the OHS Manual
  5. Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. with People with Mental Illness
  7. Workplace Respect
  8. Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned

title: Full-time, Overnight, North York, Access Control Security Guard
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

More than a job – 26% of our corporate employees at GardaWorld started as frontline employees. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset and you're ambitious, this could be just the beginning of your career journey with GardaWorld! 

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in North York now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, you can be sure that we have a position that can fill your needs and goals. Join our team of dedicated and highly qualified professionals! 

What's in it for you?

What does a Security Guard in North York do?

  • Be eligible to work in Canada

title: Loss Control Specialist - Canada
description:
About Our Company:

Are you looking for a challenging career that rewards hard work and success?   AFIRM is committed to finding outstanding people who have the ambition and willingness to learn in order to succeed.   The most successful candidates will be detail-oriented, self-motivated and possess strong problem-solving and analytical skills.  

 

AFIRM is the national leader in risk control, consulting services as well as commercial and residential inspections.   We provide our exceptional services to insurers, brokers, risk managers and government agencies.

 

Equal Opportunity Employer

The H.W. Kaufman Group of companies is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other status or condition protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

 

 

Qualifications:

Our Inspectorsâ€™ education and training:

 

  • Inspectors come from all walks of life with their own experience and background
  • AFIRM provides its candidates and Inspectors with a valuable set of skills unlike any other
  • They have all successfully completed AFIRMâ€™s own self-directed, on-line training certification program
  • Continue to hone their skills with AFIRMâ€™s on-going distance learning opportunities

 

 

Our Inspectorsâ€™ work environment      

 

  • As independent contractors with AFIRM, our inspectors work from home
  • They travel to various locations from their home base to assigned locations
  • Work evenings and weekends whenever required to maintain customer satisfaction

 

 

What all our Inspectors must have:

 

  • A reliable vehicle
  • Mobile phone
  • Windows based computer
  • Internet connection (high speed preferably)
  • Digital camera or smart phone that takes high quality digital pictures
Responsibilities:

 

AFIRM is a global leader in Loss Prevention and Premium Audit with Canadian locations in Richmond Hill and Montreal.   We are currently seeking independent Loss Prevention service contractors.

 

Our Loss Control Representatives (Inspectors) visit various property locations on behalf of the ownerâ€™s insurance company with a goal to minimize potential losses.   There is no selling involved.   Requests for inspection are received directly from the insurance companies.

 

Our successful Inspectors are:

 

  • Outgoing and independent
  • Curious and inquisitive by nature
  • Self-motivated strivers
  • Well organized and manage their time efficiently
  • Focused on quality of service
  • Competent computer skills with good input speed & accuracy
  • Skilled at writing well

 

What our Inspectors do:

 

  • Take responsibility for; and organize their assignments
  • Schedule their own appointments with property owners
  • Travel to the location
  • Tour the property and collect information (Residential and Commercial)
  • Identify potential areas of loss such as fire, theft and liability
  • Take photographs and measure buildings
  • Prepare a pre-define Loss Control report of the property using AFIRMâ€™s own web-based platform

title: Security Guard - Full Time - Ingredion - London
description:
To:                                       All Security Personnel

From:                                  People and Culture

Date:                                   March 14, 2022

Closing Date:                     March 18, 2022

Re:                                      Job Posting

Position:                             Security Guard

Site:                                     Ingredion Canada – 1100 Green Valley Rd

City:                                     London, Ontario

Status:                                 Full Time

Hours:                                  Sunday (2359- 0700hrs) + Monday-Thursday (2300-0700hrs)

Pay Rate:                             $17.00/hr.

Position Overview:

The day-to-day work activities of a Security Guard working at Ingredion include, but are not limited, the following duties:

  • Control entry and access to the plant and maintain accurate logs of those entering and leaving the plant
  • Weigh scale operations  
  • Document and Customs control for contractors/drivers
  • There is also some document and customs control for contractors/drivers
  • Report safety non-compliances and all incidents to specified Ingredion representative
  • Aid in incident mitigation and investigations when required
  • Aid in emergency responses and first aid measures when required
  • Aid in Ingredion Health and Safety programs/procedures when required
  • Maintain a helpful and professional affiliation with Ingredion employees, carriers, contractors, and visitors
  • Prevent, help manage, observe, detect, report:
    • Thefts, break-ins, vandalism
    • Accidents, fire, leaks
    • Articles of value found
    • Damage found to building
    • Hazardous conditions
    • Unauthorized parking on site
    • Any other circumstances and conditions not in line with good security practices
  • Follow additional practices as set out by Ingredion when necessary

 

Requirements:

The applicant must possess the following:

  • Be courteous and cooperative with a high quality of customer service.
  • Good interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively at various social levels and across diverse cultures
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Write clear, concise and legible reports

 

Preferred skills/qualifications:

  • Valid Ontario Security Guard licence (required)
  • Valid First Aid & CPR certificate
  • Experience in a Truck Gate/Warehouse environment
  • Microsoft Office experience

 

Essential Job Functions:

  • Be courteous and cooperative with a high quality of customer service.
  • Good interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively at various social levels and across diverse cultures.
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Communicates any concerns/issues with Supervisor 

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  2. Proficient in English (both oral and written)

 

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  3. Use of Force
  4. Report Writing
  5. Additional courses as assigned

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

 

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned

title: Day Tactical Guard, Downtown Toronto
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

GardaWorld is hiring Tactical Security Guards in Toronto’s security industry!

Looking for a full time or part time job?  Do you have experience as a Tactical Security Guard?  Do you have your security license?

If you meet these 3 requirements, we could have you working soon depending on our needs in your area!

We’re offering a hiring bonus* for licensed guards!

What's in it for you?

  • Competitive salary/wages from $19.00/hr-$20.00/hr 
  • Flexible shifts - Part-time /Full-time
  • Benefits in accordance with collective bargaining agreements
  • Complete uniform & diverse work assignment
  • Career development and training opportunities

What does a Security Guard in Toronto do?

  • Protecting people, assets & property at client locations
  • Monitoring access points using surveillance & alarm systems
  • Conducting preventive surveillance 
  • Providing impeccable customer service 
  • Preventing fire, theft & vandalism through vigilance 
  • Verifying & inspecting all safety equipment
  • Enforcing client property regulations
  • Writing reports

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in Toronto

  • Valid Ontario Security Guard license & Standard First Aid/CPR certification
  • Previous security experience
  • Driver’s licence & access to a vehicle (asset)
  • Full availability (includin nights, days, afternoons, weekends & statutory holidays)
  • Professional deportment
  • Proactive, attention-to-detail, self-motivated, team players 

 

No license? No problem!  We’d be happy to help.

Thank you for considering GardaWorld's big family as your future employer! We can’t wait to welcome you in!

*restrictions apply

title: Security Guards - Prince Rupert
description:
Securiguard will be hiring for part-time/full-time Security Guards in the Prince Rupert area with the potential to lead to fulltime! This is a chance to be a part of a unique and exciting project!

Job Requirements:

  • Providing excellent customer service to both the client and its guests
  • Emergency response: Ability to respond to incident/emergency situations and follow required protocol
  • Access control at terminals and project sites
  • Patrolling of designated areas
  • Radio check ins
  • Report writing
  • Identify and reporting safety hazards
  • Visual security presence - detect and deter unauthorized persons
  • Coordinating and liaising with the police or emergency personnel when required
  • Reporting security breaches
  • Adhere to Securiguards core Values, Vision, Mission statement
  • Perform regularly scheduled site duties as required by client standard operating procedures
  • Keep consistent notes using company issued note book
  • Frequent shift activity reporting

Candidate Requirements:

  • Valid BC Security License
  • Valid Drivers License
  • Ability to obtain a Transport Canada Security Clearance(TSC).
  • Ability to read and write descriptive and factual reports in the English language

About us:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada. With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea their team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.

title: Security Guard - Healthcare - $20/hr starting
description:
YOUR NEXT OPPORTUNITY

Be part of a booming industry and create a rewarding career ensuring the safety of our healthcare workers, patients, and visitors in the Greater Vancouver Area. Make a difference in your community through our people-first approach and flexible hours

Paladin has new opportunities for Security Officers who have open availability for a variety of shifts: morning, evening, and overnight required.

Our Healthcare position pay rates start at $20/hr (depending on position/location)

WHAT YOU WILL DO

As a Healthcare Security Officer, you will respond to alarms, emergency requests, and use exceptional verbal de-escalation skills when needed. Your ability to take HUFT (Healthcare Use of Force) training provides you with the know-how to respond to critical scenarios. You always maintain confidentiality and discretion when handling private information, and you never forget to smile while providing your above and beyond customer service.

You swiftly fill out detailed reports whenever an issue arises. This helps you discover solutions on how to keep staff, patients, and guests feeling comfortable in the secure environment you provide through an empathy-led security model. Along with your confidence and ability to use your Protective Equipment, you regularly patrol the facility so that no potential security matter leaves your sight.

YOU’RE A GREAT FIT IF YOU:

  • Provide exceptional customer service
  • Have strong communication skills
  • Are comfortable with on-foot duties
  • Possess OFA1/MOAB/HUFT (Occupational First Aid, Managing Aggressive Behaviour, Healthcare Use of Force) certifications. Considered an asset, however,            our industry-leading training will be provided
  • Are eligible to work in Canada
  • Have prior experience and a valid security license, which are considered an asset. If not, you’re in luck! We will help you acquire your security license and even pay for it

All our Officers are required to carry a valid Security License. We also provide Basic Security Training to those who have not been through the course previously.

WHAT PALADIN OFFERS:

  • Competitive wages
  • Promotion from within opportunities
  • Company-paid and best-in-class training & uniforms
  • Benefits & recognition programs
  • Award-winning culture
  • Above and beyond Leadership
  • Unwavering support from your very first shift.

Paladin Security is one of Canada’s Best Employers and most awarded security company. Each year, Paladin continues to grow and push the boundaries, all while staying in line with our goals and values. Join the Paladin Family today, we would love to see you grow with us!

Please note that all initial interviews are being conducted remotely at this time, via phone and/or video chat.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those applicants that are shortlisted will be contacted for an interview.

ABOUT US

Paladin Security: Making the World a Safer and Friendlier Place! Do you have superior customer service skills and a passion for helping people? Are you able to think quickly on your feet and defuse difficult situations? Your track record of handling a great deal of responsibility combined with your varied life experience and enthusiasm for a job well done make you an ideal candidate for our team! The Paladin Difference starts with our officers; we're the best because we hire the best. We believe in promoting from within, respecting people and their differences, providing high-quality service and always having fun! If you think you have what it takes to join our team, we want to meet you!

title: High Profile Commercial Security Supervisor
description:
More than a job- 26% of our corporate employees at GardaWorld Canada started as frontline employees. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset and you’re ambitious, this could be just the beginning for your career journey with GardaWorld!

We’re growing our ranks in Edmonton now more than ever! We are looking for our next Security Supervisor at a premium high profile site downtown Edmonton. If you are a self starter, ambitious, upbeat, and looking for a long-term career, you have picked the right position!

Security Supervisor will be responsible for:

  • Submitting daily incident and shift summer report electronically
  • Review all submitted team incident reports for quality assurance
  • Assist in the removal of unwanted persons
  • Liaise with client, contractors, tenants, local police
  • Review and export of CCTV footage using digital CCTV systems
  • Assist in emergency situations
  • Provide first aid and basic life safety
  • Train, coach, and mentor new and existing staff
  • Maintain site schedule
  • Provide quality assurance
  • Provide customer service and concierge services to tenants, guests, etc
  • Cover other possible positions when required

What we offer:

  • We offer competitive wages starts at $18.50 & comprehensive health benefits
  • We can guarantee 40 hours/week
  • Uniform provided free of charge
  • Career advancement opportunities in the security field or within the head office
  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld
  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus
  • Corporate discounts

What we’re looking for:

  • Valid Alberta Security Guard License
  • Valid First Aid
  • Minimum one (1) year in security
  • Security Supervisor experience is an asset or at least several more years of equivalent supervisor experience
  • Moderate to advance knowledge of Microsoft office programs
  • Looking for long-term full-time employee
  • Ability to handle pressure
  • Able to work downtown and take transit if needed
  • Team player and be a self-starter
  • Leadership and mentorship skills
  • Must be adaptable to change and able to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong relationship management and consulting skills in order to cultivate positive and effective relationships with client groups and key stakeholder

title: Security Guard - Full time - Ingersoll
description:
Overview:

We are North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider with over 300,000 phenomenal employees. At Allied Universal ®, we pride ourselves on fostering a promote from within culture. There are countless examples of individuals who began their career as Security Professionals and today hold positions on our senior leadership team. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, and vision coverage, life insurance, employee assistance programs, and more! We also offer company paid uniforms and part-time and flexible schedules!

Job Description:

Join our team today!  Currently, we are seeking  Full Time Security Guards.

 

Specific Duties Performed and Essential Functions

  • Access control for the facility/area
  • Present a polished, professional, customer friendly image at all times
  • Ability to manage conflicts and incidents and to deescalate
  • Patrolling and following protocols as per  the post orders, which may include indoor or outdoor patrols,  manage the movement of guests at various points throughout the property etc.
  • Ensure that the facilityâ€™s safety and emergency procedures are followed in response to fire alarms and other site Emergencies
  • Undertake site specific training, follow direction and guidance from Site Supervisor or Manager
  • Demonstrate good  judgment, common sense and decision-making ability, particularly when required to take charge and direct others in emergencies or other incidents
  • Meticulous record keeping, report writing, observation skills excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Operate/monitor security room equipment, Completion of site required training
  • Must perform In-Car duties  
  • Perform Access control and Covid Screening duties  

Site is located in Ingersoll and is not located on a bus route

The Ideal Candidate

      • Valid Provincial Security Guard Licence
      • Valid  First Aid & CPR and AED
      • Must have a minimum high school diploma or GED
      • Shifts may vary from Days/Evenings/Overnights - flexible availability is an asset
      • Exceptional interpersonal and organizational skills
      • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
      • Positions may require the use  of a computer for report writing and communications
      • Applicants with security experience may be considered for more advanced positions
      • Ontario Driver's Licence and own vehicle is required
Closing:

Allied Universal ®  provides unparalleled service, systems and solutions to the people and business of our communities, and is North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider. Allied Universal delivers high-quality, tailored solutions, which allows clients to focus on their core business. For more information:  www.AUSecurity.ca.

title: Pipeline Remote Camp Security Guard - $252 per day
description:
Canada's Leading Provider of Corporate Security is seeking full-time security guards for oil pipeline in sites in the BC Interior, such as Merritt, Clearwater, Blue River and Valemount BC

Hours of work: 12-hour shifts, 14 days on 14 days off

Job overview:

Our mission at Securiguard is to make people feel safe. As a security professional, you'll be responsible for the protection of people and assets by patrolling designated areas, identifying, and reporting safety hazards and reporting security breaches, as well as completing all reporting and radio check-ins. Other duties may include monitoring CCTV and surveillance systems, responding to alarms and emergencies and controlling access to the site. You will provide excellent customer service to our clients and guests, while providing a visual security presence to deter and detect unauthorized guests.

In this role, you will be working in an industrial environment, supporting a large and exciting critical infrastructure project in a remote area. You'll be dedicated to safety and maintaining a safe work environment for all by following all safety protocols, processes and procedures, and reporting any hazards.

What's in it for YOU!

  • Accommodation for 2 weeks in your rotation
  • Clean private room, which includes, Bed, A/C, 32" TV ( Netflix, Crave, Prime are included), desk, small closet, personal shower, and toilet.
  • Housekeeping - towels, sheet changing and room cleaning
  • Meals are provided - 24/7 meals, includes a daily breakfast, lunch and dinner, and after-hours snack/food available, support any dietary restrictions. Meal to GO app available
  • Health and Wellness - workout gym, running and bike machines, lounge, playroom, media room
  • Free Wi-Fi in each room
  • Travel allowance per rotation, including hotel stay if needed.

Stay and work in comfort with Securiguard


Candidate requirements:

  • Valid BC Security License or ability to obtain
  • Class 5 Driver's License with a clean driving abstract and claims history
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Must be able to pass a pre-employment drug screening test
  • Must be comfortable working in a wilderness setting for extended periods of time
  • Must be able to work a 12 hour shift (day or night) and must be physically fit to work in a remote location
  • Must have open availability and be able to work morning or night shifts

Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Daily & weekly overtime
  • Work Life balance
  • Extended health and dental benefits
  • Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians through TELUS Health
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS health
  • Discounts on Cineplex movie tickets and more
  • Access to a robust corporate discount program through Perkopolis
  • Sponsored training (including Occupational First Aid Level 1 and PCST courses)

More about Securiguard:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

At Securiguard, we believe you can make a difference - by making people feel safe, caring for the people around you and supporting your community.

Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer and we are proud of inclusive workplace culture. In 2021, Securiguard was a winner of Canada's Most Admired Culture Culture and listed as a finalist in Canada's HR Awards for excellence in diversity and inclusion. Join our amazing team and help make people feel safe.

Securiguard is committed to maximizing employment and training opportunities for Indigenous, local and regional residents. If you identify as a member of an Indigenous community, we encourage you to self-identify in our optional screening question.

title: Loss Control Specialist - Canada
description:
About Our Company:

Are you looking for a challenging career that rewards hard work and success?   AFIRM is committed to finding outstanding people who have the ambition and willingness to learn in order to succeed.   The most successful candidates will be detail-oriented, self-motivated and possess strong problem-solving and analytical skills.  

 

AFIRM is the national leader in risk control, consulting services as well as commercial and residential inspections.   We provide our exceptional services to insurers, brokers, risk managers and government agencies.

 

Equal Opportunity Employer

The H.W. Kaufman Group of companies is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other status or condition protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

 

 

Qualifications:

Our Inspectorsâ€™ education and training:

 

  • Inspectors come from all walks of life with their own experience and background
  • AFIRM provides its candidates and Inspectors with a valuable set of skills unlike any other
  • They have all successfully completed AFIRMâ€™s own self-directed, on-line training certification program
  • Continue to hone their skills with AFIRMâ€™s on-going distance learning opportunities

 

 

Our Inspectorsâ€™ work environment      

 

  • As independent contractors with AFIRM, our inspectors work from home
  • They travel to various locations from their home base to assigned locations
  • Work evenings and weekends whenever required to maintain customer satisfaction

 

 

What all our Inspectors must have:

 

  • A reliable vehicle
  • Mobile phone
  • Windows based computer
  • Internet connection (high speed preferably)
  • Digital camera or smart phone that takes high quality digital pictures
Responsibilities:

 

AFIRM is a global leader in Loss Prevention and Premium Audit with Canadian locations in Richmond Hill and Montreal.   We are currently seeking independent Loss Prevention service contractors.

 

Our Loss Control Representatives (Inspectors) visit various property locations on behalf of the ownerâ€™s insurance company with a goal to minimize potential losses.   There is no selling involved.   Requests for inspection are received directly from the insurance companies.

 

Our successful Inspectors are:

 

  • Outgoing and independent
  • Curious and inquisitive by nature
  • Self-motivated strivers
  • Well organized and manage their time efficiently
  • Focused on quality of service
  • Competent computer skills with good input speed & accuracy
  • Skilled at writing well

 

What our Inspectors do:

 

  • Take responsibility for; and organize their assignments
  • Schedule their own appointments with property owners
  • Travel to the location
  • Tour the property and collect information (Residential and Commercial)
  • Identify potential areas of loss such as fire, theft and liability
  • Take photographs and measure buildings
  • Prepare a pre-define Loss Control report of the property using AFIRMâ€™s own web-based platform

title: Security Guard / Officer - North Vancouver Sites
description:
Do you have strong skills in customer service delivery, teamwork, and problem-solving? We want to hear from you! The Paladin Difference starts with our officers; we're the best because we hire the best.  If you think you have what it takes to join our team, we want to meet you! We offer job stable positions and lots of career advancement opportunities, including free training, security licensing, and promotion from within.

Pay range: $17-22 per hour (dependent on site/location).

Apply now to join our Team of elite security officers at our various locations in the North Vancouver and West Vancouver Area. 

We are looking for candidates that can travel to the North Shore on a daily basis for Full-time and Part-time positions.

Locations included:

  • BCIT Marine Campus
  • Capilano University
  • Movie / Film Studios
  • ICBC Corporate Office
  • Industrial Yards
  • Lion's Gate Hospital
  • Woodcroft Estates

Minimum Requirements

  • Excellent customer service, problem solving, and willingness to help.
  • Strong English communication skills (written and verbal).
  • Comfortable interacting verbally with team members, client personnel, members of the general public, and emergency services.
  • Able to write detailed incident reports which may be utilized in court if subpoenaed.
  • A passion for being active, your patrols may be indoors or outdoors, in all weather conditions, and can include stairwells, uneven surfaces, and parkades. You must be physically able to stand and/or patrol for the majority of a shift (8-hours average).
  • Comfortable approaching and leading in emergency situations, including trauma, aggression, intoxication, bodily fluids, etc.
  • Able to watch for and report irregularities, such as security breaches, facility and safety hazards, and emergency situations and contact emergency responders as required
  • Basic skills in utilizing technology, including writing reports on a computer, tracking patrols in a smart phone, and communicating via two-way radio.

Benefits

  • An active lifestyle: If sitting behind a desk doesn’t appeal to you, you’ll love the dynamic work environment that security can bring.
  • Leading Corporate Culture: Paladin is a Canadian employee or choice because of the amazing people that work here!
  • Career advancement: Whether you are gaining experience for law enforcement, looking for meaningful work as a student, or simply exploring a field you are passionate about, Paladin gives you the opportunity to advance your skills!
  • Health Benefits & Perks: Full-time employees are eligible for great benefits, and all staff can enjoy exclusive Paladin discounts at your favourite retailers and service providers across Canada!
  • And more…

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those applicants that are short listed will be contacted for an interview.

title: Agent de sécurité, Tour à bureaux BentallGreenOak - Montréal
description:
Prêt à revêtir l’uniforme?

Si vous cherchez un emploi où vous impacterez le quotidien des gens, celui-ci est fait pour vous ! En tant qu'agent de sécurité dans une tour à bureaux prestigieuse au Centre-ville de Montréal, vous jouerez un rôle clé en assurant la sécurité des travailleurs et visiteurs pour certaines des plus grandes marques !  

Nous offrons à nos employés des possibilités d'évolution. 30% de nos employés de première ligne sont promus pour faire partie de nos équipes opérationnelles.  

Grâce à notre grande variété de contrats, nous avons un poste qui répondra à vos besoins et vous aidera à atteindre vos objectifs.

Qu'est-ce que vous y gagnez ?

  • Salaire de 19,33$ (+ primes) et des prestations de santé complètes 

  • Nous pouvons garantir 40 heures par semaine 

  • Possibilités de quarts de jour, soir ou de nuit

  • Uniforme fourni gratuitement  

  • Opportunités de croissance avec GardaWorld  

  • Formation continue avec notre Campus GardaWorld

Que fait un agent de sécurité à BentallGreenOak

  • Accueillir, informer, diriger et escorter les différents usagers et visiteurs 

  • Opérer le système de contrôle d'accès 

  • Porter assistance et évacuer le bâtiment en cas d’urgence 

  • Rondes de patrouilles dans l'établissement

  • Procéder à l'inventaire des équipements de sécurité 

Qualifications pour devenir un agent de sécurité?

  • Un permis d'agent de sécurité et une carte de premiers soins valides 

  • Être disponible pour travailler selon un horaire flexible  

  • Avoir un casier judiciaire vierge  

  • Être admissible à travailler au Canada

title: Security Guard-FT/PT
description:
Overview:

We are North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider with over 300,000 phenomenal employees. At Allied Universal ®, we pride ourselves on fostering a promote from within culture. There are countless examples of individuals who began their career as Security Professionals and today hold positions on our senior leadership team. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, and vision coverage, life insurance, employee assistance programs, and more! We also offer company paid uniforms and part-time and flexible schedules!

Job Description:

Allied Universal is seeking Professional Security Guards in Montreal.

 

  • Competitive pay
  • Full uniform and gear
  • Paid Sick leave
  • Paid Vacation
  • Company Health Benefits

 

QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS:

  • Be at least 18 years of age with high school diploma or equivalent
  • Legally entitled to work in Canada
  • Possess effective written and oral communication and interpersonal skills with ability to deal with all levels of personnel and the general public in a professional and effective manner

  • Licensing requirements are subject to province and/or local laws and regulations and will be required prior to employment.

  • As a condition of employment, employee must successfully complete a background check

title: Tactical Security Guard, Downtown Toronto
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

GardaWorld is hiring Security Guards in Toronto’s security industry!

Looking for a full time or part time job?  Do you have experience as a Tactical Security Guard?  Do you have your security license?

If you meet these 3 requirements, we could have you working soon depending on our needs in your area!

We’re offering a hiring bonus* for licensed guards!

What's in it for you?

  • Competitive salary/wages  from $19.00/hr-$20.00/hr 
  • Flexible shifts - part time / full time
  • Benefits in accordance with collective bargaining agreements
  • Complete uniform & diverse work assignment
  • Career development and training opportunities

What does a Security Guard in Toronto do?

  • Protecting people, assets & property at client locations
  • Monitoring access points using surveillance & alarm systems
  • Conducting preventive surveillance 
  • Providing impeccable customer service 
  • Preventing fire, theft & vandalism through vigilance 
  • Verifying & inspecting all safety equipment
  • Enforcing client property regulations
  • Writing reports

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in Toronto?

  • Valid Ontario Security Guard license & Standard First Aid/CPR certification
  • Previous Tactical security experience
  • Driver’s license & access to a vehicle (an asset)
  • Full availability (including. nights, days, afternoons, weekends & statutory holidays)
  • Professional deportment
  • Proactive, attention-to-detail, self-motivated, team player 

 

No license? No problem!  We’d be happy to help.

Thank you for considering GardaWorld's big family as your future employer! We can’t wait to welcome you in!

*restrictions apply

title: Security Professionals
description:
Security Professionals


Location: Nanaimo - Port Site

Securiguard is currently looking for enthusiastic security professionals with an MTSC to join our team at Port sites!

Key responsibilities:

  • Controlling access to the site and ensuring only authorized access
  • Conducting foot patrols on site
  • Conducting mobile patrols
  • Watching and reporting any safety and security breaches
  • Providing a visual crime deterrence
  • Emergency first aid response, if required
  • Various administrative and clerical duties
  • Monitoring traffic entering/exiting site
  • Monitoring CCTV

Skills & Qualifications:

  • Valid B.C. Security License
  • MTSC required
  • Class 5 Driver's License along with a clean driver's abstract
  • Weekend and overnight availability an asset.
  • Excellent Customer Service Skills
  • Confidence in handling and deescalating confrontation in an assertive, calm, and respectful manner.
  • Comfort working independently and in varying weather conditions

Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Award winning corporate culture
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS Babylon
  • Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians
  • Health and Dental Benefits after 9 months to P/T and F/T Employees
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Paid Training

Who We Are:

Securiguard has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

At Securiguard, we believe you can make a difference - by making people feel safe, caring for the people around you and supporting your community.

Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer, and we value the diversity of our staff. We are committed to building a facilitative environment of respect, inclusiveness, and career growth.

How To Apply:

Interested applicants please email your resume as well as proof of applicable certifications through to Frumsa@securiguard.com

  • Ability to manage conflicts and incidents and to deescalate
  • Patrolling and following protocols as per  the post orders, which may include indoor or outdoor patrols,  manage the movement of guests at various points throughout the property etc.
  • Ensure that the facilityâ€™s safety and emergency procedures are followed in response to fire alarms and other site Emergencies
  • Undertake site specific training, follow direction and guidance from Site Supervisor or Manager
  • Demonstrate good  judgment, common sense and decision-making ability, particularly when required to take charge and direct others in emergencies or other incidents
  • Meticulous record keeping, report writing, observation skills excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Operate/monitor security room equipment, Completion of site required training
  • Perform Access control and Covid Screening duties  

The Ideal Candidate

  • Valid Provincial Security Guard Licence
  • Valid  First Aid & CPR and AED
  • Must have a minimum high school diploma or GED
  • Shifts may vary from Days/Evenings/Overnights - flexible availability is an asset
  • Exceptional interpersonal and organizational skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Positions may require the use  of a computer for report writing and communications
  • Applicants with security experience or Valid Drivers, Licence and reliable form of transportation may be considered for more advanced positions

 

Closing:

Allied Universal ®  provides unparalleled service, systems and solutions to the people and business of our communities, and is North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider. Allied Universal delivers high-quality, tailored solutions, which allows clients to focus on their core business. For more information:  www.AUSecurity.ca.

title: Security Guards
description:
Whether you're looking to start a new career in security services or you're a seasoned security professional, we invite you to explore a future with Securiguard. Our men and women in the field are the true ambassadors of our company and we are fully committed to providing an environment of respect and personal growth for our staff.

We support this commitment with highly competitive compensation and benefits, comprehensive training, reliable equipment and supportive supervision as well as great opportunities for advancement, community involvement and work/life balance practices.

title: Security Guard - Lambton College - South Building - Part Time
description:
To:                                All Security Personnel
From:                           People & Culture Coordinator 
Date:                            March 3, 2022
Closing Date:               March 9, 2022
Re:                              Job Posting
Position:                      Security Guard  
Site:                            Lambton College - South Building 
City:                            Sarnia 
Status:                        Part Time (2 positions)  
Hours:                         Various Hours (1600-0000, 0000-0800, 0800-2000,2000-0800) 
Pay Rate:                    $17.43/hr. 

Position Overview:

Working assigned shifts, you will be responsible for completing written reports.  You will be expected to perform constant patrols and interact with students, staff and members of the public to provide direction and promote good customer service while providing a security presence.

Essential Job Functions:

  • Implement security measures to protect property, control access to sites, patrol assigned areas and ensure client rules and regulations are followed.
  • Maintain written reports.
  • Perform security checks and liaise with visitors, customers, and the public.
  • Communicates any concerns/issues with Branch Manager.

Job Requirements:

  • Physical Demands include excessive walking and standing.
  • Patrol assigned area on foot, as assigned, to ensure personal, building, and equipment security.
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy.
  • Must have customer service-oriented attitude.
  • Utilize two-way radio and computer applications for communicating site activities.
  • Watch for and report irregularities by completing investigations and incident reports, such as security breaches, facility and safety hazards, and emergency situations; contact emergency responders, such as police, fire, and/or ambulance personnel, as required.
  • Sustain effective relationships with key stakeholders and provide specialized security services by enforcing rules and regulations when required.
  • Offer support to any person in need such as providing good customer service when providing a security presence, such as providing direction, responding to emergency situation involving violent individuals and injuries.
  • Working knowledge of the Trespass to Property Act and Mental Health Act
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. Immunization Record
  2. Covid Vaccines
  3. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  4. Proficient in English (both oral and written)

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  3. Use of Force
  4. Report Writing
  5. Additional courses as assigned

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those applicants that are short listed will be contacted for an interview.

Should you have any questions on this process, please contact LeeAnne Feddes, People and Culture Coordinator at

lfeddes@paladinsecurity.com

.

title: Security Guard, Education
description:
Position: Security Guard, Education 

Schedule: Monday to Friday 7:30 am to 1:30 pm 

Location:  31 King St E 2nd Floor, Hamilton, ON

Hourly Pay Rate: $15.25

What's in it for you?

  • Uniform provided free of charge
  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld
  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus like Use of Force training

What does a Security Guard in Hamilton do?

  • Interior and exterior patrols 

  • Access control, security escorts, response to calls for service

  • Emergency assistance, first aid or any other intervention                   

  • Detect, challenge and relocate unwanted persons     

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in Hamilton

  • A valid security guard license and first aid card 

  • Have a clear criminal background 

  • Be eligible to work in Canada 

 

Interested? Apply online or send in your resume to palak.soni@garda.com

description:
Overview:

We are North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider with over 300,000 phenomenal employees. At Allied Universal ®, we pride ourselves on fostering a promote from within culture. There are countless examples of individuals who began their career as Security Professionals and today hold positions on our senior leadership team. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, and vision coverage, life insurance, employee assistance programs, and more! We also offer company paid uniforms and part-time and flexible schedules!

Job Description:

Allied Universal is seeking Professional Security Guards  in Canada.    

 

Join a Phenomenal Team

Unlimited Training  

Endless opportunities  to grow

Pay Rate: $19.38

Computer Savvy

Full Time Availability â€“ Morning /Nights/ Afternoon/Overnight

Own Vehicle

  • As a condition of employment, employee must successfully complete a background check

    • Work in various environments such as cold weather, rain/snow or heat

title: Part Time Security Guards - City of Vancouver Contract
description:
Securiguard is looking for outstanding, experienced, and motivated Security Professionals for our City of Vancouver contract in a highly restricted site. We are now accepting applications for various positions and our services include uniformed guards, mobile patrols, alarm response, security equipment & systems, locksmiths, and alarm monitoring services. Candidates with OFA1 will only be considered.

Location: Vancouver


Who we are:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost 50 years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solutions provider. That is how we have become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.


With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea, our team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.


Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Free Uniforms
  • Paid Training
  • Health and Dental Benefits (subject to benefit waiting period)
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS Babylon. Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians (subject to waiting period)
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Recognition Programs & Events

What would you do:

  • Provide excellent customer service
  • Team Player
  • Working with the community and providing a friendly customer service as you will be representing both City of Vancouver and Securiguard Services Ltd.
  • Ability to build relationships with the public and be there as a support system for the team
  • Comfortable with Radio Communication
  • Able to write detailed reports on job-related activities
  • Keen eye for observing exterior and interior premises
  • Working independently in all types of environment
  • Customer Service with stakeholders
  • Access Control
  • Report all incidents and health and safety concerns
  • Demonstrate empathy when handling situations involving Vancouver's most vulnerable populations
    • (i.e.: less fortunate individuals, individuals with drug/mental health issues, etc.)

What would you bring:

  • Valid BC Security License
  • At least 6 months security experience in Canada
  • OFA1 is an asset
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Experience working in a fast-paced customer-oriented environment
  • High School Diploma or equivalent
  • Clean background check
  • You must complete six hours of online mandatory training prior to being deployed on the field.

Assets

  • Class 5 Driver's License
  • Mental Health Training
  • CPI
  • AST
  • OFA-2

Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer, and we value the diversity of our staff. We are committed to building a facilitative environment of respect, inclusiveness, and career growth.

title: Cabot - Security Guard - Spare - Sarnia
description:
To:                                         All Security Personnel

From:                                    LeeAnne Feddes

Date:                                     March 3, 2022

Closing Date:                       March 9, 2022  

Re:                                        Job Posting

Position:                              Security Guard

Site:                                      Cabot

City:                                     Sarnia

Status:                                 Spare

Hours:                                 Monday - Friday 0500-1300/ 1300-2100 (Monday shift starts at 0430-1300)  

Pay Rate:                             $19.29/hr.

Essential Job Functions:

  • Implement security measures to protect property, control access to the site, patrol assigned areas to monitor activities and ensure client rules and regulations are followed.
  • Ensure site safety and emergency procedures are followed and maintain written reports.
  • Direct visitors to appropriate areas, perform security checks, and liaise with visitors, customers, and the public.
  • Enforce compliance to company policies and procedures.
  • Maintaining a positive, productive work environment through collaboration.
  • Check that Contractor’s IEC and Site-Specific Safety training is current.
  • Issue a swipe card and complete relevant documentation.
  • Issue vehicle passes and complete documentation.
  • Complete vehicle inspections and paperwork for DTR loads.
  • Record bulk truck and SPS trailer information on the Fleet database.
  • Update all information in Security Office, Doorway and Information Board when required.
  • Monitor Surveillance camera system.
  • Conduct site Patrols and complete reports.
  • First aid – be prepared to administer when required.
  • Answer the switch board phone calls.
  • Fire extinguishers – cleaning, checking, switching out for Hydrostatic Testing.
  • Public Announcements to the site including Heat Stress, Adverse Weather updates.
  • Order supplies as needed for Office, First Aid, CO monitor’s etc., including eyewash stations.
  • Ensuring site safety expectations are provided to all personnel before entry to site.
  • Update the database as necessary and inform Shift Supervisor of updates.
  • Performs weekly waste inspections.
  • Trespassers – deal with in an efficient and courteous manner.
  • E-Mail/Fax Paladin time sheets.
  • Month end filing for documentation that is to be stored.
  • Housekeeping is an essential security function.
  • Perform miscellaneous job – related duties as assigned.

Requirements:

  • Must possess Ontario Security Guard License.
  • First Aid & CPR – Level C
  • Written and verbal communication skills.
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability.
  • Patrol assigned area on foot, as assigned.

Security Guards at Cabot may be required to complete a drug & alcohol test for incidents that occur on Cabot property.

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. Immunization Record
  2. Full Covid Vaccine
  3. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  4. Proficient in English (both oral and written)

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  2. Use of Force
  3. Report Writing
  4. Additional courses as assigned

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned

Should you have any questions on this process, please contact LeeAnne Feddes People and Culture Coordinator at lfeddes@paladinsecurity.com
