title: Security Guard - West Kelowna
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

If you are seeking a job where you have important responsibilities, this one is for you! As a security guard in the industrial sector, you will play a key role in ensuring the safety of workers for some of the biggest brands out there! 

We provide people with growth opportunities. 30% of our frontline employees are promoted to become part of our operation teams. 

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in West Kelowna now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, we have a position that will accommodate your needs and help you reach your goals. 

What's in it for you?

  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits  

  • We can guarantee 40 hours/week 

  • Uniform provided free of charge 

  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld 

  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus like Use of Force training 

What does a Security Guard in West Kelowna do?

  • Manage access as well as access cards through the computer system 

  • Camera surveillance of access gates and parking barriers 

  • Greet customers and register visitors as needed 

  • Act as a first responder in the event of a crisis or emergency  

Qualifications

  • A valid BC security guard license

  • Available to work overnight shifts

  • Have a clear criminal background 

  • Be eligible to work in Canada

title: Security Guard - Full Time
description:
Securiguard is currently looking for full-time Security Guards to join our team in Pickering/Ajax.

Whether you're looking to start a new career in security services or you're a seasoned security professional, we invite you to explore a future with us. Our men and women in the field are the true ambassadors of our company and we are fully committed to providing an environment of respect and personal growth for our staff.

Our ideal candidate will possess

  • Ontario Security Guard License
  • Excellent Communication Skills
  • Takes Pride in Delivering Outstanding Customer Service
  • Comfortable with Radio Communication
  • Able to Write Reports on Job-Related Activities
  • Keen Eye for Observing Exterior and Interior Premises
  • Access Control Experience
  • Approaches a Situation with a Listening Mindset
  • Mature Attitude Towards Executive Protection
  • Capable of Standing/walking for a Duration of 8 Hours
  • We've got mobile positions available as well!

We offer:

  • Extensive Training
  • Extended Health Benefits (subject to benefit waiting periods)
  • Recognition Programs & Events

We are committed to building an environment of respect and personal growth for all of our staff. We support this commitment with highly competitive compensation and benefits, comprehensive training, reliable equipment and supportive supervision as well as great opportunities for advancement, community involvement and work/life balance practices.

Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer and we value the cultural diversity of our staff. We offer flexibility in scheduling to accommodate students, family, caregivers and part-time personnel.

title: Healthcare Security Guards -Mackenzie Health - Full Time
description:
To:                                          All Security Personnel

From:                                    Sharlin Alpin

Date:                                     February 15, 2022

Closing Date:                     February 22, 2022

Re:                                         Job Posting

Position:                              High Profile Security Guard

Site:                                       Mackenzie Health

City:                                       10 Trench Street, Richmond Hill

Status:                                  Full-Time

 

Hours:                                 Rotating Continental (0700-1900/1900-0700)

 

Pay Rate:                             $16.98/hr “Rates are based on a levelling system”

 

Are you interested in starting a career in a fast paced and growing industry? As a provider of security services to clients with complex security needs, Paladin Security Group is offering an exciting career opportunity for you to give back to your community, while developing skills for future careers. Our training programs are also a leader in the security industry, and they will help prepare you for advancements, as well as build your resume for a potential career in law enforcement.

 

 

 

Job Description:

 

  • Patrol assigned area on foot, as assigned, to ensure personal, building, and equipment security.
  • Watch for and report irregularities by completing investigations and incident reports, such as security breaches, facility and safety hazards, and emergency situations; contact emergency responders, such as police, fire, and/or ambulance personnel, as required.
  • Utilize two-way radio and computer applications for communicating site activities.
  • Sustain effective relationships with key stakeholders and provide specialized security services by enforcing rules and regulations when required.
  • Offer support to any person in need such as providing good customer service when providing a security presence, such as providing direction, responding to emergency situation involving violent individuals and injuries.
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

 

 

 

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. Immunization Record
  2. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  3. Proficient in English (both oral and written)

 

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  3. Use of Force
  4. Report Writing
  5. Additional courses as assigned

 

 

 

 

Should you have any questions on this process, kindly contact the People and Culture Department at

hrtoronto@paladinsecurity.com

.

title: Security Guard, Education
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

As Security Guard earning a premium rate of $18.00/HR you will be working in an educational setting you will play a key role in keeping workers, students, and visitors safe for one of the most prestigious schools in our region. If you are looking for a challenging and interesting career where every day you learn something new and have interesting experiences then this is the position for you. We have multiple openings available with a variety of hours and are looking to fill part time and full time positions within Owen Sound. This opportunity offers a great work/life balance with no overnight shifts required. 

We provide people with growth opportunities. 30% of our frontline employees are promoted to become part of our operation teams. Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in Owen Sound now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, we have a position that will accommodate your needs and help you reach your goals.

What's in it for you?

  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits
  • We can guarantee 40 hours/week
  • Uniform provided free of charge
  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld
  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus like Use of Force training

What does a Security Guard in Owen Sound do?

  • Interior and exterior patrols 

  • Access control, security escorts, response to calls for service  

  • Emergency assistance, first aid or any other intervention                   

  • Detect, challenge and relocate unwanted persons     

  • Evacuating the building in case of emergency 

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in Owen Sound

  • A valid security guard license and first aid card 

  • Must be able to pass Use of Force Certification provided at no charge by GardaWorld and maintain certification throughout employment. Annual recertification will be required. 

  • Available to work flexible hours 

  • Have a clear criminal background 

  • Be eligible to work in Canada

title: Pipeline Remote Camp Security Guard - $283 per day
description:
Securiguard is looking for Security Guards for an industrial project in Burns Lake, Fraser Lake and Houston, BC. This is a great opportunity for those looking for well paid work to those who are open to travel to the beautiful North Coast.


Wages: starting at $283 per day (based on a 12 hour shift) plus travel expenses.


Who we are:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost 50 years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solutions provider. That is how we have become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea, our team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.


What would you do:

  • Observe and report suspicious activity, and report security breaches
  • Respond to incident/emergency situations and follow protocol
  • Provide perimeter security coverage
  • Provide access control and ensure there is no unauthorized access to the site
  • Patrolling of designated areas in an outdoor environment
  • Radio check ins and security report writing duties
  • Provide a visual security presence - detecting and deterring unauthorized persons
  • Coordinating and liaising with the police or emergency personnel when required
  • Adhere to Securiguard's core Values, Vision, Mission statement

What would you bring:

  • Valid BC Security License
  • Previous security experience is an asset
  • Class 5 Driver's License with a clean driving abstract and claims history
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Comfort working in a wilderness setting
  • Must be able to pass drug and alcohol test

Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer, and we value the diversity of our staff. We are committed to building a facilitative environment of respect, inclusiveness, and career growth.

Securiguard is committed to maximizing employment and training opportunities for Indigenous, local, and regional residents. If you identify as a member of an Indigenous community, we encourage you to self-identify in our optional screening question.

title: Lake Huron Water Supply - Grand Bend - Security Guard - Casual
description:
To:                                All Security Personnel

From:                           People and Culture Coordinator

Date:                            March 2, 2022

Closing Date:               March 8, 2022

Re:                              Job Posting

Position:                       Security Guard 

Site:                              Lake Huron Water Supply System

City:                              Grand Bend, Ontario

Status:                         Casual

Hours:                           Rotating Continental Shift (0700-1900/1900-0700) (including weekends)

Pay Rate:                     $20.81/hr.

Overview:

Paladin Security: Making the World a Safer and Friendlier Place! Do you have superior customer service skills and a passion for helping people? Are you able to think quickly on your feet and defuse difficult situations? Your track record of handling a great deal of responsibility combined with your varied life experience and enthusiasm for a job well done make you an ideal candidate for our team! The Paladin Difference starts with our officers; we're the best because we hire the best. We believe in promoting from within, respecting people and their differences, providing high quality service and always having fun! If you think you have what it takes to join our team, we want to meet you!  

Job Description:

Successful applicants will be responsible for both proactive and reactive patrols throughout their shifts while providing access control to the facility.  Additionally, you will be required to monitor all security systems inclusive of CCTV.

Staff assigned to this location will be tasked with alarm response as well as assisting in both fire and medical situations.

The successful applicants will be required to have strong customer service skills and be graduates of a law and security or related college program.

Security Guards at the site are required to complete a Drug & Alcohol test for incidents that occur on client property.

Required Certifications

  • Standard First Aid CPR Level C
  • Valid Ontario Security License
  • Vulnerable Sector Check

 

Required Education

  • Post-secondary education in law enforcement from a recognized institution or equivalent experience College/University Education.

 

Screening Requirements

  • Criminal Background Check
  • Education Verification
  • Employment Verification

 

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

 

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. Immunization Record
  2. Full Covid Vaccine
  3. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  4. Proficient in English (both oral and written)

 

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

 

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned.

 

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those applicants that are short listed will be contacted for an interview.

Should you have any questions on this process, please contact LeeAnne Feddes, People and Culture Coordinator at 

lfeddes@paladinsecurity.com

description:
To:                             All Security Personnel
From:                        People & Culture Coordinator 
Date:                         Feb. 9, 2022 
Closing Date:            Open
Re:                            Job Posting
Position:                   Security Guard – Spare (2 positions) 
Site:                          NOVA Chemicals 
City:                         Corunna/Mooretown/St. Clair
Status:                     Part Time 
Hours:                     Various Hours (12-hour shifts) 
Pay Rate:                $16.49/hr. - $19.06 rates are based on a levelling system 
. 

Position Overview:

The job of a Paladin Security Guard serving NOVA is to provide such services that are required within established post orders or given by direct communication by their Manager. These include the keeping of logs, the supervision of safety orientations, response to alarms and site emergencies and any other duties NOVA may require. The Security Guard is to maintain a secure post and through due diligence offer protection to those on site and for the assets of NOVA. 

Essential Job Functions:

  • Enforce compliance to company policies and procedures.
  • Control access and provide a response capability to address security breaches, site emergencies, and incidences of accident or injury on the site.
  • The Security Guard would only be given temporary responsible charge in training situations and in providing supervisory relief. This would be a directed assignment by a Manager.
  • Each and every staff member has a responsibility to ensure the maintenance and good working order of equipment allocated by Paladin and NOVA in support of our contract services.
  • The Security Guard should strive to know the NOVA and contract personnel that they encounter daily on their site. They should also communicate one to another that information that ensures a consistent level of service.

Requirements:

  • At least two years of security experience in an industrial setting would be an asset.
  • Post-Secondary education in a law enforcement/security program from a recognized college would be an asset.
  • Working knowledge of the Trespass to Property Act and Mental Health Act
  • Capable of working 12 hour rotating shift schedule, accept short notice call in and be flexible with scheduling
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy
  • Patrol assigned area on foot, as assigned, to ensure personnel, building, and equipment security.
  • Watch for and report irregularities by completing investigations and incident reports, such as security breaches, facility and safety hazards, and emergency situations; contact emergency responders, such as police, fire, and/or ambulance personnel, as required.
  • Utilize two-way radio and computer applications for communicating site activities and shift occurrences. Computer skills required for most tasks and equipment utilizing Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook.
  • Experience with Access Control Computer Systems would be an asset
  • Sustain effective relationships with key stakeholders and provide specialized security services by enforcing rules and regulations when required.
  • Offer support to any person in need such as providing good customer service when providing a security presence, such as providing direction, responding to emergency situations involving violent individuals and injuries.
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned by client and management.

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. Immunization Record
  2. Covid vaccine
  3. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  4. Proficient in English (both oral and written)

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  3. Use of Force
  4. Report Writing
  5. Additional courses as assigned

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

 

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned

title: Security Guard, Shopping Centre
description:
We are looking for Security Guards to work at a Mall located at 900 Maple Ave, Burlington, ON. As a member of the GardaWorld team, your primary role is to ensure the safety and security of client assets, tenants and visitors to the assignment area in a professional and courteous manner.  The hourly pay rate for this site is $16.16. Please find details below for the positions available: 

 

Schedule 1: Sunday and Monday 0000hrs to 0800hrs 

Schedule 2: Friday 1400hrs to 2200hrs, Saturday and Sunday 1100hrs to 1900hrs 

Schedule 3: Monday 1400hrs to 2200hrs, Wednesday 1400hrs to 2200hrs, Friday 1000hrs to 1800hrs (w/ potential emergency coverage of 1600hrs-0000hrs) 40 hours total 

Schedule 4: Friday and Saturday 1600hrs to 0000hrs 

What does a Security Guard in Burlington do?

  • Perform patrols on foot
  • Provide excellent customer service to everyone on the property
  • Work closely with the mall services as well as with the emergency services when appropriate
  • Assist visitors, guests and the renter's staff with respect to safety, requests for directions, escorts, package transportation, lost vehicles, etc.
  • Apply property rules and regulations in a fair and responsible manner
  • Write daily and incident reports
  • Intervene during medical emergencies and provide first aid
  • Be prepared to respond to situations of crime, urgency and disturbance occurring at the mall
  • Facilitate access to authorized persons to restricted areas
  • Direct car traffic on the property, if necessary
  • Monitor closed circuit cameras (if applicable) to ensure proper operation of the shopping center
  • Answer and follow up on phone calls received by the security service
  • Monitor the fire alarm system and fire extinguisher system

What's in it for you?

  • Diverse benefits plan
  • On-the-job paid training
  • Opportunity for advancement in the security industry
  • Complete uniform

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in Burlington

 

  • Possession of a valid provincial security guard license
  • First aid and CPR certification
  • Strong customer service skills
  • Strong oral and written communication skills
  • Ability to exercise sound judgment under stressful situations
  • Ability to work independently as well as part of a team environment
  • Knowledge of criminal, provincial and federal laws as they pertain to the security industry

 

Interested? Apply online or send your resume to palak.soni@garda.com

description:
Whether you're looking to start a new career in security services or you're a seasoned security professional, we invite you to explore a future with Securiguard.

Location: Keremeos, Penticton, and Summerland


The Ideal Candidate will Possess:

  • BC Security Workers License
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Takes pride in delivering outstanding customer service
  • Comfortable with radio communication
  • Able to write reports on job-related activities
  • Keen eye for observing exterior and interior premises
  • Access control
  • Approaches a situation with a listening mindset
  • Mature attitude towards executive protection
  • Capable of standing for a duration of 8 hours

Availability:

Overnight
Weekdays and weekends


Employee Perks We Offer:

Free uniforms
Paid training
Benefits (Conditions Apply)
Flexible schedules
Recognition programs & events

About Us

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada. With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea their team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.

title: Imperial Oil - Full Time - Security Guard - 318 Gate - Sarnia
description:
To:                                     All Security Personnel

From:                                 People and Culture Coordinator

Date:                                 March 2, 2022

Closing Date:                   March 8, 2022

Re:                                     Job Posting

Position:                           Imperial Oil (#318 Gate) Security Guard

Site:                                   Imperial Oil

City:                                   Sarnia

Status:                              Full Time

Hours:                               Shift rotation (12-hour shifts)

Pay Rate:                          $15.89 - 20.06 /hr. Rates based on a levelling system.  

 

Position Overview:

Reporting to the Security Front Line Supervisor serving IOL this position has the primary responsibility to perform all duties related to the Site Access Control System to control access to the Imperial Oil Sarnia Site for the purpose of security.

This position requires familiarity of the Imperial Oil Sarnia site and its practices, as well as an extensive general computer knowledge in order to perform all required tasks.

The #318 Gate Security guard is expected to represent Paladin Security Group as well as the facility they are assigned to. 

 

Essential Job Functions:

  • Security personnel at this location is primary for emergency duties
  • Security personnel are to be conversant with emergency duties and procedures
  • Monitor Genetec access at Gate 318.
  • Conduct EWS test every second Monday as per schedule.
  • Operate Site Center COM Radio system as required.
  • Custodian of keys and key log for #318 Gate.
  • Issue card keys to authorized persons for Scott Road Tank Farm.
  • Issue Site Access Control System visitor cards for Area #3 access. Handle incoming calls for Area #3 access.
  • Responsible for LPG and SPPL Terminal shutdown upon request of an authorized IOL personnel with password.
  • Radio or phone communication every two (2) hours with LPG loader during off hours (Mon-Fri (1800-0800 hrs.).
  • Notify S.E.R.L. and the Security Shift Leader of all alarms at LPG and SPPL terminals and Imperial Transformer station.
  • Notification to S.E.R.L. and RSS of any incident in Area #3. Requires immediate follow up – Call to the Area #3 S/S.
  • Monitor CCTV for LPG Terminal, Area #3 TX Loading Rack and the LDR1 loading rack. Report all unusual activities to the Security Shift Leader and S.E.R.L.
  • Operate weigh scale during the off-hours according to #3 weigh Scale procedures.
  • Liaise with other security staff on site.
  • Provide assistance to all IOL contacts and contractors when requested
  • Liaise with site S.E.R.L. and Security Front Line Supervisor
  • Use StormGeo to detect severe weather and heat and crosspatch this to the site

 

Requirements:

  • At least two years of security experience in a team lead role would be an asset
  • Post-Secondary education in a law enforcement/security program from a recognized college
  • Working knowledge of the Trespass to Property Act and Mental Health Act
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy
  • Watch for and report irregularities by completing investigations and incident reports, such as security breaches, facility and safety hazards, and emergency situations; contact emergency responders, such as police, fire, and/or ambulance personnel, as required.
  • Utilize two-way radio and computer applications for communicating site activities.
  • Sustain effective relationships with key stakeholders and provide specialized security services by enforcing rules and regulations when required.
  • Offer support to any person in need such as providing good customer service when providing a security presence, such as providing direction, responding to emergency situation involving violent individuals and injuries.
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.

Security Guards at Imperial Oil may be required to complete a drug & alcohol test for incidents that occur on Imperial Oil property.

 

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. Immunization Record
  2. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  3. Proficient in English (both oral and written)

 

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  3. Use of Force
  4. Report Writing
  5. Additional courses as assigned

 

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

 

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned

Should you have any questions on this process, kindly contact the People and Culture Department at lfeddes@paladinsecurity.com.

title: Campus Security Guard - Full Time
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

We are looking for motivated individuals to join or team as Security Guards in a high-profile school setting. 

This is a Full-Time, straight night position with Rotating Nights from 2000-0800. Pay rate for this position is $15.49/Hour
 

What's in it for you?

  • Comprehensive benefits
  • Room for advancement in an expanding organization
  • Ongoing education and skill development
  • Flexible scheduling 
  • Guaranteed full time hours

What does a Security Guard in Barrie do?

  • Interior and exterior patrols
  • Access control, security escorts, service call response and report writing
  • Property inspections and enforcement of property laws, client rules, and other regulations                    
  • Assist in the event of an emergency, first aid or any other intervention                  
  • Interact with visitors, customers. and the general public on a regular basis
  • Detect, challenge and displace unwanted people    
  • Evacuate the building in case of emergency
  • Collect information on complaints or events
  • Maintain a positive, productive work environment through teamwork                                                                         

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in Barrie

  • Previous experience in the security industry
  • Valid Provincial Security Guard licence
  • Good verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong computer skills
  • Available to work days and/or nights 
  • Customer service oriented
  • Security clearance reliability
  • Leadership and problem-solvingskills
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment

title: Remote Camp Security - Positions starting at $252 per day
description:
Securiguard is hiring full-time Remote Camp Security Guards for remote camp opportunities within British Columbia. This is a chance to be a part of a unique and exciting project! All training is provided!

Hours of work: 12-hour shifts, 14 days on 14 days off

Who are we:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada. With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea their team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.


Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Full uniforms & PPE provided
  • Daily & weekly overtime
  • Extended health and dental benefits - waiting periods apply
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS Babylon. Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians (subject to waiting period)
  • Recognition programs

What would you do:

  • Providing excellent customer service to both the client and its guests
  • Emergency response: Ability to respond to incident/emergency situations and follow required protocol
  • Provide perimeter security coverage of Contractor activities and equipment
  • Access control at project sites
  • Patrolling of designated areas in outdoor terrain environment
  • Alarm response
  • Radio check ins
  • Report writing
  • Identify and reporting safety hazards
  • Visual security presence - detect and deter unauthorized persons
  • Perform visual scan of materials for signs of vandalism
  • Control a consistent traffic flow of vehicles and personnel entering and exiting
  • Coordinating and liaising with the police or emergency personnel when required
  • Reporting security breaches
  • Adhere to Securiguard's core Values, Vision, Mission statement
  • Perform regularly scheduled site duties as required by client standard operating procedures
  • Keep consistent notes using company issued notebook
  • Frequent shift activity reporting

What would you bring:

  • Valid BC Security License or ability to obtain
  • Class 5 Driver's License with a clean driving abstract and claims history
  • Pipeline Construction Safety Training is an asset
  • First Aid Certification is an asset
  • Bear Awareness Certification is an asset
  • Must be able to pass a pre-employment drug screening test & agree not to consume drugs or alcohol while deployed
  • Must be comfortable working in a wilderness setting for extended periods of time
  • Must be able to work a 12 hour shift (day or night) and must be physically fit to work in a remote location
  • Must have open availability & be able to work morning or night shifts
  • Must have access to a vehicle

We're only accepting applications from individuals seeking full-time employment.

Securiguard is committed to maximizing employment and training opportunities for Indigenous, local and regional residents. If you identify as a member of an Indigenous community, we encourage you to self-identify in our optional screening question.

title: Hospital Security Guards - Richmond Hill Region - Full Time
description:
To:                                          All Security Personnel

From:                                    Sharlin Alpin

Date:                                     February 15, 2022

Closing Date:                     February 28, 2022

Re:                                         Job Posting

Position:                              High Profile Security Guard

Site:                                       Mackenzie Health

City:                                       10 Trench Street, Richmond Hill

Status:                                  Full-Time

Hours:                                 Rotating Continental (0700-1900/1900-0700)

Pay Rate:                             $16.98/hr

 

Are you interested in starting a career in a fast paced and growing industry? As a provider of security services to clients with complex security needs, Paladin Security Group is offering an exciting career opportunity for you to give back to your community, while developing skills for future careers. Our training programs are also a leader in the security industry, and they will help prepare you for advancements, as well as build your resume for a potential career in law enforcement.

 

Job Description:

 

  • Patrol assigned area on foot, as assigned, to ensure personal, building, and equipment security.
  • Watch for and report irregularities by completing investigations and incident reports, such as security breaches, facility and safety hazards, and emergency situations; contact emergency responders, such as police, fire, and/or ambulance personnel, as required.
  • Utilize two-way radio and computer applications for communicating site activities.
  • Sustain effective relationships with key stakeholders and provide specialized security services by enforcing rules and regulations when required.
  • Offer support to any person in need such as providing good customer service when providing a security presence, such as providing direction, responding to emergency situation involving violent individuals and injuries.
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.

 

 

 

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

 

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. Immunization Record
  2. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  3. Proficient in English (both oral and written)

 

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  3. Use of Force
  4. Report Writing
  5. Additional courses as assigned

 

 

Should you have any questions on this process, kindly contact the People and Culture Department at

hrtoronto@paladinsecurity.com

.

description:

Allied Universal is seeking Professional Security Guards  in Canada.

title: Security Coordinator - Metropolis
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

If you are looking for your next professional challenge, we have an opportunity for you! As a Security Coordinator, you will play a key role in the day-to-day operations and processes in place! We provide people with growth opportunities. 30% of our frontline employees are promoted to become part of our operation teams. Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in Burnaby now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, we have a position that will accommodate your needs and help you reach your goals. 

What's in it for you?

  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits  

  • We can guarantee 40 hours/week 

  • Uniform provided free of charge 

  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld 

  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus like Use of Force training 

What does a Security Coordinator in Burnaby do?

  • Plan, direct and ensure the smooth running of operations at the client's site 

  • Develop and implement procedures and policies for security operations 

  • Maintain protection systems for fire, theft and other disasters 

  • Ensure the availability of emergency equipment 

  • Make suggestions to improve and optimize the security service 

Qualifications to become a Security Coordinator in Burnaby

  • 1 to 3 years experience in personnel management in a unionized environment 

  • Excellent oral and written communication skills 

  • Good knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook 

  • Valid security guard license and first aid card 

  • Available to work flexible hours

title: Industrial Security Guard - $252 per day
description:
Canada's Leading Provider of Corporate Security is seeking full-time remote camp security guards for sites in the BC Interior.

Hours of work: 12-hour shifts, 14 days on 14 days off

Job overview:

Our mission at Securiguard is to make people feel safe. As a security professional, you'll be responsible for the protection of people and assets by patrolling designated areas, identifying, and reporting safety hazards and reporting security breaches, as well as completing all reporting and radio check-ins. Other duties may include monitoring CCTV and surveillance systems, responding to alarms and emergencies and controlling access to the site. You will provide excellent customer service to our clients and guests, while providing a visual security presence to deter and detect unauthorized guests.

In this role, you will be working in an industrial environment, supporting a large and exciting critical infrastructure project in a remote area. You'll be dedicated to safety and maintaining a safe work environment for all by following all safety protocols, processes and procedures, and reporting any hazards.

Candidate requirements:

  • Valid BC Security License or ability to obtain
  • Class 5 Driver's License with a clean driving abstract and claims history
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Must be able to pass a pre-employment drug screening test
  • Must be comfortable working in a wilderness setting for extended periods of time
  • Must be able to work a 12 hour shift (day or night) and must be physically fit to work in a remote location
  • Must have open availability and be able to work morning or night shifts

Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Daily & weekly overtime
  • Work Life balance
  • Extended health and dental benefits
  • Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians through TELUS Health
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS health
  • Discounts on Cineplex movie tickets and more
  • Sponsored training (including Occupational First Aid Level 1 and PCST courses)

More about Securiguard:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

At Securiguard, we believe you can make a difference - by making people feel safe, caring for the people around you and supporting your community.

Securiguard is committed to maximizing employment and training opportunities for Indigenous, local and regional residents. If you identify as a member of an Indigenous community, we encourage you to self-identify in our optional screening question.

title: Agent de sécurité, Bibliothèque et Archives nationales du Québec - Montréal
description:
Prêt à revêtir l’uniforme?

Si vous cherchez un emploi où vous impacterez le quotidien des gens, celui-ci est fait pour vous ! En tant qu'agent de sécurité à la Grande Bibliothèque à Montréal, vous jouerez un rôle clé en assurant la sécurité des employés et visiteurs!

Grâce à notre grande variété de contrats, nous avons un poste qui répondra à vos besoins et vous aidera à atteindre vos objectifs.

Qu'est-ce que vous y gagnez ?

  • Nous offrons des salaires compétitifs et des prestations de santé complètes   

  • Nous pouvons garantir 40 heures par semaine  

  • Possibilités de quarts de jour, soir ou nuit 

  • Possibilités de postes à temps plein ou à temps partiel 

  • Uniforme fourni gratuitement  

  • Opportunités de croissance avec GardaWorld  

  • Formation continue avec notre Campus GardaWorld

Que fait un agent de sécurité à la BANQ ?

  • Accueillir, informer, diriger et escorter les différents usagers et visiteurs 

  • Effectuer des rondes de patrouilles dans l'établissement 

  • Porter assistance et évacuer le bâtiment en cas d’urgence 

  • Appréhender les contrevenants et les livrer aux autorités compétentes 

  • Détecter, interpeler et éconduire les personnes indésirables 

Qualifications pour devenir un agent de sécurité?

  • Un permis d'agent de sécurité et une carte de premiers soins valides 

  • Être disponible pour travailler selon un horaire flexible  

  • Avoir un casier judiciaire vierge  

  • Être admissible à travailler au Canada

title: Security Guards: Detention Center
description:
Securiguard is currently hiring highly motivated and qualified security guards to join our team at a Detention Center, Surrey. If you are looking for intriguing and rewarding position for your career advancement, then this position is for you!

Who we are:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost 50 years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solutions provider. That is how we have become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea, our team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.


Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Free Uniforms and Equipment
  • Paid training
  • Advanced Security Training (AST), Occupational First Aid (OFA) and class 4 (driver's license) training to eligible candidates
  • Health and Dental Benefits (no waiting period)
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS Babylon. Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians
  • Recognition Programs & Events

Signing Bonus: Candidates with valid AST are eligible for $200 signing bonus after successful completion of 3 months of employment (Conditions apply)


What you would do:

  • Overseeing the care, custody, and control of detained persons being held for Immigration
  • Working with CBSA, Correction Facilities, and police agencies to ensure the safe and secure transport of detainees
  • Admitting and discharging detainees confirming, documenting, and ensuring detainee's personal property and valuables are safe
  • Observing and conducting regular searches of detainees, cells, and property
  • Access Control of the facility including the inflow of people, goods, and information
  • Monitoring CCTV activity throughout the facility and controlling all movement of people
  • Reporting all incidents or issues in a quick and efficient manner

What you would bring:

  • Valid BC Security License
  • Security Experience- 6 months (asset)
  • OFA-1 (asset)
  • Class 5 Drivers License & Clean Abstract
  • Completion of Grade 12 or equivalent
  • Permanent Resident Card or Canadian Citizenship
  • Must be able to work 12 hours on a rotating schedule (4 days on 3 days off)

Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer, and we value the diversity of our staff. We are committed to building a facilitative environment of respect, inclusiveness, and career growth.

title: Security Guard
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

GardaWorld is the world’s largest privately owned security services company, offering cash services, physical and specialized security solutions. We protect our clients’ staff and assets, wherever they are in the world.

We are looking for security guards to fulfill different assignments for our clients.

What you’ll be doing

  • Ensure the protection of people, assets and property
  • Monitor access of entryways and exit points using equipment at your disposal
  • Conduct preventive surveillance rounds according to established procedures
  • Provide impeccable customer service
  • Prevent fire, theft and vandalism
  • Verify and inspect safety equipment
  • Enforce the regulations in effect at your client's premises
  • Write daily reports and incident reports

What we offer

  • Competitive wages 
  • Complete uniform
  • Diverse work assignements
  • Career development and advancement, and training opportunities

What we’re looking for

  • Valid Security Guard licence AND valid standard first aid & CPR
  • Professional deportment
  • Proactive, attention-to-detail, self-motivated, team player 
  • Above average written and oral communication skills
  • High school diploma or equivalent (asset)
  • Driver’s licence and access to a vehicle (asset)
  • Previous experience in security (asset)

title: Security Guard for a High Profile Site - OFA2
description:
Securiguard is currently looking for highly motivated and hard-working individuals to work at a high-profile corporate office site in Downtown Vancouver. If you have an OFA-2 certification, security experience in a similar role, and open availability, we'd love to hear from you.

What you would do:

  • Providing excellent customer service to both the client and guests
  • OFA2 response for all first aid incidents
  • Security desk duties including CCTV monitoring
  • Administration and issuance of access badges
  • Contractor/guest access control
  • Responding to client requests
  • Responding to emergency service requests
  • Patrolling duties including regular building patrols, inspections of data server rooms and temperature gauge monitoring.
  • Report writing

What would you bring:

  • Valid BC security license
  • OFA-2 certificate
  • 1-2 years of security experience is an asset
  • Excellent customer service and communication skills
  • Professional deportment and accountability
  • Requires basic computer skills and an ability to use systems such as Microsoft Office Suite

Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Paid Training
  • Flexible Schedules & Work life balance
  • Extended Health and Dental Benefits
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS Babylon
  • Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians
  • Access to a robust corporate discount program, Perkopolis
  • Discounted cineplex movie tickets
  • Discounts for an Annual Grouse Mountain Gondola Pass

Who we are:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

At Securiguard, we believe you can make a difference - by making people feel safe, caring for the people around you and supporting your community.

Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer and we are proud of inclusive workplace culture. In 2021, Securiguard was a winner of Canada's Most Admired Culture Culture and listed as a finalist in Canada's HR Awards for excellence in diversity and inclusion. Join our amazing team.

title: Security Guard - Lambton College - Parking - Part Time - Sarnia
description:
To:                                      All Security Personnel

From:                                 People & Culture Coordinator

Date:                                  February 28, 2022

Closing Date:                    March 4, 2022

Re:                                     Job Posting

Position:                            Security Guard  

Site:                                    Lambton College – Parking

City:                                    Sarnia

Status:                                Part Time (2 positions)

Hours:                                Various Hours (0800-1730/0800-1815)

Pay Rate:                            $15.00

Position Overview:

Working assigned shifts, you will be responsible for completing written reports.  You will be expected to perform constant patrols and interact with students, staff and members of the public to provide direction and promote good customer service while providing a security presence.

Essential Job Functions:

  • Implement security measures to protect property, control access to sites, patrol assigned areas and ensure client rules and regulations are followed.
  • Maintain written reports.
  • Perform security checks and liaise with visitors, customers, and the public.
  • Communicates any concerns/issues with Branch Manager

 

Job Requirements:

  • Physical Demands include excessive walking and standing.
  • Patrol assigned area on foot, as assigned, to ensure personal, building, and equipment security.
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy.
  • Must have customer service-oriented attitude.
  • Utilize two-way radio and computer applications for communicating site activities.
  • Watch for and report irregularities by completing investigations and incident reports, such as security breaches, facility and safety hazards, and emergency situations; contact emergency responders, such as police, fire, and/or ambulance personnel, as required.
  • Sustain effective relationships with key stakeholders and provide specialized security services by enforcing rules and regulations when required.
  • Offer support to any person in need such as providing good customer service when providing a security presence, such as providing direction, responding to emergency situation involving violent individuals and injuries.
  • Foot patrols as well as Kubota vehicle patrols of onsite parking lots
  • Enforcement of parking regulations up to and including ticketing.
  • Customer service and providing direction to students, staff and visitors
  • Ability to operate a handheld computer device
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.

 

 Security Guards at the site are required to complete a Drug & Alcohol test for incidents that occur on client property.

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. Immunization Record
  2. Double Vaccination
  3. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  4. A valid Driver’s License
  5. A clean driver’s abstract
  6. Proficient in English (both oral and written)

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  3. Use of Force
  4. Report Writing
  5. Additional courses as assigned

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

 

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those applicants that are short listed will be contacted for an interview.

Should you have any questions on this process, please contact LeeAnne Feddes, People and Culture Coordinator at

lfeddes@paladinsecurity.com

.

title: Industrial Security Guard - $252 per day
description:
Canada's Leading Provider of Corporate Security is seeking full-time security guards for an industrial site in Valemount.

Hours of work: 12-hour shifts, 14 days on 14 days off

Job overview:

Our mission at Securiguard is to make people feel safe. As a security professional, you'll be responsible for the protection of people and assets by patrolling designated areas, identifying, and reporting safety hazards and reporting security breaches, as well as completing all reporting and radio check-ins. Other duties may include monitoring CCTV and surveillance systems, responding to alarms and emergencies and controlling access to the site. You will provide excellent customer service to our clients and guests, while providing a visual security presence to deter and detect unauthorized guests.

In this role, you will be working in an industrial environment, supporting a large and exciting critical infrastructure project in a remote area. You'll be dedicated to safety and maintaining a safe work environment for all by following all safety protocols, processes and procedures, and reporting any hazards.

Candidate requirements:

  • Valid BC Security License or ability to obtain
  • Class 5 Driver's License with a clean driving abstract and claims history
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Must be able to pass a pre-employment drug screening test
  • Must be comfortable working in a wilderness setting for extended periods of time
  • Must be able to work a 12 hour shift (day or night) and must be physically fit to work in a remote location
  • Must have open availability and be able to work morning or night shifts

Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Daily & weekly overtime
  • Work Life balance
  • Extended health and dental benefits
  • Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians through TELUS Health
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS health
  • Discounts on Cineplex movie tickets and more
  • Sponsored training (including Occupational First Aid Level 1 and PCST courses)

More about Securiguard:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

At Securiguard, we believe you can make a difference - by making people feel safe, caring for the people around you and supporting your community.

Securiguard is committed to maximizing employment and training opportunities for Indigenous, local and regional residents. If you identify as a member of an Indigenous community, we encourage you to self-identify in our optional screening question.

title: Security Guard, Industrial
description:
As a security guard in the industrial sector, you will play a key role in ensuring the safety of workers for some of the biggest brands out there!  We’re growing our ranks in Fort McMurray now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, we have a position that will accommodate your needs and help you reach your goals.

 

 

What’s in it for you? 

  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits
  • We can guarantee full time employment
  • Uniform provided free of charge
  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus like Use of Force training

 

 

What does a Security Guard in Fort McMurray do?

  • Manage access control as well as badging through computer system
  • Camera surveillance of access gates and parking barriers
  • Greet customers and register visitors as needed
  • Act as a first responder in the event of a crisis or emergency
  • Perform daily reports and incident reports
  • Perform surveillance rounds with multiple foot patrols of grounds and facilities, including climbing multiple sets of stairs safely
  • Unlock and lock certain areas during monitoring rounds and via Lenel systems
  • Pedestrian bag searches and vehicle searches
  • Working in all types of seasonal weather conditions including dry dusty weather conditions and cold winter temperatures. 

 

 

Qualifications to become a Security Guard with Garda Fort McMurray Branch  

  • Valid Alberta Security Guard licence**Picture must be included with resume
  • Valid Class 5 Drivers License (NON-GDL)**Picture must be included with resume
  • 3-year clear Drivers Abstract
  • Valid Standard First Aid with AED and CPR - Level C
  • CSO or BSO or OSSA and CSTS
  • Wildlife Awareness and Fit Testing (training provided)
  • Pass drug and alcohol test
  • Security experience considered an asset
  • Comfortable working on a computer (data entry and Microsoft office Suites)
  • At ease working as a team and offering excellent customer service
  • 24/7 availability
  • Must reside within Fort McMurray
  • Must be a Canadian citizen or landed immigrant

 

Start your career journey with GardaWorld today, apply online or email your resume to

marsha.hutchings-campbell@garda.com

Other duties may include responding to alarms and emergencies and controlling access to the site. You will provide excellent customer service to our clients and guests, while providing a visual security presence to deter and detect unauthorized guests.

  • Valid BC Security License
  • Pride in delivering outstanding customer service
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Comfort with radio communication
  • Ability to write reports on job-related activities
  • Keen eye for observing exterior and interior premises
  • A listening mindset
  • Capable of standing for a duration of 8 hours

Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Paid Training

title: Agent de sécurité, Sherbrooke
description:
Prêt à revêtir l’uniforme?

Vous êtes à la recherche d'un emploi qui vous permettrait de développer vos compétences?  Nous avons l’emploi qu’il vous faut!

Plus qu'un emploi - 26% de nos employés corporatifs chez GardaWorld ont commencé comme employés de première ligne. Si vous avez l'esprit d'entreprise et que vous êtes ambitieux, ce pourrait être le début de votre carrière chez GardaWorld !  

Malgré les défis de la dernière année, nous élargissons nos rangs à Sherbrooke maintenant plus que jamais ! Grâce à notre grande variété de contrats, vous pouvez être sûr que nous avons un poste qui répondra à vos besoins et à vos objectifs. Rejoignez notre équipe de professionnels dévoués et hautement qualifiés !  

Qu'est-ce que vous y gagnez en tant qu'agent de sécurité à Sherbrooke?

  • Nous offrons des salaires compétitifs et des prestations de santé complètes  

  • Nous pouvons garantir 40 heures par semaine  

  • Uniforme fourni gratuitement  

  • Possibilités d'avancement dans le domaine de la sécurité ou au siège social.  

  • Opportunités de croissance au sein de GardaWorld  

  • Formation continue avec notre Campus GardaWorld, comme emploi de la force 

Que fait un agent de sécurité à Sherbrooke ?

  • Assurer la protection des personnes, des biens et des propriétés.  

  • Surveiller l'accès aux entrées et aux sorties  

  • Effectuer des rondes de surveillance préventive   

  • Assurer le contact avec les autorités et les services d'urgence  

Qualifications pour devenir un agent de sécurité à Sherbrooke ?

  • Une licence d'agent de sécurité et une carte de premiers secours valide 

  • Être disponible pour travailler selon des horaires flexibles  

  • Avoir un casier judiciaire vierge  

  • Être admissible à travailler au Canada  
     

Intéressé par ce défi ? Envoyer votre CV dès maintenant à felicia.pupo@garda.com

 

SSEST

title: Security Guards- New to Security?
description:
Are you passionate about making people feel safe and providing excellent customer service? If so, then this is the perfect opportunity for those that need an entry level position to gain basic security professional skills!

Securiguard is currently hiring for F/T, P/T, and On-call job opportunities. We invite you to come and explore a future with us!


Who we are:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea their team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.


Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Sponsorships to obtain a BC Security License (conditions apply)
  • Free Uniforms
  • Paid Training
  • Health and Dental Benefits (subject to benefit waiting period)
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS Babylon. Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians (subject to waiting period)
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Recognition Programs & Events

What would you bring:

  • Valid BC Security License (or willing to obtain)
  • Take pride in delivering outstanding customer service
  • Have excellent communication skills
  • Be comfortable with radio communication
  • Be able to write reports
  • Have a keen eye for observing exterior and interior premises
  • Approach a situation with a listening mindset
  • Be capable of standing for a duration of 8 hours
  • Class 5 Drivers License is an asset

Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer, and we value the diversity of our staff. We are committed to building a facilitative environment of respect, inclusiveness, and career growth.

title: Security Guard - Elgin County Courthouse - St. Thomas - Full Time
description:
To:                                       All Security Personnel

From:                                  LeeAnne Feddes, People & Culture Coordinator

Date:                                   February 22, 2022

Closing Date:                     February 28, 2022

Re:                                      Job Posting

Position:                             Security Guard (Start Date - April 1, 2022)

Site:                                     Elgin County Courthouse – 4 Wellington St., St Thomas, ON

City:                                     St Thomas, Ontario

Status:                                 Full Time

Hours:                                  Sunday to Thursday (2359-0800hrs)

Pay Rate:                             $15.67/hr.

Position Overview:

  • Implement security measures to protect property, control access to sites, patrol assigned areas to monitor activities and ensure client rules and regulations are followed.
  • Ensure safety and emergency procedures are followed and maintain written reports.
  • Direct visitors to appropriate areas, perform security checks, and liaise with visitors, customers and the public.
  • Maintaining a positive, productive work environment through collaboration.
  • Support security measures relative to courthouse access policies in accordance with COVID19 protocols
  • Ensure safety and emergency procedures are followed
  • Maintaining a positive, productive work environment through collaboration.
  • Monitor CCTV and Access Control systems
  • Foot Patrols
 

Preferred skills/qualifications:

  • Valid Ontario Security Guard licence (required)
  • Valid St Thomas Police Security Clearance (required – completed internally)
  • Valid First Aid & CPR certificate
  • In this role, it is essential that you maintain integrity, clear written and oral communication skills, and maintain a high standard of customer service.

Essential Job Functions:

  • Be courteous and cooperative with a high quality of customer service.
  • Good interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively at various social levels and across diverse cultures.
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Communicates any concerns/issues with Operations Manager.

Requirements:

  • Working knowledge of the Trespass to Property Act.
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Excellent communication skills with a focus on customer service
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills. Ability to write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy.
  • Patrol assigned area on foot, as assigned, to ensure personal, building, and equipment security.
  • Sustain effective relationships with key stakeholders and provide specialized security services by enforcing rules and regulations when required.
  • Offer support to any person in need such as providing good customer service when providing a security presence, such as providing direction, responding to emergency situation involving violent individuals and injuries.
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned. 

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  2. Proficient in English (both oral and written)

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Fully Vaccinated 
  3. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  4. Use of Force
  5. Report Writing
  6. Additional courses as assigned

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned

Should you have any questions on this process, kindly contact LeeAnne Feddes, People & Culture Coordinator at

lfeddes@paladinsecurity.com

.

title: Security Guard, Industrial
description:
If you are seeking a job where you have important responsibilities, this one is for you! As a security guard in the industrial sector, you will play a key role in ensuring the safety of workers for some of the biggest brands out there!

We’re growing our ranks in Fort McMurray, now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, we have a position that will accommodate your needs and help you reach your goals. Currently seeking full-time security guards for our industrial projects.  

What's in it for you?

  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits
  • We can guarantee full-time employment
  • Uniform provided 
  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld
  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus like Use of Force training

What does a Security Guard in Fort McMurray do?

  • Manage access control, badging through the computer system
  • Camera surveillance for access/egress points of people, material, and equipment.
  • Greet customers and register visitors as needed
  • Act as a first responder in the event of a crisis or emergency
  • Perimeter patrols, searches of camps, lay-down areas, storage facilities and Personal belonging including Vehicles, Bags etc.
  • Must be able to work in areas that have exposure to height, noise and dusty environment including seasonal exposure to extreme cold/heat.
  • Must be able to meet the physical requirements:
  • Manual dexterity,
    • Standing, walking, bending, and sitting for extended period
    • Heavy lifting up to fifty (50) lbs.
  • Ability to understand and follow all site policy and procedures.

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in Fort McMurray

  • A valid Alberta security guard license
  • Standard first aid level C
  • CSO
  • Class 5 Driver’s License, no restrictions
  • Ability to pass a Drug and Alcohol test
  • Available to work flexible hours
  • Have a clear criminal background
  • Be eligible to work in Canada

 

Start your career journey with GardaWorld today, apply online or via email: marsha.hutchings-campbell@garda.com

 SSFMAC

title: Security Guards
description:
Whether you're looking to start a new career in security services or you're a seasoned security professional, we invite you to explore a future with us.

Our mission at Securiguard is to make people feel safe. As a full-time security guard, you'll be responsible for the protection of people and assets by patrolling designated areas, identifying, and reporting safety hazards and reporting security breaches, as well as completing all reporting and radio check-ins. Other duties may include responding to alarms and emergencies and controlling access to the site. You will provide excellent customer service to our clients and guests, while providing a visual security presence to deter and detect unauthorized guests.

What you bring:

  • Valid BC Security License
  • Pride in delivering outstanding customer service
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Comfort with radio communication
  • Ability to write reports on job-related activities
  • Keen eye for observing exterior and interior premises
  • A listening mindset
  • Capable of standing for a duration of 8 hours

Availability:

  • Full Time
  • Days, Afternoons, Overnights
  • Weekdays and Weekends

Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Paid Training
  • Flexible Schedules & Work life balance
  • Extended Health and Dental Benefits
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS Babylon
  • Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians
  • Access to a robust corporate discount program, Perkopolis
  • Discounted cineplex movie tickets
  • Discounts for an Annual Grouse Mountain Gondola Pass

Who we are:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

At Securiguard, we believe you can make a difference - by making people feel safe, caring for the people around you and supporting your community.

Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer and we are proud of inclusive workplace culture. In 2021, Securiguard was a winner of Canada's Most Admired Culture Culture and listed as a finalist in Canada's HR Awards for excellence in diversity and inclusion. Join our amazing team and help make people feel safe.

  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Excellent communication skills with a focus on customer service
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills. Ability to write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy.
  • Patrol assigned area on foot, as assigned, to ensure personal, building, and equipment security.
  • Sustain effective relationships with key stakeholders and provide specialized security services by enforcing rules and regulations when required.
  • Offer support to any person in need such as providing good customer service when providing a security presence, such as providing direction, responding to emergency situation involving violent individuals and injuries.
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned. 

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

 

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  2. Proficient in English (both oral and written)

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Fully Vaccinated
  3. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  4. Use of Force
  5. Report Writing
  6. Additional courses as assigned

 

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned

Should you have any questions on this process, kindly contact LeeAnne Feddes, People & Culture Coordinator at

lfeddes@paladinsecurity.com
