title: Industrial Security Guard - $252 per day
description:
Canada's Leading Provider of Corporate Security is seeking full-time Industrial Security Guards for a site based in Clearwater.

If you are looking for a stimulating and rewarding entry level position with great potential for career advancement in corporate security and asset protection, this role is for you.

Hours of work: 12-hour shifts, 14 days on 14 days off

Job overview:

Our mission at Securiguard is to make people feel safe. As a security professional, you'll be responsible for the protection of people and assets by patrolling designated areas, identifying, and reporting safety hazards and reporting security breaches, as well as completing all reporting and radio check-ins. Other duties may include monitoring CCTV and surveillance systems, responding to alarms and emergencies and controlling access to the site. You will provide excellent customer service to our clients and guests, while providing a visual security presence to deter and detect unauthorized guests.

In this role, you will be working in an industrial environment, supporting a large and exciting critical infrastructure project in a remote area. You'll be dedicated to safety and maintaining a safe work environment for all by following all safety protocols, processes and procedures, and reporting any hazards.

Candidate requirements:

  • Valid BC Security License or ability to obtain
  • Class 5 Driver's License with a clean driving abstract and claims history
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Must be able to pass a pre-employment drug screening test
  • Must be comfortable working in a wilderness setting for extended periods of time
  • Must be able to work a 12 hour shift (day or night) and must be physically fit to work in a remote location
  • Must have open availability and be able to work morning or night shifts

Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Daily & weekly overtime
  • Work Life balance
  • Extended health and dental benefits
  • Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians through TELUS Health
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS health
  • Discounts on Cineplex movie tickets and more
  • Sponsored training (including Basic Security Training, Occupational First Aid Level 1 and PCST courses)

More about Securiguard:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

At Securiguard, we believe you can make a difference - by making people feel safe, caring for the people around you and supporting your community.

Securiguard is committed to maximizing employment and training opportunities for Indigenous, local and regional residents. If you identify as a member of an Indigenous community, we encourage you to self-identify in our optional screening question.

title: Agent de sécurité, SQDC Chibougamau
description:
Prêt à revêtir l’uniforme?

Plus qu'un emploi - 26% de nos employés corporatifs chez GardaWorld ont commencé comme employés de première ligne. Si vous avez l'esprit d'entreprise et que vous êtes ambitieux, ce pourrait être le début de votre carrière chez GardaWorld !  

 

Malgré les défis de la dernière année, nous élargissons nos rangs dans Chibougamau maintenant plus que jamais ! Grâce à notre grande variété de contrats, vous pouvez être sûr que nous avons un poste qui répondra à vos besoins et à vos objectifs. Rejoignez notre équipe de professionnels dévoués et hautement qualifiés !  

Qu'est-ce que vous y gagnez ?

  • Nous offrons des salaires compétitifs et des prestations de santé complètes  

  • Uniforme fourni gratuitement    

  • Opportunités de croissance au sein de GardaWorld  

  • Formation d'agent de sécurité offerte gratuitement 

Que fait un agent de sécurité à la SQDC ?

• Assurer la sécurité des employés, des clients et des biens de la SQDC;
• Prévenir les agressions verbales et physiques ainsi que les vols à main armée en demeurant bien visible en succursale et appliquant les procédures s’y rattachant;
• S’assurer que des clients qui désirent accéder à la succursale sont majeurs en vérifiant les pièces d’identité acceptées par la SQDC;
• Assurer une surveillance extérieure et intérieure des lieux, notamment en effectuant des rondes;
• Identifier les individus à risque (intoxiqué, agressif, mineur, etc.) et assurer une présence auprès d’eux afin de prévenir tout incident;
• Assurer une surveillance auprès des clients qui sont en état d’ébriété. S’il y a lieu, et avec l’autorisation de la direction de succursale, les amener à quitter la succursale;

Qualifications pour devenir un agent de sécurité?

  • Être admissible à l'obtention d'un permis d'agent de sécurité et d'une carte de premiers secours valide 

  • Être disponible pour travailler selon des horaires flexibles  

  • Avoir un casier judiciaire vierge  

  • Être admissible à travailler au Canada

Type (F/T or Contract): Full Time
City: Mississauga, ON


Report Location: Creekside (Onsite / No Remote Access)
Hours: 9:00 am to 5:00 pm (Monday to Friday)

 


Job Description/Accountabilities:

 


The Physical Security Risk Technologies (PSRT) Operator will support the business with troubleshooting and generating Security related service tickets. This role provides the successful candidate with the opportunity to exercise technical, analytical and relationship management skills. The PSRT Operator will interact with multiple stakeholders across the bank and various outside vendors.

 


Responsibilities:
â€¢ Works in the Incident Reporting Centre (IRC) to administer and provide triage for all physical security risk technology (PSRT) service tickets for retail, corporate and other locations as required
â€¢ Work with technical staff, business and/or vendor to troubleshoot equipment deficiencies and triage issues prior to placing service calls
â€¢ Appropriately reviews and responds to any Security System or Security device failures reported to the IRC in a timely manner based on severity of the failure and impact to TD Bank
â€¢ Monitor and follow security vendor activities related to service calls to close
â€¢ Enter information on service requests into the data repository and generate reports as needed
â€¢ Work closely with the PSRT Team and various Security vendors to troubleshoot and assist with Security Device issues or problems
â€¢ Liaise with members of PSRT and GSI to review and flag potential trends or issues with Security Devices
Job Requirements:
â€¢ Minimum 2 years' experience in security industry within an organization of similar size
â€¢ Strong Customer service and communication skills
â€¢ Expert skills and demonstrated expertise in MS Excel, MS Access, Visio, PowerPoint
â€¢ Excellent oral and written communication skills
â€¢ Sound knowledge of risk technology equipment (alarm systems, access control and CCTV systems)
â€¢ Highly motivated individual with willingness to take initiative and propose pragmatic solutions to complex challenges and issues
â€¢ Ability to work both independently and as part of a team, think critically and make decisions
â€¢ Ability to manage high volumes of work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities
â€¢ Ability to prioritize tasks while working with competing priorities
â€¢ Ability to collaborate in and support a team environment
â€¢ Ability to work independently
â€¢ Ability to plan and successfully complete tasks within specified timelines
â€¢ Works effectively in a team environment and be able to interact with all levels of personnel from various functional areas
â€¢ Well-developed organizational awareness and business acumen


Education/Accreditations:
College/University degree in business, IT, engineering and/or relevant equivalent experience


Hours/Availability Detail:
â€¢ 8-hour shifts â€“ Monday to Friday 9:00 am to 5:00 pm
â€¢ Must be able to work onsite in Mississauga, Ontario

Closing:

Allied Universal ®  provides unparalleled service, systems and solutions to the people and business of our communities, and is North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider. Allied Universal delivers high-quality, tailored solutions, which allows clients to focus on their core business. For more information:  www.AUSecurity.ca.

title: Security Guard, University Campus
description:
We are looking for Full Time and Part Time Security Guards to work at a university located in St. Catharines. Your primary role is to ensure the safety and security of our client’s tenants, visitors and assets in a professional and courteous manner. You will enjoy regular and diverse interactions with the public, while also being expected to maintain the highest degree of professionalism and customer service. It is continental rotation based shifts with the hourly pay rate being $15.30. Post completion of 6 months, the rate increases to $16.32

 

Garda Hamilton Branch is open for Walk in interviews every Thursdayfrom 10 am to 3 pm at 54 Centennial Pkwy N, Hamilton. Please ensure you have the following documents and dress business casual: 

  • Updated Resume 
  • Valid Security License 
  • Valid First Aid CPR 

 

In the event you are hired on the spot, please be prepared to spend 15 minutes to an hour for documentations and uniforming. 

What does a Security Guard in St. Catharines do?

  • Interior and exterior patrols
  • Locking and unlocking doors
  • Assisting staff and students on campus
  • Access control, security escorts, service call response and report writing
  • Property inspections and enforcement of property laws, client rules, and other regulations                    
  • Assist in the event of an emergency, first aid or any other intervention                  
  • Interact with students, visitors, customers and the general public on a regular basis
  • Maintain social distancing
  • Detect, challenge and displace unwanted people    
  • Evacuate the building in case of emergency
  • Maintain a positive, productive work environment through teamwork                                                                         

What’s in it for you?

  • Competitive wages
  • Diverse benefits plan
  • Opportunity for advancement in the security industry
  • Full uniform

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in St. Catharines?

  • Previous experience in the security industry
  • Valid Provincial Security Guard license
  • Valid G license and a clean abstract a must
  • Valid First Aid and CPR C, AED certification  
  • Must be completely vaccinated
  • Good verbal and written communication skills
  • Customer service oriented
  • Leadership and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Vulnerable Sector Check Clearance required 

 

Interested? Apply online or you can send your resume to palak.soni@garda.com

title: Security Guards: Detention Center
description:
Securiguard is currently hiring highly motivated and qualified security guards to join our team at a Detention Center, Surrey. If you are looking for intriguing and rewarding position for your career advancement, then this position is for you!

Who we are:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea their team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.


Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Free Uniforms and Equipment
  • Paid training
  • Advanced Security Training (AST), Occupational First Aid (OFA) and class 4 (driver's license) training to eligible candidates
  • Health and Dental Benefits (no waiting period)
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS Babylon. Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians
  • Recognition Programs & Events

Signing Bonus: Candidates with valid AST are eligible for $200 signing bonus after successful completion of 3 months of employment (Conditions apply)


What would you do:

  • Overseeing the care, custody, and control of detained persons being held for Immigration
  • Working with CBSA, Correction Facilities, and police agencies to ensure the safe and secure transport of detainees
  • Admitting and discharging detainees confirming, documenting, and ensuring detainee's personal property and valuables are safe
  • Observing and conducting regular searches of detainees, cells, and property
  • Access Control of the facility including the inflow of people, goods, and information
  • Monitoring CCTV activity throughout the facility and controlling all movement of people
  • Reporting all incidents or issues in a quick and efficient manner

What would you bring:

  • Valid BC Security License
  • Security Experience- 6 months (asset)
  • OFA-1 (asset)
  • Class 5 Drivers License & Clean Abstract
  • Completion of Grade 12 or equivalent
  • Permanent Resident Card or Canadian Citizenship
  • Must be able to work 12 hours on a rotating schedule (4 days on 3 days off)

Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer, and we value the diversity of our staff. We are committed to building a facilitative environment of respect, inclusiveness, and career growth.

title: High Profile Security Guard
description:
More than a job – 26% of our corporate employees at GardaWorld Canada started as frontline employees. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset and you’re ambitious, this could be just the beginning of your career journey with GardaWorld!

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in Edmonton, Alberta now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, you can be sure that we have a position that can fill your needs and goals. Join our team of dedicated and highly qualified professionals! If you are interested in a fulfilling career in a one of a kind premium high profile site, you have picked the right position!

 

 

What you'll be doin

  • Providing uniformed, physical security to our client and its customers/visitors
  • Interior and exterior patrols
  • Conducting daily functions of the security unit including access control, security escorts, responding to calls for service and report writing/note taking 
  • Performing property inspections and enforce property laws, client rules, and other regulations
  • Provide keys and temporary pass to visitors/employees
  • Liaising with visitors, customers. and the general public on a consistent basis
  • Providing customer service information and assist in handling the questions of visitors
  • Maintaining a positive, productive work environment through positive teamwork

What we offer:

  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits
  • We can guarantee 40 hours/week
  • Uniform provided free of charge
  • Career advancement opportunities in the security field or within the head office
  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld
  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus
  • Corporate discounts

What we’re looking for

  • Good verbal and written communication skills – English is required; French is an asset
  • Valid Alberta Security Guard license
  •  Strong computer skills
  •  Customer service oriented
  •  Security clearance reliability
  •  Must be available any day of the week for 12 hour rotational shifts either days or nights 
  •  Leadership and problem-solving skills
  •  Ability to work in a stressful environment
  • Removal on unauthorized individuals
  • Ability to stand on foot and walk for long periods of time
  • Candidates must have two (2) years of security guard experience 

We thank all applicants for applying. Those who are selected will be contacted for further procedure.

title: Security Guard - Formet Industries - Part time - St. Thomas
description:
Are you interested in starting a career in a fast paced and growing industry? As a provider of security services to clients with complex security needs, Paladin Security Group is offering an exciting career opportunity for you to give back to your community, while developing skills for future careers. Our training programs are also a leader in the security industry, and they will help prepare you for advancements, as well as build your resume for a potential career in law enforcement.

Position Overview:

The facility adheres to US Homeland Security CTPAT (Customs Trade Partnership Against Terrorism) program access control including inbound and outbound shipments, visitors and contractors. The guard will be required to work outdoors in all weather conditions inspecting and logging truck traffic and completing patrols.

Experience with CTPAT would be an asset. Excellent communication skills with a focus on customer service along with good computer abilities are all core requirements.

Duties include but are not limited to: CTPAT Procedures, Weigh Scale Operation, Covid Screening, Access Control, Monitor Security Systems, Conduct Security Patrols, Respond to Emergency Situations.

 

The applicant must possess the following:

  • Be courteous and cooperative with a high quality of customer service
  • Good interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively at various social levels and across diverse cultures
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Write clear, concise and legible reports

Preferred skills/qualifications:

  • Valid Ontario Security Guard licence (required)
  • Full Covid Vaccine
  • Valid First Aid & CPR certificate
  • Microsoft Office experience

Essential Job Functions:

  • Be courteous and cooperative with a high quality of customer service.
  • Good interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively at various social levels and across diverse cultures.
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Communicates any concerns/issues with Operations Manager.

Requirements:

  • Working knowledge of the Trespass to Property Act.
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Excellent communication skills with a focus on customer service along with good computer abilities are all core requirements.
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills. Ability to write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy.
  • Patrol assigned area on foot, as assigned, to ensure personal, building, and equipment security.
  • Watch for and report irregularities by completing investigations and incident reports, such as security breaches, facility and safety hazards, and emergency situations; contact emergency responders, such as police, fire, and/or ambulance personnel, as required.
  • Sustain effective relationships with key stakeholders and provide specialized security services by enforcing rules and regulations when required.
  • Offer support to any person in need such as providing good customer service when providing a security presence, such as providing direction, responding to emergency situation involving violent individuals and injuries.
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  2. Full Covid-19 Vaccination Records
  3. Proficient in English (both oral and written)

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  3. Use of Force
  4. Report Writing
  5. Additional courses as assigned

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned

Should you have any questions on this process, kindly contact LeeAnne Feddes, People & Culture Coordinator at

lfeddes@paladinsecurity.com

.

title: High Profile Industrial Security Guard
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

If you are seeking a job where you have important responsibilities, this one is for you! As a security guard in the industrial sector, you will play a key role in ensuring the safety of workers for some of the biggest brands out there! 

We provide people with growth opportunities. 30% of our frontline employees are promoted to become part of our operation teams. 

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in Hardisty now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, we have a position that will accommodate your needs and help you reach your goals. 

What's in it for you?

  • We offer competitive wages starting at $19/hr  & comprehensive health benefits  

  • We can guarantee 40 hours/week 

  • Uniform provided free of charge 

  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld 

  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus 

  • Corporate Discounts

What does a Security Guard in Hardisty do?

Manage access as well as access cards through the computer system 

  • Access control at gates

  • Making ID cards

  • Parking lot patrols

  • Greet customers and register visitors as needed 

  • Act as a first responder in the event of a crisis or emergency  

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in Hardisty

  • A valid Alberta security guard license and first aid card 

  • Available to work flexible hours 12 hour shifts

  • Have a clear criminal background 

  • Some sites require a N95 mask to be fit tested, which will require no facial hair for those working on site. Please note, if you are unable to remove your facial hair, you will not be selected for this site

  • Excellent customer service and communication skills

  • Be eligible to work in Canada

title: On-Call Security Guards
description:
Securiguard is currently hiring for licensed on-call Security Guards for our sites across Victoria, Vancouver Island. We have a range of site options and offer flexibility in scheduling. Come join one of the fastest-growing security companies in Western Canada and be part of our commitment to our community to making people feel safe!


Who we are:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea their team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.


Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Free Uniforms
  • Paid Training
  • Health and Dental Benefits (subject to benefit waiting period)
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS Babylon. Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians (subject to waiting period)
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Recognition Programs & Events

What would you bring:

  • A valid BC Security Workers License
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Comfortable with radio communication
  • Pride in delivering outstanding customer service
  • Ability to write reports on job-related activities/ incidents
  • Keen eye for observing exterior and interior premises
  • Ability to provide building access control
  • Approaches a situation with a listening mindset
  • Capable of standing for a duration of 8 hours
  • OFA-1 and Class 5 BC Driver License is a bonus!

Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer, and we value the diversity of our staff. We are committed to building a facilitative environment of respect, inclusiveness, and career growth.

title: St. Clair College - Centre of Arts - Security Guard - Supervisor - Full Time
description:
Are you interested in starting a career in a fast paced and growing industry? As a provider of security services to clients with complex security needs, Paladin Security Group is offering an exciting career opportunity for you to give back to your community, while developing skills for future careers. Our training programs are also a leader in the security industry, and they will help prepare you for advancements, as well as build your resume for a potential career in law enforcement.

Position Overview:

In this role you will be responsible for patrolling the St. Clair Centre For The Arts site both on foot and with a security vehicle during all types of weather. The successful candidate must possess superior computer skills and the ability to diffuse difficult or emotional situations. Must be able to endure excessive walking Extensive computer knowledge.

Essential Job Functions:

  • Implement security measures to protect property, control access to sites, patrol assigned areas to monitor activities and ensure client rules and regulations are followed.
  • Maintain written reports.
  • Perform security checks and liaise with students, customers, and the public.
  • Ensure site safety and emergency procedures are followed and maintain written reports.
  • Enforce compliance to company policies and procedures.
  • First aid – be prepared to administer when required.
  • Maintaining a positive, productive work environment through collaboration.
  • Perform miscellaneous job – related duties as assigned.

Please note, students currently enrolled with St. Clair College are not eligible to apply to this position.

Job Requirements:

  • Must have a valid Ontario Security Guard License.
  • First Aid & CPR, Defib
  • Valid G Class Ontario Drivers Licence & clean Drivers Abstract
  • Post-Secondary education in law enforcement from a recognized institution or equivalent experience.
  • Physical Demands include excessive walking and standing.
  • Patrol area on foot and vehicle as assigned, to ensure personal, building, and equipment security.
  • Utilize radio and computer applications for communicating site activities.
  • Watch for and report irregularities by completing incident reports, such as security breaches, facility and safety hazards, and emergency situations; contact emergency responders, such as police, fire, and/or ambulance personnel, as required.
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills.
  • Must possess excellent computer skills.
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy.
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.

Highlights:

  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement
  • Extensive Paid Industry Training

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. Immunization Record
  2. Covid Vaccine’s Record 
  3. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  4. Proficient in English (both oral and written)

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  3. Use of Force
  4. Report Writing
  5. Additional courses as assigned

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned.

Should you have any questions on this process, please contact LeeAnne Feddes, People and Culture Coordinator at

lfeddes@paladinsecurity.com

.

title: Special Events Security Guard
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

Are you looking for a job that will take you to the heart of the action? As a security guard in the event industry, you will ensure the safety of participants and the smooth running of events. A great way to spice up your summer!

We are looking for motivated, licensed security guards to join us on a casual basis in order to work several high-profile special events throughout the warm weather months in Sudbury.  These events are pre-planned and the schedule available to you well in advance.  In addition, you will have access to pick up extra shifts at numerous other sites throughout the City on a regular basis at your own discretion. 

Pay-Rate is $16.50/Hour with potential for increases as the event season progresses. 

We provide people with growth opportunities. 30% of our frontline employees are promoted to become part of our operation teams. 

 

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in Sudbury now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, we have a position that will accommodate your needs and help you reach your goals.

What's in it for you?

  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits  
  • We can guarantee 40 hours/week 
  • Uniform provided free of charge 
  • Career advancement opportunities in the security field or within the head office 
  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld 
  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus like Use of Force training 

What does a Security Guard in Sudbury do?

  • Ensure the protection of people, assets, and property 
  • Monitor access of entryways and exit points 
  • Conduct preventive surveillance rounds  
  • Point of contact with authorities and emergency services 

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in Sudbury

  • A valid security guard license and first aid card 
  • Available to work flexible hours 
  • Have a clear criminal background 
  • Be eligible to work in Canada 
  • Smart Serve Certification (Preferred but not required)

title: High Profile Security
description:
We are currently seeking a full time Security Guard to fill a position at Londonderry Mall.

Overview Securiguard is committed to building a facilitative environment of respect and personal growth for all of our staff. We support this commitment with highly competitive compensation and benefits, comprehensive training, reliable equipment and supportive supervision as well as great opportunities for advancement, community involvement and work/life balance practices.

About Londonderry Mall:

Londonderry Mall is a two level regional Shopping Centre located in north-east Edmonton. Securiguard has been contracted to provide security at the Centre and is currently looking for a qualified Security Agent to work at this location.

Job Description:

  • Conduct regular patrols throughout the Centre.
  • Respond to calls for assistance from tenants and customers
  • Generate incident reports and maintain a daily notebook
  • Adhere to mall operating policies and procedures
  • Maintain positive relationships with tenants and customers

Experience and Education:

  • Possess a valid security license
  • Possess a valid first aid certificate
  • Possess a valid Alberta driver's license
  • Able to provide a driver's abstract (3 year history)
  • Have a minimum Grade 12 diploma or equivalent, post-secondary education is an asset.
  • Have good working knowledge of standard computer programs, including WORD and OUTLOOK
  • Additional experience and training in the field of security is an asset.
  • Experience in Security/Loss Prevention in a retail environment

Essential Skills:

  • Be in good physical condition
  • Be confident and have a positive outlook
  • Possess excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Have excellent public relations skills
  • Know when and how to use tact and diplomacy
  • Be able to apply the training that you receive
  • Be able to work independently as well as being able to contribute to the security team
  • Be able to think on your feet and deal with any situation
  • Be able to assess, prioritize and act quickly in the field
  • Be able to work rotating shifts

Additional Information/Benefits

  • Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer and we value the cultural diversity of our staff.
  • Benefits are available upon completion of qualifying period/hours.

About Us

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada. With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea their team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.

title: St. Thomas Elgin Security Guard - General Hospital - Screener - Part Time (Saturday and Sunday)
description:
Position Overview:

In this role you will work alongside hospital staff to ensure compliance of Covid Entry Protocols. Must hold a valid Ontario Security Guard Licence. All required PPE is provided, and you will be required to always wear a medical face mask.

  • Support security measures relative to hospital access policies in accordance with COVID19 protocols
  • Ensure safety and emergency procedures are followed
  • Direct visitors to appropriate areas, perform security checks, and liaise with visitors, customers, and the public.
  • Maintaining a positive, productive work environment through collaboration.

 

Preferred skills/qualifications:

  • Valid Ontario Security Guard licence (required)
  • Valid First Aid & CPR certificate
  • In this role, it is essential that you maintain integrity, clear written and oral communication skills, and maintain a high standard of customer service.

Essential Job Functions:

  • Be courteous and cooperative with a high quality of customer service.
  • Good interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively at various social levels and across diverse cultures.
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Communicates any concerns/issues with Operations Manager.

Requirements:

  • Working knowledge of the Trespass to Property Act.
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Excellent communication skills with a focus on customer service along with good computer abilities are all core requirements.
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills. Ability to write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy.
  • Patrol assigned area on foot, as assigned, to ensure personal, building, and equipment security.
  • Watch for and report irregularities by completing investigations and incident reports, such as security breaches, facility and safety hazards, and emergency situations; contact emergency responders, such as police, fire, and/or ambulance personnel, as required.
  • Sustain effective relationships with key stakeholders and provide specialized security services by enforcing rules and regulations when required.
  • Offer support to any person in need such as providing good customer service when providing a security presence, such as providing direction, responding to emergency situation involving violent individuals and injuries.
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned. 

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  2. Full Covid-19 Vaccination Records
  3. Proficient in English (both oral and written)

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  3. Use of Force
  4. Report Writing
  5. Additional courses as assigned

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned

Should you have any questions on this process, kindly contact LeeAnne Feddes, People & Culture Coordinator at

lfeddes@paladinsecurity.com

.

title: F/T Security Guard Positions - Londonderry Mall
description:
We are currently seeking a full time Security Guard to fill a position at Londonderry Mall.

Overview Securiguard is committed to building a facilitative environment of respect and personal growth for all of our staff. We support this commitment with highly competitive compensation and benefits, comprehensive training, reliable equipment and supportive supervision as well as great opportunities for advancement, community involvement and work/life balance practices.

About Londonderry Mall:

Londonderry Mall is a two level regional Shopping Centre located in north-east Edmonton. Securiguard has been contracted to provide security at the Centre and is currently looking for a qualified Security Agent to work at this location.

Job Description:

  • Conduct regular patrols throughout the Centre.
  • Respond to calls for assistance from tenants and customers
  • Generate incident reports and maintain a daily notebook
  • Adhere to mall operating policies and procedures
  • Maintain positive relationships with tenants and customers

Experience and Education:

  • Possess a valid security license
  • Possess a valid first aid certificate
  • Possess a valid Alberta driver's license
  • Able to provide a driver's abstract (3 year history)
  • Have a minimum Grade 12 diploma or equivalent, post-secondary education is an asset.
  • Have good working knowledge of standard computer programs, including WORD and OUTLOOK
  • Additional experience and training in the field of security is an asset.
  • Experience in Security/Loss Prevention in a retail environment

Essential Skills:

  • Be in good physical condition
  • Be confident and have a positive outlook
  • Possess excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Have excellent public relations skills
  • Know when and how to use tact and diplomacy
  • Be able to apply the training that you receive
  • Be able to work independently as well as being able to contribute to the security team
  • Be able to think on your feet and deal with any situation
  • Be able to assess, prioritize and act quickly in the field
  • Be able to work rotating shifts

Additional Information/Benefits

  • Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer and we value the cultural diversity of our staff.
  • Benefits are available upon completion of qualifying period/hours.

About Us

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada. With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea their team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.

title: Security Guard - St. Thomas Elgin General Hospital - Full time - Screener
description:
Position Overview:

In this role you will work alongside hospital staff to ensure compliance of Covid Entry Protocols. Must hold a valid Ontario Security Guard Licence. All required PPE is provided, and you will be required to always wear a medical face mask.

  • Support security measures relative to hospital access policies in accordance with COVID19 protocols
  • Ensure safety and emergency procedures are followed
  • Direct visitors to appropriate areas, perform security checks, and liaise with visitors, customers, and the public.
  • Maintaining a positive, productive work environment through collaboration.

Preferred skills/qualifications:

  • Valid Ontario Security Guard licence (required)
  • Valid First Aid & CPR certificate
  • In this role, it is essential that you maintain integrity, clear written and oral communication skills, and maintain a high standard of customer service.

Essential Job Functions:

  • Be courteous and cooperative with a high quality of customer service.
  • Good interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively at various social levels and across diverse cultures.
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Communicates any concerns/issues with Operations Manager.

Requirements:

  • Working knowledge of the Trespass to Property Act.
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Excellent communication skills with a focus on customer service along with good computer abilities are all core requirements.
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills. Ability to write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy.
  • Patrol assigned area on foot, as assigned, to ensure personal, building, and equipment security.
  • Watch for and report irregularities by completing investigations and incident reports, such as security breaches, facility and safety hazards, and emergency situations; contact emergency responders, such as police, fire, and/or ambulance personnel, as required.
  • Sustain effective relationships with key stakeholders and provide specialized security services by enforcing rules and regulations when required.
  • Offer support to any person in need such as providing good customer service when providing a security presence, such as providing direction, responding to emergency situation involving violent individuals and injuries.
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  2. Full Covid-19 Vaccination Records
  3. Proficient in English (both oral and written)

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  3. Use of Force
  4. Report Writing
  5. Additional courses as assigned

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

 

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned

Should you have any questions on this process, kindly contact LeeAnne Feddes, People & Culture Coordinator at

lfeddes@paladinsecurity.com

.

title: Required Concierge/ Security Guard - Condominium in Up/Midtown
description:
Overview:

We are North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider with over 300,000 phenomenal employees. At Allied Universal ®, we pride ourselves on fostering a promote from within culture. There are countless examples of individuals who began their career as Security Professionals and today hold positions on our senior leadership team. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, and vision coverage, life insurance, employee assistance programs, and more! We also offer company paid uniforms and part-time and flexible schedules!

Job Description:

We are seeking a Swing Shifts,  front desk  Concierge at condominium residential sites.

Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Emergency response to fire & life safety emergencies
  • Providing outstanding, personalized customer service
  • Operate condo building systems (report writing, daily logs, parcel logs)
  • Access control  
  • Surveillance (alarm & CCTV systems)
  • Patrolling, as required
  • Guest management, including guest parking
  • Parcel management
  • Follow site Post Orders and approved Condo Rules & Regulations  
  • Report writing (Daily & Incident) with excellent communication  
  • Proficient using Microsoft Office (Word/Excel)

 

Candidates must have:

    • Legal & valid ability to work in Canada (SIN)
    • Valid  Ontario  Security Guard license
    • Valid Standard First Aid and CPR Level C (minimum)
    • Minimum secondary school diploma/equivalence
  • Full time availability to work on Swing Shifts  
  • Benefits after probation
  • Referral Bonus
  • Free Parking available on site
Closing:

Allied Universal ®  provides unparalleled service, systems and solutions to the people and business of our communities, and is North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider. Allied Universal delivers high-quality, tailored solutions, which allows clients to focus on their core business. For more information:  www.AUSecurity.ca.

 

Requisition ID:2022-761191

title: Security Guard - Full-Time & Part-Time - St. Thomas, ON
description:
To:                                         Security Personnel

From:                                    People & Culture Department

Date:                                     February 1, 2022

Closing Date:                        Ongoing

Re:                                         Job Posting

Position:                                Security Guard

Site:                                       Various Sites

City:                                       St. Thomas

Status:                                  Casual , Part-Time, Full – Time

Hours:                                  Various Hours (12-hour schedule)

Pay Rate:                             $14.84- 18.00/hour

Are you interested in starting a career in a fast paced and growing industry? As a provider of security services to clients with complex security needs, Paladin Security Group is offering an exciting career opportunity for you to give back to your community, while developing skills for future careers. Our training programs are also a leader in the security industry, and they will help prepare you for advancements, as well as build your resume for a potential career in law enforcement.

Position Overview:

Reporting to the Branch Manager, the security guard is accountable for maintaining the security of the client site.

Essential Job Functions:

  • Excellent communication skills with a focus on customer service along with good computer abilities are all core requirements.
  • Implement security measures to protect property, control access to sites, patrol assigned areas to monitor activities and ensure client rules and regulations are followed.
  • Ensure safety and emergency procedures are followed and maintain written reports.
  • Direct visitors to appropriate areas, perform security checks, and liaise with visitors, customers, and the public.
  • Maintaining a positive, productive work environment through collaboration.
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy.

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. Immunization Record
  2. Covid Vaccines
  3. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  4. Drivers Licence 
  5. Post-Secondary Education in Law Enforcement related field an asset  
  6. Proficient in English (both oral and written)
  7. Vulnerable Sector check may be required

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  3. Use of Force
  4. Report Writing
  5. Additional courses as assigned

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned

Should you have any questions on this process, kindly contact LeeAnne Feddes, People and Culture Coordinator at

title: RICHMOND HILL FT URBACON Security Guard
description:
Overview:

We are North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider with over 300,000 phenomenal employees. At Allied Universal ®, we pride ourselves on fostering a promote from within culture. There are countless examples of individuals who began their career as Security Professionals and today hold positions on our senior leadership team. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, and vision coverage, life insurance, employee assistance programs, and more! We also offer company paid uniforms and part-time and flexible schedules!

Job Description:

Allied Universal is seeking Professional Security Guards  in Canada.    

 

FRESHERS ARE WELCOME, PAY RATE $15.00. LOCATION IS RICHMOND HILL.

 

QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS:

  • Be at least 18 years of age with high school diploma or equivalent
  • Legally entitled to work in Canada
  • Possess effective written and oral communication and interpersonal skills with ability to deal with all levels of personnel and the general public in a professional and effective manner

  • Licensing requirements are subject to province and/or local laws and regulations and will be required prior to employment.

  • As a condition of employment, employee must successfully complete a background check
  • Display exceptional customer service and communication skills
  • Have intermediate computer skills to operate innovative, wireless technology at client specific sites
  • Ability to handle crisis situations at the client site, calmly and efficiently
  • Able to:
    • Work in various environments such as cold weather, rain/snow or heat
    • Occasionally lift or carry up to 20 kilograms
    • Climb stairs, ramps, or ladders occasionally during shift
    • Stand or walk on various surfaces for long periods of time
Closing:

Allied Universal ®  provides unparalleled service, systems and solutions to the people and business of our communities, and is North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider. title: Agent de sécurité, Centre commercial de la Cité
description:
Prêt à revêtir l’uniforme?

Si vous cherchez un emploi où vous serez appelé à travailler avec le publique, celui-ci est fait pour vous ! En tant qu'agent de sécurité en centre commercial, vous jouerez un rôle clé en assurant la sécurité des travailleurs, des commerces et du public !  

Nous offrons à nos employés des possibilités d'évolution. 30% de nos employés de première ligne sont promus pour faire partie de nos équipes opérationnelles.  

Malgré les défis de la dernière année, nous élargissons nos rangs dans Québec maintenant plus que jamais ! Grâce à notre grande variété de contrats, nous avons un poste qui répondra à vos besoins et vous aidera à atteindre vos objectifs. 

Quels sont les avantages pour vous ?

  • Nous offrons des salaires compétitifs et des prestations de santé complètes   

  • Nous pouvons garantir 24 heures par semaine  

  • Uniforme fourni gratuitement  

  • Opportunités de croissance avec GardaWorld  

  • Formation continue avec notre Campus GardaWorld, comme emploi de la force 

Que fait un agent de sécurité de nuit ?

  • Faciliter l’accès des personnes autorisées aux zones d’accès restreint 

  • Patrouiller le site à pied

  • Surveiller les caméras à circuit fermé  

  • Coordonner l’intervention en cas d’incidents  

  • Répondre aux appels téléphoniques reçus par le service de sécurité 

Qualifications pour devenir un agent de sécurité?

  • Un permis d'agent de sécurité et une carte de premiers soins valides 

  • Être disponible pour travailler DE NUIT LA FIN DE SEMAINE

  • Avoir un casier judiciaire vierge  

  • Être admissible à travailler au Canada

title: Casual Security Guard Position
description:
We are currently seeking to fill Casual Security Guard Positions at a location in the area of Forestburg, AB which is about 175 kms Southeast of Edmonton, AB. Only candidates that reside in or nearby the community will be considered for the position. Candidates MUST have or be willing to obtain a security license before being hired.

Overview Securiguard is committed to building a facilitative environment of respect and personal growth for all of our staff. We support this commitment with highly competitive compensation and benefits, comprehensive training, reliable equipment and supportive supervision as well as great opportunities for advancement, community involvement and work/life balance practices.

Job Skills/Requirements The successful candidates MUST have or be willing to obtain a security license before being hired. Shifts may be either days or overnights and will most often be 12 hours in length.


Certification Requirements

Security License

Strong communication skills

First Aid/CPR

Reliable transportation a must

Must be willing to work any day or night of the week and on short notice.


Additional Information/Benefits Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer and we value the cultural diversity of our staff. We offer flexibility in scheduling to accommodate students, family caregivers and part-time personnel.


About Us

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada. With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea their team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.

title: Security Guard - CF Industries - Full Time
description:
Position Overview:

Reporting to the Security Manager and Security Supervisor, the Main Gate Security Guard is accountable for the security and safety of the Courtright Location. They must ensure all personnel entering the Courtright location has a valid site-specific safety orientation and/ or is registered appropriately upon arrival.

Essential Job Functions:

  • Maintain a professional relationship with all personnel and visitors entering the site.
  • Maintain confidence.
  • Provide security services at the Courtright CF location, maintaining order and the protection of property and employees onsite.
  • Responsible for product inbound and outbound truck scaling and shipping; Scaling transport trucks and other various trucks. Providing bills of lading and custom documents when required.
  • Responsible for communicating with the loading areas prior to scaling in a truck.
  • Scale and record all waste management shipments i.e. garbage, recycling trucks.
  • Responsible for Alarms, Fire Alarms and Access System Alarms i.e. data room alarm, lab alarms, heat sensor alarms etc.
  • Responsible for the daily testing of the Secutron Alarm System and site PA system; conducted at 12:30 hours and 19:00 hours. (Site Alarm System tested each Monday at 12:30 hours).
  • Responsible for the daily test of the CVECO radio; 07:00 hours.
  • Responsible to monitor and communicate severe weather following provided weather applications.
  • Administrative and reception duties; forward incoming calls to the appropriate department or personnel, forward hand delivered resumes to Human Resources, send out overtime meals via fax and call and confirm the order(s).
  • Greet all visitors and communicate with the appropriate location personnel upon their arrival.
  • Report all observed hazardous or unsafe conditions to the appropriate shift supervisor including communicating this information to the oncoming shift.
  • Log and report all unusual activities to the other security guards, Security Supervisor and EH&S Manager.
  • Track hourly headcount of all personnel onsite following report form.
  • Track and record all CF vehicles entering and exiting the site.
  • Responsible for tracking location upsets and start-ups following report form.
  • Conduct random site security checks i.e. vehicle inspections.
  • Conduct random security seal inspections – document.
  • In the event of an emergency situation, follow emergency response procedures and directives from Security Supervisor, Emergency Operating Center and/ or Location Field Incident Commander.
  • Act as the EOC for emergency response situations on off-hours.
  • Review and continue to educate oneself on site emergency procedures and first-aid/ CPR.
  • Responsible to administer first-aid/ CPR when required.
  • Continuously stay up to date on all CAER, US Border Agency, Canadian Government, Canadian Coast Guard regulations and law.
  • Continuously review and monitor location access and surveillance camera system. Report any unusual activity or occurrences.
  • Responsible for the activation of CAER codes
  • Responsible for activation of Everbridge notifications as directed.
  • Write informative and detailed reports (Daily, Incident, and Accident) on all security matters.
  • Responsible for access control; assists with issuing site access cards and photo IDs.
  • Assist with and the signing out and issuance of keys onsite i.e. office keys, vehicle keys.
  • Responsible for the issuance of vehicle passes onsite.
  • Responsible for Material Gate/ Personal passes onsite. Must review the pass for appropriate signatures, inspect the item(s) and sign the pass to allow item(s) to leave the Courtright location.
  • Responsible to consult with ISNetworld Application program to ensure contractor companies onsite are in compliance with insurance and WSIB requirements.
  • Any other duties assigned by the Security Supervisor, Security Manager or EH&S Manager.

Security Guards are required to complete a Drug & Alcohol test for incidents that occur on client property.

 

Requirements:

  • Must possess a valid Ontario Security Guard Licence.
  • Must possess a valid G Class Ontario Driver’s Licence.
  • Must possess a valid First Aid training certificate.
  • Must possess a valid Transportation of Dangerous Goods training certificate.
  • Must possess a Law and Security/ Police Foundations or equivalent diploma or CPO certificate.
  • Demonstrate knowledge of safety and environmental regulations and issues.
  • Strong attention to detail with high focus on accuracy.
  • Strong communication skills both written and verbal.
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills.
  • Demonstrate the ability to work safely and in compliance with site safety, health and environmental standards and practices.
  • Demonstrate leadership capabilities.
  • Strong analytical and decision-making abilities.
  • Ability to deal effectively and diplomatically with employees, contractors, visitors etc.
  • Working knowledge of the Trespass to Property Act and Mental Health Act.
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy.
  • Patrol assigned area on foot, as assigned, to ensure personal, building, and equipment security.
  • Watch for and report irregularities by completing investigations and incident reports, such as security breaches, facility and safety hazards, and emergency situations; contact emergency responders, such as police, fire, and/or ambulance personnel, as required.
  • Utilize two-way radio and computer applications for communicating site activities.
  • Sustain effective relationships with key stakeholders and provide specialized security services by enforcing rules and regulations when required.
  • Offer support to any person in need such as providing good customer service when providing a security presence, such as providing direction, responding to emergency situation involving violent individuals and injuries.
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.

Working Conditions:

  • This position is stationed in the main gate security office.
  • Indoor duties.
  • Moderate physical activities related to tasks and duties.
  • Sitting for extended periods of time is required.
  • Computer work throughout the day.
  • Day and Night 12-hour shift schedule.

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

title: Security Guard, Training Class
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

 

At GardaWorld Fort McMurray we are now offering free security training as well as assistance with getting your required qualifications. We understand how valuable your transferrable skills are. You may not have security experience, but we know that your resume doesn’t tell the whole story.  

 

We’ve seen people with backgrounds in customer service, retail, and hospitality be very successful as a Security Guard because of their excellent communication skills, their outgoing nature that allows them to build relationships easily, and strong observation skills. In a nutshell, they know when someone needs help and how to do just that.  

 

We’re growing our ranks in Fort McMurray now more than ever! And we want to invest in you! We have a structured Security Guard training program that would have you licensed in 70 hours of training. Check out GardaWorld Campus. 

What's in it for you?

 

  • Structured Security Guard training – the best in the industry, the first step in your new career journey 
  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits  
  • We can guarantee full time employment
  • Uniform provided 
  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld 
  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus like Use of Force training 

What does a Security Guard in Fort McMurray do?

 

  • Ensure the protection of people, assets, and property 
  • Adapt to different situations – Where your experience is an asset 
  • Monitor access of entryways and exit points 
  • Conduct preventive surveillance rounds  
  • Point of contact with authorities and emergency services 
  • Computer skills (data entry and Microsoft office Suites)

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in Fort McMurray

 

  • Obtain your license through GardaWorld Campus  
  • Have a clear criminal background 
  • Be eligible to work in Canada 
  • Must reside within Fort McMurray
  • Valid Class 5 Drivers License (NON-GDL)**Picture must be included with resume

 

Ask us about our Training program to obtain the following Certifications

 

  • Valid Standard First Aid with AED and CPR - Level C
  • CSO (Common Safety Orientation)
  • Pass drug and alcohol test

 

Start your career journey with GardaWorld today, apply online or email your resume to

marsha.hutchings-campbell@garda.com

SSFMAC

title: Casual Security Guard Position
description:
We are currently seeking to fill Casual Security Guard Positions at a location in the area of Hanna, AB which is about 300 kms Southeast of Edmonton, AB. Only candidates that reside in or nearby the community will be considered for the position. Candidates MUST have or be willing to obtain a security license before being hired.

Overview Securiguard is committed to building a facilitative environment of respect and personal growth for all of our staff. We support this commitment with highly competitive compensation and benefits, comprehensive training, reliable equipment and supportive supervision as well as great opportunities for advancement, community involvement and work/life balance practices.

Job Skills/Requirements The successful candidates MUST have or be willing to obtain a security license before being hired. Shifts may be either days or overnights and will most often be 12 hours in length.


Certification Requirements

Security License

Strong communication skills

First Aid/CPR

Reliable transportation a must

Must be willing to work any day or night of the week and on short notice.


Additional Information/Benefits Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer and we value the cultural diversity of our staff. We offer flexibility in scheduling to accommodate students, family caregivers and part-time personnel.


About Us

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada. With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea their team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.

title: Lambton College - Security Guard - Part time
description:
Position Overview:

Working assigned shifts, you will be responsible for completing written reports.  You will be expected to perform constant patrols and interact with students, staff and members of the public to provide direction and promote good customer service while providing a security presence.

Essential Job Functions:

  • Implement security measures to protect property, control access to sites, patrol assigned areas and ensure client rules and regulations are followed.
  • Maintain written reports.
  • Perform security checks and liaise with visitors, customers, and the public.
  • Communicates any concerns/issues with Branch Manager.

 

Job Requirements:

  • Physical Demands include excessive walking and standing.
  • Patrol assigned area on foot, as assigned, to ensure personal, building, and equipment security.
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy.
  • Must have customer service-oriented attitude.
  • Utilize two-way radio and computer applications for communicating site activities.
  • Watch for and report irregularities by completing investigations and incident reports, such as security breaches, facility and safety hazards, and emergency situations; contact emergency responders, such as police, fire, and/or ambulance personnel, as required.
  • Sustain effective relationships with key stakeholders and provide specialized security services by enforcing rules and regulations when required.
  • Offer support to any person in need such as providing good customer service when providing a security presence, such as providing direction, responding to emergency situation involving violent individuals and injuries.
  • Working knowledge of the Trespass to Property Act and Mental Health Act
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. Immunization Record
  2. Covid Vaccines
  3. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  4. Proficient in English (both oral and written)

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  3. Use of Force
  4. Report Writing
  5. Additional courses as assigned

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those applicants that are short listed will be contacted for an interview.

Should you have any questions on this process, please contact LeeAnne Feddes, People and Culture Coordinator at

lfeddes@paladinsecurity.com

.

title: Security Guard, Industrial
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

If you are seeking a job where you have important responsibilities, this one is for you! As a security guard in the industrial sector, you will play a key role in ensuring the safety of workers for some of the biggest brands out there! 

We provide people with growth opportunities. 30% of our frontline employees are promoted to become part of our operation teams. 

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in Squamish now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, we have a position that will accommodate your needs and help you reach your goals. 

 

GardaWorld is looking for full-time Security Officers to work in Squamish. We are offering a $500* signing bonus! Please follow up with us for more details!

What's in it for you?

  • Full-time overnight shifts (1900-0700)

  • Uniform provided free of charge 

  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld 

  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus like Use of Force training 

What does a Security Guard in Squamish do?

  • Manage access as well as access cards through the computer system 

  • Camera surveillance of access gates and parking barriers 

  • Greet customers and register visitors as needed 

  • Act as a first responder in the event of a crisis or emergency  

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in Squamish

  • A valid security guard license and first aid card 

  • Available to work flexible hours 

  • Have a clear criminal background 

  • Be eligible to work in Canada 

 

SSVAN

*conditions apply.

description:

From:                                    People & Culture Coordinator

Date:                                     January 28, 2022

Closing Date:                     February 3, 2022

Re:                                         Job Posting

Position:                              Security Guard

Site:                                       Libro Centre

City:                                       Amherstburg, Ontario

Status:                                  Part-Time (2 position)

Hours:                                 Saturday & Sunday (0700-1430/ 1430-2200 hours)

Pay Rate:                             $16.50/hour

 

Are you interested in starting a career in a fast paced and growing industry? As a provider of security services to clients with complex security needs, Paladin Security Group is offering an exciting career opportunity for you to give back to your community, while developing skills for future careers. Our training programs are also a leader in the security industry, and they will help prepare you for advancements, as well as build your resume for a potential career in law enforcement. 

Position Overview:

Reporting to the Branch Manager, the security guard is accountable for maintaining the security of the client site.

Essential Job Functions:

  • Implement security measures to protect property, control access to sites, patrol assigned areas and ensure client rules and regulations are followed.16.501
  • Maintain written reports.
  • Perform security checks and liaise with visitors, customers, and the public.

Requirements:

  • Valid Security guard license.
  • Valid G class driver’s license with a clean abstract.  
  • Must provide drivers abstract.
  • Standard First Aid, CPR Level C.
  • Excellent communication skills with a focus on customer service along with good computer abilities are all core requirements.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills. Ability to write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy.
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.

Highlights:

  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. Immunization Record
  2. Full Covid Vaccination
  3. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  4. A Valid Ontario G Driver’s Licence with a clean abstract.
  5. Proficient in English (both oral and written)
  6. Vulnerable Sector Check may be required

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. Immunization Record
  2. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  3. Report Writing
  4. Additional courses as assigned
  5. Paladin License LMS Course
  6. Vulnerable Sector Check may be required

  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls

Should you have any questions on this process, kindly contact LeeAnne Feddes People and Culture Coordinator at lfeddes@paladinsecurity.com.
