title: Agent de sécurité, Patrouilleur - ETS Montréal
description:
Prêt à revêtir l’uniforme GardaWorld?

Si vous cherchez un emploi où vous avez d'importantes responsabilités, celui-ci est fait pour vous ! En tant qu'Agent de sécurité et Patrouilleur à l'École des Technologie Supérieure, vous jouerez un rôle clé en assurant la sécurité des travailleurs, des étudiants et des visiteurs pour cet établissement. 

Nous offrons à nos employés des salaires compétitifs (et qui augmentent dès 3 mois d'ancienneté), un emploi régulier et temps plein afin de vous garantir la sécurité d'emploi et des opportunités d'évolution au sein de GardaWorld. 

Qu'est-ce que vous y gagnez ?

  • Nous offrons des salaires compétitifs et des prestations de santé complètes 
  • Nous pouvons garantir 40 heures par semaine
  • Uniforme fourni gratuitement
  • Opportunités de croissance avec GardaWorld
  • Formation continue avec notre Campus GardaWorld, comme emploi de la force

Que fait un agent de sécurité à l'ETS de Montréal ?

  • Patrouilles intérieures et extérieures 
  • Contrôle d'accès, escortes de sécurité, réponse aux appels de service  
  • Assistance en cas d'urgence, premiers soins ou toute autre intervention                   
  • Détecter, interpeller et déplacer les personnes indésirables     
  • Évacuer le bâtiment en cas d'urgence 

Qualifications pour devenir un agent de sécurité à l'ETS?

  • Un permis d'agent de sécurité et une carte de premiers soins valides 
  • Avoir minimalement 3 mois d'expérience en sécurité
  • Être disponible pour travailler selon un horaire flexible  
  • Avoir un casier judiciaire vierge  
  • Être admissible à travailler au Canada  

 

Le masculin est utilisé dans le seul but d'alléger le texte.

title: Security Guard, Floater
description:
Casual Shift Opportunities?

 

Are you looking to supplement your income? We’re growing our ranks in Fort McMurray now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, we have a position that will accommodate your needs and help you reach your goals.

 

What's in it for you?

 

  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits  

  • Uniform provided free of charge 

  • Opportunities to grow with GardaWorld 

  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus like Use of Force training 

What does a Security Guard in Fort McMurray do?

 

  • Manage access as well as access cards through the computer system
  • Camera surveillance of access gates and parking barriers
  • Greet customers and register visitors as needed
  • Act as a first responder in the event of a crisis or emergency
  • Perform daily reports and incident reports
  • Perform surveillance rounds with multiple foot patrols of grounds and facilities, including climbing multiple sets of stairs safely
  • Unlock and lock certain areas during monitoring rounds and via Lenel systems
  • Pedestrian bag searches and vehicle searches
  • Working in all types of seasonal weather conditions including dry dusty summers and cold winter temperatures. 

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in Fort McMurray

 

  • Valid Alberta Security Guard licence
  • Valid Class 5 Drivers License (NON-GDL)
  • 3-year clear Drivers Abstract
  • Valid Standard First Aid with AED and CPR - Level C
  • CSO or BSO or OSSA and CSTS
  • Wildlife Awareness and Fit Testing (training provided)
  • Pass drug and alcohol test
  • Security experience considered an asset
  • Comfortable working on a computer (data entry and Microsoft office Suites)
  • At ease working as a team and offering excellent customer service
  • Must reside within Fort McMurray
  • Must be eligible to work in Canada
  • Start your career journey with GardaWorld today, apply online or email your resume to

    marsha.hutchings-campbell@garda.com

title: Overnight Oil and Gas Security - $276/day
description:
Location: Burnaby

Hours of work: 12-hour shifts, 4 days on 4 days off

Shift Hours: 18:00 - 06:00

What you'll do:

Our mission at Securiguard is to make people feel safe. As a security professional, you'll be responsible for the protection of people and assets by patrolling designated areas, identifying, and reporting safety hazards and reporting security breaches, as well as completing all reporting and radio check-ins. Other duties may include monitoring CCTV and surveillance systems, responding to alarms and emergencies and controlling access to the site. You will provide excellent customer service to our clients and guests, while providing a visual security presence to deter and detect unauthorized guests.

In this role, you will be working in an industrial environment, supporting a large and exciting critical infrastructure project. You'll be dedicated to safety and maintaining a safe work environment for all by following all protocols, processes and procedures and taking steps to eliminate and minimize hazards.

Why you'll love working with us:

  • Work life balance
  • Health and Dental Benefits
  • Sponsored training (including Occupational First Aid 1 and PCST courses!)
  • Retention bonus
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS Health.
  • Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians through TELUS Health
  • Corporate Discount Programs which include savings on CINEPLEX tickets, Grouse Mountain gondola passes, travel, clothing and more!
  • Exciting growth opportunities in security and valuable experience for a career in law enforcement, corrections, or civil service

Your skills and qualifications:

  • Valid BC Security License or ability to obtain
  • Class 5 Driver's License with a clean driving abstract and claims history, and a vehicle to travel to and from the job site
  • Ability to pass a drug and alcohol test
  • Ability to pass a low intensity strength and mobility test
  • Ability to read and write descriptive and factual reports in the English language
  • Outstanding customer service skills
  • Must share our REACH values (Respect, Empathy, Accountability, Courtesy & Honesty).

Who we are:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how we have become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

At Securiguard we believe in living and acting by our values: R.E.A.C.H. · Respect · Empathy · Accountability · Courtesy & · Honesty. Our mission, vision, and values enabled us to be a finalist of the 2021 Canadian HR Awards' Excellence in Diversity & Inclusion category. We celebrate people of diverse backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives, and we believe that diversity enables the company to grow towards a better future.Join us if you believe you can make a difference.

Securiguard is committed to maximizing employment and training opportunities for Indigenous, local, and regional residents. If you identify as a member of an Indigenous community, we encourage you to self-identify in our optional screening question.

title: Security Guards- City of Vancouver Contract
description:
Securiguard is looking for outstanding, experienced, and motivated Security Professionals for our City of Vancouver contract in a high restricted site. We are now accepting applications for various positions and our services include uniformed guards, mobile patrols, alarm response, security equipment & systems, locksmiths, and alarm monitoring services. Candidates with OFA1 will only be considered.

Location: Vancouver


Who we are:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost 50 years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solutions provider. That is how we have become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.


With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea, our team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.


Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Free Uniforms
  • Paid Training
  • Health and Dental Benefits (subject to benefit waiting period)
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS Babylon. Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians (subject to waiting period)
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Recognition Programs & Events

What would you do:

  • Provide excellent customer service
  • Team Player
  • Working with the community and providing a friendly customer service as you will be representing both City of Vancouver and Securiguard Services Ltd.
  • Ability to build relationships with the public and be there as a support system for the team
  • Comfortable with Radio Communication
  • Able to write detailed reports on job-related activities
  • Keen eye for observing exterior and interior premises
  • Working independently in all types of environment
  • Customer Service with stakeholders
  • Access Control
  • Report all incidents and health and safety concerns
  • Demonstrate empathy when handling situations involving Vancouver's most vulnerable populations
    • (i.e.: less fortunate individuals, individuals with drug/mental health issues, etc.)

What would you bring:

  • Valid BC Security License
  • At least 6 months security experience in Canada
  • OFA1 is an asset
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Experience working in a fast-paced customer-oriented environment
  • High School Diploma or equivalent
  • Clean background check
  • You must complete six hours of online mandatory training prior to being deployed on the field.

Assets

  • Class 5 Driver's License
  • Mental Health Training
  • CPI
  • AST
  • OFA-2

Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer, and we value the diversity of our staff. We are committed to building a facilitative environment of respect, inclusiveness, and career growth.

title: High Profile Part-Time Medical First Responder Security Guard
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

If you are seeking a job where you have important responsibilities, this one is for you! As a security guard in the industrial sector, you will play a key role in ensuring the safety of workers for some of the biggest brands out there! 

 

We provide people with growth opportunities. 30% of our frontline employees are promoted to become part of our operation teams. 

 

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in Rocanville now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, we have a position that will accommodate your needs and help you reach your goals. 

What's in it for you?

  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits  

  • Corporate Discounts

  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld 

  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus

What does a Security Guard in Rocanville do?

  • Manage access cards through the computer system
  • Routine interior and exterior patrols
  • Camera surveillance
  • Answer telephone, transfer calls, use paging system
  • Complete weekly Fire Alarm Testing
  • Complete weekly inventories and unit checks
  • Monitor access gates and parking lots
  • Greet customers and register visitors as needed
  • Act as a first responder in the event of a crisis or emergency
  • Assist OHN and Mine Rescue Teams
  • Assess patients and treat as needed

Qualifications and skills

  • Hold a valid security guard license in Saskatchewan
  • First Aid Level C with AED
  • Available to work flexible hours
  • Have a clear criminal background
  • Be eligible to work in Canada
  • Steel toe boots
  • Medical First Responder Certificate 

 

 

Start your career journey with GardaWorld today! Apply online or get in touch with Brooke Wilgosh at Brooke.wilgosh@gardworld.com or Laura Duchek laura.duchek@nutrien.com

title: Security Guards
description:
Securiguard is looking for dedicated guards to join our team! Whether you're looking to start a new career in security services or you're a seasoned security professional, we invite you to explore a future with us.

Our mission at Securiguard is to make people feel safe. As a security guard, you'll be responsible for the protection of people and assets by patrolling designated areas, identifying, and reporting safety hazards and reporting security breaches, as well as completing all reporting and radio check-ins. Other duties may include responding to alarms and emergencies and controlling access to the site. You will provide excellent customer service to our clients and guests, while providing a visual security presence to deter and detect unauthorized guests.

What you bring:

  • Valid BC Security License
  • Pride in delivering outstanding customer service
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Comfort with radio communication
  • Ability to write reports on job-related activities
  • An observant eye and a listening mindset
  • Capable of standing for a duration of 8 hours

Availability:

  • Full time or part time
  • Weekdays and weekends

Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Award winning corporate culture
  • Paid training
  • Flexible schedules & work life balance
  • Extended health and dental benefits
  • Employee assistance program through TELUS MyHealth
  • Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians
  • Access to a robust corporate discount program
  • Discounted Cineplex movie tickets

Who we are:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

At Securiguard, we believe you can make a difference - by making people feel safe, caring for the people around you and supporting your community.

title: Security Guard - Markham Stouffville Hospital
description:
To:                          All Security Personnel

 

From:                    Sharlin Alpin

 

Date:                     January 26, 2022

 

Closing Date:      February 7, 2022

 

Re:                         Job Posting

 

Position:              Security Guard                

 

Site:                       Markham-Stouffville Hospital

 

City:                       Markham

 

Status:                  Full Time

 

Hours:                Rotating Continental (0700-1900/ 1900-0700hrs)

 

Pay Rate:             $16.65/ hr.

 

Site Description:   Markham Stouffville Hospital is a leading community hospital. The hospital provides diagnostic and emergency services, and high-quality patient-centered care to over 412,000 patients each year. Markham Stouffville Hospital is the center of community care for the residents of the City of Markham, the Town of Whitchurch-Stouffville and the Township of Uxbridge. At Markham Stouffville Hospital delivering excellent patient care is top priority.

 

Job Description:  Working on assigned shifts, you will work 8 and/or 12-hour shifts providing proactive and reactive security patrols and response to incidents.  You will be required to write reports and investigate routine incidents, as well as respond to coded emergencies in a quick and efficient manner.  You should display excellent customer service skills and be able to work with people who are under stress or in need of medical assistance.  In this role, it is essential that you are physically fit and able to stand and walk for long periods of time.

 

Prerequisites:  At the time of the interview, applicants must be able to produce proof of completion of the following:

 

  1. Immunization Record
  2. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  3. Proficient in English (both oral and written)
  4. Vulnerable Sector Check
  5. COVID Double Vaccination

 

 

Position Requirements:  Successful applicants will be required to complete the following courses:

 

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Fire Safety and WHMIS
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slip, Trips and Falls
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online WHMIS
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Note Taking and Report Writing
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  7. Additional courses as assigned

 

All interested personnel must apply through the Employee Portal by simply following these steps:

 

  1. Visit www.paladinsecurity.com
  2. Click on Employee Portal
  3. Enter username and password
  4. Click on career opportunities
  5. Click on Ontario, then Toronto
  6. Select the job posting
  7. Register and apply

 

Should you have any questions on this process, kindly contact the HR Department at

hrtoronto@paladinsecurity.com

.

title: Security Professionals
description:
Security Professionals


Location: Nanaimo - Port Site

Securiguard is currently looking for enthusiastic security professionals with an MTSC to join our team at Port sites!

Key responsibilities:

  • Controlling access to the site and ensuring only authorized access
  • Conducting foot patrols on site
  • Conducting mobile patrols
  • Watching and reporting any safety and security breaches
  • Providing a visual crime deterrence
  • Emergency first aid response, if required
  • Various administrative and clerical duties
  • Monitoring traffic entering/exiting site
  • Monitoring CCTV

Skills & Qualifications:

  • Valid B.C. Security License
  • MTSC required
  • Class 5 Driver's License along with a clean driver's abstract
  • Weekend and overnight availability an asset.
  • Excellent Customer Service Skills
  • Confidence in handling and deescalating confrontation in an assertive, calm, and respectful manner.
  • Comfort working independently and in varying weather conditions

Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Award winning corporate culture
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS Babylon
  • Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians
  • Health and Dental Benefits after 9 months to P/T and F/T Employees
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Paid Training

Who We Are:

Securiguard has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

At Securiguard, we believe you can make a difference - by making people feel safe, caring for the people around you and supporting your community.

Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer, and we value the diversity of our staff. We are committed to building a facilitative environment of respect, inclusiveness, and career growth.

How To Apply:

Interested applicants please email your resume as well as proof of applicable certifications through to

Frumsa@securiguard.com

  • Conduct preventive surveillance rounds according to established procedures
  • Provide impeccable customer service
  • Prevent fire, theft and vandalism
  • Verify and inspect safety equipment
  • Enforce the regulations in effect at your client's premises
  • Write daily reports and incident reports

What we offer

  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits

  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld

  • Above average written and oral communication skills

title: Security Guard - Lakeridge Health/Whitby- Full Time
description:
To:                                          All Security Personnel

From:                                    Sharlin Alpin

Date:                                   January 28, 2022

Closing Date:                     February 4, 2021

Re:                                         Job Posting

Position:                              Security Guard

Site:                                       Lakeridge Health - Whitby

City:                                       Whitby, ON

Status:                                  Full Time

Hours:                                 Continental Days (0700-1900hrs)

Pay Rate:                             $16.50/hourly

 

Are you interested in starting a career in a fast paced and growing industry? As a provider of security services to clients with complex security needs, Paladin Security Group is offering an exciting career opportunity for you to give back to your community, while developing skills for future careers. Our training programs are also a leader in the security industry, and they will help prepare you for advancements, as well as build your resume for a potential career in law enforcement.

 

Site Description:  Lakeridge Health is one of Ontario's largest community hospitals, serving people across Durham Region and beyond. With five hospital sites and four emergency rooms throughout Durham Region from Ajax-Pickering, Bowmanville, Oshawa and Port Perry and one specialty hospital in Whitby. They care for 1600 people every day and have a staff 4,900 doctors, nurses and other health care professionals and over 1,500 amazing volunteers.

 

 

Job Description:

 

  • Proactive & reactive security patrols
  • Response to incidents
  • Report writing
  • Investigate routine incidents

 

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

 

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. Immunization Record
  2. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  3. Proficient in English (both oral and written)
  4. Vulnerable Sector Check
  5. COVID Double Vaccination

 

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  3. Use of Force
  4. Report Writing
  5. Additional courses as assigned

 

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

 

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned

 

 

 

Should you have any questions on this process, kindly contact the People and Culture Department at

hrtoronto@paladinsecurity.com

title: Bilingual (FRENCH/ENGLISH) Security Guard - Government Site
description:
Overview:

We are North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider with over 300,000 phenomenal employees. At Allied Universal ®, we pride ourselves on fostering a promote from within culture. There are countless examples of individuals who began their career as Security Professionals and today hold positions on our senior leadership team. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, and vision coverage, life insurance, employee assistance programs, and more! We also offer company paid uniforms and part-time and flexible schedules!

Job Description:

Allied Universal is seeking  Bilingual (FRENCH/ENGLISH) Security Guard - Government Site  in Canada.    

 

Please read the mandatory requirements below. Only qualified candidates will be contacted.

  • Bilingual (French/English) a must
  • Full time  
  • Monday to Friday - 4pm to 12am
  • Government Site - Immigration Holding Centre
  • Hwy 27 & Rexdale Blvd
  • Valid Security Guard Licence
  • Valid First Aid/CPR certificate
  • Must have 5 years residency in Canada (min. PR held since April 2017) due to Federal clearances
  • Must have a min. OSSD and/or Post Secondary Diploma. If education was completed outside of Canada, an assessment from WES or ICAS will be required.
  • Ability to successfully pass MAB/Use of Force training
  • Pay range: $19.00 per hour (probationary rate); up to $20.00 per hour after 6 months

Great opportunity for Police Foundations, Justice Studies and/or Criminal Justice students or recent grads!!

 

QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS:

  • Be at least 18 years of age with high school diploma or equivalent
  • Legally entitled to work in Canada
  • Possess effective written and oral communication and interpersonal skills with ability to deal with all levels of personnel and the general public in a professional and effective manner

  • Licensing requirements are subject to province and/or local laws and regulations and will be required prior to employment.

  • As a condition of employment, employee must successfully complete a background check
  • Display exceptional customer service and communication skills
  • Have intermediate computer skills to operate innovative, wireless technology at client specific sites
  • Ability to handle crisis situations at the client site, calmly and efficiently
  • Able to:
    • Work in various environments such as cold weather, rain/snow or heat
    • Occasionally lift or carry up to 20 kilograms
    • Climb stairs, ramps, or ladders occasionally during shift
    • Stand or walk on various surfaces for long periods of time
Closing:

Allied Universal ®  provides unparalleled service, systems and solutions to the people and business of our communities, and is North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider. Allied Universal delivers high-quality, tailored solutions, which allows clients to focus on their core business. For more information:  www.AUSecurity.ca.

title: High Profile Commercial Building Security Guard
description:
More than a job – 26% of our corporate employees at GardaWorld Canada started as frontline employees. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset and you’re ambitious, this could be just the beginning of your career journey with GardaWorld!

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in Calgary now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, you can be sure that we have a position that can fill your needs and goals. Join our team of dedicated and highly qualified professionals! If you are interested in a fufulling career in a one of a kind premium high profile site, you have picked the right position!

 

 

What you'll be doin

  • Providing uniformed, physical security to our client and its customers/visitors
  • Interior and exterior patrols
  • Conducting daily functions of the security unit including access control, security escorts, responding to calls for service, report writing/note taking and replacement for vacation book offs
  • Performing property inspections and enforce property laws, client rules, and other regulations
  • Provide keys and temporary pass to visitors/employees
  • Liaising with visitors, customers. and the general public on a consistent basis
  • Providing customer service information and assist in handling the questions of visitors
  • Maintaining a positive, productive work environment through positive teamwork

What we offer:

  • We offer competitive wages starting at $17.79 & comprehensive health benefits
  • We can guarantee 40 hours/week
  • Uniform provided free of charge
  • Career advancement opportunities in the security field or within the head office
  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld
  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus
  • Corporate discounts

What we’re looking for

  • Good verbal and written communication skills – English is required; French is an asset
  • Previous experience in the security industry (asset)
  • Valid Alberta Security Guard licence
  •  Strong computer skills
  •  Customer service oriented
  •  Security clearance reliability
  •  Must be able to work days / nights and rotating shifts 4/4 2 days/ 2 nights 12 hour shifts
  •  Leadership and problem-solving skills
  •  Ability to work in a stressful environment
  • Removal on unauthorized individuals

We thank all applicants for applying. Those who are selected will be contacted for further procedure.

title: Pipeline Security Guards - $252 per day
description:
Securiguard is hiring full-time Pipeline Security Guards for areas within British Columbia. This is a chance to be a part of a unique and exciting project!

Hours of work: 12-hour shifts, 14 days on 14 days off


What you'll do

Our mission at Securiguard is to make people feel safe. As a security professional, you'll be responsible for the protection of people and assets by patrolling designated areas, identifying, and reporting safety hazards and reporting security breaches, as well as completing all reporting and radio check-ins. Other duties may include monitoring CCTV and surveillance systems, responding to alarms and emergencies and controlling access to the site. You will provide excellent customer service to our clients and guests, while providing a visual security presence to deter and detect unauthorized guests.

In this role, you will be working in an industrial environment, supporting a large and exciting critical infrastructure project in a remote area. You'll be dedicated to safety and maintaining a safe work environment for all by following all safety protocols, processes and procedures, and reporting any hazards.


Candidate Requirements:

  • Valid BC Security License or ability to obtain
  • Class 5 Driver's License with a clean driving abstract and claims history
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Must be able to pass a pre-employment drug screening test
  • Must be comfortable working in a wilderness setting for extended periods of time
  • Must be able to work a 12 hour shift (day or night) and must be physically fit to work in a remote location
  • Must have open availability & be able to work morning or night shifts

Other Employee Perks:

  • Daily & weekly overtime
  • Work Life balance
  • Extended health and dental benefits
  • Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians through TELUS Health
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS health
  • Discounts on Cineplex movie tickets and more
  • Sponsored training (including Occupational First Aid Level 1 and PCST courses)

About Us:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada. With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea their team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.

We're only accepting applications from individuals seeking full-time employment.

Securiguard is committed to maximizing employment and training opportunities for Indigenous, local and regional residents. If you identify as a member of an Indigenous community, we encourage you to self-identify in our optional screening question.

title: Security Guard-Operator Level I (Physical Security)
description:
Overview:

We are North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider with over 300,000 phenomenal employees. At Allied Universal ®, we pride ourselves on fostering a promote from within culture. There are countless examples of individuals who began their career as Security Professionals and today hold positions on our senior leadership team. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, and vision coverage, life insurance, employee assistance programs, and more! We also offer company paid uniforms and part-time and flexible schedules!

Job Description:

Allied Universal is seeking Professional Security Guards  in Canada.    

 

Operator Level I (Physical Security)   â€“ Global Security Operations Center (GSOC)

 

Pay Rate: $19.00-$21.00/hour (To Advertise)

Classification & Benefits: Supervisor(s)

 

Reports to:

Direct - Account Manager

Indirect - Operator Level II - Shift Lead

 

General Purpose and Function of Position:

The GSOC Operator Level I is responsible for providing primary and secondary security service support by pro-actively monitoring systems and actioning events in accordance with established Standard Operating Procedures.

The GSOC Operator Level I functions as a critical lifeline to client personnel and contract security guards, receiving information, dispatching personnel, and escalating events as appropriate while ensuring that an accurate shift report is maintained.

When required, the GSOC Operator Level I will conduct active monitoring via CCTV to support short term security initiatives and events.


In a regular day, the GSOC Operator Level I will:

  • Conduct general monitoring of systems to be aware of adverse and irregular events (i.e. alarms, access control systems, temperature monitoring systems, intrusion detection systems)
  • Follow established processes and procedures to document and escalate events to the appropriate work-centre 24/7
  • Review CCTV and Networked Video Systems to conduct remote monitoring and investigations.
  • Triage and manage of inbound requests to the GSOC from employees, security guards, and external partners (e.g. Alarm Monitoring Stations, Law Enforcement, etc.)
  • Work with a team and leader to ensure effective communication of events that occurred during shift and any on-going events (i.e. facilities emergencies waiting for action, etc.)
  • Complete relevant shift and/or event based reports in a professional and clear manner
  • Utilize a variety of tools ranging from enterprise access control and alarm monitoring systems to various business intelligence sources, open source media, internet, and in-house tools, to respond and alert personnel regarding any adverse conditions that may affect the client, its employees, facilities, and/or properties.
  • Additional duties as defined.

The selected candidate(s) must be willing to work on a 24/7 shift rotation and be able to work overtime as required.

**THIS IS A 24/7 POSITION THAT REQUIRES SHIFT WORK AND AN AVERAGE OF 84 HOURS BI-WEEKLY.   THE OPERATOR LEVEL I WILL WORK A ROTATING SCHEDULE FOLLOWING A PATTERN OF:

 

 

SUNDAY

MONDAY

TUESDAY

WEDNESDAY

THURSDAY

FRIDAY

SATURDAY

Formal Education, Experience, and Licenses Required:

  • College diploma or university degree in Police Foundations/Law and Security/Criminology, Communications or related field, AND/OR 2 years of relevant work experience.
  • Must be able to pass any provincially required training or other qualifications for employment
  • Must be able to pass and complete employer mandated training (on-line learning modules, in-class and virtual training as required)
  • Must successfully pass a Criminal Background Check and/or obtain security clearances as required by the client and employer

Highly Preferred Qualifications

  • 1-2 years of experience working in one or more of the following environments:
    • Commercial or Corporate security environments involving 24/7 monitoring and escalation processes.
    • Security/Emergency/Response based dispatch/operations centre services involving direct interaction with callers and dispatched personnel.
    • Customer service and/or call centre experience is an asset.

 

  • Ability to effectively use computer systems in the following areas:
    • General Office Systems (i.e. MS Office/GSuite)
    • CCTV and Networked Video Systems
    • Access Control Systems
    • Incident Reporting Systems
    • Alarm monitoring systems
    • Telephone and Instant Messaging systems.
  • Advanced communication skills (written and verbal) in English with the ability to effectively communicate with persons who may or may not speak English as their primary language
  • Ability to remain calm under pressure and de-escalate and re-direct telephone conversations to quickly identify and take action to resolve emergencies.
  • Demonstrated desire for continuous learning and skills development
  • Desire to perform and deliver work by the Allied Universal core values of Integrity, Respect, Teamwork, and Service Excellence
  • Prior military or law enforcement experience is an asset
Closing:

Allied Universal ®  provides unparalleled service, systems and solutions to the people and business of our communities, and is North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider. Allied Universal delivers high-quality, tailored solutions, which allows clients to focus on their core business. For more information:  www.AUSecurity.ca.

title: Security Guard Cargill - High River
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

If you are seeking a job where you have important responsibilities, this one is for you! As a security guard in the industrial sector, you will play a key role in ensuring the safety of workers for some of the biggest brands out there!

We provide people with growth opportunities. 26% of our frontline employees are promoted to become part of our operation teams.

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in Cargill, High River, Alberta now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, we have a position that will accommodate your needs and help you reach your goals.

What's in it for you?

  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits
  • We can guarantee 40 hours/week
  • Uniform provided free of charge
  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld

title: Security Guard
description:
Whether you're looking to start a new career in security services or you're a seasoned security professional, we invite you to explore a future with us.

Our mission at Securiguard is to make people feel safe. As a security guard, you'll be responsible for the protection of people and assets by patrolling designated areas, identifying, and reporting safety hazards and reporting security breaches, as well as completing all reporting and radio check-ins. Other duties may include responding to alarms and emergencies and controlling access to the site. You will provide excellent customer service to our clients and guests, while providing a visual security presence to deter and detect unauthorized guests.

Location: Victoria

What you bring:

  • Valid BC Security License
  • Pride in delivering outstanding customer service
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Comfort with radio communication
  • Ability to write reports on job-related activities
  • Keen eye for observing exterior and interior premises
  • A listening mindset
  • Capable of standing for a duration of 8 hours

Availability:

  • Full time or part time
  • Weekdays and weekends

Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Paid Training
  • Flexible Schedules & Work life balance
  • Extended Health and Dental Benefits
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS MyHealth
  • Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians
  • Access to a robust corporate discount program
  • Discounted Cineplex movie tickets

Who we are:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

At Securiguard, we believe you can make a difference - by making people feel safe, caring for the people around you and supporting your community.

Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer, and we are proud of inclusive workplace culture. In 2021, Securiguard was a winner of Canada's Most Admired Culture and listed as a finalist in Canada's HR Awards for excellence in diversity and inclusion. Join our amazing team and help make people feel safe.

The Empire Life Insurance Company was founded in 1923 in Toronto and is now one of the top 10 life insurance companies in Canada. In 1936, our Corporate Head Office moved to Kingston, Ontario and is now an integral part of the city's history.

Part-Time

title: Security Guard
description:
We are hiring security guards to ensure the security of various sites in and around the Red Deer area.  Preference will be given to applicants who posses a valid Alberta Security License.

What are the job benefits we offer you:

  • Regular wages ranging from $15 to $16/hour
  • Medical benefits after 90 days
  • Free uniform
  • Career path planning and advancement opportunities
  • Paid on-the-job training
  • Ongoing training available

On a typical day, you will be responsible of:

  • Interior and exterior patrols
  • Enforce property rules, city bi-laws, and other applicable laws
  • Deter and respond to incidents on property
  • Maintain a presence to ensure the safety and security of all persons on site
  • Communicate regularly with patrons/clients
  • Complete reports and memo book entries on a regular basis
  • Respond to various types of emergencies (fire alarms/elevator entrapments/medical emergencies)
  • Work in a variety of settings including but not limited to: special events, commercial properties, retail, industrial and mobile positions

You are the ideal candidate for this position because you possess:

  • Valid Alberta Security License
  • Ability to work any shift in a 24/7 period
  • Excellent English communication skills both written and verbal (candidates will be tested)
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • Some understanding/knowledge of applicable laws
  • Valid First Aid/CPR, or willingness to obtain
  • Professional deportment

 

Interested? Join our workforce!

title: Pipeline Remote Camp Security Guards - $252 per day
description:
Canada's Leading Provider of Corporate Security is seeking full-time remote camp security guards for sites in the BC Interior.

If you are looking for a rewarding entry level position with great potential for career advancement in corporate security and asset protection, this role is for you.

Hours of work: 12-hour shifts, 14 days on 14 days off

Job overview:

Our mission at Securiguard is to make people feel safe. As a security professional, you'll be responsible for the protection of people and assets by patrolling designated areas, identifying, and reporting safety hazards and reporting security breaches, as well as completing all reporting and radio check-ins. Other duties may include monitoring CCTV and surveillance systems, responding to alarms and emergencies and controlling access to the site. You will provide excellent customer service to our clients and guests, while providing a visual security presence to deter and detect unauthorized guests.

In this role, you will be working in an industrial environment, supporting a large and exciting critical infrastructure project in a remote area. You'll be dedicated to safety and maintaining a safe work environment for all by following all safety protocols, processes and procedures, and reporting any hazards.

Candidate requirements:

  • Valid BC Security License or ability to obtain
  • Class 5 Driver's License with a clean driving abstract and claims history
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Must be able to pass a pre-employment drug screening test
  • Must be comfortable working in a wilderness setting for extended periods of time
  • Must be able to work a 12 hour shift (day or night) and must be physically fit to work in a remote location
  • Must have open availability and be able to work morning or night shifts

Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Daily & weekly overtime
  • Work Life balance
  • Extended health and dental benefits
  • Telemedical access to doctors, therapists, and dietitians through TELUS Health
  • Employee Assistance Program through TELUS health
  • Discounts on Cineplex movie tickets and more

More about Securiguard:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada.

At Securiguard, we believe you can make a difference - by making people feel safe, caring for the people around you and supporting your community.

Securiguard is committed to maximizing employment and training opportunities for Indigenous, local and regional residents. If you identify as a member of an Indigenous community, we encourage you to self-identify in our optional screening question.

title: Overnight Security Guard - Federal Site (Part time)
description:
Overview:

We are North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider with over 300,000 phenomenal employees. At Allied Universal ®, we pride ourselves on fostering a promote from within culture. There are countless examples of individuals who began their career as Security Professionals and today hold positions on our senior leadership team. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, and vision coverage, life insurance, employee assistance programs, and more! We also offer company paid uniforms and part-time and flexible schedules!

Job Description:

Allied Universal is seeking  Overnight Security Guards - Government Site  in Canada.    

 

Please read the mandatory requirements below. Only qualified candidates will be contacted.

  • Part time - Overnights - 12am to 8am
  • Flexible/ various schedules - 8 hr shifts
  • Government Site - Immigration Holding Centre
  • Hwy 27 & Rexdale Blvd
  • Valid Security Guard Licence
  • Valid First Aid/CPR certificate
  • Must have 5 years residency in Canada (min. PR held since April 2017) due to Federal clearances
  • Must have a min. OSSD and/or Post Secondary Diploma. If education was completed outside of Canada, an assessment from WES or ICAS will be required.
  • Ability to successfully pass MAB/Use of Force training
  • Pay range: $18.00 per hour (probationary rate); $19.00 per base rate & up to $20.00 per hour after 6 months

Great opportunity for Police Foundations, Justice Studies and/or Criminal Justice students or recent grads!!

 

QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS:

  • Be at least 18 years of age with high school diploma or equivalent
  • Legally entitled to work in Canada
  • Possess effective written and oral communication and interpersonal skills with ability to deal with all levels of personnel and the general public in a professional and effective manner

  • Licensing requirements are subject to province and/or local laws and regulations and will be required prior to employment.

  • As a condition of employment, employee must successfully complete a background check
  • Display exceptional customer service and communication skills
  • Have intermediate computer skills to operate innovative, wireless technology at client specific sites
  • Ability to handle crisis situations at the client site, calmly and efficiently
  • Able to:
    • Work in various environments such as cold weather, rain/snow or heat
    • Occasionally lift or carry up to 20 kilograms
    • Climb stairs, ramps, or ladders occasionally during shift
    • Stand or walk on various surfaces for long periods of time
Closing:

Allied Universal ®  provides unparalleled service, systems and solutions to the people and business of our communities, and is North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider. Allied Universal delivers high-quality, tailored solutions, which allows clients to focus on their core business. For more information:  www.AUSecurity.ca.

title: Security Guard 1
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

GardaWorld is the world’s largest privately owned security services company, offering cash services, physical and specialized security solutions. We protect our clients’ staff and assets, wherever they are in the world.

We are looking for security guards to fulfill different assignments for our clients.

What you’ll be doing

  • Ensure the protection of people, assets and property
  • Monitor access of entryways and exit points using equipment at your disposal
  • Conduct preventive surveillance rounds according to established procedures
  • Provide impeccable customer service
  • Prevent fire, theft and vandalism
  • Verify and inspect safety equipment
  • Enforce the regulations in effect at your client's premises
  • Write daily reports and incident reports

What we offer

  • Competitive wages 
  • Complete uniform
  • Diverse work assignements
  • Career development and advancement, and training opportunities

What we’re looking for

  • Valid Security Guard licence AND valid standard first aid & CPR
  • Professional deportment
  • Proactive, attention-to-detail, self-motivated, team player 
  • Above average written and oral communication skills
  • High school diploma or equivalent (asset)
  • Driver’s licence and access to a vehicle (asset)
  • Previous experience in security (asset)

title: Casual Security Officers - Prince Rupert
description:
Securiguard will be hiring for a casual/part time Security Guards in the Prince Rupert area with the potential to lead to fulltime! This is a chance to be a part of a unique and exciting project!

Job Requirements:

  • Providing excellent customer service to both the client and its guests
  • Emergency response: Ability to respond to incident/emergency situations and follow required protocol
  • Access control at terminals and project sites
  • Patrolling of designated areas
  • Radio check ins
  • Report writing
  • Identify and reporting safety hazards
  • Visual security presence - detect and deter unauthorized persons
  • Coordinating and liaising with the police or emergency personnel when required
  • Reporting security breaches
  • Adhere to Securiguards core Values, Vision, Mission statement
  • Perform regularly scheduled site duties as required by client standard operating procedures
  • Keep consistent notes using company issued note book
  • Frequent shift activity reporting

Candidate Requirements:

  • Valid BC Security License
  • Valid Drivers License
  • Ability to obtain a Transport Canada Security Clearance(TSC).
  • Ability to read and write descriptive and factual reports in the English language

About us:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada. With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea their team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.

title: Security Guards - Trillium Health Partners - Full Time
description:
To:                                          All Security Personnel

From:                                    Sharlin Alpin

Date:                                     January 27, 2022

Closing Date:                        February 12, 2022

Re:                                         Job Posting

Position:                              Security Guard

Site:                                       Trillium Health Partner -M-Site

City:                                       Mississauga, ON

Status:                                  Full Time

Hours:                                 Rotating Continental (0800-2000/2000-0800hrs)

Pay Rate:                             $16.72 - $18.81- “Rates are based on a levelling system”

 

Are you interested in starting a career in a fast paced and growing industry? As a provider of security services to clients with complex security needs, Paladin Security Group is offering an exciting career opportunity for you to give back to your community, while developing skills for future careers. Our training programs are also a leader in the security industry, and they will help prepare you for advancements, as well as build your resume for a potential career in law enforcement.

 

Site Description: Trillium Health Partners and their security department are proud winners of the IAHSS Lindberg Bell Award 2017. It is also one of Canada’s largest academically-affiliated tertiary care hospitals with highly-specialized regional programs in advanced cardiac, vascular, stroke, neurosciences, orthopedic, and sexual assault/domestic violence services.

 

 

Job Description: Description:  Working on assigned shifts, you will work 12-hour shifts providing proactive and reactive security patrols and response to incidents to the mental health ward.  You will be required to write reports and investigate routine incidents, as well as respond to coded emergencies in a quick and efficient manner.  You should display excellent customer service skills and be able to work with people who are under stress or in need of medical assistance.  In this role, it is essential that you are physically fit and able to stand and walk for long periods of time.

 

 

 Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

 

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. Immunization Record
  2. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  3. Proficient in English (both oral and written)
  4. Vulnerable Sector Check
  5. COVID Double Vaccination

 

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  3. Use of Force
  4. Report Writing
  1. Additional courses as assigned

 

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

 

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  1. Additional courses as assigned

 

 

 

Should you have any questions on this process, kindly contact the People and Culture Department at

hrtoronto@paladinsecurity.com

.

title: Agent de sécurité
description:
Prêt à revêtir l’uniforme?

Vous cherchez à lancer votre carrière en sécurité ?

Vous êtes issue du milieu de la restauration, hôtellerie, service à la clientèle et êtes à la recherche d’une seconde carrière avec des possibilités d’avancements?

Vous êtes présentement étudiants pour devenir policier, agent correctionnel, agent des services frontaliers ou autre et voulez acquérir de l’expérience terrain ?

 

Nous avons un emploi qui répond à vos besoins. Venez faire une différence dans une entreprise qui vous permet de faire rayonner vos compétences. Devenez agent de sécurité GardaWorld.

 

Joignez-vous à notre équipe composée de professionnels dédiés et hautement qualifiés ! En tant qu'agent de sécurité, vous pourriez être appelé à effectuer des tâches variées dans multiples environnement de travail avec des responsabilités peu routinières ainsi que des horaires flexibles.
 

  • Pas de permis? Devenez étudiant chez GardaWorld en vous inscrivant à une de nos formations offertes par notre Campus

Ce que vous ferez

  • Assurer la protection des personnes, des biens et des lieux
  • Contrôler les entrées et sorties avec l’équipement mis à votre disposition
  • Effectuer des rondes de surveillance préventives en suivant les procédures établies
  • Assurer un service à la clientèle irréprochable
  • Prévenir le feu, le vol et le vandalisme
  • Vérifier et inspecter les équipements de sécurité
  • Veiller à l’application des règlements en vigueur chez votre client
  • Rédiger des rapports quotidiens et d’incidents

Ce que nous offrons

  • Salaire à partir de 18,34$/h : Salaire moyen de nos employés dépendant des disponibilités et des demandes clients entre 1500$ brut et 2934$ brut par mois
  • Avantages sociaux et uniforme neuf fourni
  • Rabais corporatifs
  • Quarts de travail flexibles offerts pour maximiser votre nombre d’heures de travail par semaine
  • Nombreuses possibilités d’avancement de carrière dans le domaine de la sécurité
  • Travailler au sein d’une entreprise reconnue comme un leader international de la sécurité entouré de collègues aussi passionnés par le domaine que vous.
  • Opportunités d’emploi locales dans des environnements de travail variés (industriels, aéroport, tours à bureaux, centres commerciaux, hôpitaux, banques, etc.) offrant des possibilités de transfert à travers le Canada.
  • Support interne et disponibilité 24/7 du centre de contrôle

Ce que nous recherchons

Obligatoire

  • Disponibilité pour travailler selon un horaire variable
  • Capacité à intervenir en situation d’urgence et d’offrir un bon service à la clientèle.
  • Être éligible à l’obtention d’un permis d’agent de sécurité
  • Bonne communication orale et écrite, en français et en anglais
  • Posséder un permis de conduire et une voiture
  • Permis d’agent de sécurité et carte de premiers soins valides

 

Pas de permis? Devenez étudiant chez GardaWorld en vous inscrivant à une de nos formations offertes par notre Campus


Vous avez des questions ou vous êtes intéressé par ce défi ? N’hésitez pas à me contacter au 

meliza.thibault@garda.com

title: Casual Security Guard Position - Hanna, AB
description:
We are currently seeking to fill Casual Security Guard Positions at a location in the area of Hanna, AB which is about 300 kms Southeast of Edmonton, AB. Only candidates that reside in or nearby the community will be considered for the position. Candidates MUST have or be willing to obtain a security license before being hired.

Overview Securiguard is committed to building a facilitative environment of respect and personal growth for all of our staff. We support this commitment with highly competitive compensation and benefits, comprehensive training, reliable equipment and supportive supervision as well as great opportunities for advancement, community involvement and work/life balance practices.

Job Skills/Requirements The successful candidates MUST have or be willing to obtain a security license before being hired. Shifts may be either days or overnights and will most often be 12 hours in length.


Certification Requirements

Security License

Strong communication skills

First Aid/CPR

Reliable transportation a must

Must be willing to work any day or night of the week and on short notice.


Additional Information/Benefits Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer and we value the cultural diversity of our staff. We offer flexibility in scheduling to accommodate students, family caregivers and part-time personnel.


About Us

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. title: Industrial Security Guard, Mississauga
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

If you are seeking a job where you have important responsibilities, this one is for you! As a security guard in the industrial sector, you will play a key role in ensuring the safety of workers for some of the biggest brands out there! 

We provide people with growth opportunities. 30% of our frontline employees are promoted to become part of our operation teams. 

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in Mississauga now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, we have a position that will accommodate your needs and help you reach your goals. 

What's in it for you?

  • We offer a pay rate of $15.30/hr & comprehensive health benefits  

  • We can guarantee 24 hours/week 

  • Uniform provided free of charge 

  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld 

  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus like Use of Force training 

What does a Security Guard in Mississauga do?

  • Manage access as well as access cards through the computer system 

  • Camera surveillance of access gates and parking barriers 

  • Greet customers and register visitors as needed 

  • Act as a first responder in the event of a crisis or emergency  

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in Mississauga

  • A valid Ontario security license and CPR-C/first aid card 

  • Available to work flexible hours. Currently hiring for 2 open positions, specifically Part-time Overnights 12AM-12PM, and Part-time Days 12PM-12AM

  • Have a clear criminal background 

  • Be eligible to work in Canada 

  • Have previous security experience

  • Have 10 year residency in Canada, and be a Canadian Citizen (required for Security Clearance Check)

title: Casual Security Guard Position - Forestburg, AB
description:
We are currently seeking to fill Casual Security Guard Positions at a location in the area of Forestburg, AB which is about 175 kms Southeast of Edmonton, AB. Only candidates that reside in or nearby the community will be considered for the position. Candidates MUST have or be willing to obtain a security license before being hired.

Overview Securiguard is committed to building a facilitative environment of respect and personal growth for all of our staff. We support this commitment with highly competitive compensation and benefits, comprehensive training, reliable equipment and supportive supervision as well as great opportunities for advancement, community involvement and work/life balance practices.

Job Skills/Requirements The successful candidates MUST have or be willing to obtain a security license before being hired. Shifts may be either days or overnights and will most often be 12 hours in length.


Certification Requirements

Security License

Strong communication skills

First Aid/CPR

Reliable transportation a must

Must be willing to work any day or night of the week and on short notice.


Additional Information/Benefits Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer and we value the cultural diversity of our staff. We offer flexibility in scheduling to accommodate students, family caregivers and part-time personnel.


About Us

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada. With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea their team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.

title: Security Guard - Full Time - Formet - St. Thomas, ON
description:
To:                                         All Security Personnel

From:                                    People & Culture  

Date:                                     January 17, 2022

Closing Date:                       Open

Re:                                        Job Posting

Position:                               Security Guard

Site:                                       Formet

City:                                      St. Thomas, Ontario

Status:                                  Full time  

Hours:                                   0730- 1530 & 15:30-23:30 hours

Pay Rate:                             $17.00 per hour

 

Are you interested in starting a career in a fast paced and growing industry? As a provider of security services to clients with complex security needs, Paladin Security Group is offering an exciting career opportunity for you to give back to your community, while developing skills for future careers. Our training programs are also a leader in the security industry, and they will help prepare you for advancements, as well as build your resume for a potential career in law enforcement.

Position Overview:

The facility adheres to US Homeland Security CTPAT (Customs Trade Partnership Against Terrorism) program access control including inbound and outbound shipments, visitors and contractors. The guard will be required to work outdoors in all weather conditions inspecting and logging truck traffic and completing patrols.

Experience with CTPAT would be an asset. Excellent communication skills with a focus on customer service along with good computer abilities are all core requirements.

Duties include but are not limited to: CTPAT Procedures, Weigh Scale Operation, Covid Screening, Access Control, Monitor Security Systems, Conduct Security Patrols, Respond to Emergency Situations

The applicant must possess the following:

  • Be courteous and cooperative with a high quality of customer service
  • Good interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively at various social levels and across diverse cultures
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Write clear, concise and legible reports

Preferred skills/qualifications:

  • Valid Ontario Security Guard licence (required)
  • Valid First Aid & CPR certificate
  • Microsoft Office experience

Essential Job Functions:

  • Be courteous and cooperative with a high quality of customer service.
  • Good interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively at various social levels and across diverse cultures.
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Communicates any concerns/issues with Operations Manager.

Requirements:

  • Working knowledge of the Trespass to Property Act.
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Excellent communication skills with a focus on customer service along with good computer abilities are all core requirements.
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills. Ability to write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy.
  • Patrol assigned area on foot, as assigned, to ensure personal, building, and equipment security.
  • Watch for and report irregularities by completing investigations and incident reports, such as security breaches, facility and safety hazards, and emergency situations; contact emergency responders, such as police, fire, and/or ambulance personnel, as required.
  • Sustain effective relationships with key stakeholders and provide specialized security services by enforcing rules and regulations when required.
  • Offer support to any person in need such as providing good customer service when providing a security presence, such as providing direction, responding to emergency situation involving violent individuals and injuries.
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  2. Proficient in English (both oral and written)
  3. Full Covid Vaccine

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  3. Use of Force
  4. Report Writing
  5. Additional courses as assigned

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned

Should you have any questions on this process, kindly contact LeeAnne Feddes, People & Culture Coordinator at

lfeddes@paladinsecurity.com

.

title: Security Guard
description:
Overview:

We are North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider with over 300,000 phenomenal employees. At Allied Universal ®, we pride ourselves on fostering a promote from within culture. There are countless examples of individuals who began their career as Security Professionals and today hold positions on our senior leadership team. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, and vision coverage, life insurance, employee assistance programs, and more! We also offer company paid uniforms and part-time and flexible schedules!

Job Description:

Allied Universal is seeking Professional Security Guards  in Canada.

  • Be at least 18 years of age with high school diploma or equivalent
  • Legally entitled to work in Canada

Closing:

Allied Universal ®  provides unparalleled service, systems and solutions to the people and business of our communities, and is North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider. Allied Universal delivers high-quality, tailored solutions, which allows clients to focus on their core business. For more information:  www.AUSecurity.ca.

title: Industrial Site Trained Casual Security Guard, Vaughan 1
description:
Are you ready to suit up?

If you are seeking a job where you have important responsibilities, this one is for you! As a Site Trained Casual Security Guard in the industrial sector, you will play a key role in ensuring the safety of workers for some of the biggest brands out there! 

We provide people with growth opportunities. 30% of our frontline employees are promoted to become part of our operation teams. 

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in Vaughan now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, we have a position that will accommodate your needs and help you reach your goals. 

What's in it for you?

  • We offer a pay rate of $15.00/hour & comprehensive health benefits  

  • Uniform provided free of charge 

  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld 

  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus like Use of Force training 

What does a Security Guard in Vaughan do?

  • Manage access as well as access cards through the computer system 

  • Wanding (metal detector) of all staff/visitors entering the building

  • Camera surveillance of access gates and parking barriers 

  • Greet customers and register visitors as needed 

  • Act as a first responder in the event of a crisis or emergency  

Qualifications to become a Security Guard in Vaughan

  • A valid Ontario security license and CPR-C/first aid card 

  • Comfortable with use of radio communication equipment

  • Available to work flexible hours 

  • Have a clear criminal background 

  • Be eligible to work in Canada
