title: Security Guard - St. Thomas Elgin General Hospital
description:
To:                                         All Security Personnel

From:                                    People & Culture

Date:                                     Jan 25, 2022

Closing Date:                       Open 

Re:                                         Job Posting

Position:                                Security Guard

Site:                                       St. Thomas Elgin General Hospital

City:                                       St. Thomas, Ontario

Status:                                   Part Time

Hours:                                 Shift Rotation – 12 hours Days & Nights

Pay Rate:                             $17.00 – $18.00/hour – Rates based on Levelling System

Are you interested in starting a career in a fast paced and growing industry? As a provider of security services to clients with complex security needs, Paladin Security Group is offering an exciting career opportunity for you to give back to your community, while developing skills for future careers. Our training programs are also a leader in the security industry, and they will help prepare you for advancements, as well as build your resume for a potential career in law enforcement.

 

Job Description:

  • Working on assigned shifts, you will provide proactive and reactive security patrols and response to incidents.
  • You should display excellent customer service skills and be able to work with people you are under stress or in need of medical assistance.
  • In this role, it is essential that you are physically fit and able to stand and walk for long periods of time.
  • You will be required to operate the Switchboard duties including call handling, dispatching, monitoring of building alarm systems and CCTV.
  • Perform a variety of preventative and reactive duties to include, but not limited to interior and exterior patrols within the hospital as well as exterior of all buildings and areas of the organization.
  • Provide Use of Force/Restraint as required and directed under the Mental Health Act
  • Provide security escort service to staff and visitors as requested.
  • Daily lock and unlock of facilities
  • Provide motor vehicle assistance to staff and or visitors as required.
  • Responsible for the collection of all lost and found items and produce the proper documentation and location of owner of property when possible.
  • Accountable for keeping accurate logs and notebook entries of all shift activity and calls for service.
  • Accountable to write accurate reports upon investigations or reportable occurrences in timely manner upon completion of occurrence.
  • Investigate and follow-up of incidents, report writing, door opening requests, CCTV camera reviews.
  • Security Guards shall warn persons of rule infractions or violations, and apprehend or evict violators from premises, using force when necessary.
  • Responsible for all office duties (i.e. ID badges, key distribution, lost and found etc)

Essential Job Functions:

  • Be courteous and cooperative with a high quality of customer service.
  • Good interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively at various social levels and across diverse cultures.
  • Must be able to communicate clearly with clinical staff, and the general public while conveying professionalism and authority at all times.
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Communicates any concerns/issues with Site Coordinator.

Requirements:

  • Diploma in Police Foundations/Protection, Security & Investigations or equivalent from a recognized College, University or equivalent ie: military, police college or hospital security guard experience
  • CPR and First Aid certificates -Standard First Aid & CPR Level A/AED 
  • Valid Ontario Security Guard License 

General Duties

  • Provides excellent customer service at all times.

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement
     

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. Immunization Record
  2. Full Covid Vaccine
  3. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  4. Proficient in English (both oral and written)

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  3. Use of Force
  4. Report Writing
  5. Additional courses as assigned

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned

Should you have any questions on this process, kindly contact LeeAnne Feddes People & Culture Coordinator at

lfeddes@paladinsecurity.com

.

title: Casual Site Trained Security Guards - Trillium Health Partners
description:
To:                                        All Security Personnel

From:                                    Sharlin Alpin

Date:                                     January 19, 2022

Closing Date:                       January 26, 2022

Re:                                         Job Posting

Position:                              Security Guard

Site:                                       Trillium Health Partner –M-Site/CVH/ Q Site

City:                                       Mississauga, ON

Status:                                  Casual Site Trained Guards

Hours:                              Rotating Continental (0800-2000/2000-0800hrs)

Pay Rate:                             $16.72 Once site training is successfully completed.

 Are you interested in starting a career in a fast paced and growing industry? As a provider of security services to clients with complex security needs, Paladin Security Group is offering an exciting career opportunity for you to give back to your community, while developing skills for future careers. Our training programs are also a leader in the security industry, and they will help prepare you for advancements, as well as build your resume for a potential career in law enforcement.

Site Description: Trillium Health Partners and their security department are proud winners of the IAHSS Lindberg Bell Award 2017. It is also one of Canada’s largest academically-affiliated tertiary care hospitals with highly-specialized regional programs in advanced cardiac, vascular, stroke, neurosciences, orthopedic, and sexual assault/domestic violence services.

Job Description: Description:  Working on assigned shifts, you will work 12-hour shifts providing proactive and reactive security patrols and response to incidents to the mental health ward.  You will be required to write reports and investigate routine incidents, as well as respond to coded emergencies in a quick and efficient manner.  You should display excellent customer service skills and be able to work with people who are under stress or in need of medical assistance.  In this role, it is essential that you are physically fit and able to stand and walk for long periods of time.

  Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. Immunization Record
  2. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  3. Proficient in English (both oral and written)
  4. Vulnerable Sector Check
  5. COVID Double Vaccination

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  3. Use of Force
  4. Report Writing
  5. Additional courses as assigned

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned

Should you have any questions on this process, kindly contact the People and Culture Department at 

hrtoronto@paladinsecurity.com

.

Education Requirements

  • High School Diploma/GED
  • First Aid/CPR

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those applicants that are short listed will be contacted for an interview.

title: CBSA Security Guard
description:
More than a job – 26% of our corporate employees at GardaWorld Canada started as frontline employees. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset and you’re ambitious, this could be just the beginning of your career journey with GardaWorld!

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in Calgary now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, you can be sure that we have a position that can fill your needs and goals. Join our team of dedicated and highly qualified professionals! If you are interested in a fulfilling career in a one-of-a-kind premium high profile position, you have picked the right position!

 

What you’ll be doin

 

  • The safe and secure control and custody of individuals in all the work sites and at other locations (e.g., hospitals, hearings, etc.) as required by the CBSA
  • Complying with and applying all CBSA policies and POSOPS, and ensuring all individuals follow site specific rules
  • Monitoring and controlling designates areas inside and outside the resources assigned work location
  • Following CBSA building emergency procedures
  • Admitting individuals to the IHC or other CBSA facilities
  • Conducting intake (logging and itemization of personal effects) and decontamination of individuals belongings
  • Using CBSA-approved search methods
  • Communication using radios that comply with all provincial and federal regulations
  • Completing report and forms as required
  • Applying use of force principles and methods for intervention when handling individuals
  • Using metal detectors and x-ray technology
  • Monitoring individual’s behavior through active engagement and using verbal de-escalation techniques, as required
  • Entire outer perimeter is safe and secure. Reporting verbally and in writing.
  • Ensuring all illegal items or substance are removed from an individual’s personal belongings upon admission at Admission & Discharge
  • Admitting visitors to the IHC and advising specific rules and policies
  • Keeping up-to-date records, inventories and handing all incoming and outgoing mail
  • Meeting detained and non-detained individuals at in-bound domestic flights and
  • escort them to their outbound flight
  • Escorting individuals who have voluntarily withdrawn their application to enter Canada to their outbound flight and confirm departure.
  • Transporting individuals between terminals, airline counters for check-in, baggage examination when required.
  • Retrieving incoming calls on the video reception phone and properly advise the CBSA on-duty Superintendent
  • Completing the COD package for non-detained individuals, including making a copy of the individual’s boarding pass and having them sign their COD;
  • Booking flights and checking in individuals who have been deemed inadmissible to Canada

 

What we offer:

 

    • We offer competitive wages starting at $22.20/hr
    • Comprehensive health benefits
    • We can guarantee 40 hours/week
    • Uniform provided free of charge
    • Career advancement opportunities in the security field or within the head office
    • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld
    • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus- Use of Force Training
    • Corporate discounts
    • Paid onsite training

 

 Skill Requirements:

    • Fluency in English, spoken and written. Fluency in French is an asset
    • Excellent communication, customer service and people skills
    • Previous experience in the security industry
    • Strong computer skills
    • Available to work and commute any scheduled shifts in a 24/7 operation including weekends and public holidays
    • Leadership and problem-solving skills
    • Ability to work in a stressful environment
    • Ability to stand on foot and walk for long periods of time

 

 

Career Requirements:

 

    • CBSA Enhanced Reliability
    • Contract Security Program (CSP) Reliability Status
    • Vulnerable Sector Check
    • Valid Alberta Security Guard licence
    • Full Class 5 Drivers license with clean drivers abstract
    • First Aid and PR Training with Automated External Defibrillator (AED)
    • Must be able to obtain a Transportation Canada Security Clearance (RAIC)
    • Over 18 years of age with a high school diploma or equivalent (GED)
    • Must be a Canadian Citizen or Permanent Residence
    • All GardaWorld employees are required to be fully vaccinated with a COVID-19 vaccine series, approved by Health Canada, as a condition of hire. Should you be a successful candidate, you will be required to comply with GardaWorld’s mandatory Vaccination Policy that is in effect.

 

We thank all applicants for applying. Those who are selected will be contacted for further procedure

title: Security Guard
description:
Overview:

We are North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider with over 300,000 phenomenal employees. At Allied Universal ®, we pride ourselves on fostering a promote from within culture. There are countless examples of individuals who began their career as Security Professionals and today hold positions on our senior leadership team. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, and vision coverage, life insurance, employee assistance programs, and more! We also offer company paid uniforms and part-time and flexible schedules!

Job Description:

Allied Universal is seeking Professional Security Guards  in Canada.    

 

QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS:

  • Be at least 18 years of age with high school diploma or equivalent
  • Legally entitled to work in Canada
  • Possess effective written and oral communication and interpersonal skills with ability to deal with all levels of personnel and the general public in a professional and effective manner

  • Licensing requirements are subject to province and/or local laws and regulations and will be required prior to employment.

  • As a condition of employment, employee must successfully complete a background check
  • Display exceptional customer service and communication skills
  • Have intermediate computer skills to operate innovative, wireless technology at client specific sites
  • Ability to handle crisis situations at the client site, calmly and efficiently
  • Able to:
    • Work in various environments such as cold weather, rain/snow or heat
    • Occasionally lift or carry up to 20 kilograms
    • Climb stairs, ramps, or ladders occasionally during shift
    • Stand or walk on various surfaces for long periods of time
Closing:

Allied Universal ® is an inclusive and equitable employer, encouraging applications from qualified women and men including persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and Aboriginal persons.

Requisition ID:2022-742895

title: Marine Security- Security Guard
description:
Securiguard is committed to building a facilitative environment of respect and personal growth for all of our staff. We support this commitment with highly competitive compensation and benefits, comprehensive training, reliable equipment and supportive supervision as well as great opportunities for advancement, community involvement and work/life balance practices.

We are looking for security professionals to join our ports security team.

Location: Nanaimo

Job Requirements:

  • Providing excellent customer service to both the client and its guests
  • First aid and emergency response
  • Access Control
  • Patrolling of designated area
  • Monitoring and Controlling Video surveillance systems
  • Alarm Response
  • Radio Check Ins
  • Report Writing
  • Flagging Safety Hazards
  • Visual Deterrence
  • Coordinating and liaising with the police or emergency personnel when required
  • Flagging any breach of security to the Account Management immediately through the proper channels.
  • Adhere to Securiguard's core Values, Vision, ission
  • Verify all vehicles entering are authorized and either hold a valid vehicle pass or construction permit.
  • Perform regularly scheduled site duties as required.
  • Keep consistent notes using company issued note book


Candidate Requirements:

  • Valid BC Security License
  • OFA1 strongly preferred
  • Excellent customer service
  • High School Diploma or Equivalent

Employee Perks We Offer:

  • Free Uniforms
  • Paid Training
  • Benefits after 9 months to P/T & F/T Employees (Conditions Apply)
  • Discount Cineplex Movie Tickets
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Recognition Programs & Events

title: Security Guard - CF Industries - Full Time - Courtright, ON
description:
To:                                         All Security Personnel

From:                                    LeeAnne Feddes, People & Culture Coordinator

Date:                                     Jan. 25, 2022

Closing:                                Open 

Re:                                        Job Posting

Position:                               Front Counter - Main Gate Security Guard

Site:                                       CF Industries

City:                                       Courtright, ON

Status:                                  Full Time

Hours:                                  (0700- 1630/0630-1630/ 0500 -1700 / 1700 -0500 hours)

Pay Rate:                              $15.73/hr. – 17.91/hr. wages based on levelling system.

Are you interested in starting a career in a fast paced and growing industry? As a provider of security services to clients with complex security needs, Paladin Security Group is offering an exciting career opportunity for you to give back to your community, while developing skills for future careers. Our training programs are also a leader in the security industry, and they will help prepare you for advancements, as well as build your resume for a potential career in law enforcement.

Position Overview:

Supervision of security incumbents and the security and safety of the Courtright Location. They must ensure all personnel entering the Courtright location has a valid site specific safety orientation and/ or is registered appropriately upon arrival.

Essential Job Functions:

  • Maintain professionalism, confidence and confidentiality.
  • Provide security services at the Courtright CF Nitrogen Complex, maintaining order and the protection of assets, information and employees onsite.
  • Maintain a professional relationship with all personnel entering the site.
  • Administrative and reception duties; forward incoming calls to the appropriate department or personnel. Greet all visitors and communicate with the appropriate location personnel upon their arrival.
  • Responsible for site access control; issues site access cards and photo IDs as per the site Access Management Program. Ensure profiles are current and up to date information is complete.  Complete proper documentation as required.  Report any security breaches involving the program.
  • Responsible to conduct site Safety Orientation video for approved individuals prior to entry to site or annual renewals. Assist EH&S with Contractor Management Program.
  • Responsible to consult with ISNetworld Application program/ Short List to ensure contractor companies onsite are in compliance with insurance and WSIB prior to access on site. Report infractions to Procurement and/or EHS department.
  • Responsible for the signing out and issuance of keys onsite i.e. office keys, vehicle keys as per the site Access Management Program.   Complete proper documentation as required. Report any security breaches involving the program.
  • Responsible for the signing out and issuance of vehicle passes onsite as per the site Access Program.  Complete proper documentation as required.Report any security breaches involving the program.
  • Responsible for Material Gate / Personal passes onsite. Must review the pass for appropriate signatures, inspect the item(s) and sign the pass to allow item(s) to leave the Courtright location.
  • Assist in all shipping procedures. Must be fluent in the operation of the CF Direct shipping program.
  • Conduct Vehicle/ Seal inspections as required or requested.
  • Report all observed hazardous or unsafe conditions to the Security Supervisor/ Security Manager or appropriate shift supervisor including communicating this information to the oncoming security shift.
  • Log and report all unusual activities to the other security guards, Security Supervisor/ Security Manager.
  • Conduct interior and exterior patrols of the site; day shift only.Patrol grounds to protect against possible hazards through exercising sound judgment and problem-solving skills. Conduct random site security checks foot patrols.
  • Assist in any site investigation.
  • Write informative and detailed reports (Daily, Incident, and Accident) on all security matters.
  • Conduct Bag checks as required or requested.
  • Responsible to deliver outgoing mail and pickup incoming mail.
  • Responsible for miscellaneous deliveries or pickups as requested by the Security Supervisor/ Security Manager.
  • In the event of an emergency, follow emergency response procedures and directives from Security Supervisor/ Security Manager, Incident Commander, or ER Coordinator.
  • Review and continue to educate oneself on site emergency procedures and first aid/ CPR and all site medical equipment.
  • Responsible to administer first-aid/ CPR when required.
  • Continuously stay up to date on all Everbridge, CAER and Site Watch notification systems. Responsible to initiate notifications when directed to do so. 
  • Continuously stay up to date US/ Canadian Border Agency, Canadian Government Agencies, Canadian Coast Guard regulations and laws.
  • Send out via fax overtime meals and call and confirm the orders. Report any security breaches involving the program.
  • Accept after hours deliveries as per directives. Log and communicate arrival.
  • Responsible for monitoring and reporting any noncompliance with any EH&S/ HR policies and procedures
  • Unlock offices and gates as requested by the Security Supervisor/ Security Manager.
  • Assist/ conduct in any monthly Security inspections as required by the site Security Management Program.
  • Assist in the management of the Security Management Program
  • Designated the back up to the Maingate Guard position; hours will be flexible up scheduling needs. Will cover Maingate Guard vacations, and time off.
  • Complete all assigned training or reviews as required.
  • Attend mandatory security training meetings.
  • Any other duties assigned by the Security Supervisor or Security Manager and/or site FSO.

Security Guards are required to complete a Drug & Alcohol test for incidents that occur on client property.

Requirements:

  • Must possess a valid Ontario Driver’s License.
  • Must possess a valid First Aid training certificate.
  • Must possess a valid Transportation of Dangerous Goods training certificate.
  • Completion of Law and Security or equivalent considered an asset.
  • Must possess a minimum of 1 year’s directly related experience in the security and safety field; preferably in the fertilizer or petrochemical processing industry.
  • Demonstrate knowledge of safety and environmental regulations and issues.
  • Strong attention to detail with high focus on accuracy.
  • Strong communication skills both written and verbal.
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills.
  • Demonstrate the ability to work safely and in compliance with site safety, health and environmental standards and practices.
  • Demonstrate leadership capabilities.
  • Strong analytical and decision-making abilities.
  • Ability to deal effectively and diplomatically with employees, contractors, visitors etc.
  • Ability to work flexible hours

Working Conditions:

  • This position is mostly stationed out of the main gate security office
  • Indoor/ Outdoor tasks and duties
  • Moderate physical activities related to tasks and duties
  • Standing for extended periods of time is required
  • Computer work throughout the day.
  • Primarily day shift also shift work as back up main gate position

Physical Conditions:

  • This position is mostly stationed out of an office; the incumbent must be able to be mobile, with physical demands pertaining to standing for extended periods of time, climbing stairs, building tours, emergency response and computer work throughout the day.

Highlights:

  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement.

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. Immunization Record.
  2. Full Covid Vaccine.
  3. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License.
  4. Proficient in English (both oral and written).
  5. Vulnerable Sector Check may be required.

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  3. Use of Force
  4. Report Writing
  5. Additional courses as assigned

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Mental Illness Awareness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned

Should you have any questions on this process, kindly contact LeeAnne Feddes, People and Culture Coordinator at

lfeddes@paladinsecurity.com

.

title: CBSA Security Guard
description:
More than a job – 26% of our corporate employees at GardaWorld Canada started as frontline employees. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset and you’re ambitious, this could be just the beginning of your career journey with GardaWorld!

Despite the challenges over the last year, we’re growing our ranks in Edmonton now more than ever! With our wide variety of contracts, you can be sure that we have a position that can fill your needs and goals. Join our team of dedicated and highly qualified professionals! If you are interested in a fulfilling career in a one-of-a-kind premium high profile position, you have picked the right position!

 

What you’ll be doin

 

  • The safe and secure control and custody of individuals in all the work sites and at other locations (e.g., hospitals, hearings, etc.) as required by the CBSA
  • Complying with and applying all CBSA policies and POSOPS, and ensuring all individuals follow site specific rules
  • Monitoring and controlling designates areas inside and outside the resources assigned work location
  • Following CBSA building emergency procedures
  • Admitting individuals to the IHC or other CBSA facilities
  • Conducting intake (logging and itemization of personal effects) and decontamination of individuals belongings
  • Using CBSA-approved search methods
  • Communication using radios that comply with all provincial and federal regulations
  • Completing report and forms as required
  • Applying use of force principles and methods for intervention when handling individuals
  • Using metal detectors and x-ray technology
  • Monitoring individual’s behavior through active engagement and using verbal de-escalation techniques, as required
  • Entire outer perimeter is safe and secure. Reporting verbally and in writing.
  • Ensuring all illegal items or substance are removed from an individual’s personal belongings upon admission at Admission & Discharge
  • Admitting visitors to the IHC and advising specific rules and policies
  • Keeping up-to-date records, inventories and handing all incoming and outgoing mail
  • Meeting detained and non-detained individuals at in-bound domestic flights and
  • escort them to their outbound flight
  • Escorting individuals who have voluntarily withdrawn their application to enter Canada to their outbound flight and confirm departure.
  • Transporting individuals between terminals, airline counters for check-in, baggage examination when required.
  • Retrieving incoming calls on the video reception phone and properly advise the CBSA on-duty Superintendent
  • Completing the COD package for non-detained individuals, including making a copy of the individual’s boarding pass and having them sign their COD;
  • Booking flights and checking in individuals who have been deemed inadmissible to Canada

 

What we offer:

 

    • We offer competitive wages starting at $22.20/hr
    • Comprehensive health benefits
    • We can guarantee 40 hours/week
    • Uniform provided free of charge
    • Career advancement opportunities in the security field or within the head office
    • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld
    • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus- Use of Force Training
    • Corporate discounts
    • Paid onsite training

 

 Skill Requirements:

    • Fluency in English, spoken and written. Fluency in French is an asset
    • Excellent communication, customer service and people skills
    • Previous experience in the security industry
    • Strong computer skills
    • Available to work and commute any scheduled shifts in a 24/7 operation including weekends and public holidays
    • Leadership and problem-solving skills
    • Ability to work in a stressful environment
    • Ability to stand on foot and walk for long periods of time

 

 

Career Requirements:

 

    • CBSA Enhanced Reliability
    • Contract Security Program (CSP) Reliability Status
    • Vulnerable Sector Check
    • Valid Alberta Security Guard licence
    • Full Class 5 Drivers license with clean drivers abstract
    • First Aid and PR Training with Automated External Defibrillator (AED)
    • Must be able to obtain a Transportation Canada Security Clearance (RAIC)
    • Over 18 years of age with a high school diploma or equivalent (GED)
    • Must be a Canadian Citizen or Permanent Residence
    • All GardaWorld employees are required to be fully vaccinated with a COVID-19 vaccine series, approved by Health Canada, as a condition of hire. Should you be a successful candidate, you will be required to comply with GardaWorld’s mandatory Vaccination Policy that is in effect.

 

We thank all applicants for applying. Those who are selected will be contacted for further procedure

title: Security Guard-FT/PT
description:
Overview:

We are North Americaâ€™s leading security services provider with over 300,000 phenomenal employees. At Allied Universal ®, we pride ourselves on fostering a promote from within culture. There are countless examples of individuals who began their career as Security Professionals and today hold positions on our senior leadership team. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, and vision coverage, life insurance, employee assistance programs, and more! We also offer company paid uniforms and part-time and flexible schedules!

Job Description:

Allied Universal is seeking Professional Security Guards  in Canada.    

 

QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS:

  • Be at least 18 years of age with high school diploma or equivalent
  • Legally entitled to work in Canada
  • Possess effective written and oral communication and interpersonal skills with ability to deal with all levels of personnel and the general public in a professional and effective manner

  • Licensing requirements are subject to province and/or local laws and regulations and will be required prior to employment.

  • As a condition of employment, employee must successfully complete a background check
  • Display exceptional customer service and communication skills
  • Have intermediate computer skills to operate innovative, wireless technology at client specific sites
  • Ability to handle crisis situations at the client site, calmly and efficiently
  • Able to:
    • Work in various environments such as cold weather, rain/snow or heat
    • Occasionally lift or carry up to 20 kilograms
    • Climb stairs, ramps, or ladders occasionally during shift
    • Stand or walk on various surfaces for long periods of time
Closing:

Allied Universal ® is an inclusive and equitable employer, encouraging applications from qualified women and men including persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and Aboriginal persons.

Requisition ID:2022-750364

title: Security Officer - Terrace
description:
Securiguard will be hiring for a part time guard in the Terrace area! This is a chance to be a part of a unique and exciting project!

Hours of work: Pay Rate is: $18-$21/hr;

Job Requirements:

  • Providing excellent customer service to both the client and its guests
  • Emergency response: Ability to respond to incident/emergency situations and follow required protocol
  • Access control at terminals and project sites
  • Patrolling of designated areas
  • Radio check ins
  • Report writing
  • Identify and reporting safety hazards
  • Visual security presence - detect and deter unauthorized persons
  • Coordinating and liaising with the police or emergency personnel when required
  • Reporting security breaches
  • Adhere to Securiguard's core Values, Vision, Mission statement
  • Perform regularly scheduled site duties as required by client standard operating procedures
  • Keep consistent notes using company issued note book
  • Frequent shift activity reporting

Candidate Requirements:

  • Valid BC Security License
  • Reliable transportation to get to an from site
  • Ability to read and write descriptive and factual reports in the English language

Please note this is not a remote position. Travel/accommodation is not provided.


About us:

Securiguard Services Limited has been at the forefront of the asset protection arena for almost fifty years by being a leading-edge innovative security and safety solution provider. That is how it has become one of the largest and most trusted private security organizations in Canada. Securiguard has proven expertise in deploying security and safety personnel in a variety of industries including Corporate, Retail, Property Management, Industrial, Aviation, Marine, Government, Educational, and Industrial/Resource Projects and has the largest and highest accredited K9 detection and screening division in Canada. With the ability to service clients across Canada including major centers, small towns, and remote locations by air, land, or sea their team of 3000+ strong security and safety professionals, make people feel safe by offering a comprehensive selection of safety and security services and solutions.

title: Security Guard - Part Time -Formet - St. Thomas, ON
description:
To:                                         All Security Personnel

From:                                    People & Culture Coordinator

Date:                                     January 12, 2022

Closing Date:                       Open

Re:                                        Job Posting

Position:                               Security Guard

Site:                                       Formet

City:                                      St. Thomas, Ontario

Status:                                  Part Time

Hours:                                  Saturday & Sunday 0730hrs to 1930hrs – additional hours available

Pay Rate:                             $17 per hour

 

Are you interested in starting a career in a fast paced and growing industry? As a provider of security services to clients with complex security needs, Paladin Security Group is offering an exciting career opportunity for you to give back to your community, while developing skills for future careers. Our training programs are also a leader in the security industry, and they will help prepare you for advancements, as well as build your resume for a potential career in law enforcement.

Position Overview:

The facility adheres to US Homeland Security CTPAT (Customs Trade Partnership Against Terrorism) program access control including inbound and outbound shipments, visitors and contractors. The guard will be required to work outdoors in all weather conditions inspecting and logging truck traffic and completing patrols.

Experience with CTPAT would be an asset. Excellent communication skills with a focus on customer service along with good computer abilities are all core requirements.

Duties include but are not limited to: CTPAT Procedures, Weigh Scale Operation, Covid Screening, Access Control, Monitor Security Systems, Conduct Security Patrols, Respond to Emergency Situations.

The applicant must possess the following:

  • Be courteous and cooperative with a high quality of customer service
  • Good interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively at various social levels and across diverse cultures
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Write clear, concise and legible reports

Preferred skills/qualifications:

  • Valid Ontario Security Guard licence (required)
  • Valid First Aid & CPR certificate
  • Microsoft Office experience

Essential Job Functions:

  • Be courteous and cooperative with a high quality of customer service.
  • Good interpersonal skills with the ability to interact effectively at various social levels and across diverse cultures.
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Communicates any concerns/issues with Operations Manager.

Requirements:

  • Working knowledge of the Trespass to Property Act.
  • Able to maintain a professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances and people under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
  • Excellent communication skills with a focus on customer service along with good computer abilities are all core requirements.
  • Superior written and verbal communication skills. Ability to write clear, concise, and legible reports.
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy.
  • Patrol assigned area on foot, as assigned, to ensure personal, building, and equipment security.
  • Watch for and report irregularities by completing investigations and incident reports, such as security breaches, facility and safety hazards, and emergency situations; contact emergency responders, such as police, fire, and/or ambulance personnel, as required.
  • Sustain effective relationships with key stakeholders and provide specialized security services by enforcing rules and regulations when required.
  • Offer support to any person in need such as providing good customer service when providing a security presence, such as providing direction, responding to emergency situation involving violent individuals and injuries.
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  2. Covid Vaccine
  3. Proficient in English (both oral and written)

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  3. Use of Force
  4. Report Writing
  5. Additional courses as assigned

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned

Should you have any questions on this process, kindly contact John Cox, Operations Manager at

lfeddes@paladinsecurity.com

.

title: Casual Security Guards Required
description:
We currently have several Casual Positions available at various locations within the city of Edmonton.

Overview
Securiguard is committed to building a facilitative environment of respect and personal growth for all of our staff. We support this commitment with highly competitive compensation and benefits, comprehensive training, reliable equipment and supportive supervision as well as great opportunities for advancement, community involvement and work/life balance practices.

Job Skills/Requirements
The successful candidates will be working in different locations throughout the city of Edmonton and surrounding area.

Guards are required to spend long hours patrolling locations and interacting with customers.

Locations have a mixture of indoor and outdoor areas which require patrolling in all weather conditions.

Excellent communication in both written and oral reports.

Certification Requirements
Alberta Individual Security License

First Aid CPR-C is recommended.


Additional Information/Benefits
Securiguard is an equal opportunity employer and we value the cultural diversity of our staff. We offer flexibility in scheduling to accommodate students, family caregivers and part-time personnel.

title: Security Guard - Enbridge Gas - Full Time - Chatham, ON
description:
To:                                         All Security Personnel

From:                                    People & Culture Coordinator

Date:                                     January 25, 2022

Closing Date:                       Open 

Re:                                         Job Posting

Position:                               Security Guard

Site:                                       Enbridge Gas

City:                                       Chatham, ON  

Status:                                   Full Time

Hours:                                   12-hour Shifts (2000-0800 hrs.)  

Pay Rate:                              $15.53/hr.

Are you interested in starting a career in a fast paced and growing industry? As a provider of security services to clients with complex security needs, Paladin Security Group is offering an exciting career opportunity for you to give back to your community, while developing skills for future careers. Our training programs are also a leader in the security industry, and they will help prepare you for advancements, as well as build your resume for a potential career in law enforcement.

Position Overview:

The job of a Paladin Security Guard serving Enbridge Gas is to provide such services that are required within established post orders or given by direct communication by their Manager. The Security Guard is to maintain a secure post and through due diligence offer protection to those on site and for the assets of the client.

Essential Job Functions:

  • Provide exceptional customer service.
  • Check in visitors/contractors/Vendors.
  • Enforce rules and policies and control access to the property.
  • Write clear and comprehensive reports including daily guard and security incident reports.
  • Utilize computers and various software including Microsoft Office, office 365 and preparatory programs.
  • Foot and Mobile patrol

Knowledge Skills and Abilities:

  • Remain calm and effectively perform in emergency situations.
  • Able to detect problems and hazards and follow up with writing reports.
  • Able to follow and enforce safety protocols and procedures.
  • Strong interpersonal skills, flexibility, and customer service focused.
  • Able to handle confidential information with a high amount of discretion.
  • Present a professional image to employees and public/customers.
  • Able to understand and follow specific instructions and procedures.
  • Must be able to work unsupervised and with a partner.
  • Moderate physical activity including standing, walking and stair climbing for extended periods of time.

Requirements:

  • Superior written and verbal communication skills
  • Valid Ontario Security Guard License.
  • Valid First Aid & CPR Level C Certificate.
  • Strong interpersonal and customer service skills, professional demeanor, and deportment. 
  • Ability to solve problems, make decisions and respond to emergencies while working independently.
  • Discretion when handling confidential and private information. 
  • Physical ability to stand, sit and walk for extended periods of time.
  • Ability to pass a security clearance.
  • High school diploma or equivalent.
  • Working knowledge of the Trespass to Property Act and Mental Health Act
  • Demonstrated punctuality and reliability, tact and diplomacy.
  • Patrol assigned area on foot, as assigned, to ensure personal, building, and equipment security.
  • Watch for and report irregularities by completing investigations and incident reports, such as security breaches, facility and safety hazards, and emergency situations; contact emergency responders, such as police, fire, and/or ambulance personnel, as required.
  • Utilize two-way radio and computer applications for communicating site activities.
  • Sustain effective relationships with key stakeholders and provide specialized security services by enforcing rules and regulations when required.
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.

Security Guards are required to complete a Drug & Alcohol test for incidents that occur on client property.

Highlights:

  • Extensive Paid Industry Training
  • Employer Paid Benefits
  • Opportunities for Growth & Advancement

At the time of the interview applicant must be able to produce proof of completion of the following prerequisites:

  1. Immunization Record
  2. Full Covid Vaccine
  3. A Valid Ontario Security Guard License
  4. Proficient in English (both oral and written)
  5. Vulnerable Sector Check may be required

Successful completion of the following requirements provided by Paladin are mandatory prior to placement:

  1. First Aid & CPR – Level C
  2. Management of Aggressive Behavior
  3. Use of Force
  4. Report Writing
  5. Additional courses as assigned

Upon hire successful applicants will be required to complete the following Paladin online courses:

  1. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Customer Service
  2. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Patrol Procedures
  3. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Diversity Awareness  
  4. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Finding The OHS Manual
  5. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Paladin OHS Orientation
  6. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Dealing with People with Mental Illness
  7. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Workplace Respect
  8. Successful completion of Paladin’s online Slips, Trips and Falls
  9. Additional courses as assigned.

Should you have any questions on this process, please contact LeeAnne Feddes, People and Culture Coordinator at

lfeddes@paladinsecurity.com

title: Mine Security Guard
description:
Are you looking for an exciting new opportunity?

We are looking for a motivated Security Guard to join our team for a premium role at a mine camp in Geraldton ON.  This position is a one week on, one week off position from Wednesday to Wednesday that will see you living on site while working.  This is a perfect opportunity for those looking for extended periods off on a regular basis and a unique working environment. 

  • $22.00/Hour
  • Meals and Lodging provided while on site
  • Free transportation provided to and from Thunder Bay

We are pleased to offer a $350 Sign on Bonus to the next two successful applicants*

 

*Applicants must pass all applicable interviews, be offered and accept employment and successfully pass a 90 day probationary period as determined by GardaWorld management. 

 

What's in it for you?

  • We offer competitive wages & comprehensive health benefits  

  • Uniform provided free of charge 

  • Opportunities to grow alongside GardaWorld 

  • Continuing education through GardaWorld Campus like Use of Force training 

  • All meals provided free of charge while living on site

  • Lodging provided free of charge while on site

  • Free transportation provided to and from Thunder Bay

What does the position involve?

  • Surveillance of access gates and parking barriers 
  • Greet customers and register visitors as needed 
  • Act as a first responder in the event of a crisis or emergency  

Qualifications to become a Security Guard for this position

  • A valid security guard license and first aid card 

  • Available to work flexible hours 

  • Have a clear criminal background 

  • Be eligible to work full time in Canada 

  • G Class Drivers License with clean drivers abstract

 

 

SSNORTH
